title: comparison of methodology for the detection of braf mutation in bone marrow trephine specimen
abstract: aim braf ve detection assist in the diagnosis of hairy cell leukaemia hcl however testing practice vary we evaluated the clinical utility of braf mutation testing strategy for use on bone marrow trephine bmt method hcl hcl mimic treated hcl and normal bmt specimen were tested for mutant braf comparing sanger sequencing pyrosequencing ampliconbased next generation sequencing ng automated idylla pcr and immunohistochemistry ihc result pcr and ihc were cheaper and identified ve in of hcl case pyrosequencing detected the mutation in ng in of case and sanger sequencing in all assay gave wildtype braf result in hcl mimic and normal bmt sample conclusion pcr and ihc were most sensitive and costeffective but these have limited scope for multiplexing and are likely to be replaced by ng gene panel or whole genome sequencing in the medium to long term
label: Cancer

title: tumour biomarkerstracing the molecular function and clinical implication
abstract: in recent year with the increase in cancer mortality caused by metastasis and with the development of individualized and precise medical treatment early diagnosis with precision becomes the key to decrease the death rate since detecting tumour biomarkers in body fluid is the most noninvasive way to identify the status of tumour development it ha been widely investigated for the usage in clinic these biomarkers include different expression or mutation in micrornas mirnas circulating tumour dna ctdnas protein exosomes and circulating tumour cell ctc in the present article we summarized and discussed some updated research on these biomarkers we overviewed their biological function and evaluated their multiple role in human and small animal clinical treatment including diagnosis of cancer classification of cancer prognostic and predictive value for therapy response monitor for therapy efficacy and anticancer therapeutic biomarkers including different expression or mutation in mirnas ctdnas protein exosomes and ctc provide more choice for early diagnosis of tumour detection at early stage before metastasis combination detection of these tumour biomarkers may provide higher accuracy at the lowest molecule combination number for tumour early detection moreover tumour biomarkers can provide valuable suggestion for clinical anticancer treatment and execute monitoring of treatment efficiency
label: Cancer

title: pomalidomide cyclophosphamide and dexamethasone for relapsedrefractory multiple myeloma patient in a reallife setting a singlecenter retrospective study
abstract: pomalidomide dexamethasone is a standard of care for relapsed multiple myeloma mm patient who received at least two prior line of therapy including both lenalidomide and proteasome inhibitor pi we report here a reallife singlecenter series of consecutive patient with relapsed and refractory mm treated with the triplet pomalidomide cyclophosphamide dexamethasone pcd combination the median of prior line of therapy wa and all patient were previously exposed to proteasome inhibitor and lenalidomide the overall response rate wa including very good partial response or better with a median followup of month the median progressionfree survival pfs wa month and the median overall survival wa not reached regarding safety most frequent toxicity wa hematologic including grade cytopenia nine patient discontinued therapy due to adverse event our study confirms that pcd combination is feasible and result in favorable response rate and pfs in comparison with pomalidomide dexamethasone alone
label: Cancer

title: aggressive variant of prostate cancer are we ready to apply specific treatment right now
abstract: recently adoption of novel drug for systemic treatment of metastatic prostate cancer ha led to a striking improvement of response rate and survival in both hormonesensitive and castrationresistant disease in most case prostate cancer essentially depends on androgen receptor signaling axis even in castrationresistant setting and hence may be targeted by second generation hormonal therapy however a subset of patient bear androgenindependent cancer biology with a shortterm response to hormonal treatment early and extensive visceral metastasis low psa level and poor outcome identification and specific management of these rapidly fatal malignancy is of an unmet medical need since their classification and utilized therapeutic regimen vary significantly unfortunately molecular pathway have not been sufficiently elucidated yet in order to provide an effective targeted treatment with a prolonged response lack of diagnostic and predictive biomarkers for these cancer make successful counteraction against them even more sophisticated in this comprehensive review we aimed at summarizing the current body of literature reporting on causal molecular machinery a well a diagnostic and therapeutic concept of aggressive prostate tumor and draw clinically relevant conclusion for the uptodate sensible disease management

title: circulating tumour cell ctc head and neck cancer and radiotherapy future perspective
abstract: head and neck cancer is the seventh most common cancer in australia and globally despite the current improved treatment modality there is still up to local regional recurrence and or distant metastasis highresolution medical imaging technology such a petct and mri do not currently detect the early spread of tumour cell thus limiting the potential for effective minimal residual detection and early diagnosis circulating tumour cell ctc are a rare subset of cell that escape from the primary tumour and enter into the bloodstream to form metastatic deposit or even reestablish themselves in the primary site of the cancer these cell are more aggressive and accumulate gene alteration by somatic mutation that are the same or even greater than the primary tumour because of additional feature acquired in the circulation the potential application of ctc in clinical use is to acquire a liquid biopsy by taking a reliable minimally invasive venous blood sample for cell genotyping during radiotherapy treatment to monitor the decline in ctc detectability and mutational change in response to radiation resistance and radiation sensitivity currently very little ha been published on radiation therapy ctc and circulating cancer stem cell ccscs the prognostic value of ctc in cancer management and personalised medicine for head and neck cancer radiotherapy patient requires a deeper understanding at the cellular level along with other advanced technology with this goal this review summarises the current research of head and neck cancer ctc ccsc and the molecular target for personalised radiotherapy response
label: Cancer

title: alk rearrangement biology detection and opportunity of therapy in nonsmall cell lung cancer
abstract: the alk receptor tyrosine kinase alk gene encodes a transmembrane protein rearranged in of nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc case this gene ha become the second most studied therapeutic target after egfr due to the implied therapeutic opportunity while the diagnostic of alk rearrangement is well established small molecule targeting alk are in constant evolution because tumor cell eventually will develop mechanism of resistance in this review we describe the biology of the alk gene alteration epidemiology diagnostic test a well a strategy of treatment
label: Cancer

title: aga clinical practice update on interaction between oral directacting antiviral for chronic hepatitis c infection and hepatocellular carcinoma expert review
abstract: description the purpose of this clinical practice update is to evaluate the evidence describing the interaction between directacting antiviral daa therapy for hepatitis and hepatocellular carcinoma hcc with regard to hcc incidence hcc recurrence and daa efficacy and to summarize best practice advice regarding hcc surveillance and timing of daa therapy method the recommendation outlined in this expert review are based on available published evidence including observational study and systematic review and incorporates expert opinion where applicable best practice advice daa treatment is associated with a reduction in the risk of incident hcc the relative risk reduction is similar in patient with and without cirrhosis best practice advice patient with advanced liver fibrosis f or cirrhosis should receive surveillance imaging before initiating daa treatment best practice advice patient with advanced liver fibrosis f or cirrhosis at the time of daa treatment represent the highestrisk group for hcc after daainduced sustained virologic response these patient should stay in hcc surveillance best practice advice hcc surveillance should be performed using ultrasound with or without alphafetoprotein every month current data do not support shorter surveillance interval or the use of alternative surveillance modality best practice advice future study may show a reduction in hcc risk over time after daainduced sustained virologic response however in the interim hcc surveillance should continue indefinitely if patient are otherwise eligible for potentially curative therapy best practice advice the presence of active hcc is associated with a small but statistically significant decrease in sustained virologic response with daa therapy best practice advice patient with hcc who are eligible for potentially curative therapy with liver resection or ablation should defer daa therapy until after hcc treatment is completed best practice advice timing of daa therapy for patient with hcc who are listed for liver transplantation should be determined with consideration of median wait time availability of hepatitis c viruspositive organ and degree of liver dysfunction best practice advice there are insufficient data evaluating benefit and costeffectiveness of daa therapy in patient with active intermediate or advanced hcc decision regarding daa treatment in these patient should be considered in light of hcc tumor burden degree of liver dysfunction life expectancy and patient preference best practice advice there are no conclusive data that daa therapy is associated with increased or decreased risk differential time to recurrence or aggressiveness of recurrent hcc in patient with complete response to hcc therapy best practice advice daa therapy should not be withheld from patient with complete response to hcc therapy however daa therapy can be deferred month to confirm response to hcc therapy best practice advice patient with complete response to hcc therapy who are treated with daas have a continued risk of hcc recurrence and require hcc surveillance which should be conducted indefinitely with dynamic contrastenhanced computed tomography or magnetic resonance imaging every month current data do not support more frequent surveillance in these patient this clinical practice update wa produced by the aga institute
label: Cancer

title: concurrent driver gene mutation a negative predictive factor in epidermal growth factor receptorpositive nonsmall cell lung cancer
abstract: background tyrosine kinase inhibitor tkis are clinically effective in nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc patient harbouring epidermal growth factor receptor egfr oncogene mutation genetic factor other than egfr sensitive mutation that allow prognosis of tki treatment remain undefined method we retrospectively screened consecutive patient with advanced nsclc and egfr del or lr mutation a total of patient whose progressionfree survival pfs were shorter than month or longer than month were included and stratified into separate group genetic background discrepancy wa analysed in the two group using next generation sequencing ng finding sensitive egfr mutation of del or lr were detected by ng in all patient the lr mutation wa the major type the most frequent accompanying somatic mutation were tp rb mapk alk fusion met amplification and braf ve were found only in the short pfs group concurrent pretreament t m mutation wa found in both group but wa proportionally higher in the short pfs group in the short pfs group patient had significantly more driver gene mutation than in long pfs group p the number of concomitant somatic mutation egfr pathwayrelated mutation and tumor mutation burden tmb were not significantly different between the two group interpretation cooccuring driver gene mutation were negative predictive factor of tki therapy in egfrmutated patient this study highlight the importance of exploring cooccuring genomic alteration before initiation of egfrtkis
label: Cancer

title: inhibition of tumor growth by betaglucans through promoting cd t cell immunomodulation and neutrophilkilling in mouse
abstract: betaglucans are polysaccharide comprising betadglucoses with various bioactivities herein we extracted three betaglucans from lentinus edodes with different source and assessed their antitumor activity on a mouse model with intragastric intraperitoneal and intratumoral injection three polysaccharide were shown to have the same chemical structure of betaglucan with beta branch and exhibited s tumorsuppressing ability with good safety it wa found that betaglucans upregulated cd t cell level in lymphoid organ decreased by tumorburden indicating promotion of immunomodulation betaglucans targeted tumor in vivo even after oral or intraperitoneal injection furthermore betaglucans not only targeted to lymphoid organ and increased cd t cell number but also enhanced cd t cell and neutrophil population in tumor it wa proposed that betaglucans promoted cd t cell immunomodulation and neutrophil infiltration into tumor leading to tumor growth inhibition these finding reveal that betaglucans can be used a an effective agent for cancer immunotherapy
label: Cancer

title: a comprehensive study of epigenetic alteration in hepatocellular carcinoma identifies potential therapeutic target
abstract: background aim a causal link ha recently been established between epigenetic alteration and hepatocarcinogenesis indicating that epigenetic inhibition may have therapeutic potential we aimed to identify and target epigenetic modifier that show molecular alteration in hepatocellular carcinoma hcc method we studied the molecularclinical correlation of epigenetic modifier including bromodomains histone acetyltransferases lysine methyltransferases and lysine demethylases in hcc using the cancer genome atlas tcga data of patient with hcc the therapeutic potential of epigenetic inhibitor wa evaluated in vitro and in vivo rna sequencing analysis and it correlation with expression and clinical data in the tcga dataset were used to identify expression program normalized by jumonji lysine demethylase jmjc inhibitor result genetic alteration aberrant expression and correlation between tumor expression and poor patient prognosis of epigenetic enzyme are common event in hcc epigenetic inhibitor that target bromodomain jq lysine methyltransferases bix and lly and jmjc lysine demethylases jib gskj and sd reduce hcc aggressiveness the panjmjc inhibitor jib had a potent antitumor effect in tumor bearing mouse hcc cell treated with jmjc inhibitor showed overlapping change in expression program related with inhibition of cell proliferation and induction of cell death jmjc inhibition revers an aggressive hcc gene expression program that is also altered in patient with hcc several gene downregulated by jmjc inhibitor are highly expressed in tumor v nontumor parenchyma and their high expression correlate with a poor prognosis we identified and validated a gene expression prognostic signature consisting of cenpa kifa plk and ncapg conclusion the epigenetic alteration identified in hcc can be used to predict prognosis and to define a subgroup of highrisk patient that would potentially benefit from jmjc inhibitor therapy lay summary in this study we found that mutation and change in expression of epigenetic modifier are common event in human hepatocellular carcinoma leading to an aggressive gene expression program and poor clinical prognosis the transcriptional program can be reversed by pharmacological inhibition of jumonji enzyme this inhibition block hepatocellular carcinoma progression providing a novel potential therapeutic strategy
label: Cancer

altered in patient with hcc several gene downregulated by jmjc inhibitor are highly expressed in tumor v nontumor parenchyma and their high expression correlate with a poor prognosis we identified and validated a gene expression prognostic signature consisting of cenpa kifa plk and ncapg conclusion the epigenetic alteration identified in hcc can be used to predict prognosis and to define a subgroup of highrisk patient that would potentially benefit from jmjc inhibitor therapy lay summary in this study we found that mutation and change in expression of epigenetic modifier are common event in human hepatocellular carcinoma leading to an aggressive gene expression program and poor clinical prognosis the transcriptional program can be reversed by pharmacological inhibition of jumonji enzyme this inhibition block hepatocellular carcinoma progression providing a novel potential therapeutic strategy

title: the singlebasepair deletion msh cdelc affecting intron splicing can be a cause of lynch syndrome
abstract: the proband wa a yearold man with ureter cancer he had a history of metachronous colorectal and gastric cancer immunohistochemical staining showed the absence of both msh and msh protein in the ureter cancer and other available cancer tissue specimen genetic testing wa conducted to identify the causative gene of hereditary gastrointestinal cancer syndrome including mismatch repair gene we detected a germline variant cdelc within the splice acceptor site of exon in the msh gene to investigate whether this variant affected splicing of the gene rna sequencing wa performed using blood sample we observed a substantial amount of the transcript that lacked proper splicing of intron in the indexed case whereas a very low amount of such aberrant transcript wa detected in the control strongly indicating an association between the variant and splicing defect these result indicate that msh cdelc affect normal splicing and might be a cause of lynch syndrome
label: Cancer

title: circulating cellfree dnadiagnostic and prognostic application in personalized cancer therapy
abstract: genomic analysis in oncologic care allow for the development of more precise clinical laboratory test that will be critical for personalized pharmacotherapy traditional biopsybased approach are limited by the availability of sequential tissue specimen to detect resistance bloodbased genomic profiling liquid biopsy is useful for longitudinal monitoring of tumor genome and can complement biopsy tumorassociated mutation can be identified in cellfree tumor dna ctdna from patient blood sample and used for monitoring disease activity the u food and drug administration approved a liquid biopsy test for egfractivating mutation in patient with nonsmallcell lung cancer a a companion diagnostic for therapy selection ctdna also allows for the identification of mutation selected by treatment such a egfr tm in nonsmallcell lung cancer ctdna can also detect mutation such a kras gv in colorectal cancer and braf vevk in melanoma chromosomal aberration pattern analysis by lowcoverage whole genome sequencing is a new broader approach genomic imbalance detected in cellfree dna cfdna can be used to compute a copy number instability cni score in clinical study it wa demonstrated that the change in cni score can serve a an early predictor of therapeutic response to chemotherapyimmunotherapy of many cancer type in multivariable model it could be shown that the cni score wa superior to clinical parameter for prediction of overall survival in patient with head and neck cancer there is emerging evidence for the clinical validity of ctdna testing regarding identification of candidate for targeted therapy prediction of therapeutic response early detection of recurrence resistance mutation detection measuring genetic heterogeneity tumor burden monitoring and risk stratification improvement of sensitivity to detect tumor at very early stage is difficult due to insufficient mutant dna fraction of further development will include validation in prospective multicenter interventional outcome study and the development of digital platform to integrate diagnostic data
label: Cancer

diagnostic data

title: telomere and telomerase in cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma
abstract: the role of telomere biology and telomerase activation in skin cancer ha been investigated in melanoma and basal cell carcinoma but limited evidence is available for cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma cscc we will review the current knowledge on the role of telomere and telomerase pathway in cscc pathogenesis at the somatic level both long and short telomere length have been described in cscc this telomere dichotomy is probably related to two different mechanism of tumour initiation which determines two tumour subtypes telomere shortening is observed during the invasive progression from in situ form of cscc such a bowens disease bd and actinic keratosis ak to invasive cscc at the germline level controversial result have been reported on the association between constitutive telomere length and risk of cscc approximately of cscc tumour are characterized by a high level of telomerase activity telomerase activation ha been also reported in ak and bd and in sundamaged skin thus supporting the hypothesis that uv modulates telomerase activity in the skin activating tert promoter mutation have been identified in of csccs with the majority showing the uvsignature no significant correlation wa observed between tert promoter mutation and cscc clinicopathological feature however tert promoter mutation have been recently suggested to be independent predictor of an adverse outcome the attention on telomere biology and telomerase activity in cscc is increasing for the potential implication in the development of effective tool for prognostic assessment and of therapeutic strategy in patient with cutaneous cscc
label: Cancer

title: pfkfb promoter hypomethylation a recurrence predictive marker in welldifferentiated thyroid carcinoma
abstract: despite the low mortality rate welldifferentiated thyroid carcinoma wdtc frequently relapse braf and tert mutation have been extensively related to prognosis in thyroid cancer in this study the methylation level of selected cpgs cytosinephosphateguanine comprising a classifier previously reported by our group were assessed in combination with braf and tert mutation we evaluated wdtc three poorlydifferentiatedanaplastic thyroid carcinoma pdtcatc benign thyroid lesion btl and nonneoplastic thyroid nt tissue braf ve and tert promoter ct and ct mutation were tested by pyrosequencing and sanger sequencing respectively three cpgs mapped in pfkfb atpvc and cxxc were evaluated by bisulfite pyrosequencing atpvc hypermethylation and pfkfb hypomethylation were detected in poorprognosis pdtcatc and relapsed wdtc compared with goodprognosis no relapsed wdtc and nonmalignant case ntbtl cxxc wa hypomethylated in both poor and goodprognosis case shorter diseasefree survival wa observed in wdtc patient presenting lower pfkfb methylation level p no association wa observed on comparing braf and tert mutation and prognosis lower pfkfb methylation level wa an independent factor of high relapse risk hazard ratio ci pfkfb promoter methylation analysis ha potential applicability to better stratify wdtc patient according to the recurrence risk independently of braf and tert mutation
label: Cancer

title: the small molecule bclmcl inhibitor tw show singleagent cytotoxicity in neuroblastoma cell line
abstract: background highrisk neuroblastoma with nmyc amplification remains a therapeutic challenge in paediatric oncology antagonism of prodeath bcl homology bh protein to prosurvival bh member such a mcl and bcl ha become a treatment approach but previous study suggest that a combined inhibition of bcl and mcl is necessary tw inhibits mcl and bcl with almost the same affinity however singleagent cytotoxicity of tw in neuroblastoma cell line ha not been investigated method cell viability apoptosis proliferation and change in growth property were determined in sknas imr syy and kelly cell after treatment with tw after transfection with mcl or bcl sirna apoptosis and proliferation were investigated in kelly cell mouse with kelly cell line xenograft were treated with tw and tumor growth survival and apoptosis were determined result cell line with nmyc amplification were more sensitive to tw treatment ic value for imr and kelly cell being mum and mum compared to syy cell and sknas cell ic mum and mum treatment with tw resulted in increased apoptosis and reduced proliferation rate especially in imr and kelly cell bcl a well a mcl knockdown induced apoptosis in kelly cell tw led to a decrease in tumor growth and a favorable survival p in a kelly neuroblastoma xenograft mouse model conclusion tw ha strong singleagent cytotoxicity in vitro and in vivo therefore combined inhibition of bclmcl by tw in nmyc amplified neuroblastoma may represent an interesting therapeutic strategy
label: Cancer

title: a study of alkpositive pulmonary squamouscell carcinoma from diagnostic methodology to clinical efficacy
abstract: background high concordance ha been observed between ventana df alk immunohistochemistry ihc and fluorescence insitu hybridization fish in lung adenocarcinoma ladc however whether a similar conclusion can be applied to lung squamouscell carcinoma lscc ha remained unclear we therefore evaluated the alk anaplastic lymphoma kinase status and the therapeutic effect of an alk tyrosine kinase inhibitor tki in ihc or fishpositive lscc material and method a total of lscc patient from three institution were screened for alk aberration by ihc all ihcpositive case were subjected to fish with an approximately equal number of negative case a a control group and nextgeneration sequencing ng clinical efficacy wa evaluated for the patient who received tki therapy result in case of lscc case were identified a alkpositive by ihc after quality control case were succeeded by fish six with insufficient tissue three with lack of signal and by ng failed due to insufficient sample or poor dna quality the percentage of nondiagnostic test wa and respectively four case analyzed by fish were determined a alkpositive for the control group alk ihc fish demonstrated no sample with alk gene fusion the concordance between alk ihc and alk fishpositive result wa in the case studied by ng two case showed alkeml fusion consistent with two fishpositive result and two case were interpreted a harboring an alkassociation gene mutation among four patient two fishpositive and two ihcpositive only case receiving tki therapy two patient had stable disease and the other two had progressive disease conclusion the positive concordance rate of alk ihc and fish in lscc is far less than that reported for ladc therefore alk ihc detection in lscc can not be used a a diagnostic method for alk rearrangement

title: immunotherapy in colorectal cancer rationale challenge and potential
abstract: following initial success in melanoma treatment immunotherapy ha rapidly become established a a major treatment modality for multiple type of solid cancer including a subset of colorectal cancer crcs two programmed cell death pdblocking antibody pembrolizumab and nivolumab have shown efficacy in patient with metastatic crc that is mismatchrepairdeficient and microsatellite instabilityhigh dmmrmsih and have been granted accelerated fda approval in contrast to most other treatment for metastatic cancer immunotherapy achieves longterm durable remission in a subset of patient highlighting the tremendous promise of immunotherapy in treating dmmrmsih metastatic crc here we review the clinical development of immune checkpoint inhibition in crc leading to regulatory approval for the treatment of dmmrmsih crc we focus on new advance in expanding the efficacy of immunotherapy to earlystage crc and crc that is mismatchrepairproficient and ha low microsatellite instability pmmrmsil and discus emerging approach for targeting the immune microenvironment which might complement immune checkpoint inhibition

title: immunotherapy in endometrial cancer new scenario on the horizon
abstract: this extensive review summarizes clinical evidence on immunotherapy and targeted therapy currently available for endometrial cancer ec and report the result of the clinical trial and ongoing study the research wa carried out collecting preclinical and clinical finding using keywords such a immune environment tumor infiltrating lymphocyte programmed death pdprogrammed deathligand pdl expression immune checkpoint inhibitor antipdpdl antibody and others on pubmed finally we looked for the ongoing immunotherapy trial on clinicaltrialsgov ec is the fourth most common malignancy in woman in developed country despite medical and surgical treatment survival ha not improved in the last decade and death rate have increased for uterine cancer in woman therefore identification of clinically significant prognostic risk factor and formulation of new rational therapeutic regimen have great significance for enhancing the survival rate and improving the outcome in patient with advanced or metastatic disease the identification of genetic alteration including somatic mutation and microsatellite instability and the definition of intracellular signaling pathway alteration that have a major role in in tumorigenesis is leading to the development of new therapeutic option for immunotherapy and targeted therapy
label: Cancer

title: two novel variant in the atm gene causing ataxiatelangiectasia including a duplication of kb utility of targeted nextgeneration sequencing in detection of copy number variation
abstract: ataxiatelangiectasia at is a rare autosomal recessive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by progressive cerebellar ataxia ocular apraxia immunodeficiency telangiectasia elevated serum alphafetoprotein concentration radiosensitivity and cancer predisposition classical at is caused by biallelic variant on atm ataxia telangiectasia mutated gene leading to a loss of function of the protein kinase atm involved in dna damage repair atypical presentation can be found in atlike disease or in nijmegen breakage syndrome caused by deficiency of mre or nibrin protein respectively in this report we present the genetic characterization of a yearold female with clinical diagnosis of at nextgeneration sequencing ng revealed two novel heterozygous mutation in the atm gene a singlenucleotide variant snv at exon nmcg c ptrpser and kb genomic duplication spanning exon nggdup these finding were validated by sanger sequencing and mlpa multiplex ligationdependent probe amplification analysis respectively familial segregation study confirmed that the two variant are inherited and the infant is a compound heterozygote thus our study expands the spectrum of atm pathogenic variant and demonstrates the utility of targeted ng in the detection of copy number variation
label: Cancer

title: the proteogenomic landscape of curable prostate cancer
abstract: dna sequencing ha identified recurrent mutation that drive the aggressiveness of prostate cancer surprisingly the influence of genomic epigenomic and transcriptomic dysregulation on the tumor proteome remains poorly understood we profiled the genome epigenomes transcriptomes and proteome of localized intermediaterisk prostate cancer we discovered that the genomic subtypes of prostate cancer converge on five proteomic subtypes with distinct clinical trajectory ets fusion the most common alteration in prostate tumor affect different gene and pathway in the proteome and transcriptome globally mrna abundance change explain only of protein abundance variability a a result prognostic biomarkers combining genomic or epigenomic feature with proteomic one significantly outperform biomarkers comprised of a single data type
label: Cancer

title: braf ve mutation and micrornas are helpful in distinguishing papillary thyroid malignant lesion tissue and fine needle aspiration cytology case
abstract: aim mutation of braf oncogene are considered to contribute in the invasiveness and poor clinicopathologic feature of papillary thyroid cancer ptc a a step towards understanding the underlying molecular mechanism of this contribution we aimed to examine the association of four micrornas mir b level with brafve and clinicopathological feature in ptc tissue and fine needle aspiration fna specimen method in total ptc and benign with multinodular goiter tissue sample fna sample and bcpap and hek cell line were examined brafve mutation wa examined in ptc tissue and fna sample expression of micrornas wa assessed by realtime quantitative reverse transcriptionpcr key finding the frequency of brafve in ptc tissue and fna sample suspicious for ptc wa and respectively mir and b were significantly upregulated in ptc tumor p and in bcpap cell line p in fna the expression of mir b and were significantly elevated in patient suspected for ptc p while there wa no significant difference in mir after adjustment for age and sex mirb wa associated with an increased risk of bearing brafve mutation or ci p and risk of lymphovascular invasion or ci p mir wa associated with the risk of larger tumor size or ci p mir wa related to increase in extracapsular invasion or ci p significance upregulation of mir and b ha been confirmed in ptc tumor fna sample and cell line mir upregulation ha been confirmed in ptc tumor and cell line but not in fna sample mir and b showed an association with the degree of malignancy in ptc tumor
label: Cancer

title: measurement of ffdg pet tumor heterogeneity improves early assessment of response to bevacizumab compared with the standard size and uptake metric in a colorectal cancer model
abstract: purpose treatment of metastatic colorectal cancer frequently includes antiangiogenic agent such a bevacizumab size measurement are inadequate to assess treatment response to these agent and newer response assessment criterion are needed we aimed to evaluate ffdg petderived texture parameter in a preclinical colorectal cancer model a alternative metric of response to treatment with bevacizumab material and method fourteen cd athymic mouse injected in the flank with x lst cell human colorectal carcinoma were either untreated control n or bevacizumab treated n after week mouse underwent ffdg petct callipermeasured tumor growth deltavol and final tumor volume volcal ffdg pet metabolically active volume volmet mean metabolism metmean and maximum metabolism metmax were measured twentyfour texture feature were compared between treated and untreated mouse immunohistochemical mean tumor vascular density wa estimated by anticd staining after tumor resection result treated mouse had significantly lower tumor vascular density p confirming the antiangiogenic therapeutic effect of bevacizumab none of the conventional measure were different between the two group deltavol p volcal p volmet p metmax p or metmean p one texture parameter glszmszv visually indicating that the ffdg pet image of treated mouse comprise uniformly sized cluster of different activity had significantly different mean between the two group of mouse p conclusion ffdg pet derived texture parameter particularly glszmszv may be valid biomarkers of tumor response to treatment with bevacizumab before change in volume
label: Cancer

title: dna methylation profiling distinguishes ewinglike sarcoma with ewsrnfatc fusion from ewing sarcoma
abstract: purpose recent study revealed divergent gene expression pattern in ewing sarcoma ew with canonical ewsrets gene fusion and undifferentiated round cell sarcoma urcs with ewsr rearrangement fused to the nonets gene nfatc thus the question arises whether the latter tumor really belong to ew method we collected five case matching the group of urcs with ewsrnfatc fusion and performed dna methylation and copy number profiling result were compared to methylation data of ew with various ewsrets fusion and one ew with fuserg fusion urcs with cic rearrangement and urcs with bcor alteration and a total of ewsrassociated soft tissue sarcoma including angiomatoid fibrous histiocytomas clear cell sarcoma of the soft tissue desmoplastic small round cell tumor extraskeletal myxoid chondrosarcoma and myxoid liposarcoma result unsupervised hierarchical clustering and tdistributed stochastic neighbor embedding analysis of dna methylation data revealed a homogeneous methylation cluster for urcs with ewsrnfatc fusion which clearly segregated from ew and the other subtypes copy number profile of ewsrnfatc case showed recurrent loss on chromosome q and segmental gain on q and q involving the ewsr and nfatc locus respectively conclusion in summary urcs with ewsrnfatc fusion share a distinct dna methylation signature and carry characteristic copy number alteration which emphasizes that these sarcoma should be considered separately from ew
label: Cancer

title: fulminant essential thrombocythemia associated with acquired von willebrand syndrome and bleeding episode in a yearold girl
abstract: background essential thrombocythemia is a chronic myeloproliferative neoplasm it is extremely rare in child below year of age with an estimated annual incidence of only per million usually clinical symptom associated with essential thrombocythemia are mild or absent case here we present the case of a yearold female patient fulminantly presenting with acute symptom comprising visual impairment palmar and plantar stabbing pain blood count revealed massive thrombocytosis of x l bone marrow morphology showed elevated number of mature megakaryocyte von willebrand factor activityantigen ratio wa significantly reduced compatible with an acquired von willebrand syndrome associated with high platelet count molecular analysis for driver mutation of myeloproliferative neoplasm including jakvf calr and mpl were negative acute therapy comprising hyperhydration and oxygen supply complemented by acetylsalicylic acid led to amelioration of symptom medication with hydroxycarbamide maintained a significant reduction of platelet count but had to be reduced or withheld several time due to neutropenia repeated bleeding episode observed in the course were clearly associated with increase in platelet count above x l explained by acquired von willebrand syndrome sixteen month after diagnosis therapy wa switched to pegylated interferon and platelet count could be stabilized without significant side effect
label: Cancer

title: association between kras gd mutation and anastomotic recurrence in colorectal cancer two case report
abstract: rationale the prevalence of anastomotic recurrence ar in colorectal cancer crc after resection of the primary tumor pt is to however no association ha been observed between specific somatic genetic alteration and ar such association may shed light on the mechanism of ar patient concern we experienced patient with ar of crc the first patient wa a yearold woman who underwent resection of an ar of rectal cancer time within month after resection of the pt the second patient wa a yearold woman who underwent resection of an ar of ascending colon cancer twice within month after resection of the pt diagnosis both case were diagnosed a repetitive ar intervention loss of heterozygosity analysis microsatellite instability msi study of microsatellite locus and mutational analysis of kras braf apc tp and smad were performed outcome all the lesion except harbored mutation in apc kras and tp without msi after neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy the apc kras and tp mutation were pathogenic or likely pathogenic in the pt and ar both woman harbored the same kras gd mutation which account for of all kras mutation in sporadic crc s the probability of the incidental occurrence of kras gd mutation in both case is provided that the mutation were independent of ar lesson our finding may shed light on the mechanism of ar in crc namely that the pt harbored the same mutation a the ar and the lesion in both case harbored the kras gd mutation
label: Cancer

title: genotypephenotype correlation in familial adenomatous polyposis patient a prospective prevention protocol
abstract: background familial adenomatous polyposis fap is a syndrome caused by germline pathogenic variant in the tumor suppressor gene adenomatous polyposis coli apc identification of apc pathogenic variant site and the genotypephenotype correlation are important for characterizing monitoring and treating member of affected family the aim of this study wa to correlate genotypephenotype of brazilian individual carrying apc pathogenic germline variant and that have fap method the polyposis phenotype of individual from family between july and december were prospectively evaluated based on the insight polyposis staging classification seven extracolonic manifestation were assessed and the clinical manifestation correlated with the apc genotype result the age of the study participant ranged from to year median of year twentysix apc pathogenic variant were identified fiftyfive case harbored nonsense pathogenic variant frameshift alteration were noted in case aberrant splicing wa noted in case rearrangement were observed in case an association between nonsense variant and rearrangement wa noted in case the genotypephenotype correlation analysis led the identification of classic fap in case profuse polyposis wa identified in case thirtysix case were diagnosed with cancer of which case were colorectal cancer case wa brain cancer case were papillary thyroid cancer and case were stomach cancer the extracolonic manifestation included individual with desmoids tumor with osteoma and with congenital hypertrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium conclusion the genotypephenotype correlation in brazilian individual with fap revealed specific finding not previously reported for other cohort demonstrating the relevance of knowledge regarding the variable pathogenic variant and clinical presentation in different population for adequate individual clinical management of patient harboring this medical condition
label: Cancer

title: breast cancer and mirsnps the importance of mir germline genetics
abstract: recent study in cancer diagnostics have identified micrornas mirnas a promising cancer biomarkers single nucleotide polymorphism snp in mirna binding site seed region and coding sequence can help predict breast cancer risk aggressiveness response to stimulus and prognosis this review also document significant known mirsnps in mirna biogenesis gene and their effect on gene regulation in breast cancer taking into account the genetic background and ethnicity of the sampled population when applicable mirsnps are evaluated in the context of other patient factor including mutation hormonal status and demographic given the power of mirsnps to predict patient cancer risk prognosis and outcome further study of mirsnps is warranted to improve effort towards personalized medicine
label: Cancer

title: highfructose corn syrup enhances intestinal tumor growth in mouse
abstract: excessive consumption of beverage sweetened with highfructose corn syrup hfc is associated with obesity and with an increased risk of colorectal cancer whether hfc contributes directly to tumorigenesis is unclear we investigated the effect of daily oral administration of hfc in adenomatous polyposis coli apc mutant mouse which are predisposed to develop intestinal tumor the hfcstreated mouse showed a substantial increase in tumor size and tumor grade in the absence of obesity and metabolic syndrome hfc increased the concentration of fructose and glucose in the intestinal lumen and serum respectively and the tumor transported both sugar within the tumor fructose wa converted to fructosephosphate leading to activation of glycolysis and increased synthesis of fatty acid that support tumor growth these mouse study support the hypothesis that the combination of dietary glucose and fructose even at a moderate dose can enhance tumorigenesis
label: Cancer

title: measurable residual disease monitoring using wilms tumor gene expression in childhood acute myeloid leukemia based on childspecific reference value
abstract: background measurableminimal residual disease mrd monitoring can predict imminent hematological relapse in acute myeloid leukemia aml the majority of childhood aml patient do not harbor fusion gene or mutation applicable a mrd marker and overexpression of wilms tumor gene wt may constitute a useful monitoring target however agespecific reference value in healthy hematopoiesis and standardization of wt assessment are prerequisite for clinical utility procedure we investigated wt expression across age in hematologically healthy control n during suspected infection n and bone marrow bm regeneration n wt expression in aml at diagnosis n and during followup n wa compared with agespecific reference value result wt expression correlated with age and showed higher level in both bm and peripheral blood pb in child compared with adult p and p wt expression from healthy hematopoiesis wa lower in pb compared with bm wtbm wtpb ci and not influenced by infection nor bm regeneration at aml diagnosis had more than fold wt overexpression in pb or bm pb bm wt wa quantified in pb sample during followup all patient with pb sampling within month of disease recurrence displayed wt overexpression by a median of month range before hematological relapse conclusion this study defines childspecific reference value for wt expression in healthy hematopoiesis and demonstrates that wt expression in pb is a useful posttreatment monitoring tool in childhood aml based on these observation we propose definition for childhood aml molecular relapse using wt overexpression
label: Cancer

title: successful role of adjuvant radiotherapy in a rare case of tracheal inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor a case report
abstract: background inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor imt is a rare benign cancer that can express a more aggressive phenotype related to the genetic mutation of the anaplastic lymphoma kinase receptor alk involvement of trachea is extremely rare and due to the clinical and radiologic nonspecificity the definitive diagnosis is based on the histologic evaluation of tissue specimen total surgical excision is curative and chemotherapy or radiotherapy ha been employed in the treatment of unresectable tumor or a adjuvant therapy case presentation the case described here is being reported because of the rare tracheal location and the atypical treatment approach used for an alkpositive imt a week pregnant woman voluntary interrupted pregnancy and underwent total surgical excision that resulted to have close margin although alkpositive expression indicated the use of alk inhibitor she refused any type of adjuvant therapy that could affect ovarian function thus d conformational external beam radiotherapy wa performed with a daily dose of cgy time per week up to gy at the level of trachea a total of month of followup showed and no sign of disease recurrence or late radiation therapyrelated toxicity conclusion this report describes an extremely rare case of a tracheal imt underlying the key role of radiotherapy a adjuvant treatment able to definitively cure imt limiting systemic chemotherapyrelated toxicity
label: Cancer

title: an integral view of cancer i the study classification and reprogramming of the tumoral microclimate
abstract: the group of disease that we call cancer share a biological structure formed by a complex ecosystem with altered intercellular communication information field development and tissue function beyond the genetic alteration of the tumor cell the demonstration of an altered ecosystem with interconnection at systemic level open up a new perspective on cancer biology and behavior different tumor facet such a morphology classification clinical aggressiveness prognosis and response to treatment now appear under a comprehensive vision that offer a new horizon of study research and clinical management the somatic mutation theory in cancer in force for more than one hundred year is now completed by the study of the tumor microenvironment the extracellular matrix the stromal cell the immune response the innervation the nutrition the mitochondrion the metabolism the interstitial fluid the mechanical and electromagnetic property of the tissue and many other area of emerging knowledge thus opening the door to a reprogramming exercise of the tumor phenotype through the modification of the key offered by this new paradigm it recognition make it possible to go from considering the oncological process a a cellular problem to a supracellular alteration based on the disorganization of tissue immersed in the relationship of the complex system of the living being

title: the role of inherited genetic variant in colorectal polyposis syndrome
abstract: colorectal carcinoma crc is the third most common cancer in men and the second most common cancer in woman across the world most crcs occur sporadically but in of case hereditary factor are important some patient with an inherited predisposition to crc will be diagnosed with a genetic polyposis syndrome such a familial adenomatous polyposis fap mutyhassociated polyposis map polymerase proofreading associated polyposis ppap nthlassociated polyposis mshassociated polyposis or a hamartomatous polyposis syndrome individual with colorectal polyp have traditionally been referred for genetic diagnostic testing to identify apc and mutyh mutation which cause fap and map respectively mutation are found in most patient with adenoma but in only a minority of those with adenoma the reason that diagnostic laboratory are not identifying pathogenic variant include mutation occurring outside of the open reading frame of gene individual exhibiting generalized mosaicism and the involvement of additional gene it is important to identify patient with an inherited polyposis syndrome and to define the mutation causing their polyposis so that the individual and their relative can be managed appropriately
label: Cancer

title: metabolomics of neonatal blood spot reveal distinct phenotype of pediatric acute lymphoblastic leukemia and potential effect of earlylife nutrition
abstract: earlylife exposure are believed to influence the incidence of pediatric acute lymphoblastic leukemia all archived neonatal blood spot nb collected within the first day of life offer a mean to investigate small molecule that reflect earlylife exposure using untargeted metabolomics we compared abundance of smallmolecule feature in extract of nb punch from child that later developed all and healthy control subject were stratified by early y and late y diagnosis mutuallyexclusive set of metabolic feature representing putative lipid and fatty acid were associated with all including and metabolite in the early and latediagnosis group respectively in the latediagnosis group a prominent cluster of feature with apparent fattyacid chain suggested that newborn exposure to the essential nutrient linoleic acid increased all risk interestingly abundance of these putative lipid were greater in infant who were fed formula rather than breast milk colostrum and increased with the mother prepregnancy body mass index these result suggest possible etiologic role of newborn nutrition in latediagnosis all
label: Cancer

title: firstinhuman phase study of inchxadtpa trastuzumab for her tumor imaging
abstract: introduction tumor overexpressing the human epithelial receptor her or exhibiting amplification or mutation of it protooncogene have a poorer prognosis using trastuzumab andor other her targeted therapy can increase overall survival in patient with her tumor making it critical to accurately identify patient who may benefit we report on a phase study of the imaging agent inchxadtpa trastuzumab in patient with known her status to evaluate it safety and biodistribution and to obtain preliminary data regarding it ability to provide an accurate wholebody noninvasive mean to determine her status method inchxadtpa trastuzumab wa radiolabeled onsite and slowly infused into patient who underwent single n or multiple n gammacamera n andor spect n imaging session result no safety issue were identified visual and semiquantitative imaging data were concordant with tissue her expression profiling in all but patient the biodistribution showed intense peak liver activity at the initial imaging timepoint h and a singlephase clearance fit of the average timeactivity curve tac estimated th r ci to h this wa followed by high gastrointestinal gi tract activity peaking by h linear regression predicted gi clearance by h r ci to h blood pool had lower activity with it maximum on the initial image nonlinear regression fit projected a th r ci to h assuming linear wholebody clearance linear regression projected complete elimination xintercept at hr r ci to h conclusion inchxadtpa trastuzumab can be safely imaged in human the biodistribution allowed for visual and semiquantitative analysis with result concordant with tissue expression profiling in of patient advance in knowledge and implication for patient care using readily available component and onsite radiolabeling inchxadtpa trastuzumab spect imaging may provide an economical noninvasive mean to detect her overexpression
label: Cancer

title: expandable immunotherapeutic nanoplatforms engineered from cytomembrane of hybrid cell derived from cancer and dendritic cell
abstract: using the cytomembrane fm of hybrid cell acquired from the fusion of cancer and dendritic cell dc this study offer a biologically derived platform for the combination of immunotherapy and traditional oncotherapy approach due to the immunoactivation implicated in the cellular fusion fm can effectively express whole cancer antigen and immunological costimulatory molecule for robust immunotherapy fm share the tumor selftargeting character with the parent cancer cell in bilateral tumorbearing mouse model the fmcoated nanophotosensitizer cause durable immunoresponse to inhibit the rebound of primary tumor postnanophotosensitizerinduced photodynamic therapy pdt the fminduced immunotherapy display ultrahigh antitumor effect even comparable to that of pdt on the other hand pdt toward primary tumor enhances the immunotherapycaused regression of the irradiationfree distant tumor consequently both the primary and the distant tumor are almost completely eliminated this tumorspecific immunotherapybased nanoplatform is potentially expandable to multiple tumor type and readily equipped with diverse function owing to the flexible nanoparticle option
label: Cancer

title: highlevel expression of prss correlate with metastasis and poor prognosis in patient with gastric cancer
abstract: background and objective serine protease prss is a known contributor to the genesis and development of malignant tumor although it role in gastric cancer gc is still unclear method prss expression in gc tissue sample and it relationship with clinicopathological feature were analyzed effect of gc cellular response to the introduction of small interfering rna sirnamediated and short hairpin rna shrnamediated interference with tumor prss expression were also assessed result prss wa significantly upregulated in gc tissue and prss protein level were higher in tumor that developed metastasis soon after the surgery compared with those that remained metastasisfree high expression of prss wa associated with tumor n staging and independently predictive of postoperative prognosis in patient with gc the v variant of prss wa primarily detected in gc tissue and cell line the others vv being scarcely detectable methylation and demethylation drug had no impact on expression level of any prss transcriptional variant the downregulated prss expression suppressed gc cell growth migration and invasion in vitro and in vivo conclusion prss appears to act a an oncogene of gc high prss expression portends postoperative metastasis serving a an effective biomarker of poor therapeutic outcome
label: Cancer

title: somatic alteration detected in diagnostic prostate biopsy provide an inadequate representation of multifocal prostate cancer
abstract: background the majority of clinical prostate cancer are multifocal with morphological and molecular heterogeneity adequate tissue representation is crucial for the clinical utility of multigene panel sequencing of core needle biopsy the aim of this study wa to evaluate the genomic heterogeneity in multifocal prostate cancer and to analyze how representative preoperative biopsy are of spatially separated tumor focus method we analyzed at least tumor focus and to preoperative biopsy core from patient diagnostic biopsy a well a fresh frozen and formalinfixed paraffinembedded sample from major tumor focus of radical prostatectomy specimen were macrodissected for the enrichment of tumor tissue dna wa extracted and sequenced we analyzed structural alteration mutation and copy number variation and compared the genomic profile of tumor focus with those of preoperative biopsy result alteration were rarely shared between focus indicating a high degree of genomic heterogeneity in of men at least tumor focus wa represented by the biopsy defined a harboring at least common clonal somatic event in only one case somatic alteration from two spatially separate tumor were identified in the biopsy of the mutation and structural variant detected in fresh frozen or formalinfixed paraffinembedded prostatectomy material only an average of range and range respectively were found in preoperative biopsy where a common somatic origin wa established conclusion multifocal prostate cancer is a somatically heterogeneous disease in which systematic needle biopsy do not provide sufficient molecular representation of the somatic alteration detected in spatially distinct tumor area targeted biopsy directed at separate tumor focus could potentially improve tissue representation of these heterogeneous focus in preoperative biopsy
label: Cancer

title: association between the her gene status and the efficacy of firstline pemetrexed combined with platinum chemotherapy in patient with advanced lung adenocarcinoma
abstract: background human epidermal growth factor receptor her is one of the driver gene of nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc several study have shown that the efficacy of pemetrexed in hermutant nsclc is controversial the aim of this study is to investigate the efficacy of pemetrexed combined with platinum chemotherapy in patient with hermutant and her wildtype lung adenocarcinoma method the clinical data of case of egfr alk ro kras braf ret and metnegative patient with advanced lung adenocarcinoma patient who diagnosed by histopathology in the first affiliated hospital of zhengzhou university were retrospectively reviewed the relationship between her gene status clinical characteristic and response and progressionfree survival pfs were analyzed result all of the patient her status were determined her mutation occurred in case no mutation in case her mutation were common in young nonsmoking and female patient all patient received firstline pemetrexed and platinumbased chemotherapy the objective response rate orr and disease control rate dcr of patient with hermutant lung adenocarcinoma were significantly higher than those without her mutation v chi p v chi p and the difference wa statistically significant according to univariate analysis the pfs wa significantly associated with the brain metastasis maintenance chemotherapy and her gene status p cox multivariate analysis indicated that her mutation wa an independent positive prognostic factor of pfs p conclusion hermutant lung adenocarcinoma patient with firstline pemetrexed combined with platinum chemotherapy have greater clinical benefit than her wildtype patient
label: Cancer

title: molecular marker in recurrent stage i grade endometrioid endometrial cancer
abstract: objective stage i grade endometrial cancer have low recurrence rate and often do not receive adjuvant therapy we compared recurrent case to matched nonrecurrent control to evaluate for molecular marker associated with higher risk of recurrence method a casecontrol study including all case of recurrent stage i grade endometrioid endometrial cancer at one institution in a tenyear period case were matched to control by age bmi weight and stage molecular testing and immunohistochemistry were performed on archival tumor specimen microsatellite instability msih mismatch repair status pole mutational status and nextgeneration sequencing result stage i grade endometrial cancer case with recurrent disease and available tumor specimen were identified ctnnb and msih were present at significantly higher rate in case than control ctnnb v or ci p and msih v or ci p pole mutation were found in of case v of control p among specimen demonstrating microsatellite stability ms of case v of control had ctnnb mutation p ctnnb wild type tumor were msih in of case v of control p conclusion compared to control ctnnb mutation is present at significantly higher rate in recurrent stage i grade endometrial cancer and is found most commonly in ms tumor msih is also present at significantly higher rate in recurrent case these marker may be useful for prognostic risk stratification and adjuvant therapy decisionmaking in this otherwise lowrisk population
label: Cancer

title: comprehensive analysis of the characteristic and treatment outcome of patient with nonsmall cell lung cancer treated with antipd therapy in realworld practice
abstract: purpose immune checkpoint inhibitor ici have shown marked response in patient with nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc in clinical trial however because such trial comprise cohort selected based on specific criterion it is unclear if their result represent routine clinical practice method we examined patient with advanced nsclc who were administered either nivolumab or pembrolizumab at yonsei cancer center korea between march and january patient characteristic egfralk mutation status metastatic location response to icis and adverse event were retrospectively analyzed result the median age wa year and of patient were male former or current smoker constituted of the subject adenocarcinoma wa predominant and of the patient underwent previous treatment twentythree patient were egfr mutation or alk rearrangementpositive the objective response rate orr wa confidence interval ci the median progressionfree survival pfs and overall survival o were ci and ci month respectively multivariate analysis identified ecog performance status egfr mutationalk rearrangement status liver metastasis and pdl proportion a independent predictor of o furthermore of the patient had adverse event of any grade had immunerelated adverse event that were associated with pfs and o on multivariate analysis conclusion the realworld orr pfs o and adverse event profile were comparable to previous clinical trial despite the patient different baseline characteristic our finding can aid in establishing effective immunotherapeutic management of nsclc in routine clinical practice
label: Cancer

title: a combined gene expression tool for parallel histological prediction and gene fusion detection in nonsmall cell lung cancer
abstract: accurate histological classification and identification of fusion gene represent two cornerstone of clinical diagnostics in nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc here we present a nanostring gene expression platform and a novel platformindependent single sample predictor ssp of nsclc histology for combined simultaneous histological classification and fusion gene detection in minimal formalin fixed paraffin embedded ffpe tissue the ssp wa developed in nsclc tumor of adenocarcinoma ac squamous cell carcinoma sqcc and largecell neuroendocrine carcinoma lcnec histology based on nanostring expression of chga syp cd sftpg napsa ttf tpl krta krt krt krt relevant gene for ihcbased nsclc histology classification the ssp wa combined with a gene fusion detection module analyzing alk ret ro met nrg and ntrk into a multicomponent nanostring assay the histological ssp wa validated in six cohort varying in size n tissue origin early or advanced disease histological composition including undifferentiated cancer and gene expression platform fusion gene detection revealed five emlalk fusion four kifbret fusion two cdnrg fusion and three met exon skipping event among tested case the histological ssp wa successfully trained and tested in the development cohort mean auc in iterated test set the ssp proved successful in predicting histology of nsclc tumor of welldefined subgroup and difficult undifferentiated morphology irrespective of gene expression data platform discrepancy between gene expression prediction and histologic diagnosis included case with mixed histology true large cell carcinoma or poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma with mucin expression in summary we present a proofofconcept multicomponent assay for parallel histological classification and multiplexed fusion gene detection in archival tissue including a novel platformindependent histological ssp classifier the assay and ssp could serve a a promising complement in the routine evaluation of diagnostic lung cancer biopsy
label: Cancer

gene detection revealed five emlalk fusion four kifbret fusion two cdnrg fusion and three met exon skipping event among tested case the histological ssp wa successfully trained and tested in the development cohort mean auc in iterated test set the ssp proved successful in predicting histology of nsclc tumor of welldefined subgroup and difficult undifferentiated morphology irrespective of gene expression data platform discrepancy between gene expression prediction and histologic diagnosis included case with mixed histology true large cell carcinoma or poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma with mucin expression in summary we present a proofofconcept multicomponent assay for parallel histological classification and multiplexed fusion gene detection in archival tissue including a novel platformindependent histological ssp classifier the assay and ssp could serve a a promising complement in the routine evaluation of diagnostic lung cancer biopsy

title: clear cell sarcoma of the kidney
abstract: clear cell sarcoma of the kidney is an uncommon malignant pediatric renal neoplasm that typically present in the to year age group and ha a propensity for aggressive behavior and late relapse histologically this tumor exhibit a great diversity of morphologic pattern that can mimic most other pediatric renal neoplasm often leading to confusion and misdiagnosis until recently adjunct immunohistochemical and molecular genetic test to support the diagnosis were lacking the presence of internal tandem duplication in bcl coreceptor bcor and a translocation t creating the fusion gene ywhaenutmbe have now been well accepted immunohistochemistry for bcor ha also been shown to be a sensitive and specific marker for clear cell sarcoma of the kidney in the context of pediatric renal tumor improved intensive chemotherapy regimen have influenced the clinical course of the disease with late relapse now being less frequent and the brain having overtaken bone a the most common site of relapse
label: Cancer

title: senecavirus a c protease mediates host cell apoptosis late in infection
abstract: senecavirus a sva an oncolytic picornavirus used for cancer treatment in human ha recently emerged a a vesicular disease vdcausing agent in swine worldwide notably svainduced vd is indistinguishable from footandmouth disease fmd and other highconsequence vd of pig here we investigated the role of apoptosis on infection and replication of sva given the critical role of the nuclear factorkappa b nfkappab signaling pathway on modulation of cell death we first assessed activation of nfkappab during sva infection result here show that while early during infection sva induces activation of nfkappab a evidenced by nuclear translocation of nfkappabp and nfkappabmediated transcription late in infection a cleaved product corresponding to the cterminus of nfkappabp is detected in infected cell resulting in lower nfkappab transcriptional activity additionally we assessed the potential role of sva c protease cpro in svainduced hostcell apoptosis and cleavage of nfkappabp transient expression of sva cpro wa associated with cleavage of nfkappabp and poly adpribose polymerase parp suggesting it involvement in virusinduced apoptosis most importantly we showed that while cleavage of nfkappabp is secondary to caspase activation the proteolytic activity of sva cpro is essential for induction of apoptosis experiment using the pancaspase inhibitor zvadfmk confirmed the relevance of late apoptosis for sva infection indicating that sva induces apoptosis presumably a a mechanism to facilitate virus release andor spread from infected cell together these result suggest an important role of apoptosis for sva infection biology
label: Cancer

title: clinical implication of the genetics of sporadic colorectal cancer
abstract: colorectal cancer crc is common and at least of case are sporadic without any significant family history prognostication and treatment have been relatively empirical for what ha become increasingly identified a a genetically heterogeneous disease there are three main genetic pathway in sporadic crc the chromosomal instability pathway the microsatellite instability pathway and the cpg island methylator phenotype pathway there is significant overlap between these complex molecular pathway and this limit the clinical application of crc genetics recent australian and new zealand guideline recommend routine testing of mismatch repair mmr status for new case of crc and selective kras and braf testing on the basis of diagnostic prognostic and therapeutic implication it is important that all clinician treating crc have an understanding of the importance of and basis for identifying key genetic feature of crc it is likely that in the future better molecular characterization such a that allowed by the consensus molecular subtype classification will allow improved prognostication and targeted therapy in order to deliver more personalized treatment for crc
label: Cancer

title: prognostic value of ffdg petct metabolic parameter and clinical figure in locally advanced pancreatic cancer underwent chemotherapy combined with stereotactic body radiation therapy
abstract: stereotactic body radiation therapy sbrt ha emerged to be a preference treatment for locally advanced pancreatic cancer lapc patient in this study we aimed to investigate the prognostic role of ffdg petct metabolic parameter and clinical figure in lapc patient underwent chemosbrt combined therapyduring january to january lapc patient who underwent ffdg petct within week before treatment were recruited and retrospectively analyzed maximum standardized uptake value suvmax suvmean metabolic tumor volume mtv total lesion glycolysis tlg chemoradiotherapy crt sequence and relevant clinical figure were grouped upon the median value then analyzed by kaplanmeier method and cox proportional hazard model for their prognostic evaluationthe median overall survival o and progressionfree survival pfs of all patient were month and month respectively according to the statistic result the longest diameter of tumor ldt mtv tlg and crt sequence were associated with o all p among which ldt and mtv were proved to be the independent prognostic factor for o hazard ratio hr both p additionally ldt and crt sequence were found associated with pfs both p and crt sequence wa the independent prognostic factor for pfs in chemosbrt treated lapc patient hr p for lapc patient received chemotherapy and sbrt combined therapy mtv and ldt showed independent prognostic value for o meanwhile crt sequence wa an independent pfs prediction factor
label: Cancer

title: mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma clinical pathology and treatment option
abstract: mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma is a distinct subtype of colorectal cancer crc characterized by the presence of abundant extracellular mucin which account for at least of the tumor volume mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma is found in of crc patient and occurs more commonly in female and younger patient moreover mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma is more frequently located in the proximal colon and diagnosed at an advanced stage based on it molecular context mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma is associated with the overexpression of mucin muc and mucin ac mucac protein at the same time it show higher mutation rate in the fundamental gene of the rasmapk and pikaktmtor pathway mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma also show higher rate of microsatellite instability msi than nonmucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma which might correlate it with lynch syndrome and the cpg island methylator phenotype the prognosis of mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma a to nonmucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma is debatable further the impaired response of mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma to palliative or adjuvant chemotherapy warrant more study to be performed for a specialized treatment for these patient in this review we discus the molecular background and histopathology of mucinous colorectal adenocarcinoma and provide an update on it prognosis and therapeutic from recent literature
label: Cancer

title: genetic variant in rpa associated with the response to oxaliplatinbased chemotherapy in colorectal cancer
abstract: background oxaliplatin lohp is a commonly used firstline chemotherapy for colorectal cancer genetic variant in nucleotide excision repair ner pathway gene may alter genomic integrity and the efficacy of oxaliplatinbased chemotherapy in colorectal cancer method we investigated the association between genetic variant in ner pathway gene and the disease control rate dcr and progressionfree survival pfs among colorectal cancer patient who received oxaliplatinbased chemotherapy expression quantitative trait locus eqtl analysis wa performed using the genotypetissue expression gtex portal gene harboring significant snp wa overexpressed or knocked down to demonstrate the effect on cell phenotype with or without oxaliplatin treatment result we found that r located in the untranslated region utr of rpa wa associated with dcr or p x and pfs hr p x the c allele wa significantly associated with higher rpa mrna expression level according to eqtl analysis p for sigmoid colon and p for transverse colon the c allele of r disrupted letep binding to enhance rpa expression functionally rpa knockdown inhibited cell proliferation and promoted cell apoptosis whereas rpa overexpression promoted proliferation and suppressed apoptosis furthermore low rpa expression increased sensitivity to oxaliplatin in colon cancer cell and inhibited proliferation after oxaliplatin treatment conclusion our finding demonstrate an association between r and the dcr and pfs of colorectal cancer patient rpa function a a putative oncogene in tumorigenesis by reducing sensitivity to oxaliplatin and could serve a a potential prognostic biomarker in colorectal cancer
label: Cancer

title: mucosaassociated lymphoid tissue lymphoma with tqq translocation longterm followup result
abstract: translocation qq is found in mucosaassociated lymphoid tissue malt lymphoma resulting in apimalt gene fusion it is known that tpositive malt lymphoma show a tendency to disseminate and be resistant to helicobacter pylorus eradication by antibiotic however the prognostic feature including recurrence and histological transformation ht remain unknown we conducted a singleinstitute retrospective analysis of patient with newly diagnosed malt lymphoma evaluating the impact of t on clinical outcome one hundred and six patient were screened for the translocation by fluorescence in situ hybridization andor reverse transcriptasepolymerase chain reaction of these patient patient were diagnosed a malt lymphoma with t the patient had a significantly shortened progressionfree survival pfs at year v p compared to those without t however this did not translate into overall survival or incidence of ht we confirmed previous report stating that tpositive malt lymphoma showed disseminated disease and refractoriness to h pylorus eradication therapy patient with t had more frequent monoclonal gammopathy especially of igm subtype v p some of which developed class switch these finding characterize the feature of tpositive malt lymphoma suggesting that it comprises a distinct clinical entity of malt lymphoma

title: comparison of the volumetric and radiomics finding of ffdg petct image with immunohistochemical prognostic factor in locallocally advanced breast cancer
abstract: objective the aim of this study wa to determine the change in volumetric and radiomics parameter of fluorine fluorodeoxyglucose ffdg petcomputed tomography ct imaging in locallocally advanced cancer patient according to immunohistochemical finding patient and method a total of patient who were diagnosed with locallocally advanced breast cancer and then examined by ffdg petct for staging were included in this study immunohistochemical prognostic factor estrogen receptor er progesterone receptor pr human epidermal growth factor receptor her p mutation ki proliferation index and histological grade were determined standardized uptake value suvbased volumebased and radiomics finding were obtained from ffdg petct image result in case of er and pr negativity her positivity presence of the p mutation and ki index of at least patient total volumetric parameter were significantly higher in paired comparison the result of the ernegative group were significantly higher than those of erpositive patient in glrlmglnu glrlmrlnu glzlmglnu and glzlmzlnu comparison in grade patient mean suv maximum suv and glrlmlrhge value were higher than those of grade patient suv and volumetric parameter were significantly higher in patient with ki index of at least than those with less than maximum suv breast tumor lesion glycolysis value and entropy in nuclear polymorphism in the patient group were found to be higher compared with the patient group moreover patient with mitosis had significantly higher breast metabolic tumor volume breast tumor lesion glycolysis and kurtosis value than the group conclusion er negativity triple negativity high tumor grade and high nuclear polymorphism were associated with tumor heterogeneity with respect to er negativity pr negativity high tumor grade high mitosis number high ki index her positivity and the presence of p mutation an increased tumor load were observed in addition to immunohistochemical parameter the use of radiomics data is believed to contribute to breast cancer management
