title: genomic subtyping and therapeutic targeting of acute erythroleukemia
abstract: acute erythroid leukemia ael is a highrisk leukemia of poorly understood genetic basis with controversy regarding diagnosis in the spectrum of myelodysplasia and myeloid leukemia we compared genomic feature of childhood and adult ael case with nonael myeloid disorder and defined five agerelated subgroup with distinct transcriptional profile adult tp mutated npm mutated kmta mutatedrearranged adult ddx mutated and pediatric nup rearranged genomic feature influenced outcome with npm mutation and hoxb overexpression being associated with a favorable prognosis and tp flt or rb alteration associated with poor survival targetable signaling mutation were present in of case and included recurrent mutation of alk and ntrk the latter of which drive erythroid leukemogenesis sensitive to trk inhibition this genomic landscape of ael provides the framework for accurate diagnosis and risk stratification of this disease and the rationale for testing targeted therapy in this highrisk leukemia
label: Cancer

title: radiogenomics of rectal adenocarcinoma in the era of precision medicine a pilot study of association between qualitative and quantitative mri imaging feature and genetic mutation
abstract: objective to investigate association between genetic mutation and qualitative a well a quantitative feature on mri in rectal adenocarcinoma at primary staging method in this retrospective study patient with rectal adenocarcinoma genome sequencing and pretreatment rectal mri were included statistical analysis wa performed to evaluate association between qualitative feature obtained from subjective evaluation of rectal mri and gene mutation a well a between quantitative textural feature and gene mutation for the qualitative evaluation fisher exact test wa used to analyze categorical association and wilcoxon rank sum test wa used for continuous clinical variable for the quantitative evaluation we performed manual segmentation of tweighted image for radiomicsbased quantitative image analysis thirtyfour texture feature consisting of first order intensity histogrambased feature n second order haralick texture n and gaboredge based haralick texture were computed at two different orientation consensus clustering wa performed with computed texture feature using the kmeans algorithm with euclidean distance between the texture feature the cluster resulting from the algorithm were then used to enumerate the prevalence of gene mutation in those cluster result in patient gene were mutated in more than patient and were included in the statistical analysis regarding qualitative imaging feature on univariate analysis tumor location wa significantly associated with apc p and rasa mutation p crm status wa significantly associated with atm mutation p and lymph node metastasis wa significantly associated with brca p mutation however these association were not significant after adjusting for multiple comparison regarding quantitative imaging feature cluster c had tumor with higher mean gabor edge intensity compared with cluster c theta p theta p theta p cluster c theta p theta p theta p and cluster c theta p theta p theta p suggesting that the cluster c had tumor with more distinct edge or heterogeneous appearance compared with other cluster conclusion although this preliminary study showed promising association between quantitative feature and genetic mutation it did not show any correlation between qualitative feature and genetic mutation further study with larger sample size are warranted to validate our preliminary data
label: Cancer

title: ring sideroblast in chronic phase of polycythemia vera identifies a subset of patient with an increased risk of progression to blast phase
abstract: blast phase of pv is often associated with a complex karyotype ck and bilineage dysplasia we hypothesized that bm morphologic abnormality detected in the chronic phase cp can identify patient with an increased risk of developing blast phase bp we also compared case of bp pv to a group of acute myeloid leukemia case with jak mutation amljakmut we collected morphological cytogenetics cg and molecular information at the time of diagnosis and at time of diagnosis of bp we evaluate the presence of splicing factor mutation at bp a total of patient with diagnosis of bp of pv were identified of them had bm sample available during cp ten patient with pv cp were used a control group we found that dyserythropoiesis during evolution were more frequent in patient who develop bp than in patient who remain in cp v p similarly ring sideroblast r increase during cp were more frequent in patient who develop bp v p by eln risk stratification for cg risk in bp all patient had adverse or intermediate risk in amljakmut patient had favorable a risk category tp mutation were significantly more frequent in bp than in amljakmut v p mutation analysis for splicing factor at bp wa performed on patient only patient with r had srsf patient and sfb patient mutation the other patient were wild type dyserythropoiesis and the acquisition of r precede other marker of disease progression to bp ck and tp mutation are more frequent in bp than in amljakmut sfb mutation are rare in bp
label: Cancer

title: review of ependymomas assessment of consensus in pathological diagnosis and correlation with genetic profile and outcome
abstract: we focused on histological and immunohistochemical characteristic of ependymoma epn with molecular profile to develop more reproducible criterion of the diagnosis three expert neuropathologists reviewed the pathology of sample from the japan pediatric molecular neurooncology group study confirmed case were assessed for histology surrogate marker molecular subgrouping and survival data we reached a consensus regarding the diagnosis of epns in of spinal cord tumor and of posterior fossa pf tumor that had been diagnosed a epns by local pathologist whereas we reached a consensus regarding only of the local diagnosis of supratentorial st epns among the pfepns most of anaplastic ependymomas aepns were defined a epna by methylation profiling which wa significantly correlated with the subgroup assignment regarding prognosis the overall survival of patient with pfepn wa significantly better than that of patient with pf aepn p histologically all ependymoma rela fusionpositive epnrela qualified a grade iii both l cell adhesion molecule and nuclear factor kappab p antibody showed good sensitivity for detecting epnrela this study indicated that the expert consensus pathological diagnosis could correlate well with the molecular classification in epns st epns should be diagnosed more carefully by histological and molecular analysis
label: Cancer

title: clear cell variant of papillary thyroid carcinoma with associated anaplastic thyroid carcinoma description of an extraordinary case
abstract: clear cell change is a rare observation in thyroid cancer resulting from aberrant cytoplasmic accumulation of lipid glycogen or thyroglobulin in the tumor cell the phenomenon is most common for follicular thyroid neoplasia with no definite coupling to patient outcome the clear cell variant of papillary thyroid carcinoma ccptc is even more infrequentmaking conclusion regarding prognosis difficult single report describe distant metastasis of ccptcs a well a cooccurrence with anaplastic thyroid carcinoma atc in this report a case of a therapyresistant ccptc dedifferentiating into an atc is characterized from morphological and immunohistochemical standpoint the patient wa a yearold female presenting with a mm nodule in her right thyroid lobe a first round of cytology raised the suspicion of ptc but a repeated biopsy verified an atc diagnosis neoadjuvant doxorubicin and external irradiation therapy wa administered and the patient developed lung metastasis concomitantly a palliative lobectomy wa performed and the final diagnosis wa a ccptc with focal dedifferentiation into an atc intriguingly the ccptc component wa viable and dominated the lesion the clear cell morphology stemmed from an accumulation of glycogen while the anaplastic component wa devoid of evident clear cell change the case is one of exceedingly few description of a ccptc that dedifferentiates to an atc suggesting that this ptc subtype is not without potential for development of a highly lethal tumor component moreover the partial lack of response to neoadjuvant therapy suggests a possible underlying resistance to aggressive treatment modality in this particular case
label: Cancer

title: analysis of lpl gene expression in patient with chronic lymphocytic leukemia
abstract: aim the ighv mutational status is one of the most important marker for chronic lymphocytic leukemia cll prognostication lipoprotein lipase lpl gene expression wa found to correlate with ighv status and wa suggested a it surrogate marker recent data reported that lpl expression might be influenced by pivotal signalling pathway in cll this study aimed to assess lpl gene expression in relation to key immunogenetic and molecular marker of cll including ighv mutational status bcell receptor bcr stereotypy tp notch and sfb gene mutation material and method expression of lpl mrna wa measured in peripheral blood mononuclear cell of cll patient by realtime quantitative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction rtqpcr ighv notch tp and sfb gene mutation analysis wa performed by pcr amplification and direct sequencing result of cll case were categorized a lplpositive based on the cutoff value established by roc receiver operating characteristic curve analysis lpl expression wa significantly associated with ighv mutation status r p and tended to correlate with presence of notch gene mutation p bcr stereotyped case showed higher lpl expression value in comparison to unstereotyped case in the lplpositive group of patient p lpl expression wa associated with a shorter overall survival in the entire sll group median v p a well a in binet a patient albeit with borderline significance median v not reached p conclusion lpl expression wa found to be closely correlated with ighv gene mutational status and overall survival proving lpl a prognostic marker in cll our result also indicate a possible relationship between aberrant expression of lpl and bcr and notchdependent signalling pathway
label: Cancer

title: detection of a circulating microrna custom panel in patient with metastatic colorectal cancer
abstract: there is increasing interest in liquid biopsy for cancer diagnosis prognosis and therapeutic monitoring creating the need for reliable and useful biomarkers for clinical practice here we present a protocol to extract reverse transcribe and evaluate the expression level of circulating mirnas from plasma sample of patient with colorectal cancer crc micrornas mirnas are a class of noncoding rna of nucleotide in length that regulate the expression of target gene at the translational level and play an important role including that of pro and antiangiogenic function in the physiopathology of various organ mirnas are stable in biological fluid such a serum and plasma which render them ideal circulating biomarkers for cancer diagnosis prognosis and treatment decisionmaking and monitoring circulating mirna extraction wa performed using a rapid and effective method that involves both organic and columnbased methodology for mirna retrotranscription we used a multistep procedure that considers polyadenylation at and the ligation of an adapter at of the mature mirnas followed by random mirna preamplification we selected a mirna custom panel to be tested by quantitative realtime polymerase chain reaction qrtpcr and spotted the mirna probe on array custom plate we performed qrtpcr plate run on a realtime pcr system housekeeping mirnas for normalization were selected using genorm software v data were analyzed using expression suite software v and statistical analysis were performed the method proved to be reliable and technically robust and could be useful to evaluate biomarker level in liquid sample such a plasma andor serum
label: Cancer

title: diagnosis and management of a recurrent polymeraseepsilon polemutated endometrial cancer
abstract: polymeraseepsilon polemutated carcinoma are a rare but wellknown subtype of endometrial cancer while typically associated with good prognosis recurrence are documented here we present a case of recurrent polemutated endometrial cancer discus pathologic feature current method of molecular classification and explore therapeutic implication for the polemutation phenotype
label: Cancer

title: ocular infiltration a initial presentation of acute monocytic leukaemia transformed from chronic myelomonocytic leukaemia associated with braf ve mutation
abstract: acute monocytic leukaemia frenchbritishamerican classification amlmb is characterised by a predominance of cell of the monocytic lineage on bone marrow examination furthermore a discerning feature is it tendency for tissue infiltration while gum hypertrophy and hepatosplenomegaly are common ocular involvement is rare here we present a case of a yearold man referred with proptosis and monocytosissubsequently diagnosed a amlmb whose disease course wa distinguished by extensive tissue invasion ocular pulmonary liver spleen cytogenetics and molecular test were consistent with blastic transformation of previously undiagnosed chronic myelomonocytic leukaemia supported by the presence of longstanding lowgrade monocytosis notably a braf ve mutation wa also detectedan oncogenic driver previously reported in de novo and therapyrelated but not chronic myelomonocytic leukaemiatransformed amlmb while an initial response to cytoreductive treatment wa observed his tissueinvasive disease soon progressed with worsening pulmonary infiltrates disseminated intravascular coagulation and renal failure resulting in death
label: Cancer

title: bronchoalveolar lavage in hairy cell leukemia with pulmonary infiltration
abstract: we report a yearold male patient suffering from hairy cell leukemia presenting clinically mainly with dyspnea radiology exhibited bilateral groundglass shadow in order to prevent pneumonia a a possible side effect due to conventional chemotherapy it wa decided to first treat the patient with rituximab however dyspnea persisted therefore bronchoscopy wa performed and specimen were sampled for both histological examination and bronchoalveolar lavage bal analysis bal showed lymphocytosis and by mean of immunocytochemistry a few cda blymphocytes a well a lymphoid cell positive for the hairy cell marker dba were observed in addition molecular study revealed the braf ve mutation thus the finding of bal were interpreted a lung infiltration by hairy cell leukemia this result wa confirmed by histology following a therapy switch to cladribine a significant improvement wa reached pulmonary infiltrates by hairy cell leukemia were rarely described this case represents the first report of hairy cell leukemia diagnosed by mean of bal it may be difficult to clearly separate between lymphoma infiltration of the lung and medicamentous pneumonitis but this differential diagnosis can be supported by morphological method
label: Cancer

title: metachronous contralateral male breast cancer case report and literature review
abstract: male breast cancer mbc is rare and consequently understudied here we present the case of contralateral breast cancer in a male patient nearly a quarter century following his initial breast cancer diagnosis and treatment the epidemiology risk factor diagnosis characterization treatment and prognosis of male breast cancer are reviewed mbc account for in lifetime risk of breast cancer and is present in of mbc patient while brca is present in an estimated of mbc patient the risk of contralateral breast cancer developing in a male with a unilateral lesion is much higher than for a primary male breast cancer in the general population men tend to be diagnosed at a later age and stage than female prognosis for male and female breast cancer is similar considering both age of patient and stage of the tumor at diagnosis and similar treatment paradigm have resulted in similar outcome although lumpectomy with radiation therapy may have the same prognosis a mastectomy the standard of care for male breast cancer continues to be simple mastectomy with sentinel lymph node biopsy
label: Cancer

title: a case of meningeal solitary fibrous tumourhaemangiopericytoma who grade iii metastasized to the spleen shortly after tumor resection
abstract: revision of who guideline in led to the classification of solitary fibrous tumourssftsand haemangiopericytomashpcsas a single tumor entity characterized by nabstat fusion standardofcare treatment involves surgery but local recurrence and distant metastasis sometimes occur the average latency to metastasis after surgery is month a yearold female patient presented with a complaint of headache an xxcm lesion showing gdt enhancement wa detected near the superior sagittal sinus pathological assessment following resection revealed proliferating polymorphic atypical tumor cell with distinct nucleolus in a patternless pattern cellularity wa moderate to high and mitotic figure were observed in high power field immunohistochemically tumor cell tested positive for stat and rtpcr revealed a nabstat fusion geneexons and respectively supporting a diagnosis of sfthpc who grade iii despite postoperative radiotherapy multiple metastasis to the spleen were detected month after surgery and distal pancreatectomy with splenectomy wa performed the pathology of the splenic tumor wa similar to that of the intracranial tumor recurrent disease in a lymph node wa detected month later and local radiation therapy wa administered the patient died of cancerous peritonitis month later in this case exceedingly rapid metastasis to the spleen occurred despite the administration of vigorous treatment here we review sfthpc incidence treatment and outcome to better understand this rare malignancy
label: Cancer

title: firstline treatment choice of turkish medical oncologist in metastatic colorectal cancer a survey study
abstract: purpose colorectal cancer is one of the most common malignancy in the world rasbraf mutational status and primary tumor location are also important factor for the selection of optimal combination therapy in this study we aimed to evaluate the turkish oncologist treatment decision depending on tumor location and mutational status in metastatic colorectal cancer method an online survey link wa sent to the medical oncologist who are registered to turkish society of medical oncology via email and mobile application result ninetyfour oncologist reported that tumor localization affect their treatment modality in rasbraf wild type left colon tumor turkish oncologist mostly use chemotherapy and antiegfr therapy for the firstline treatment while on the right side oncologist favored antivegf therapy in combination with chemotherapy brafmutant tumor in left colon had nearly the same rate of treatment tendency with both antivegf and antiegfr antibody in combination with chemotherapy while in rightsided tumor the main treatment selection of the participant wa antivegfbased treatment in rasmutant patient a great number of oncologist selected antivegfbased treatment on the right and left colon tumor antivegf treatment option ratio were and respectively maintenance treatment is usually preferred by oncologist in both antivegf and antiegfrbased treatment conclusion turkish oncologist are considering tumor sidedness a an indicator for treatment individualization of patient the selection of monoclonal antibody is being affected by tumor localization and mutation status
label: Cancer

title: labelfree electrochemical sensor for cd by ligandprotein interaction
abstract: detection of biomarkers in biosystems play a key role in advanced biodiagnostics for research and clinical use design of new analytical platform is challenging and in demand addressing molecular capture and subsequent quantitation herein we developed a labelfree electrochemical sensor for cd by ligandprotein interaction we assembled carbon nanotube composite on the electrode to enhance electronic conductivity by fold and reduce overpotential with a shift of mv we conjugated hyaluronic acid ha to the surface of carbon nanotube via electrostatic interaction between ha and polydiallyldimethylammonium chloride pdda consequently we performed direct electrochemical sensing of cd with a dynamic range of ngml and detection limit of pgml without any postlabeling for amplification comparable to the best current result the sensor also displayed high selectivity reproducibility with relative standard deviation rsd n of and longterm stability for day we demonstrated application of the sensor in detection of human serum and cancer cell our work guide the development of more sensor type by ligandprotein interaction and contributes to design of interface in given biosystems for diagnosis
label: Cancer

title: the prognostic significance of the long noncoding rna ccat pvt in t associated acute myeloid leukemia
abstract: long noncoding rna lncrna is recently linked to various type of cancer ccat and pvt are two lncrnas linked to t associated acute myeloid leukemia the interplay between ccat pvt and the myc protooncogene implicated in t could present an opportunity for using lncrna a prognostic biomarker or a target for therapy we investigated the expression level of lncrnas in patient with t positive aml and with t negative aml we found that ccat and pvt are expressed in higher level in t positive aml by fold compared to t negative group the expression value were significantly associated with highrisk clinical criterion moreover they are associated with lower overall survival o rate and leukemiafree survival lf however we didnt find a statistically significant cutoff value of lncrnas using the cox regression analysis for lncpvt except with lf we conclude that high expression level of ccat and pvt are associated with poor prognosis while being poor prognostic biomarkers in t associated aml
label: Cancer
combined_text: the prognostic significance of the long noncoding rna ccat pvt in t associated acute myeloid leukemia long noncoding rna lncrna is recently linked to various type of cancer ccat and pvt are two lncrnas linked to t associated acute myeloid leukemia the interplay between ccat pvt and the myc protooncogene implicated in t could present an opportunity for using lncrna a prognostic biomarker or a target for therapy we investigated the expression level of lncrnas in patient with t positive aml and with t negative aml we found that ccat and pvt are expressed in higher level in t positive aml by fold compared to t negative group the expression value were significantly associated with highrisk clinical criterion moreover they are associated with lower overall survival o rate and leukemiafree survival lf however we didnt find a statistically significant cutoff value of lncrnas using the cox regression analysis for lncpvt except with lf we conclude that high expression level of ccat and pvt are associated with poor prognosis while being poor prognostic biomarkers in t associated aml

title: long noncoding rna hotair promotes exosome secretion by regulating rab and snap in hepatocellular carcinoma
abstract: background emerging evidence indicates that tumor cell release a large amount of exosomes loaded with cargo during tumorigenesis exosome secretion is a multistep process regulated by certain related molecule long noncoding rna lncrnas play an important role in hepatocellular carcinoma hcc progression however the role of lncrna hotair in regulating exosome secretion in hcc cell remains unclear method we analyzed the relationship between hotair expression and exosome secretionrelated gene using gene set enrichment analysis gsea nanoparticle tracking analysis wa performed to validate the effect of hotair on exosome secretion the transport of multivesicular body mvbs after overexpression of hotair wa detected by transmission electron microscopy and confocal microscopy analysis of cluster determinant cd with synaptosome associated protein snap the mechanism of hotairs regulation of rasrelated protein rab rab vesicle associated membrane protein vamp and snap wa assessed using confocal colocalization analysis phosphorylation assay and rescue experiment result we found an enrichment of exosome secretionrelated gene in the hotair high expression group hotair promoted the release of exosomes by inducing mvb transport to the plasma membrane hotair regulated rab expression and localization which controlled the docking process moreover hotair facilitated the final step of fusion by influencing vamp and snap colocalization in addition we validated that hotair induced the phosphorylation of snap via mammalian target of rapamycin mtor signaling conclusion our study demonstrated a novel function of lncrna hotair in promoting exosome secretion from hcc cell and provided a new understanding of lncrnas in tumor cell biology
label: Cancer

title: the role of p isoforms expression and p mutation status in renal cell cancer prognosis
abstract: objective to analyze p mutation and gene expression of p p and p isoforms in renal cell cancer rcc tissue and normal adjacent tissue nat and to associate them to clinical feature and outcome patient and method fortyone randomly selected patient with primary previously untreated rcc with complete clinicopathohistological data were analyzed nat sample were available for case expression of p p and p wa determined using rtqpcr a functional yeastbased assay wa performed to analyze p mutation result more than half of patient harbored functional p mutation and they were significantly younger than those with wild type wt p p expression of p p and p wa upregulated in mutant mt p rcc compared to wt p rcc tissue however there wa no difference in expression of these isoforms between mt p rcc tissue and nat expression of p wa significantly downregulated in wt p tissue compared to nat p patient that harbored functional p mutation had better overall survival hazard ratio confidence interval p multivariate analysis demonstrated that tumor stage and p mutation might be used a independent prognostic marker for overall survival in rcc patient conclusion our finding support the specific event in the carcinogenesis of rcc p isoforms can be differentially expressed depending on p mutational status
label: Cancer

title: the impact of brain metastasis and associated neurocognitive aspect on health utility score in egfr mutated and alk rearranged nsclc a real world evidence analysis
abstract: background in lung cancer brain metastasis bm and their treatment are associated with high economic burden and inferior healthrelated quality of life in the era of targeted therapy real world evidence through health utility score hus is critical for economic analysis material and method in a prospective observational cohort study outpatient with stage iv lung cancer completed demographic and eqdl survey to derive hus health state and clinicopathologic variable were obtained from chart abstraction patient were categorized by the presence or absence of bm regression analysis identified factor that were associated with hus a subset of patient prospectively completed neurocognitive function ncf test andor the factbrain factbr questionnaire which were then correlated with hus spearman coefficient regression analysis result of patient with eqdlderived hus completed ncf test and completed factbr never developed bm developed first bm during study period and had bm at study entry the sample wa enriched for egfr mutation egfrm and alkrearrangements alkr there were no hus difference by bm status overall and in subset by demographic in multivariable analysis superior hus wa associated with having egfrmalkr p no prior radiation for extracranial disease p and both intracranial p and extracranial disease control p hus correlated with multiple element of the factbr and test of ncf conclusion having bm in lung cancer is not associated with inferior hus in a population enriched for egfrm and alkr patient exhibiting disease control and those with oncogeneaddicted tumor have superior hus implication for practice in the setting of egfr mutation or alk rearrangement nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc a diagnosis of brain metastasis no longer consigns the patient to an inferior health state suggesting that new economic analysis in nsclc are needed in the era of targeted therapy additionally the eqd questionnaire is associated with measure of healthrelated quality of life and neurocognitive score suggesting this tool should be further explored in prospective clinical study
label: Cancer

title: the expression of circulating mir in plasma is associated with egfr mutation status in nonsmallcell lung carcinoma patient
abstract: micrornas mirnas key regulator of gene expression at the posttranscriptional level are grossly misregulated in some human cancer including nonsmallcell lung carcinoma nsclc the aberrant expression of specific mirnas result in the abnormal regulation of key component of signalling pathway in tumour cell mirna level and the activity of the gene target including oncogene and tumour suppressor produce feedback that change mirna expression level and indicates the cell genetic activity in this study we measured the expression of five circulating mirnas mir mir mir mirb and mir and evaluated their association with epidermal growth factor receptor egfr mutation status in nsclc patient moreover we examined the discriminative power of circulating mirnas for egfr mutantpositive and negative nsclc patient using two different data normalisation approach we extracted total rna from the plasma of nonsquamous nsclc patient of whom had tumour with egfr mutation and measured circulating mirna level using quantitative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction rtqpcr the mirna expression level were normalised using two endogenous control mir and mir we found significant association between the expression of circulating mir and egfractivating mutation in nsclc patient regardless of the normalisation approach used p and for mir and mir normalisation respectively the greatest discriminative power of circulating mir wa observed in patient with egfr exon deletion versus wildtype egfr normalised to mir area under the curve auc p interestingly circulating mir level were significantly reduced in the vkiras kirsten rat sarcoma viral oncogene homolog krasmutated subgroup compared to egfrmutated patient p and those with egfrkras wildtype tumour p our study demonstrated the feasibility and potential diagnostic value of plasma mir expression analysis to distinguish between egfrmutated and wildtype nsclc patient however quality control and normalisation strategy are very important and have a major impact on the outcome of circulating mirna analysis
label: Cancer

title: noninvasive follicular thyroid neoplasm with papillarylike nuclear feature niftp update and diagnostic considerationsa review
abstract: advance in our understanding of thyroid lesion especially those entity with an indolent behavior ha led clinician to question the most appropriate surgical management of such thyroid nodule several study have shown that the noninvasive encapsulated follicular variant of papillary thyroid carcinoma niefvpc exhibit poor histopathologic diagnostic reproducibility and have been overtreated a conventional thyroid cancer in an international thyroid working group reevaluated niefvpc and it diagnostic criterion the new terminology of noninvasive follicular thyroid neoplasm with papillarylike nuclear feature niftp wa accordingly introduced to replace niefvpc the literature ha emphasized that niftps are biologically similar to follicular adenoma lacking lymph node metastasis andor recurrence while the definition of niftp is based on specific morphological parameter recent study have questioned whether the criterion allowing less than of true papilla should be revised to a total absence of papilla the motivation for this revision is the rare finding in some study of lymph node with metastatic niftp this review evaluates the existing published series of niftp case clinical consequence of niftp and emerging change in the diagnostic criterion for niftp the introduction of niftp ha resulted in significant impact on the clinical management of thyroid nodule recent revision in the morphological criterion for niftp emphasize the need to adhere to very stringent histomorphologic criterion when making a diagnosis of niftp the adoption of niftp terminology instead of niefvpc is associated with conservative lobectomy without radioactive iodine treatment in the majority of case
label: Cancer

title: intussusception reveals mutyhassociated polyposis syndrome and colorectal cancer a case report
abstract: background we are reporting a rare case of mutyhassociated polyposis a colorectal cancer hereditary syndrome diagnosticated after an intussusception colorectal cancer is an important cause of cancer related mortality that can be manifested by an intussusception a rare occurrence in adult and almost always related to tumor approximately of colorectal cancer can be attributed to syndrome known to cause hereditary colorectal cancer such a mutyhassociated polyposis autosomal genetic syndrome associated with this disease case presentation we present the case of a year old male that sought medical consultation with a complaint of abdominal discomfort that after five day changed it characteristic the patient wa sent to the emergency department were a ctscan revealed intestinal subocclusion by ileocolic invagination right colectomy wa carried out the anatomicpathological examination revealed a moderately differentiated mucinous adenocarcinoma and multiple sessile polyp which led to the suspicion of a genetic syndrome in the genetics analysis two mutation were observed in the mutyh gene and mutyhassociated polyposis wa diagnosticated conclusion this case demonstrates the importance of meticulous analysis of the patient examination result to identify possible discrete alteration that can lead to improved understanding of disease
label: Cancer

title: diagnosis of lung biopsy employing the who criterion and detection of related oncogenic driver mutation
abstract: objective the diagnostic criterion of lung biopsy specimen by who lung tumor classification were used to evaluate lung biopsy specimen along with detection of genetic alteration of major tumor driving gene including epidermal growth factor receptor egfr method the clinical data histological slide immunohistochemical stain and special stain of lung biopsy specimen at beijing hospital from july to july were retrospectively analyzed diagnosis of lung cancer wa reclassified according to the who lung tumor classification and related gene mutation data were analyzed result during a threeyear period the total number of lung cancer diagnosis wa case including female and male patient with age ranging from to year median age of year there were case of small cell carcinoma case of large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma case of combined neuroendocrine carcinoma case of atypical carcinoid case of adenocarcinoma case of nonsmall cell carcinoma favor adenocarcinoma case of squamous cell carcinoma case of nonsmall cell carcinoma favor squamous cell carcinoma case of nonsmall cell carcinoma not otherwise specified and case of nonsmall cell carcinoma possible adenosquamous carcinoma among case tested case showed egfr mutation including of case of adenocarcinoma and of case of nonsmall cell carcinoma favor adenocarcinoma twenty two case were found to have tm mutation among patient after egfr tki targeted drug therapy immunohistochemical staining of alk df wa positive in of case of nonsmall cell lung cancer confirmed by emlalk fusion gene fluorescence pcr ro gene fusion wa found in of case splicing mutation in exon of met gene were seen in one case of nonsmall cell carcinoma with spindle cell differentiation conclusion the new diagnostic criterion by the who lung tumor classification is better suited for diagnosing lung biopsy specimen and providing accurate treatment guidance and improving the patient outcome
label: Cancer

title: dedifferentiated liposarcoma with inflammatory myofibroblastic tumorlike feature a clinicopathological analysis of five case
abstract: objective to investigate the clinicopathological feature diagnosis and differential diagnosis of dedifferentiated liposarcoma ddlps with inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor imtlike feature method five case of ddlps with imtlike feature were collected from the first affiliated hospital of nanjing medical university the affiliated hospital of nanjing university of traditional chinese medicine and the first people hospital of qinzhou between and envision method and fluorescence in situ hybridization fish were used to detect the immunophenotype of the tumor cell and the profile of mdm gene amplification respectively result all five case were male and the median age wa range to year the clinical symptom were mainly related to the spaceoccupying lesion the tumor were located in duodenal mesentery two case intestinal wall one case retroperitoneum one case and spermatic cord one case grossly the tumor were not well encapsulated ranging from to cm median cm in diameter with tan to gray and firm cut surface histologically the dedifferentiated component closely resembled inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor imt with spindlepolygonalstellateshaped cell arranged in storiform sheetlike or random pattern with varying degree of chronic inflammation and fibrosis all three major pattern seen in imt myxoid cellular and hypocellular fibrous were observed the hypocellular fibrous pattern wa the most common welldifferentiated liposarcomatous component wa found in the peripheral area of all the tumor one case had high grade dedifferentiated component four case were strongly positive for mdm and p two case were positive for sma and one case wa focally positive for desmin and one for cd none of the case stained for alk fish demonstrated mdm gene amplification in all five case clinical followup were available in all five case and the interval ranged from to month median month two patient developed recurrence and one patient had metastasis the remaining two patient were alive with no evidence of tumor recurrence at and month after surgery respectively conclusion ddlps with imtlike feature is a more aggressive neoplasm than it histological mimic imt and should not be misdiagnosed a other intermediate or lowgrade malignant tumor such a imt sclerosing liposarcoma inflammatory liposarcoma aggressive fibromatosis solitary fibrous tumor lowgrade myofibroblastic sarcoma and lowgrade fibrosarcoma

title: pembrolizumab versus chemotherapy for previously untreated pdlexpressing locally advanced or metastatic nonsmallcell lung cancer keynote a randomised openlabel controlled phase trial
abstract: background firstline pembrolizumab monotherapy improves overall and progressionfree survival in patient with untreated metastatic nonsmallcell lung cancer with a programmed death ligand pdl tumour proportion score tps of or greater we investigated overall survival after treatment with pembrolizumab monotherapy in patient with a pdl tps of or greater method this randomised openlabel phase study wa done in medical centre in country eligible patient were adult year with previously untreated locally advanced or metastatic nonsmallcell lung cancer without a sensitising egfr mutation or alk translocation and with an eastern cooperative oncology group ecog performance status score of or life expectancy month or longer and a pdl tps of or greater randomisation wa computer generated accessed via an interactive voiceresponse and integrated webresponse system and stratified by region of enrolment east asia v rest of world ecog performance status score v histology squamous v nonsquamous and pdl tps v enrolled patient were randomly assigned in block of four per stratum to receive pembrolizumab mg every week for up to cycle or the investigator choice of platinumbased chemotherapy for four to six cycle primary endpoint were overall survival in patient with a tps of or greater or greater and or greater onesided significance threshold p p and p respectively in the intentiontotreat population assessed sequentially if the previous finding were significant this study is registered at clinicaltrialsgov number nct finding from dec to march patient men woman median age year iqr with a pdl tps of or greater were allocated to pembrolizumab n or chemotherapy n and included in the intentiontotreat population had a tps of or greater and patient had a tps of or greater a of feb median followup wa month overall survival wa significantly longer in the pembrolizumab group than in the chemotherapy group in all three tps population hazard ratio ci p p and p the median surival value by tps population were month ci for pembrolizumab versus month for chemotherapy month versus month and month versus month respectively treatmentrelated adverse event of grade or worse occurred in of treated patient in the pembrolizumab group and in of in the chemotherapy group and led to death in and patient respectively interpretation the benefittorisk profile suggests that pembrolizumab monotherapy can be extended a firstline therapy to patient with locally advanced or metastatic nonsmallcell lung cancer without sensitising egfr or alk alteration and with low pdl tps funding merck sharp dohme

title: specific allelic variant of snp in the mdm and mdmx gene are associated with earlier tumor onset and progression in caucasian breast cancer patient
abstract: background genetic factor play a substantial role in breast cancer etiology gene encoding protein that have key function in the dna damage response such a p and it inhibitor mdm and mdmx are most likely candidate to harbor allelic variant that influence breast cancer susceptibility the aim of our study wa to comprehensively analyze the impact of snp in the tp mdm and mdmx gene in conjunction with tp mutational status regarding the onset and progression of breast cancer method in specimen from breast cancer patient five snp within the selected gene were analyzed tp argpro r mdm snp r snp r mdmx snp r and snp r classification of the tumor wa evaluated by histomorphology subtyping according hormone receptor status herstatus and proliferation rate enabled provision of the clinicopathological surrogate of intrinsic subtypes result the homozygous callele of mdm snp wa significantly associated with a younger ageatdiagnosis of year in contrast to gg and gcpatients yr respectively p logranktest in contrast there wa no difference regarding the ageatdiagnosis for patient with the respective genotype of mdm snp p logranktest in patient with estrogen receptor erpositive and tpmutated tumor however the ttgenotype of the mdm snp wa significantly associated with an earlier average ageatdiagnosis compared with tgggpatients v yr p logranktest in the triplenegative subgroup the ggpatients had an average ageatdiagnosis of year compared with year for snpt carrier p logranktest indicating a susceptibility of the gg genotype for the development of triple negative breast cancer patient with the aagenotype of mdmx snp with ernegative tumor were diagnosed year earlier compared with patient and erpositive tumor v yr p logranktest furthermore in luminal blike patient herindependent the ccgenotype of mdmx snp wa significantly correlated with a decreased eventfree survival compared with the aagenotype p logranktest conclusion we showed that snp in the mdm and mdmx gene affect at least in part the onset and progression of breast cancer dependent on the erstatus our finding provide further evidence for the distinct etiological pathway in ernegative and erpositive breast cancer

title: mirbp and mir cooperatively regulate blm gene expression by directly targeting the utr in pc cell
abstract: blm recq like helicase blm ha a pivotal role in genetic recombination transcription dna replication and dna repair which present the possibility of using blm a an anticancer target for treatment however the posttranscriptional control regulation of blm gene expression is not fully understood and limit the application of drug targeting blm for carcinoma therapy in the future micrornas mirnas inhibit gene expression through interaction with the untranslated region utr of mrna at the posttranscriptional stage therefore the current study screened for mirnas that regulate blm gene expression with software predicting that mirna mirbp mir mirp mirp and mirp blm gene expression level in the pc prostate cancer cell line and rwpe normal prostate epithelium cell line were detected by reverse transcriptionquantitative pcr additionally blm mrna level were following mirna overexpression for and h for further mirna filtration and validation a dualluciferase reporter system and western blot analysis were performed which demonstrated that mirbp and mir reduce blm gene expression by directly targeting the blm mrna utr a boxbehnken design experiment suggested that mirbp and mir have synergetic mutual effect on blm gene expression finally the suppressive effect of mirbp and mir on pc cell proliferation colony formation migration and invasion indicated the benefit of studying blm a a drug target in cancer in conclusion the finding of the current provide evidence that mirbp and mir have an oncosuppressive function in pc cell and cooperatively downregulate blm expression at the posttranscriptional level
label: Cancer

title: gtse is involved in breast cancer progression in p mutationdependent manner
abstract: background with the rapid development of the high throughput detection technique tumorrelated omics data ha become an important source for studying the mechanism of tumor progression including breast cancer one of the major malignancy worldwide a previous study ha shown that the g and s phaseexpressed gtse can act a an oncogene in several human cancer however it functional role in breast cancer remain elusive method in this study we analyzed breast cancer data downloaded from the cancer genome atlas tcga database and other online database including the oncomine bcgenexminer and proggenev database to identify the molecule contributing to the progression of breast cancer the gtse expression level were investigated using qrtpcr immunoblotting and ihc the biological function of gtse in the growth migration and invasion of breast cancer wa examined in mdamb mdamb and mcf cell line the in vitro cell proliferative migratory and invasive ability were evaluated by mt colony formation and transwell assay respectively the role of gtse in the growth and metastasis of breast cancer were revealed by in vivo investigation using balbc nude mouse result we showed that the expression level of gtse wa upregulated in breast cancer specimen and cell line especially in triple negative breast cancer tnbc and p mutated breast cancer cell line importantly high gtse expression wa positively correlated with histological grade and poor survival we demonstrated that gtse could promote breast cancer cell growth by activating the akt pathway and enhance metastasis by regulating the epithelialmesenchymal transition emt pathway furthermore it could cause multidrug resistance in breast cancer cell interestingly we found that gtse could regulate the p function to alter the cell cycle distribution dependent on the mutation state of p conclusion our result reveal that gtse played a key role in the progression of breast cancer indicating that gtse could serve a a novel biomarker to aid in the assessment of the prognosis of breast cancer
label: Cancer

title: increased breast cancer risk in woman with neurofibromatosis type a metaanalysis and systematic review of the literature
abstract: background neurofibromatosis type nf is a cancer predisposing syndrome study suggest that woman v stage iiiiv respectively p median survival for the entire cohort wa year v the reported median bc survival of over year in the general population using the seer database median age at bc death wa year of deceased patient were yo conclusion this systematic literature review and metaanalysis suggests that woman with nf yo have a fivefold increased risk of bc present with more advanced disease and may have an increased bc related mortality increased awareness and implementation of recent national comprehensive cancer network early bc screening guideline for this highrisk patient population is essential additional evaluation on the influence of nf gene mutation identified in patient undergoing hereditary cancer genetic testing on breast cancer risk in individual without clinical evidence of nf is needed
label: Cancer

title: an update on the central nervous system manifestation of neurofibromatosis type
abstract: neurofibromatosis nf is an autosomal dominant genetic disorder that present with variable phenotype a a result of mutation in the neurofibromatosis type nf gene and subsequently abnormal function of the protein product neurofibromin patient with nf are at increased risk for central nervous system cns manifestation including structural functional and neoplastic disease the mechanism underlying the varied manifestation of nf are incompletely understood but the loss of functional neurofibromin resulting in sustained activation of the oncoprotein ra is responsible for tumorigenesis throughout the body including the cns much of our understanding of nfrelated cns manifestation is from a combination of data from animal model and natural history study of people with nf and cns disease data from animal model suggest the importance of both nf mutation and somatic genetic alteration such a tp loss for development of neoplasm a well a the role of the timing of the acquisition of such alteration on the variability of cns manifestation a variety of nonneoplastic structural macrocephaly hydrocephalus aqueductal stenosis and vasculopathy and functional epilepsy impaired cognition attention deficit and autism spectrum disorder abnormality occur with variable frequency in individual with nf in addition there is increasing evidence that similar appearing cns neoplasm in people with and without the nf syndrome are due to distinct oncogenic pathway glioma in people with nf show alteration in the rasmapk pathway generally in the absence of braf alteration common to sporadic pilocytic astrocytomas or idh or histone h mutation common to diffuse glioma subset a subset of lowgrade astrocytomas in these patient remain difficult to classify using standard criterion and occasionally demonstrate morphologic feature resembling subependymal giant cell astrocytomas that afflict patient with tuberous sclerosis complex segalike astrocytomas there is also emerging evidence that nfassociated highgrade astrocytomas have frequent coexisting alteration such a atrx mutation and an alternative lengthening of telomere alt phenotype responsible for unique biologic property ongoing effort are seeking to improve diagnostic accuracy for cns neoplasm in the setting of nf versus sporadic tumor in addition mek inhibitor which act on the rasmapk pathway continue to be studied a rational target for the treatment of nfassociated tumor including cns tumor
label: Cancer

sporadic tumor in addition mek inhibitor which act on the rasmapk pathway continue to be studied a rational target for the treatment of nfassociated tumor including cns tumor

title: nonve braf mutation and egfr signaling pathway in colorectal cancer
abstract: the raf murine sarcoma viral oncogene homolog b brafve mutation mt in metastatic colorectal cancer crc is a wellknown prognostic indicator and a negative predictive biomarker for antiepidermal growth factor receptor egfr treatment however the clinical characteristic and significance of brafnonve mt remain unclear here we evaluated the clinical characteristic of brafnonve mt v those of other mt in the egfr signaling pathway including brafve consecutive crc patient in our institute from june to november were enrolled in our study multiplex genotyping of the egfr pathway wa performed with archival sample using a luminex assay for brafve brafnonve krasnras exon and phosphatidylinositolbisphosphate kinase catalytic subunit alpha pikca we analyzed correlation among the mt profile clinical data and primary tumor location in crc all statistical analysis were performed using r software crc sample from male and female patient were analyzed of which or had stage i ii iii or iv or recurrent crc respectively the frequency of brafve brafnonve kras including exon nra and pikca mt were and respectively the characteristic of patient with the brafve mt were an age of year old a rightsided primary tumor location poorly differentiated histology and an advanced disease stage in contrast the characteristic of patient with brafnonve mt were a leftsided primary tumor location and welldifferentiated histology brafnonve mt were relatively rare and showed different characteristic compared to the brafve mt these result may contribute to future precision medicine
label: Cancer

title: endosomal escape by photoactivated fusion of liposome containing a malachite green derivative a novel class of photoresponsive liposome for drug delivery vehicle
abstract: we conducted photoactivated delivery of drug based on the fusion of liposome with endocytic membrane thus allowing the direct release of encapsulated drug inside the cytoplasm a described in our earlier work liposome can be photoresponsive and fusogenic following the incorporation of a malachite green derivative carrying a long alkyl chain mgl into the lipid membrane we prepared mgl liposome using palmitoyloleoylsnglycerophosphatidylcholine and encapsulated doxorubicin dox though the shape of mgl liposome became elliptical after encapsulating dox uv irradiation did not enhance dox leakage from mgl liposome we demonstrated the cellular uptake of mgl liposome into murine cell derived from colon cancer colon cell using flow cytometry and we found that the uptake wa governed by a clathrindependent endocytosis pathway confocal fluorescence microscopic observation of colon cell treated with mgl liposome encapsulating dox revealed that dox wa localized in endosomes under dark condition while dox wa observed in the cytosol and nucleus after uv irradiation the viability of colon cell treated with mgl liposome encapsulating dox wa reduced by uv irradiation indicating photoinduced enhancement of anticancer efficacy
label: Cancer

title: defective homologous recombination dna repair a therapeutic target in advanced chordoma
abstract: chordomas are rare bone tumor with few therapeutic option here we show using wholeexome and genome sequencing within a precision oncology program that advanced chordomas n may be characterized by genomic pattern indicative of defective homologous recombination hr dna repair and alteration affecting hrrelated gene including for example deletion and pathogenic germline variant of brca nbn and chek a mutational signature associated with hr deficiency wa significantly enriched in of sample and cooccurred with genomic instability the polyadpribose polymerase parp inhibitor olaparib which is preferentially toxic to hrincompetent cell led to prolonged clinical benefit in a patient with refractory chordoma and wholegenome analysis at progression revealed a parp pta mutation predicted to disrupt the autoinhibitory parp helical domain these finding uncover a therapeutic opportunity in chordoma that warrant further exploration and provide insight into the mechanism underlying parp inhibitor resistance
label: Cancer

title: diverse and cancer typespecific role of the p rq gainoffunction mutation in cancer migration and invasiveness
abstract: gainoffunction gof mutation in the tp gene lead to acquisition of new function by the mutated tumor suppressor p protein a number of the overrepresented hot spot mutation including the one in codon or convey gof phenotype such phenotype may include resistance to chemotherapeutics or change in motility and invasiveness whereas the prevalent notion is that the acquisition of the p gof phenotype translates into poorer prognosis for the patient the analysis of a human somatic p mutation dataset demonstrated earlier tumor onset but decreased frequency and altered location of metastasis in patient with the prq allele therefore the gof activity of prq and pdg were analyzed in triple negative breast cancer mdamb and lung adenocarcinoma h cell line with regard to invasive and metastatic trait the expression of pdg increased the motility and invasiveness of the lung cancer cell but not those of the breast cancer cell in contrast the expression of prq decreased the motility and invasiveness of the breast and lung cancer cell in a p transactivationdependent manner the intravenous xenotransplantation of mdamb cell expressing prq into zebrafish embryo resulted in an alteration of the distribution of cancer cell in the body of the fish in prqexpressing h cell a decrease in the expression of tcfzeb and ncadherin wa observed suggesting partial mesenchymaltoepithelial transition in the two cell line expressing prq a decrease wa noted in the expression of myosin light chain a protein involved in actomyosinbased motility to the best of our knowledge the present study is one of only few report demonstrating the mutated p gof activity resulting in a decrease of a malignant trait in human cancer
label: Cancer

title: different clinical presentation and management in complete androgen insensitivity syndrome cais
abstract: complete androgen insensitivity syndrome cais is an xlinked recessive genetic disorder resulting from maternally inherited or de novo mutation involving the androgen receptor gene situated in the xqq region the diagnosis is based on the presence of female external genitalia in a xy human individual with normally developed but undescended testis and complete unresponsiveness of target tissue to androgen subsequently pelvic ultrasound or magnetic resonance imaging mri could be helpful in confirming the absence of mullerian structure revealing the presence of a blindending vagina and identifying testis cais management still represents a unique challenge throughout childhood and adolescence particularly regarding timing of gonadectomy type of hormonal therapy and psychological concern indeed this condition is associated with an increased risk of testicular germ cell tumour tgct although tgct result less frequently than in other disorder of sex development dsd furthermore the majority of detected tumoral lesion are noninvasive and with a low probability of progression into aggressive form therefore histological epidemiological and prognostic feature of testicular cancer in cais allow postponing of the gonadectomy until after pubertal age in order to guarantee the initial spontaneous pubertal development and avoid the necessity of hormonal replacement therapy hrt induction however hrt is necessary after gonadectomy in order to prevent symptom of hypoestrogenism and to maintain secondary sexual feature this article present differential clinical presentation and management in patient with cais to emphasize the continued importance of standardizing the clinical and surgical approach to this disorder
label: Cancer

title: prevalence and prognostic value of ckit and tp mutation in canine mast cell tumour
abstract: cutaneous mast cell tumour mct are among the most frequent malignancy in dog their clinical behaviour is highly variable and with the exception of mutation in the ckit gene little is known about their genetic aetiology the mutational status of the ckit exon and and exon of the tp gene wa analysed to find marker for molecular stratification of mcts and predictor of clinical outcome mutation in the ckit gene were detected in n sample and their presence wa significantly associated with the high histopathological grade p mutation in the dna binding domain of the tp gene were found in n of the analysed mcts and their frequency wa similar in low and high grade mcts p tp mutation were not useful prognostic factor in this sample of canine cutaneous mcts
label: Cancer

title: the diagnostic significance of trophoblast cellsurface antigen expression in benign and malignant thyroid lesion
abstract: context thyroid cancer are the most common malignancy of the endocrine system overexpression of trophoblast cellsurface antigen trop in various tumor ha been found to correlate with poor prognosis and aggressive tumor behavior aim the aim of this study wa to evaluatetrop expression in thyroid neoplasm subject and method this study contained case including follicular nodular disease fnd follicular adenoma fa papillary thyroid carcinoma ptc follicular thyroid carcinoma ftc medullary thyroid carcinoma mtc poorly differentiated thyroid carcinoma pdtc and undifferentiated thyroid carcinoma udtc trop expression wa investigated via immunohistochemistry in section prepared from paraffin block of the case result the case comprised male and female with a mean age of year range year trop expression wa observed in of the malignant lesion of the thyroid except for medullary carcinoma poorly differentiated and undifferentiated thyroid carcinoma immunoreactivity wa in fa of case with ftc and in ptc follicular variant ptc fv the difference between faftc and faptc follicular variant were both significant p p respectively there wa no difference between ftcptc fv p conclusion trop can be considered a useful marker for distinguishing ptc fv case from follicular nodular disease and follicular adenoma case because of it high sensitivity in the identification of papillary carcinoma of the thyroid

title: posttransplant epithelioid inflammatory myofibroblastic sarcoma a case report
abstract: epithelioid inflammatory myofibroblastic sarcoma eims is a rare entity and a novel variant of inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor imt usually seen in child and nonsmoking young adult their occurrence in a posttransplant setting is still rare these tumor are characterized by prominent epithelioid morphology large histiocytoid reed sternberglike cell unique pattern of alk immunoreactivity and aggressive clinical behavior their etiology and metastatic potential is controversial in a posttransplant setting many factor such a trauma infection with ebv hiv hepatitis c mycobacteria fungus and chemotherapyinduced immunosuppression have been implicated in their etiology we present the case of a yearold female child who developed multiple omental and mesenteric tumor nodule month post liver transplant for progressive familial intrahepatic cholestasis pfic following a histopathological diagnosis of mesenchymal neoplasm of possible malignant nature on a trucut biopsy and frozen section tumor debulking wa performed a final histological diagnosis of emis wa made on the completely resected tumor the patient remains in remission nearly month after presentation without any followup systemic chemotherapy imt after a solid organ transplant is rare only case have been reported in the literature until now similar phenomenon ha also been noted with hematopoietic stem cell transplant however to our knowledge this case of emis in a post liver transplant patient is first of it kind
label: Cancer

title: epithelioid sarcoma of paratesticular region a case report of an unusual case
abstract: primary tumor of the paratesticular region are rare with sarcoma constituting a major proportion particularly in the old age the paratesticular region consists of mesothelial various epithelial and mesenchymal cell and may therefore give rise to a variety of tumor epithelioid sarcoma usually occurs at the distal extremity of young adult the proximaltype variant is characterized by a more aggressive course and resistance to treatment we herein report a case of year male with scrotal swelling diagnosed a proximaltype epithelioid sarcoma of paratesticular region after histopathological examination and immunohistochemistry to the best of our knowledge this is only the second case of proximal epithelioid sarcoma of paratesticular region in the english literature a these tumor are rare it ha been difficult to establish their optimal treatment also these can be easily misdiagnosed a other epithelioid lesion

title: the effect of inhaler aromatherapy on invasive pain procedure adherence vital sign and saturation during port catheterization in oncology patient
abstract: the study wa conducted to evaluate the effect of inhaler aromatherapy on invasive pain procedure adherence vital sign and saturation during port catheter insertion among patient diagnosed with cancer the study wa conducted in a nonrandomized controlled trial sixty patient including patient in the intervention group and patient in the control group who were subjected with the same local anesthetic protocol were included in the study aromatic mixture prepared by diluting orange chamomile and lavender oil in ml distilled water wa inhaled by the intervention group during the procedure the data of the study were collected by using questionnaire vital followup form and visual analog scale the patient in the intervention and control group were similar in term of sociodemographic and disease characteristic p it wa determined that inhaler aromatherapy applied to patient in the intervention group decreased pain experienced during the procedure and facilitated the procedure adherence p it can be recommended to administer inhaler aromatherapy with pharmacological therapy during catheterization procedure since it decrease invasive pain and facilitates the procedure adherence
label: Cancer

title: clinical spectrum of lifraumeni syndromelifraumenilike syndrome in brazilian individual with the tp prh mutation
abstract: background the tp prh germline mutation is highly prevalent among child with adrenocortical tumor act from south and southeast brazil however the prevalence of other tumor of the lifraumeni syndrome lf and lifraumenilike syndrome lfl spectrum the clinical outcome and the potential tumor occurrence in relative carrying this distinct tp mutation were not fully investigated patient and method we investigated tumor profile data and outcome of individual and their close relative with the tp prh germline mutation a questionnaire and the toronto protocol were used for evaluation of asymptomatic carrier of this tp mutation result the cohort of this study comprised patient from different family were female all but one harbored the tp prh mutation in heterozygous state only one child wa homozygous for this variant maternal allele inheritance occurred in of the case p in pediatric group act wa the most common primary tumor at the diagnosis median age year no patient of the pediatric group who initially presented with act developed a second primary tumor and n died due to complication related to the primary tumor median followup time of month range month in adult group the main tumor at diagnosis were adrenocortical carcinoma acc median age year breast cancer median age year soft tissue sarcoma median age year and choroid plexus carcinoma cpc median age year among adult patient who were diagnosed with acc a the first primary tumor all presented with aggressive disease a per histologic and clinical criterion at diagnosis and of patient died median followup time of month range month five adult patient had a second primary tumor including bronchoalveolar lung cancer case acc uterine cervical carcinoma and fibrosarcoma the diagnosis of these tumor wa established from to month after the first primary tumor three family presented more than one case of act nine malignant neoplasm were diagnosed in asymptomatic carrier using toronto protocol conclusion this study confirms a high frequency of tp prh mutation in pediatric group with act in addition we observed the occurrence of other tumor of lfslfl spectrum and a difference in the aggressiveness of act depending on the age group in which they were diagnosed the predominance of maternal mutated allele inheritance wa first demonstrated in the affected brazilian family

title: inherited predisposition to malignant mesothelioma and overall survival following platinum chemotherapy
abstract: survival from malignant mesothelioma particularly pleural mesothelioma is very poor for patient with breast ovarian or prostate cancer overall survival is associated with increased sensitivity to platinum chemotherapy due to lossoffunction mutation in dna repair gene the goal of this project wa to evaluate in patient with malignant mesothelioma the relationship between inherited lossoffunction mutation in dna repair and other tumor suppressor gene and overall survival following platinum chemotherapy patient with histologically confirmed malignant mesothelioma were evaluated for inherited mutation in tumor suppressor gene survival wa evaluated with respect to genotype and site of mesothelioma among patient treated with platinum chemotherapy median overall survival wa significantly longer for patient with lossoffunction mutation in any of the targeted gene compared with patient with no such mutation p the effect of genotype wa highly significant for patient with pleural mesothelioma median survival y versus y p but not for patient with peritoneal mesothelioma median survival y versus y p effect of patient genotype on overall survival measured at y remained independently significant after adjusting for gender and age at diagnosis two other known prognostic factor patient with pleural mesothelioma with inherited mutation in dna repair and other tumor suppressor gene appear to particularly benefit from platinum chemotherapy compared with patient without inherited mutation these patient may also benefit from other dna repair targeted therapy such a polyadp ribose polymerase parp inhibitor
label: Cancer

title: a requirement for stag in replication fork progression creates a targetable synthetic lethality in cohesinmutant cancer
abstract: cohesin is a multiprotein ring that is responsible for cohesion of sister chromatid and formation of dna loop to regulate gene expression genomic analysis have identified that the cohesin subunit stag is frequently inactivated by mutation in cancer however the reason stag mutation are selected during tumorigenesis and strategy for therapeutically targeting mutant cancer cell are largely unknown here we show that stag is essential for dna replication fork progression whereby stag inactivation in nontransformed cell lead to replication fork stalling and collapse with disruption of interaction between the cohesin ring and the replication machinery a well a failure to establish smc acetylation a a consequence stag mutation confers synthetic lethality with dna doublestrand break repair gene and increased sensitivity to select cytotoxic chemotherapeutic agent and parp or atr inhibitor these study identify a critical role for stag in replication fork procession and elucidate a potential therapeutic strategy for cohesinmutant cancer
label: Cancer

title: molecular carcinogenesis of gastric cancer lauren classification mucin phenotype expression and cancer stem cell
abstract: gastric cancer gc one of the most common human cancer is a heterogeneous disease with different phenotype prognosis and response to treatment understanding the pathogenesis of gc at the molecular level is important for prognosis prediction and determining treatment microsatellite instability msi silencing of mlh mgmt and cdkna gene by dna hypermethylation kras mutation apc mutation and erbb amplification are frequently found in intestinal type gc inactivation of cdh and rarb by dna hypermethylation and amplification of fgfr and met are frequently detected in diffuse type gc in addition bst and pcdhb gene are overexpressed in intestinal type gc both gene are associated with gc progression gc can be divided into gastricintestinal mucin phenotype according to mucin expression msi alteration of tp cdh mutation and dna methylation of mlh are detected frequently in the gastric mucin phenotype tp mutation deletion of apc and dna methylation of mgmt are detected frequently in the intestinal mucin phenotype fktn is overexpressed in the intestinal mucin phenotype and iqgap is overexpressed in the gastric mucin phenotype these gene are involved in gc progression to characterize cancer stem cell a useful method is spheroid colony formation kifc and kif gene show more than twofold higher expression in spheroidforming cell than that in parental cell both kif gene are overexpressed in gc and knockdown of these gene inhibits spheroid formation alteration of these molecule may be useful to understand gastric carcinogenesis specific inhibitor of these molecule may also be promising anticancer drug
label: Cancer
combined_text: molecular carcinogenesis of gastric cancer lauren classification mucin phenotype expression and cancer stem cell gastric cancer gc one of the most common human cancer is a heterogeneous disease with different phenotype prognosis and response to treatment understanding the pathogenesis of gc at the molecular level is important for prognosis prediction and determining treatment microsatellite instability msi silencing of mlh mgmt and cdkna gene by dna hypermethylation kras mutation apc mutation and erbb amplification are frequently found in intestinal type gc inactivation of cdh and rarb by dna hypermethylation and amplification of fgfr and met are frequently detected in diffuse type gc in addition bst and pcdhb gene are overexpressed in intestinal type gc both gene are associated with gc progression gc can be divided into gastricintestinal mucin phenotype according to mucin expression msi alteration of tp cdh mutation and dna methylation of mlh are detected frequently in the gastric mucin phenotype tp mutation deletion of apc and dna methylation of mgmt are detected frequently in the intestinal mucin phenotype fktn is overexpressed in the intestinal mucin phenotype and iqgap is overexpressed in the gastric mucin phenotype these gene are involved in gc progression to characterize cancer stem cell a useful method is spheroid colony formation kifc and kif gene show more than twofold higher expression in spheroidforming cell than that in parental cell both kif gene are overexpressed in gc and knockdown of these gene inhibits spheroid formation alteration of these molecule may be useful to understand gastric carcinogenesis specific inhibitor of these molecule may also be promising anticancer drug

title: comparison of lmethylcmethionine pet with magnetic resonance spectroscopy in detecting newly diagnosed glioma
abstract: aim amino acid pet and magnetic resonance spectroscopy mr are at the forefront of noninvasive imaging technique used for detection and subtyping of gliomasuspicious lesion in this pilot study we compare lmethylcmethionine pet and mr for their ability to predict glioma subtypes method nineteen patient with histologically confirmed newly diagnosed glioma underwent preoperative lmethylcmethionine pet and mr in diagnostic session according to the molecular portfolio and histopathologic diagnosis patient were subdivided in isocitrate dehydrogenase idh wildtype glioblastoma idh wildtype grade iiiii glioma idhmutant grade iiiii glioma without pq codeletion and with pq codeletion subgroup maximum tumortobrain ratio tbrmax creatine choline and nacetyl aspartate peak were correlated with postoperative histopathologic tumor diagnosis result maximum tumortobrain ratio wa highest in glioblastoma patient followed by patient with idh wildtype grade ii and iii glioma the latter tbrmax value were higher compared with those in patient with idhmutant grade iiiii glioma without pq codeletion and in patient with idhmutant pq codeleted grade ii and iii glioma magnetic resonance spectroscopy marker distribution showed no clear trend receiver operating characteristic analysis revealed tbrmax to be the best performing parameter in identifying idh status area under the curve and all spectroscopy marker combined in identifying glioma subgroup area under the curve respectively conclusion lmethylcmethionine pet and mr bear limited potential in glioma subgrouping lmethylcmethionine pet appears to be superior in differentiating idh status whereas mr is more helpful in glioma subgrouping
label: Cancer

title: pathological and molecular feature of glioblastoma and it peritumoral tissue
abstract: glioblastoma gbm is one of the most aggressive and lethal human brain tumor at present gbms are divided in primary and secondary on the basis of the mutational status of the isocitrate dehydrogenase idh gene in addition idh and idh mutation are considered crucial to better define the prognosis although primary and secondary gbms are histologically indistinguishable they retain distinct genetic alteration that account for different evolution of the tumor the high invasiveness the propensity to disperse throughout the brain parenchyma and the elevated vascularity make these tumor extremely recidivist resulting in a short patient median survival even after surgical resection and chemoradiotherapy furthermore gbm is considered an immunologically cold tumor several study highlight a highly immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment that promotes recurrence and poor prognosis deeper insight into the tumor immune microenvironment together with the recent discovery of a conventional lymphatic system in the central nervous system cns led to new immunotherapeutic strategy in the last two decade experimental evidence from different group proved the existence of cancer stem cell cscs also known a tumorinitiating cell that may play an active role in tumor development and progression recent finding also indicated the presence of highly infiltrative cscs in the peritumoral region of gbm this region appears to play a key role in tumor growing and recurrence however until recently few study investigated the biomolecular characteristic of the peritumoral tissue the aim of this review is to recapitulate the pathological feature of gbm and of the peritumoral region associated with progression and recurrence
label: Cancer
