title: linc interacting with hnrnpd contributes to the proliferation and metastasis in colorectal cancer through activating wntbetacatenin signaling pathway
abstract: background long noncoding rna lncrnas have been identified to play an important role in the development and progression of various tumor including colorectal cancer crc however the regulatory molecular mechanism by lncrna in crc initiation and progression ha not been fully clarified method tcga database wa used to identify the involvement of linc in crc qrtpcr and western blot were used to determine rna and protein expression the gain and lossoffunction assay were conducted to explore the function of linc in the progression of crc in order to investigate the lincmediated mrna in crc tumorigenesis we applied the profiling analysis a well a go and kegg analysis pulldown and rip assay were applied to detect the interaction of hnrnpd with linc and betacatenin result the upregulation of linc in crc and it prognostic significance were identified by tcga database and confirmed in crc tissue functionally forced expression of linc promoted while knockdown of linc inhibited cell proliferation migration and emt phenotype formation of crc cell a significant enrichment of the wntbetacatenin signaling pathway gene under linc overexpression in addition linc modulated the mrna stability of betacatenin through interacting with hnrnpd thereby activating wntbetacatenin signaling pathway conclusion our investigation proposed novel regulatory axis of linchnrnpdwntbetacatenin which might be in favor of exploring novel therapeutic regimen for the clinical treatment of crc
label: Cancer

title: isolated bone marrow nonlangerhans cell histiocytosis preceding runxmutated acute myeloid leukemia case report and literature review
abstract: objective the prevalence of concomitant myeloid neoplasm wa recently reported to be unexpectedly high among adult without nonlangerhans cell histiocytosis nonlch however the coexistence of nonlch with runx genetic aberration ha not been reported previously method herein we report a yearold woman with severe pancytopenia diagnosed with nonlch following presentation with pancytopenia and marrow examination showing histiocytosis positive for cd cd cd and lysozyme but negative for cda langerin and s result wholeexome sequencing showed runx mutation and nf mutation in the ensuing month she developed hepatosplenomegaly and repeat bone marrow evaluation wa diagnostic of acute myeloid leukemia aml repeat mutational analysis showed again presence of runx mutation she underwent induction therapy but died of septic shock conclusion the demonstration of runx mutation in both nonlch and aml bone marrow specimen at differing time point is suggestive of a biologic association of both distinct disease entity
label: Cancer

title: survival and prognostic factor in surgically treated brain metastasis
abstract: purpose while surgery and radiation remain the mainstay of therapy for all patient with brain metastasis bm the management is moving to a more individualized approach based on the underlying tumor we sought to identify prognostic factor of both intracranial progression icpfs and overall survival o in a surgical cohort method we retrospectively reviewed the record of patient treated surgically for bm at brigham and womens hospital kaplanmeier curve were used for o and icpfs and cox proportional hazard model were built to assess for predictive factor result common origin were lung breast and melanoma median o for the cohort wa month confidence interval ci breast cancer month ci and colorectal cancer month ci had the longest and shortest o respectively on multivariable cox regression significant prognostic factor of shorter o were age hr ci number of lesion hr ci extracranial spread at bm diagnosis hr ci and kp hr ci regarding molecular factor all driver mutation in lung adenocarcinoma had a favorable effect egfr hr ci alk hr ci kras hr ci triple negative status predicted poor prognosis in breast adenocarcinoma hr ci while no effect of brafnras mutation wa demonstrated in melanoma bm conclusion our result corroborate the role of tumor origin and systemic a well a intracranial spread in o heterogeneity within histology wa further explained by molecular alteration
label: Cancer

title: differential expression of wilms tumor protein in diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma
abstract: diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma dipgs are deadly tumor comprising of all childhood cns cancer standard treatment is considered palliative and prognosis is near universal mortality dipgs have been classified into genomic subtypes based on histone variant with the lysine to methionine mutation on position of histone tail km given the increasing promise of immunotherapy there have been ongoing effort to identify tumorspecific antigen to serve a immunologic target we evaluated a large cohort of cns specimen for wilms tumor protein wt expression these specimen include primary pediatric cns tumor n midline glioma and n nonmidline glioma n dipg n lowgrade glioma n highgrade glioma and dipg primary cell here we report the validation of wt a a tumorassociated antigen in dipgs we further report that wt expression is significantly correlated with specific oncohistone variant with the highest expression detected in the hkm subgroup wt expression wa absent in all control specimen n western blot assay using dipg primary cell n showed a trend of higher wt expression in hkm cell when compared with h km cell and h wildtype cell our data are the first indication of the association between wt and dipg with specific upregulation in those harboring oncohistone hkm
label: Cancer

title: recommendation for the management of hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis in adult
abstract: hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis hlh is a severe hyperinflammatory syndrome induced by aberrantly activated macrophage and cytotoxic t cell the primary genetic form caused by mutation affecting lymphocyte cytotoxicity and immune regulation is most common in child whereas the secondary acquired form is most frequent in adult secondary hlh is commonly triggered by infection or malignancy but may also be induced by autoinflammatoryautoimmune disorder in which case it is called macrophage activation syndrome ma or mashlh most information on the diagnosis and treatment of hlh come from the pediatric literature although helpful in some adult case this raise several challenge for example the hlh diagnostic criterion developed for child are commonly applied but are not validated for adult another challenge in hlh diagnosis is that patient may present with a phenotype indistinguishable from sepsis or multiple organ dysfunction syndrome treatment algorithm targeting hyperinflammation are frequently based on pediatric protocol such a hlh and hlh which may result in overtreatment and unnecessary toxicity in adult therefore dose reduction individualized tailoring of treatment duration and an agedependent modified diagnostic approach are to be considered here we present expert opinion derived from an interdisciplinary working group on adult hlh sponsored by the histiocyte society to facilitate knowledge transfer between physician caring for pediatric and adult patient with hlh with the aim to improve the outcome for adult patient affected by hlh
label: Cancer

title: targeting lifmediated paracrine interaction for pancreatic cancer therapy and monitoring
abstract: pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma pdac ha a dismal prognosis largely owing to inefficient diagnosis and tenacious drug resistance activation of pancreatic stellate cell pscs and consequent development of dense stroma are prominent feature accounting for this aggressive biology the reciprocal interplay between pscs and pancreatic cancer cell pccs not only enhances tumour progression and metastasis but also sustains their own activation facilitating a vicious cycle to exacerbate tumorigenesis and drug resistance furthermore psc activation occurs very early during pdac tumorigenesis and activated pscs comprise a substantial fraction of the tumour mass providing a rich source of readily detectable factor therefore we hypothesized that the communication between pscs and pccs could be an exploitable target to develop effective strategy for pdac therapy and diagnosis here starting with a systematic proteomic investigation of secreted disease mediator and underlying molecular mechanism we reveal that leukaemia inhibitory factor lif is a key paracrine factor from activated pscs acting on cancer cell both pharmacologic lif blockade and genetic lifr deletion markedly slow tumour progression and augment the efficacy of chemotherapy to prolong survival of pdac mouse model mainly by modulating cancer cell differentiation and epithelialmesenchymal transition status moreover in both mouse model and human pdac aberrant production of lif in the pancreas is restricted to pathological condition and correlate with pdac pathogenesis and change in the level of circulating lif correlate well with tumour response to therapy collectively these finding reveal a function of lif in pdac tumorigenesis and suggest it translational potential a an attractive therapeutic target and circulating marker our study underscore how a better understanding of cellcell communication within the tumour microenvironment can suggest novel strategy for cancer therapy
label: Cancer

title: pituitary adenoma
abstract: despite characteristic symptom the diagnosis of clinically relevant pituitary adenoma is often delayed until an advanced stage due to the rarity of the disease the typical clinical manifestation are presented in this review article the recent discovery of the usp mutation in cushing disease and of xlinked acrogigantism xlag syndrome in early onset gigantism were milestone in the search for the molecular etiology of pituitary adenoma the triad of endocrinological radiological and ophthalmological diagnostics are the main pillar for the diagnostic workup of pituitary adenoma the standard treatment modality which include surgery medical treatment and irradiation have been further developed and refined for transsphenoidal excision of pituitary adenoma microsurgery and endoscopy are two equivalent surgical technique with relatively few complication surgery represents the firstline treatment of pituitary adenoma prolactinomas are an exception a the medical treatment with dopamine agonist is highly efficient nowadays new medical treatment option are available for acromegaly and cushing disease and are used for secondline treatment the alkylating chemotherapeutic agent temozolomide is used for the firstline chemotherapy of rare aggressively growing pituitary adenoma irradiation is indicated if surgical and medical treatment option are insufficiently successful stereotactic onestage irradiation radiosurgery is especially suitable for welldemarcated invasive residual or recurrent adenoma in the cavernous sinus a new development is hypofractionated radiosurgery for protection of structure at risk fractionated irradiation is necessary with large radiation volume and for pituitary adenoma with a close proximity to the optic tract
label: Cancer

title: mutation spectrum of fancj gene in adult acute myeloid leukemia
abstract: objective to detect and analyze the mutation status of fancj gene in adult aml patient so a to provide the basis for studying the mechanism of fancj driven aml and guiding the preventim and treatment of deseese method the cdna were extracted and transeripted from bone marrow cell and normal skin cell in newly diagnosed aml patient the primer were designed for fancj gene coding region the mutation of fancj gene coding region in aml patient a well a the mutation of fancj gene in mucous membrane epethelia in patient were detected by pcr and sanger seguencing the evolutionary conservation of fancj mutation in different organism wa analyzed by ncbi blast online bioinformaties software result the sequencing analysis showed that the mutation of fancj gene happened in site of fancj gene coding region which were a followed exoncgapat exoncagpns exoncctprw exoncgapgd exonccgplv exoncctppl exoncctprc exoncctphy exoncagpiv exonccgpqe exoncgapdn among them the repeatability existed in mutation of at n rc iv and qe beside the mutation site of a r g l p h q and d were highly conserved in different organism conclusion among adult aml patient the mutation of fancj gene have been found in patient moreover the mutation site are relatively conserved in different organism and possess important fanction the result of this study provide the basis for exploring the mexhanism of fancj gene driven aml and for guiding the prevantion and treatment of aml

title: aurkb a a target in nonsmall cell lung cancer with acquired resistance to antiegfr therapy
abstract: nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc tumor harboring mutation in egfr ultimately relapse to therapy with egfr tyrosine kinase inhibitor egfr tkis here we show that resistant cell without the ptm or other acquired mutation are sensitive to the aurora b aurkb inhibitor barasertib and s phosphohistone h ph a major product of aurkb is increased in most resistant cell and treatment with aurkb inhibitor reduces the level of ph triggering g arrest and polyploidy senescence is subsequently induced in cell with acquired mutation while in their absence polyploidy is followed by cell death finally in nsclc patient ph level are increased after progression on egfr tkis and high ph baseline correlate with shorter survival our result reveal that aurkb activation is associated with acquired resistance to egfr tkis and that aurkb constitutes a potential target in nsclc progressing to antiegfr therapy and not carrying resistance mutation
label: Cancer

title: pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma is associated with brca germline mutation a case report and literature review
abstract: acinar cell carcinoma acc is a rare pancreatic neoplasm with dismal prognosis insight into the molecular basis of acc can pave the way for the application of more effective personalized therapy and detection of patient with hereditary predisposition molecular analysis revealed a germline brca and chek mutation in a patient with a rare pancreatic acc with extensive intraductal growth somatic loss of the wildtype brca allele in the tumor indicated the causal relationship of acc with the germline defect a thorough literature review identified another nine acc associated with germline brca mutation and two acc associated with germline brca mutation resulting in a prevalence of brca germline mutation in almost of acc moreover somatic brca alteration are reported in of sporadic acc overall about one fifth of all pancreatic acc exhibit brca deficiency this study underscore the important role of brca mutation in pancreatic acc all acc patient should undergo genetic testing for brca mutation to identify carrier of pathogenic variant this will allow to select patient that can benefit from targeted therapy directed against brcadeficient tumor and is also crucial a a referral to genetic screening for the relative of affected individual carrying germline brca alteration abbreviation acc acinar cell carcinoma hboc hereditary breast and ovarian cancer loh loss of heterozygosity parp poly adpribose polymerase pdac pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma pp pancreatic panniculitis sd standard deviation wes wholeexome sequencing
label: Cancer

title: jakstat oncogenic pathway and prdm expression stratify clinicopathologic feature of extranodal nktcell lymphoma nasal type
abstract: the inactivation of tumor suppressor gene positive regulatory domain containing i prdm and activation of signal transducer and activator of transcription stat have been detected in the majority of extranodal nktcell lymphoma nasal type ennktnt case in the present study their association with and effect on the clinicopathologic feature of ennktnt are described prdm wa revealed to be expressed in out of patient with ennktnt and phosphorylated stat wa overexpressed in out of oncogenic pathway were investigated by nanostring encounter technology in prdm and prdm ennktnt specimen multiple oncogenic pathway involved in cell apoptosis cellcycle cc and angiogenesis were discriminately activated in ennktnt case and in prdm case in particular the sustained activation of the janus kinase jakstat pathway wa more pronounced in addition missense mutation in the src homology domain of stat were detected in out of ennktnt case and the acquired mutation wa related to the activation of the jakstat pathway the downregulation of prdm and upregulation of phosphostat tyr were associated with angiocentric infiltration of ennktnt p notably the prognosis of patient in the prdmstat mutated mut group wa considerably improved than that of patient in the statmutprdm group p in addition the inhibition of nkt cell lymphoma cell line by stattic and tofacitinib could suppress cell proliferation by inducing cell apoptosis or arresting the cc the present result revealed that the jakstat oncogenic pathway and prdm expression could stratify clinicopathologic feature of ennktnt the inhibition of the jakstat pathway may serve a a treatment option for ennktnt
label: Cancer
combined_text: jakstat oncogenic pathway and prdm expression stratify clinicopathologic feature of extranodal nktcell lymphoma nasal type the inactivation of tumor suppressor gene positive regulatory domain containing i prdm and activation of signal transducer and activator of transcription stat have been detected in the majority of extranodal nktcell lymphoma nasal type ennktnt case in the present study their association with and effect on the clinicopathologic feature of ennktnt are described prdm wa revealed to be expressed in out of patient with ennktnt and phosphorylated stat wa overexpressed in out of oncogenic pathway were investigated by nanostring encounter technology in prdm and prdm ennktnt specimen multiple oncogenic pathway involved in cell apoptosis cellcycle cc and angiogenesis were discriminately activated in ennktnt case and in prdm case in particular the sustained activation of the janus kinase jakstat pathway wa more pronounced in addition missense mutation in the src homology domain of stat were detected in out of ennktnt case and the acquired mutation wa related to the activation of the jakstat pathway the downregulation of prdm and upregulation of phosphostat tyr were associated with angiocentric infiltration of ennktnt p notably the prognosis of patient in the prdmstat mutated mut group wa considerably improved than that of patient in the statmutprdm group p in addition the inhibition of nkt cell lymphoma cell line by stattic and tofacitinib could suppress cell proliferation by inducing cell apoptosis or arresting the cc the present result revealed that the jakstat oncogenic pathway and prdm expression could stratify clinicopathologic feature of ennktnt the inhibition of the jakstat pathway may serve a a treatment option for ennktnt

title: magnetic resonance imagingtransrectal ultrasound image fusion guidance of prostate biopsy current status challenge and future perspective
abstract: the use of multiparametric magnetic resonance imaging mpmri in prostate cancer pca diagnosis is rapidly evolving to try to overcome the limitation of the current diagnostic pathway using systematic transrectal ultrasoundguided biopsy trusbx for all men with clinical suspicion of pca prostate mpmri allows for high quality lesion detection and characterization and ha been shown to improve detection of significant pca with a more accurate gleason score grading suspicious lesion can be stratified by suspicion and sampled by selective mriguided targeted biopsy tbx for improved diagnostic accuracy several tbx method have been established and include mritrus image fusion biopsy cognitive or softwareassisted and inbore biopsy but none have yet proven superior in clinical practice however while mri inbore biopsy is not routinely used due to it cost and limited availability mritrus image fusion is rapidly embraced a it allows skilled urologist to perform tbx in an outpatient clinic furthermore it give the operator the advantage of adding tbx to the systematic standard biopsy scheme which is the currently recommended approach with the anticipated increased future use of prebiopsy mpmri a more widespread implementation of mritrus image fusion platform is concurrently expected in clinical practice therefore the objective of this review is to assess the current status challenge and future perspective of prostate mritrus image fusion biopsy
label: Cancer

title: spontaneous rotational dislocation of the lumbar spine in type neurofibromatosis a case report and literature review
abstract: rationale scoliosis is the most common form of dystrophic spinal deformity in type neurofibromatosis whereas a spontaneous rotational dislocation of the lumbar spine is a rare entity former researcher had advocated the use of circumferential fusion performed through combined anteriorposterior approach a the mode of treatment of this situation but we managed to achieve a solid circumferential fusion equally using posterior approach alone patient concern a yearold lady presented with severe back pain and no history of trauma fever or loss of weight on examination she showed several cafeaulait spot on her body and no neurologic deficit diagnosis the imageology revealed a rotational dislocation of the l to l the diagnosis of neurofibroma wa confirmed by biopsy intervention the patient underwent posterior reduction combined intervertebralposterolateral fusion and internal fixation with screw and rod outcome the patient wa satisfied with the back pain relief after surgery and able to live a normal life at followup the imageology showed a good correction of the deformity with a solid bony fusion lesson special attention must be paid to patient who have neurofibromatosis and unexplained back pain for early diagnosis early circumferential fusion to reconstruct a stable spine is the key to treatment given the result of this case the prognosis is promising following posterior surgery alone

title: hepatic complication of oral contraceptive pill and estrogen on mri controversy and update adenoma and beyond
abstract: hepatic complication of oral contraceptive pill and exogenous estrogen include intrahepatic canalicular cholestasis neoplasm formation and vascular pathology while it remains controversial a to whether estrogen play a role in focal nodular hyperplasia hemangioma or hamartoma exposure to oral contraceptive pill and estrogen ha a strong association with hepatic adenoma four different subgroup of adenoma have been described inflammatory hnfalphamutated betacateninmutated and unclassified vascular complication may include buddchiari syndrome vascular thrombosis dilated sinusoid and peliosis

title: clinical impact of testing for mutation and micrornas in thyroid nodule
abstract: background we report result of a multicenter clinical experience study examining the likelihood of patient with indeterminate thyroid nodule to undergo surgery or have malignant outcome based on multiplatform combination mutation and microrna testing mpt method mpt assessed mutation in braf hras kras nra and pikca gene paxppargamma retptc and retptc gene rearrangement and the expression of micrornas baseline clinical information at the time of mpt and clinical followup record were reviewed for patient of which had negative mpt result kaplan meier analysis for cumulative probability of survival without having a surgical procedure or malignant diagnosis over the course of patient followup wa determined for mpt result of patient among which only had malignancy result a negative mpt result in nodule with bethesda iii or iv conferred a high probability of nonsurgical treatment with only expected to undergo surgery and a high probability of survival without malignancy for up to year follow up a positive mpt result conferred a probability of malignancy and wa an independent risk factor for undergoing surgical treatment hazard ratio hr confidence interval p and for malignancy hr confidence interval p for nodule with weak driver mutation positive microrna test result supported high risk of cancer while negative result downgraded cancer risk conclusion mpt result are predictive of realworld decision to surgically treat indeterminate thyroid nodule with those decision being appropriately aligned with a patient risk of malignancy over time

title: the composition of t cell infiltrates varies in primary invasive breast cancer of different molecular subtypes a well a according to tumor size and nodal status
abstract: t lymphocyte are the most numerous immune cell in tumorassociated infiltrates and include several subpopulation of either anticancer or protumorigenic function however the association between level of different t cell subset and breast cancer molecular subtypes a well a other prognostic factor have not been fully established yet we performed immunohistochemistry for cd cytotoxic t cell ctl foxp regulatory t cell tregs and gata th cell in formalinfixed paraffinembedded invasive breast cancer tissue sample and analyzed both the number and percentage of investigated cell in tumorassociated infiltrates we observed that triplenegative breast cancer tnbc and her nonluminal breast tumor were associated with more numerous ctls and tregs and a higher tregth cell ratio a compared with luminal a subtype a higher treg percentage wa related to a decreased hormone receptor expression an increase in the ki level a greater tumor size of luminal tumor and the presence of lymph node metastasis moreover difference in the composition of t cell infiltrates were associated with her status and histologic grade and type and a distinct immune pattern wa observed in tumor of different phenotype regarding pt stage and nodal status the result of our work show the diversity of t cell infiltrates in primary invasive breast cancer of different phenotype and suggest that progression of luminal or nonluminal tumor is related to distinct tumorassociated t cell composition

title: genetic profile and clinical implication of hepatoblastoma and neuroblastoma coexistence in a child
abstract: the aim of the following case report is to provide a description of the coexistence of two independent tumor in a child a monthold male wa referred to department of pediatric oncology and hematology with hepatic tumor present on ultrasound imaging and symptom of enlarged abdominal circumference physical examination revealed a palpable epigastric mass and the imaging technique showed a tumor of the left hepatic lobe measuring x x cm with pancreas infiltration distant metastasis in both lung and abnormal lesion in the left adrenal gland basing on histopathological examination after a coreneedle biopsy hepatoblastoma hbl mixed epithelialmesenchymal subtype wa diagnosed the alphafetoprotein level wa ngml elevated value of normetanephrine methoxytyramine a well a neuronspecific enolase were observed due to the clinical picture and diagnosis the patient wa qualified to preoperative chemotherapy according to the siopel protocol followed by siopel protocol for the highrisk patient after undergoing preoperative chemotherapy imaging test revealed regression of hepatic tumor and no focal pulmonary mass while regression of adrenal gland mass wa not completed the patient wa qualified for left hemihepatectomy with left adrenalectomy histopathological examination of liver specimen confirmed the hbl diagnosis however in left adrenal gland and paraaortic lymph node the residual neuroblastoma nbl cell were detected whole exome sequencing wes wa utilized to identify diseaseassociated germline mutation wes revealed a novel germline insertion variant in twist pglydup along with the potentially pathogenic nonsynonymous variant in nf pvalile raf pleuarg and whsc pserasn gene currently month after completion of treatment according to the siopel protocol the patient is in good general condition without any sign and symptom of relapse of both neoplasm the coexistence of two different primary childhood malignancy is rarely seen so far only one case of synchronous hbl and nbl ha been reported however for the first time therapeutic process wa successful a specific signature of rare germline mutation can be proposed a a predisposing factor to synchronous hbl and nbl occurrence

title: a case report of revision occipitalcervical fusion after atlantoaxial instrumentation failure for neurofibromatosis type i
abstract: background neurofibromatosis type is an autosomal dominant genetic disease with characteristic cafeaulait spot neurofibroma and dystrophic change in the bone however complication involving atlantoaxial dislocation are rare case presentation we report a case of neurofibromatosis with atlantoaxial dislocation the chief complaint were numbness of the upper limb and gait disturbance we performed short fusion using the brook method however recurrence of the dislocation wa found after month recovery and the patient underwent posterior fusion from the occipital bone to c thereafter she had a good postoperative course conclusion neurofibromatosis patient often exhibit a low bone mineral density because of dystrophic change and are prone to fragile bone in the present case the use of long fusion at the first surgery may have helped to form a strong fusion of fragile bone
label: Cancer

title: integrated diagnostics of diffuse astrocytic and oligodendroglial tumor
abstract: background diffuse astrocytic and oligodendroglial glioma are the most common neuroepithelial tumor their classification is based on the integration of histological and molecular finding according to the classification of tumor of the central nervous system published by the world health organization who in objective this review describes the different entity and variant of diffuse glioma and summarizes the current diagnostic criterion for these tumor material and method based on the who classification and selected other publication the histomolecular diagnostics of diffuse glioma is presented and illustrated result diffuse glioma are divided into isocitrate dehydrogenase idhmutant or idhwildtype glioma by detection of mutation in the idh or idh gene among the idhmutant glioma oligodendroglial tumor are characterized by combined loss of chromosome arm p and q loss of nuclear expression of the atrx protein is a marker of idh mutant astrocytic glioma glioblastoma idhwildtype is the most common diffuse glioma diffuse and anaplastic astrocytic glioma without idh mutation should be further evaluated for molecular feature of glioblastoma idhwildtype diffuse glioma in the thalamus brainstem or spinal cord carrying a histone hkm mutation are classified a diffuse midline glioma hkmmutant by determining the idh and pq status oligoastrocytomas can be stratified into either astrocytic or oligodendroglial glioma gliomatosis cerebri is no longer regarded a a distinct glioma entity conclusion diffuse glioma can today be classified accurately and reproducibly by mean of histological immunohistochemical and molecular analysis
label: Cancer

title: impact of initial stage on metastatic melanoma survival
abstract: patient diagnosed with metastatic melanoma have varied clinical course even in patient with similar disease characteristic we examine the impact of initial stage of melanoma diagnosis braf status of primary melanoma and receiving adjuvant therapy on postmetastatic overall survival pmos we studied melanoma patient presenting to perlmutter cancer center at new york university and prospectively enrolled in new york university melanoma biospecimen database and followed up on protocoldriven schedule patient were stratified by stage at initial melanoma diagnosis a per ajcc th ed guideline pmos wa determined using the kaplanmeier method and cox proportional hazard model were used to assess hazard ratio hr three hundred and four out of patient developed metastatic disease over the time of followup median followup year range year patient diagnosed with stage i n melanoma had longer pmos month than those diagnosed with stage ii n pmos month or stage iii n pmos month melanoma p initial stage of diagnosis remained significant in multivariate analysis when controlling for lactate dehydrogenase and site of metastasis primary diagnosis stage ii hr p stage iii hr p adjuvant treatment wa associated with better survival but braf mutation status did not show an association our data challenge the general assumption that primary melanoma converge upon diagnosis of metastatic disease and behave uniformly primary stage of melanoma at the time of diagnosis may be prognostic of outcome similar to lactate dehydrogenase and metastatic disease site

title: improvement in the survival of patient with stage iv nonsmallcell lung cancer experience in a single institutional
abstract: objective in the past two decade several antineoplastic agent have been approved for the treatment of advanced nonsmallcell lung cancer nsclc and the management of these patient ha drastically changed however there is limited information regarding the impact of these advance on patient survival in clinical practice material and method we analyzed the survival of patient with stage iv nsclc who received any treatment in the cancer institute hospital of the japanese foundation for cancer research jfcr between january and march a total of consecutive patient were included in this case series in this analysis five diagnostic period were evaluated period a period b period c period d and period e we compared overall survival o between the period before and after propensity score matching psm and in patient with egfr mutation with alk fusion gene or without driver mutation result in the past two decade the o of patient with stage iv nsclc improved the median os for period a b c d and e were month and not reached respectively after psm with known baseline characteristic the trend of improvement in o wa similar however the o of patient with egfr mutation or alk fusion gene did not improve between period despite the availability of several tyrosine kinase inhibitor in japan the o of patient without a driver mutation wa slightly longer in the period e conclusion the introduction of new class of drug ha significantly improved the survival of patient with stage iv nsclc however the approval of similar type of drug may not be associated with further improvement in survival

title: a retrospective cohort study of pdl prevalence molecular association and clinical outcome in patient with nsclc result from the european thoracic oncology platform etop lungscape project
abstract: introduction the pdl biomarker is an important factor in selecting patient with nonsmall cell lung cancer for immunotherapy while several report suggest that pdl positivity is linked to a poor prognosis others suggest that pdl positive status portends a good prognosis method pdl positivity prevalence assessed via immunohistochemistry ihc on tissue microarrays tmas and it association with clinicopathological characteristic molecular profile and patient outcome relapsefree survival rf timetorelapse ttr and overall survival o is explored in the etop lungscape cohort of stage iiii nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc tumor are considered positive if they have neoplastic cell membrane staining result pdl expression wa assessed in nsclc case evaluable median followup year still alive from etop center adenocarcinoma represent of the cohort squamous cell former smoker are current never pdl positivity prevalence is present in more than one third of the lungscape cohort cutoff it doesnt differ between adenocarcinoma and squamous cell histology but is more frequently detected in higher stage never smoker larger tumor cutoff with cutoff it is significantly associated with ihc met overexpression expression of pten egfr and kras mutation only for adenocarcinoma result for and cutoff were similar with met being significantly associated with pdl positivity both for ac p cutoff and scc p cutoff and p for when adjusting for clinicopathological characteristic a significant prognostic effect wa identified in adenocarcinoma adjusted pvalues for rfsttros cutoff analogous for but not for similar result obtained for the model including all histology but no effect wa found for the squamous cell carcinoma conclusion pdl positivity when adjusted for clinicopathological characteristic is associated with a better prognosis for nonmetastatic adenocarcinoma patient

title: early second round targeted biopsy of pirads score or in men with persistent suspicion of prostate cancer
abstract: backgroundaim the aim of the study wa to determine the rate of clinically significant prostate cancer cspca case in men submitted to early second round mpmritrus multiparametric magnetic resonance imagingtransrectal ultrasound fusion biopsy tpbx material and method from january to december men with a pirads prostate imagingreporting and data system score case or case and negative repeat transperineal saturation biopsy plus tpbx underwent a new tpbx four core for the persistent clinical suspicion of cancer the accuracy of mpmri adc apparent diffusion coefficient value in the diagnosis of cspca were evaluated result overall detection rate of cspca wa equal to case versus had a pirads score equal to versus respectively the presence of cspca wa significantly correlated with an adc value of x mmsec conclusion a negative tbpx missed a cspca in of pirads score that wa diagnosed by an early second round tbpx the evaluation of adc map could select mpmri lesion deserving a repeat tpbx

title: targeted capturebased ng is superior to multiplex pcrbased ng for hereditary brca and brca gene analysis in ffpe tumor sample
abstract: background with the introduction of olaparib treatment for brcadeficient recurrent ovarian cancer testing for somatic andor germline mutation in brca gene in tumor tissue became essential for treatment decision in most case only formalinfixed paraffinembedded ffpe sample containing fragmented and chemically modified dna of minor quality are available thus multiplex pcrbased sequencing is most commonly applied in routine molecular testing which is predominantly focused on the identification of known hot spot mutation in oncogene method we compared the overall performance of an adjusted targeted capturebased enrichment protocol and a multiplex pcrbased approach for calling of pathogenic snvs and indels using dna extracted from ffpe tissue sample we further applied both strategy to seven blood sample and five matched ffpe tumor tissue of patient with known germline exonspanning deletion and genewide duplication in brca to evaluate cnv detection based solely on panel ng data finally we analyzed dna from ffpe tissue of index patient from family suspected of having hereditary breast and ovarian cancer of whom no blood sample were available for testing in order to identify underlying pathogenic germline brca mutation result the multiplex pcrbased protocol produced inhomogeneous coverage among target of each sample and between sample a well a sporadic amplicon drop out leading to insufficiently or noncovered nucleotide which subsequently hindered variant detection this protocol further led to detection of pcrartifacts that could easily have been misinterpreted a pathogenic mutation no such limitation were observed by application of an adjusted targeted capturebased protocol which allowed for cnv calling with sensitivity and specificity all pathogenic cnvs were confirmed in the five matched ffpe tumor sample from patient carrying known pathogenic germline mutation and we additionally identified somatic loss of the second allele in brca furthermore we detected pathogenic brca variant in four the eleven ffpe sample from patient of whom no blood wa available for analysis conclusion we demonstrate that an adjusted targeted capturebased enrichment protocol is superior to commonly applied multiplex pcrbased protocol for reliable brca variant detection including cnvdetection using ffpe tumor sample

sample from patient of whom no blood wa available for analysis conclusion we demonstrate that an adjusted targeted capturebased enrichment protocol is superior to commonly applied multiplex pcrbased protocol for reliable brca variant detection including cnvdetection using ffpe tumor sample

title: study of anogenital distance a a diagnostic tool for prostate cancer
abstract: introduction and objective the distance from the genitals to the anus anogenital distance agd reflects androgen concentration during prenatal development in mammal at the present time there is only one study suggesting the relationship between agd and risk of prostate cancer cap the goal of this study wa to assess the performance and clinical utility of agd a a biomarker of prenatal androgenic milieu and risk of cap in a larger population in cap diagnosis material and method a casecontrol study wa conducted on men seen in a hospital outpatient clinic where underwent a physical and andrological examination and completed a brief questionnaire cap patient were confirmed by biopsy of the tumor control were men without cap seen in the urology outpatient clinic for routine examination two variant of agd from the anus to the posterior base of the scrotum agdas and to the cephalad insertion of the penis agdap were measured parametric and nonparametric test and receiver operating characteristic cor analysis were used to determine relationship between agd and presence of cap result the highest area under the curve ci to and ci to wa obtained for the gleason subgroup with the agdas and agdap measurement with a sensitivity and specificity of and and and the predictive positive value of and and negative value of and respectively conclusion agd may be a useful clinical tool for the cap diagnosis

title: a novel approach to preoperative risk stratification in endometrial cancer the added value of immunohistochemical marker
abstract: background the current model used to preoperatively stratify endometrial cancer ec patient into low and highrisk group is based on histotype grade and imaging method and is not optimal our study aim to prove whether a new model incorporating immunohistochemical marker lcam er pr p obtained from preoperative biopsy could help refine stratification and thus the choice of adequate surgical extent and appropriate adjuvant treatment material and method the following data were prospectively collected from patient operated for ec from january through august age pre and postoperative histology grade lymphovascular space invasion lcam er pr p imaging parameter obtained from ultrasound ct chestabdomen final figo stage and current decision model based on histology grade imaging method result in total patient were enrolled the current model revealed sensitivity and specificity for highrisk group determination in myometrial invasion lower level of er p pr and higher level of lcam p were observed in cervical involvement a higher expression of lcam p lower pr p in tumor with positive lvsi higher lcam p in case with positive ln lower expression of erpr p p the positive predictive value ppv for er pr and lcam were the negative predictive value npv for each marker were a follows and mutation of p revealed ppv and npv when immunohistochemical marker were included into the current diagnostic model sensitivity improved v p ppv wa similar for both method while npv ie the probability of extremely low risk in negative test case wa improved v p conclusion we proved superiority of new proposed model using immunohistochemical marker over standard clinical practice and that new proposed model increase accuracy of prognosis prediction we propose wider implementation and validation of the proposed model

title: genomic assessment of bloodderived circulating tumor dna in patient with colorectal cancer correlation with tissue sequencing therapeutic response and survival
abstract: purpose genomic alteration in bloodderived circulating tumor dna ctdna from patient with colorectal cancer were correlated with clinical outcome patient and method nextgeneration sequencing of ctdna to gene panel wa performed in patient with colorectal cancer result most patient had metastatic or recurrent disease at the time of blood draw the median number of nonsynonymous alteration per patient wa three range zero to the most frequently aberrant gene were tp of patient kras and apc concordance between tissue and blood nextgeneration sequencing ranged from apc to braf altogether patient had one or more nonsynonymous alteration had one or more potentially actionable alteration and had an alteration actionable by a drug approved by the u food and drug administration on or off label lung metastasis correlated with improved survival from diagnosis in univariable analysis ctdna of or more from blood test a well a egfr and erbb her nonsynonymous alteration correlated with worse survival but only erbb remained significant in multivariable analysis no two patient had identical molecular portfolio overall versus of patient treated with matched n versus unmatched therapy n after ctdna testing achieved stable disease for month or more partial response or complete response p progressionfree survival versus month p and survival not reached versus month p all by multivariable analysis conclusion patient with colorectal cancer have heterogeneous ctdna profile and most harbor potentially actionable ctdna alteration matched therapy yielded higher rate of stable disease for month or more partial response or complete response ctdna assessment may have clinical utility and merit further investigation

title: thyroidlike follicular carcinoma of the kidney with extensive sarcomatoid differentiation a case report and review of the literature
abstract: thyroidlike follicular carcinoma of the kidney tlfck is an extremely rare primary renal malignancy that typically ha an indolent course and good prognosis histologically this tumor mimic follicular carcinoma of the thyroid however typical thyroid marker are negative there are fewer than case reported in the literature and thus the prognosis and course of disease is not well understood sarcomatoid differentiation ha never been reported in a case of tlfck we present a case of a yearold woman with an aggressive tlfck with extensive sarcomatoid differentiation and metastatic disease at presentation we performed targeted nextgeneration sequencing of both the thyroidlike component and the poorly differentiated sarcomatoid component using our solid tumor panel to evaluate for any diseaseassociated mutation and to better understand the molecular profile of these tumor

title: an update on mucosal melanoma future direction
abstract: by definition mucosal melanoma are malignant primary tumor originating from melanocyte located in the mucosal membrane of the nasal cavity and accessory sinus oral cavity lip and pharynx and vulvar vaginal or uterus anorectal or basically any other part of the mucosal surface lining these malignant melanoma usually occur in occult site which in combination with the lack of early specific sign contributes to the delay in diagnosis and poor prognosis of the disease given the rarity of mucosal melanoma knowledge about their pathogenesis and risk factor is insufficient and when compared with cutaneous and ocular melanoma they have the lowest fiveyear survival rate surgical resection is frequently the first approach to primary tumor even though the utility of lymph node surgery and radiation therapy is not well established novel molecular technique such a whole exome sequencing have become routine in order to aid patient care they show great promise in the treatment of rare and usually fatal disease such a mucosal melanoma target therapy against ckit activating mutation frequently seen in mucosal melanoma and the immunotherapy have emerged a a promising treatment modality for these aggressive tumor
label: Cancer

title: association between certain nonsmall cell lung cancer driver mutation and predictive marker for chemotherapy or programmed deathligand inhibition
abstract: this study aimed to analyze the association between driver mutation and predictive marker for some antitumor agent in nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc a cohort of chinese patient with nsclc who underwent resection from march to november in the first affiliated hospital of guangzhou medical university wa investigated the specimen were subjected to hybridization capture and sequence of important nsclcrelated driver gene in addition the slide were tested for pdl excision repair crosscomplementation group ercc ribonucleotide reductase subunit m rrm thymidylate synthase t and betatubulin iii by immunohistochemical staining a total of patient had at least driver gene alteration wildtype egfr rare mutation mut alk fusion fus ra mut ret fus and met mut had relatively higher proportion of lower ercc expression egfr del egfr lr egfr rare mut alk fus her mut ro fus and met mut were more likely to have t low expression wildtype egfr lr egfr rare mut and braf mut were associated with lower betatubulin iii expression in addition wildtype ra mut ro fus braf and met mut had higher proportion of pdl high expression a a pilot validation wildtype patient with advanced nsclc showed better depth of response and response rate to taxanes compared with pemetrexedgemcitabine v our study may aid in selecting the optimal salvage regimen after targeted therapy failure or the chemoregimen where targeted therapy ha not been a routine option further validation is warranted

title: galectin expression and it clinical significance in acute myeloid leukemia with positive amleto fusion gene
abstract: objective to investigate the mrna expression of galectin and it clinical significance in acute myeloid leukemia aml patient carrying amletofusion gene method rqpcr method wa used to detect the expression of galectin mrna in bone marrow mononuclear cell of aml patient with amleto elisa wa used to detect the expression of galectin protein in peripheral blood and the correlation of galectin expression with clinical and laboratory feature and outcome were analyzed result the mrna and protein level of galectin were significantly higher in newly diagnosed amleto aml patient compared with the control p but there wa significant difference in recurrence rate between the two group p the median overall survival o rate and diseasefree survival dfs rate were shortened in the highexpression group p p and the cumulative incidence of relapse wa increased p but there wa no significant difference in the cumulative incidence of cmmmmortality p cox regression analysis suggested galectin mrna level an independent indicator of o and dfs in amleto aml patient conclusion bone marrow galectin mrna level may be an important reference index for evaluating the prognosis and guiding the treatment of amleto aml patient

title: evaluating mmp and tgfssri expression in circulating tumor cell of pancreatic cancer patient and their correlation with clinical evolution
abstract: background metastasis is common in the diagnosis of pancreatic cancer and the presence of epithelialmesenchymal transition marker in circulating tumor cell may suggest worse prognosis aim to correlate the number of circulating tumor cell ctc in the peripheral blood of patient with a locally advanced or metastatic pancreatic tumor and the protein expression involved in epithelialmesenchymal transition emt in ctc with clinical characteristic progressionfree survival pfs and overall survival o method this wa a prospective study conducted using peripheral blood sample collected at three different time ctc were quantified by the iset test and analyzed by immunocytochemistry protein involved in emt vimentin tgfssri and mmp were analyzed in all ctc result twentyone patient were included median ctc detected were and ctc ml blood at baseline first and second followup respectively no statistically significant correlation wa found in correlating the number of ctc and the evaluated clinical characteristic pfs or o there wa no difference in pfs and o among the emt marker in the group with and without marker conclusion ctc analysis wa not relevant in this sample for comparing clinical finding pfs and o in patient with pancreatic cancer however marker analysis in ctc could be useful for the mmp andor tgfssri expression a observed by the separate pfs curve

title: primary cardiac malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor a case report
abstract: malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor are rare sarcoma of child and adolescent and they are aggressive tumor with a high rate of local recurrence here we report a case of a primary cardiac malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor without neurofibromatosis type i a year old woman presented having had cough expectoration and dyspnea for day and wa found to have a heartinvolving tumor diagnosed a a malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor a rare cardiac sarcoma of x x cm in size the patient underwent a successful resection of the tumor but died month postoperative we report this case for it rarity and peculiar mode of morphologic and immunohistochemical presentation

title: snw is a prognostic biomarker in prostate cancer
abstract: background snw is a nuclear receptor coactivator involved in splicing and transcription control including androgen receptor signaling overexpression of snw ha been linked to adverse prognosis in different cancer type but study on the role of snw in prostate cancer are lacking method using immunohistochemistry we analyzed snw expression in prostate cancer in a tissue microarray tma with attached clinical and molecular data result the comparison with normal prostate tissue revealed an up regulation of snw in a subset of cancer sample snw staining wa considered weak in moderate in and strong in of cancer strong snw expression wa markedly more frequent in prostate cancer harboring the tmprsserg fusion than in erg negative cancer p significant association with gleason grade stage nodal status and early biochemical recurrence were observed in the erg negative and positive subset multivariable modeling revealed that the prognostic value of snw up regulation wa independent from the established preoperative histopathological and clinical parameter conclusion these result demonstrate that snw overexpression is an independent prognostic marker in prostate cancer with potential clinical utility
label: Cancer

title: capicua regulates neural stem cell proliferation and lineage specification through control of ets factor
abstract: capicua cic is a transcriptional repressor mutated in the brain cancer oligodendroglioma despite it cancer link little is known of cics function in the brain we show that nuclear cic expression is strongest in astrocyte and neuron but weaker in stem cell and oligodendroglial lineage cell using a new conditional cic knockout mouse we demonstrate that forebrainspecific cic deletion increase proliferation and selfrenewal of neural stem cell furthermore cic loss bias neural stem cell toward glial lineage selection expanding the pool of oligodendrocyte precursor cell opcs these proliferation and lineage effect are dependent on derepression of ets transcription factor in patientderived oligodendroglioma cell cic reexpression or etv blockade decrease lineage bias proliferation selfrenewal and tumorigenicity our result identify cic a an important regulator of cell fate in neurodevelopment and oligodendroglioma and suggest that it loss contributes to oligodendroglioma by promoting proliferation and an opclike identity via ets overactivity
label: Cancer

title: circulating cellfree nucleic acid a biomarkers in colorectal cancer screening and diagnosis an update
abstract: introduction screening method for one of the most frequently diagnosed malignancy colorectal cancer crc have limitation circulating cellfree nucleic acid cfna hold clinical relevance a screening prognostic and therapy monitoring marker area covered in this review we summarize potential crcspecific cfna biomarkers the recently developed sample preparation technique their application and pitfall expert opinion automated extraction of cfdna is highly reproducible however cfdna yield is less compared to manual isolation quantitative and highly sensitive detection technique eg digital pcr ng can be applied to analyze genetic and epigenetic change detection of dna mutation or methylation in cfdna and related altered level of mrna mirna and lncrna may improve early cancer recognition based on specific crcrelated pattern detection of cfdna mutation eg tp kras apc ha limited diagnostic sensitivity however methylated dna including sept sfrp sdc can be applied with higher sensitivity up to for crc circulating mirnas eg mir mir mir provide comparably high sensitivity for crc a the circulating tumor cell mrna marker eg egfr ck ck cea automation of cfna isolation coupled with quantitative analysis of crcrelated highly sensitive biomarkers may enhance crc screening and early detection in the future

title: the molecular biologic basis of esophageal and gastric cancer
abstract: esophageal cancer and gastric cancer are leading cause of cancerrelated mortality worldwide in this article the author discus the molecular biology of esophageal and gastric cancer with a focus on esophageal adenocarcinoma they review data from the cancer genome atlas project and advance in the molecular stratification and classification of esophageal carcinoma and gastric cancer they also summarize advance in microrna molecular staging gene expression profiling tumor microenvironment and detection of circulating tumor dna finally the author summarize some of the implication of understanding the molecular basis of esophageal cancer and future direction in the management of esophageal cancer

title: proposed diagnostic criterion for classical chronic myelomonocytic leukemia cmml cmml variant and precmml condition
abstract: chronic myelomonocytic leukemia cmml is a myeloid neoplasm characterized by dysplasia abnormal production and accumulation of monocytic cell and an elevated risk of transforming into acute leukemia over the past two decade our knowledge about the pathogenesis and molecular mechanism in cmml ha increased substantially in parallel better diagnostic criterion and therapeutic strategy have been developed however many question remain regarding prognostication and optimal therapy in addition there is a need to define potential prephases of cmml and special cmml variant and to separate these entity from each other and from condition mimicking cmml to address these unmet need an international consensus group met in a working conference in august and discussed open question and issue around cmml it variant and precmml condition the outcome of this meeting are summarized herein and include diag nostic criterion and a proposed classification of precmml condition a well a refined minimal diagnostic criterion for classical cmml and special cmml variant including oligomonocytic cmml and cmml associated with systemic mastocytosis moreover we propose diagnostic standard and tool to distinguish between normal precmml and cmml entity these criterion and standard should facilitate diagnostic and prognostic evaluation in daily practice and clinical study in applied hematology
label: Cancer

title: genetic diversity of tumor with mismatch repair deficiency influence antipd immunotherapy response
abstract: tumor with mismatch repair deficiency mmrd are characterized by sequence alteration in microsatellites and can accumulate thousand of mutation this high mutational burden render tumor immunogenic and sensitive to programmed cell death pd immune checkpoint inhibitor yet despite their tumor immunogenicity patient with mmrdeficient tumor experience highly variable response and roughly half are refractory to treatment we present experimental and clinical evidence showing that the degree of microsatellite instability msi and resultant mutational load in part underlies the variable response to pd blockade immunotherapy in mmrd human and mouse tumor the extent of response is particularly associated with the accumulation of insertiondeletion indel mutational load this study provides a rationale for the genomewide characterization of msi intensity and mutational load to better profile response to antipd immunotherapy across mmrdeficient human cancer
label: Cancer

title: advancedstage mycosis fungoides role of the signal transducer and activator of transcription nuclear factorkappab and nuclear factor of activated t cell pathway
abstract: background the malignant mechanism that control the development of cutaneous tcell lymphoma ctcl are beginning to be identified recent evidence suggests that disturbance in specific intracellular signalling pathway such a rasmitogenactivated protein kinase tcell receptor tcrphospholipase c gamma plcgnuclear factor of activated t cell nfat and janus kinase jaksignal transducer and activator of transcription stat may play an essential role in the pathogenesis of ctcl objective to investigate the mechanism controlling disease development and progression in mycosis fungoides mf the most common form of ctcl method we collected sample that were submitted for diagnosis of or a second opinion regarding mf between and of which were in the early clinical stage of the disease formalinfixed paraffinembedded tissue were used for histological review and to measure the expression by immunohistochemistry of surrogate marker of activation of the tcrplcgnfat jakstat and nfkappab pathway folliculotropism and largecell transformation were also examined result nfat and nuclear factor kappa b nfkappab marker showed a comparable activation status in early and advanced stage while stat activation wa more frequent in advanced stage and wa associated with largecell transformation consistently with this observation stat activation occurred in parallel with mf progression in two initially mfnegative case a significant association of nfat with nfkappab marker wa also found reflecting a common mechanism of activation in the two pathway genomic study identified nine mutation in seven gene known to play a potential role in tumorigenesis in tcell leukaemialymphoma including plcg jak and stat which underlies the activation of these key cellsurvival pathway a higher mutational allele frequency wa detected in advanced stage conclusion our result show that stat is activated in advanced case and is associated with largecell transformation while the activation of nfat and nfkappab is maintained throughout the disease these finding could have important diagnostic and therapeutic implication whats already known about this topic mycosis fungoides is characterized by a clonal expansion of t cell in the skin the mechanism controlling disease development and progression are not fully understood what doe this study add an association of the nuclear factor of activated t cell and nuclear factor kappa b pathway wa found which could reflect a common mechanism of activation these pathway were activated in early and advanced stage at the same level signal transducer and activator of transcription activation wa associated with largecell transformation and wa more frequent in advanced stage a genomic analysis of cutaneous tcell lymphomaassociated gene wa performed nine mutation were detected what is the translational message these result could have important implication for the treatment of mf in the near future

used for histological review and to measure the expression by immunohistochemistry of surrogate marker of activation of the tcrplcgnfat jakstat and nfkappab pathway folliculotropism and largecell transformation were also examined result nfat and nuclear factor kappa b nfkappab marker showed a comparable activation status in early and advanced stage while stat activation wa more frequent in advanced stage and wa associated with largecell transformation consistently with this observation stat activation occurred in parallel with mf progression in two initially mfnegative case a significant association of nfat with nfkappab marker wa also found reflecting a common mechanism of activation in the two pathway genomic study identified nine mutation in seven gene known to play a potential role in tumorigenesis in tcell leukaemialymphoma including plcg jak and stat which underlies the activation of these key cellsurvival pathway a higher mutational allele frequency wa detected in advanced stage conclusion our result show that stat is activated in advanced case and is associated with largecell transformation while the activation of nfat and nfkappab is maintained throughout the disease these finding could have important diagnostic and therapeutic implication whats already known about this topic mycosis fungoides is characterized by a clonal expansion of t cell in the skin the mechanism controlling disease development and progression are not fully understood what doe this study add an association of the nuclear factor of activated t cell and nuclear factor kappa b pathway wa found which could reflect a common mechanism of activation these pathway were activated in early and advanced stage at the same level signal transducer and activator of transcription activation wa associated with largecell transformation and wa more frequent in advanced stage a genomic analysis of cutaneous tcell lymphomaassociated gene wa performed nine mutation were detected what is the translational message these result could have important implication for the treatment of mf in the near future

title: six regulates leukemia stem cell maintenance in acute myeloid leukemia
abstract: molecular genetic change in acute myeloid leukemia aml play crucial role in leukemogenesis including recurrent chromosome translocation epigeneticspliceosome mutation and transcription factor aberration six a transcription factor of the sine oculis homeobox six family ha been shown to transform normal hematopoietic progenitor into leukemia in cooperation with eya however the specific role and the underlying mechanism of six in leukemia maintenance remain unexplored here we showed increased expression of six in aml patient and murine leukemia stem cell ckit cell lscs importantly we also observed that a higher level of six in human patient predicts a worse prognosis notably knockdown of six significantly prolonged the survival of mllafinduced aml mouse with reduced peripheral infiltration and tumor burden aml cell from sixknockdown kd mouse displayed a significantly decreased number and function of lsc a assessed by the immunophenotype colonyforming ability and limiting dilution assay further analysis revealed the augmented apoptosis of lsc and decreased expression of glycolytic gene in six kd mouse overall our data showed that six is essential for the progression of mllafinduced aml via maintaining the pool of lsc
label: Cancer

title: receptor radionuclide targeting for neuroendocrine tumor net diagnostic and therapy
abstract: neuroendocrine tumor net represent a heterogeneous group of tumor originating from cell of neuroendocrine origin which express somatostatin receptor sstr this property allowed the successful development of radionuclides for diagnostic and peptide radionuclide radiation therapy prrt this is the paradigm for the theragnostic concept in net personalized medicine the only phase iii study to date netter clearly demonstrated the ability of lutetiumbased prrt to improve progressionfree survival in advanced intestinal net in clinical practice the indication are limited to gg welldifferentiated net with high expression of sstr net with a low tumor burden and slow progression are probably the optimal indication this treatment is now available in france however it precise position in the treatment algorithm remains to be explored we provide an overview of receptor radionuclide utilization and mechanism in diagnostic and pretherapeutic imaging and we focus on prrt for endocrine tumor

title: osteosarcoma and second malignant neoplasm a case series
abstract: background the overall survival of patient with localised osteosarcoma ha dramatically improved with the introduction of multidrug chemotherapeutic regimen into the treatment paradigm however despite optimal treatment allcause mortality remains higher among osteosarcoma survivor than in the general population the development of second malignant neoplasm contributes to this higher mortality rate case series we present three case of patient definitively treated for osteosarcoma who subsequently developed a second malignant neoplasm the first case describes a yearold female with osteosarcoma of her right femur treated with surgical resection and perioperative chemotherapy ten year later she wa diagnosed with metastatic herpositive breast cancer genetic testing identified a germline tp mutation confirming the presence of lifraumeni syndrome the second case detail an yearold male with osteosarcoma of his right humerus treated with definitive resection and perioperative chemotherapy he wa diagnosed with appendiceal adenocarcinoma after presenting with acute abdominal pain year later the third case reviewed is of a yearold male with osteosarcoma of his right femur treated with definitive resection and adjuvant chemotherapy a diagnosis of leiomyosarcoma wa made year later following surveillance imaging discussion the risk of second malignant neoplasm in osteosarcoma may relate to previous oncological treatment an inherited cancer predisposition syndrome or a spontaneous new neoplasm although screening for a second malignancy is not routinely recommended for osteosarcoma survivor a high degree of clinical suspicion should be maintained during surveillance
label: Cancer

title: analysis of agespecific cytogenetic change among patient withacute myeloid leukemia
abstract: objective to characterize cytogenetic change and prognosis of patient with acute myeloid leukemia aml from different age group method the karyotype of aml patient were analyzed by using shortterm culture of bone marrow cell and rbanding technique combined with fab typing and genetic testing cytogenetic change and prognosis of different age group were analyzed result the abnormal cloning rate wa among the patient the abnormal cloning rate and adverse risk karyotype proportion of those with myeloproliferative syndrome md and secondary aml were higher than those with de novo aml p pyearold group wa lower than the yearsold group and karyotype of poor prognosis is low patient with md with secondary aml have a poor prognosis

title: characterizing the molecular cytogenetics in acute monocytic leukemia
abstract: objective to characterize the molecular genetics of patient with acute monocytic leukemia aml method fluorescence in situ hybridization fish wa employed to detect mll gene rearrangement combined mutation of gene were detected by dnabased pcr and sanger sequencing result sixty seven patient were found to harbor at least one mutation the most commonly mutated gene wa npm n which wa followed by fltitd n nra n dnmta n tet n runx n and kras n based on the function of mutated gene the most frequently involved gene were those involved in dna methylation tyrosine kinase receptor signaling transcription regulation and ra pathway single gene mutation predominated in patient with cytogenetic abnormality while coexistence of mutation have predominated in patient with normal cytogenetic finding stratified by cytogenetic finding patient with single gene mutation intermediaterisk group had significantly higher complete remission cr rate than those with gene mutation unfavorablerisk group v v p respectively conclusion over of aml patient were found to harbor at least one mutation their clinical phenotype and prognosis may be impacted by the synergy of mll gene rearrangement and multiple mutation for patient under the same risk stratification the number of mutation is reversely correlated with the cr rate

title: a pilot lowinflammatory dietary intervention to reduce inflammation and improve quality of life in patient with familial adenomatous polyposis protocol description and preliminary result
abstract: patient with familial adenomatous polyposis fap depend on a lifelong endoscopic surveillance programme and prophylactic surgery and usually suffer nutritional problem intestinal inflammation ha been linked to both fap and colorectal cancer epidemiological study show a relationship between diet and inflammation preventive dietary recommendation for fap patient are so far lacking we have designed a nonrandomized prospective pilot study on fap patient to assess whether a lowinflammatory diet based on the mediterranean diet principle and recipe by interacting with the microbiota reduces gastrointestinal marker of inflammation and improves quality of life this report describes the scientific protocol of the study and report the participant adherence to the proposed dietary recommendation thirtyfour fap patient older than year bearing the apc pathogenic variant who underwent prophylactic total colectomy with ileorectal anastomosis were eligible into the study during the month dietary intervention they reported improvement in their consumption of mediterranean food vegetable fruit fish and legume and a reduction in proinflammatory food redprocessed meat and sweet this led to a significant increase in their adherence to the mediterranean diet the improvement wa accompanied by a decrease in the number of diarrhoeal discharge these preliminary result are encouraging with regard to feasibility dietary outcome measure and safety
label: Cancer

title: fish and herneu equivocal immunohistochemistry in breast carcinoma
abstract: aim the aim of this study wa to validate the role of fluorescence in situ hybridization fish in investigating herneu gene amplification human epidermal growth factor receptor in patient with herneu equivocal breast cancer diagnosed on immunohistochemistry ihc material and method this wa a retrospective study conducted from january to october a total of patient diagnosed with invasive breast carcinoma and herneu equivocal status on ihc were analyzed also the case for the year and formed a subgroup that wa analyzed further to study the impact of preanalytical factor on ihc and fish result result a total of woman with herneu ihc equivocal breast cancer were included in the study with a median age of year range herneu amplification by fish wa noted in case whereas it wa nonamplified in case ten case were reported a equivocal even on fish ascocap guideline polysomy wa noted in case of which patient were year of age twenty of these case showed herneu amplification whereas case were nonamplified and case were reported a equivocal on fish also more than half of the polysomy case were hormone receptor negative conclusion ihc is a good screening tool for negative and positive result any patient targeted for trastuzumab therapy should undergo confirmation of herneu equivocal status by fish analysis we also suggest that if a nonclassical fish pattern is seen the test should be repeated with a noncentromeric chromosome reference locus probe for better treatment planning
label: Cancer

title: a potential antitumor effect of dendritic cell fused with cancer stem cell in hepatocellular carcinoma
abstract: hcc stem cell were reported a posttreatment residual tumor cell that play a pivotal role in tumor relapse fusing dendritic cell dc with tumor cell represents an ideal approach to effectively activate the antitumor immunity in vivo dchcc stem cell vaccine provides a potential strategy to generate polyclonal immune response to multiple tumor stem cell antigen including those yet to be unidentified to assess the potential capacity of dchcc stem cell vaccine against hcc cdhepg cell were sorted from the hcc cell line hepg dc and cdhepg and dc and hepg fused cell were induced by polyethylene glycol peg the influence of fusion cell on proliferation and immunological function transformation of lymphocyte wa assessed by fcm and elisa assay respectively the cytotoxicity assay of specific fusion cellinduced ctls against hepg wa conducted by cytotox nonradioactive cytotoxicity assay kit in vitro at last the prevention of hcc formation in vivo wa described in a mouse model the result of fcm analysis showed that the proportion of cdhepg cell in the spheral cdhepg enriched by suspension sphere culture wa ranging from to and cdhepgdc fused cell were successfully constructed the fusion cell expressed a higher level of costimulatory molecule cd cd cd and mhci and mhcii molecule hlaabc and hladr than did immature dc p and the functional analysis of fusion cellinduced ctls also illustrated that cdhepgdc fusion cell showed a greater capacity to activate proliferation of lymphocyte in vitro p the cdhepgdcactivated ctls had a specific killing ability against cdhepg cell in vivo these result suggested that cdhepgdc fusion cell could efficiently stimulate t lymphocyte to generate specific ctls targeting cdhepg cell it might be a promising strategy of immunotherapy for hcc

title: heterogeneity of genomic alteration and clinical aspect in peripheral tcell lymphoma future perspective
abstract: peripheral tcell lymphoma ptcl is a heterogeneous group of lymphoid malignancy several recent comprehensive genomic study characterize the genomic alteration of each ptcl type and reveal the complexity and heterogeneity the updated world health organization classification ha precisely distinguished lymphoma from lymphoproliferative disorder and ha included a new entity based on the tumor phenotype although establishing the classification based on genomic alteration ha been difficult because of heterogeneity the genomic alteration may support the diagnosis establishing genomic alteration that act a predictive marker for clinical course andor therapeutic target is needed in future study using genomic alteration information since patient with ptcl generally have poor prognosis establishing the target and standard therapy is one of the major issue to be addressed in addition to clinicopathological and genomic analysis patientderived xenograft model can provide these therapeutic strategy integration of analyzed data is considered to promote future ptcl study leading to improved ptcl prognosis
label: Cancer
