title: apc germline hepatoblastomas demonstrate cisplatininduced intratumor tertiary lymphoid structure
abstract: hepatoblastoma hb is the most common liver cancer in child we aimed to characterize hb related to apc adenomatous polyposis coli germline mutation apchb this french multicentric retrospective study included apchb patient under at diagnosis clinical feature of apchb were compared to the french siopel cohort of hb patient molecular and histopathological analysis of apchb were compared to consecutive sporadic hb treated at bicetre hospital from to nonapchb apchb patient have a peculiar spectrum of germline apc mutation with no event in the main hotspot of classical apc mutation at codon p compared to sporadic hb they have similar clinical feature including good prognosis since all patient are alive in complete remission at last followup apchb are mostly welllimited tumor with fetal predominance and few mesenchymal component all apchb have an activated wntbetacatenin pathway without ctnnb mutation confirming that germline apc and somatic ctnnb mutation are mutually exclusive p pathological reviewing identified massive intratumor tertiary lymphoid structure tl containing both lymphocyte and antigenpresenting cell in all apchb case who received cisplatinbased neoadjuvant chemotherapy but not in five prechemotherapy sample four paired biopsy and one patient resected without chemotherapy indicating that these tl are induced by chemotherapy p conclusion apchb show a good prognosis they are all infiltrated by cisplatininduced tl a feature only retrieved in a minority of nonapchb this suggests that apc inactivation can synergize with cisplatin to induce an immunogenic cell death that initiate an antitumor immune response
label: Cancer

title: inherited thrombocytopenia and platelet disorder with germline predisposition to myeloid neoplasia
abstract: advance in molecular genetic sequencing technique have contributed to the elucidation of previously unknown germline mutation responsible for inherited thrombocytopenia it regardless of age of presentation and severity of symptom related to thrombocytopenia andor platelet dysfunction a subset of patient with it are at increased risk of developing myeloid neoplasm during their life time particularly those with germline autosomal dominant mutation in runx ankrd and etv patient may present with isolated thrombocytopenia and megakaryocytic dysmorphia or atypia on baseline bone marrow evaluation without constituting myelodysplasia md bone marrow feature may overlap with idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura itp or sporadic md leading to misdiagnosis progression to myelodysplastic syndrome acute myeloid leukemia mdsaml may be accompanied by progressive bi or pancytopenia multilineage dysplasia increased blast cytogenetic abnormality acquisition of biallelic mutation in the underlying gene with germline mutation or additional somatic mutation in gene associated with myeloid malignancy a subset of patient may present with mdsaml at a young age underscoring the growing concern for evaluating young patient with mdsaml for germline mutation predisposing to myeloid neoplasm early recognition of germline mutation and predisposition to myeloid malignancy permit appropriate treatment adequate monitoring for disease progression proper donor selection for hematopoietic stem cell transplantation a well a genetic counseling of the affected patient and their family member herein we describe the clinical and diagnostic feature of it with germline mutation predisposing to myeloid neoplasm focusing on mutation involving runx ankrd and etv
label: Cancer

title: controlling trapping state on selective theranostic coreshell nayfybtmtiozro nanocomplexes for enhanced niractivated photodynamic therapy against breast cancer cell
abstract: photodynamic and immune therapy are innovative medical strategy against cancer and their integration with upconversion nanoparticles ucnps can improve the diagnosis and treatment of the disease the ucnps convert the deep penetrating nearinfrared nir light into higher energy emission allowing the imaging and detection of malignant cell and the simultaneous energy transfer for activation of the photosensitizers in this work the ucnps were coated with a photocatalytic tiozro shell and an increase of oxygen defect vo wa observed a a result of the partial substitution of ti by zr ion in the crystalline lattice of tio such defect act a trapping state improving charge separation and then reducing the recombination rate of the electronhole pair eh generated upon resonant energy transfer from the donor ucnps to acceptor shell the overall result are the enhancement of both ro production and the emission band centered at nm which is useful for tracking cell at the deep tissue level however an excess of those defect produce deleterious effect on both process a a result of charge migration the specificity against her positive breast cancer wa provided by bioconjugation with the monoclonal antibody trastuzumab after administration of the synthesized nayfybtmtiozrotrastuzumab theranostic nanocomplex doped with an optimal zro molar concentration and subsequent exposure to nm light w cm during minute herpositive skbr breast cancer cell were suppressed with drop of the cell viability higher than ucnps decorated with a pure tio shell

title: going to extreme determinant of extraordinary response and survival in patient with cancer
abstract: research into factor affecting treatment response or survival in patient with cancer frequently involves cohort that span the most common range of clinical outcome a such patient are most readily available for study however attention ha turned to highly unusual patient who have exceptionally favourable or atypically poor response to treatment andor overall survival with the expectation that patient at the extreme may provide insight that could ultimately improve the outcome of individual with more typical disease trajectory while clinician can often recount surprising patient whose clinical journey wa very unusual given known clinical characteristic and prognostic indicator there is a lack of consensus among researcher on how best to define exceptional patient and little ha been proposed for the optimal design of study to identify factor that dictate unusual outcome in this opinion article we review different approach to identifying exceptional patient with cancer and possible study design to investigate extraordinary clinical outcome we discus pitfall with finding these rare patient including challenge associated with accrual of patient across different treatment centre and time period we describe recent molecular and immunological factor that have been identified a contributing to unusual patient outcome and make recommendation for future study on these intriguing patient

title: low expression of acly associate with favorable prognosis in acute myeloid leukemia
abstract: background aberrant metabolism is a hallmark of cancer cell recently atp citratelyase acly expression wa demonstrated a an independent predictor of clinical outcome in solid tumor however no systematic study wa conducted to explore the prognostic impact of acly on acute myeloid leukemia aml method to assess the prognostic value of acly transcript we conducted a study with a discovery and validation design we measured acly transcript by realtime quantitative pcr in aml patient and validated the prognostic value in the two independent cohort using published data metaanalysis of geneexpression profile and inhibition acly expression in leukemia cell line were conducted to help u understand the biological insight of low acly expression result low acly expression is less common amongst amls with dnmta mutation but coexisted in double allele cebpa mutation moreover low acly expression is associated with favorable overall survival in aml patient and is involved in multiple pathway these result are also validated in two independent cohort of aml patient moreover acly silencing induces proliferation arrest in thp and molm leukemia cell line conclusion we found low acly expression is associated with favorable overall survival in aml patient

combined_text: low expression of acly associate with favorable prognosis in acute myeloid leukemia background aberrant metabolism is a hallmark of cancer cell recently atp citratelyase acly expression wa demonstrated a an independent predictor of clinical outcome in solid tumor however no systematic study wa conducted to explore the prognostic impact of acly on acute myeloid leukemia aml method to assess the prognostic value of acly transcript we conducted a study with a discovery and validation design we measured acly transcript by realtime quantitative pcr in aml patient and validated the prognostic value in the two independent cohort using published data metaanalysis of geneexpression profile and inhibition acly expression in leukemia cell line were conducted to help u understand the biological insight of low acly expression result low acly expression is less common amongst amls with dnmta mutation but coexisted in double allele cebpa mutation moreover low acly expression is associated with favorable overall survival in aml patient and is involved in multiple pathway these result are also validated in two independent cohort of aml patient moreover acly silencing induces proliferation arrest in thp and molm leukemia cell line conclusion we found low acly expression is associated with favorable overall survival in aml patient

title: classification of acute myeloid leukemia by the revised fourth edition world health organization criterion a retrospective singleinstitution study with appraisal of the new entity of acute myeloid leukemia with gene mutation in npm and biallelic cebpa
abstract: the world health organization who classification for acute myeloid leukemia aml includes new entity with gene mutation in npm amlnpmmut and biallelic cebpa amlbicebpamut to retrospectively identify and study these new molecularly defined whoentities we reviewed clinicopathologic data and pretherapy archived pathologic material at diagnosis for consecutive aml case male median age range year and classified all case by the who who and revised who criterion by who case included with recurrent genetic abnormality male median age range year with myelodysplasiarelated change male median age range year therapy related male median age range year and not otherwise specified male median age range year twentytwo case aml not otherwise specified aml with myelodysplasiarelated change by who reclassified by who a amlnpmmut showed female predominance and median range value were a follows age year hemoglobin gdl total leucocyte x l monocyte x l neutrophil x l platelet x l blast peripheral blood bone marrow with myeloblastscdneg cytogeneticsnormal fltitdpos fltitdnegflttkdpos fltitdnegflttkdneg and extramedullary involvement including novel cutaneous presentation notably presenting feature among amlnpmmut included those of anemia and thrombocytopenia this is also the first report of amlnpmmut including nonsmoker with a family history of leukemia and one yearold with familial amlbicebpamut this study validates the application of the who classification criterion by retrospectively identifying amlnpmmut and amlbicebpamut case using singlegene molecular analysis additional study are needed to characterize the complete spectrum of whodefined amlbicebpamut and for familial aml including amlnpmmut

title: concurrent lymphoma and hemophilia b in a pediatric patient a case report
abstract: introduction lymphoma is the third most common cancer among child in the united state and europe hemophilia is a congenital bleeding disorder characterized by deficiency of coagulation factor viii or ix hemophilia b is a consequence of factor ix deficiency and ha an incidence of in male birth a concurrence of these uncommon disease is rare except in patient infected with the human immunodeficiency virus hiv we report a case of a patient with both burkitt lymphoma and hemophilia b this is only such report in china since patient concern a yearold boy wa admitted to our hospital because of melena and jaundice for several day his older brother had died due to hemophilia b and ventricular septal defect the patient had not experienced any previous episode of severe bleeding gradual abdominal distention wa observed after admission the patient superficial lymph node were not enlarged result of blood routine and bone marrow examination showed no abnormality he wa diagnosed with sclerosing cholangitis abdominal infection and hepatitis however after treatment of reducing enzyme activity and eliminating jaundice the patient condition deteriorated hydrops abdominis wa detected on abdominal ultrasonography tumor cell were found by pathological examination of peritoneal effusion both a cmyc gene translocation and a cmycigh gene fusion were detected diagnosis burkitt lymphoma and hemophilia b intervention the patient wa transferred to the pediatric hematology department of our hospital and treated with a modified bnhlbfm protocol during chemotherapy platelet change were monitored regularly and blood product were infused timely outcome the patient died of infection and bleeding after chemotherapy conclusion concurrent hemophilia and lymphoma are rare especially in child when encountering a patient with unexplained obstructive jaundice and massive ascites the possibility of a tumor should be considered early diagnosis and adequate treatment of such tumor may improve prognosis

should be considered early diagnosis and adequate treatment of such tumor may improve prognosis

title: oncogenic effect of the novel fusion gene vaparab in lung adenocarcinoma
abstract: fusion gene have been identified a oncogene in several solid tumor including lung colorectal and stomach cancer here we characterized the fusion gene vaparab discovered from rnasequencing data of a patient with lung adenocarcinoma who did not harbor activating mutation in egfr kras and alk this fusion gene encodes a protein comprising the nterminal region of vesicleassociated membrane protein vampassociated protein a vapa fused to the cterminal region of rasrelated protein rab exogenous expression of vaparab in immortalized normal bronchial epithelial cell demonstrated the potential transforming effect of this fusion gene including increased colony formation and cell proliferation in vitro also enhanced tumorigenicity upon vaparab wa confirmed in vivo using a mouse xenograft model metastatic tumor were also detected in the liver and lung of xenografted mouse overexpression of vaparab upregulated antiapoptotic protein bcl and phosphorylated creb both in cell and xenograft tumor reduced apoptosis and increased phosphorylation of creb and erk were observed in vaparaboverexpressing cell after bortezomib treatment elevated bcl level via activated creb contributed to the resistance to the bortezomibinduced apoptosis our data suggest the oncogenic function of the novel fusion gene vaparab via upregulated bcl and activated creb in lung cancer
label: Cancer

title: a comparison of dna mutation and copy number profile of primary breast cancer and paired brain metastasis for identifying clinically relevant genetic alteration in brain metastasis
abstract: improving the systemic treatment of brain metastasis bm in primary breast cancer pbc is impaired by the lack of genomic characterization of bm to estimate the concordance of dna copynumberalterations cnas mutation and actionable genetic alteration aga between paired sample we performed wholegenome arraycomparativegenomichybridization and targetednextgenerationsequencing on clinical pbcbm pair we found more cnas more mutation and higher tumor mutational burden and more aga in bm than in pbc of the pair harbored at least one aga in the bm not observed in the paired pbc this concerned various therapeutic class including tyrosinekinasereceptorinhibitors phosphatidylinositol kinaseakt mammalian target of rapamycin pikaktmtorinhibitors poly adp ribose polymerase parpinhibitors or cyclindependent kinase cdkinhibitors with regard to the parpinhibitors the homologous recombination defect score wa positive in of bm compared to of pbc discordant in out of pair and positive in the bm in out of case cdkinhibitors were associated with the largest percentage of discordant aga appearing in the bm when considering the aga with the highest clinicalevidence level for each sample of the pair harbored an aga in the bm not detected or not retained from the analysis of the paired pbc thus the profiling of bm provided a more reliable opportunity than that of pbc for diagnostic decisionmaking based on genomic analysis patient with bm deserve an investigation of several targeted therapy
label: Cancer

title: role of amino acid transporter expression a a prognostic marker in patient with surgically resected colorectal cancer
abstract: backgroundaim ltype amino acid transporter lat is highly expressed in various human cancer however the clinicopathological significance of lat and f cell surface antigen fhc in patient with colorectal cancer crc is unknown the aim of this study wa to clarify the prognostic significance of lat expression in crc patient who underwent surgical resection material and method sample from one hundred and fortyseven patient were examined by immunohistochemistry the expression of lat and fhc and the ki labeling index were assessed using resected tumor specimen result the positive expression of lat and fc wa and p respectively the expression of lat wa identified a an independent significant marker linked to worse prognosis in patient with crc and wa correlated with tumor cell proliferation tumor aggressiveness and metastasis moreover lat wa closely associated with the expression of fhc and phosphorylation of the mtor pathway conclusion lat is a significant molecular marker used to predict prognosis after surgical resection of crc patient
label: Cancer

title: epicardial fat mimicking pericardial tumour case series and review of literature
abstract: advance in imaging modality have improved diagnosis of disease in patient allowing physician to make earlier and accurate diagnosis with resultant improved overall outcome for patient sometimes however this come at a cost of over estimation of normal variant leading to further unnecessary investigation or in extreme case intervention in this article we demonstrate three case where epicardial fat is misdiagnosed a pericardial mass which are an example of misinterpretation of normal finding correct identification of pericardial fat on transthoracic echocardiogram is important in reducing misdiagnosis and also anxiety for both physician and patient knowledge about normal variant not only improves patient care but also reduce unnecessary investigation that are subsequently ordered for clarification

title: mutyhassociated polyposis
abstract: mutyhassociated polyposis is the only polyposis syndrome with an autosomal recessive type of inheritance often phenotypically similar to a weakened form of familial adenomatous polyposis for the development of the disease mutation in both allele of the gene are required but an increased risk of developing colorectal cancer in carrier of monoallelic mutation is noted the diagnosis of mutyhassociated polyposis should be suspected in a patient with colorectal cancer over year old on the background of polyp in the colon the review present modern algorithm for diagnostic and treatment of the disease

title: mycn amplified relapse following resolution of mycn nonamplified s neuroblastoma with placental involvement a case report and review of the literature
abstract: congenital neuroblastoma with placental involvement is exceptionally rare but mortality is high detailed examination of placenta including mycn amplification and segmental chromosomal aberration should be performed in all suspected case a it is noninvasive and readily available maternal dissemination ha not been reported in this manuscript we describe an infant with placental diagnosis of mycn nonamplified congenital neuroblastoma this is the first report of a recurrence of congenital s neuroblastoma following resolution in which mycn amplification is only detected in the recurrence germline sequencing using a large comprehensive cancer panel did not reveal variant in candidate cancer predisposition gene

title: the programmed cell death proteinprogrammed cell death ligand expression cd t cell infiltration nyeso expression and microsatellite instability phenotype in primary cutaneous melanoma and mucosal melanoma and their clinical significance and prognostic value a study of consecutive case
abstract: we evaluated the expression of programmed cell death protein pd programmed cell death ligand pdl and nyeso antigen the infiltration of cd t cell and the microsatellite instability msi phenotype a well a the relationship of each factor to survival in malignant melanoma patient malignant melanoma sample from patient were stained by immunohistochemistry to evaluate pd pdl cd tumorinfiltrating lymphocyte tils nyeso and msi pd and pdl were expressed in and of the sample respectively there wa a significant correlation between pd and pdl expression r p high infiltration of cd t cell wa observed in of the sample and increased cell infiltration wa associated with increased pd expression p nyeso antigen wa detected in of all sample and the expression of nyeso wa positively correlated with the expression of pd p in our research msi wa detected in sample survival analysis showed that a high infiltration of cd t cell wa related to longer progressionfree survival pfs month confidence interval ci v month ci p similarly the median overall survival o of the cd t cell highinfiltration patient wa also longer v month but with no statistical significance p the result for the immune marker mentioned above provide a theoretical basis for the prognosis and immunotherapy selection of malignant melanoma patient

title: mek inhibitor activate wnt signalling and induce stem cell plasticity in colorectal cancer
abstract: in colorectal cancer crc aberrant wnt signalling is essential for tumorigenesis and maintenance of cancer stem cell however how other oncogenic pathway converge on wnt signalling to modulate stem cell homeostasis in crc currently remains poorly understood using largescale compound screen in crc we identify mek inhibitor a potent activator of wntbetacatenin signalling targeting mek increase wnt activity in different crc cell line and murine intestine in vivo truncating mutation of apc generated by crisprcas strongly synergize with mek inhibitor in enhancing wnt response in isogenic crc model mechanistically we demonstrate that mek inhibition induces a rapid downregulation of axin using patientderived crc organoids we show that mek inhibition lead to increased wnt activity elevated lgr level and enrichment of gene signature associated with stemness and cancer relapse our study demonstrates that clinically used mek inhibitor inadvertently induce stem cell plasticity revealing an unknown side effect of ra pathway inhibition

title: functional linkage of gene fusion to cancer cell fitness assessed by pharmacological and crisprcas screening
abstract: many gene fusion are reported in tumour and for most their role remains unknown a fusion are used for diagnostic and prognostic purpose and are target for treatment it is crucial to assess their function in cancer to systematically investigate the role of fusion in tumour cell fitness we utilized rnasequencing data from human cancer cell line to functionally link fusion event with genomic data sensitivity to anticancer drug and crisprcas lossoffitness effect established clinicallyrelevant fusion were identified overall detection of functional fusion wa rare including those involving cancer driver gene suggesting that many fusion are dispensable for tumour fitness therapeutically actionable fusion involving raf brd and ro were verified in new histology in addition recurrent yapmaml fusion were identified a activator of hippopathway signaling in multiple cancer type our approach discriminates functional fusion identifying new driver of carcinogenesis and fusion that could have clinical implication

title: feature and prognostic significance of intraductal carcinoma of the prostate
abstract: context intraductal carcinoma of the prostate idcp is an intraglandularductal neoplastic growth of glandular epithelial cell characterized by marked abnormality of the glandular architecture andor cytological atypia that exceeds what is typically seen in highgrade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia hpgin it ha been shown that idcp is a strong independent indicator of poor prognosis for prostate carcinoma pca objective to review the pathological and genetic feature diagnostic criterion and differential diagnosis and clinical significance of idcp evidence acquisition pubmed wa searched using keywords including prostate carcinoma intraductal carcinoma idc histology diagnostic criterion and prognosis the reference in relevant article were also reviewed evidence synthesis idcp is a distinct entity with characteristic morphological and genetic feature it is strongly associated with aggressive pca with high gleason scoregrade group and large tumor volume and portends unfavorable clinical outcome morphological diagnostic criterion have been established to distinguish it from other lesion with similar histological feature idcp is an uncommon finding in prostate biopsy and is even rarer a an isolated finding without concomitant pca however patient with isolated idcp in biopsy specimen are recommended to have either definitive treatment or immediate repeat biopsy conclusion it is critical to recognize and report idcp especially in prostate biopsy where the clinical impact of such a diagnosis is greatest patient summary intraductal carcinoma is a unique form of aggressive prostate cancer in this report we review it pathological and genetic feature and poor prognostic significance it is critical for pathologist to recognize and report this lesion in prostate specimen especially in prostate biopsy for patient management
label: Cancer

title: not all multiparametric magnetic resonance imagingtargeted biopsy are equal the impact of the type of approach and operator expertise on the detection of clinically significant prostate cancer
abstract: background the extensive use of multiparametric magnetic resonance imaging mpmri ha led to an even more widespread use of different targeted biopsy technique and approach the best way of performing targeted biopsy and the effect of operator expertise have still to be defined objective to compare the rate of detection of clinically significant prostate cancer cspca of different mpmri targeted approach and to assess the role of operator expertise in the detection of cspca design setting and participant we included consecutive patient who underwent both core transrectal ultrasound trus biopsy and mpmri targeted biopsy with either a cognitive biopsy cb or fusion biopsy fb approach during the same session between and at a single tertiary referral centre intervention all men underwent t mpmri with an endorectal coil all biopsy were performed by three operator a their first case of targeted biopsy lesion with a prostate imaging recording and data system pirads v score of detected at mpmri were targeted outcome measurement and statistical analysis cspca wa defined a disease with a gleason score at biopsy of operator expertise wa coded a the progressive number of targeted biopsy performed by each physician multivariable logistic regression analysis mva were used to assess the association between the targeted biopsy technique fb v cb and operator expertise for detection of cspca covariates consisted of prostatespecific antigen prostate volume pirads v v number of targeted core per mri lesion and digital rectal examination negative v positive the same analysis were performed for patient undergoing fb only after accounting for the fb approach transrectal v transperineal a lowess smoothing weighted function wa used to graphically assess the effect of operator expertise on the probability of detecting cspca after accounting for all confounders result and limitation overall patient underwent fb and underwent cb the overall cspca detection rate wa for fb and for cb p a significantly higher rate of cspca detection in targeted sample wa observed for fb compared to cb v p on mva fb and operator expertise were significantly associated with a higher probability of cspca detection in targeted sample odds ratio or and respectively both p when the same analysis were repeated for patient undergoing fb operator expertise remained an independent predictor of cspca detection or p an increase in the probability of detecting cspca with the number of procedure performed wa observed after accounting for all confounders conclusion we demonstrated that fb had higher detection rate than cb for cspca moreover operator expertise wa significantly associated with higher detection rate for cspca patient summary when different targeted biopsy technique were compared fusion biopsy provided a higher detection rate compared to cognitive biopsy for clinically significant prostate cancer cspca moreover we found that operator expertise wa an important predictor of the detection of cspca regardless of the procedure used
label: Cancer

title: outcome of diseasespecific nextgeneration sequencing gene panel testing in adolescent and young adult with colorectal cancer
abstract: purpose adolescent and young adult with colorectal cancer crc have attracted recent attention with a hereditary syndrome identified in onethird of patient diagnosed we aimed to study this population to determine if a crcspecific gene panel increased the yield of testing method patient with crc evaluated from were identified from the genetic counseling database record were reviewed for personalfamily history and genetic counseling outcome result one hundred fortythree patient with crc were included one hundred four underwent crc panel testing thirtynine had syndromedirected testing declined or were lost to followup fortytwo patient had a genetic syndrome twentyfour of the hereditary patient were identified via syndromedirected testing mutation identified via panel testing were consistent with patient personalfamily history thirtythree patient had at least one variant of uncertain significance conclusion hereditary syndrome were identified in of patient panel testing in patient without a phenotype did not increase diagnostic yield but identified variant in onethird diseasespecific panel testing is of low yield in young patient without a suggestive personalfamily history testing broader panel may increase the yield of mutation pickup in this population although at the expense of identifying variant

title: expression of wt gene and it prognostic value in patient with acute myeloid leukemia
abstract: objective to investigate the expression of wilmstumor wt gene in patient with acute myeloid leukemia aml and to explore it application in predicting prognosis of aml in patient with wild or mutated nucleophosmin npm and fmslike tyrosine kinase internal tandem duplication fltitd method one hundred and sixtyseven newly diagnosed aml patientsexclued m type were enrolled in this study the survival of patient were analyzed with kaplanmeier method the clinical data laboratory finding and the survival of patient were analyzed and compared between patient with high wt expression highwt group and those with low wt expression lowwt group a well a among the patient with npm or fltitd wild type and mutant result the overall response rate orr in highwt and lowwt group were and respectively p log wa associated with higher orr and y o rate all p in patient with npm wild type the highwt group had inferior orr and y o rate all p conclusion wt gene overexpression indicated poor prognosis of aml patient the patient with decreased wt gene expression log after the first induction therapy show better prognosis than those with log the wt gene expression level at diagnosis can be used a an unfavorable prognostic factor for aml patient with npm or fltitd wild type

title: reactivity with the epcamspecific antibody moc and berep in plasma cell neoplasm a potential diagnostic pitfall in cytology sample
abstract: objective epithelial cell adhesion molecule epcam is a protein expressed on surface of healthy epithelium and is overexpressed in dysplasia and carcinoma immunohistochemistry ihc utilizing antibody that react with epcam such a moc and berep distinguish reactive mesothelial cell from carcinoma in serous effusion ihc is crucial in effusion with singly dispersed atypical cell a scenario with a broad differential including hematopoietic malignancy plasma cell neoplasm pcn are the second most common hematopoietic malignancy manifesting a multiple myeloma or plasmacytoma with of case developing serous cavity involvement most pcns are readily recognizable however variant that deviate from the classic cytomorphology risk erroneous diagnosis this study demonstrates epcam expression in a subset of pcns highlighting a potential diagnostic pitfall in serous effusion cytology method a year retrospective search for cytology specimen with a diagnosis of pcn wa performed all case demonstrating cdcd and monoclonal immunoglobulin expression and adequately cellular cell block were included ihc analysis for moc and berep wa performed using ventana benchmark ultra scoring wa performed a follows total ihc score equal the positive proportion no positive tumor cell wa considered positive result of pcns demonstrated positivity for moc and berep conclusion a subset of pcns in cytology sample show positivity for moc and berep which could result in misinterpretation a carcinoma
label: Cancer

title: hnfa inhibition induces the resistance of pancreatic cancer cell to gemcitabine by targeting abcb
abstract: background pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma pdac is an aggressive disease with poor prognosis and gemcitabinebased chemotherapy remains an effective option for the majority of pdac patient hepatocyte nuclear factor alpha hnfa is a tumorsuppressor in pdac but it role in gemcitabine chemoresistance of pdac ha not been clarified method the function of hnfa in gemcitabine wa detected by overexpression and knockdown of hnfa in vitro and in vitro the regulatory network between hnfa and abcb wa further demonstrated by luciferase assay deletionmutation reporter construct assay and chip assay finding here we found that hnfa expression is significantly associated with gemcitabine sensitivity in pdac cell line moreover we identified that hnfa overexpression enhanced gemcitabine sensitivity of pdac both in vitro and in vitro while inhibition of hnfa had the opposite effect furthermore by inhibiting and overexpressing hnfa we revealed that hnfa regulates the expression of mdr gene abcb and abcc in pdac cell mechanistically we demonstrated that hnfa regulates abcb expression through binding to it specific promoter region and suppressing it transcription level finally the survival analysis revealed the clinical value of hnfa in stratification of gemcitabine sensitive pancreatic cancer patient interpretation our study paved the road for finding novel treatment combination using conventional cytotoxic agent with functional restoration of the hnfa protein individualized treatment through hnfa staining and improvement of the prognosis of pdac patient fund national natural science foundation of china and national natural science foundation of guangdong province
label: Cancer

title: functional antibody response following allogeneic stem cell transplantation for tp mutant preball in a patient with xlinked agammaglobulinemia
abstract: patient with xlinked agammaglobulinemia xla have failure of bcell development with lack of immunoglobulin ig production while immunoglobulin replacement therapy igrt is beneficial xla patient remain at risk for infection structural lung damage and rarely neoplasia allogeneic stem cell transplantation allosct may offer a potential cure but is associated with significant lifethreatening complication here we present a year old xla patient who developed preb acute lymphocytic leukemia all with somatic tp mutation and treatment for this highrisk malignancy involved full myeloablative conditioning and a hlamatched sibling allosct full donor chimerism wa achieved for cd and cd cell fraction the patient remains in morphological and flow cytometric remission month posttransplant with lateonset oral gvhd requiring low dose prednisolone and cyclosporin following igrt discontinuation at month posttransplantation humoral immunity wa established within month a reflected by normal number of total b cell memory b cell serum igg igm and iga and production of specific igg response to prevenar vaccination this is only the second reported case of an xla patient with preball and the most detailed report of engraftment following allosct in xla together with the two previous xla case treated with allosct our report provides evidence for the potential for successful humoral reconstitution with allosct in patient with bcell intrinsic antibody deficiency these observation may be relevant given igrt while beneficial remains an imperfect solution to longterm infectious complication
label: Cancer
combined_text: functional antibody response following allogeneic stem cell transplantation for tp mutant preball in a patient with xlinked agammaglobulinemia patient with xlinked agammaglobulinemia xla have failure of bcell development with lack of immunoglobulin ig production while immunoglobulin replacement therapy igrt is beneficial xla patient remain at risk for infection structural lung damage and rarely neoplasia allogeneic stem cell transplantation allosct may offer a potential cure but is associated with significant lifethreatening complication here we present a year old xla patient who developed preb acute lymphocytic leukemia all with somatic tp mutation and treatment for this highrisk malignancy involved full myeloablative conditioning and a hlamatched sibling allosct full donor chimerism wa achieved for cd and cd cell fraction the patient remains in morphological and flow cytometric remission month posttransplant with lateonset oral gvhd requiring low dose prednisolone and cyclosporin following igrt discontinuation at month posttransplantation humoral immunity wa established within month a reflected by normal number of total b cell memory b cell serum igg igm and iga and production of specific igg response to prevenar vaccination this is only the second reported case of an xla patient with preball and the most detailed report of engraftment following allosct in xla together with the two previous xla case treated with allosct our report provides evidence for the potential for successful humoral reconstitution with allosct in patient with bcell intrinsic antibody deficiency these observation may be relevant given igrt while beneficial remains an imperfect solution to longterm infectious complication

title: future option of moleculartargeted therapy in small cell lung cancer
abstract: lung cancer is the leading cause of cancerrelated death worldwide with a focus on histology there are two major subtypes nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc the more frequent subtype and small cell lung cancer sclc the more aggressive one even though sclc in general is a chemosensitive malignancy relapse following induction therapy are frequent the standard of care treatment of sclc consists of platinumbased chemotherapy in combination with etoposide that is subsequently enhanced by pdlinhibiting atezolizumab in the extensivestage disease a the addition of immunecheckpoint inhibition yielded improved overall survival although there are promising molecular pathway with potential therapeutic impact targeted therapy are still not an integral part of routine treatment against this background we evaluated current literature for potential new molecular candidate such a surface marker eg dll trop or cd apoptotic factor eg bcl bet genetic alteration eg crebbp notch or pten or vascular marker eg vegf fgfr or cd apart from these factor the application of socalled polyadpribose polymerase parp inhibitor can influence tumor repair mechanism and thus offer new perspective for future treatment another promising therapeutic concept is the inhibition of enhancer of zeste homolog ezh in the loss of function of tumor suppressor or amplification of proto oncogene considering the poor prognosis of sclc patient new molecular pathway require further investigation to augment our therapeutic armamentarium in the future
label: Cancer

title: a computer aided drug designing for pharmacological inhibition of mutant alk for the treatment of nonsmall cell lung cancer
abstract: background lung cancer is the most common among all the type of cancer worldwide with million people diagnosed every year leading to million death every year according to the american cancer society the involvement of mutated anaplasic lymphoma kinase alk positive fusion protein in the progression of nsclc ha made a propitious target to inhibit and treat nsclc in the present study the main motif is to screen the most effective inhibitor against alk protein with the potential pharmacological profile the ligand selected were docked with molegro virtual docker mvd and cep pubchem cid wa the best docked preestablished compound with a permissible pharmacological profile method the selected ligand were docked with molegro virtual docker mvd with reference to the obtained compound with the lowest rerank score pubchem database wa virtually screened to retrieve a large set of similar compound which were docked to find the compound with higher affinity further comparative study and in silico prediction included pharmacophore study proximity energy parameter admet and boiledegg plot analysis result cep pubchem cid wa the best docked preestablished compound with preferable pharmacological profile and pubchem compound cid came out a the most efficient virtually screened inhibitor interestingly the contour of the virtual screened compound pubchem cid fall within our desired high volume cavity of protein having admirable property to control the alk regulation to prevent carcinogenesis in nsclc boiledegg plot analysis depicts that both the compound have analogous characteristic in the divergent aspect moreover in the evaluation of blood brain barrier human intestinal absorption ames toxicity and ld the virtually screened compound pubchem cid wa found within high optimization conclusion these investigation denote that the virtually screened compound pubchem cid is more efficient to be a better prospective candidate for nsclc treatment having good pharmacological profile than the preestablished compound cep pubchem cid with low rerank score the identified virtually screened compound ha high potential to act a an alk inhibitor and can show promising result in the research of nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc

title: rare case of primary central nervous system anaplastic variant of diffuse large bcell lymphoma
abstract: background primary central nervous system cns diffuse large bcell lymphoma dlbcl is a rare intracranial tumor defined a dlbcl arising from the brain spinal cord leptomeninges and eye with an overall annual incidence of case per million the primary cns anaplastic variant of dlbcl adlbcl is even less common to our knowledge there are only two other case report in the literature the aim of this report is to present rare case of primary cns adlbcl and study their clinicopathologic and genetic feature case presentation we report patient two men and one woman aged and year old with primary cns adlbcl all patient had a high international extranodal lymphoma study group ielsg score although the patient were treated with methotrexatebased regimen andor with radiation therapy the overall survival wa only and month all patient presented with characteristic feature of perivascular space infiltration with bizarreshaped tumor cell leading to the diagnosis of primary cns adlbcl concurrent of myc and bcl andor bcl abnormality and mycbcl doubleexpressor dlbcl occurred in all patient two patient had mycbclbcl triple extra copy and one patient had myc extra copy and bcl translocation all patient displayed mutation in myd lp and nuclear positivity for rela relb andor crel indicating constitutive activation of the nfkappab pathway conclusion these case shed light on the unique genetic alteration and biological feature of primary cns adlbcl patient with primary cns adlbcl may often have a mycbcl doubleexpressor and concurrent myc and bcl andor bcl genetic abnormality a well a constitutive activation of the nfkappab pathway primary cns adlbcl follows a very aggressive disease course and poor prognosis in the future a large number of case should be analyzed and the evaluation of molecular genetic characteristic could help with practical and therapeutic implication for primary cns adlbcl
label: Cancer

title: release of paused rna polymerase ii at specific locus favor dna doublestrandbreak formation and promotes cancer translocation
abstract: it is not clear how spontaneous dna doublestrand break dsbs form and are processed in normal cell and whether they predispose to cancerassociated translocation we show that dsbs in normal mammary cell form upon release of paused rna polymerase ii pol ii at promoter splice site and active enhancer and are processed by endjoining in the absence of a canonical dnadamage response logistic and causalassociation model showed that pol ii pausing at long gene is the main predictor and determinant of dsbs damaged intron with paused pol iips topb and xrcc are enriched in translocation breakpoints and map at topologically associating domain boundaryflanking region showing high interaction frequency with distal locus thus in unperturbed growth condition release of paused pol ii at specific locus and chromatin territory favor dsb formation leading to chromosomal translocation
label: Cancer

title: comprehensive evaluation of context dependence of the prognostic impact of mycn amplification in neuroblastoma a report from the international neuroblastoma risk group inrg project
abstract: background mycn amplification mycna is an established adverse prognostic factor in neuroblastoma the extent to which the prognostic impact of mycna depends on other factor ha not been fully characterized patient and method using the international neuroblastoma risk group database we constructed cox model of overall survival o to obtain hazard ratio of the effect of mycna within subgroup defined by other prognostic factor cox model assessed the degree to which the prognostic impact of mycna wa modulated by each other covariate we used absolute hazard ratio hr difference to construct classification tree to identify subgroup with greatest differential prognostic effect of mycna result in a cohort of patient with known mycn status the o hazard ratio associated with mycna wa confidence interval p month mycna remained significantly prognostic of o after controlling for other factor abrogating their prognostic strength patient whose outcome wa most impacted by mycn status were those who were month had high mitosis karrhyohexis index mki and low ferritin conclusion the prognostic strength of mycna varies depending on which patient subgroup defined by other neuroblastoma risk factor is examined with greatest strength in patient with otherwise favorable feature mycna ha little effect within some subgroup aiding clinical decisionmaking if mycn status can not be assessed subgroup where mycna ha large effect may be prioritized for agent targeting myc family protein
label: Cancer

title: papillary thyroid cancer with focal tall cell change are a aggressive a tall cell variant and should not be considered a lowrisk disease
abstract: background the tall cell variant of papillary thyroid carcinoma ptc is a an aggressive histological variant the proportion of tall cell needed to influence prognosis is debated method patient with ptc and tall cell defined a having a heighttowidth ratio of seen at a highvolume center between and were reviewed specimen were classified a focal tall cell change containing of tall cell and control case selected from infiltrative classical ptcs without adverse cytologic feature univariate sensitivity and multivariate analysis were performed with persistentrecurrent disease a the primary outcome result we identified ptcs with focal tall cell change with the tall cell variant and control case factor associated with poor clinical prognosis were significantly greater in those with focal tall cell change and tall cell variant regarding primary outcome hazard ratio were confidence interval ci for focal tall cell change and ci for tall cell variant compared with control fiveyear diseasefree survival wa higher for the control group ci compared with focal tall cell change ci and the tall cell variant ci when stratified in group consisting of tall cell proportion identification of tall cell change wa associated with worse outcome p conclusion ptcs with tall cell change have worse prognosis than those without tall cell our data indicate that thyroid cancer management guideline should consider ptcs with focal tall cell change outside of the lowrisk classification
label: Cancer

title: microsatellite instability review of method and application
abstract: after introduction of the bethesda microsatellite test panel demonstration of microsatellite instability msi andor loss of mismatch repair protein mmrd wa primarily used a a marker for cancer predisposition of lynch syndrome l previous hnpcc nowadays msimmrd ha become an important biomarker to predict therapy response to checkpoint immunotherapy msi can be determined either by polymerase chain reaction pcrbased technology with or without specification of fragment size or next generation sequencing ng method depending on the individual tumor entity these test method are used differently currently msimmrd is a tumor biomarker which cover a broad spectrum of indication in tumor pathology especially in colorectal endometrial and gastric cancer in advanced carcinoma msi is an established predictor of therapy response to checkpointdirected immunotherapy
label: Cancer

title: kit mutation in a naive succinate dehydrogenasedeficient gastric gist
abstract: up to of gastrointestinal stromal tumor gist harbor mutually exclusive mutation in the kit or the pdgfra gene among others known a wild type gist succinate dehydrogenase sdhdeficient tumor develop due to genetic or epigenetic alteration in any of four sdh gene herein we present a unique case of sdhdeficient gist with an unusual heterogeneous sdha and sdhb staining pattern and mutation detected in the sdha and kit gene a yearold patient presented with a cm large gastric tumor with a multinodularplexiform growth pattern mixed epithelioid and spindle cell morphology and focal pronounced nuclear atypia with hyperchromasia and high mitotic activity immunohistochemically cd and dog were positive sdhb and sdha stain showed loss of expression in some of the nodule whereas others presented with an unusually weak patchy positivity molecular analysis revealed a point mutation in exon of the sdha gene and a mutation in exon of the kit gene we hypothesize that based on the allele frequency of sdha and kit mutation the tumor is best regarded a sdhdeficient gist in which the sdha mutation represents the most likely driver mutation the identified kit mutation raise the distinct possibility that the kit mutation is a secondary event reflecting clonal evolution this is the first case of a treatment naive gist harboring a somatic sdha and a kit mutation challenging the dogma that oncogenic mutation in treatment naive gist are mutually exclusive
label: Cancer

title: difference in circrna expression profile between herpositive breast cancer cell and normal mammary epithelial cell
abstract: objective to investigate the differential expression profile of circular rna circrna in human epidermal growth factor receptor her positive breast cancer cell and normal mammary epithelial cell and to develop novel diagnostic and therapeutic marker for her positive breast cancer method total rna were extracted from her positive breast cancer cell skbr and normal mammary epithelial cell mcfa rna quality wa detected using nanodrop nd rnase r wa applied to remove linear rna and enrich circrnas after amplification and reverse transcription into fluorescent complementary rna crna using random primer the labeled crnas were hybridized onto the arraystar human circrna array the raw data were extracted and the acquired array image were subjected to quantile normalization followed by heat map and volcano plot analysis the expression of circrnas with large fold change wa verified by realtime quantitative polymerase chain reaction rtqpcr finally gene ontology go and kyoto encyclopedia of gene and genome kegg enrichment analysis were performed in the differentially expressed circrnas and circrnamicrorna mirna network wa constructed result the total rna extracted from skbr and mcfa had high integrity and quality the expression profile of circrna in skbr and mcfa cell were significantly different shown by fluorescent expression signal compared with mcfa cell there were upregulated circrnas and downregulated circrnas in skbr cell there were circrnas with logfc of which were upregulated and were downregulated moreover circrnas with logfc among them were upregulated in skbr cell including hsacircrna logfc hsacircrna logfc hsacircrna logfc hsacircrna logfc and hsacircrna logfc a well a were downregulated including hsacircrna logfc hsacircrna logfc and hsacircrna logfc the expression level of hsacircrna hsacircrna and hsacircrna were further validated by rtqpcr in consistent with the result of microarray go analysis showed that differentially expressed circrnas were significantly enriched in the biological process of heart development p cellular component in the cell adhesionrelated component p molecular function in protein serinethreonine kinase activity p kegg analysis revealed that differentially expressed circrnas were significantly enriched in the pikakt signaling pathway conclusion the expression profile of circrna in her positive breast cancer cell is significantly different from that in normal mammary epithelial cell the differentially expressed circrnas may be served a potential diagnostic or therapeutic target for her positive breast cancer
label: Cancer
combined_text: difference in circrna expression profile between herpositive breast cancer cell and normal mammary epithelial cell objective to investigate the differential expression profile of circular rna circrna in human epidermal growth factor receptor her positive breast cancer cell and normal mammary epithelial cell and to develop novel diagnostic and therapeutic marker for her positive breast cancer method total rna were extracted from her positive breast cancer cell skbr and normal mammary epithelial cell mcfa rna quality wa detected using nanodrop nd rnase r wa applied to remove linear rna and enrich circrnas after amplification and reverse transcription into fluorescent complementary rna crna using random primer the labeled crnas were hybridized onto the arraystar human circrna array the raw data were extracted and the acquired array image were subjected to quantile normalization followed by heat map and volcano plot analysis the expression of circrnas with large fold change wa verified by realtime quantitative polymerase chain reaction rtqpcr finally gene ontology go and kyoto encyclopedia of gene and genome kegg enrichment analysis were performed in the differentially expressed circrnas and circrnamicrorna mirna network wa constructed result the total rna extracted from skbr and mcfa had high integrity and quality the expression profile of circrna in skbr and mcfa cell were significantly different shown by fluorescent expression signal compared with mcfa cell there were upregulated circrnas and downregulated circrnas in skbr cell there were circrnas with logfc of which were upregulated and were downregulated moreover circrnas with logfc among them were upregulated in skbr cell including hsacircrna logfc hsacircrna logfc hsacircrna logfc hsacircrna logfc and hsacircrna logfc a well a were downregulated including hsacircrna logfc hsacircrna logfc and hsacircrna logfc the expression level of hsacircrna hsacircrna and hsacircrna were further validated by rtqpcr in consistent with the result of microarray go analysis showed that differentially expressed circrnas were significantly enriched in the biological process of heart development p cellular component in the cell adhesionrelated component p molecular function in protein serinethreonine kinase activity p kegg analysis revealed that differentially expressed circrnas were significantly enriched in the pikakt signaling pathway conclusion the expression profile of circrna in her positive breast cancer cell is significantly different from that in normal mammary epithelial cell the differentially expressed circrnas may be served a potential diagnostic or therapeutic target for her positive breast cancer

title: prognostic value of b cell in cutaneous melanoma
abstract: background measure of the adaptive immune response have prognostic and predictive association in melanoma and other cancer type specifically intratumoral t cell density and function have considerable prognostic and predictive value in skin cutaneous melanoma skcm less is known about the significance of tumorinfiltrating b cell in skcm our goal wa to understand the prognostic and predictive value of b cell phenotypic subset in skcm using rna sequencing method we used our previously published algorithm vdjer to assemble b cell receptor bcr repertoire and estimate diversity from shortread rna sequencing rnaseq we applied machine learningbased cellular phenotype classifier to measure relative similarity of bulk tumor sample gene expression profile and different b cell phenotype we assessed these aspect of b cell biology in skcm from the cancer genome atlas project tcga a well a in rnaseq data corresponding to tumor sample procured from patient who received ctla and pd inhibitor for metastatic skcm result we found that the bcr repertoire wa associated with different clinical factor such a tumor tissue site and sex however increased clonality of the bcr repertoire wa favorably prognostic in skcm and wa prognostic even after first conditioning on various clinical factor mutation burden wa not correlated with any bcr measurement and no specific mutation had an altered bcr repertoire lack of an assembled bcr in pretreatment tumor tissue wa associated with a lack of antitumor response to a ctla inhibitor in metastatic skcm conclusion these finding suggest an important prognostic and predictive role for b cell characteristic in skcm this ha implication for melanoma immunobiology and potential development of immunogenomics feature to predict survival and response to immunotherapy
label: Cancer

title: tumorlocalized costimulatory tcell engagement by the bbher bispecific antibodyanticalin fusion pr
abstract: purpose bb cd is a key costimulatory immunoreceptor and promising therapeutic target in cancer to overcome limitation of current bbtargeting antibody we have developed pr a bbher bispecific molecule pr is designed to facilitate tcell costimulation by tumorlocalized herdependent bb clustering and activation experimental design pr wa generated by the genetic fusion of bbspecific anticalin protein to a variant of trastuzumab with an engineered igg isotype it activity wa characterized using a panel of in vitro assay and humanized mouse model the safety wa assessed using ex vivo human cell assay and a toxicity study in cynomolgus monkey result pr target bb and her with high affinity and bind both target simultaneously bbexpressing t cell are efficiently costimulated when incubated with pr in the presence of cancer cell expressing her a evidenced by increased production of proinflammatory cytokine il gmcsf tnfalpha and ifngamma in a humanized mouse model engrafted with herpositive skov tumor cell and human peripheral blood mononuclear cell pr lead to tumor growth inhibition and a dosedependent increase of tumorinfiltrating lymphocyte in indenabling study pr wa found to be well tolerated with no overt toxicity and no relevant drugrelated toxicologic finding conclusion pr facilitates tumorlocalized targeting of t cell by bispecific engagement of her and bb this approach ha the potential to provide a more localized activation of the immune system with higher efficacy and reduced peripheral toxicity compared with current monospecific approach the reported data led to initiation of a phase i clinical trial with this firstinclass moleculesee related commentary by su et al p

title: a noncoding regulatory rna network driven by circcdyl act specifically in the early stage hepatocellular carcinoma
abstract: hepatocellular carcinoma hcc is one of the fastestrising cause of cancerrelated death worldwide but it deficiency of specific biomarkers and therapeutic target in the early stage lead to severe inadequacy in the early diagnosis and treatment of hcc covalently closed circular rna circrna which wa once considered an aberrant splicing byproduct is now drawing new interest in cancer research because of it remarkable functionality beneath the surface of the dominant functional protein event a hidden circrnacentric noncoding regulatory rna network active in the very early stage of hcc is here revealed by a genomewide analysis of mrna circrna and microrna mirna expression profile circcdyl chromodomain y like is specifically upregulated in the early stage of hcc and therefore contributes to the property of epithelial cell adhesion molecule epcampositive liver tumorinitiating cell circcdyl interacts with mrna encoding hepatomaderived growth factor hdgf and hypoxiainducible factor asparagine hydroxylase hifan by acting a the sponge of mira and mirp respectively subsequently activation of the phosphoinositide kinase pikakt serinethreonine kinasemechanistic target of rapamycin kinase complex betacatenin and notch pathway which promote the expression of the effect protein baculoviral iap repeat containing birc or survivin and myc protooncogene is influenced by circcdyl a treatment incorporating circcdyl interference and traditional enzyme inhibitor targeting pik and hifan demonstrated highly effective inhibition of stemlike characteristic and tumor growth in hcc finally we demonstrated that circcdyl expression or which combined with hdgf and hifan are both independent marker for discrimination of early stage of hcc with the odds ratio of confidence interval ci and ci respectively conclusion these finding uncover a circrnacentric noncoding regulatory rna network in the early stage of hcc and thus provide a possibility for surveillance and early treatment of hcc

title: the role of gene fusion in melanocytic neoplasm
abstract: recent advance in next generation sequencing ng have allowed for efficient whole transcriptome sequencing leading to the identification of important kinase fusion a the primary driver in some melanocytic neoplasm these fusion typically occur mutually exclusively of one another and other wellknown initiating mutation such a braf nra nf kit and gnaq fusion are found in over of spitz neoplasm including alk braf ntrk ntrk ro met mapk and ret familiarity with the typical morphologic feature of certain fusiondriven melanocytic neoplasm can help with classification diagnosis and identification of targeted molecular therapy in malignant case spitz tumor with alk ntrk and ntrk fusion have characteristic morphologic feature braf and mapk fusion in particular tend to be epithelioid high grade and more frequent in spitz melanoma than other fusion subtypes sporadic case of pigmented epithelioid melanocytoma may have prkca fusion and sheet of monomorphic epithelioid melanocyte fusion event are also enriched among melanoma without the key mutation braf nra or nf although ng is the most reliable method to detect fusion immunohistochemistry and fluorescence in situ hybridization are costeffective alternative in some case we describe recent discovery regarding the role of kinase fusion in melanocytic neoplasm and their associated morphology

title: analysis of fusobacterium nucleatum and streptococcus gallolyticus in saliva of colorectal cancer patient
abstract: aim the aim of the study wa to examine the prevalence and amount of fusobacterium nucleatum fn porphyromonas gingivalis pg and streptococcus gallolyticus sg in the saliva of colorectal cancer crc patient and control method pcr analysis performed in crc patient and control result saliva sample of patient had higher amount of fn p and sg p compared with control amount of fn and sg were lower in the microsatellite instability group evaluation of salivary sg amount by receiver operating characteristic analysis found to have diagnostic value for crc auc ci conclusion we found higher amount of fn and sg in the saliva of crc patient salivary sg could helpful in distinction of crc
label: Cancer

title: clinical implication of genetic aberration in metastatic prostate cancer
abstract: purpose of review the utility of tumor genetic testing in metastatic prostate cancer is rapidly evolving especially in respect to finding prognostic and predictive biomarkers in this review we describe genomic aberration in clinically relevant pathway in metastatic castrationresistant prostate cancer mcrpc for which therapeutic targeting is possible recent finding recognizing the diverse array of genetic feature within prostate cancer the goal of testing in mcrpc is to match an individual patient tumor with the best therapy approximately of mcrpc patient have defect in dna repair which may be exploited with polyadpribose polymerase inhibitor platinumbased chemotherapy andor immunotherapy choosing between the secondgeneration androgen inhibitor and chemotherapy may be informed through testing for androgen receptor splice variant or androgen receptor amplification but technology and outcome are still being clarified genetic testing for mismatch repair deficiency of mcrpc patient is a standard of care but may be expanded a other subpopulation that could respond to immunotherapy are found summary the era of precision medicine for prostate cancer is here but is being refined further study with newer technology and standardized analytical platform are needed and must be matched with improvement in clinical care infrastructure

title: clinicopathological feature diagnosis and treatment of sessile serrated adenomapolyp with dysplasiacarcinoma
abstract: sessile serrated adenomapolyps ssaps are early precursor lesion in the serrated neoplasia pathway which result in brafmutated colorectal carcinoma with not only high level of microsatellite instability but also microsatellite stable ssaps with advanced histology including cytological dysplasia or minimally invasive carcinoma are important lesion because ssaps are considered major contributor to interval cancer and these lesion can rapidly become dysplastic or invasive carcinoma clinicopathologically ssaps with dysplasia or invasive carcinoma were associated with advanced age female sex and proximal colon although ssaps with submucosal invasive carcinoma were smaller and invaded less deeply into the submucosal layer than conventional tubular adenoma with submucosal invasive carcinoma ssaps with submucosal invasive carcinoma frequently had a mucinous component and exhibited a higher potential for lymphatic invasion and lymph node metastasis in an ssap series endoscopic characteristic including semipedunculated morphology double elevation central depression and reddishness may help accurately diagnose ssaps with advanced histology removal of ssaps with dysplasia or invasive carcinoma wa recommended endoscopic treatment such a endoscopic mucosal resection or endoscopic submucosal dissection is useful for those lesion however surgical resection with lymph node dissection might be indicated when ssaps with invasive carcinoma are endoscopically suspected because these have the high risk of lymph node metastasis greater awareness may promote further research into improving the detection recognition and complete resection rate of ssaps with dysplasia or invasive carcinoma and reduce the interval cancer rate
label: Cancer

title: elucidating a falsenegative myc breakapart fluorescence in situ hybridization probe study by nextgeneration sequencing in a patient with highgrade bcell lymphoma with ighmyc and ighbcl rearrangement
abstract: the identification of myc rearrangement in several mature bcell neoplasm is critical for diagnostic and prognostic purpose commercially available fluorescence in situ hybridization fish probe set including ighmyc dualcolor dualfusion dfish and myc breakapart probe bap serve a the primary methodology utilized to detect myc rearrangement however performing either ighmyc dfish or myc bap fish study in isolation ha been reported to result in falsenegative result because of the complex nature of q rearrangement involving the myc gene region we report a yrold male with newly diagnosed highgrade bcell lymphoma with a negative myc bap study but with positive bcl and bcl bap study per our current laboratory algorithm to concurrently interrogate the myc gene region with both myc bap and ighmyc dfish probe set we performed ighmyc dfish study and detected an ighmyc fusion to further characterize the discrepant myc result obtained by fish a nextgeneration sequencing strategy matepair sequencing mpseq wa performed and revealed a small insertion kb of the igh locus downstream from the myc gene that wa undetectable by myc bap study this case highlight the importance of utilizing both ighmyc dfish and myc bap set to detect potential cryptic myc rearrangement and also demonstrates the power of mpseq to characterize complex structural rearrangement and copynumber abnormality unappreciable by fish
label: Cancer

title: prostaglandin emajor urinary metabolite pgemum a a tumor marker for lung adenocarcinoma
abstract: background prostaglandin e pge is metabolized to prostaglandin emajor urinary metabolite pgemum enhanced cyclooxygenase cox expression demonstrated in lung adenocarcinoma indicates increased pgemum level in patient with lung adenocarcinoma objective we aimed to elucidate the clinical usefulness of measuring pgemum a an indicator of tumor burden in patient with lung adenocarcinoma method pgemum wa measured by a radioimmunoassay in control healthy volunteer n and patient with lung adenocarcinoma n association between pgemum level and clinical characteristic of the patient including lung cancer stage and tnm factor t tumor n node m metastasis were examined result pgemum level were significantly elevated in patient with lung adenocarcinoma a pgemum level of mugg cr showed sensitivity and specificity for the diagnosis of lung adenocarcinoma pgemum level tended to be positively correlated with cancer progression a determined by the tnm staging system advanced stage stage iii stage iv and recurrence wa significantly associated with high pgemum level by logistic regression analysis no apparent correlation wa demonstrated between pgemum and carcinoma embryonic antigen cea level conclusion pgemum can be a promising biomarker reflecting the systemic tumor burden of lung adenocarcinoma

title: idiopathic myelofibrosis causing inflammatory central retinal vein occlusion mimicking frosted branch angiitis
abstract: primary idiopathic myelofibrosis is a clonal disorder arising from the neoplastic transformation of early haematopoietic stem cell leading to abnormal fibrous tissue within bone marrow we present a yearold man complaining of sudden loss of vision in the right eye along with multiple superficial retinal haemorrhage and perivascular infiltration fundus fluorescein angiography and optical coherence tomography confirmed the diagnosis of inflammatory central retinal vein occlusion with macular oedema which mimicked frosted branch angiitis laboratory test and bone marrow biopsy confirmed underlying systemic disease to be janus kinase mutation positive primary idiopathic myelofibrosis he received one intravitreal injection of antivascular endothelial growth factor along with dexamethasone for his ocular condition in view of his systemic disease he wa started on systemic chemotherapy and oral corticosteroid which helped in stabilising the eye condition
label: Cancer

title: tcell deletion of myd connects il and ikappabzeta to ra oncogenesis
abstract: cancer development requires a favorable tissue microenvironment by deleting myd in keratinocytes or specific bone marrow subpopulation in oncogenic rasmediated skin carcinogenesis we show that il from infiltrating t cell and ikappabzeta signaling in keratinocytes are essential to produce a permissive microenvironment and tumor formation both normal and rastransformed keratinocytes respond to tumor promoter by activating canonical nfkappab and ikappabzeta signaling releasing specific cytokine and chemokines that attract th cell through myddependent signaling in t cell the release of il into the microenvironment elevates ikappabzeta in normal and rastransformed keratinocytes activation of ikappabzeta signaling is required for the expression of specific promoting factor induced by il in normal keratinocytes and constitutively expressed in rasinitiated keratinocytes deletion of nfkbiz in keratinocytes impairs rasmediated benign tumor formation transcriptional profiling and gene set enrichment analysis of ikappabzetadeficient rasinitiated keratinocytes indicate that ikappabzeta signaling is common for ra transformation of multiple epithelial cancer probing the cancer genome atlas datasets using this transcriptional profile indicates that reduction of ikappabzeta signaling during cancer progression associate with poor prognosis in rasdriven human cancer implication the paradox that elevation of ikappabzeta and stimulation of ikappabzeta signaling through tumor extrinsic factor is required for rasmediated benign tumor formation while relative ikappabzeta expression is reduced in advanced cancer with poor prognosis implies that tumor cell switch from microenvironmental dependency early in carcinogenesis to cellautonomous pathway during cancer progression
label: Cancer

title: complexity of pecomas diagnostic approach molecular background clinical management german version
abstract: perivascular epithelioid cell neoplasm pecomas are a family of mesenchymal neoplasm with feature of both melanotic and smooth muscle differentiation pecoma morphology is highly variable and encompasses epithelioid to spindle cell often with clear cytoplasm and prominent nucleolus molecularly most pecomas are defined by a loss of function of the tsctsc complex additionally a distinct small subset of pecomas harboring rearrangement of the tfe xp gene locus ha been identified by presenting a series of three case report with distinct feature we demonstrate diagnostic pitfall a well a the importance of molecular workup of pecomas because of important therapeutic consequence

title: liquid biopsy for ovarian carcinoma how blood test may improve the clinical management of a deadly disease
abstract: ovarian cancer ovc are frequent with more than new case each year for death in the united state except for patient with brca or brca mutation diagnostic method prognostic tool and therapeutic strategy have not much improved in the last two decade high throughput tumor molecular analysis have identified important alteration involved in ovarian carcinoma growth and spreading however these data have not modified the clinical management of most of patient moreover tumor sample collection requires invasive procedure not adapted to objective such a the screening prediction or assessment of treatment efficacy monitoring of residual disease and early diagnosis of relapse in recent year circulating tumor biomarkers also known a liquid biopsy such a circulating tumor cell circulating nucleotide dna or mirna or extracellular vesicle have been massively explored through various indication platform and goal but their use ha not yet been validated in routine practice this review describes the method of analysis and result related to liquid biopsy for ovarian epithelial cancer the different setting that a patient can go through during her journey with ovc are explored screening and early diagnosis prognosis prediction of response to systemic therapy for advanced stage and monitoring of residual subclinical disease

title: acute myeloid leukemia evolving from kit dmutated systemic mastocytosis relapsing two month after completion of chemotherapy
abstract: here we report the case of a yearold girl with acute myeloid leukemia aml developed from systemic mastocytosis sm she experienced bladder and rectal disturbance due to an extramedullary nodule in the paraspinal region of the sacrum cytogenetic and genetic analysis of leukemic cell revealed the kit dy mutation besides t qq runxrunxt despite receiving proton beam therapy after conventional chemotherapy the patient relapsed after month a smaml with the kit d mutation in adult exhibit a poor prognosis hematopoietic stem cell transplantation is recommended owing to a few report of smaml in child the standard therapy for pediatric case ha not been established to date based on our experience and the related literature the prognosis of childhood smaml could be a poor a in adult hence further investigation including mutational analysis of the kit gene is warranted to establish a riskoriented strategy for managing childhood smaml
