combined_text: acute myeloid leukemia evolving from kit dmutated systemic mastocytosis relapsing two month after completion of chemotherapy here we report the case of a yearold girl with acute myeloid leukemia aml developed from systemic mastocytosis sm she experienced bladder and rectal disturbance due to an extramedullary nodule in the paraspinal region of the sacrum cytogenetic and genetic analysis of leukemic cell revealed the kit dy mutation besides t qq runxrunxt despite receiving proton beam therapy after conventional chemotherapy the patient relapsed after month a smaml with the kit d mutation in adult exhibit a poor prognosis hematopoietic stem cell transplantation is recommended owing to a few report of smaml in child the standard therapy for pediatric case ha not been established to date based on our experience and the related literature the prognosis of childhood smaml could be a poor a in adult hence further investigation including mutational analysis of the kit gene is warranted to establish a riskoriented strategy for managing childhood smaml

title: latent essential thrombocythemia becoming perceptible after splenectomy
abstract: a yearold male wa admitted to our hospital because of left hypochondrium part pain and wa diagnosed with splenomegaly with splenic infarction in may his complete blood cell count wa almost within normal limit and a bone marrow biopsy revealed normal cellularity with no fibrosis in addition no abnormal uptake wa noted on fdg petct in august he underwent splenectomy for splenomegaly the histological examination revealed fibrotic stenosis of the blood vessel in the spleen after splenectomy his platelet count elevated and remained at xl month later finally he wa diagnosed with latent essential thrombocythemia et because the jakvf mutation wa positive accordingly oral hydroxyurea wa initiated thrombosis could be a complication in myeloproliferative neoplasm mpn in our case et wa masked perhaps because of hypersplenism and splenomegaly because of splenic vein thrombosis hence examination of the jakvf mutation in patient with splanchnic vein thrombosis is recommended because of the possibility of latent mpn

title: surgical management of carcinoma vulvacase series and review of literature
abstract: the objective of this study wa to study the risk factor management protocol and the outcome of vulvar cancer case over a period of year in a tertiary care hospital this is a case series of earlystage vulvar cancer in the department of surgical oncology in bl kapur superspeciality hospital from jan to date five patient with histologically proven diagnosis of earlystage vulvar cancer were included the mean age for the diagnosis of vulvar cancer wa year and the peak incidence wa seen in postmenopausal age group all of the case were squamous cell carcinoma in stage ib except one which wa a basisquamous variant all case were treated primarily with surgery and vulvar flap reconstruction adjuvant therapy wa not given in any case case were followed from month to date and no recurrence noted the limitation of the study were rarity of disease and less number of case a all the case in our study were in early stage of disease stage i and ii surgical treatment in the form of modified radical vulvectomy with bl inguinofemoral lymph node dissection and oncoplastic procedure wa the treatment modality chosen for all the patient
label: Cancer

title: intrahepatic adrenocortical adenoma arising from adrenohepatic fusion mimicking hepatic malignancy two case report
abstract: rationale intrahepatic adrenocortical adenoma iaa arising from adrenohepatic fusion ahf is rare and it imaging finding are not well established moreover it is easily misdiagnosed a malignant hepatic tumor in patient at risk of malignancy it key finding is the connection between the tumor and adrenal gland when iaa from ahf is suspected biopsy should be considered to avoid unnecessary surgery herein we report case of iaa from ahf patient concern a yearold woman wa admitted due to a cm hypoechoic nodule in the right hepatic lobe detected on ultrasound for hepatocellular carcinoma hcc surveillance due to chronic hepatitis b contrastenhanced computed tomography ct and gadoxetic acidenhanced magnetic resonance imaging mri were performed to evaluate the hepatic mass another yearold woman wa admitted due to rectal adenocarcinoma detected on colonoscopy contrastenhanced ct depicted a cm mass in the right hepatic lobe diagnosis in case ct and mri showed a cm subcapsular mass in the right hepatic lobe with typical finding of hcc in a patient with chronic hepatitis b the mass wa confirmed a iaa from ahf after the laparoscopic surgery in case ct showed advanced rectal malignancy and a cm poorly enhancing mass in the right hepatic lobe the tentative diagnosis wa hepatic metastasis however based on the connection between the tumor and adrenal gland during preoperative review the presumed diagnosis wa changed to iaa from ahf which wa confirmed on biopsy intervention the hepatic mass connected with the right adrenal gland wa laparoscopically resected in case laparoscopic lower anterior resection for rectal malignancy and percutaneous biopsy for the hepatic mass were performed in case outcome the first patient had an uneventful recovery without recurrence on the year followup ct the second patient had an uneventful postoperative course and ha been alive for month postoperatively without pathologically proven iaa change on followup ct lesson when hepatic mass is found adjacent to the right adrenal gland on imaging the connection between the tumor and adrenal gland should be investigated when iaa arising from ahf is suspected biopsy should be considered to avoid unnecessary surgery
label: Cancer

lobe the tentative diagnosis wa hepatic metastasis however based on the connection between the tumor and adrenal gland during preoperative review the presumed diagnosis wa changed to iaa from ahf which wa confirmed on biopsy intervention the hepatic mass connected with the right adrenal gland wa laparoscopically resected in case laparoscopic lower anterior resection for rectal malignancy and percutaneous biopsy for the hepatic mass were performed in case outcome the first patient had an uneventful recovery without recurrence on the year followup ct the second patient had an uneventful postoperative course and ha been alive for month postoperatively without pathologically proven iaa change on followup ct lesson when hepatic mass is found adjacent to the right adrenal gland on imaging the connection between the tumor and adrenal gland should be investigated when iaa arising from ahf is suspected biopsy should be considered to avoid unnecessary surgery

title: hereditary cancer syndromesa primer on diagnosis and management part breastovarian cancer syndrome
abstract: cancer is the second leading cause of death in both men and woman in the united state with colorectal cancer and breast cancer being two of the most frequent cancer type hereditary cause occurring due to pathogenic sequence variant and defect in certain gene make up roughly of all colorectal cancer and breastovarian cancer highrisk hereditary predisposition syndrome have been associated with a substantially increased lifetime risk for the development of colorectal cancer and breastovarian cancer depending on the genetic syndrome and many people also carry an increased risk of several other cancer compared with the general population the aim of this review wa to provide comprehensive literature on the most commonly encountered hereditary predisposition syndrome including lynch syndrome familial adenomatous polyposis mutyhassociated polyposis hamartomatous polyposis and breastovarian cancer condition this will be presented a a part series the first part will cover the breastovarian cancer syndrome and the second will focus on the inherited colorectal cancer and polyposis condition
label: Cancer

title: hereditary cancer syndromesa primer on diagnosis and management part gastrointestinal cancer syndrome
abstract: hereditary cause due to mutation and defect in certain gene account for roughly to of all colorectal cancer these inherited syndrome have been associated with a to lifetime risk for development of colorectal cancer depending on the genetic syndrome and many also carry an increased risk for multiple extracolonic malignancy in this second part of a review series on hereditary cancer syndrome the focus will be to provide guidance on the feature and management of the most commonly encountered hereditary colorectal cancer and polyposis condition including lynch syndrome familial adenomatous polyposis mutyhassociated polyposis and hamartomatous polyposis

title: overexpression of galectin in chronic lymphocytic leukemia is associated with p deletion a short report
abstract: backgroundaim galectins belong to the family of galactosebinding protein known to play an important role in the process of cell proliferation differentiation migration and neoplastic progression herein we studied the expression of galectin gal in chronic lymphocytic leukemia cll material and method the expression of gal wa analyzed by mean of multiparametric flow cytometry in normal and pathological bcells from peripheral blood and bone marrow sample of patient with cll result pathological bcells expressed significantly higher level of cytoplasmic gal than normal bcells moreover overexpression of cytoplasmic gal wa observed in the prognostically poorest subgroup of cll patient namely those with p deletion conclusion our result indicate a possible role of galectin in cll pathophysiology and it potential value a a prognostic marker and therapeutic target
label: Cancer

title: paraoxonase pon qr and lm polymorphism a potential predisposition factor for chronic lymphocytic leukemia
abstract: backgroundaim pon gene ha an executive role in antioxidant defense protecting cell from genotoxic factor qr and lm pon polymorphism reduce catalytic activity of the encoded protein these polymorphism were studied in chronic lymphocytic leukemia cll patient and healthy donor they were also associated with patient cytogenetic finding to investigate their possible implication in cll pathogenesis material and method snp genotyping wa performed using polymerase chain reactionrestriction fragment length polymorphism pcrrflp assay karyotypic analysis wa also performed by chromosome gbanding analysis and fluorescence in situ hybridization result genotypic and allelic distribution of qr polymorphism showed a statistically significant higher frequency of mutant genotype and mutant allele in patient compared to control the same observation wa noted in patient with abnormal karyotype and those carrying abnq and delq a statistically increased frequency for the mutant allele wa also revealed in patient with delq on the contrary lm polymorphism showed a similar distribution between patient and control conclusion qr polymorphism play a role in cll predisposition and the formation of specific chromosomal aberration
label: Cancer

title: targeted genomic sequencing reveals novel tp inframe deletion mutation leading to p overexpression in highgrade serous tuboovarian carcinoma
abstract: backgroundaim highgrade serous carcinoma hgsc is the most common histological subtype of ovarian carcinoma somatic mutation of tumor protein tp is a hallmark of tuboovarian hgsc and is observed in almost all such case highly sensitive targeted genomic sequencing can be used to identify novel mutation that may become potential druggable target and aid in therapeutic decision the aim of this study wa to describe the clinicopathological and molecular characteristic of hgscs with novel somatic tp mutation identified by nextgeneration sequencing ng material and method a commercial ng panel comprising gene including tp wa used to analyze the genetic profile of ovarian carcinoma case the clinicopathological characteristic and p immunostaining result of two hgscs exhibiting novel tp mutation were investigated result eightyeight out of ovarian carcinoma case were diagnosed a hgsc novel tp inframe deletion mutation cdelgttcctgca p psercysdel and cdeltttcgacat p pfhdel were detected in a single case of hgsc each both patient were postmenopausal woman imaging and laboratory study revealed peritoneal carcinomatosis and elevated level of serum tumor marker the patient underwent primary debulking surgery and were diagnosed a having stage iiic hgsc in both case p immunostaining revealed uniform nuclear immunoreactivity in or more of tumor cell at a very strong intensity conclusion targeted genomic sequencing revealed novel inframe deletion mutation of tp leading to p overexpression in tuboovarian hgsc this discovery of previously unreported somatic tp mutation provides insight into the translation of ng technology into personalized medicine and identifies new potential target for therapeutic application
label: Cancer

title: diagnosis and prognosis of canine cutaneous mast cell tumor
abstract: canine cutaneous mast cell tumor mcts are among the most common canine cutaneous tumor with highly variable biological behavior this review describes in detail current approach for cytologic and histologic diagnosis and prognosis including advantage and limitation of cytologic and histologic grading and utilization of molecular marker for example ki agnors kit expression and ckit mutation for a more accurate detection of aggressive mcts furthermore the current approach to evaluate surgical margin and spread to local lymph node is discussed
label: Cancer

title: zbtb spdef and etv novel potential biomarkers and therapeutic target in castrationresistant prostate cancer
abstract: prostate cancer pca is the second most common killer among men in western country targeting androgen receptor ar signaling by androgen deprivation therapy adt is the current therapeutic regime for patient newly diagnosed with metastatic pca however most patient relapse and become resistant to adt leading to metastatic castrationresistant pca crpc and eventually death several proposed mechanism have been proposed for crpc however the exact mechanism through which crpc develops is still unclear one possible pathway is that the ar remains active in crpc case therefore understanding ar signaling network a primary pca change into metastatic crpc is key to developing future biomarkers and therapeutic strategy for pca and crpc in the current review we focused on three novel biomarkers zbtb spdef and etv that were demonstrated to play critical role in crpc progression epidermal growth factor receptor tyrosine kinase inhibitor egfr tki drug resistance and the epithelialtomesenchymal transition emt for patient treated with adt or ar inhibition in addition we summarize how these potential biomarkers can be used in the clinic for diagnosis and a therapeutic target of pca
label: Cancer

title: the deubiquitinase otub control the activation of cd t cell and nk cell by regulating ilmediated priming
abstract: cd t cell and natural killer nk cell are central cellular component of immune response against pathogen and cancer which rely on interleukin il for homeostasis here we show that il also mediates homeostatic priming of cd t cell for antigenstimulated activation which is controlled by a deubiquitinase otub il mediates membrane recruitment of otub which inhibits ubiquitindependent activation of akt a kinase that is pivotal for t cell activation and metabolism otub deficiency in mouse cause aberrant response of cd t cell to il rendering naive cd t cell hypersensitive to antigen stimulation characterized by enhanced metabolic reprograming and effector function otub also control the maturation and activation of nk cell deletion of otub profoundly enhances anticancer immunity by unleashing the activity of cd t cell and nk cell these finding suggest that otub control the activation of cd t cell and nk cell by functioning a a checkpoint of ilmediated priming
label: Cancer

title: lack of response to vemurafenib in melanoma carrying braf ke mutation
abstract: vemurafenib ha been developed to target common braf mutation ve it also exerts activity towards some but not all rare braf substitution proper cataloguing of drugsensitive and insensitive rare mutation remains a challenge due to low occurrence of these event and inability of commercial pcrbased diagnostic kit to detect the full spectrum of braf gene lesion we considered the result of braf exon testing in consecutive melanoma patient braf mutation wa identified in case while drugsensitive codon substitution constituted the majority of braf gene lesion ve vk vr the fourth common braf allele wa ke accounting for melanoma case the data on braf inhibitor sensitivity of tumor with ke substitution are scarce we administered singleagent vemurafenib to a melanoma patient carrying braf ke mutation a the firstline treatment unfortunately this therapy did not result in a tumor response taken together with already published data this report indicates lack of benefit from conventional braf inhibitor in patient with braf ke mutated melanoma
label: Cancer

title: the role of p and xpo on colorectal cancer progression in yemeni patient
abstract: background the colorectal cancer crc tumorigenesis is driving by genetic alteration leading to change in protein expression such a p the p is frequently expressed in crc and it association with clinicopathological feature is still controversial moreover accumulated evidence suggests that both p and nuclear exporter protein exportin xpo are working in reciprocal manner may lead to loss of p nuclear localization and enhance cancer progression through hyperactive nuclear export accordingly the present study aimed to evaluate the expression of p in crc yemeni patient and to explore the association between the p and xpo coexpression in relation to clinicopathological feature method a series of formalin fixed paraffin embedded ffpe tissue block taken from crc patient that diagnosed a adenocarcinoma were prospectively collected and then analyzed for p and xpo expression by immunohistochemistry ihc the patient and tumor clinicopathological characteristic were retrieved from the histopathology report and the p value were considered statistically significant result the p expression wa observed in of crc tumor sample significantly the p expression wa noted in of the left side compared to of the right side colon tumor p furthermore p expression wa positively and significantly correlated with wellbut not moderate or poorlydifferentiated tumor p no significant difference wa observed between the p expression and age gender and tumor size regarding the xpo expression the p expression didnt show an association with xpo expression the coexpression of p and xpo analysis revealed that tumor with negative p and positive xpo coexpression wa noted with lymph node metastasis with significant difference p and more frequently observed in moderateor poorly differentiated tumor conclusion the loss of p accompanied with increased xpo expression wa associated with the progression of histopathological feature of crc yemeni patient further study are needed to elucidate the p genetic mutation in relation to the xpo coexpression in crc prognosis
label: Cancer

title: dendritic polyglycerolderived nanoarchitectures a delivery platform of gemcitabine for pancreatic cancer
abstract: dendritic polyglycerolcopolycaprolactone pgcopclderived block copolymer are synthesized and explored a nanoscale drug delivery platform for a chemotherapeutic agent gemcitabine gem which is the cornerstone of therapy for pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma pdac current treatment strategy with gem result in suboptimal therapeutic outcome owing to microenvironmental resistance and rapid metabolic degradation of gem to address these challenge physicochemical and cellbiological property of both covalently conjugated and noncovalently stabilized variant of gemcontaining pgcopcl architecture have been evaluated selfassembly behavior drug loading and release capacity cytotoxicity and cellular uptake property of these construct in monolayer and in spheroid culture of pdac cell are investigated to realize the covalently conjugated carrier system gem in conjunction with a tertiary amine is attached to the polycarbonate block grafted from the pgcopcl core it is observed that phdependent ionization property of these amine sidechains direct the formation of selfassembly of block copolymer in the form of nanoparticles for noncovalent encapsulation a facile solventshifting technique is adopted fabrication technique are found to control colloidal and cellular property of gemloaded nanoconstructs the feasibility and potential of these newly developed architecture for designing carrier system for gem to achieve augmented prognosis for pancreatic cancer are reported
label: Cancer

title: minimal residual disease monitoring with nextgeneration sequencing methodology in hematological malignancy
abstract: ultradeep nextgeneration sequencing ha emerged in recent year a an important diagnostic tool for the detection and followup of tumor burden in most of the known hematopoietic malignancy meticulous and highthroughput method for the lowest possible quantified disease are needed to address the deficiency of more classical technique precisionbased approach will allow u to correctly stratify each patient based on the minimal residual disease mrd after a treatment cycle in this review we consider the most prominent way to approach nextgeneration sequencing methodology to followup mrd in hematological neoplasm
label: Cancer

title: diverse regulatory manner of human telomerase reverse transcriptase
abstract: human telomerase reverse transcriptase htert is the core subunit of human telomerase and play important role in human cancer aberrant expression of htert is closely associated with tumorigenesis cancer cell stemness maintaining cell proliferation apoptosis inhibition senescence evasion and metastasis the molecular basis of htert regulation is highly complicated and consists of various layer a deep and fullscale comprehension of the regulatory mechanism of htert is pivotal in understanding the pathogenesis and searching for therapeutic approach in this review we summarize the recent advance regarding the diverse regulatory mechanism of htert including the transcriptional promoter mutation promoter region methylation and histone acetylation posttranscriptional mrna alternative splicing and noncoding rna and posttranslational level phosphorylation and ubiquitination which may provide novel perspective for further translational diagnosis or therapeutic strategy targeting htert
label: Cancer

title: liquid biopsy in nonhodgkins lymphoma
abstract: ctdna provides an important new strategy that will aid in the treatment of nonhodgkins lymphoma immunoglobulin sequencing provides a tumor specific marker for disease activity with a sensitivity equivalent to one tumor cell per furthermore it can provide an estimate of tumor bulk and tumor response dynamic during treatment interim monitoring can identify patient at high risk of treatment failure and surveillance monitoring can identify patient month before radiographic disease progression tumor specific mutation can also be detected in ctdna and may reflect an averaging of mutation present within multiple tumor mass such analysis may aid in the molecular characterization of tumor and selection of targeted treatment for precision medicine
label: Cancer

title: colonic surgery in patient with familial adenomatous polyposis
abstract: case summary a yearold woman is referred after a colonoscopy that revealed polyp throughout her colon and rectum a random selection of polyp is biopsied and reported a adenoma she is adopted and is unaware of her biological family she is found to have a deleterious germline variant in apc cdel she work a a nurse and is married with child age and year she ha had no prior abdominal operation
label: Cancer

title: acid specific dark quencher qc phlip for multispectral optoacoustic diagnosis of breast cancer
abstract: breast cancer is the most common type of malignant growth in woman early detection of breast cancer a well a the identification of possible metastatic spread pose a significant challenge because of the structural and genetic heterogeneity that occurs during the progression of the disease currently mammography biopsy and mri scan are the standard of care technique used for breast cancer diagnosis all of which have their individual shortfall especially when it come to discriminating tumor and benign growth with this in mind we have developed a noninvasive optoacoustic imaging strategy that target the acidic environment of breast cancer a ph low insertion peptide phlip wa conjugated to the dark quencher qc yielding a nonfluorescent sonophore with high extinction coefficient in the near infrared that increase signal a a function of increasing amount of membrane insertion in an orthotopic murine breast cancer model phliptargeted optoacoustic imaging allowed u to differentiate between healthy and breast cancer tissue with high signalnoise ratio in vivo the sonophore qcphlip could detect malignancy at higher contrast than it fluorescent analog icgphlip which wa developed for fluorescenceguided surgical application phliptype optoacoustic imaging agent in clinical setting are attractive due to their ability to target breast cancer and a wide variety of other malignant growth for diagnostic purpose intuitively these agent could also be used for visualization during surgery
label: Cancer

title: nse from diffuse large bcell lymphoma cell regulates macrophage polarization
abstract: backgroundaims diffuse large bcell lymphoma dlbcl is a highly common type of malignant and heterogeneous nonhodgkins lymphoma tumorassociated macrophage specially the mtype promote tumor progression and drug resistance the clinical outcome of patient with high neuronspecific enolase nse expression is worse than that with low nse expression the tumorpromoting mechanism of nse however remains unclear this study explored the role of nse in macrophage polarization associated with the immune microenvironment of dlbcl result our result showed that nse protein expression wa higher in lymphoma cell line than in the b lymphocyte functional study demonstrated that upregulation of nse in lymphoma cell could promote m polarization and migration ability of macrophage thereby consequently promoting the progression of lymphoma in vitro and in vivo further mechanism study revealed that lymphomaderived exosomes could mediate nse into macrophage nse enhanced nuclear p translocation with subsequent defective classical nuclear factorkappab activity in macrophage conclusion these result indicate that nse may be a potential target for lymphoma therapy and a prognosis marker for lymphoma
label: Cancer

title: prolonged lumbosacral pain a the initial presentation in acute lymphoblastic leukemia in an adult a case report
abstract: rationale the differential diagnosis of condition manifesting a bone and joint pain is complex although many individual with acute leukemia experience bone pain lumbosacral pain a an early feature of acute lymphoblastic leukemia all is rare patient concern here we report a case of an adult who presented with a month history of persistent lumbosacral pain which had become more severe during the previous month diagnosis prior to referral his full blood count revealed no abnormality and a computerized tomography scan revealed mild bone hyperplasia of his lumbar vertebra with disc herniation of l his blood biochemistry and urinary test result had been normal after referral to our clinic test of the morphology immunology cytogenetics and molecular biology of his bone marrow led to a diagnosis of mllaf fusion positive bcell all intervention prior to his referral he had been treated with painkiller by local doctor the painkiller initially provided pain relief but their effect wore off over time after diagnosis he wa started on an adult all chemotherapy protocol outcome his symptom resolved within a week of starting chemotherapy at his most recent assessment month after diagnosis he wa on maintenance chemotherapy and in remission lesson this case illustrates that prolonged lumbosacral pain may be a symptom of a lifethreatening condition rather than only attributable to chronic inflammation or disk herniation therefore clinician need to pay attention to subtle difference in the clinical presentation of patient with lumbosacral pain
label: Cancer

title: mira regulates chemoresistance of human osteosarcoma cell via repression of irs
abstract: chemoresistance prevents curative potential of chemotherapy in most case micrornas mirnas are key player in regulating chemoresistance in osteosarcoma which is the most common primary bone cancer bisulfite sequencing and quantitative real time pcr analysis showed that mira expression is downregulated by dna hypermethylation at it promoter region in a chemoresistant cell line sjsa compared to a chemosensitive cell line g introduction of a mira mimic in sjsa cell or an antagomir into g cell confirmed the role of mira in osteosarcoma chemoresistance bioinformatics together with biochemical assay showed that insulin receptor substrate irs is a target of mira our data concludes that mira play a role in the osteosarcoma chemoresistance and thus might serve a a useful biomarker for osteosarcoma prognosis
label: Cancer

title: preclinical modelling of pda is organoid the new black
abstract: pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma pda is a malignancy of the exocrine pancreas with the worst prognosis among all solid tumour and soon to become the second leading cause of cancerrelated death a more comprehensive understanding of the molecular mechanism underlying this disease is crucial to the development of diagnostic tool a well a to the identification of more effective therapy highfrequency mutation in pda occur in undruggable gene and molecular subtyping based on bulk transcriptome analysis doe not yet nominate valid therapeutic intervention strategy genomewide sequencing study have also demonstrated a considerable intra and interpatients genetic heterogeneity which further complicate this dire scenario more than in other malignancy functionalization of the pda genome and preclinical modelling at the individual patient level appear necessary to substantially improve survival rate for pancreatic cancer patient traditional human pda model including monolayer cell culture and patientderived xenograft have certainly led to valuable biological insight in the past year however those model system suffer from several limitation that have contributed to the lack of concordance between preclinical and clinical study for pda pancreatic ductal organoids have recently emerged a a reliable culture system to establish model from both normal and neoplastic pancreatic tissue pancreatic organoid culture can be efficiently generated from small tissue biopsy which open up the possibility of longitudinal study in individual patient a proofofconcept study ha demonstrated that patientderived pda organoids are able to predict response to conventional chemotherapy the use of this threedimensional culture system ha already improved our understanding of pda biology and promise to implement precision oncology by enabling the alignment of preclinical and clinical platform to guide therapeutic intervention in pda
label: Cancer

title: antialphaaminohydroxymethylisoxazolepropionic acid receptor glur encephalitis in a myasthenia gravis patient with complete thymectomy a case report
abstract: background autoimmune encephalitis ae is a newly recognized autoimmune disorder in which the target are protein or receptor involved in synaptic transmission and neuronal excitability alphaaminohydroxymethylisoxazolepropionic acid receptor ampar is a subtype of glutamate receptor that mediates most of the fast excitatory neurotransmission in the brain case presentation a yearold woman presented with subacute onset of memory loss and behavioral change high level of serum and csf antibody against the ampar glur were detected a wide range of abnormality in hz low to middle slow wave wa found by electroencephalograph and highintensity signal on fluidattenuated inversion recovery in both the medial temporal lobe and hippocampus were identified on brain magnetic resonance image this patient presented with myasthenia gravis and type b thymoma world health organization thymoma classification at age this case wa unique in that the patient initiated with the symptom of myasthenia gravis and thymoma two year prior to encephalitis and a complete thymectomy wa performed before ae onset without recurrence of the thymoma when encephalitis occurred conclusion thymoma wa reported to be associated with paraneoplastic neurological disease this is the first time a thymectomy ha been applied in a myasthenia gravis patient with thymoma two year prior to the onset of antiampar encephalitis this case highlight the complexity of autoimmune encephalitis associated with thymoma
label: Cancer

title: role of the dna damage response in prostate cancer formation progression and treatment
abstract: background clinical and preclinical study have revealed that alteration in dna damage response ddr pathway may play an important role in prostate cancer pca etiology and progression these alteration can influence pca response to radiotherapy and antiandrogen treatment the identification of dna repair gene aberration in pca ha driven the interest for further evaluation whether these genetic change may serve a biomarkers for patient stratification method in this review we summarize the current knowledge on ddr alteration in pca their potential impact on clinical intervention and prospect for improved management of pca we particularly focus on the influence of ddr gene mutation on pca initiation and progression and describe the underlying mechanism result and conclusion a better understanding of these mechanism will contribute to better disease management a treatment strategy can be chosen based on the specific disease property since a growing number of treatment are targeting ddr pathway alteration such a polyadpribose polymerase inhibitor furthermore the recently discovered crosstalk between the ddr and androgen receptor signaling open a new array of possible strategy to optimize treatment combination we discus how these recent and ongoing study will help to improve diagnostic prognostic and therapeutic approach for pca management
label: Cancer

title: temporal and spatial effect and survival outcome associated with concordance between tissue and blood kras alteration in the pancancer setting
abstract: we investigated the impact of time interval primary v metastatic biopsy site variant allele fraction vaf and histology on concordance of kras alteration in tissue v circulating tumor dna ctdna and association of concordance with survival blood and tissue were evaluated by nextgeneration sequencing in patient with diverse cancer altogether patient had kras alteration ctdna tissue and both the overall blood and tissue concordance rate for kras alteration wa but wa mainly driven by the large negativenegative subset therefore specificity of one test for the other wa high while sensitivity wa not high and wa lower still in patient with v month between blood and tissue sampling v p time intervaldependent sensitivity of blood for tissue p tissue for blood positive concordance rate for kras alteration wa v colorectal v noncolorectal cancer p but site of biopsy primary v metastatic and vaf ctdna wa not impactful the presence of kras alteration in both test wa independently associated with shorter survival from diagnosis hazard ratio confidence interval and from recurrentmetastatic disease positive concordance of kras alteration between ctdna and tissue wa negatively affected by a longer time period between blood and tissue sampling and wa higher in colorectal cancer than in other malignancy the presence of kras alteration in both test wa an independent prognostic factor for poor survival

title: maternal tumor disease a a reason for repeated test failure in cellfree dna screening
abstract: noninvasive prenatal testing nipt is a screening test for fetal chromosome disorder recent study show an incidental detection of maternal malignancy in nipt diagnostics where the simultaneous presence of multiple aneuploidy is described a an nipt anomaly in this case the diagnosis of a maternal tumor disease wa made due to a repeat nipt failure no call

title: flt overexpression in acute leukaemia new insight into the search for molecular mechanism
abstract: flt overexpression is a recurrent event in various acute leukaemia subtypes this transcriptional deregulation is important to define the prognostic risk for many patient of note the molecular mechanism leading to this gene upregulation are unknown for a substantial number of case in this minireview we highlight the role of flt overexpression in acute leukaemia and discus emerging mechanism accounting for this upregulation the benefit of using targeted therapy are also addressed in the overexpression context posing other therapeutic possibility based on stateoftheart knowledge that could be considered for future research

title: the role of circulating tumor dna in lung cancer mutational analysis diagnosis and surveillance now and into the future
abstract: opinion statement isolation and analysis of circulating tumor dna ctdna have emerged a an effective and promising tool for genomic profiling in nonsmall cell lung cancer analysis of ctdna can be particularly useful in situation where tissue biopsy is not safely obtainable due to poor physical condition or inaccessible tumor biopsy location in addition to identifying oncogenic driver mutation which can be treated with targetable therapy in the treatment naive advanced nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc setting ctdna is being utilized in novel way including monitoring during an advanced nsclc patient treatment course realtime monitoring determining mechanism of resistance and lastly a a tool to identify minimal residual disease in earlystage nsclc recent research demonstrates that ctdna testing can provide a useful adjunct to tissue genotyping in nsclc utilization of ctdna into routine clinical practice for nsclc should be strongly considered
label: Cancer

title: clinical feature and therapeutic efficacy in adult acute lymphoblastic leukemia with t eapbx
abstract: objective to explore the clinical feature and therapeutic efficacy in adult all patient with t eapbx method the clinic data of adult all patient with t eapbx in our hospital from nov to apr were collected the clinical featurescomplete remission cr rate overall survival o rate and relapsefree survival rf rate of patient received chemotherapy and chemotherapyhsct were analyzed result in all the patient the median age wa median wbc count wa x l median hb level wa gl median plt count wa xl pre ball were case and common ball were case patient received the induction therapy the overall cr rate wa one course cr rate wa year o rate wa and rf rate wa the o rate and rf rate of patient received transplantation were slightly higher than those of patient not received transplantation o v prfs v p conclusion most adult all patient with t eapbx is pre ball by immunophenotyping a compared with the pediatric patient the therapeutic efficacy for adult patient with t eapbx is worsen therefore stem cell transplantation is still acquired for better long term survival

title: analysis of induction efficacy and prognostic factor in fltitd positive acute myeloid leukemia in the real world
abstract: objective to investigate the efficacy and prognostic factor of induction therapy in fltitd acute myeloid leukemia aml in the real world data method from january to december de novo patient with fltitdaml were enrolled in this study out of case were male and were female the median age wa year old ranged from to year old the chemotherapy regimen were used for induction therapy and all case were followed up the treatment response wa evaluated by micm and the comparison of the ratio were analyzed by chisquare test and the survival wa estimated by kaplanmeier analysis and cox proportional hazard model wa used to identify independent prognostic factor result there were fltitdaml patient with favorable prognosis gene case with npm case with runxrunxt case with cebpa double mutation and patient with other type of fltitdaml at diagnosis all patient completed at least one cycle of induction therapy and the clinical curative effect wa evaluated complete remission cr rate wa in one cycle and total cr rate wa in two cycle the cr rate of the fltitd aml patient with favorable prognosis gene wa in one cycle and in two cycle for the other type fltitdaml patient the cr rate wa in one cycle and in two cycle there wa a significant difference in cr rate between the fltitdaml patient with and without favorable prognosis gene p this indicates that the fltitdaml patient with favorable prognosis gene had relatively good therapeutic effect among other type of fltitdaml patient who did not achieve remission from one cycle of chemotherapy patient were given sorafenib plus chemotherapy and case achieved cr patient were given conventional chemotherapy and case achieved cr there wa a significant difference between sorafenib plus chemotherapy and conventional chemotherapy group chi p and this indicates that sorafenib plus chemotherapy can significantly improve the cr rate of fltitdaml patient comparing overall survival o and disease free survival dfs there wa no significant difference between sorafenib plus chemotherapy and conventional chemotherapy group p value were and respectively conclusion the overall prognosis of fltitdaml patient is poor and the stratification therapeutic efficacy of fltitdaml without favorable prognosis gene can be improved by sorafenib combined with chemotherapy

title: molecular genetic characterization reveals linear tumor evolution in a pulmonary sarcomatoid carcinoma patient with a novel phfntrk fusion a case report
abstract: background pulmonary sarcomatoid carcinoma sc consists of both carcinomatous and sarcomatous tumor with high degree of malignancy rapid progression and poor prognosis however little is known regarding how pulmonary sc develops and progress case presentation a yearold male wa initially diagnosed with stage iiia lung cancer containing both adenocarcinoma adc and sc adjuvant chemotherapy wa administrated postsurgery however recurrence with sc only soon followed mutation profiling of the patient microdissected adc and sc component of the primary lesion and recurrent tumor wa performed by targeted nextgeneration sequencing ng of cancerrelevant gene our data showed that primary scadc and the recurrent sc shared multiple gene mutation including egfr nf tp cdknb and smarca while both primary and recurrent sc had a unique tp exon splicing mutation frequently observed in sarcoma interestingly a novel phfntrk fusion wa acquired in the recurrent sc which may be a potential driver for sc recurrence conclusion the molecular genetic characteristic of tumor tissue at different stage reveals a linear tumor evolution model in this case and support that the primary sc derived from the original lung adc during the evolution of the tumor we also identified a novel phfntrk fusion which may contribute to the disease recurrence and that can be potentially targeted with ntrk inhibitor for treatment
label: Cancer

title: epigenome remodeling in cholangiocarcinoma
abstract: cholangiocarcinoma cca comprises a heterogeneous collection of malignancy arising within the biliary tract characterized by late diagnosis innate chemoresistance and abysmal prognosis sequencing data have uncovered recurrent mutation in diverse epigenetic regulator implicating epigenetic destabilization at the root of these tumor however few study have characterized biliary tumor epigenomes in this opinion article we argue that an epigenomeoriented approach to cca could establish diverse interconnection between many key aspect of research on this disease including molecular heterogeneity diverse cell of origin and prominent tumor microenvironments moreover we discus plausible cause of epigenome dysregulation in biliary tumor including genetic epigenetic metabolic microenvironmental and physiological factor lastly we assess the translational potential of epigenomics in cca to uncover robust biomarkers and therapeutic opportunity for this growing group of patient with limited treatment option
label: Cancer

title: community assessment to advance computational prediction of cancer drug combination in a pharmacogenomic screen
abstract: the effectiveness of most cancer targeted therapy is shortlived tumor often develop resistance that might be overcome with drug combination however the number of possible combination is vast necessitating datadriven approach to find optimal patientspecific treatment here we report astrazenecas large drug combination dataset consisting of experiment from combination across molecularly characterized cancer cell line and result of a dream challenge to evaluate computational strategy for predicting synergistic drug pair and biomarkers team participated to provide a comprehensive methodological development and benchmarking winning method incorporate prior knowledge of drugtarget interaction synergy is predicted with an accuracy matching biological replicates for of combination however of drug combination are poorly predicted by all method genomic rationale for synergy prediction are identified including adam inhibitor antagonism when combined with pikcbd inhibition contrasting to synergy when combined with other pikpathway inhibitor in pikca mutant cell
label: Cancer
combined_text: community assessment to advance computational prediction of cancer drug combination in a pharmacogenomic screen the effectiveness of most cancer targeted therapy is shortlived tumor often develop resistance that might be overcome with drug combination however the number of possible combination is vast necessitating datadriven approach to find optimal patientspecific treatment here we report astrazenecas large drug combination dataset consisting of experiment from combination across molecularly characterized cancer cell line and result of a dream challenge to evaluate computational strategy for predicting synergistic drug pair and biomarkers team participated to provide a comprehensive methodological development and benchmarking winning method incorporate prior knowledge of drugtarget interaction synergy is predicted with an accuracy matching biological replicates for of combination however of drug combination are poorly predicted by all method genomic rationale for synergy prediction are identified including adam inhibitor antagonism when combined with pikcbd inhibition contrasting to synergy when combined with other pikpathway inhibitor in pikca mutant cell

title: application of ushaped convolutional neural network in auto segmentation and reconstruction of d prostate model in laparoscopic prostatectomy navigation
abstract: objective to investigate the efficacy of intraoperative cognitive navigation on laparoscopic radical prostatectomy using d prostatic model created by ushaped convolutional neural network unet and reconstructed through medical image interaction tool kit mitk platform method a total of piece of prostate cancer magnetic resonance mr imaging discovery set with manual annotation were used to train a modified unet and a set of clinically demandoriented stable and efficient full convolutional neural network algorithm wa constructed the mr image were cropped and segmented automatically by using modified unet and the segmentation data were automatically reconstructed using mitk platform according to our own protocol the modeling data were output a stl format and the prostate model were simultaneously displayed on an android tablet during the operation to help achieving cognitive navigation result based on original unet architecture we established a modified unet from a case mr imaging training set the network performance wa tested and compared with human segmentation and other segmentation network by using one certain testing data set auto segmentation of multistructures such a prostate prostate tumor seminal vesicle rectus neurovascular bundle and dorsal venous complex were successfully achieved secondary automatic d reconstruction had been carried out through mitk platform during the surgery d model of prostatic area were simultaneously displayed on an android tablet and the cognitive navigation wa successfully achieved intraoperation organ visualization demonstrated the structural relationship among the key structure in great detail and the degree of tumor invasion wa visualized directly conclusion the modified unet wa able to achieve automatic segmentation of important structure of prostate area secondary d model reconstruction and demonstration could provide intraoperative visualization of vital structure of prostate area which could help achieve cognitive fusion navigation for surgeon the application of these technique could finally reduce positive surgical margin rate and may improve the efficacy and oncological outcome of laparoscopic prostatectomy

title: recent advance in invasive adenocarcinoma of the cervix
abstract: endocervical adenocarcinoma ecas are currently classified according to the world health organization who system which is predominantly based on descriptive morphologic characteristic considers factor bearing minimal etiological clinical or therapeutic relevance and lack sufficient reproducibility the international endocervical adenocarcinoma criterion and classification iecc system wa developed by a group of international collaborator to address these limitation the iecc system separate ecas into two major groupsthose that are human papillomavirusassociated hpva and those that are nonhpvassociated nhpvabased on morphology linked to etiology alone precluding the need for an expensive panel of immunohistochemical marker for most case the major type of hpva eca include the usual with villoglandular and micropapillary architectural variant and mucinous type not otherwise specified no intestinal signetring and invasive stratified mucinproducing carcinoma invasive adenocarcinoma no is morphologically uninformative yet considered part of this group when hpv positive nhpva ecas include gastric clear cell endometrioid and mesonephric type the iecc system is supported by demographic and clinical feature hpva ecas develop in younger patient are smaller and are diagnosed at an earlier stage phpv status almost all hpva ecas are p andor hpv positive prognostic parameter nhpva ecas more often have lymphovascular invasion lymph node metastasis and are silva pattern c and survival data nhpva ecas are associated with worse survival a move from the morphologybased who system to the iecc system will likely provide clinician with an improved mean to diagnose and classify ecas and ultimately to better personalize treatment for these patient
label: Cancer

title: identification of a novel orally bioavailable erk inhibitor with selectivity over palpha and brd
abstract: extracellular regulated kinase erk signalling ha been implicated in driving a number of cellular phenotype including endothelial cell angiogenesis and tumour cell motility novel erk inhibitor were identified using high throughput screening with a series of pyrrolecarboxamides substituted at the position with an aroyl group being found to exhibit ic value in the micromolar range but having no selectivity against palpha map kinase truncation of the nsubstituent marginally enhanced potency fold against erk but importantly attenuated inhibition of palpha systematic variation of the substituents on the aroyl group led to the selective inhibitor bromofluorobenzoylnpyridinylhpyrrolecarboxamide ic mum for erk ic mum for palpha the crystal structure pdb oi of this compound in complex with erk ha been solved this compound wa orally bioavailable and inhibited bfgfdriven matrigel plug angiogenesis and tumour xenograft growth the selective erk inhibitor described herein provides a lead for further development into a tool compound for more extensive study seeking to examine the role of erk signalling in cancer and other disease
label: Cancer

title: bioinformatics analysis for circulating cellfree dna in cancer
abstract: molecular analysis of cellfree dna cfdna that circulates in plasma and other body fluid represents a liquid biopsy approach for noninvasive cancer screening or monitoring the rapid development of sequencing technology ha made cfdna a promising source to study cancer development and progression specific genetic and epigenetic alteration have been found in plasma serum and urine cfdna and could potentially be used a diagnostic or prognostic biomarkers in various cancer type in this review we will discus the molecular characteristic of cancer cfdna and major bioinformatics approach involved in the analysis of cfdna sequencing data for detecting genetic mutation copy number alteration methylation change and nucleosome positioning variation we highlight specific challenge in sensitivity to detect genetic aberration and robustness of statistical analysis finally we provide perspective regarding the standard and continuing development of bioinformatics analysis to move this promising screening tool into clinical practice
label: Cancer

title: optimizing genetic workup in pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma by integrating diagnostic and research approach
abstract: pheochromocytoma and paragangliomas ppgl are rare neuroendocrine tumor with a strong hereditary background and a large genetic heterogeneity identification of the underlying genetic cause is crucial for the management of patient and their family a it aid differentiation between hereditary and sporadic case to improve diagnostics and clinical management we tailored an enrichment based comprehensive multigene next generation sequencing panel applicable to both analysis of tumor tissue and blood sample we applied this panel to tumor sample and compared it performance to our current routine diagnostic approach routine diagnostic sequencing of ppgl susceptibility gene wa applied to blood sample of unselected ppgl patient at a single center in dresden germany predisposing germline mutation were identified in patient analysis of ppgl tumor tissue using the dedicated ppgl panel revealed pathogenic or likely pathogenic variant in known ppgl susceptibility gene in case including mutation in idh atrx and hras these mutation suggest sporadic tumor development our result imply a diagnostic benefit from extended molecular tumor testing of ppgls and consequent improvement of patient management the approach is promising for determination of prognostic biomarkers that support therapeutic decisionmaking
label: Cancer

title: stabilization of intrinsically disordered dkk protein by fusion to rnabinding domain
abstract: intrinsic disorder are a common feature of hub protein in eukaryotic interactomes controlling the signaling pathway the intrinsically disordered protein idp are prone to misfolding and maintaining their functional stability remains a major challenge in validating their therapeutic potential considering that idp are highly enriched in rnabinding protein rbps here we reasoned and confirmed that idp could be stabilized by fusion to rbps dickkopf dkk wnt antagonist and a prototype idp wa fused with lysyltrna synthetase lysrs with or without the fragment crystallizable fc domain of an immunoglobulin and expressed predominantly a a soluble form from a bacterial host the functional competence wa confirmed by in vitro wnt signaling reporter and tube formation in human umbilical vein endothelial cell huvecs and in vivo matrigel plug assay the removal of lysrs by sitespecific protease cleavage prompted the insoluble aggregation confirming that the linkage to rbp chaperone the functional competence of idp while addressing to dkk a a key modulator for cancer and ischemic vascular disease our result suggest the use of rbps a stabilizer of disordered proteinaceous material for acquiring and maintaining the structural stability and functional competence which would impact the druggability of a variety of idp from human proteome
label: Cancer

title: role of the hexosamine biosynthetic pathway and pentose phosphate pathway in bile acidinduced cancer development
abstract: esophageal squamous cell carcinoma esccs a well a adenocarcinoma eacs were developed in rat duodenal content reflux model reflux model the present study aimed to shed light on the mechanism by which bile acid stimulation cause cancer onset and progression metabolomics analysis were performed on sample of neoplastic and nonneoplastic tissue from reflux model and kd cultivated from a nonmetastatic primary escc and esccdr established from a metastatic thoracic lesion esccdrtcam wa prepared by treating esccdr cell with taurocholic acid tca to accelerate cancer progression the line were subjected to comprehensive genomic analysis in addition protein expression level of glucosephosphate dehydrogenase gpd nuclear factor kappa b nfkappab p and olinked nacetylglucosamine oglcnac were compared among line cancer developed in the reflux model exhibited greater hexosamine biosynthesis pathway hbp activation compared with the nonneoplastic tissue expression of oglcnac transferase ogt increased considerably in both escc and eac compared with nonneoplastic squamous epithelium conversely cell linebased experiment revealed the greater activation of the pentose phosphate pathway ppp at higher degree of malignancy gpd overexpression in response to tca exposure wa observed both nfkappab p and oglcnac were expressed more highly in esccdrtcam than in the other cell line moreover esccdrtcam cell had additional chromosomal abnormality in excess of esccdr cell overall glucose metabolism wa upregulated in both esophageal cancer tissue and cell line while bile acid are not mutagenic chronic exposure seems to trigger nfkappabp activation potentially inducing genetic mutation a well a facilitating carcinogenesis and cancer progression glucose metabolism wa upregulated in both esophageal cancer tissue and cell line and the hbp wa activated in the former the cell linebased experiment demonstrated upregulation of the pentose phosphate pathway ppp at higher degree of malignancy while bile acid are not mutagenic chronic exposure seems to trigger gpd overexpression and nfkappab p activation potentially inducing genetic mutation a well a facilitating carcinogenesis and cancer progression

title: vocal cord inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor with mucoid deposit harboring timpalk fusion a potential diagnostic pitfall
abstract: a yearold japanese man who had experienced hoarseness for year presented with a vocal cord lesion a gross examination revealed a left vocal cord polyp occupying twothirds of the vocal space the endoscopically resected lesion contained scattered atypical fibroblastic stellate or ganglionlike cell with mucoid stroma vacuolated cell were also seen lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate wa largely undetectable a vocal cord polyp wa first suspected but welldifferentiated liposarcoma and inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor imt were included in the differential diagnosis the tumor cell were positive for anaplastic lymphoma kinase alk calponin and vimentin and negative for other smooth muscle marker by immunohistochemistry structure resembling myofibroblasts were not observed by electron microscopy which confirmed abundant rough endoplasmic reticulum in the tumor cell and accumulated lipid droplet in some tumor cell alk gene rearrangement wa detected by fluorescence in situ hybridization and timpalk fusion wa confirmed by rapid amplification of cdna end we diagnosed the lesion a an imt and an alkrearranged stellate cell tumor may be postulated this is the first report of a fusion partner gene of alk in a case of laryngeal imt
label: Cancer

title: multidisciplinary challenge in mastocytosis and how to address with personalized medicine approach
abstract: mastocytosis is a hematopoietic neoplasm defined by abnormal expansion and focal accumulation of clonal tissue mast cell in various organsystems the disease exhibit a complex pathology and an equally complex clinical behavior the classification of the world health organization who divide mastocytosis into cutaneous form systemic variant and localized mast cell tumor in of patient with systemic mastocytosis sm a somatic point mutation in kit at codon is found whereas patient with indolent form of the disease have a normal or nearnormal life expectancy patient with advanced mast cell neoplasm including aggressive sm and mast cell leukemia have a poor prognosis with short survival time in a majority of these patient multiple somatic mutation andor an associated hematologic neoplasm such a a myeloid leukemia may be detected independent of the category of mastocytosis and the serum tryptase level patient may suffer from mediatorrelated symptom andor osteopathy depending on the presence of comorbidities the symptomatology in such patient may be mild severe or even lifethreatening most relevant comorbidities in such patient are igedependent allergy psychiatric psychological or mental problem and vitamin d deficiency the diagnosis and management of mastocytosis is an emerging challenge in clinical practice and requires vast knowledge a multidisciplinary approach and personalized medicine procedure in this article the current knowledge about mastocytosis is reviewed with special emphasis on the multidisciplinary aspect of the disease and related challenge in daily practice
label: Cancer

title: pten hamartoma tumor syndrome a clinical overview
abstract: the phosphatase and tensin homolog pten hamartoma tumor syndrome phts is a grouping of related genetic disorder that ha been linked to germline mutation in the pten gene these disorder include cowden syndrome c bannayanrileyruvalcaba syndrome adult lhermitteduclos disease and autism spectrum disorder associated with macrocephaly the majority of the clinical information available on phts however is related to individual diagnosed with c there is still much to be learned about this disorder since diagnostic criterion for c were only established in before the identification of the pten gene and were based primarily on feature seen in case reported in the existing literature more recently however data from several large series of patient have shown that a number of the clinical feature associated with pten mutation are either more or less common than previously reported in addition we now know that only about of patient meeting clinical diagnostic criterion for cowden syndrome actually have a detectable pten mutation thus our understanding of ptenrelated disease and their management ha evolved significantly over time the united state national comprehensive cancer network nccn ha produced and regularly update practice guideline which include clinical diagnostic criterion a well a guideline for pten testing and management of patient with mutation this review will summarize the overall literature on phts a well a recent finding which are broadening our understanding of this set of disorder
label: Cancer

title: clinicopathological characteristic and differential diagnosis of interdigitating dendritic cell sarcoma
abstract: objective to analyze the clinicopathological feature and differential diagnosis of interdigitating dendritic cell sarcoma idcs method the clinical pathological feature of idcs were analyzed among them the followup result of case were available result among the idcs patient case were male and were female the age of the patient ranged from to yearsthree case were originated from lymph node and case were originated from skin stomach adrenal gland and mesentery respectively microscopically the tumor cell presented a fascicular and storiform proliferation and infiltrated by lymphocyte the tumor cell were shortspindle or ovoid with indistinct border of cytoplasm the immunohistochemistry result showed that tumor cell were s vim cd and cd positive and aeae ema cd cd desmin sma cdalpha cd cd cd hmb melana melanpan and alk negativethe braf mutation and clonal rearrangement of t and b cell were not detected among the followup period of idcs patient occurred disease progression conclusion idcs is extremely rare with unique pathological feature and it lesion is not limited to the lymph node the idcs patient with extensive lesion may have worse prognose the differential diagnosis of idcs includes other histiocytic and dendritic cell neoplasm malignant melanoma and soft tissue neoplasm
label: Cancer

title: adenoviral vaccine targeting multiple neoantigens a strategy to eradicate large tumor combined with checkpoint blockade
abstract: neoantigens nag are promising tumor antigen for cancer vaccination with the potential of inducing robust and selective t cell response genetic vaccine based on adenovirus derived from nonhuman great ape gad elicit strong and effective t cellmediated immunity in human here we investigate for the first time the potency and efficacy of a novel gad encoding multiple neoantigens prophylactic or early therapeutic vaccination with gad efficiently control tumor growth in mouse in contrast combination of the vaccine with checkpoint inhibitor is required to eradicate large tumor gene expression profile of tumor in regression show abundance of activated tumor infiltrating t cell with a more diversified tcr repertoire in animal treated with gad and antipd compared to antipd data suggest that effectiveness of vaccination in the presence of high tumor burden correlate with the breadth of nagsspecific t cell and requires concomitant reversal of tumor suppression by checkpoint blockade
label: Cancer

title: prognostic significance of chek mutation in progression of breast cancer
abstract: breast cancer bc is one of the most common cancer among woman genetic mutation reflect the development of this disease mutation in cell signaling factor can be the main cause of bc development in this study we focused on mutation in checkpoint kinase chek and their impact a a prognostic factor in the pathogenesis of bc chek is controlled in cell signaling pathway through the influence of upstream gene also several downstream gene are regulated by chek in addition mutation in chek lead to resistance of bc cell to chemotherapy and metastasis of cancer cell to other part of the body finally detection of mutation in chek can be used a a prognostic factor for patient response to treatment and for targeting downstream molecule of chek that are involved in the proliferation of breast tumor cell mutation such a cdelc and it can distinguish which patient are susceptible to metastasis
label: Cancer

title: clinical and pathological characterization of lynchlike syndrome
abstract: background aim lynch syndrome is characterized by dna mismatch repair mmr deficiency some patient with suspected lynch syndrome have dna mmr deficiency but no detectable mutation in gene that encode mmr proteinsthis is called lynchlike syndrome lls there is no consensus on management of patient with lls we collected data from a large series of patient with lls to identify clinical and pathology feature method we collected data from a nationwideregistry of patient with colorectal cancer crc in spain we identified patient whose colorectal tumor had loss of msh msh pm or mlh based on immunohistochemistry without the mutation encoding ve in braf detected by realtime pcr andor no methylation at mlh determined by methylationspecific multiplex ligationdependent probe amplification and no pathogenic mutation in mmr gene braf or epcam determined by dna sequencing these patient were considered to have lls we collected data on demographic clinical and pathology feature and family history of neoplasm the chi test wa used to analyze the association between qualitative variable followed by the fisher exact test and the student t test or the mannwhitney test for quantitative variable result we identified patient with lls their mean age at diagnosis of crc wa year and patient were female the amsterdam i and ii criterion for lynch syndrome were fulfilled by of case and the revised bethesda guideline criterion by of case of the patient with lls were identified in universal screening there were no proportional difference in sex indication for colonoscopy immunohistochemistry pathology finding or personal history of crc or other lynch syndromerelated tumor between patient who met the amsterdam andor bethesda criterion for lynch syndrome and patient identified in universal screening for lynch syndrome without a family history of crc conclusion patient with lls have homogeneous clinical demographic and pathology characteristic regardless of family history of crc
label: Cancer

title: mutation status of ra tp and smad is superior to mutation status of ra alone for predicting prognosis after resection of colorectal liver metastasis
abstract: purpose somatic gene mutation have been increasingly recognized to impact prognosis following resection of colorectal liver metastasis clm we aimed to determine the impact of combination of somatic mutation on survival in patient undergoing clm resection experimental design we identified patient who underwent initial clm resection during and had genetic sequencing data available risk factor for overall survival o and recurrencefree survival rf were determined using cox proportional hazard model result of patient who underwent clm resection during the study period met the inclusion criterion multigene testing revealed mutation rate greater than for tp mutated in of patient apc ra pikca and smad braf wa mutated in of patient braf ra tp and smad mutation were significantly associated with o and ra tp and smad mutation were significantly associated with rf coexisting mutation in ra tp and smad were associated with significantly worse o and rf than coexisting mutation in any of these gene and mutation in or none of these gene coexisting mutation in gene conferred significantly worse o and rf than single mutation or no mutation o and rf did not differ significantly between patient with ra mutation and wildtype tp and smad and patient with wildtype ra p and respectively conclusion ra mutation status alone is not sufficient for precisely predicting prognosis after clm resection
label: Cancer

title: mutational profiling of poorly differentiated and anaplastic thyroid carcinoma by the use of targeted nextgeneration sequencing
abstract: aim to characterise the mutational profile of poorly differentiated thyroid carcinoma pdtc and anaplastic thyroid carcinoma atc and to identify marker with potential diagnostic prognostic and therapeutic significance method and result targeted nextgeneration sequencing with a panel of thyroid carcinomarelated gene wa performed on tissue sample from pdtc and atc patient genetic alteration and their correlation with clinicopathological factor including survival outcome were also analysed our result showed that atc had significantly higher mutation rate of braf tp tert and pikca than pdtc p p p and p respectively nine atc case with papillary thyroid carcinoma ptc component harboured braf mutation all of which coexisted with a late mutation event tp tert or pikca nine case with oncogenic fusion six ret case one ntrk case one alk case and one pparg case were identified in pdtcs whereas only one case with oncogenic fusion ntrk wa found among atcs moreover all six case of ret fusion were found in pdtc with ptc component accounting for in pdtcatc patient concurrent tert and pikca mutation were associated with poor overall survival after adjustment for tnm stage p conclusion atc with ptc component is typically characterised by a braf mutation with a late mutation event whereas pdtc with ptc component is more closely correlated with ret fusion tert and concurrent pikca mutation predict worse overall survival in pdtcatc patient
label: Cancer

title: seterpr a robust gene predictor for sensitivity to endocrine therapy for metastatic breast cancer
abstract: there is a clinical need to predict sensitivity of metastatic hormone receptorpositive and hernegative hrher breast cancer to endocrine therapy and targeted rna sequencing rnaseq offer diagnostic potential to measure both transcriptional activity and functional mutation we developed the seterpr index to measure gene expression microarray probe set that were correlated with hormone receptor esr and pgr and robust to preanalytical and analytical influence we tested seterpr index in biopsy of metastastic hrher breast cancer against the treatment outcome in patient then we customized the seterpr assay to measure informative reference transcript and sequence the ligandbinding domain lbd of esr using dropletbased targeted rnaseq and tested that in residual rna from patient higher seterpr index in metastatic sample predicted longer pfs and o when patient received endocrine therapy a next treatment even after adjustment for clinicalpathologic risk factor pfs hr ci to p o hr ci to p mutated esr lbd wa detected in of metastasis involving of esr transcript all had high seterpr index a signature based on probe set with good preanalytical and analytical performance facilitated our customization of an accurate targeted rnaseq assay to measure both phenotype and genotype of errelated transcription elevated seterpr wa associated with prolonged sensitivity to endocrine therapy in patient with metastatic hrher breast cancer especially in the absence of mutated esr transcript
label: Cancer

title: genomewide analysis of long noncoding rna profile in canine oral melanoma
abstract: mucosal melanoma mm are rare aggressive cancer in human and one of the most common form of oral cancer in dog similar biological and histological feature are shared between mm in both specie making dog a powerful model for comparative oncology study of melanoma although exome sequencing recently identified recurrent coding mutation in canine mm little is known about change in noncoding gene expression and more particularly in canine long noncoding rna lncrnas which are commonly dysregulated in human cancer here we sampled a large cohort n of canine normaltumor oral mm from three predisposed breed poodle labrador retriever and golden retriever and used deep transcriptome sequencing to identify more than differentially expressed de lncrnas we further prioritized candidate lncrnas by comparative genomic analysis to pinpoint doghuman conserved de lncrnas including soxas zebas and casc lncrnas using unsupervised coexpression network analysis with coding gene we inferred the potential function of the de lncrnas suggesting association with cancerrelated gene cell cycle and carbohydrate metabolism gene ontology go term finally we exploited our multibreed design to identify de lncrnas within breed this study provides a unique transcriptomic resource for studying oral melanoma in dog and highlight lncrnas that may potentially be diagnostic or therapeutic target for human and veterinary medicine
label: Cancer

title: androgen upregulates the palmitoylation of eifl in human prostate lncap cell
abstract: background prostate cancer is the second leading cause of cancerrelated death in western country most patient diagnosed with advanced prostate cancer can be treated with the main treatment androgen deprivation therapy adt the androgen receptor ar signaling axis play a pivotal role in the progression of prostate cancer however most patient can ultimately progress to the castrationresistant prostate cancer crpc stage within year at this stage drug targeting the ar signaling axis including enzalutamide and abiraterone acetate can not prevent the progression of prostate cancer thus predicting a poor prognosis the molecular mechanism lie in the aberrant ar reactivation which exhibit an adaptive response to adt such a the presence of ar splice variant thus crpc treatment remains a challenge purpose in addition to the ar axis a mechanism leading to this progression should be determined the present study mainly compared palmitoylated protein between androgentreated lncap cell and nontreated lncap cell by palmitoylome profiling to illustrate the change at proteomic level material and method to screen the androgeninduced palmitoylated protein we conducted proteomic experiment using clickable palmitate probe alkc between three individual pair of androgentreated and nontreated lncap cell result we identified unique peptide corresponding to protein among them a number of these identified protein were palmitoylated protein particularly eifl androgen treatment significantly increased the palmitoylation level of eifl an individual subunit of eif a an initiation factor eifl play a pivotal role in the translation of mrna encoding growthpromoting protein by enhancing translation rate thus controlling cell proliferation conclusion in this study we demonstrated that the regulation of eifl palmitoylation may provide new direction for the therapy of prostate cancer moreover the increased level of androgeninduced eifl may be used a a biomarker for the diagnosis of earlystage prostate cancer
label: Cancer
