title: ilex hainanensis merr target itgav to suppress the proliferation and metastasis of osteosarcoma cell
abstract: background osteosarcoma o is the most common primary malignant bone tumor hence there is an urgent need to identify effective and safe therapeutic agent against o it ha been reported that ilex hainanensis merr ime possesses antitumor property integrin subunit alpha v itgav is important for the diagnosis treatment and prognosis of tumor purpose the objective of this study wa to whether ime can play a role in the treatment of osteosarcoma by regulating itgav method western blot and realtime pcr were used to detect the expression of itgav in nontumorous tissue osteosarcoma tissue and metastatic tumor the expression of itgav in mg uos and hfob a total of cell wa determined through western blotting and realtime pcr the expression of itgav in o cell treated with different concentration of ddp wa determined through western blotting agter transfecting with control or siitgav and subsequently treated with control or mumoll ddp mtt assay and transwell assay were used to detect the proliferaion and migration of cell western blot wa used to detect the expression of itgav in cell treated with different concentration of ime and mtt assay and transwell assay were used to detect the proliferaion and migration of cell mg and uos cell were treated with control mumoll ddp mumoll ime or mumoll ddp combined with mumoll ime the expression of itgav wa determined through western blotting and realtime pcr mtt assay and transwell assay were used to detect the proliferation and migration of cell inhibitory effect of ime on lung metastasis of osteosarcoma in vivo result itgav wa highly expressed in tumor with the highest expression found in metastatic tumor and higher in o cell a low concentration of ddp mumoll inhibited the expression of itgav however itgav may be related to the development of resistance to ddp silencing of itgav downregulates the proliferation and migration of o cell a the effect of lowconcentration ddp mumoll ime inhibited the proliferation and migration of mg and uos cell in a concentrationdependent manner and decreased the expression of itgav mtt and transwell assay showed that mumoll ime and mumoll ddp exhibited similar inhibitory effect on the proliferation and migration of o cell the combination of ime with ddp resulted in the amplification of these inhibitory effect both ddp and ime downregulated the expression of itgav and the inhibition of itgav wa amplified by the combination of ime with ddp invivo study have shown that ime and ddp independently or in combination may significantly inhibit the metastasis of o to the lung conclusion ime may reduce the resistance of o cell to ddp to some extent
label: Cancer

title: roundcell sarcoma
abstract: roundcell sarcoma represent highly malignant tumor that occur predominantly in child adolescent and young adult roundcell sarcoma are caused by recurrent translocation that involve certain transcription factor ewings sarcoma ewinglike sarcoma eg cicdux positive or bcor positive sarcoma desmoplastic small roundcell tumor dsrcts and alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma arm are typical example of this particular group of sarcoma these entity differ in their tumor genetics which is correlated with immunohistochemical expression profile and with clinical phenotype classification should be based on molecular finding immunohistochemistry may serve a a surrogate marker
label: Cancer

title: circular rna a novel biomarker for cervical cancer
abstract: besides messenger rna recent rnaseq and biochemical analysis showed another type of rna a a product of splicing which is named circular rna circrna evidence demonstrated that circrnas are abundant in the cell and are able to show celltissuespecific expression or tissue developmental stage which suggest that circrnas may have regulatory potential in recent year researcher have focused attention on circrnas because of their key function in various cellular mechanism circrnas also have the potential to be a promising biomarkers for diagnosis of various disease such a cancer growing up evidence ha shown the various role of circrnas in multiple cancer in recent year cervical cancer a one of the main cause of cancer death in woman ha been interesting for molecular research circrnas are one of the novel object which have recently been evaluated in this cancer the improvement in our knowledge of the role of circrnas in cervical cancer may lead to new transcription therapeutic approach to cervical cancer inhibition therefore the purpose of this review is to review many study which examined the role of circrnas in cervical cancer carcinogenesis and progression up till date and to summarize possible mechanism of action of circrnas in cervical neoplasm
label: Cancer

title: establishment of permutation for cancer risk estimation in the urothelium based on genomewide dna methylation analysis
abstract: the aim of this study wa to establish permutation for cancer risk estimation in the urothelium twentysix sample of normal control urothelium obtained from patient without urothelial carcinoma c sample of noncancerous urothelium without noticeable morphological change obtained from patient with urothelial carcinoma n and sample of the corresponding cancerous tissue t in the learning cohort and n sample in the validation cohort ie tissue sample in total were analyzed genomewide dna methylation analysis wa performed using the infinium humanmethylation k beadchip and dna methylation level were verified using pyrosequencing and massarray amplicon sequencing wa performed using the generead dnaseq targeted panel v although n sample rarely showed genetic mutation or copy number alteration they showed dna methylation alteration at cpg site compared to c sample and such alteration were inherited by or strengthened in t sample indicating that dna methylation alteration may participate in field cancerization in the urothelium receiver operating characteristic curve analysis confirmed the feasibility of cancer risk estimation to identify urothelium at the precancerous stage by dna methylation quantification cancer risk estimation permutation wa established using a combination of two marker cpg locus on the hoxc tenm and tlr gene sensitivity and specificity among them the diagnostic impact of pattern of permutation wa successfully validated in the validation cohort sensitivity and specificity these data suggest that cancer risk estimation using procedure such a urine test during health checkup might become applicable for clinical use
label: Cancer

title: dock mutation diagnosed using wholeexome sequencing of the dried blood spotderived dna a case report of an iraqi girl diagnosed in japan
abstract: background dedicator of cytokinesis dock deficiency mim is a rare disease lead to a combined primary immunodeficiency pid and account for the autosomal recessivehyper immunoglobulin e syndrome arhies dock deficiency status characterizes by recurrent infection atopy and risk of cancer lymphoproliferative disease complicating pid is difficult to diagnose our aim is to present a rare case of pid and to the best of our knowledge she is the first case of dock deficiency from iraq the genetic diagnosis wa carried out in japan using dried blood spotbased dna transfer and wholeexome sequencing case presentation an yearold iraqi girl of double firstcousinparents had a history of severe eczema food allergy and repeated infection she presented with a jaw mass bilateral cervical and axillary lymphadenopathy and immunoglobulin ig assay of and fold above maximum normal level for age of ige iga and igg respectively along with a low igm eosinophilia and lymphopenia based on the jaw mass biopsy nonhodgkin lymphoma wa suggested in iraq whereas histopathological reevaluation in japan revealed the diagnosis of a polyclonal reactive proliferation spectrum of lymphoproliferative disordersplasmacytic hyperplasia complicating pid wholeexome sequencing supported the diagnosis of pid by identifying a homozygous dock mutation with previously reported pathogenicity nmcdelt ppheleufs that may be attributed to consanguinity conclusion international collaboration using an effective dna transportation technique and nextgeneration sequencing wa the key to pinpoint the diagnosis of dock deficiency our case asserted that careful pathogenetic evaluation in an advanced setting wa crucial for ruling out the neoplastic process pediatrician in area with a high prevalence of consanguinity marriage should have a high index of suspicion of dock deficiency in patient with recalcitrant eczema and frequent respiratory and skin infectious episode
label: Cancer
combined_text: dock mutation diagnosed using wholeexome sequencing of the dried blood spotderived dna a case report of an iraqi girl diagnosed in japan background dedicator of cytokinesis dock deficiency mim is a rare disease lead to a combined primary immunodeficiency pid and account for the autosomal recessivehyper immunoglobulin e syndrome arhies dock deficiency status characterizes by recurrent infection atopy and risk of cancer lymphoproliferative disease complicating pid is difficult to diagnose our aim is to present a rare case of pid and to the best of our knowledge she is the first case of dock deficiency from iraq the genetic diagnosis wa carried out in japan using dried blood spotbased dna transfer and wholeexome sequencing case presentation an yearold iraqi girl of double firstcousinparents had a history of severe eczema food allergy and repeated infection she presented with a jaw mass bilateral cervical and axillary lymphadenopathy and immunoglobulin ig assay of and fold above maximum normal level for age of ige iga and igg respectively along with a low igm eosinophilia and lymphopenia based on the jaw mass biopsy nonhodgkin lymphoma wa suggested in iraq whereas histopathological reevaluation in japan revealed the diagnosis of a polyclonal reactive proliferation spectrum of lymphoproliferative disordersplasmacytic hyperplasia complicating pid wholeexome sequencing supported the diagnosis of pid by identifying a homozygous dock mutation with previously reported pathogenicity nmcdelt ppheleufs that may be attributed to consanguinity conclusion international collaboration using an effective dna transportation technique and nextgeneration sequencing wa the key to pinpoint the diagnosis of dock deficiency our case asserted that careful pathogenetic evaluation in an advanced setting wa crucial for ruling out the neoplastic process pediatrician in area with a high prevalence of consanguinity marriage should have a high index of suspicion of dock deficiency in patient with recalcitrant eczema and frequent respiratory and skin infectious episode

title: stk pgw a novel mutation detected in a case of msi high mixed medullarymucinous carcinoma of the transverse colon
abstract: backgroundaim to report a case of mixed medullarymucinous adenocarcinoma with unusual mutational gene profile patient and method a yearold female wa diagnosed with a colorectal carcinoma of the transverse colon the diagnostic workup of this case included thorough clinicopathological evaluation immunohistochemistry and next generation sequencing result the clinicopathological evaluation showed a tumor with morphological feature of both medullary and mucinous colorectal carcinoma immunohistochemistry revealed the loss of dna mismatch repair protein ng showed that the medullary component of this tumor had a novel stk pgw mutation which wa not present in the mucinous component both the medullary and mucinous component also had braf ve and akt pek mutation conclusion we report a novel mutation stk pgw in medullary carcinoma of the colon with an associated mucinous component
label: Cancer

title: identification of flt and npm mutation in patient with acute myeloid leukaemia
abstract: objective the most frequent acquired molecular abnormality and important prognostic indicator in patientswith acute myeloid leukaemia aml are fmslike tyrosine kinase gene flt and nucleophosmin npmmutations our study aim to develop a cost effective and comprehensive inhouse conventional pcr method fordetection of fltitd fltd and npm mutation and to evaluate the frequency of these mutation in patientswith cytogenetically normal cn aml in our population method a total of sample from aml patient woman men were included in the study mutation analysis were performed using polymerase chain reactionpcr and gene sequencing result sixtyeight patient were positive for the mutation fltitd mutation weredetected in patient followed by fltd in and npm in double mutation ofnpm and fltitd were detected in case assay validation were performed using sanger sequencingand showed concordance with in house method conclusion the optimized inhouse pcr assay for thedetection of fltitd fltd and npm mutation in aml patient were robust less labour intensive and costeffective these assay can be used a diagnostic tool for mutation detection in aml patient since identification ofthese mutation are important for prognostication and optimization of patient care
label: Cancer

title: braf nonve mutated metastatic colorectal cancer in a young patient discussion from a case report
abstract: we report the case of a yearold man with a caecal adenocarcinoma with major lymph node extension and peritoneal carcinomatosis presenting a brafke mutation a triplet fu plus oxaliplatin plus irinotecan combination with bevacizumab achieved tumor control but the disease progressed immediately after cessation and the patient died month after the diagnosis a short review of braf nonve mutation show that outcome and clinical feature depend on the mutation
label: Cancer
combined_text: braf nonve mutated metastatic colorectal cancer in a young patient discussion from a case report we report the case of a yearold man with a caecal adenocarcinoma with major lymph node extension and peritoneal carcinomatosis presenting a brafke mutation a triplet fu plus oxaliplatin plus irinotecan combination with bevacizumab achieved tumor control but the disease progressed immediately after cessation and the patient died month after the diagnosis a short review of braf nonve mutation show that outcome and clinical feature depend on the mutation

title: leveraging the role of the metastatic associated protein anterior gradient homologue in unfolded protein degradation a novel therapeutic biomarker for cancer
abstract: effective diagnostic prognostic and therapeutic biomarkers can help in tracking disease progress predict patient survival and considerably affect the drive for successful clinical management the present review aim to determine how the metastaticlinked protein anterior gradient homologue agr operates to affect cancer progression and to identify associated potential diagnostic prognostic and therapeutic biomarkers particularly in central nervous system cns tumor study that show a high expression level of agr and associate the protein expression with the resilience to chemotherapeutic treatment or with poor cancer survival are reported the primary protein structure of the seven variant of agr including their functional domain are summarized based on experiment in various biological model this review show an orchestra of multiple molecule that regulate agr expression including a feedback loop with p the agrassociated molecular function and pathway including genomic integrity proliferation apoptosis angiogenesis adhesion migration stemness and inflammation are detailed in addition the mechanism that can enable the rampant oncogenic effect of agr are clarified the different strategy used to therapeutically target agrpositive cancer cell are evaluated in light of the current evidence moreover novel associated pathway and clinically relevant deregulated gene in agr high cns tumor are identified using a metaanalysis approach
label: Cancer

title: identification of novel pathogenic msh mutation and new dna repair gene variant investigation of a tunisian lynch syndrome family with discordant twin
abstract: background lynch syndrome l is a highly penetrant inherited cancer predisposition syndrome characterized by autosomal dominant inheritance and germline mutation in dna mismatch repair gene despite several genetic variation that have been identified in various population the penetrance is highly variable and the reason for this have not been fully elucidated this study investigates whether besides pathogenic mutation environment and low penetrance genetic risk factor may result in phenotype modification in a tunisian l family patient and method a tunisian family with strong colorectal cancer crc history that fulfill the amsterdam i criterion for the diagnosis of lynch syndrome wa proposed for oncogenetic counseling the index case wa a man diagnosed at the age of year with crc he ha a monozygotic twin diagnosed at the age of year with crohn disease fortyseven yearsold wa the onset age of his paternal uncle withcrc an immunohistochemical ihc labeling for the four protein mlh msh msh and pm of the mismatchrepair mmr system wa performed for the index case a targeted sequencing of msh mlh and a panel of dna repair gene wa performed for the index case and for his unaffected father result the ihc result showed a loss of msh but not mlh msh and pm protein expression genomic dna screening by targeted dna repair gene sequencing revealed an msh pathogenic mutation cct pqx confirmed by sanger sequencing this mutation wa suspected to be a causal mutation associated to the loss of msh expression and it wa found in first and second degree relative the index case ha smoking and alcohol consumption habit moreover he harbor extensive genetic variation in other dnarepair gene not shared with his unaffected father conclusion in our investigated tunisian family we confirmed the l by ihc molecular and in silico investigation we identified a novel pathogenic mutation described for the first time in tunisia these result come enriching the previously reported pathogenic mutation in l family our study brings new argument to the interpretation of mmr expression pattern and highlight new risk modifier gene eventually implicated in crc twin discordance reported in this work underscore that disease penetrance could be influenced by both genetic background and environmental factor

title: case report mutation analysis of primary pulmonary lymphoepitheliomalike carcinoma via wholeexome sequencing
abstract: background primary pulmonary lymphoepitheliomalike carcinoma lelc is a rare tumor subtype accounting for around of lung cancer at present research on lelc mainly focus on pathological diagnosis while the molecular mutation landscape is still unclear case presentation a yearold female presented a productive cough for three week followed by severe symptom for another week respiratory sound were weak and coarser in the right lung field ffdg petcta showed a hypermetabolic mass in the upper lobe of the right lung a well a the enlargement of right hilar and subcarinal lymph node hematoxylineosin staining and immunohistochemistry staining of the biopsy established the diagnosis of primary pulmonary lelc after thoracoscopicassisted radical resection of right lung cancer and middle lobe of right lung the patient vital sign were stable without apparent productive cough chest pain chest tightness and other subjective discomfort furtherwhole exome sequencing of the patient tumor tissue and leukocyte served a a germline mutation control revealed somatic gene mutation and of which mutation in prim kcnb cdh and atrx were most likely related to the lelc pathogenesis the recurrence of gene mutation from various cancer database and a tumor mutation burden tmb of mutationsmb were revealed a well conclusion our finding have illustrated the genomic profile of a primary pulmonary lelc case and provided a positive biomarker that immune checkpoint blockade is potentially effective for this patient in further treatment
label: Cancer

title: molecular classification of endometrial carcinoma applied to endometrial biopsy specimen towards early personalized patient management
abstract: background the current risk stratification system used to guide management of endometrial cancer are based on irreproducible post surgical pathological information hence the need for more reliable classification system using microarray and sequencing technology tcga recently identified four prognostically significant endometrial carcinoma subtypes which subsequently proved reproducible using clinically applicable surrogate test using these test we sought to determine the level of concordance between endometrial biopsy and subsequent hysterectomy specimen in assessing the molecular classification of endometrial carcinoma material and method fifty biopsy with corresponding hysterectomy specimen for endometrial carcinoma were collected additionally case of biopsy proven atypical hyperplasiaein who were found to have endometrial carcinoma on resection were included ihc for mismatch repair mmr protein mlh pm msh and msh and p wa performed microsatellite instability analysis wa performed by pcr and sanger sequencing wa performed to detect mutation in exon and of the pole gene the level of concordance for tumor grade histologic subtype immunohistochemical and molecular profile in both specimen wa determined using cohens kappa estimate result a high level of concordance wa achieved for mmrloss msihigh pwild and abnormal type in contrast grade and histologic subtype showed only moderate level of agreement pole gene mutation wa detected in two patient for both case mutation were detected only in resection specimen when comparing atypical hyperplasiaein with subsequent hysterectomy tumor the profile wa identical to that of endometrial carcinoma conclusion in our cohort of endometrial carcinoma a high level of concordance wa achieved between biopsy and hysterectomy specimen for mmrloss msihigh pwild and abnormal type superior to that of grade and histologic subtype providing earlier and more reliable prognostic information to inform management similar concordance could not be achieved for pole mutation given the low frequency of this mutation in our study

title: blastic variant of plasma cell myeloma mimicking squamous cell carcinoma of the uterine cervix in a supermorbidly obese female
abstract: plasmablastic plasma cell myeloma of the cervix can mimic the more common cervical squamous cell carcinoma it can be difficult to differentiate plasmablastic lymphoma of the cervix from cervical plasmablastic plasma cell myeloma the clinician must rely on clinical laboratory and radiologic finding to diagnose genital plasma cell myeloma prompt diagnosis of this rare clinical condition can potentially allow timely treatment with systemic chemotherapy
label: Cancer

title: a longterm survivor of pediatric midline glioma with hfa km and braf ve double mutation
abstract: we report a case of yearold female with lateral ventricular glioma harboring both hfa km and braf ve mutation by the methylation analysis the tumor wa classified a a diffuse midline glioma h km mutant who grade iv however the tumor wa pathologically lowgrade and likely localized rather than diffusely infiltrating further the patient ha survived more than year after gross total resection of the tumor whereas both hfa km and braf ve have been reported a poor prognostic marker in pediatric glioma our case along with several other reported case suggests that the coexistence of these two mutation might not indicate poor prognosis the case emphasizes the importance of comprehensive assessment based on pathological genetic and clinical finding and call for further investigation of nondiffuse glioma with hfa km and glioma with hfa km and braf ve
label: Cancer

title: safe neoadjuvant trastuzumabbased treatment in her inflammatory early breast cancer in a glucose phosphate dehydrogenasedeficient postmenopausal woman a case report and review of the literature
abstract: introduction glucose phosphate dehydrogenase gpd is a basic antioxidant pathway for erythrocyte being it deficiency the most common gene mutation worldwide a breast cancer is one of the most frequent tumor many of these patient may present with gpd deficiency prior treatment without notice case report we present the case of a woman deficient for gpd with the diagnosis of stage iiib ctd cn cm herenriched early breast cancer management and outcome the patient underwent neoadjuvance with trastuzumab and anthracyclinefree chemotherapy based on docetaxel mgm mg and carboplatin auc mg she did not present hemolytic crisis and no blood transfusion were needed she achieved a good pathologic response and completed oneyear adjuvant trastuzumab without incidence discussion although the role of her and trastuzumab in oxidative stress is not yet completely understood we suggest that trastuzumab may be a suitable agent for treatment in patient with herenriched breast cancer in a nonoxidative chemotherapy scheme with acceptable response and no triggering hemolytic crisis

title: multiple endocrine neoplasia type men an update and the significance of early genetic and clinical diagnosis
abstract: multiple endocrine neoplasia type men is a rare hereditary tumor syndrome inherited in an autosomal dominant manner and characterized by a predisposition to a multitude of endocrine neoplasm primarily of parathyroid enteropancreatic and anterior pituitary origin a well a nonendocrine neoplasm other endocrine tumor in men include foregut carcinoid tumor adrenocortical tumor and rarely pheochromocytoma nonendocrine manifestation include meningioma and ependymomas lipoma angiofibromas collagenomas and leiomyoma men is caused by inactivating mutation of the tumor suppressor gene men which encodes the protein menin this syndrome can affect all age group with of patient developing menassociated tumor before year of age despite advance in the diagnosis and treatment of menassociated tumor patient with men continue to have decreased life expectancy primarily due to malignant neuroendocrine tumor the most recent clinical practice guideline for men published in highlight the need for early genetic and clinical diagnosis of men and recommend an intensive surveillance approach for both patient with this syndrome and asymptomatic carrier starting at the age of year with the goal of timely detection and management of menassociated neoplasm and ultimately decreased diseasespecific morbidity and mortality unfortunately there is no clear genotypephenotype correlation and individual mutationdependent surveillance is not possible currently
label: Cancer

title: challenge in managing patient with hereditary cancer at gynecological service
abstract: aim to reveal current problem and challenge faced by our gynecologic service department in managing patient with hereditary cancer method we collected clinical data of patient with hereditary cancer identified via genetic testing or clinically diagnosed in case of cowden syndrome or peutzjeghers syndrome and treated in our gynecological department from to result fifteen patient had hereditary breast and ovarian cancer hboc had lynch syndrome had cowden syndrome and had peutzjeghers syndrome five patient diagnosed with hboc were younger than year at diagnosis riskreducing salpingooophorectomy rrso wa performed on patient with a brca mutation at age year seven patient overall underwent rrso and none had malignancy on pathological examination peritoneal washing cytology pwc wa suspicious for malignancy in one patient however subsequent pwc at month after rrso wa negative a patient with endometrial cancer and lynch syndrome and a patient with atypical endometrial hyperplasia aeh and cowden syndrome strongly desired fertility preservation they achieved remission after medroxyprogesterone acetate treatment and multiple dilation and curettage respectively one patient with lynch syndrome developed aeh after year of surveillance laparotomy revealed adjacent lowgrade and highgrade serous ovarian cancer with positive ascites cytology she had no recurrence during year followup after laparotomy conclusion managing patient with hereditary cancer positive or falsepositive ascites cytology discovered during rrso and desired preservation of fertility is highly challenging

title: prognostic and predictive significance of kit protein expression and ckit gene mutation in canine cutaneous mast cell tumour a consensus of the oncologypathology working group
abstract: one of the primary objective of the oncologypathology working group opwg a joint initiative of the veterinary cancer society and the american college of veterinary pathologist is for oncologist and pathologist to collaboratively generate consensus document to standardize aspect of and provide guideline for oncologic pathology consensus is established through critical review of peerreviewed literature relevant to a subgroup particular focus subsequent acceptance and approval of the document by the opwg membership at large establishes consensus the intent of this publication is to help educate practitioner and pathologist on the value of diagnostics related to the kit receptor tyrosine kinase for canine cutaneous mast cell tumour and to provide a guide for the use of these test in veterinary medicine this document represents the opinion of the opwg and the author and doe not constitute a formal endorsement by the american college of veterinary pathologist or the veterinary cancer society
label: Cancer

title: renal cell carcinoma with a mesenchymal stromal component what do we know so far
abstract: a subset of renal cell neoplasm contains a mesenchymal stromal component often resembling smooth muscle to date it remains debated whether these represent one or more distinct pathological entity the foremost of these renal cell carcinoma with angioleiomyomalike stroma also known a smooth muscle or leiomyomatous stroma ha some distinctive feature including immunohistochemical positivity for cytokeratin and often a lack of genetic change of clear cell renal cell carcinoma it is debated whether this is related to the much more common clear cell papillary renal cell carcinoma owing to the substantial similarity of their immunohistochemical phenotype the term renal angiomyoadenomatous tumour ha been used by some author in this context but this is a source of controversy with some believing it is synonymous with clear cell papillary renal cell carcinoma smooth musclerich renal cancer appear to be enriched in tuberous sclerosis complex patient but it is likely that these occur sporadically also recently renal cell carcinoma with tceb mutation and monosomy of chromosome have also been reported these have been noted to have fibromuscular stroma and cytokeratin reactivity however absence of these genetic alteration in renal cell carcinoma with smooth muscle stroma suggests that this represents only one of likely several entity other uncommon pattern of renal neoplasm such a clear cell renal cell carcinoma with degenerative fibrosis or haemangiomalike change mixed epithelial and stromal tumour with epithelial proliferation angiomyolipoma with epithelial cyst renal cell carcinoma with associated angiomyolipoma and sarcomatoid renal cell carcinoma may cause diagnostic challenge for the pathologist although knowledge of renal cell carcinoma with a stromal component ha dramatically increased recently further study is necessary to understand the molecular pathology of these tumour and if they have implication for inherited tumour syndrome

title: melanotic schwannoma of the vulva a case report and review of the literature
abstract: melanotic schwannoma is a pigmented tumor of peripheral nerve differentiation primary cutaneous presentation are extremely rare a the bulk of melanotic schwannomas tend to develop in paraspinal and axial site tumor arise sporadically and in the setting of the carney complex alteration in the gene encoding protein kinase a regulatory subunitalpha prkara underlie most patient with the carney complex and mediate melanotic schwannoma tumorigenesis melanotic schwannomas from noncutaneous site can locally recur and metastasize widely leading to a recent proposal to change the nomenclature to malignant melanotic schwannian tumor however the clinicopathologic feature of primary cutaneous melanotic schwannomas are relatively unexplored we present a case of a nodule arising on the vulva of a yearold woman microscopically a dermalbased heavily pigmented proliferation of plump spindled and epithelioid cell arrayed in nodule and fascicle wa seen lesional cell stained positively for s melana and bap but were negative for prkaralpha nextgeneration sequencing of a panel of cancerassociated gene revealed that the tumor harbored a prkara psf truncating mutation and copy neutral loss of heterozygosity of chromosome q the locus at which prkara resides importantly no other genetic abnormality or chromosomal copy number change were identified on the basis of combined histopathologic immunohistochemical and genetic feature a diagnosis of melanotic schwannoma wa rendered overall we present the first clinicopathologic description of a vulvar melanotic schwannoma review the literature concerning cutaneous presentation of melanotic schwannoma and propose that melanotic schwannian tumor native to skin may behave more indolently than their noncutaneous counterpart
label: Cancer

title: longterm survival of a patient with inoperable gastric cancer with distant lymph node metastasisa case report
abstract: a yearold female patient wa diagnosed with inoperable gastric cancer with distant lymph node metastasisctnm lym cstage iv for which she received s chemotherapyorally administered on day ofa day course the patient received a total of treatment course after an initial phase of stable disease due to chemotherapy she eventually showed progressive disease s chemotherapy wa discontinued because ofher social background she decided against any further chemotherapy after year she underwent metallic stent insertion through the gastric cancer which enabled her to consume food she is currently alive a of year and month from the date of first diagnosis

title: a case of sigmoid colon cancer with complete visceral inversion
abstract: complete visceral inversion occurs in individual in of case complete visceral inversion is complicated by the malformation of other organ careful attention is required when performing surgery in recent year with the development of laparoscopic surgery some case of laparoscopic surgery with complete visceral inversion have been reported herein we report a case of safely performed laparoscopic surgery for sigmoid colon cancer with complete visceral inversion along with a relevant discussion

title: sarcomatoid carcinoma after radiotherapy for earlystage oral squamous cell carcinoma case report
abstract: rationale sarcomatoid carcinoma is a rare variant of squamous cell carcinoma scc with poor prognosis previous radiation ha been reported a one of the etiologic factor patient concern we describe a case of a yearold man presented with a painless mass in the left supraclavicular area five year before he wa diagnosed with scc in floor of mouth fom and underwent radiotherapy rt diagnosis sonographyguided biopsy on the supraclavicular lymph node revealed diffuse spindle cell proliferation with a focus of squamous differentiation local recurrence on primary site or distant metastasis wa not obvious on both computed tomography ct of the neck and ffluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography ct the final diagnosis wa confirmed a sarcomatoid carcinoma via surgery intervention the patient underwent surgery including explorative resection of the mouth floor excision of the submandibular gland and modified radical neck dissection following surgery the patient received adjuvant radiation therapy outcome there were no complication according to the surgery six month after adjuvant therapy distant metastasis to liver wa identified the patient is currently undergoing palliative chemotherapy lesson this may be the first reported case of sarcomatoid carcinoma arising from earlystage scc in fom that wa previously treated with rt alone when rt is performed a a single modality for oral scc even in an early stage rigorous followup should be performed
label: Cancer
combined_text: sarcomatoid carcinoma after radiotherapy for earlystage oral squamous cell carcinoma case report rationale sarcomatoid carcinoma is a rare variant of squamous cell carcinoma scc with poor prognosis previous radiation ha been reported a one of the etiologic factor patient concern we describe a case of a yearold man presented with a painless mass in the left supraclavicular area five year before he wa diagnosed with scc in floor of mouth fom and underwent radiotherapy rt diagnosis sonographyguided biopsy on the supraclavicular lymph node revealed diffuse spindle cell proliferation with a focus of squamous differentiation local recurrence on primary site or distant metastasis wa not obvious on both computed tomography ct of the neck and ffluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography ct the final diagnosis wa confirmed a sarcomatoid carcinoma via surgery intervention the patient underwent surgery including explorative resection of the mouth floor excision of the submandibular gland and modified radical neck dissection following surgery the patient received adjuvant radiation therapy outcome there were no complication according to the surgery six month after adjuvant therapy distant metastasis to liver wa identified the patient is currently undergoing palliative chemotherapy lesson this may be the first reported case of sarcomatoid carcinoma arising from earlystage scc in fom that wa previously treated with rt alone when rt is performed a a single modality for oral scc even in an early stage rigorous followup should be performed

title: the cancer genome atlas of renal cell carcinoma finding and clinical implication
abstract: the cancer genome atlas tcga characterized the somatic genetic and genomic alteration in renal cell carcinoma rcc encompassing the major rcc histological subtypes including clear cell rcc ccrcc papillary rcc prcc and chromophobe rcc chrcc unique distinguishing feature were found between the rcc subtypes including in chromosomal alteration and tumour metabolism a well a within each rcc subtype of which some correlated with difference in patient survival two new rcc subtypes were defined by distinct epigenetic and metabolic pathway expression pattern the hypermethylated cpg island methylator phenotypeassociated cimp rccs and metabolically divergent chrccs and new biomarkers of poor patient outcome were identified including pbrm mutation in type prcc and cdkna loss in chrcc expression of many immune cell genespecific signature wa increased in ccrcc compared with prcc and chrcc and expression of select signature including the type t helper cell signature wa increased in cimp rcc increased expression of the type t helper cell signature correlated with poorer survival in ccrcc prcc and chrcc in addition to improving our current understanding of rcc tcga rcc study are an invaluable resource that provides the foundation for the development of improved method for diagnosis treatment and prevention of this disease
label: Cancer

title: molecular genetics in the diagnosis and biology of lymphoid neoplasm
abstract: objective the workshop of the society for hematopathologyeuropean association for haematopathology reviewed the role of molecular genetics in the diagnosis and biology of lymphoid neoplasm method the workshop panel reviewed case result molecular genetic testing reveals alteration that expand the spectrum of disease such a dusp rearrangement in alknegative anaplastic large cell lymphoma large bcell lymphoma with irf rearrangement myd mutation in bcell lymphoma burkittlike lymphoma with q aberration and diagnostic criterion for highgrade bcell lymphoma therapeutic agent and natural tumor progression may be associated with transcriptional reprogramming that lead to transdifferentiation and lineage switch conclusion application of emerging technical advance ha revealed the complexity of genetic event in lymphomagenesis progression and acquired resistance to therapy they also contribute to enhanced understanding of the biology of indolent v aggressive behavior clonal evolution tumor progression and transcriptional reprogramming associated with transdifferentiation event that may occur subsequent to therapy

title: novel noninvasive diagnostics
abstract: molecular diagnostics have revolutionized human oncology to allow early detection targeted therapy monitoring throughout treatment and evidence of recurrence by identifying genetic signature associated with cancer liquid biopsy technique have been developed to diagnose and monitor cancer in noninvasive or minimally invasive way these technique offer new opportunity for improving cancer screening diagnosis and monitoring the impact of therapy on the patient over time liquid biopsy also drive drug development program similar diagnostics hold promise for comparable result in the veterinary field several noninvasiveminimally invasive technique have been described in veterinary medicine that could be referred to a liquid biopsy

title: bcl bcl and mycpositive intravascular large bcell lymphoma presenting with bilateral adrenal gland lesion
abstract: primary adrenal lymphoma is a rare lymphoma accounting for of nonhodgkin lymphoma the leading histopathological subtype of adrenal lymphoma is diffuse large bcell lymphoma and intravascular large bcell lymphoma ivlbcl is rare here we report a case of ivlbcl occurrence a a bilateral adrenal gland tumor which wa diagnosed by ctguided biopsy tumor cell were positive for cd and mum but not for cd on immunostaining suggesting nongerminal center bcell subtype lymphoma in addition the triple expression of bcl bcl and myc wa demonstrated on tumor cell the bone marrow examination revealed the involvement of lymphoma cell but not hemophagocytosis the chromosomal analysis revealed complex karyotypic abnormality without a rearrangement of bcl or myc using fish analysis although the patient responded to rchop chemotherapy he developed central nervous system involvement by lymphoma to date the significance of the triple expression of bcl bcl and myc without gene translocation remains partially elucidated therefore an accumulation of similar case is needed to elucidate the pathogenesis and clinical significance of the triple expression of these oncoproteins
label: Cancer

title: genetic analysis of japanese patient with fanconi anemia novel finding
abstract: fanconi anemia fa is an inherited bone marrow failure syndrome characterized by multiple congenital abnormality progressive bone marrow failure and a predisposition to malignancy resulting from mutation in one of the known fanc gene from fanca to fancw the protein encoded by these gene participate in a deoxyribonucleic acid interstrand crosslink repair pathway the socalled fabrca pathway the fanc gene include hereditary breast and ovarian cancer susceptibility gene such a brca or brca patient with fa display a wide range of clinical phenotype owing to the genetic heterogeneity of the disease therefore the molecular diagnosis is critical for the appropriate management of such patient recently we successfully subtyped of the japanese patient with fa and identified mutant allele through a comprehensive strategy in this review the characteristic of genetic subtyping and mutated fanc gene variant in japanese patient with fa and the genotypephenotype correlation in fa are summarized in addition the carrier frequency of pathogenic fanc gene and risk of cancer among the fanc gene mutation carrier in general japanese population are discussed
label: Cancer

title: mesothelioma scientific clue for prevention diagnosis and therapy
abstract: mesothelioma affect mostly older individual who have been occupationally exposed to asbestos the global mesothelioma incidence and mortality rate are unknown because data are not available from developing country that continue to use large amount of asbestos the incidence rate of mesothelioma ha decreased in australia the united state and western europe where the use of asbestos wa banned or strictly regulated in the s and s demonstrating the value of these preventive measure however in these same country the overall number of death from mesothelioma ha not decreased a the size of the population and the percentage of old people have increased moreover hotspot of mesothelioma may occur when carcinogenic fiber that are present in the environment are disturbed a rural area are being developed novel immunohistochemical and molecular marker have improved the accuracy of diagnosis however about highresource country to developing country of mesothelioma diagnosis are incorrect resulting in inadequate treatment and complicating epidemiological study the discovery that germline brcaasssociated protein bap mutation cause mesothelioma and other cancer bap cancer syndrome elucidated some of the key pathogenic mechanism and treatment targeting these molecular mechanism andor modulating the immune response are being tested the role of surgery in pleural mesothelioma is controversial a it is difficult to predict who will benefit from aggressive management even when local therapy are added to existing or novel systemic treatment treatment outcome are improving however for peritoneal mesothelioma multidisciplinary international collaboration will be necessary to improve prevention early detection and treatment
label: Cancer

title: lynch syndrome with exclusive skin involvement time to consider a molecular definition
abstract: muirtorre syndrome mt is clinically characterized by the occurrence of skin usually sebaceous and visceral tumor in the same individual the most common underlying mechanism is a constitutional defect of the mismatch repair mmr gene that cause lynch syndrome l herewithin we report on a yearsold male patient heterozygous for a pathogenic msh missense substitution who presented with a striking cutaneous phenotype in the absence of typical l visceral tumor the patient developed skin tumor including sebaceous adenomascarcinomas and keratoacanthoma two skin tumor showed immunohistochemical loss of msh and msh expression there wa no apparent family history of neoplasia based on the variable involvement of the skin and internal organ we suggest that the definition of tumor association that are often observed a variant of inherited tumor syndrome such a mt should be guided by the underlying molecular base in addition the presence of multiple sebaceous tumor especially if showing mmr deficiency appears to be a very strong indicator of a constitutional mmr gene defect the reason underlying the high phenotypic variability of cutaneous phenotype associated with constitutional mmr defect are yet to be determined
label: Cancer

title: double heterozygous mutation in the brca and atm gene involved in development of primary metachronous tumour a case report
abstract: purpose between and of case of breast cancer bc are attributable to a genetic susceptibility the brca and brca gene described in the late s are associated with an increased risk of breast and ovarian cancer and the clinical management of carrier of pathogenic variant in these gene is defined in several clinical guideline paluchshimon et al in ann oncol suppl vv llort et al in clin transl oncol however the pathogenic variant in brca and brca represent only a third of the cause of hereditary bc easton et al in n engl j med the incorporation of ng next generation sequencing technique in the genetic diagnosis of this pathology in addition to minimising the cost and time of analysis allows the simultaneous study of other gene of high and moderate penetrance easton et al in n engl j med op cit tung et al in cancer to date there are not many case or series of patient that describe the cooccurrence of two pathogenic variant in these gene of bc case of double heterozygosis have been described with the presence of pathogenic variant in brca brca palb chek blm or nbn nomizu et al in breast cancer heidemann et al in breast cancer re treat zuradelli et al in breast cancer re treat sokolenko et al in breast cancer re treat method we report the case of a patient diagnosed with multiple tumour who presented two pathogenic variant in heterozygosis result two pathogenic variant cc a palaglu in the brca gene and cc t pargx in the atm gene were detected in heterozygosis said variant were confirmed by sangertype sequencing using specific primer conclusion the implementation of gene panel using ng in the study of hereditary cancer involves the detection of heterozygous double mutation in gene of high and moderate penetrance for cancer although with a low frequency
label: Cancer

title: elevated nmethyltransferase expression induced by hepatic stellate cell contributes to the metastasis of hepatocellular carcinoma via regulation of the cdv isoform
abstract: the crosstalk between hepatic stellate cell hscs and hepatic carcinoma cell contributes to hepatocellular carcinoma hcc progression but the underlying mechanism is largely unknown we report here that activated hscs induce upregulation of nicotinamide nmethyltransferase nnmt which is known to regulate multiple metabolic pathway in hepatoma cell of the liver high level of nnmt in hcc tissue were positively correlated with vascular invasion increased serum hbvdna level and distant metastasis in addition functional assay showed that nnmt promoted hcc cell invasion and metastasis by altering the histone h methylation on methylation pattern and transcriptionally activating cluster of differentiation cd nnmtmediated nmethyladenosine modification of cd mrna resulted in the formation of a cdv splice variant while it product methylnicotinamide stabilized cd protein by preventing ubiquitinmediated degradation finally nnmt wa also shown to be a target of statin that inhibited metastasis of hepatoma cell taken together our study show for the first time that the nnmtcdv axis regulates hcc metastasis and present nnmt a a promising prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target for hcc
label: Cancer

title: p major hotspot variant are associated with poorer prognostic feature in hereditary cancer patient
abstract: tp pathogenic germline variation is associated with the multicancer predisposition lifraumeni syndrome lf nextgeneration sequencing and multigene panel testing are highlighting variability in the clinical presentation of patient with tp positive result we aimed to investigate if the p variant considered a major hotspot at both germline and somatic level parghis pglyasp pglyser parggln pargtrp pargcys parghis and pargtrp were associated with poorer prognostic feature compared to other pathogenic missense variant in the dnabinding domain to do so we assessed clinical feature from carrier of germline tp pathogenic variant probands and relative from three independent datasets iarc tp database ambry single gene testing and ambry multigene panel testing we observed that compared to carrier of nonhotspot germline variant individual that carried a hotspot germline variant were more likely to present with a classic lf phenotype earlier age of first breast cancer onset and shorter time to diagnosis to any cancer further study with larger datasets addressing difference in cancer phenotype by genotype are thus needed to replicate our finding and consider variant effect and position towards future personalized clinical management of pathogenic variant carrier
label: Cancer

title: hereditary breast and ovarian cancer syndrome
abstract: recently olaparibbrand name lynparza tabletsa parp inhibitorhas been approved for national health insurance coverage in japan a a drug for unresectable or recurrent brcapositive hernegative breast cancer in patient with a history of cancer chemotherapy the addition of brca genetic testing a a companion diagnostic tool to the health insurance coverage is of considerable significance a a spearhead of health insurance medical care for all different type of hereditary tumor however several problem related to this companion diagnostic test have emerged including the estab lishment of a genetic counseling system and handling of brca genetic test performed at the patient own expense in addition the purpose of the companion diagnostic test is to confirm drug indication in a case however since the test result include the diagnosis of hereditary tumor there is also an urgent need to improve the medical care system and social environment for family member of patient with pathological mutation the use of genetic analysis is widespread in the clinical setting and genetic medical care is anticipated to advance in the future therefore it would be pivotal to come up with measure against hereditary tumor such a hereditary breast and ovarian cancerhbocsyndrome in this chapter we describe the current status and prospect of hboc medical care with a particular focus on companion diagnostics

title: immune checkpoint inhibitor treatment in patient with oncogene addicted nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc summary of a multidisciplinary roundtable discussion
abstract: the introduction of targeted treatment and more recently immune checkpoint inhibitor ici to the treatment of metastatic nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc ha dramatically changed the prognosis of selected patient for patient with oncogeneaddicted metastatic nsclc harbouring an epidermal growth factor receptor egfr or vraf murine sarcoma viral oncogene homologue b braf mutation or an anaplastic lymphoma kinase alk or ro protooncogene receptor tyrosine kinase ro gene alteration translocation fusion amplification mutationspecific tyrosine kinase inhibitor tki are already firstline standard treatment while targeted treatment for other driver mutation affecting met ret human epidermal growth factor receptor her tropomyosin receptor kinase trk and others are currently under investigation the role of ici in these patient subgroup is currently under debate this article summarises a roundtable discussion organised by esmo open in vienna in july it review current clinical data on ici treatment in patient with metastatic oncogeneaddicted nsclc and discusses molecular diagnostic assessment potential biomarkers and radiological method for response evaluation of ici treatment the roundtable panel concluded ici should only be considered in patient with oncogeneaddicted nsclc after exhaustion of effective targeted therapy and in some case possibly after all other therapy including chemotherapy more clinical trial on combination therapy and biomarkers for ici therapy based on the specific differing characteristic of oncogeneaddicted nsclc need to be conducted
label: Cancer

title: genomic landscape and it correlation with tumor mutational burden pdl expression and immune cell infiltration in chinese lung squamous cell carcinoma
abstract: introduction to depict the genomic landscape of chinese earlystage lung squamous cell carcinoma lusc and investigate it correlation with tumor mutation burden tmb pdl expression and immune infiltrates method wholeexome sequencing wa performed on surgically resected lusc tmb wa defined a the sum of nonsynonymous single nucleotide and indel variant cd tumorinfiltrating lymphocyte til density and pdl expression were evaluated by immunohistochemistry six immune infiltrates were estimated using an online database result the median tmb wa mutation per megabase positive pdl expression and cd tils density were identified in and pikca amplification wa associated with significantly higher tmb p frequent genetic alteration had no impact on pdl expression but pikca amplification and keap mutation were independently associated with significantly lower cd til density p p respectively low tmb and high cd til density were independently associated with longer diseasefree survival dfs while none of them could individually predict the overall survival o combination of tmb and pdl expression or tmb and cd til density could stratify total population into two group with distinct prognosis classifying tumorimmune microenvironment based on pdl expression and cd til density showed discrepant genomic alteration but similar tmb clinical feature and o notably patient with different smoking status had distinct prognostic factor conclusion the combination of tmb pdl expression immune infiltrates and smoking status showed the feasibility to subgroup stratification in chinese patient with earlystage lusc which might be helpful for future design of personalized immunotherapy trial in lusc
label: Cancer

title: dataset for the reporting of renal biopsy for tumour recommendation from the international collaboration on cancer reporting iccr
abstract: the international collaboration on cancer reporting iccr ha developed a suite of detailed datasets for international implementation these datasets are based on the reporting protocol developed by the royal college of pathologist uk the royal college of pathologist of australasia and the college of american pathologist with modification undertaken by international expert group appointed according to iccr protocol the dataset for the reporting of renal biopsy for tumour is designed to provide a structured reporting template containing minimum data recording key element suitable for international use in formulating the dataset the iccr panel incorporated recommendation from the vancouver consensus conference of the international society of urological pathology isup and the edition of the who bluebook on tumour of the urinary and male genital system reporting element were divided into required core and recommended noncore component of the report required element are a follows specimen laterality histological tumour type whoisup histological tumour grade sarcomatoid morphology rhabdoid morphology necrosis lymphovascular invasion and coexisting pathology in nonneoplastic kidney recommended reporting element are a follows operative procedure tumour site histological tumour subtype and detail of ancillary study in particular it is noted that fluorescence in situ hybridisation study may assist in diagnosing translocation renal cell carcinoma rcc and in distinguishing oncocytoma and eosinophilic chromophobe rcc it is anticipated that the implementation of this dataset into routine clinical practice will facilitate uniformity of pathology reporting worldwide this in turn should have a positive impact on patient treatment and the quality of demographic information held by cancer registry
label: Cancer

title: large nested urothelial carcinoma a clinicopathological study of case on transurethral resection material
abstract: large nested urothelial carcinoma lnuc is a recently recognized variant of urothelial carcinoma uc which is characterized with inverted growth pattern and bland cytology diagnosis can be extremely challenging especially in transurethral resection tur material haematoxylineosin stained slide of tur material with uc submitted to our department between and were reexamined twentytwo lnuc case were found lnuc frequency wa mean age wa were male mean tumor diameter wa cm noninvasive uc wa present in all case lowgrade in highgrade in low and highgrade in five and case were pt and pt respectively no invasion wa detected in one case in addition to mediumlarge nest small nest and conventional uc area wa present in and case respectively stromatumor interface wa irregular in case and case had invasive nest with rounded contour fibrous stromal reaction andor stromal lymphoid infiltration were present in case budding described a small nest in stromal interface of mediumlarge nest wa found in case followup wa available for case with an average of month four case had metastasis patient died of disease lnuc cause diagnostic difficulty especially in tur material large size of tumor irregularity of nest presence of stromal reaction and budding can be clue for correct diagnosis
label: Cancer

title: pathology of pancreatic cancer
abstract: pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma pdac is a highly aggressive malignancy and estimated to become the second leading cause of cancerrelated death by although overall year survival rate have constantly remained below for the last decade several key point important for accurate patient stratification have emerged during recent year these key point include a highly standardized gross examination of pdac resection specimen using an axial slicing technique and inking of the circumferential resection margin crm a well a a meticulous microscopic examination taking into account the prognostic relevance of factor such a the exact resection status r v r mm v r resection histopathological tumor grading and the socalled lymph node ratio lnr with increasing use of neoadjuvant therapy in pdac tumor regression grading trg for pdac is currently rising in relevance in order to stratify and manage preoperatively treated pdac patient a all current trg system for pdac are unsatisfactory new standardized international protocol are urgently needed several morphological subtypes of pdac exist some of which share the same molecular background with classical pdac while others are characterized by a distinct molecular pathogenesis while some show a prognosis similar to classical pdac other subtypes stand out due to a better or even worse prognosis than classical pdac prognostic relevant molecular subtypes of pdac have been proposed a well however limitation of used cohort and the lacking correlation of molecular subtypes with histomorphological subtypes limit the translation of these finding into valuable clinical application lastly several macroscopic and microscopic precursor lesion of pdac have been described in genetically engineered mouse model gemm and human in recent time providing further insight into pdac carcinogenesis in addition improved diagnosis of pdac precursor represents a chance to select patient for resection before invasive pdac is present
label: Cancer

patient for resection before invasive pdac is present

title: malignant phyllode tumor in lynch syndrome a case report
abstract: background lynch syndrome or hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal cancer is an autosomal dominant genetic syndrome that predisposes individual to multiple cancer type the known cancer associated with lynch syndrome include colorectal and endometrial cancer a well a cancer of the stomach ovary urinary tract hepatobiliary tract pancreas small bowel and brain there are no searchable case of malignant phyllode of the breast associated with lynch syndrome case presentation our patient wa a yearold caucasian woman who felt a lump in her left breast and wa found to have a spindle cell neoplasm definitive surgery revealed a malignant phyllode tumor on the basis of her cancer diagnosis and family history of multiple cancer a myriad myrisk hereditary cancer test panel of gene wa performed this testing revealed that she had a heterozygous msh mutation a part of the lynch syndrome panel due to positive margin the patient received adjuvant chemotherapy with doxorubicin and ifosfamide she also had a subsequent total abdominal hysterectomy and a bilateral salpingooophorectomy for risk reduction she remains in a highrisk surveillance program her family member have been tested which revealed that her two brother and daughter also carry the genetic mutation conclusion this case highlight the importance of genetic testing with rare malignancy because the full scope of phenotypic sequela for known hereditary syndrome ha not been mapped

title: complexity of pecomas diagnostic approach molecular background clinical management
abstract: perivascular epithelioid cell neoplasm pecomas are a family of mesenchymal neoplasm with feature of both melanotic and smooth muscle differentiation pecoma morphology is highly variable and encompasses epithelioid to spindle cell often with clear cytoplasm and prominent nucleolus molecularly most pecomas are defined by a loss of function of the tsctsc complex additionally a distinct small subset of pecomas harboring rearrangement of the tfe xp gene locus ha been identified by presenting a series of three case report with distinct feature we demonstrate diagnostic pitfall a well a the importance of molecular workup of pecomas because of important therapeutic consequence

title: nonmuscle invasive bladder cancer a review of the current trend in africa
abstract: bladder cancer is the fourth most common cancer in men and the th most common cancer in woman accounting for of all cancer case approximately bladder cancer are nonmuscle invasive bladder cancer nmibc a few african study have provided considerable rate of nmibc a compared to western setting to critical step in the management of nmibc is to prevent tumor recurrence which include transurethral resection of the bladder tumor turbt for staging and histological diagnosis a second turbt for high grade tumor t tumor and intravesical adjuvant chemotherapy and immunotherapy are essential to reduce recurrence rate nevertheless variant histology multiple progressive and recurrent highgrade tumor are best treated with early radical cystectomy the african literature is scanty on the management of nmibc most of the histological type are squamous cell bladder cancer and may not conform to transurethral resection only but rather radical cystectomy most of these patient are not suitable for any form of treatment a they present with advanced disease however there is an increasing incidence of urothelial cancer in africa over the year due to urbanization it is best that major investment is made in urooncological care to address the growing challenge of these subtypes

title: srebpdependent de novo fatty acid synthesis gene expression is elevated in malignant melanoma and represents a cellular survival trait
abstract: de novo fatty acid biosynthesis dnfa is a hallmark adaptation of many cancer that support survival proliferation and metastasis here we elucidate previously unexplored aspect of transcription regulation and clinical relevance of dnfa in cancer we show that elevated expression of dnfa gene is characteristic of many tumor type and correlate with poor prognosis especially in melanoma elevated dnfa gene expression depends on the srebp transcription factor in multiple melanoma cell line srebp predominantly bind to the transcription start site of dnfa gene regulating their expression by recruiting rna polymerase ii to promoter for productive transcription elongation we find that srebpregulated dnfa represents a survival trait in melanoma cell regardless of proliferative state and oncogenic mutation status indeed malignant melanoma cell exhibit elevated dnfa gene expression after the brafmek signaling pathway is blocked eg by braf inhibitor and dnfa expression remains higher in melanoma cell resistant to vemurafenib treatment than in untreated cell accordingly dnfa pathway inhibition whether by direct targeting of srebp with antisense oligonucleotides or through combinatorial effect of multiple dnfa enzyme inhibitor exerts potent cytotoxic effect on both brafisensitive and resistant melanoma cell altogether these result implicate srebp and dnfa enzyme a enticing therapeutic target in melanoma
label: Cancer

title: synchronicity of genetic variant between primary site and metastatic lymph node and prognostic impact in nodal metastatic lung adenocarcinoma
abstract: purpose nodal positive lung adenocarcinoma includes wide range of survival several method for the classification of nodalpositive lung cancer have been proposed however classification considering the impact of targetable genetic variant are lacking the possibility of genetic variant for the better stratification of nodal positive lung adenocarcinoma wa estimated method mutation of gene between primary site and metastatic lymph node lns were compared using nextgeneration sequencing subsequently mutation in egfr and braf rearrangement in alk and ro were evaluated in resected pnm adenocarcinoma case recurrencefree survival rf postrecurrence survival pr and overall survival o were evaluated with respect to targetable variant and tyrosine kinase inhibitor tki therapy after recurrence result about of variant were shared and allele frequency were similar between primary and metastatic site in pnm case egfralk were positive in primary site of case and same egfralk variant were confirmed in metastatic lns of tissueavailable case multivariate analysis indicated positive egfralk status wa associated with worse rf hr ci p and pr wa prolonged in case receiving tki therapy no postrecurrence tki therapy hr ci p o did not differ with respect to targetable variant or tki therapy conclusion case harbouring targetable genetic variant had a higher risk of recurrence but pr wa prolonged by tki therapy classification according to the targetable genetic status provides a basis for predicting recurrence and determining treatment strategy after recurrence

title: the role of brca in hereditary and familial breast and ovarian cancer
abstract: background brca pathogenic variant have become associated with familial breast and ovarian cancer and hereditary cancerpredisposition syndrome with advance in molecular biology brca profiling facilitates early diagnosis and the implementation of preventive and therapeutic strategy the gene exhibit variable prevalence among different individual and moderate interpretation complexity brca deficiency is instrumental in cancer development affect therapeutic option and is instrumental in drug resistance in addition brca profile is diverse across different group and ha been associated with the founder effect in certain population method in this review we aim to detail the spectrum of brca variant and their associated risk estimate result the relationship between brca and hereditary and familial cancer is indisputable yet brca screening method are beset with limitation and lack clinical confidence conclusion this review emphasizes the importance of screening brca genetics in addition to their clinical utility furthermore founder variant are anticipated in the saudi population
label: Cancer

title: novel multiplex droplet digital pcr assay for scoring pdl in nonsmall cell lung cancer biopsy specimen
abstract: objective immune checkpoint inhibitor have become integrated into the clinical management of nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc using rtqpcr we have previously identified a gene expression panel that detected presence of malignant cell mmptimp ratio and quantified pdl transcript level in small biopsy specimen however rtqpcr ha diagnostic limitation a it doe not generate absolute copy number and is not readily multiplexed to address this we have developed a multiplex droplet digital pcr ddpcr assay material and method biopsy obtained from nsclc patient n adenocarcinoma and n squamous cell carcinoma and control lung biopsy specimen n were analysed absolute mmp timp and pdl transcript copy number were determined within a single assay by multiplex ddpcr using taqman primer and the qx droplet digital pcr system result and conclusion using our optimised triplex ddpcr assay the mmptimp ratio wa significantly elevated in nsclc biopsy and using a cutoff of wa ci sensitive and specific for identifying malignant biopsy the pdltimp ratio significantly associated with pdl tumour cell immunohistochemistry staining r p pdl tumour cell staining p in summary a major advantage of our workflow is that it can accurately quantify pdl tumour level and provide sufficient nucleic acid for screening additional targetable mutation such a egfr alk and ro from a single small biopsy thereby potentially avoiding the need for rebiopsy future study will need to determine diagnostic ddpcr value that are predictive of clinical response to pdpdl immunotherapy
label: Cancer

title: exosomes and their role in cancer progression
abstract: exosomes are a subset of extracellular vesicle and their size is approximately nm in diameter they are surrounded by a lipid bilayer membrane and secreted from almost all of cell exosomes are generated within the endocytic system a ilv intraluminal membrane vesicle and secreted during the fusion of mvb multivesicular body with the cell membrane recently it ha been reported that exosomes modulate cellcell communication contributing to the maintenance of tissue homeostasis by molecule including exosomes moreover exosomes released from cancer cell are involved in cancer progression thus data regarding the role of the exosomes in malignant cancer will lead to development of novel diagnostic and therapeutic method

title: nsd mutation by hpv status in head and neck cancer difference in survival and response to dnadamaging agent
abstract: background compared to hpvnegative head and neck squamous cell carcinoma hnsccs hpvpositive hnsccs are associated with a favorable prognosis in part due to their improved treatment sensitivity inactivating mutation in nsd were shown to be a favorable prognostic biomarker in laryngeal cancer here we characterize nsd mutation from the expanded the cancer genome atlas tcga hnscc cohort n and examine their prognostic implication based on hpv status of the tumor we also begin to examine if nsd regulates response to platinumbased drug and other dnadamaging agent method tcga hnscc sample were segregated by hpv and nsd mutation using cbioportal and patient survival wa determined pathogenicity of mutation wa predicted using umdpredictor nsddepleted cell line were established by transfection with control or shrnas against nsd followed by puromycin selection and confirmed by qrtpcr cell sensitivity to dna damaging agent wa assessed using shortterm proliferation and longterm clonogenic survival assay result among hpv tumor contained alteration in the nsd gene the majority of nsd gene alteration in hpv specimen were truncating mutation within or before the enzymatic set domain the remaining alteration included homozygous gene deletion missense point mutation and inframe deletion umdpredictor categorized of missense point mutation a pathogenic for hpv hnscc n nsd mutation comprised of two truncating and missense point mutation were identified three of the missense point mutation were predicted to be pathogenic or probably pathogenic by umdpredictor kaplanmeier survival analysis determined significantly improved survival of hpv hnscc patient whose tumor harbored nsd gene alteration a compared to patient with wildtype nsd tumor interestingly the survival effect of nsd mutation observed in hpvnegative hnscc wa reversed in hpv tumor proliferation and clonogenic survival of two hpv cell line stably expressing control or nsd shrnas showed that nsddepleted cell were more sensitive to cisplatin and carboplatin but not to other dna damaging drug conclusion genetic alteration in nsd hold potential a novel prognostic biomarkers in hpv head and neck cancer nsd mutation in hpv cancer may also play a prognostic role although this effect must be examined in a larger cohort nsd downregulation result in improved sensitivity to cisplatin and carboplatin but not to other dnadamaging agent in epithelial cell increased sensitivity to platinumbased chemotherapy agent associated with nsd depletion may contribute to improved survival in hpv hnsccs further study are needed to determine mechanism through which nsd protects hpv hnscc cell from platinumbased therapy a well a confirmation of nsd effect in hpv hnscc

title: chronic shisha exposure alters phosphoproteome of oral keratinocytes
abstract: shisha smoking ha been epidemiologically linked to oral cancer however few study have investigated the pathobiology of shishainduced cellular transformation we studied the effect of chronic shisha exposure month in an in vitro model using immortalized nonneoplastic oral keratinocytes okftert quantitative proteomic and phosphoproteomic analysis were performed on okftert cell treated with shisha extract for a period of month pathway analysis wa carried out to identify significantly enriched biological process in shishatreated cell chronic shisha exposure resulted in increased cell scattering phenomenon in okftert cell data analysis revealed differential phosphorylation of peptide fold change p corresponding to protein protein associated with mtorc and eiff complex involved in initiating protein translation were seen to be enriched upon shisha treatment network analysis also highlighted downregulation of protein involved in type i interferon signaling in shishatreated cell quantitative phosphoproteomic approach elucidated global perturbation to the molecular milieu of oral keratinocytes upon shisha exposure further study are needed to validate putative target in oral cancer patient with shisha smoking history
label: Cancer

title: a germline mbd mutation wa identified in a patient with colorectal oligopolyposis and earlyonset cancer a case report
abstract: a yearold woman presented with adenomatous polyp of the left sidedcolon with early rectosigmoid cancer the patient had no previous medical history and no familial history of inherited colorectal disease no germline gene mutation associated with colorectal adenomatous polyposis including apc regulator of wnt signaling pathway muty dna glycosylase dna polymeraseepsilon catalytic subunit dna polymerase delta catalytic subunit and mismatch repair gene were detected via germline genetic testing a heterozygous germline mutation in methylcpg binding domain dna glycosylase mbd cctpgln which resulted in the generation of a stop codon wa identified by genetic analysis including wholeexome sequencing immunohistochemical staining analysis revealed that the expression of mbd protein wa absent in the cancer tissue while it wa expressed in the normal epithelium sequencing and copynumber analysis demonstrated the loss of the remaining allele of mbd in the cancer tissue furthermore somatic mutation signature analysis showed preferential transition of cytosine to thymine residue at cpg dinucleotides in cancer tissue although it ha been previously reported that germline missense mutation and somatic mutation of mbd are associated with the development of colorectal cancer this is the first report to the best of our knowledge in which a germline nonsense mutation of the mbd gene ha been identified in an earlyonset colorectal cancer patient with oligopolyposis
label: Cancer
