title: morphophenotypic characteristic of ovarian serous borderline tumor
abstract: borderline ovarian tumor bot represent particular challenge for diagnosis and clinical management a they are characterized with the feature of both benign cystadenomas and malignant carcinoma the aim of our study wa to investigate histomorphological and immunohistochemical characteristic of ovarian serouspapillary borderline tumor compared to serous cystadenomas and low and highgrade serous carcinoma altogether formalin fixed and paraffin embedded tissue specimen distributed in four group including serous cystadenoma group i serous bot group ii low group iii and high group iv grade serous carcinoma were investigated by standard immunohistochemistry using antibody against ck ck wt vimentin cdx cea er cyclin d bcl ecadherin calretinin sa ki p study result showed that ovarian serous bot are characterized with slightly increase proliferative potential compared to benign cystadenomas whilst apoptotic potential is retained with the difference from malignant serous carcinoma p mutation is not present a well a the expression of vimentin overall ovarian serous bot are characterized with highly variable immunohistochemical phenotype and the use of multiple immunohistochemical marker are recommended for the differential diagnosis from low grade serous carcinoma and benign cystadenomas
label: Cancer

title: characteristic and diagnostic application of circulating cellfree dna in colorectal cancer
abstract: the incidence and mortality of colorectal cancer crc are considerably high in central european country it is the second most common cancer in both men and woman in hungary with newly registered patient per year these data indicate the necessity of new screening method that are more comfortable for patient hence the compliance can be increased cellfree dna cfdna level in blood is elevated in certain physiological condition such a pregnancy or high physical activity furthermore cfdna concentration alteration can also be detected in some pathological process increased cfdna amount wa observed in autoimmune and inflammatory disease a well a in various cancer including crc numerous study about origin function and mechanism of cfdna can be found in the scientific literature in this review we aimed to describe the quantitative and qualitative change of cfdna to present it function and to provide an overview of the available diagnostic application for crc cfdna can be released to the circulatory system via apoptosis necrosis or by direct secretion by living cell in cancer patient cfdna can originate from healthy and cancer cell hence genetic eg mutation in apc kras braf and epigenetic eg methylation in sept sfrp alteration of tumor cell can be examined in cfdna fraction several highthroughput sensitive and even automated method are available providing opportunity to perform standardized sample preparation and to analyse biomarker candidate quantitatively these enhancement can help to develop alternative screening method that can be easily integrated into the clinical practice and can contribute to early cancer detection orv hetil
label: Cancer

title: molecular pathogenesis of gallbladder cancer an update
abstract: gallbladder carcinoma gbc is the most aggressive gastrointestinal malignancy throughout the world with wide geographical variance it is the subtype of biliary tract malignancy that ha the poorest prognosis and lower survival among all biliary tract malignancy various factor are associated with gbc pathogenesis such a environmental microbial metabolic and molecular chronic inflammation of gallbladder due to presence of gallstone or microbial infection eg salmonella or h pylorus result in sustained production of inflammatory mediator in the tissue microenvironment which can cause genomic change linked to carcinogenesis genetic alteration are one of the major factor associated with aggressiveness and prognosis research have been done to explore suitable biomarker for early diagnosis and identify altered molecular pathway to develop appropriate biomarkers for early diagnosis therapy and predicting prognosis different agent for targeted therapy against actionable mutation of molecule like egfr vegf mtor her pdl pd met pik ncadherin vegfr mek and mek are being tried despite these advancement there is dismal improvement in the survival of gbc patient genetic aberration other than actionable mutation and epigenetic modification including aberrant expression of micrornas are also being studied both a diagnostic biomarker and therapeutic target complex pathogenesis of gbc still need to be unfolded in this review we focus on the molecular pathogenesis of gbc elucidated till date along with future direction that can be explored to achieve better management of gbc patient

title: the molecular hallmark of the serrated pathway in colorectal cancer
abstract: colorectal cancer crc is a leading cause of cancer death worldwide it includes different subtypes that differ in their clinical and prognostic feature in the past decade in addition to the conventional adenomacarcinoma model an alternative multistep mechanism of carcinogenesis namely the serrated pathway ha been described approximately to of all crcs arise from neoplastic serrated polyp a heterogeneous group of lesion that are histologically classified into three morphologic category hyperplastic polyp sessile serrated adenomaspolyps and the traditional serrated adenomaspolyps serrated polyp are characterized by genetic braf or kras mutation and epigenetic cpg island methylator phenotype cimp alteration that cooperate to initiate and drive malignant transformation from normal colon mucosa to polyp and then to crc the high heterogeneity of the serrated lesion render their diagnostic and pathological interpretation difficult hence novel genetic and epigenetic biomarkers are required for better classification and management of crcs to date several molecular alteration have been associated with the serrated polypcrc sequence in addition the gut microbiota is emerging a a contributor tomodulator of the serrated pathway this review summarizes the state of the art of the genetic epigenetic and microbiota signature associated with serrated crcs together with their clinical implication
label: Cancer

title: subtyping of microsatellite instabilityhigh colorectal cancer
abstract: background patient with microsatellite instabilityhigh msih colorectal cancer crc generally have a better prognosis than patient with microsatellite stable ms crc however some msih crc patient do not gain overall survival benefit from immune checkpointblockade treatment in other word heterogeneity within the subgroup of msih tumor remains poorly understood thus an indepth molecular characterization of msih tumor is urgently required method here we use nonnegative matrix factorization nmfbased consensus clustering to define crc msih subtypes in the cancer genome atlas and a french multicenter cohort gse cibersort wa used to calculate the proportion of lymphocyte in tumor tissue in msih subtypes result msih crc sample basically clustered into two subgroup msih and msih msih wa characterized by a lower braf mutational status higher frequency of chromosomal instability global hypomethylation and worse survival than msih further examination of the immune landscape showed that macrophage of the m phenotype were enriched in msih which may be associated with poor prognosis in this subgroup conclusion our result illustrate the genetic heterogeneity in msih crcs and macrophage may serve a good target for anticancer therapy in msih

title: rag high expression associated with ikzf dysfunction in adult bcell acute lymphoblastic leukemia
abstract: the recombination mediated by recombination activating gene rag is not only the dominant mutational process but also the predominant driver of oncogenic genomic rearrangement in acute lymphoblastic leukemia all it is further responsible for leukemic clonal evolution in this study significant rag increase is observed in the subset of ball patient and high expression of rag is observed to be correlated with high proliferation marker ikzfencoded protein ikaros directly bind to the rag promoter and regulates rag expression in leukemic cell ck inhibitor by increasing ikaros activity significantly suppresses rag expression in all in an ikarosdependent manner patient with ikzf deletion have significantly higher expression of rag compared to that without ikzf deletion ck inhibitor treatment also result in an increase in ikzf binding to the rag promoter and suppression of rag expression in primary all cell taken together these result demonstrate that rag high expression is associated with high proliferation marker in ball our data for the first time proved that rag expression is directly suppressed by ikaros our result also reveal drive oncogenesis of ball is driven by high expression of rag with ikaros dysfunction together which have significance in an integrated prognostic model for adult all
label: Cancer

title: primary malignant epithelioid and rhabdoid tumor of bone harboring znfnutm fusion the expanding nut cancer family
abstract: nutm gene rearrangement is the genetic hallmark of nut carcinoma an aggressive tumor that most commonly affect the thoracic and head and neck region and often exhibit squamous differentiation the most common fusion partner gene is brd followed by brd and nsd recently nutm gene rearrangement ha been identified in rare tumor from soft tissue intracranial location and other visceral organ these tumor often show high grade malignant epithelioid to round cell histomorphology and lack evidence of squamous andor epithelial differentiation therefore their relationship with classic nut carcinoma is still uncertain here we present a primary mandible bone tumor of a yearold female exhibiting monotonous epithelioid and rhabdoid cytomorphology vesicular chromatin and prominent nucleolus the initial immunohistochemical workup wa nonspecific showing only cd positivity while being negative for cytokeratin aeae ema p etc ini expression wa retained rna sequencing wa performed and identified a rare znfnutm gene fusion which had only been reported in a single case of pulmonary nut carcinoma the fusion wa confirmed by fish for nutm gene rearrangement and supported by diffuse and strong nut immunoreactivity myc mrna upregulation and immunoreactivity a common finding in nut carcinoma wa also observed in this tumor suggesting a possible common pathogenetic mechanism and potential treatment target the patient presented with a nonmetastatic disease status and received hemimandibulectomy selective neck dissection level ib and postoperative radiation therapy she remained disease free year after the initial diagnosis
label: Cancer

title: evaluating the tumor biology of lung adenocarcinoma a multimodal analysis
abstract: we evaluated the relationship among functional imaging modality such a petct and dwmri and lung adenocarcinoma pathologic heterogeneity extent of invasion depth and tumor cellularity a a marker of tumor microenvironmentin total lung adenocarcinoma were prospectively included all patient underwent ffluorodeoxyglucose fdg petct and mri before curative surgery pathology revealed stage i tumor stage ii tumor and stage iiia tumor comprehensive histologic subtyping wa performed for all surgically resected tumor maximum standardized uptake value suvmax and adc value were correlated with pathologic grade extent of invasion solid tumor size and tumor cellularitymean solid tumor size low mm indeterminate mm and high grade mm and suvmax low indeterminate and high grade had a significant relationship with pathologic grade based on confidence interval p and p respectively suvmax showed a strong correlation with tumor cellularity r p but wa not correlated with extent of invasion r p a significant and strong positive correlation wa observed among suvmax value and higher cellularity and pathologic grade adc did not exhibit a significant relationship with tumor cellularityintratumor heterogeneity quantification using a multimodalmultiparametric approach might be effective when tumor volume consists of a real tumor component a well a a nontumorous stromal component
label: Cancer

title: telomere length and it correlation with gene mutation in chronic lymphocytic leukemia in a korean population
abstract: telomere length tl is a prognostic indicator in caucasian chronic lymphocytic leukemia cll but it significance in asian cll remains unknown to investigate the prognostic significance of tl and it correlation with cytogenetic aberration and somatic mutation we analyzed tl measurement at the cellular level by interphase fluorescence in situ hybridization in patient with cll in korea the present study enrolled patient female and male diagnosed with cll according to the world health organization criterion tl of bone marrow nucleated cell at the singlecell level were measured by quantitative fluorescence in situ hybridization qfish in patient the correlation of tl with clinical characteristic cytogenetic aberration genetic mutation and overall survival were assessed the median value of mean tl in cll patient tc ratio range wa significantly shorter than that in the normal control tc ratio range p shorter tl were associated with complex karyotype p delq p presence of deletion andor mutation in atm andor tp p and shb mutation p a shorter tl wa correlated with lower hemoglobin level and adverse survival mean tl p when the proportion of cell with extremely short tl wa greater than cll patient showed poor survival p complex karyotype tp mutation and the number of mutated gene were determined to be significant adverse variable by multivariable cox analysis p p and p respectively tl wa attrited in cll and attrited telomere were correlated with adverse survival and other wellknown adverse prognostic factor we infer that tl is an independent adverse prognostic predictor in korean cll

title: yap promotes multidrug resistance and inhibits autophagyrelated cell death in hepatocellular carcinoma via the racrosmtor pathway
abstract: background multidrug resistance is the major cause of chemotherapy failure in hepatocellular carcinoma hcc yap a critical effector of the hippo pathway ha been shown to contribute to the progression metastasis and invasion of cancer however the potential role of yap in mediating drug resistance remains obscure method rtqpcr and western blot were used to assess yap expression in hcc cell line cck assay flow cytometry a xenograft tumour model immunochemistry and gfpmrfplc fusion protein were utilized to evaluate the effect of yap on multidrug resistance intracellular ro production and the autophagy of hcc cell in vitro and in vivo autophagy inhibitor and rescue experiment were carried out to elucidate the mechanism by which yap promotes chemoresistance in hcc cell result we found that belfu a typical hcc cell line with chemoresistance exhibited overexpression of yap moreover the inhibition of yap by shrna or verteporfin conferred the sensitivity of belfu cell to chemotherapeutic agent through autophagyrelated cell death in vitro and in vivo mechanistically yap silencing significantly enhanced autophagic flux by increasing racdriven ro which contributed to the inactivation of mtor in hcc cell in addition the antagonist of autophagy reversed the enhanced effect of yap silencing on cell death under treatment with chemotherapeutic agent conclusion our finding suggested that yap upregulation endowed hcc cell with multidrug resistance via the racrosmtor pathway resulting in the repression of autophagyrelated cell death the blockade of yap may serve a a promising novel therapeutic strategy for overcoming chemoresistance in hcc
label: Cancer

title: acinar cell carcinoma of the pancreas with thyroidlike follicular feature first description of a new diagnostic challenging subtype
abstract: acinar cell carcinoma acc of the pancreas are a heterogeneous group of neoplasm showing a wide spectrum of morphological feature including acinar solid glandular and trabecular architecture in addition uncommon cytological aspect have recently been described and include oncocytic spindle clear and pleomorphic cell type this wide histological spectrum represents a challenge in the diagnostic task for pathologist molecular mechanism involved in the onset and progression of acc are not completely known but in general they differ from those observed in ductal adenocarcinoma or neuroendocrine neoplasm of the pancreas and frequently include alteration in the apcbetacatenin pathway in the present paper we describe a new variant of acc showing thyroidlike follicular feature and ctnnb mutation this phenotype need to be included in the spectrum of morphological presentation of acc
label: Cancer

title: loxl function beyond amino oxidase and role in pathology including cancer
abstract: lysyl oxidase like loxl is a copperdependent amine oxidase responsible for the crosslinking of collagen and elastin in the extracellular matrix loxl belongs to a family including other member lox loxl loxl and loxl autosomal recessive mutation are rare and described in patient with stickler syndrome earlyonset myopia and nonsyndromic cleft palate along with an essential function in embryonic development multiple biological function have been attributed to loxl in various pathology related to amino oxidase activity additionally various novel role have been described for loxl such a the oxidation of fibronectin in myotendinous junction formation and of deacetylation and deacetylimination activity of stat to control of inflammatory response in tumor three distinct role were described loxl interacts with snail and contributes to proliferation and metastasis by inducing epithelialmesenchymal transition in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma cell loxl is localized predominantly in the nucleus associated with invasion and poor gastric cancer prognosis loxl interacts with protein involved in dna stability and mitosis completion contributing to melanoma progression and sustained proliferation here we review the structure function and activity of loxl in normal and pathological condition and discus the potential of loxl a a therapeutic target in various disease
label: Cancer

title: clinicopathological feature and prognosis of ciliated muconodular papillary tumor
abstract: background the pulmonary ciliated muconodular papillary tumor cmpt is a very rare tumor with only several case report in published literature and it clinicopathological feature standard treatment method and prognosis ha not been well defined method two case of cmpt diagnosed and treated in our hospital and case reported in the published literature were analyzed retrospectively result the cohort of cmpt patient comprised of male and female aged year the diameter of the primary tumor wa cm most of these lesion were subsolid nodule a observed on computed tomography and easily misdiagnosed a early lung adenocarcinoma tumor of patient were stained by immunohistochemistry method which revealed that ck cea and ttf were positive and ck wa negative in most patient the result of gene alternation demonstrated mutation in egfr kras and braf and alk rearrangement in cmpt all the patient underwent surgical treatment and did not receive postoperative adjuvant therapy the followup duration wa month and no case of tumor recurrence wa found until the final followup conclusion the incidence of cmpt wa low and rate of image misdiagnosis high immunohistochemistry is helpful for accurate diagnosis of cmpt sublobectomy may be proper and adjuvant treatment should be avoided since the disease is now prone to benign lesion furthermore since the biological behavior of this tumor is not yet fully elucidated additional case data are essential for accurate conclusion

title: histologic feature and genomic alteration of primary colorectal adenocarcinoma predict growth pattern of liver metastasis
abstract: background different histological growth pattern hgps of colorectal carcinoma crc liver metastasis are associated with patient prognosis and response to antiangiogenic therapy however the relationship between hgps of liver metastasis and clinicopathological and genomic characteristic of primary cancer ha not been well established aim to assess whether certain clinicopathological and genomic feature of primary crc could predict the hgps of liver metastasis method a total of patient with paired resection of both primary crc and liver metastasis were divided into two group a case with desmoplastic liver metastasis and b case with replacement liver metastasis clinical information wa obtained from patient chart mismatch repair protein brafve and pdl were evaluated by immunohistochemistry five case were selected randomly from each group for whole exome sequencing wes analysis result in the primary tumor expanding growth pattern low tumor budding score tb and crohn diseaselike response cdr were associated with desmoplastic liver metastasis and better overall survival whereas infiltrating growth pattern alone of primary carcinoma could predict the replacement liver metastasis and worse overall survival p on wes analysis primary carcinoma with desmoplastic liver metastasis showed mutation in apc tp kras pikca and fat brca brca braf and dnah whereas primary carcinoma with replacement liver metastasis showed mutation in apc and tp kras fat dnh smad erbb erbb lrp and sdk conclusion the hgps tb and cdr of primary crc a well a the presence of specific genetic mutation such a those in pikca could be used to predict the hgps of liver metastasis response to therapy and patient prognosis
label: Cancer

title: molecular heterogeneity in lung cancer from mechanism of origin to clinical implication
abstract: molecular heterogeneity is a frequent event in cancer responsible of several critical issue in diagnosis and treatment of oncologic patient lung tumour are characterized by high degree of molecular heterogeneity associated to different mechanism of origin including genetic epigenetic and nongenetic source in this review we provide an overview of recognized mechanism underlying molecular heterogeneity in lung cancer including epigenetic mechanism mutant allele specific imbalance genomic instability chromosomal aberration tumor mutational burden somatic mutation we focus on the role of spatial and temporal molecular heterogeneity involved in therapeutic implication in lung cancer patient
label: Cancer

title: hepatic yaptfe rearranged epithelioid hemangioendothelioma
abstract: epithelioid hemangioendothelioma ehe is an uncommon lowgrade malignant vascular tumor that may arise in soft tissuebone or visceral site such a the liver and lung a this tumor exhibit epithelioid morphology it frequently cause diagnostic confusion with other epithelioid vascular neoplasm a well a carcinoma while of classic ehe are driven by a wwtrcamta fusion gene a histologically distinctive subset of ehe ha been recently shown to harbor a different fusion gene yaptfe this variant is likely underrecognized given it rarity and only recent description notably ehe frequently involves the liver but only one case of hepatic yaptfe rearranged ehe ha been reported to date we present the second case of yaptfe rearranged ehe affecting a yearold woman and presenting a multiple liver mass with characterization of the fusion gene at the transcriptomic and genomic level there are several educational point noted from this case yaptfe rearranged ehe show distinctly vasoformative focus unlike classic ehe and mimicking angiosarcoma or epithelioid hemangioma the tumor cell show a histiocytoid appearance with voluminous cytoplasm similar to other tferearranged tumor finally in the liver this tumor may in part mimic focal nodular hyperplasia of the liver which is an underrecognized diagnostic pitfall this report highlight the key diagnostic and genetic feature of this newly recognized variant of hepatic ehe to aid pathologist in appropriately classifying these tumor
label: Cancer

title: clinical evaluation of intelliplex kras g mutation kit for detection of kras mutation in codon and a novel multiplex approach
abstract: background colorectal cancer crc is among the most frequently occurring cancer worldwide and it incidence is forecasted to increase testing for kras kirsten rat sarcoma viral oncogene homolog mutation in colorectal tissue biopsy sample ha become a crucial tool to guide therapeutic decision for personalized treatment objective the objective of this study wa to determine the diagnostic sensitivity and specificity of the intelliplex kras g mutation kit using clinical specimen compared to sanger sequencing a the reference method method a total of formalinfixed paraffinembedded ffpe tissue sample with crc tumor comprising more than of the whole tissue sample were included in the study and analyzed for specific kras mutation in codon and for sample with discordant result between sanger sequencing and the intelliplex kras g mutation kit pyrosequencing wa utilized to resolve the kras mutational status result sequencing determined specimen a kras wildtype genotype while the intelliplex kras g mutation kit confirmed of the wildtype case resulting in a clinical specificity of confidence interval ci all specimen with a reported mutation in codon or of kras by sequencing were also reported a nonwildtype by the intelliplex kras g mutation kit resulting in a clinical sensitivity to detect kras mutation of ci conclusion the intelliplex kras g mutation kit demonstrates suitable specificity and sensitivity for use in clinical laboratory to determine the mutational status of kras codon and

title: high incidence of myc rearrangement in human immunodeficiency viruspositive plasmablastic lymphoma
abstract: aim myc rearrangement are the main cytogenetic alteration in plasmablastic lymphoma pbl we aimed to investigate the relationship between myc rearrangement and the clinicopathological feature of pbl method and result myc rearrangement assessed in unpublished singlecentre pbl case and an additional case from the literature with reported myc rearrangement information individualised by patient were reviewed in asia pbl wa much less commonly diagnosed in human immunodeficiency virus hivpositive patient versus p with older age median age at diagnosis year versus year p and a lower ebv infection rate versus p than in nonasian region overall myc rearrangement were identified in of pbl case and igh wa the partner in almost all available case a confirmed with a mycigh fusion probe the myc rearrangement rate in hivpositive case wa significantly higher than that in hivnegative case p patient with myc rearrangement showed a trend towards an inferior median survival time month versus month p and year overall survival versus p conclusion myc rearrangement wa frequently identified in pbl patient and igh wa the partner gene in an overwhelming majority of myc rearrangement in addition the myc rearrangement rate wa significantly higher in hivpositive pbl patient than that in hivnegative patient myc rearrangement may play an important role in the pathogenesis of hivpositive pbl but further study are required to understand the underlying mechanism

title: next generation sequencing reveals novel mutation in mismatch repair gene and other cancer predisposition gene in asian patient with suspected lynch syndrome
abstract: background although at least gene are implicated in lynch syndrome l up to of suspected case are owing to undefined gene we utilized next generation sequencing ng to characterize the mutation profile of patient with cancer ca suspected to have l patient and method we enrolled asian patient with ca from our ca genetics clinic from to suspected to have l and obtained germline dna for ng using trusight cancer frameshift nonsense and known deleterious mutation were considered pathogenic polymorphism t nonsense mutation n or ercccca nonsense mutation n without l gene mutation which is of clinical interest conclusion in this asian study ng proved to be feasible in screening for causative mutation in patient with ca suspected to have l

title: parallel analysis of somatic mutation in plasma circulating tumor dna ctdna and matched tumor tissue in earlystage breast cancer
abstract: purpose early detection and intervention can decrease the mortality of breast cancer significantly assessment of geneticgenomic variant in circulating tumor dna ctdna have generated great enthusiasm for their potential application a clinically actionable biomarkers in the management of earlystage breast cancerexperimental design in this study serial plasma and matched tissue specimen from patient with earlystage breast cancer who need chemotherapy and individual with benign breast tumor were deeply sequenced via nextgeneration sequencing ng technique using large gene panel result cancer tissue in this cohort of patient showed profound intratumor heterogeneity ithgs that were properly reflected by ctdna testing integrating the ctdna detection rate of in this cohort with the corresponding predictive result based on breast imaging reporting and data system classification birads could increase the positive predictive value up to and potentially dramatically reduce surgical overtreatment patient with positive ctdna after surgery showed a higher percentage of lymph node metastasis indicating potential recurrence and remote metastasis the ctdnapositive rate were significantly decreased after chemotherapy in basallike and her tumor subtypes but were persistent despite chemotherapy in luminal type the tumor mutation burden in blood btmb assessed on the basis of ctdna testing wa positively correlated with the tmb in tumor tissue ttmb providing a candidate biomarker warranting further study of it potential used for precise immunotherapy in cancer conclusion these data showed that ctdna evaluation is a feasible sensitive and specific biomarker for diagnosis and differential diagnosis of patient with earlystage breast cancer who need chemotherapy

title: giant lumbar polypoid tumor with bulla on it surface
abstract: dear editor acrochordons are common benign neoplasm found in everyday practice we present a rare case of a giant and single acrochordon on the lumbar region with sign of ischemia the correlation of clinical dermatoscopic and histopathological analysis may help the clinician differentiate this entity from other benign and malignant dermatosis a yearold man presented to the outpatient clinic complaining of a lumbar mass that had been growing for two year the lesion wa asymptomatic except for recent discomfort when lying in the supine decubitus position on examination there wa a single erythematous nontender pedunculated lesion cm x cm x cm in size with flaccid bulla on it surface and firm consistency figure ab dermoscopy showed regularly arranged dotted vessel in a violaceous background and bulla filled with serous fluid figure cd his personal and family medical history were unremarkable shave excision wa performed and the sample wa sent for histopathologic analysis histopathology revealed a normal epidermis surrounding a core of loose collagen fiber papillary dermis showed a mixed inflammatory cell infiltrate congested capillary and extravasated erythrocyte scattered cluster of adipocytes were found in the deep dermis figure the diagnosis of a giant ischemic acrochordon wa established acrochordons also commonly known a skin tag are benign pedunculated neoplasm frequently found on the neck axilla or groin they represent fibroepithelial polyp that originate from ectoderm and mesoderm tissue they can be pigmented or skin colored and usually range between to mm in size skin tag can affect nearly of the general population giant and solitary acrochordons are an uncommon clinical variant differential diagnosis of this pathology may be challenging in the particular clinical context of this patient benign neoplasm such a dermatofibroma neurofibroma and epidermal inclusion cyst can be clinically similar to giant skin tag histopathological analysis of acrochordons usually show papillomatosis irregular acanthosis loose collagen fiber and dilated capillary a fibrolipomatous variant of acrochordon may reveal adipose tissue lobule between septum of collagen on pathological examination local ischemia due to twisting of the stalk may induce the formation of intradermal or subepidermal blister in these tumor histopathologic characteristic found in ischemic acrochordons are neutrophil infiltration congested capillary and extravasated erythrocyte fibroepithelioma of pinkus fep is a rare variant of basal cell carcinoma that may clinically mimic benign polypoid tumor and ha a certain predilection for the lumbosacral area dermoscopic characteristic of fibroepithelioma of pinkus that may aid the clinician in this diagnosis are fine arborizing vessel either alone or associated with dotted vessel and white streak cosmetically adequate treatment of a giant acrochordon can be performed by shave excision and electrodesiccation of it pedicle choudhary et al reported good result with this technique on a giant acrochordon on the thigh
label: Cancer

title: photothermal effect of nayfyberpefeo superparamagnetic nanoprobes in the treatment of melanoma
abstract: objective the study aimed to synthesize superparamagnetic nayfyberpefeo upconversion nanoprobes and to study their photothermal effect for the treatment of malignant melanoma method morphological characteristic of the synthesized nanoprobes were examined by scanning electron microscopy their biocompatibility and biodistribution profile were assessed through blood routinebiochemistry test and the inductively coupled plasmaoptical emission spectrometrybased analysis of tissue metal element their photothermal conversion efficiency and their potential a contrast agent for upconversion luminescence uclmagnetic resonance imaging mri dualmodal imaging were tested efficacy in photothermal therapy which wa achieved by combining nanoprobes with nearinfrared nir irradiation wa evaluated in both a cell line and balbc mouse model the underlying mechanism were interrogated by molecular approach including the mtt assay flow cytometry semiquantitative pcr western blot and immunohistochemistry result our synthesized nayfyberpefeo nanoprobes exhibited a uniform cubic morphology with a diameter of nm subcutaneous administration led to no severe longlasting adverse effect in mouse possibly due to complete removal of these nanomaterials within one month our nanoprobes possessed superior photothermal conversion efficiency and strong contrasting effect during uclmri dualmodal imaging corroborating their application in imagingguided photothermal therapy combinatorial treatment of these nanoprobes with nir irradiation induced profound apoptosisnecrosis in a cell similarly the same treatment modality led to strong therapeutic effect in balbc mouse implanted with a tumor xenograft mechanistic study suggested an involvement of heat shock protein in mediating the observed antitumor effect of our nanoprobes conclusion our study describes a convenient method to synthesize a new type of superparamagnetic upconversion nanoprobes which possess high biocompatibility and can be used in imagingguided photothermal therapy for the treatment of malignant melanoma importantly our finding will promote clinical application of nayfyberpefeo a novel theranostic agent in treating melanoma and many other tumor

title: prognostic significance of the pank family expression in acute myeloid leukemia
abstract: background acute myeloid leukemia aml is a highly heterogenous hematological malignancy and it prognostication depends on the genetic mutation and expression profile of each patient pantothenate kinase pank is a regulatory enzyme that control coenzyme a coa biosynthesis it ha four isoforms encoded by pank respectively whether the expression of the pank family ha prognostic significance in aml remains unclear method we screened the cancer genome atlas database for aml patient with complete pank expression data eightyfour aml patient met the criterion and were included in this study clinical characteristic at diagnosis including peripheral blood pb white blood cell count wbc blast percentage in pb and bone marrow bm frenchamericanbritish fab subtypes and the frequency of common genetic mutation were described survival wa estimated using the kaplanmeier method and the logrank test multivariate cox proportional hazard model were constructed for eventfree survival efs and overall survival o using a limited backward elimination procedure result patient with high pank expression had significantly longer eventfree survival efs and overall survival o than patient with low pank expression p p respectively whereas patient with high pank expression had shorter efs and o than patient with low pank expression p p respectively multivariate analysis confirmed that high pank expression wa an independent risk factor for efs and o both p conclusion our study suggested that high pank expression might have favorable effect on aml while high pank expression wa indicative of poor prognosis

title: early colorectal cancer provide new evidence for a lynch syndrometocmmrd phenotypic continuum
abstract: lynch syndrome l is the most common hereditary colorectal cancer crc syndrome caused by heterozygous mutation in the mismatch repair mmr gene biallelic mutation in these gene lead however to constitutive mismatch repair deficiency cmmrd in this study we follow the diagnostic journey of a year old patient with crc with a clinical phenotype overlapping cmmrd we perform molecular and functional assay to discard a cmmrd diagnosis then identify by exome sequencing and validation in a cohort of l patient a candidate variant in the mlh utr region in homozygosis we propose that this variant together with other candidate could be responsible for ageofonset modulation our data support the idea that lowrisk modifier allele may influence early development of cancer in l leading to a lstocmmrd phenotypic continuum therefore it is essential that larger effort are directed to the identification and study of these genetic modifier in order to provide optimal cancer prevention strategy to these patient

title: molecular testing strategy in nonsmall cell lung cancer optimizing the diagnostic journey
abstract: molecular testing identifies patient with advanced nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc who may benefit from targeted therapy or immunotherapy ie immune checkpoint inhibitor treatment for patient with high tumor mutational burden tmb microsatellite instabilityhigh or mismatch repairdeficient tumor current guideline state that molecular testing should be conducted at the time of initial diagnosis and tumor progression on targeted therapy in realworld clinical practice in the united state u molecular testing is often not conducted or happens late in the diagnostic journey resulting in delayed or inappropriate treatment herein we review the rationale for molecular testing in advanced nsclc along with bestpractice guideline based on published recommendation and our own clinical experience including a case study we propose three strategy to optimize molecular testing in newly diagnosed patient with advanced nsclc i pulmonologists interventional radiologist or thoracic surgeon order molecular test a soon a advanced nsclc with an adenocarcinoma component is suspected ii liquid biopsy conducted early in the diagnostic pathway and iii pathologistdirected reflex testing a conducted in other area of oncology to help facilitate these strategy we outline our recommendation for optimal sample collection technique and stewardship in summary we believe that implementation of these individual strategy will allow clinician to effectively leverage available treatment option for advanced nsclc reducing the time to optimal treatment and improving patient outcome

title: multimodalityimaging manifestation of primary renalallograft synovial sarcoma first case report and literature review
abstract: background primary renal synovial sarcoma prss is an extremely rare tumor with a poor prognosis it imaging and immunohistochemical characteristic may overlap with other renal tumor which render it early diagnosis in a dilemma the diagnosis of primary renal synovial sarcoma requires histopathology and the confirmation of sytssx gene fusion using molecular technique case of primary renal synovial sarcoma have been previously reported in the literature however to our knowledge primary renal allograft synovial sarcoma wa never described case summary a yearold male patient who underwent kidney transplantation month ago came to our hospital for regular followup traditional ultrasonography revealed multiple hypoecho neoplasm in the renal allograft contrastenhanced computed tomography cect showed slightly hyperdensity mass with slow homogeneous enhancement ultrasoundguided biopsy wa conducted for accurate pathological diagnosis the neoplasm were diagnosed a synovial sarcoma by pathological immunohistochemical and genetic analysis positron emission tomographyct showed no evidence of metastasis at approximately one week post biopsy contrastenhanced ultrasound wa conducted to eliminate active hemorrhage one month later cect showed that the biggest neoplasm grew from cm to cm in diameter parametric imaging wa conducted with sonoliver cap to conduct further quantitative analysis which showed that the enhancement pattern wa heterogeneous hypervascular enhancement radical surgical resection of the whole renal allograft and ureter wa conducted without additional adjuvant chemotherapy or external radiotherapy anlotinib wa chosen for targeted therapy with a good response conclusion we propose multimodality imaging for accurate diagnosis of renal allograft synovial sarcoma especially when it is formed by spindleshaped cell

title: clinical application of epigenetics in gastroenteropancreatic neuroendocrine neoplasm moving towards liquid biopsy
abstract: highthroughput analysis including nextgeneration sequencing and microarrays have strongly improved our understanding of cancer biology however genomic data on rare cancer type such a neuroendocrine neoplasm ha been lagging behind neuroendocrine neoplasm nens develop from endocrine cell spread throughout the body and are highly heterogeneous in biological behavior in this challenging disease there is an urgent need for new therapy and new diagnostic prognostic followup and predictive biomarkers to aid patient management the last decade molecular data on neuroendocrine neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract and pancreas termed gastroenteropancreatic nens gepnens ha strongly expanded the aim of this review is to give an overview of the recent advance on epigenetic level and highlight their clinical application to address the current need in gepnens we illustrate how molecular alteration can be and are being used a therapeutic target how mutation in daxxatrx and copy number variation could be used a prognostic biomarkers how far we are in identifying predictive biomarkers and how genetics can contribute to gepnen classification finally we discus recent study on liquid biopsy in the field of gepnens and illustrate how liquid biopsy can play a role in patient management in conclusion molecular study have suggested multiple potential biomarkers but further validation is ongoing
label: Cancer

title: myeloid neoplasm in the setting of sickle cell disease an intrinsic association with the underlying condition rather than a coincidence report of case and review of the literature
abstract: myeloid neoplasm occasionally occur in patient with sickle cell disease and the underlying connection between the two disease is unclear herein we retrospectively analyzed four case of sickle cell disease patient who developed myeloid neoplasm age at time of diagnosis ranged from to year with a median of year two patient were treated with hydroxyurea and the other two with supportive care alone with one out of the four patient receiving additional treatment with hematopoietic stem cell transplant three patient presented with leukocytosis and the remaining patient presented with pancytopenia two patient were diagnosed with myelodysplastic syndromemyeloproliferative neoplasm one with myelodysplastic syndrome and the other with acute myeloid leukemia all four case demonstrated certain degree of myelodysplasia and complex cytogenetic abnormality with q andor q or with q kmta rearrangement this cytogenetic profile resembles that seen in therapyrelated myeloid neoplasm suggesting that myeloid neoplasm in the setting of sickle cell disease may represent a subcategory of the disease distinct from de novo myeloid neoplasm in general extensive literature review further demonstrates this similarity in cytogenetic profile a well a in other associated pathologic feature potential etiology includes therapy for sickle cell disease diseaserelated immunomodulation or diseaserelated chronic inflammation we hypothesize that constant hematopoietic hyperplasia stimulated by a hemolysisinduced cytokine storm may increase the chance of somatic mutationscytogenetic aberration resulting in transformation of myeloid precursor this group of myeloid neoplasm seems to herald a dismal clinical outcome with median survival year although the exact pathogenesis and biology of the disease remain to be investigated by large cohort in future study
label: Cancer

disease patient who developed myeloid neoplasm age at time of diagnosis ranged from to year with a median of year two patient were treated with hydroxyurea and the other two with supportive care alone with one out of the four patient receiving additional treatment with hematopoietic stem cell transplant three patient presented with leukocytosis and the remaining patient presented with pancytopenia two patient were diagnosed with myelodysplastic syndromemyeloproliferative neoplasm one with myelodysplastic syndrome and the other with acute myeloid leukemia all four case demonstrated certain degree of myelodysplasia and complex cytogenetic abnormality with q andor q or with q kmta rearrangement this cytogenetic profile resembles that seen in therapyrelated myeloid neoplasm suggesting that myeloid neoplasm in the setting of sickle cell disease may represent a subcategory of the disease distinct from de novo myeloid neoplasm in general extensive literature review further demonstrates this similarity in cytogenetic profile a well a in other associated pathologic feature potential etiology includes therapy for sickle cell disease diseaserelated immunomodulation or diseaserelated chronic inflammation we hypothesize that constant hematopoietic hyperplasia stimulated by a hemolysisinduced cytokine storm may increase the chance of somatic mutationscytogenetic aberration resulting in transformation of myeloid precursor this group of myeloid neoplasm seems to herald a dismal clinical outcome with median survival year although the exact pathogenesis and biology of the disease remain to be investigated by large cohort in future study

title: clinicopathological and epidemiological significance of breast cancer subtype reclassification based on p immunohistochemical expression
abstract: tp mutation are common in breast cancer and are typically associated with more aggressive tumor characteristic but little is known about the clinicopathological and epidemiological relevance of p protein expression a tp mutation surrogate in breast cancer subtypes in this study of chinese woman with invasive breast cancer we defined breast cancer subtypes using immunohistochemical ihc measure of hormone receptor and her in conjunction with histologic grade p expression status wa then used to further stratify subtypes into ppositive and pnegative odds ratio or and confidence interval ci in caseonly logistic regression analysis were used to examine heterogeneity across different subtypes the frequency of p protein expression varied by breast cancer subtype being lowest in the luminal alike and highest in the triplenegative and herenriched subtypes pvalue in luminal alike and blikehernegative subtypes p positivity wa associated with earlyonset tumor high grade high proliferative index and basal marker ck and egfr expression further compared with luminal alikepnegative patient alikeppositive patient were more likely to be parous adjusted or parous v nulliparous pvalue and to have breastfed adjusted or ever v never pvalue p positivity wa not associated with examined clinical and risk factor in other tumor subtypes overall these finding suggest that p expression which is readily available in many setting can be used to identify phenotype of luminal alike breast cancer with distinct clinical and epidemiological implication

title: hereditary colon cancer in lynch syndromehnpcc syndrome in germany
abstract: background hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal cancer lynchhnpcc syndrome is based on a germline mutation inducing increased occurrence of colorectal cancer and extracolonic carcinoma in young age the german hnpcc consortium aim to increase awareness for detection of hereditary colon cancer among patient and physician objective reliable detection of hnpcc patient is based on a thorough documentation of patient medical history and on further diagnostics delivered by human genetics and surgical pathology this manuscript present a standardized diagnostic concept method relevant literature is reviewed and discussed and diagnostic parameter are outlined in addition operating figure of the german hnpcc consortium are presented result the german hnpcc consortium is based on an efficient cooperation between clinical physician human geneticist and surgical pathologist after a funding period from the deutsche krebshilfe hnpcc diagnostics and preventive medical examination were transferred into standard care in germany in total family patient were included in hnpcc diagnostics to date in family mutation of the mlh msh msh pm or epcamgene have been detected furthermore pathogenic variant and variant of unknown significance were found conclusion reliable detection of hnpcc patient is based on a standardized diagnostic concept which ha been established within the german hnpcc consortium

title: clinical implication of chromosomal instability cin and kinetochore abnormality in breast cancer
abstract: genetic instability is a defining property of cancer cell and is the basis of various lesion including point mutation copy number alteration and translocation chromosomal instability cin is part of the genetic instability of cancer and consists of copy number alteration in whole or part of cancer cell chromosome cin is observed in differing degree in most cancer in breast cancer cin is commonly part of the genomic landscape of the disease and ha a higher incidence in aggressive subtypes tumor suppressor that are commonly mutated or disabled in cancer such a p and prb play role in protection against cin and a a result their dysfunction contributes to the establishment or tolerance of cin several structural and regulatory protein of the centromere and kinetochore the complex structure that is responsible for the correct distribution of genetic material in the daughter cell during mitosis are direct or mostly indirect transcription target of p and prb thus despite the absence of structural defect in gene encoding for centromere and kinetochore component dysfunction of these tumor suppressor may have profound implication for the correct function of the mitotic apparatus contributing to cin cin and it prognostic and therapeutic implication in breast cancer are discussed in this article

title: cytokine r r r r r r r and r snp in relation with prognostic factor in acute myeloid leukemia
abstract: background cytokine were correlated with survival and disease progression in acute myeloid leukemia aml we aimed to evaluate the multivariate effect of tnfalpha r r r il r r il r tgfbeta r ifngamma r single nucleotide polymorphism snp on aml risk the multivariate effect of snp on overall survival o in aml and the association between the investigated snp and prognostic factor in aml method all snp were genotyped in adult aml case and healthy individual aml patient were investigated for flt itd d dnmta r and npm type a mutation result univariate analysis revealed that age above year had a negative influence on survival p lactate dehydrogenase ldh level platelet plt count iul and cytogenetic highrisk were independent significant predictor for death in aml p corrected hr p corrected hr p corrected hr respectively conclusion age above year plt count tnfalpha r variant genotype blast percentage ldh level and cytogenetic highrisk may be used a independent risk factor to assess aml mortality

title: nonsmall cell lung cancer epidemiology screening diagnosis and treatment
abstract: lung cancer remains the leading cause of cancer death in the united state in the past decade significant advance have been made in the science of nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc screening ha been introduced with the goal of early detection the national lung screening trial found a lung cancer mortality benefit of and a decrease in allcause mortality with the use of lowdose chest computed tomography in highrisk individual the treatment of lung cancer ha also evolved with the introduction of several line of tyrosine kinase inhibitor in patient with egfr alk ro and ntrk mutation similarly immune checkpoint inhibitor icis have dramatically changed the landscape of nsclc treatment furthermore the result of new trial continue to help u understand the role of these novel agent and which patient are more likely to benefit icis are now part of the firstline nsclc treatment armamentarium a monotherapy combined with chemotherapy or after definite chemoradiotherapy in patient with stage iii unresectable nsclc expression of programmed cell death proteinligand in malignant cell ha been studied a a potential biomarker for response to icis however important drawback exist that limit it discriminatory potential identification of accurate predictive biomarkers beyond programmed cell death proteinligand expression remains essential to select the most appropriate candidate for ici therapy many question remain unanswered regarding the proper sequence and combination of these new agent however the field is moving rapidly and the overall direction is optimistic

title: apc transcription study and molecular diagnosis of familial adenomatous polyposis
abstract: familial adenomatous polyposis fap is characterised by the development of hundred to thousand of colorectal adenoma and result from inherited or somatic mosaic variant in the apc gene index patient with suspected fap are usually investigated by apc coding region sequence and dosage analysis in a clinical diagnostic setting the identification of an apc variant which is predicted to alter protein function enables predictive genetic testing to guide the management of family member this report describes a generation family with a phenotype consistent with fap but in which an apc variant had not been identified despite testing to explore this further quantitative pcr qpcr wa employed to assess apc transcription demonstrating reduced level of apc rna next generation sequencing ng identified the apc utr exon variant c ga that had been reported previously in an another fap family with apc allelic imbalance quantitative rna study and dna sequencing of the apc promoter exon may be useful diagnostically for patient with suspected fap when coding region variant can not be identified
label: Cancer

title: cribriformmorular variant of papillary thyroid carcinoma and it association with familial adenomatous polyposis
abstract: the cribriformmorular variant of papillary thyroid carcinoma cmvptc is an uncommon variant of papillary thyroid carcinoma cmvptc can be associated with familial adenomatous polyposis fap an autosomaldominant polyposis syndrome caused by a mutation in the apc gene that lead to a disruption of the wntbetacatenin pathway understanding the relation between cmvptc and fap is a diagnostic tool for both pathologist and clinician because fap ha several implication for patient and their family

title: the link between colon cancer and congenital hypertrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium chrpe
abstract: purpose clarify the difference between familial adenomatous polyposis fapassociated congenital hypertrophy of the retinal epithelium chrpe and benign variant with regard to lesion characteristic and associated risk observation an eighteenyearold man with no past medical history wa found to have multiple lesion in both eye that were consistent with fapassociated chrpe although family history wa negative for colon cancer a colonoscopy wa performed and hundred of polyp were found extending from the rectum to the distal colon with pathological finding of tubular adenoma genetic testing wa consistent with a possible de novo adenomatous polyposis coli apc mutation conclusion fap is an autosomal dominant syndrome that cause colorectal cancer by age thirtyfive in ninetyfive percent of case there ha been no established relationship between the benign variant of chrpe and fap and patient with benign variant have no increased risk of colon cancer while the lack of distinction in nomenclature and similar lesion appearance often lead to misdiagnosis and overtreatment there are distinct ocular exam feature that can provide the correct diagnosis the exam finding that distinguish fapassociated chrpe lesion are bilateralism occurrence in multiple quadrant pisiform shape and irregular border knowing these feature can be of great aid especially in the setting of suspected de novo familial adenomatous polyposis

title: sarcoma with mganutm fusion in the lung an emerging entity
abstract: we here document a sarcoma with a recently reported mganutm fusion a yearold man presented with a nodule in the right lung which grew to a giant mass in year the tumor showed uniform oval to spindle cell proliferation in a hypervascular stroma associated with focal myxoid change and peculiar collagen deposition resembling an osteoid the tumor showed an undifferentiated phenotype including negativity for cytokeratin although it wa immunoreactive to bcor and muc and wa initially suspected a bcorassociated sarcoma after complete resection the tumor recurred in the mediastinal lymph node and the patient died of the disease rna sequencing detected mga exon nutm exon which wa confirmed by reverse transcriptasepolymerase chain reaction sanger sequencing fluorescence in situ hybridization and nut immunohistochemistry clinicopathological feature of the present case were similar to some of the reported case of mganutm sarcoma suggesting the emergence of a distinct tumor subtype

title: the value of detecting mll gene rearrangement in child with acute monocytic leukemia
abstract: objective to assess the value of detecting the rearrangement of mixed lineage leukemia mll gene in child with acute mononuclear leukemia aml method dualcolor fluorescence in situ hybridization fish probe wa used to detect mll gene rearrangement in child with aml by interphase fish the result were compared with that of conventional g banding chromosomal analysis result among the child were detected by fish with positive hybridization signal with a detection rate for mll gene rearrangement being twelve reciprocal translocation and interruption of q were detected by g banding analysis the difference in the detection rate between the two method wa statistically significant p conclusion the sensitivity of fish assay for mll gene rearrangement wa significantly higher than that of g banding chromosomal karyotyping combined use of both method for child with aml can improve the detection rate of mll gene rearrangement and provide crucial clue for clinical diagnosis treatment and prognosis

title: helical and kinase domain mutation of pikca and their association with hormone receptor expression in breast cancer
abstract: breast cancer is one of the major cause of female morbidity and mortality accounting for of the total cancer case in woman phosphatidylinositolbisphosphate kinase catalytic alpha subunit pikca mutation serve a major role in downstream signaling of receptor tyrosine kinase the present study aimed to elucidate the frequency of exon and mutation of pikca and their role in disease progression a total of tumor sample from confirmed breast cancer patient were collected from the histopathology laboratory at king fahd hospital of the university alkhobar saudi arabia sanger sequencing wa performed on extracted dna to identify the mutation on exon and of pikca the result were further validated by competitive allelespecific taqman polymerase chain reaction three mutation namely ek and ek within exon and hr within exon were observed in patient among these patient carried the hr mutation of the kinase domain while the remaining patient carried mutation in the helical domain pikca mutation were associated with the estrogen receptorpositiveprogesterone receptorpositive erpr group of tumor in contrast to the erpr group p furthermore it wa observed that the pikca mutation wa associated with a poor disease prognosis taken together the current study emphasized the potential of pikca mutation a an important biomarker for breast cancer classification and the possible use of pikca inhibitor a targeted therapy for breast cancer
label: Cancer

title: fdaapproved drug screen identifies proteasome a a synthetic lethal target in mycdriven neuroblastoma
abstract: mycn amplification in neuroblastoma predicts poor prognosis and resistance to therapy yet pharmacological strategy of direct myc inhibition remain unsuccessful due to it undruggable protein structure we herein developed a synthetic lethal screen against mycnamplified neuroblastoma using clinically approved therapeutic reagent we performed a highthroughput screen from a library of fdaapproved drug for candidate that elicit synthetic lethal effect in mycdriven neuroblastoma cell the proteasome inhibitor which are fda approved for the firstline treatment of multiple myeloma emerge a top hit to elicit mycmediated synthetic lethality proteasome inhibition activates the perkeifalphaatf axis in myctransformed cell and induces baxmediated apoptosis through atfdependent noxa and trib induction a combination screen reveals the proteasome inhibitor bortezomib btz and the histone deacetylase hdac inhibitor vorinostat saha concertedly induce dramatic cell death in part through synergistic activation of bax this combination cause marked tumor suppression in vivo supporting dual proteasomehdac inhibition a a potential therapeutic approach for mycdriven cancer this fdaapproved drug screen with in vivo validation thus provides a rationale for clinical evaluation of bortezomib alone or in combination with vorinostat in mycdriven neuroblastoma patient
label: Cancer

title: risk stratification for lung adenocarcinoma on egfr and tp mutation status chemotherapy and pdl immunotherapy
abstract: the overall survival rate for lung cancer remain unsatisfactorily low even for patient with biomarkers for which target therapy or immunotherapy are recommended better identification of atrisk patient is needed to achieve more effective personalized treatment here we derived a riskstratifying gene signature consisting of five gene that had the greatest differential expression by stage from lung adenocarcinoma luad transcriptomes the new gene signature enabled survival prognosis for multiple luad datasets from different platform of transcriptomics and risk stratification for patient with and without a mutation in tp or egfr with high and low level of pdl and with and without adjuvant chemotherapy treatment using these evaluation it wa also shown to be more robust compared to several other gene signature functional analysis of the five gene and their proteinprotein interaction partner indicated that they are functionally enriched in cell cycle endocytosis and egfr regulation which are biological process associated with lung cancer and drug resistance extensive discussion on related experimental study suggest that the five gene are novel and sensible target for developing new drug andor tackling drug resistance problem for luad
label: Cancer

title: an update on inherited colon cancer and gastrointestinal polyposis
abstract: background it is estimated that of colorectal cancer arise due to a known genetic syndrome individual with these cancer syndrome are also at risk of extracolonic cancer polyposis and nonpolyposis hereditary syndrome are generally recognized inclusion of nextgeneration sequencing technology especially multiplegene panel testing in routine laboratory practice ha made identifying the cause of these disease significantly easier purpose to summarize current knowledge of the cause clinical manifestation diagnostic criterion and recommendation for presymptomatic screening of individual at risk of hereditary gastrointestinal polyposis and colorectal cancer syndrome we dicuss currently defined syndrome detected by multiplegene panel nextgeneration sequencing these include constitutional mismatch repair deficiency biallelic mlh msh msh pm gene mutation gastric adenocarcinoma and proximal polyposis of the stomach apc gene nthlassociated polyposis polymerase proofreadingassociated polyposis pold pole gene juvenile polyposis smad bmpra gene and serrated polyposis syndrome another aim is to summarize recent knowledge about wellknown syndrome including hereditary nonpolyposis colon cancer lynch syndrome familial adenomatous polyposis mutyhassociated polyposis and peutzjeghers and cowdenpten hamartoma tumor syndrome conclusion awareness of hereditary polyposiscolon cancer syndrome enables early diagnosis and prevention of cancer in affected individual and their relative genetic counseling presymptomatic testing of atrisk individual and efficient screening may be beneficial for affected family thank to lenka foretova md phd masaryk memorial cancer institute brno for a critical review of the manuscript and valuable advice the author declares she ha no potential conflict of interest concerning drug product or service used in the study the editorial board declares that the manuscript met the icmje recommendation for biomedical paper submitted accepted

title: molecular biomarkers predicting early development of endometrial carcinoma a pilot study
abstract: objective endometrial carcinoma represents the most common gynaecological cancer and the sixth most frequent cancer among woman worldwide the year survival of patient with stage i endometrial carcinoma is versus for stage iii or for stage iv disease therefore early detection could improve survival rate specifically in the most prevalent type endometrial cancer develops from hyperplastic endometrium the aim of the study wa to evaluate the utility of cancer gene mutation from endometrial biopsy towards predicting synchronous or metachronous development of malignant lesion the aim of the study wa to evaluate whether endometrial biopsy could already carry mutation in cancer gene useful for predicting or anticipating subsequent cancer development method patient with a previous endometrial biopsy negative for cancer followed by a subsequent biopsy positive for cancer were included in the study a fifty cancer gene targeted nextgeneration sequencing panel were used to investigate mutation in matched noncancerous and malignant sample result all biopsy from cancer tissue harboured mutation in one or more of the following gene apc ctnnb fbxw hnfa kras mtor nra pikca pten rb and tp additionally of the biopsy from matched noncancerous tissue exhibited mutation in pten kras or pikca gene conclusion these result suggest that detecting pathogenic mutation in oncogene or tumour suppressor gene in an otherwise benign condition is associated with a risk of developing a malignant disease given the identification of mutation several month or year before the appearance of a malignancy our finding suggests that a closer monitoring of patient who present such molecular alteration in noncancerous uterine mass is warranted

combined_text: molecular biomarkers predicting early development of endometrial carcinoma a pilot study objective endometrial carcinoma represents the most common gynaecological cancer and the sixth most frequent cancer among woman worldwide the year survival of patient with stage i endometrial carcinoma is versus for stage iii or for stage iv disease therefore early detection could improve survival rate specifically in the most prevalent type endometrial cancer develops from hyperplastic endometrium the aim of the study wa to evaluate the utility of cancer gene mutation from endometrial biopsy towards predicting synchronous or metachronous development of malignant lesion the aim of the study wa to evaluate whether endometrial biopsy could already carry mutation in cancer gene useful for predicting or anticipating subsequent cancer development method patient with a previous endometrial biopsy negative for cancer followed by a subsequent biopsy positive for cancer were included in the study a fifty cancer gene targeted nextgeneration sequencing panel were used to investigate mutation in matched noncancerous and malignant sample result all biopsy from cancer tissue harboured mutation in one or more of the following gene apc ctnnb fbxw hnfa kras mtor nra pikca pten rb and tp additionally of the biopsy from matched noncancerous tissue exhibited mutation in pten kras or pikca gene conclusion these result suggest that detecting pathogenic mutation in oncogene or tumour suppressor gene in an otherwise benign condition is associated with a risk of developing a malignant disease given the identification of mutation several month or year before the appearance of a malignancy our finding suggests that a closer monitoring of patient who present such molecular alteration in noncancerous uterine mass is warranted

title: fluorescence in situ hybridization fish for detecting anaplastic lymphoma kinase alk rearrangement in lung cancer clinically relevant technical aspect
abstract: in the vysis break apart alk fluorescence in situ hybridization fish assay wa approved by the united state food and drug administration a a companion diagnostic for detecting alk rearrangement in lung cancer patient who may benefit from treatment of tyrosine kinase inhibitor therapy this assay is the current gold standard according to updated alk testing guideline from the college of american pathologist the international association for the study of lung cancer and the association for molecular pathology published in alk immunohistochemistry is formally an alternative to alk fish and simultaneous detection of multiple hot spot including at least alk ro ret met erbb braf and kras gene is also recommended while performing next generation sequencing ngsbased testing therefore alk status in a specimen can be tested by different method and platform even in the same institution or laboratory in this review we discus several clinically relevant technical aspect of alk fish including pro and con of the unique twostep to cell analysis approach employed in the vysis break apart alk fish assay including the preset cutoff value of for a positive result technical aspect and biology of discordant result obtained by different method and incidental finding such a alk copy number gain or amplification and coexistent driver mutation these issue have practical implication for alk testing in the clinical laboratory following the updated guideline
label: Cancer

title: ilrstatadar p interplay promotes oncogenicity in multiple myeloma with q amplification
abstract: q amplification is an important prognostic marker in multiple myeloma in this study we identified that ilr the interleukin membrane receptor and adar an rna editing enzyme are critical gene located within the minimally amplified q region loss of individual gene caused suppression to the oncogenic phenotype the magnitude of which wa enhanced when both gene were concomitantly lost mechanistically ilr and adar collaborated to induce a hyperactivation of the oncogenic stat pathway high ilr confers hypersensitivity to interleukin binding whereas adar form a constitutive feedforward loop with stat in a pisoformpredominant manner in this respect adarp act a a direct transcriptional target for stat and this statinducedp in turn directly interacts with and stabilizes the former protein leading to a larger pool of protein acting a oncogenic transcription factor for prosurvival gene the importance of both ilr and adarp in stat signaling wa further validated when concomitant knockdown of both gene impeded ilinducedstat pathway activation clinical evaluation of various datasets of myeloma patient showed that low expression of either one or both gene wa closely associated with a compromised stat signature confirming the involvement of ilr and adar in the stat pathway and underscoring their essential role in disease pathogenesis in summary our finding highlight the complexity of the stat pathway in myeloma in association with q amplification this study therefore reveals a novel perspective on q abnormality in myeloma and a potential therapeutic target for this cohort of highrisk patient
label: Cancer

title: mycn amplification drive an aggressive form of spinal ependymoma
abstract: spinal ependymal tumor form a histologically and molecularly heterogeneous group of tumor with generally good prognosis however their treatment can be challenging if infiltration of the spinal cord or dissemination throughout the central nervous system cns occurs and in these case clinical outcome remains poor here we describe a new and relatively rare subgroup of spinal ependymal tumor identified using dna methylation profiling that is distinct from other molecular subgroup of ependymoma copy number variation plot derived from dna methylation array showed mycn amplification a a characteristic genetic alteration in all case of our cohort n which wa subsequently validated using fluorescence in situ hybridization the histological diagnosis wa anaplastic ependymoma who grade iii in ten case and classic ependymoma who grade ii in three case histological reevaluation in five primary tumor and seven relapse showed characteristic histological feature of ependymoma namely pseudorosettes gfap and ema positivity electron microscopy revealed cilium complex intercellular junction and intermediate filament in a representative sample taking these finding into account we suggest to designate this molecular subgroup spinal ependymoma with mycn amplification spepnmycn spepnmycn tumor showed distinct growth pattern with intradural extramedullary localization mostly within the thoracic and cervical spine diffuse leptomeningeal spread throughout the whole cns and infiltrative invasion of the spinal cord dissemination wa observed in of case despite highintensity treatment spepnmycn showed significantly worse median progression free survival pfs month and median overall survival o month than all other previously described molecular spinal ependymoma subgroup o and pfs were similar to supratentorial ependymoma with relafusion stepnrela and posterior fossa ependymoma a pfepna further highlighting the aggressiveness of this distinct new subgroup we therefore propose to establish spepnmycn a a new molecular subgroup in ependymoma and advocate for testing newly diagnosed spinal ependymal tumor for mycn amplification
label: Cancer

title: understanding the mechanism of resistance in egfrpositive nsclc from tissue to liquid biopsy to guide treatment strategy
abstract: liquid biopsy ha emerged a an alternative source of nucleic acid for the management of epidermal growth factor receptor egfrmutant nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc the use of circulating cellfree dna cfdna ha been recently introduced in clinical practice resulting in the improvement of the identification of druggable egfr mutation for the diagnosis and monitoring of response to targeted therapy egfrdependent tm and c mutation and independent mesenchymal epithelial transition met gene amplification kirsten rat sarcoma kras phosphatidylinositol bisphosphate kinase catalytic subunit alpha isoform pikca and raf murine sarcoma viral oncogene homolog b braf gene mutation mechanism of resistance to egfr tyrosine kinase inhibitor tkis have been evaluated in plasma sample from nsclc patient using highly sensitive method ie digital droplet pcr next generation sequencing allowing for the switch to other therapy therefore liquid biopsy is a noninvasive method able to detect the molecular dynamic change that occur under the pressure of treatment and to capture tumor heterogeneity more efficiently than is allowed by tissue biopsy this review address how liquid biopsy may be used to guide the choice of treatment strategy in egfrmutant nsclc
label: Cancer

title: current state of biomarkers for the diagnosis and assessment of treatment efficacy of prostate cancer
abstract: in recent year with the westernization of lifestyle reduced physical activity and increased prostatespecific antigen psa testing the incidence of prostate cancer pca ha risen significantly in developing country currently psa is the only pca biomarker applied clinically but it doe not perform well in the early diagnosis and distinguishing between benign prostatic hyperplasia and prostate cancer with the advance in deep sequencing technology a series of new pca biomarkers have been recently proposed to improve the diagnostic value of psa such a prostate cancer antigen pca tmprssets fusion gene microrna and other regulatory noncoding rna in addition the prostate health index phi ha been approved by the u food and drug administration fda for clinical use in the detection of pca the prostatespecific membrane antigen psma ha been confirmed to be specifically expressed on the surface of pca cell in this review we provide an updated summary of the value and feature of these novel biomarkers in the diagnosis and treatment of pca
label: Cancer
