title: unusual synchronous double primary treatmentnaive lung adenocarcinoma harboring tm and lr mutation in earlystage lung cancer
abstract: background concurrent mutation of synchronous multiple primary nonsmall cell lung cancer smpnsclc is rare and only a few case have been reported herein we present a case of earlystage smpnsclc with tm and lr mutation case presentation a yearold male patient presented to the thoracic surgery department due to a tumor in the right lower lung the tumor wa detected more than year previously during a health examination however the patient ignored the problem because the clinician at that time stated that the lesion wa highly likely to be benign chest computed topography ct wa ordered and the image showed a welldefined tumor in the right lower lung and a faint nodular lesion over the left lower lung field a ctguided biopsy result showed the presence of atypical cell and positive staining of ttf and ck surgical intervention wa performed the right and leftsided tumor disclosed micropapillary predominant adenocarcinoma and acinarpredominant adenocarcinoma respectively both tumor were positive for ttf but negative for alk and p realtime pcr analysis showed that the rightsided tumor had an epidermal growth factor receptor egfr mutation presenting a point mutation tm in exon while the leftsided tumor had a point mutation lr in exon of egfr conclusion our patient case suggests that tumor resembling a benign pattern with central calcification may be misdiagnosed thus early screening for lung cancer is important and intensive effort to make a diagnosis through surgical resection or biopsy to allow for tailored optimal treatment may be preferential for the best patient outcome
label: Cancer

title: ffdgpetbased radiomics signature predicts mgmt promoter methylation status in primary diffuse glioma
abstract: background the methylation status of the omethylguaninedna methyltransferase mgmt promoter ha emerged a a favorable independent prognostic and predictive biomarker in glioma this study aimed to build a radiomics signature based on ffluorodeoxyglucose fdg positron emission tomography pet for noninvasive measurement of the mgmt promoter methylation status in glioma method one hundred and seven pathologyconfirmed primary diffuse glioma patient were retrospectively included and randomly assigned to the primary n or validation cohort n the mgmt promoter methylation status wa measured by pyrosequencing a total of radiomics feature were extracted from the threedimensional region of interest roi on the standard uptake value suv map that were generated from the original ffdg pet data a radiomics signature a clinical signature and a fusion signature that combined the clinical and radiomics feature together were generated the performance of the three signature wa evaluated by receiver operating characteristic roc curve analysis and the patient prognosis wa stratified based on the mgmt promoter methylation status and the signature with the best performance result five radiomics feature were selected to construct the radiomics signature and displayed the best performance with area under the receiver operating characteristic roc curve auc reaching and in the primary and validation cohort respectively which outweigh the performance of clinical signature and fusion signature with a median followup time of month the radiomics signature stratified the glioma patient into two risk group with significantly different prognosis p conclusion ffdgpetbased radiomics is a promising approach for preoperatively evaluating the mgmt promoter methylation status in glioma and predicting the prognosis of glioma patient noninvasively
label: Cancer

title: androgen receptor expression in triple negative breast carcinoma and it association with the clinicopathological parameter
abstract: introduction androgen receptor ar is the most frequently expressed biomarker in all subtypes of breast carcinoma triple negative breast carcinoma tnbc is breast carcinoma that lack oestrogen and progesterone receptor immunoexpression a well a absence of herneu gene amplification this make targeted therapy not feasible in this cancer and hence ha poorer prognosis detecting ar expression could be another milestone in the management of tnbc a ar is a prognostic predictive marker and potential index for targeted treatment this study aimed to assess expression of ar in tnbc by immunohistochemistry and it association with clinicopathological parameter method we analysed the expression of ar in tnbc case from penang general hospital for a period of year to androgen receptor immunoreactivity wa considered positive if of tumour cell nucleus were stained irrespective of staining intensity result the prevalence of ar expression in tnbc wa with the proportion of arpositive tumour cell ranged from to these include invasive carcinoma no special type nst and other invasive carcinoma subtypes papillary lobular clear cell and medullary carcinoma sixtyseven case that showed ar immunonegativity were invasive carcinoma nst n clear cell carcinoma n and metaplastic carcinoma n androgen receptor immunoexpression wa inversely correlated with tumour grade p but not the tumour stage tumour size and nodal status conclusion ar is expressed in about onethird of tnbc and loss of ar immunoexpression doe not predict adverse clinical outcome larger cohort for better characterisation of the role of ar immunoexpression in tnbc are warranted
label: Cancer

title: highthroughput assessment of the antibody profile in ovarian cancer ascitic fluid
abstract: the identification of effective biomarkers for early diagnosis prognosis and response to treatment remains a challenge in ovarian cancer oc research here we present an unbiased highthroughput approach to profile ascitic fluid autoantibody in order to obtain a tumorspecific antigen signature in oc we first reported the reactivity of immunoglobulin ig purified from oc patient ascites towards two different oc cell line using a discovery set of ig we selected tumorspecific antigen from a phage display cdna library after biopanning protein were expressed a fusion protein and used in protein array to enable largescale immunoscreening with independent set of cancer and noncancerous control finally the selected antigen were validated by elisa the initial screening identified eight antigenic clone creb mrpl exosc bcor hmgn hipr olfm and kiaa these antigen were all validated by elisa in a study involving ascitic ig from patient with oc with other cancer and without cancer with creb showing the highest sensitivity and specificity notably we were able to identify an association between the tumorassociated ta antibody response and the response to a firstline tumor treatment platinumbased chemotherapy a stronger association wa found by combining three antigen bcor creb and mrlp a a single antibody signature measurement of an ascitic fluid antibody response to multiple ta antigen may aid in the identification of new prognostic signature in oc patient and shift attention to new potentially relevant target
label: Cancer

title: mutation spectrum of cancerassociated gene in patient with early onset of colorectal cancer
abstract: background colorectal cancer crc incidence is rising worldwide a well a in the republic of kazakhstan while it occurrence is also increasing in the younger population hereditary form associated with the development of colon and rectal cancer and earlyonset crc have never been studied in the population of kazakhstan the aim of this research wa to investigate the spectrum of crcrelated gene mutation to determine which mutation cause early onset of crc in the kazakhstan population method the study included unrelated patient from kazakhstan range year in age with early onset crc genomic dna wa obtained from peripheral blood of the patient nextgeneration sequencing wa performed using the trusightcancer kit on the miseq platform the studio variant wa used to annotate and interpret genetic variant result bioinformatics analysis of nextgeneration sequencing data revealed variant from gene of them missense synonymous variant utr variant frameshift variant five stopgain variant four inframe deletion two splice donor one splice acceptor variant and intron or noncoding variant apc brca alk brip egfr fanca fancd fanci hnfa men nsd pm recql ret slx wrn and xpc gene mutated most often according to the acmg guideline and lovdclinvar database variant were pathogenic frameshifts five missenses five stopgain one inframe deletion and three splicesite mutation and were vus with population frequency of them were attributed a deleterious in the study of all pathogenic mutation found in kazakhstani patient with early crc onset were identified in the subgroup with a family history of crc and primary multiple tumor in apc pathogenic mutation were most often conclusion pathogenic and likely pathogenic mutation were found in out of patient eight novel pathogenic mutation detected in fanci apc bmpr atm and dicer gene have not been reported in previous literature given the high frequency and wide spectrum of mutation ng analysis must be carried out in family with a history of crccrcrelated cancer with the purpose to identify causeeffective mutation clarify the clinical diagnosis and prevent the development of the disease in other family member

title: molecular cytogenetic analysis of patient with plasma cell myeloma in tolna and baranya county in hungary
abstract: introduction plasma cell myeloma is a hematological malignancy with heterogeneous genomic landscape and diverse clinical course recurrent chromosomal and subchromosomal aberration commonly occur in this entity and are associated with the pathogenesis and progression of the disease the identification of these alteration aid genetic characterization classification and prognostication of patient aim molecular cytogenetic investigation of plasma cell myeloma patient treated at the university of pecs clinical center and janos balassa county hospital of tolna county szekszard between and were evaluated in our study method patient were screened for genetic aberration using fluorescence in situ hybridization translocation involving the immunoglobulin heavy chain gene loss of p and p chromosome arm gain of q chromosome arm and unbalanced aberration of chromosome were investigated loss and gain of p q q p q q and p chromosome arm were analyzed using multiplex ligationdependent probe amplification in patient during the investigated period bone marrow karyotyping wa also performed result in total genetic aberration were identified using our targeted approach the frequency of specific aberration correlated with data of the recent literature concordance of result gained by fluorescence in situ hybridization and multiplex ligationdependent probe amplification wa by analyzing the same chromosome arm the latter technique revealed additional genetic aberration in patient sample a compared to fluorescence in situ hybridization conclusion our result suggest that the combined application of the two molecular cytogenetic method may facilitate a more detailed characterization of genetic aberration of plasma cell myeloma patient in hungary orv hetil
label: Cancer

title: melanocytic skin neoplasm what lesson from genomic aberration
abstract: study on the genomic aberration in melanocytic neoplasm have shown a complex genomic landscape in nevus and melanoma a mapkinase pathway activation wa generally found produced by different chromosomal aberration including braf nra hras gnaq gna bap ctnnb mapk prkara and nf mutation and alk ro ntrk ret met braf ntrk and prkca fusion melanoma also showed a variable number of additional mutation ablating tumorsuppression mechanism and activating other oncogenic pathway including cdkna loss pten loss a well a tp and tertpromoter mutation moreover borderline melanocytic tumor displayed the same chromosomal aberration but more mutation than nevus and fewer than melanoma in this context the notion that melanocytic neoplasm can be classified a benignmalignant is hardly supportable because all neoplasm harbor a certain number of mutation and the progression risk that is the malignant potential is related and proportional to the burden of pathogenic mutation moreover from the genomic analysis in parallel to the current diagnostic category of nevus melanoma and melanocytomas some aggregation or class of tumor based on the characteristic type of driver mutationsfusions emerge a possible and more rationale including spitzoid neoplasm blue neoplasm bapinactivated melanocytic neoplasm deep penetrating melanocytic neoplasm pigmentsynthesizing melanocytic neoplasm and common melanocytic neoplasm each of these class showing the same driver mutationsfusions demonstrates to have the same pathogenesis and may be genetically considered a a single tumor although with a variable amount of progression risk histologic feature being an expression of the mutational state could be used to obtain an approximate risk assessment in each single tumor
label: Cancer
combined_text: melanocytic skin neoplasm what lesson from genomic aberration study on the genomic aberration in melanocytic neoplasm have shown a complex genomic landscape in nevus and melanoma a mapkinase pathway activation wa generally found produced by different chromosomal aberration including braf nra hras gnaq gna bap ctnnb mapk prkara and nf mutation and alk ro ntrk ret met braf ntrk and prkca fusion melanoma also showed a variable number of additional mutation ablating tumorsuppression mechanism and activating other oncogenic pathway including cdkna loss pten loss a well a tp and tertpromoter mutation moreover borderline melanocytic tumor displayed the same chromosomal aberration but more mutation than nevus and fewer than melanoma in this context the notion that melanocytic neoplasm can be classified a benignmalignant is hardly supportable because all neoplasm harbor a certain number of mutation and the progression risk that is the malignant potential is related and proportional to the burden of pathogenic mutation moreover from the genomic analysis in parallel to the current diagnostic category of nevus melanoma and melanocytomas some aggregation or class of tumor based on the characteristic type of driver mutationsfusions emerge a possible and more rationale including spitzoid neoplasm blue neoplasm bapinactivated melanocytic neoplasm deep penetrating melanocytic neoplasm pigmentsynthesizing melanocytic neoplasm and common melanocytic neoplasm each of these class showing the same driver mutationsfusions demonstrates to have the same pathogenesis and may be genetically considered a a single tumor although with a variable amount of progression risk histologic feature being an expression of the mutational state could be used to obtain an approximate risk assessment in each single tumor

title: gonadal failure is common in longterm survivor of childhood highrisk neuroblastoma treated with highdose chemotherapy and autologous stem cell rescue
abstract: background neuroblastoma is the most common extracranial solid tumor in child intensive therapy including autologous stemcell transplantation hsct ha improved the poor prognosis of highrisk neuroblastoma hrnbl but may impair gonadal function objective to investigate the gonadal function and fertility in longterm survivor of childhood hrnbl design a cohort including all finnish n female longterm year survivor of hrnbl and an age and sexmatched control group n wa examined at a median age of year oncologic treatment pubertal timing hormonal therapy and the number of offspring were recorded and pituitary and gonadal hormone were measured result altogether of the longterm survivor of hrnbl entered puberty spontaneously puberty wa hormonally induced in four survivor three female among the female survivor with spontaneous puberty seven had spontaneous menarche but developed ovarian failure soon after puberty nine female currently needed estrogen substitution amh a marker of ovarian reserve wa lower in the female survivor than control median v mugl p a a group male survivor had smaller testicular size v ml p and lower inhibin b v ngl p compared with control male with altogether survivor male fulfilling the criterion of gonadal failure absent puberty small testicle size or increased fsh with need of testosterone substitution gonadal failure wa more common in female and male survivor treated with totalbody irradiation three survivor one male had offspring all treated without totalbody irradiation and moderate dose of alkylating chemotherapy growth velocity wa compromised in all survivor after hrnbl diagnosis with absent pubertal growth spurt in survivor with complete growth data conclusion gonadal failure is common in longterm survivor of hrnbl treated with hsct fertility may be preserved in some survivor treated without totalbody irradiation
label: Cancer

title: management of tumor rupture and abdominal compartment syndrome in an infant with bilateral high risk stage neuroblastoma a case report
abstract: rationale tumor rupture and bleeding at initial presentation of infant with neuroblastoma nbl is a rare but life threatening condition and challenge in pediatric oncology here we report successful multidisciplinary management of an abdominal compartment syndrome a a result of tumor rupture and bleeding in an infant with bilateral high risk stage nbl patient concern the patient wa admitted to a cooperating hospital with vomiting failure to thrive and a large mass in the abdomen and wa then referred to our center diagnosis stage nbl with mycn amplification and p deletion wa diagnosed in an month old girl due to rapid and massive tumor growth she developed abdominal compression with renal failure severe bleeding and tumor lysis syndrome tl intervention surgical decompression by enterostomy local and systemic bleeding control with platelet and coagulation factor antiinfective and tl therapy were effective in stabilizing the patient condition this allowed initiation of the multimodal antineoplastic treatment according to protocol nb outcome mechanical ventilation wa stopped after day the abdominal wall wa closed month after the start of therapy and treatment according to the protocol be started and successfully completed lesson only the immediate coordinated multidisciplinary intervention managed to overcome the lifethreatening abdominal compartment syndrome and it associated problem eventually enabling successful curative treatment
label: Cancer

title: malignant pleural effusion and it current management a review
abstract: malignant pleural effusion mpe is an exudative effusion with malignant cell mpe is a common symptom and accompanying manifestation of metastatic disease it affect up to of all patient with cancer and is the most common in lung breast cancer lymphoma gynecological malignancy and malignant mesothelioma in the last year many study were performed focusing on the pathophysiological mechanism of mpe with the advancement in molecular technique the importance of tumorhost cell interaction is becoming more apparent additionally the process of pathogenesis is greatly affected by activating mutation of egfr kras pikca braf met emlalk and ret which correlate with an increased incidence of mpe considering all these change the author aim to present a literature review of the newest finding review of the guideline and pathophysiological novelty in this field review of the just recently after seven year published practice guideline a well a analysis of more than article from the pubmed medline database that were almost exclusively published in indexed journal in the last few year have relevance and contribute to the better understanding of the presented topic mpe still present a severe medical condition in patient with advanced malignancy recent finding in the field of pathophysiological mechanism of mpe emphasize the role of molecular factor and mutation in the dynamic of the disease and it prognosis treatment guideline offer a patientcentric approach with the use of new scoring system an out of hospital approach and ultrasound the current guideline address multiple area of interest bring novelty in the form of validated prediction tool and can based on evidence improve patient outcome however the role of biomarkers in a clinical setting possible new treatment modality and certain specific situation still present a challenge for new research
label: Cancer

title: multiple hemorragic brain lesion revealing metastatic melanoma
abstract: nearly of patient with metastatic melanoma develop brain metastasis we here report the case of an yearold woman hospitalized for secondarily generalized clonic seizure of the left leg with partial convulsive seizure in the resuscitation department melanoma resection of the left ankle had been performed month before her admission neurological examination showed left ataxic crural monoparesis electroencephalogram showed central and right frontal focus with leftsided dissemination gadoliniumenhanced magnetic resonance imaging mri of the brain showed multiple supratentorial and subtentorial encephalic lesion with varying size and shape with t hypersignal a and a haemorrhage on tweighted sequence b and b gadoliniumenhancing t with perilesional edema on flair sequence positron emission tomography pet showed multiple lymph node and bone metastasis lymph node biopsy wa negative for ve antibody with no brafve mutation by immunohistochemistry an increase in the number of metastatic lesion wa observed during control brain ct scan despite brain radiotherapy session motivating palliative care epileptic seizure were controlled with levetiracetam in patient with multiple hemorrhagic and spontaneous brain lesion it is essential to obtain information on patient history of melanoma and to perform a thorough dermatologic examination in order to investigate it cause and to establish adequate therapeutic treatment
label: Cancer

title: how many papilla in conventional papillary carcinoma a clinical evidencebased pathology study of unifocal encapsulated papillary thyroid carcinoma with emphasis on the diagnosis of noninvasive follicular thyroid neoplasm with papillarylike nuclear feature
abstract: background the percentage of papilla is a crucial criterion in differentiating noninvasive follicular thyroid neoplasm with papillarylike nuclear feature niftp from papillary thyroid carcinoma ptcs and in subclassifying ptc into classic and follicular variant since the description of niftp three study have shown that the presence of any papilla may be associated with nodal metastasis which led to modification of the niftp criterion from papilla compared with in the nnx group nodal metastasis were only present in tumor with papilla in noninvasive ueptc n n disease wa seen only in tumor with papilla a higher percentage of papilla within the tumor also correlated with an increased frequency of brafve and decreased rate of nrasqr none of the nraspositive case had nodal disease including the invasive tumor among patient with followup median year patient had distant metastasis all detected at the initial presentation all three tumor displayed follicular growth and capsular or vascular invasion there wa no locoregional recurrence in the entire cohort conclusion in ueptc there is a strong correlation between high percentage of papillary growth presence of nodal metastasis and brafras genotype regardless of invasive status nodal metastasis were not seen in tumor with papilla irrespective of invasive status these finding indicate that the initial criterion of papilla is still valid for the diagnosis of niftp reinstituting this criterion will spare a carcinoma diagnosis and unnecessary therapy with it side effect on patient who have negligible clinical risk
label: Cancer

title: mirap regulates proliferation and apoptosis of colon cancer cell by potentially targeting btg
abstract: microrna mirmirnaap ha been reported to be abnormally expressed in various type of cancer including colorectal cancer crc bcell translocation gene btg ha also been implicated with crc however the association between mirap and btg in crc to the best of our knowledge ha not been investigated in order to assess whether mirap is associated with crc reverse transcriptionquantitative pcr wa performed on paired crc and paracancerous tissue for mirna analysis for the screening and validation of mirap expression in colon cancer several colon cancer cell line hct hct sw ht lovo and caco and the normal colorectal epithelial cell line ncm were examined the highest expression level of mirap were detected in the hct which wa selected for further experimentation the hct cell were divided into control mirap mimic and inhibitor group and cell proliferation wa tested using an mtt assay additionally mirap inhibitormimic or btg plasmid were transfected into the hct cell and flow cytometry wa performed to analyze cell cycle distribution tunel analysis wa performed to detect apoptosis protein level of factor in the downstream signaling pathway mediated by mirap erkmitogenactivated extracellular signalregulated kinase mek were detected mirap wa revealed to be overexpressed in human crc tissue and colon cancer cell line knockdown of mirap suppressed proliferation of hct cell and apoptosis wa increased it further markedly upregulated expression level of btg and inhibited activation of protein of the erkmek signaling pathway in addition overexpression of btg in hct cell triggered g phase cell cycle arrest and increased apoptosis via the erkmek signaling pathway in conclusion the present study demonstrated that the effect of mirap on colon cancer cell proliferation and apoptosis were similar to those of the tumor suppressor gene btg the mirapbtg axis may have potential implication for diagnostic and therapeutic approach in crc

title: alk rearrangement a highfrequency alteration in ovarian metastasis from lung adenocarcinoma
abstract: background ovarian metastatic tumor from lung adenocarcinoma are rare and a serial study of these tumor is lacking to date additionally a better understanding of the clinicopathological and molecular characteristic of metastatic tumor is needed method seven case of ovarian metastasis from lung adenocarcinoma from to at our institute were investigated the result were combined with those found in literature review a total of case were analyzed in the present study we examined clinicopathological and immunohistochemical characteristic further detected alk rearrangement by fish fluorescence in situ hybridization and assessed egfr and kras mutation using sanger sequencing or the amplification refractory mutation system arm result the mean age of the patient wa year range year eleven of sixteen patient developed ovarian tumor within a mean time of month range month from the initial diagnosis of lung adenocarcinoma patient had lung tumor and ovarian mass simultaneously five tumor occurred in the bilateral ovary and the others were unilateral ovarian tumor all seven case from our institute were positive for ttf and napsin a but negative for pax in four case alk df wa diffusely and strongly expressed with alk rearrangement overall alk rearrangement wa found by fish or immunohistochemistry in case in two case egfr mutation in exon and respectively were found one patient did not detected egfr or alk mutation in the metastatic tumor but the primary lung adenocarcinoma did harbor an egfr mutation two case had no alteration in three gene above although the mean survival time of the patient with alk rearrangement wa longer than those without mean survival time m v m no statistical significance of the difference wa found conclusion a the largest case series of ovarian metastasis from lung adenocarcinoma our finding indicate that alk rearrangement is the most common molecular alteration although patient with alk rearrangement appear to have a better prognosis than do those without alk rearrangement more case with longer followup and multivariant analysis are needed to clarify this point

title: adenomatous polyposis coli a a major regulator of human embryonic stem cell selfrenewal
abstract: human embryonic stem cell hescs provide an essential tool to investigate early human development study disease pathogenesis and examine therapeutic intervention adenomatous polyposis coli apc is a negative regulator of wntbetacatenin signaling implicated in the majority of sporadic colorectal cancer and in the autosomal dominant inherited syndrome familial adenomatous polyposis fap study into the role of wntbetacatenin signaling in hescs arrived at conflicting result due at least in part to variation in culture condition and the use of external inhibitor and agonist here we directly targeted apc in hescs carrying a germline apc mutation derived from affected blastocyst following preimplantation genetic diagnosis pgd for fap in order to answer open question regarding the role of apc in regulating pluripotency and differentiation potential of hescs using clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeat crisprcrispr associated protein ca we generated second hit apc mutation in faphescs despite high crisprcas targeting efficiency and the successful isolation of many clone none of the isolated clone carried a loss of function mutation in the wildtype wt apc allele using a fluorescent betacatenin reporter and analysis of mutatedallele frequency in the apc locus we show that apc double mutant hescs robustly activate wntbetacatenin signaling that result in rapid differentiation to endodermal and mesodermal lineage here we provide direct evidence for a strict requirement for constant betacatenin degradation through the apc destruction complex in order to maintain pluripotency highlighting a fundamental role for apc in selfrenewal of hescs stem cell
label: Cancer

title: haploinsufficiency of nrc drive glucocorticoid resistance in adult acute lymphoblastic leukemia cell by downregulating the mitochondrial apoptosis axis and is sensitive to bcl blockage
abstract: background relapse represents the leading cause of death in both child and adult patient with acute lymphoblastic leukemia all development of chemoresistance is ultimately responsible for treatment failure and relapse therefore understanding the molecular basis underlying resistance is imperative for developing innovative treatment strategy glucocorticoid gc such dexamethasone and prednisolone are the backbone of combination chemotherapy regimen for treating all lymphoid tumor however the biological mechanism of primary gc resistance in all is not completely understood we previously performed a longitudinal wholeexome sequencing analysis on diagnosisrelapse pair from adult patient with all our data revealed that relapsespecific truncation mutation in the nrc gene encoding the gc receptor are frequently detected method in the current study we used discoverybased strategy including rna sequencing rnaseq and crisprcas followed by confirmatory testing in human all cell line bone marrow blast sample from all patient and xenograft model to elucidate the mechanism responsible for resistance result our result revealed a positive correlation between endogenous expression of nrc in all cell and sensitivity to gc and clinical outcome we further confirmed that ectopic expression of nrc in all cell could reverse gc resistance while deletion of nrc confers resistance to gc in all cell line and xenograft model rnaseq analysis revealed a remarkable abundance of gene signature involved in pathway in cancer dna replication mismatch repair p signalling cell cycle and apoptosis regulated by nrc significantly increased expression of proapoptotic gene including bcllbim bmf bad bax and bok and decreased transcription of antiapoptotic gene including bcl bcll and bag were observed in gcresistant all cell following ectopic expression of nrc finally we explored that gc resistance in all cell with haploinsufficiency of nrc can be treated with bcl blockage conclusion our finding suggest that the status of nrc gene mutation and basal expression level of nrc in all cell are associated with sensitivity to gc and clinical treatment outcome early intervention strategy by rational combination of bcl blockage may constitute a promising new treatment option to gcresistant all and significantly improving the chance of treating poor prednisone responder
label: Cancer

title: association of caspase polymorphism n insdel and asphis with progressionfree survival and tumor infiltrating lymphocyte in early breast cancer
abstract: the caspase variant casp n insdel and asphis have previously been identified to promote survival of tlymphocytes and to indicate reduced breast cancer susceptibility besides some preliminary finding prognostic relevance of these polymorphism in patient with existing breast cancer ha not been investigated considering an immunomodulatory role of these polymorphism we genotyped early breast cancer patient and correlated caspase variant with diseasefree survival dfs and the presence of tumor infiltrating lymphocyte tils early breast cancer specimen were collected a part of the multicenter prospective pia study genotyping wa performed by pyrosequencing tils status wa assessed using hematoxylin eosin staining the casp del variant wa significantly associated with improved dfs in an alleledose dependent manner p homozygosity for the del variant wa an independent predictor for improved dfs hr ci p in patient with the hishis genotype there wa no event of recurrence during observation time combined analysis of diplotypes revealed an influence of both polymorphism on dfs p interestingly patient with the hishis variant among the unstratified patient cohort and among the luminallike subtype by trend had tumor with lower lymphocyte infiltration p we propose a prognostically favorable role of the del and the his variant in primary breast cancer and suggest for the first time an association between polymorphism in apoptosisrelated gene and the immunophenotype in breast cancer our finding encourage further investigation of caspase polymorphism a biomarkers for prognostic and immunotherapeutic consideration
label: Cancer

title: medication use to reduce risk of breast cancer u preventive service task force recommendation statement
abstract: importance breast cancer is the most common nonskin cancer among woman in the united state and the second leading cause of cancer death the median age at diagnosis is year and an estimated in woman will develop breast cancer at some point in their lifetime african american woman are more likely to die of breast cancer compared with woman of other race objective to update the u preventive service task force uspstf recommendation on medication for risk reduction of primary breast cancer evidence review the uspstf reviewed evidence on the accuracy of risk assessment method to identify woman who could benefit from riskreducing medication for breast cancer a well a evidence on the effectiveness adverse effect and subgroup variation of these medication the uspstf reviewed evidence from randomized trial observational study and diagnostic accuracy study of risk stratification model in woman without preexisting breast cancer or ductal carcinoma in situ finding the uspstf found convincing evidence that risk assessment tool can predict the number of case of breast cancer expected to develop in a population however these risk assessment tool perform modestly at best in discriminating between individual woman who will or will not develop breast cancer the uspstf found convincing evidence that riskreducing medication tamoxifen raloxifene or aromatase inhibitor provide at least a moderate benefit in reducing risk for invasive estrogen receptorpositive breast cancer in postmenopausal woman at increased risk for breast cancer the uspstf found that the benefit of taking tamoxifen raloxifene and aromatase inhibitor to reduce risk for breast cancer are no greater than small in woman not at increased risk for the disease the uspstf found convincing evidence that tamoxifen and raloxifene and adequate evidence that aromatase inhibitor are associated with small to moderate harm overall the uspstf determined that the net benefit of taking medication to reduce risk of breast cancer is larger in woman who have a greater risk for developing breast cancer conclusion and recommendation the uspstf recommends that clinician offer to prescribe riskreducing medication such a tamoxifen raloxifene or aromatase inhibitor to woman who are at increased risk for breast cancer and at low risk for adverse medication effect b recommendation the uspstf recommends against the routine use of riskreducing medication such a tamoxifen raloxifene or aromatase inhibitor in woman who are not at increased risk for breast cancer d recommendation this recommendation applies to asymptomatic woman year and older including woman with previous benign breast lesion on biopsy such a atypical ductal or lobular hyperplasia and lobular carcinoma in situ this recommendation doe not apply to woman who have a current or previous diagnosis of breast cancer or ductal carcinoma in situ
label: Cancer

primary breast cancer evidence review the uspstf reviewed evidence on the accuracy of risk assessment method to identify woman who could benefit from riskreducing medication for breast cancer a well a evidence on the effectiveness adverse effect and subgroup variation of these medication the uspstf reviewed evidence from randomized trial observational study and diagnostic accuracy study of risk stratification model in woman without preexisting breast cancer or ductal carcinoma in situ finding the uspstf found convincing evidence that risk assessment tool can predict the number of case of breast cancer expected to develop in a population however these risk assessment tool perform modestly at best in discriminating between individual woman who will or will not develop breast cancer the uspstf found convincing evidence that riskreducing medication tamoxifen raloxifene or aromatase inhibitor provide at least a moderate benefit in reducing risk for invasive estrogen receptorpositive breast cancer in postmenopausal woman at increased risk for breast cancer the uspstf found that the benefit of taking tamoxifen raloxifene and aromatase inhibitor to reduce risk for breast cancer are no greater than small in woman not at increased risk for the disease the uspstf found convincing evidence that tamoxifen and raloxifene and adequate evidence that aromatase inhibitor are associated with small to moderate harm overall the uspstf determined that the net benefit of taking medication to reduce risk of breast cancer is larger in woman who have a greater risk for developing breast cancer conclusion and recommendation the uspstf recommends that clinician offer to prescribe riskreducing medication such a tamoxifen raloxifene or aromatase inhibitor to woman who are at increased risk for breast cancer and at low risk for adverse medication effect b recommendation the uspstf recommends against the routine use of riskreducing medication such a tamoxifen raloxifene or aromatase inhibitor in woman who are not at increased risk for breast cancer d recommendation this recommendation applies to asymptomatic woman year and older including woman with previous benign breast lesion on biopsy such a atypical ductal or lobular hyperplasia and lobular carcinoma in situ this recommendation doe not apply to woman who have a current or previous diagnosis of breast cancer or ductal carcinoma in situ

title: the origin and pathogenesis of endometriosis
abstract: recent molecular genetic finding on endometriosis and normal endometrium suggest a modified model in which circulating epithelial progenitor or stem cell intended to regenerate uterine endometrium after menstruation may become overreactive and trapped outside the uterus these trapped epitheliumcommitted progenitor cell form nascent gland through clonal expansion and recruit polyclonal stromal cell leading to the establishment of deep infiltrating endometriosis once formed the ectopic tissue becomes subject to immune surveillance resulting in chronic inflammation the inflammatory response orchestrated by nuclear factorkappab signaling is exacerbated by aberration in the estrogen receptorbeta and progesterone receptor pathway which are also affected by local inflammation forming a dysregulated inflammationhormonal loop glandular epithelium within endometriotic tissue harbor cancerassociated mutation that are frequently detected in endometriosisrelated ovarian cancer in this review we summarize recent advance that have illuminated the origin and pathogenesis of endometriosis and have provided new avenue for research that promise to improve the early diagnosis and management of endometriosis
label: Cancer

title: a novel btk gene mutation in a child with atypical xlinked agammaglobulinemia and recurrent hemophagocytosis a case report
abstract: xlinked agammaglobulinemia xla caused by a mutation in the brutons tyrosine kinase btk gene is rarely reported in patient with recurrent hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis hlh this mutation lead to significantly reduced number of circulatory b cell and serum immunoglobulin in patient therefore they exhibit repetitive bacterial infection since infancy and immunoglobulin ig replacement therapy is the primary treatment hlh is a lifethreatening condition with manifestation of nonremitting fever hepatosplenomegaly cytopenia coagulopathy lipid disorder and multiple organ failure it is caused by the immune dysregulation between cytotoxic t cell nk cell and histiocyte the treatment is based on hlh protocol including immunotherapy chemotherapy supportive therapy and stem cell transplantation however a we know more about the classification and pathophysiology of hlh the treatment is modified tcelldirected immunotherapy is effective in patient with primary hlh and strong immunosuppression is contraindicated in patient with severe ongoing infection or some primary immunodeficiency disease pid here we report the case of a yearold boy who presented with ecthyma gangrenosum and several episode of pyogenic infection during childhood at the age of year he exhibited cyclic hlh every month the remission of hlh episode finally achieved after he received monthly ig replacement therapy mgkg at the th hlh however transient elevation of igm wa incidentally discovered after cycle of monthly ig replacement therapy igmsecreting multiple myeloma waldenstroms macroglobulinemia and lymphoma were excluded the igm level then declined and returned to the normal range within a year the patient and his parent received wholegenome sequencing analysis it revealed a novel hemizygous cga mutation in the btk gene and xla wa diagnosed xla exhibit a spectrum of clinical and immunological presentation in patient the identification of the mutation in the btk gene contribute to an accurate diagnosis ig replacement therapy is the primary treatment for hlh in patient with xla
label: Cancer

title: overview of current immunotherapy targeting mutated kras cancer
abstract: the occurrence of somatic substitution mutation of the kras protooncogene is highly prevalent in certain cancer type which often lead to constant activation of proliferative pathway and subsequent neoplastic transformation it is often seen a a gateway mutation in carcinogenesis and ha been commonly deemed a a predictive biomarker for poor prognosis and relapse when conventional chemotherapeutics are employed additionally it mutational status also render egfr targeted therapy ineffective owing to it downstream location effort to discover new approach targeting this menacing culprit have been ongoing for year without much success and with incidence of kras positive cancer patient being on the rise researcher are now turning towards immunotherapy a the way forward in this scoping review recent immunotherapeutic development and advance in both preclinical and clinical study targeting kras directly or indirectly via it downstream signal transduction machinery will be discussed additionally some of the challenge and limitation of various kras targeting immunotherapeutic approach such a vaccine adoptive t cell therapy and checkpoint inhibitor against kras positive cancer will be deliberated
label: Cancer

title: recurrent undifferentiated carcinoma of the sella in a patient with lynch syndrome
abstract: background lynch syndrome l is a cancerpredisposing condition resulting from germline mutation in deoxyribonucleic acid mismatch repair gene patient are at high risk for a multitude of tumor but no report of undifferentiated sellar carcinoma have previously been described case description a yearold female with l due to msh and msh mutation presented with panhypopituitarism and a sellar mass she wa initially diagnosed with pituitary apoplexy and treated nonoperatively the mass selfresolved the mass recurred year later and she underwent endoscopic endonasal biopsy demonstrating an undifferentiated carcinoma of the sella with msh and msh loss the tumor wa negative for pituitary marker and weakly positive for p the patient further developed lung and bone metastasis and wa treated with radiation and chemotherapy conclusion this is the first report of an undifferentiated carcinoma of the sella our patient harbored a diagnosis of l and demonstrated local tumor recurrence and aggressive systemic progression patient with l should undergo close followup and active surveillance to detect and treat these aggressive lesion in a timely manner
label: Cancer

title: genetic testing of thyroid nodule using a gene panel developed on a new generation sequencing platform
abstract: introduction twentyfive percent of fineneedle aspiration biopsy sample of thyroid nodule produce indeterminate cytological result genetic testing of nodule can contribute to accurate diagnosis aim developing the first gene panel in europe utilizing the most relevant thyroid oncogene with mutation method examination of the isolated dna from biopsy sample by ion torrent new generation sequencing result the validation of our method wa performed on tumor tissue sample in which genetic variation were identified yet unknown in thyroid tumor axin wa the most polymorphic gene while braf cta ve wa the most frequently identified mutation we detected clinically relevant variant of which have not been described in the literature six of our cytologically malignant and of our indeterminate a well a of our cytologically benign sample were identified a containing pathologic variant in a driver gene braf cta nra cca conclusion we have developed a validated reliable new generation sequencingbased method with high positive predictive value and sensitivity suitable for the early detection of malignant lesion in the thyroid orv hetil
label: Cancer

title: the first report of molecular characterized brdnut carcinoma in brazil a case report
abstract: background nut midline carcinoma is a rare and aggressive subset of squamous cell carcinoma which is characterized by the translocation of nuclear protein in testis gene that is mostly fused with bromodomain and extraterminal family protein we describe here the first brazilian case of nut midline carcinoma with brdnut fusion detected in a nextgeneration sequencing panel and we present the clinical evolution of this patient case presentation a yearold caucasian man wa diagnosed with poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma of the left maxillary sinus with negative in situ hybridization for epsteinbarr encoding region and human papillomavirus genotyping he received induction therapy chemoradiotherapy with weekly systemic chemotherapy and concurrently weekly intraarterial chemotherapy new imaging evaluation month after the end of the last treatment revealed a good partial response in the primary lesion however positron emission tomographycomputed tomography showed multiple suspicious lesion in his bone and lung which were histologically confirmed he died exactly month after metastatic disease wa diagnosed conclusion nut midline carcinoma is usually very aggressive currently there is no standard of care for treatment of nut midline carcinoma the definitive diagnosis must be by demonstration of nutm rearrangement immunohistochemical staining of greater than of tumor nucleus on formalinfixed paraffinembedded tissue using the monoclonal rabbit antibody to nut clone cb ha a specificity of and sensitivity of for the diagnosis of nut midline carcinoma our case is the first brazilian case of nut midline carcinoma with brdnut fusion
label: Cancer

title: in vivo inhibition of microrna to decrease tumor growth in mouse
abstract: micrornas mirnas are important regulator of gene expression through their ability to destabilize mrna and inhibit translation of target mrna an everincreasing number of study have identified mirnas a potential biomarkers for cancer diagnosis and prognosis and also a therapeutic target adding an extra dimension to cancer evaluation and treatment in the context of thyroid cancer tumorigenesis result not only from mutation in important gene but also from the overexpression of many mirnas accordingly the role of mirnas in the control of thyroid gene expression is evolving a an important mechanism in cancer herein we present a protocol to examine the effect of mirnainhibitor delivery a a therapeutic modality in thyroid cancer using human tumor xenograft and orthotopic mouse model after engineering stable thyroid tumoral cell expressing gfp and luciferase cell are injected into nude mouse to develop tumor which can be followed by bioluminescence the in vivo inhibition of a mirna can reduce tumor growth and upregulate mirna gene target this method can be used to assess the importance of a determined mirna in vivo in addition to identifying new therapeutic target
label: Cancer

title: histopathological evaluation of minor salivary gland papillarycystic tumour focus on genetic alteration in sialadenoma papilliferum and intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm
abstract: aim minor salivary gland tumour showing a predominant papillarycystic structure are rare and constitute a mixture of various type of neoplasm thus the histopathological assessment of these tumour pose a significant diagnostic challenge we aimed to delineate the histological characteristic of these tumour and further mutational aspect with a particular focus on sialadenoma papilliferum sp and intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm ipmn method and result we retrieved papillarycystic tumour of the minor salivary gland and performed histological reevaluation and mutation analysis of several key oncogene the histological classification were a follows sp n splike intraductal papillary tumour spipt n ipmn n intraductal papilloma cystadenoma and cystadenocarcinoma two three and two respectively whereas sp typically consisted of a combination of exophytic squamous epithelium and endophytic intraductal papillary infolding spipt lacked the exophytic component sp and spipt frequently harboured braf ve mutation which were identified in both squamous and ductal component ipmn wa characterised by a welldemarcated cystic lesion filled exclusively with a papillary proliferation of mucinous cell and a high rate of akt ek mutation intraductal papilloma were unilocular cystic lesion with intraluminal papillary growth of bland columnar cell in contrast both cystadenomas and cystadenocarcinomas showed a multicystic appearance with a papillary configuration cystadenocarcinomas invaded the surrounding tissue and were composed of markedly atypical tumour cell conclusion the appropriate interpretation of histological finding and specific genetic alteration eg braf ve and akt ek in sp and ipmn would be useful for the correct diagnosis of minor salivary gland papillarycystic tumour
label: Cancer

title: efficacy of egfrtkis with or without upfront brain radiotherapy for egfrmutant nsclc patient with central nervous system metastasis
abstract: background although the clinical efficacy of epidermal growth factor receptor tyrosine kinase inhibitor egfrtkis in egfrmutant nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc patient ha been demonstrated their efficacy in egfrmutant nsclcs with central nervous system cns metastasis and the role of radiotherapy remain unclear this study aimed to determine if it is preferable to add upfront cranial radiotherapy to egfrtkis in patient with egfrmutant nsclc with newly diagnosed brain metastasis method we retrospectively analyzed the data of egfrmutant nsclc patient with cns metastasis who received egfrtkis a a firstline therapy result a total of patient were enrolled and patient received upfront brain radiotherapy while patient received first and second generation egfrtkis first the median time to treatment failure ttf wa month confidence interval ci the median survival time mst wa month ci the overall response rate of the cns wa the median cns progressionfree survival pfs wa month ci brain radiotherapy prior to egfrtki prolonged ttf v month p and tended to prolong cnspfs v month p but wa not significantly associated with overall survival mst v month p univariate and multivariate analysis indicated that poor performance status and the presence of extracranial metastasis were poor prognostic factor related to overall survival conclusion egfrtki showed a favorable effect for egfrmutant nsclc patient with cns metastasis prolonged ttf and cnspfs were observed with upfront brain radiotherapy
label: Cancer

title: mutated ra targeting the untargetable with t cell
abstract: the ra family of protein is at the apex of several pathway implicated in a multitude of epithelial cancer but ha remained stubbornly resistant to the wave of targeted small molecule and antibody that have revolutionized clinical oncology kras the most commonly mutated of the isoforms represents an attractive target for treatment given it ubiquity central role a a driver mutation and association with poor prognosis this review is a comprehensive summary of the existing approach to targeting kras spanning smallmolecule inhibitor cancer vaccine and with a focus on trial in adoptive cell therapy here we explain how the limitation of existing drug and nonspecific immunebased therapy are circumvented with technique in modern immunotherapy the success outlined represent the most promising path to finally targeting the prototypical undruggable ra oncogene family
label: Cancer

title: exosome dna critical regulator of tumor immunity and a diagnostic biomarker
abstract: nanosized cellular vesicle exosome contains a variety of biological cargo including dna fragment from celloforigin despite it biological stability and clinical utility in tumor diagnosis exosome dna exodna is very little studied a compare with exosome rna cytoplasmic accumulation of damaged dna from nucleus and mitochondrion often lead to it packaging in exosomes by yet unknown pathway exodna modulates tumor immunity via paracrine interaction and activation of cytosolic dna sensor pathway for example sting cgas and so forth in specific immune cell subset in addition to priming tumor immunity exodna is also emerging a a critical regulator of checkpoint immunotherapy a a useful diagnostic biomaterial exodna contains a variety of clinically relevant tumorspecific mutation representing multiple gene eg egfr braf ra idh and her thus making it a promising liquid biopsy material for therapy recommendation hence exodna in addition to tumor immunity modulation is also emerging a a suitable diagnostic material for personalized therapy in cancer here we review the current status of exodna research and it potential us in tumor biology
label: Cancer

title: cryptic recurrent acinnutm fusion in nonkmtarearranged infant acute lymphoblastic leukemia
abstract: infant acute lymphoblastic leukemia all are rare hematological malignancy occurring in child younger than year of age most frequently associated with kmta rearrangement kmtar the smaller subset without kmtar which represents of infant all case is poorly characterized here we report two case of chemotherapysensitive nonkmtar infant all transcriptome analysis revealed identical acinnutm gene fusion in both case derived from cryptic chromosomal rearrangement undetected by standard cytogenetic approach two isoforms of the gene fusion joining exon or of acin to exon of nutm were identified both fusion transcript contained the functional dnabinding sap safab acinus and pia domain of acin and most of nutm the detection of the acinnutm fusion by rtpcr allowed the molecular monitoring of minimal residual disease in a clinical setting based on publicly available genomic datasets and literature review we predict that nutm gene fusion are recurrent event in infant all a such we propose two clinically relevant assay to screen for nutm rearrangement in bone marrow cell independent of the fusion partner numt immunohistochemistry and nutm rna expression in sum our study identifies acinnutm a a recurrent and possibly cryptic fusion in nonkmtar infant all provides clinical tool to screen for nutmrearranged leukemia and contributes to the refinement of this new subgroup
label: Cancer

title: loss of psp expression is associated with early psa recurrence and deteriorates outcome of pten deleted prostate cancer
abstract: objective prostate secretory protein of amino acid psp is a target gene of the ezh transcriptional repressor and is often downregulated in prostate cancer however it prognostic value is disputed method immunohistochemical analysis of a tissue microarray of prostate cancer specimen wa performed to evaluate psp expression correlation of psp expression with tumor phenotype patient prognosis tmprsserg fusion status ezh expression and pten deletion wa studied result psp expression wa increased in benign prostatic hyperplasia however it wa downregulated in and negative in of the interpretable prostate cancer specimen the loss of psp expression wa inversely correlated to ezh expression p p loss of psp wa linked to early prostatespecific antigen recurrence but with little absolute effect p however it provided additional prognostic impact in cancer specimen with pten deletion loss of psp deteriorated prognosis of cancer patient with pten deletion by more than p the combination of pten deletion and psp loss provided independent prognostic information that wa observed in several subgroup defined by classical and quantitative gleason grade conclusion the result of our study suggest that combined psppten analysis can be potentially used in the clinical prognosis of prostate cancer
label: Cancer

title: rectal cancer subclones respond differentially to neoadjuvant therapy
abstract: treatment of locally advanced rectal cancer includes chemotherapy radiation and surgery but patient response to neoadjuvant treatment are variable we have shown that rectal tumor are comprised of multiple genetically distinct subclones unique subclones within tumor may harbor mutation which contribute to interpatient variation in response to neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy ncrt analysis of the influence of ncrt on the extent and nature of intratumoral genetic heterogeneity in rectal cancer may provide insight into mechanism of resistance locally advanced rectal cancer patient underwent pretreatment biopsy at the time of surgery tissue from the treated tumor wa obtained and analyzed pre and posttreatment specimen were subjected to whole exome and confirmatory deep sequencing for somatic mutation copy number variation wa assessed using oncoscan snp array genomic data were analyzed using pyclone to identify subclonal tumor population following ncrt alteration that persisted or were enriched in the posttreatment tumor specimen following ncrt were defined for each patient thirtytwo sample were obtained from ten patient pyclone identified to genetic subclones per tumor substantial change in the proportion of individual subclones in pre versus posttreatment tumor material were found in all patient resistant subclones recurrently contained mutation in tp apc abca muc and thsd recurrent copy number variation wa observed across multiple chromosome region after ncrt pathway analysis including variant allele and copy number change associated with resistant subclones revealed significantly altered pathway especially those linked to the apc and tp gene which were the two most frequently mutated gene intratumoral heterogeneity is evident in pretreatment rectal cancer following treatment subclonal population are selectively modified and enrichment of a subset of pretreatment subclones is seen further study are needed to define recurrent alteration at diagnosis that may contribute to resistance to ncrt

found in all patient resistant subclones recurrently contained mutation in tp apc abca muc and thsd recurrent copy number variation wa observed across multiple chromosome region after ncrt pathway analysis including variant allele and copy number change associated with resistant subclones revealed significantly altered pathway especially those linked to the apc and tp gene which were the two most frequently mutated gene intratumoral heterogeneity is evident in pretreatment rectal cancer following treatment subclonal population are selectively modified and enrichment of a subset of pretreatment subclones is seen further study are needed to define recurrent alteration at diagnosis that may contribute to resistance to ncrt

title: declining detection rate for apc and biallelic mutyh variant in polyposis patient implication for dna testing policy
abstract: this study aimed to determine the prevalence of apcassociated familial adenomatous polyposis fap and mutyhassociated polyposis map in a large cohort taking into account factor a adenoma count and year of diagnosis all application form used to send patient in for apc and mutyh variant analysis between and were collected n using the data provided on the application form the apc and biallelic mutyh prevalence wa determined and possible predictive factor were examined using multivariate multinomial logistic regression analysis in spss the prevalence of disease causing variant in the apc gene significantly increase with adenoma count while map show a peak prevalence in individual with adenoma logistic regression analysis show significant odds ratio for adenoma count age at diagnosis and interestingly a decline in the chance of finding a variant in either gene over time moreover in of patient with faprelated extracolonic manifestation a variant wa identified the overall detection rate are above for patient with adenoma aged adenoma aged t variant in the tumor or a firstdegree relative with adenoma therefore apc and mutyh testing in patient with adenoma aged adenoma aged is advised almost all fap and map patient not meeting these criterion showed other characteristic that can be used a an indication to prompt genetic testing

title: hepatic epithelioid angiomyolipomapecoma and focal nodular hyperplasia in a patient with a previous history of cutaneous melanoma
abstract: hepatic perivascular epithelioid cell tumor pecomas are uncommon mesenchymal neoplasm pecomas concurrent with other hepatic lesion is a very rare occurrence with only two previously reported case we report a primary hepatic pecoma associated with focal nodular hyperplasia in a patient with a previous history of cutaneous melanoma diagnostic imaging study suggested a hepatic adenoma and the patient underwent a segmentectomy the tumor wa mainly composed of epithelioid cell adipose tissue and smooth muscle fiber intermixed with blood vessel the neoplastic cell were diffusely immunoreactive for hmb melana and smooth muscle actin but not for hepatocyte s mitf or braf molecular study were negative for brafv mutation the final diagnosis wa hepatic epithelioid angiomyolipomapecoma the differential diagnosis of hepatic pecoma is discussed
label: Cancer

title: predictive marker of immunotherapy of colorectal cancer
abstract: colorectal carcinoma are heterogeneous in their morphologic immunologic and molecular aspect the smooth and sharply demarcated medullary carcinoma present with an expansive border and high tumor stroma ratio the high load of cancer neoantigens a a consequence of microsatellite instability result in numerous reactive regional lymph node in contrast the low grade ms type carcinoma are spiculated desmoplastic and hard frequently with smaller and sometimes also desmoplastic lymph node metastasis this macroscopic and histological heterogeneity is mirrored on the immunohistochemical and molecular level and is decisive from prognostic and predictive point of view a immunotherapy opened a new front in the therapy of colorectal cancer the pathology report ha to quantify and qualify the characteristic of the tumor microenvironment the peritumoral and intratumoral lymphoid infiltration and tumor stroma ratio in order to improve patient selection
label: Cancer

title: nonhematopoietic stat induces epithelial tight junction dysfunction and promotes intestinal inflammation and tumorigenesis
abstract: enhanced gut permeability due to dysregulated epithelial tight junction is often associated with inflammatory bowel disease ibd which have a greater risk for developing colorectal cancer stat activation wa detected in inflamed colonic epithelium of active ibd patient suggesting a role of epithelial stat in colitis development here we demonstrated that nonhematopoietic stat but not hematopoietic stat triggered dssinduced colitis and subsequent tumorigenesis this could be due to the enhancingeffect of stat on gut permeability and microbiota translocation via interruption of epithelial tight junction integrity mechanistically longmyosin lightchain kinase mlck wa identified a a target of stat leading to epithelial tight junction dysfunction and microbiotadriven colitis furthermore neutralization of il which wa primarily derived from type innate lymphoid cell ilc in a microbiotadependent way inhibited epithelial stat activation and improved gut permeability and dssinduced colitis importantly pharmacological inhibition of stat reduces murine intestinal tumor formation and tumoral pstat level positively correlated to the clinical stage and poor prognosis of human colorectal cancer thus our study reveals a direct role of stat in the disruption of epithelial tight junction integrity and colitis development and suggests stat a a potential therapeutic and prophylactic target for ibd and colitisassociated cancer
label: Cancer

title: malignant struma ovarii presenting with follicular carcinoma a case report with molecular analysis
abstract: malignant struma ovarii presenting with follicular carcinoma is extremely rare and it mechanism of tumorigenesis remains unknown here we present a case of malignant struma ovarii with peritoneal dissemination of follicular carcinoma for which a molecular analysis for major oncogenic gene alteration in follicular thyroid carcinoma wa performed a yearold nulliparous woman wa referred with a diagnosis of highly differentiated follicular carcinoma of ovarian origin primary thyroid cancer wa not diagnosed and she had a normal thyroid function i scintigraphy revealed multiple peritoneal dissemination that wa surgically resected histologically the tumor consisted of numerous follicle without nuclear feature of papillary thyroid carcinoma tumor sample were investigated for cancerrelated gene including ra braf and p and ppargpax gene fusion by targeted dna sequencing and fluorescence in situ hybridization respectively no major oncogenic gene alteration were detected these negative finding suggest a different mechanism of tumorigenesis from that of adulttype follicular thyroid carcinoma

title: estrogen signaling and estrogen receptor a prognostic indicator in laryngeal cancer
abstract: laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma lscc ha been shown to respond to betaestradiol however the presence and characterization of estrogen receptor er and other sex hormone receptor in lscc are still being determined sex hormone receptor and the way sex hormone impact lscc tumor are important for understanding which patient would benefit from hormone therapy such a antiestrogen therapy this information also ha prognostic value a there may be a correlation between er profile and lscc aggression recent work by our team and others ha shown that the canonical er estrogen receptor alpha eralpha and it splice variant eralpha are important modulators of estrogen signaling in lscc this review describes some common betaestradiol signaling pathway and explains how these signaling pathway might control lscc tumor growth we also show that loss of eralpha but not eralpha imbues lscc with enhanced aggression a pattern which ha previously only been observed in breast cancer we make a case for using eralpha a a tumorigenic modulator and pathogenic marker in lscc on par with the use of eralpha a a prognostic marker in breast cancer

title: nextgeneration sequencing improves diagnosis prognosis and clinical management of myeloid neoplasm
abstract: molecular diagnosis of myeloid neoplasm mn is based on the detection of multiple genetic alteration using various technique nextgeneration sequencing ng ha been proved a a useful method for analyzing many gene simultaneously in this context we analyzed diagnostic sample from patient affected by mn and ten relapse sample from a subset of acute myeloid leukemia patient using two enrichmentcapture ng gene panel pathogenicity classification of variant wa enhanced by the development and application of a custom oncohematology score a total of pathogenic variant were detected in of patient for structural alteration of those identified by cytogenetics were detected by ng of copy number variant and three out of three translocation the detection of variant using ng changed the diagnosis of seven patient and the prognosis of patient and enabled u to identify suitable candidate for clinical trial regarding aml six of the ten relapsed patient lost or gained variant comparing with diagnostic sample in conclusion the use of ng panel in mn improves genetic characterization of the disease compared with conventional method thus demonstrating it potential clinical utility in routine clinical testing this approach lead to betteradjusted treatment for each patient
label: Cancer

title: euracaniaslc proposal for updating the histologic classification of pleural mesothelioma towards a more multidisciplinary approach
abstract: introduction molecular and immunologic breakthrough are transforming the management of thoracic cancer although advance have not been a marked for malignant pleural mesothelioma where pathologic diagnosis ha been essentially limited to three histologic subtypes method a multidisciplinary group pathologist molecular biologist surgeon radiologist and oncologist sponsored by european network for rare adult solid cancersinternational association for the study of lung cancer met in to critically review the current classification result recommendation include classification should be updated to include architectural pattern and stromal and cytologic feature that refine prognostication subject to data accrual malignant mesothelioma in situ could be an additional category grading of epithelioid malignant pleural mesothelioma should be routinely undertaken favorableunfavorable histologic characteristic should be routinely reported clinically relevant molecular data programmed death ligand brca associated protein bap and cyclin dependent kinase inhibitor a should be incorporated into report if undertaken other molecular data should be accrued a part of future trial resection specimen ie extended pleurectomydecortication and extrapleural pneumonectomy should be pathologically staged with smaller specimen being clinically staged ideally at least three separate area should be sampled from the pleural cavity including area of interest identified on presurgical imaging imageacquisition protocolsimaging terminology should be standardized to aid researchrefine clinical staging multidisciplinary tumor board should include pathologist to ensure appropriate treatment option are considered all histologic subtypes should be considered potential candidate for chemotherapy patient with sarcomatoid or biphasic mesothelioma should not be excluded from firstline clinical trial unless there is a compelling reason tumor subtyping should be further assessed in relation to duration of response to immunotherapy and systematic screening of all patient for germline mutation is not recommended in the absence of a family history suspicious for bap syndrome conclusion these multidisciplinary recommendation for pathology classification and application will allow more informative pathologic reporting and potential risk stratification to support clinical practice research investigation and clinical trial

title: cytogenetics and cytogenomics evaluation in cancer
abstract: the availability of cytogenetics and cytogenomics technology improved the detection and identification of tumor molecular signature a well a the understanding of cancer initiation and progression the use of largescale and highthroughput cytogenomics technology ha led to a fast identification of several cancer candidate biomarkers associated with diagnosis prognosis and therapeutic the advent of array comparative genomic hybridization and nextgeneration sequencing technology ha significantly improved the knowledge about cancer biology underlining driver gene to guide targeted therapy development drugresistance prediction and pharmacogenetics however few of these candidate biomarkers have made the transition to the clinic with a clear benefit for the patient technological progress helped to demonstrate that cellular heterogeneity play a significant role in tumor progression and resistancesensitivity to cancer therapy representing the major challenge of precision cancer therapy a paradigm shift ha been introduced in cancer genomics with the recent advent of singlecell sequencing since it present a lot of application with a clear benefit to oncological patient namely detection of intratumoral heterogeneity mapping clonal evolution monitoring the development of therapy resistance and detection of rare tumor cell population it seems now evident that no single biomarker could provide the whole information necessary to early detect and predict the behavior and prognosis of tumor the promise of precision medicine is based on the molecular profiling of tumor being vital the continuous progress of highthroughput technology and the multidisciplinary effort to catalogue chromosomal rearrangement and genomic alteration of human cancer and to do a good interpretation of the relation genotypephenotype
label: Cancer

title: sensing of circulating cancer biomarkers with metal nanoparticles
abstract: the analysis of circulating cancer biomarkers including cellfree and circulating tumor dna circulating tumor cell microrna and exosomes hold promise in revolutionizing cancer diagnosis and prognosis using body fluid analysis also known a liquid biopsy to enable clinical application of these biomarkers new analytical tool capable of detecting them in very low concentration in complex sample matrix are needed metal nanoparticles have emerged a extraordinary analytical scaffold because of their unique optoelectronic property and ease of functionalization hence multiple analytical technique have been developed based on these nanoparticles and their plasmonic property the aim of this review is to summarize and discus the present development on the use of metal nanoparticles for the analysis of circulating cancer biomarkers we examine how metal nanoparticles can be used a analytical transducer in various sensing principle such a aggregation induced colorimetric assay plasmon resonance energy transfer surface enhanced raman spectroscopy and refractive index sensing and signal amplification element in surface plasmon resonance spectroscopy and electrochemical detection we critically discus the clinical relevance of each category of circulating biomarkers followed by a thorough analysis of how these nanoparticlebased design have overcome some of the main challenge that gold standard analytical technique currently face and what new direction the field may take in the future
label: Cancer

title: analysis of biomarkers and association with clinical outcome in patient with differentiated thyroid cancer subanalysis of the sorafenib phase iii decision trial
abstract: purpose the phase iii decision trial nct eudract established sorafenib efficacy in locally recurrent or metastatic progressive differentiated thyroid cancer dtc refractory to radioactive iodine we conducted a retrospective exploratory biomarker analysis of patient from decision experimental design candidate biomarkers baseline plasma protein baseline and duringtreatment serum thyroglobulin and relevant tumor mutation braf nra hras and kras were analyzed for correlation with clinical outcome result plasma biomarker and thyroglobulin data were available for of and of patient respectively elevated baseline vegfa wa independently associated with poor prognosis for progressionfree survival pfs hr confidence interval ci p overall survival hr ci p and diseasecontrol rate dcr or p elevated baseline thyroglobulin wa independently associated with poor pfs hr ci p from baseline wa achieved by and of patient receiving sorafenib and placebo respectively p thyroglobulin reduction had longer pfs than those without reduction hr ci sorafenib p placebo p braf mutation were associated with better pfs ra mutation were associated with worse pfs although neither wa independently prognostic in multivariate model no examined biomarker predicted sorafenib benefit conclusion we identified biomarkers associated with poor prognosis in dtc including elevated baseline vegfa and thyroglobulin and the presence of ra mutation serum thyroglobulin may be a biomarker of tumor response and progression
label: Cancer

title: identification and management of patient with lynch syndrome
abstract: about of colorectal cancer crc case occurred in the context of an underlying hereditary predisposition syndrome lynch syndrome is the main cause of hereditary crc but is also associated with a higher risk of other cancer such a endometrial cancer and ovarian cancer it is the consequence of constitutional mutation in a mismatch repair mmr gene involved in dna repair mlh msh msh or pm or of the epcam gene msh promotor if a mutation predisposing to lynch syndrome is identified in an individual special monitoring should be initiated adapted to estimated cancer risk clinical criterion amsterdam ii and bethesda have been validated to identify the patient who should be referred for genetic counseling in order to initiate constitutional dna testing furthermore the french national cancer institute inca systematically recommend tumoral testing looking for mmr system failure in case of crc diagnosed under endometrial cancer diagnosed under or whatever the age in patient diagnosed with crc or endometrial cancer harbouring personal or familal history of lunch syndrome cancer in this review we will discus how to detect lynch syndrome identification of the index case and family screening and how to monitor it in
label: Cancer
