title: modern view on epidermal dysplasia carcinogenesis
abstract: squamous cell carcinoma of the skin develops from the spectrum of facultative precancerous condition which in the course of malignant transformation through cancer stage in situ without early treatment fully transform into invasive squamous cell carcinoma according to classical model of carcinogenesis the transformation of actinic keratosis into squamous cell carcinoma of the skin occurs due to a mutation in one gene more often a tumor suppressor and undergoes a stage of development with lack of control of cell cycle the aim of the research is to supplement current knowledge of genetic determination of pathogenetic mechanism of epidermal dysplasia of the skin by studying the genetic determinant in the skin lesion of varying degree of malignancy material and method we analyzed skin bioptates of patient with epidermal dysplasia of the skin gr patient with actinic keratosis gr patient with noninvasive squamous cell carcinoma of the skin gr patient with invasive squamous cell carcinoma of the skin by molecular genetic testing of gene polymorphism tp ga lmyc tg tnfalpha ga in tumor tissue the histological examination revealed the level of dysplasia of the epidermis result in case of the same disease duration in patient of grgr lmyc tt is a genetic component of malignant transformation of epithelial skin cell p and the development of invasive squamous cell carcinoma other variant of tg and gg gene do not have such prognostic value for the risk of skin cancer compared to tt significant difference were found in the distribution of ga when comparing gr with gr p and gr with gr p a significant increase in the distribution of ga genotype wa revealed in patient with invasive form of keratinocyte intraepidermal neoplasia a allele wa more likely to be detected in patient of gr compared to gr p that prof the association of this allele with the development of invasive malignancy of the skin the association of gg genotype and tnfalpha g allele with the development of malignant skin lesion wa found comparing the distribution of g allele in patient of gr and gr we found it significant increase in patient of gr comparative analysis of gene polymorphism with tumor invasion level showed a significant difference only in gg genotype between patient with grade iii of kin keratinocyte intraepidermal neoplasia in gr and patient with kin iii of gr p and ga between patient with kin iii of gr and kin iii of gr p conclusion our work ha supplemented modern vision of genetic component in pathogenetic mechanism of the development of epidermal dysplasia of the skin thus the association of lmyc tt with the development of malignant skin lesion of different invasiveness and the modifying effect of tnfalpha ga and tp ga gene variant on pathological transformation in the focus of ed depending on the level of epithelial dysplasia wa revealed

title: promoter methylation downregulates bcell translocation gene expression in breast carcinoma
abstract: backgroundaim the mechanism responsible for bcell translocation gene btg downregulation in breast carcinoma remains unknown we examined the btg expression status in breast carcinoma cell and investigated the mechanism underlying the observed alteration material and method four breast carcinoma cell line skbr mdamb td and mcf and one normal mammary epithelial cell line mcfa were analyzed btg expression wa examined using quantitative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction pcr and western blot methylation status of the btg promoter wa analyzed using methylationspecific pcr msp to investigate the effect of methylation on btg the cell were treated with a demethylating agent result the carcinoma cell expressed significantly lower level of btg mrna and protein than normal cell the btg promoter wa highly methylated in the carcinoma cell azadeoxycytidine significantly restored btg expression conclusion downregulation of btg expression through epigenetic repression is involved in mammary carcinogenesis btg is a potential diagnostic marker and therapeutic target for breast carcinoma
label: Cancer

title: optimized immunohistochemical detection of estrogen receptor beta using two validated monoclonal antibody confirms it expression in normal and malignant breast tissue
abstract: purpose significant controversy exists regarding the expression pattern of estrogen receptor beta erbeta in normal and diseased breast tissue to address this issue we have validated two erbeta antibody optimized the ihc protocol for both antibody and now report the expression pattern of erbeta in normal and malignant breast tissue method erbeta antibody specificity wa determined using western blot and ihc analysis erbeta protein expression pattern were assessed via ihc in normal breast tissue and invasive breast carcinoma further we report the detailed protocol of the erbeta ihc assay developed in our capclia certified laboratory to provide a standardized method for future study result we have confirmed the specificity of two independent erbeta monoclonal antibody one that detects total ie full length plus splice variant which do not include the ligand binding domain erbeta protein ppz and one that detects only the fulllength form which includes the ligand binding domain of erbeta ppg using these two antibody we demonstrate that erbeta is highly expressed in normal human breast tissue a well a in of invasive breast cancer further these two antibody exhibited similar staining pattern across multiple different tissue and were highly concordant with regard to determining erbeta positivity in breast cancer conclusion erbeta protein wa shown to be abundant in the majority of normal breast epithelial cell and is present in of breast cancer use of these two antibody along with their standardized ihc protocol provide a reference for future study aimed at determining the utility of erbeta a a prognostic andor predictive biomarker in various tissue of benign or malignant state
label: Cancer

title: longitudinal analysis of a secondary brca mutation using digital droplet pcr
abstract: development of resistance to platinum and polyadpribose polymerase inhibitor via secondary brca gene mutation that restore functional homologous recombination ha been observed in a number of cancer type here we report a case of somatic brca mutation in a patient with high grade serous ovarian carcinoma a secondary mutation predicted to restore the brca open reading frame wa detected at low frequency in whole exome sequencing of a peritoneal biopsy at disease progression after treatment that included carboplatin and olaparib we used digital droplet pcr ddpcr to verify the presence and frequency of this mutation in the biopsy sample at progression and also used this approach to assess the presence of the secondary mutation in preceding biopsy at diagnosis and first relapse we found no evidence for the secondary mutation being present prior to the final progression biopsy suggesting that this mutation wa acquired late in the course of treatment ddpcr provides a sensitive and specific technique to investigate the presence of low frequency mutation in a time series of biopsy
label: Cancer

title: acute myeloid leukemia in an infant with tpq translocation case report and a review of the literature
abstract: acute myeloid leukemia aml patient with tpp constitute a small subgroup with a distinct genetic and clinical profile we present a unique case of a female infant with monocytic aml associated with tpq a rarely reported variation of tpp the patient presented with leukemia cutis and demonstrated erythrophagocytosis in the diagnostic bone marrow she responded well to standard aml chemotherapy and is currently in remission here we highlight her case a the youngest aml patient with t described in the literature discus the significance and prognostic implication of this genetic variant and review p fusion protein in aml

title: kabuki syndrome review of the clinical feature diagnosis and epigenetic mechanism
abstract: background kabuki syndrome k is a infrequent inherited malformation syndrome caused by mutation in a h lysine methylase kmtd or an xlinked histone h lysine demethylase utxkdma the characteristic in patient with k have not yet been well recognized data source we used database including pubmed and google scholar to search for publication about the clinical feature and the etiology of kabuki syndrome the most relevant article to the scope of this review were chosen for analysis result clinical diagnosis of k is challenging in initial period because many clinical characteristic become apparent only in subsequent year recently the genetic and functional interaction between ksassociated gene and their product have been elucidated new clinical finding were reported including nervous system and intellectual performance endocrinerelated disorder and immune deficiency and autoimmune disease cancer risk of kabuki syndrome wa reviewed meanwhile we discussed the kabukilike syndrome digital clinical genetic service such a dysmorphology database can improve availability and provide highquality diagnostic service given the significant clinical relevance of ksassociated gene and epigenetic modification crosstalk effort in the research for new mechanism are thus of maximum interest conclusion kabuki syndrome ha a strong clinical and biological heterogeneity the main pathogenesis of kabuki syndrome is the imbalance between switchon and off of the chromatin the direction of drug research may be to regulate the normal opening of chromatin small molecule inhibitor of histone deacetylases maybe helpful in treatment of mental retardation and reduce cancer risk in k

title: integrative molecular analysis of patient with advanced and metastatic cancer
abstract: purpose we developed a precision medicine program for patient with advanced cancer using integrative wholeexome sequencing and transcriptome analysis patient and method five hundred fifteen patient with locally advancedmetastatic solid tumor were prospectively enrolled and paired tumornormal sequencing wa performed seven hundred fiftynine tumor from patient were evaluated result most frequent tumor type were prostate brain bladder and kidney cancer most frequently altered gene were tp cdkna apc ktmd pten and brca pathogenic germline alteration were present in of patient most frequently chek brca brca and msh novel gene fusion were identified including a rbmcdk fusion in a metastatic prostate cancer sample the rate of clinically relevant alteration wa by wholeexome sequencing which wa improved by by adding rna sequencing in patient with more than one sequenced tumor sample n of actionable mutation were concordant conclusion integrative analysis may uncover informative alteration for an advanced pancancer patient population these alteration are consistent in spatially and temporally heterogeneous sample

title: a molecular subcluster of colon cancer cell with low vdr expression is sensitive to chemotherapy braf inhibitor and pikmtor inhibitor treatment
abstract: gene expression based consensus molecular subtypes cm and nonnegative matrix factorization nmf subclusters are robust colon cancer classification system although the molecular feature are clear colon cancer subgroup based intervention are limited to address this problem we analyze the cm and nmf subgroup guided drug sensitivity in colon cancer cell line cm subtype cell are sensitive to fluorouracil while cm subtype cell are sensitive to cisplatin treatment in nmf classification a subcluster is specifically sensitive to chemotherapy braf inhibitor pikmtor inhibitor and notch inhibitor treatment this subcluster ha low frequency of tp pole pikca and braf mutation transcriptional analysis demonstrates low notch signaling activity low cdx and vdr expression in this subcluster cdx and vdr are significantly associated with the sensitivity of chemotherapy braf inhibitor and pikmtor inhibitor moreover a positive correlation between vdr and cdx is identified vdr and cdx mediated regulatory network are constructed at last three or four subclusters classification is validated in colon cancer patient overall our result suggest a molecular subcluster of colon cancer cell with low cdx and vdr expression is sensitive to chemotherapy braf inhibitor and pikmtor inhibitor treatment and provide an example of translation of cancer classification to subgroup guided therapy
label: Cancer

title: clinical practice use of liquid biopsy to identify rasbraf mutation in patient with metastatic colorectal cancer mcrc a single institution experience
abstract: tumor heterogeneity represents a possible cause of error in detecting predictive genetic alteration on tumor tissue and can be overcome by testing alteration in circulating tumor dna ctdna using liquid biopsy we assessed consecutive patient with a diagnosis of metastatic colorectal cancer mcrc using idylla biocartis a fully automated platform that evaluates the most frequent mutation of kras nra and braf gene we correlated the result of liquid biopsy and standard tissuebased next generation sequencing ng analysis to patient clinical feature the overall agreement wa concordance wa and in treatmentnaive patient and in the patient subgroup with liver metastasis respectively in liver metastasis positive treatmentnaive patient sensitivity specificity and positive predictive value ppv were and respectively circulating mutational fraction cmf wa significantly higher in patient with liver metastasis and high carcinoembryonic antigen cea level in a subgroup of patient pretreated with antiepidermal growth factor receptor egfr agent emerging kras mutation were evidenced in of case testing rasbraf mutation on plasma using the idylla biocartis platform is feasible and reliable in mcrc patient in clinical practice

title: the differential diagnosis of classical myeloproliferative neoplasm mpn the updated who criterion
abstract: the classical myeloproliferative neoplasm mpn polycythemia vera pv essential thrombocythemia et and primary myelofibrosis pmf are characterized by clonal myeloproliferation without feature of myelodysplasia the diagnostic approach proposed by the world health organization who us clinical feature peripheral blood count and smear analysis bone marrow bm morphology karyotype and molecular genetic test to classify mpn subtypes the detection of characteristic driver mutation like jakvf jak exon mpl and calrecticulin calr is a major diagnostic feature jak mutation are detected in more than of patient with pv and are therefore used a highly sensitive clonal marker in this subtype however jak mutation may also occur in et and pmf while calr is virtually not seen in pv therefore bm remains the central diagnostic platform and is essential for distinguishing et from prefibrotic pmf and diagnosing case which do not express jak mpl or calr wildtype or triplenegative mpn the standardization of relevant bm feature is mandatory to recognize characteristic and easy to assess pattern that enable an accurate discrimination between the mpn subtypes key parameter include cellularity erythropoiesis and neutrophil granulopoiesis in context with specific feature of megakaryocyte a well a the bm fiber content especially in early stage mpn that present with thrombocytosis and clinically mimic essential thrombocythemia
label: Cancer

title: drug resistance in papillary rcc from putative mechanism to clinical practicality
abstract: papillary renal cell carcinoma prcc is the second most common renal cell carcinoma rcc subtype and account for of all rccs despite clinical need few pharmacogenomics study in prcc have been performed moreover current research fails to adequately include prcc laboratory model such a the achn or caki prcc cell line the molecular mechanism involved in prcc development and drug resistance are more diverse than in clearcell rcc in which inactivation of vhl occurs in the majority of tumour drug resistance to multiple therapy in prcc occurs via genetic alteration such a mutation resulting in abnormal receptor tyrosine kinase activation or ralbp inhibition dysregulation of signalling pathway such a gskbetaeifebp pikakt and the mapk or interleukin signalling pathway deregulation of cellular process such a resistance to apoptosis or epithelialtomesenchymal transition and interaction between the cell and it environment for example through activation of matrix metalloproteinases improved understanding of resistance mechanism will facilitate drug discovery and provide new effective therapy further study on novel resistance biomarkers are needed to improve patient prognosis and stratification a well a drug development

title: detection of ctdna in the plasma of patient with papillary thyroid carcinoma
abstract: a total of of thyroid nodule that are evaluated by fineneedle aspiration are not clearly determined to be benign or malignant gene mutation analysis is recommended for the evaluation of thyroid nodule using clinical guideline the detection of circulating tumor dna ctdna ha the potential to aid in the screening diagnosis and prediction of thyroid cancer prognosis and can be used when tissue are difficult to obtain in the present study wholeexome sequencing wes wa performed on tumor and matched normal tissue from patient with papillary thyroid carcinoma ptc in quanzhou china hotspot mutation in tumor dna and cellfree dna were identified in the validation cohort which included patient with ptc braf ve occurred in five sample and wa the most frequent mutation observed variation allele frequency vaf of braf ve detected by wes wa positively correlated with vaf determined using digital pcr r p a number of novel mutated gene were identified including zinc finger protein pleckstrin homology like domain family a member rbmx like lysine methyltransferase a and trichohyalin along with the reported gene braf nra and mucin cell surface associated somatic mutated gene were enriched in the focal adhesion pathway a determined by kyoto encyclopedia of gene and genome or gene ontology analysis in the validation cohort of tumor were braf vepositive and the sensitivity and specificity of braf ve ctdna were and respectively braf ve wa associated with aggressive tumor factor including lymph node metastasis p and advanced disease stage p the present study investigated the accuracy of ctdna detection in patient with ptc and provided evidence that ctdna can be used a an evaluation of tumor dna in thyroid nodule

title: detection of novel fusion transcript vtiacfap in hepatocellular carcinoma
abstract: background hepatocellular carcinoma hcc is now the secondhighest cause of cancer death worldwide recent study have discovered a wide range of somatic mutation in hcc these mutation involve various vital signaling pathway such a wntbetacatenin p telomerase reverse transcriptase tert chromatin remodeling rasmapk signaling and oxidative stress however fusion transcript have not been broadly explored in hcc method to identify novel fusion transcript in hcc in the first phase of our study we performed targeted rna sequencing in hcc and paired nonhcc tissue on patient with a diagnosis of hcc undergoing liver transplantation result a a result of these study we discovered the novel fusion transcript vtiacfap in the second phase of our study we measured the expression of wildtype vtia in hcc specimen which showed that of exhibited upregulation of wildtype vtia in their tumor vtia vesicle transport via interaction with tsnare homolog a is a member of the soluble nethylmaleimidesensitive factor nsf attachment protein receptor snare gene family which is essential for membrane trafficking and function in endocytosis autophagy and golgi transport notably it is known that autophagy is involved in hcc conclusion the link between novel fusion transcript vtiacfap and autophagy a a potential therapeutic target in hcc patient deserves further investigation moreover this study show that fusion transcript are worthy of additional exploration in hcc
label: Cancer

title: molecular approach to metastatic colorectal cancer better diagnosis better treatment
abstract: molecular diagnostics of metastatic colorectal cancer mcrc are coming of age whereas for many year ra mutation were the only relevant molecular alteration examined in mcrc nowadays the braf her and microsatellite instability status of a given tumor is gaining importance since it ha not only prognostic relevance but open new avenue for therapeutic approach this review summarizes the recent advance in molecular approach to mcrc and their therapeutic consequence and discusses novel approach for molecular diagnostics in mcrc

title: ctnnb and apc mutation in odontogenic carcinoma with dentinoid
abstract: the purpose of the present study is to report case of odontogenic carcinoma with dentinoid a rare lowgrade odontogenic carcinoma associated with facial deformity and bone loss and to investigate the presence of pathogenic mutation in these sample by using a nextgeneration sequencing approach we sequenced a panel of oncogene and tumor suppressor gene commonly mutated in human cancer microscopic feature of both case revealed solid area of malignant odontogenic tumor with a large amount of dentinoid material we identified pathogenic mutation in the gene ctnnb and apc both of which are part of the wntsignaling pathway consistent with wntsignaling activation both tumor showed strong betacatenin accumulation in the cytoplasm and in the nucleus the molecular profile of odontogenic carcinoma with dentinoid may help in it diagnosis a well a in the identification of potential molecular target for therapy in the future
label: Cancer

title: liquid biopsy tracking of lung tumor evolution over time
abstract: introduction the rise of the personalized era in lung cancer prompted the evaluation of novel diagnostic tool to overcome some of the limit of traditional tumor genotyping liquid biopsy refers to a multitude of minimally invasive technique that can allow a realtime biomolecular characterization of the tumor through the analysis of human body fluidsareas covered herein we provide a comprehensive overview of the role of liquid biopsy in lung cancer mainly focusing on the most studied member of the liquid biopsy family cellfree dna cfdna and circulating tumor cell ctcsexpert opinion among the different component of the large liquid biopsy family cfdna is the most studied and widely adopted source for tumor genotyping in lung cancer already entered clinical practice for detection of both sensitizing and resistance egfr mutation however the impressive technological advance made in the last few year are expanding it potential application allowing a more comprehensive plasma genotyping through nextgeneration sequencing and moving from advancedmetastatic disease to novel frontier such a early detection and minimal residual disease evaluation

title: dramatic response of folfirinox regimen in a collision pancreatic adenocarcinoma patient with a germline brca mutation a case report
abstract: germline brca and brca mutation are the most common gene mutation in familial pancreatic adenocarcinoma several report have demonstrated the utility of platinumbased chemotherapy for treating cancer patient who harbour a brca mutation here we discus a yearold japanese female with no relevant past history who presented with epigastralgia and fever in september a computed tomography scan revealed a lowdensity lowenhanced tumour mm in diameter in the head of the pancreas the pathological diagnosis wa a ductal pancreatic carcinoma a mm lowenhanced metastatic tumour wa also detected in segment of the liver because she had early onset of the disease and a family historyher mother died of pancreatic adenocarcinoma at age we considered a diagnosis of familial pancreatic adenocarcinoma she received modified folfirinox two month after starting chemotherapy she wa diagnosed with an invasive ductal carcinoma in the right breast folfirinox wa continued for cycle month the primary pancreatic adenocarcinoma shrank and the liver metastatic focus disappeared but the size of the breast tumour increased total right breast excision and sentinel lymph node dissection were performed folfirinox wa continued and after cycle month both her pancreatic adenocarcinoma and liver metastasis were no longer visible using imaging pancreatoduodenectomy wa performed and the primary tumour had shrunk to mm genetic testing revealed a germline brca mutation the folfirinox regimen showed dramatic effect on the collision pancreatic but not on the breast cancer
label: Cancer

title: genomics of gynaecological carcinosarcoma and future treatment option
abstract: gynaecological carcinosarcoma are the most lethal gynaecological malignancy that are often highly resistant to standard chemotherapy they are composed of both carcinomatous and sarcomatous component and are associated with high rate of metastatic disease due to their rarity molecular study have been carried out on relatively few tumour revealing a broad spectrum of heterogeneity in this review we have collated the gene mutation gene expression epigenetic regulation and protein expression reported by a number of study on gynaecological carcinosarcoma based on these result we describe potential therapeutic that may demonstrate efficacy and present any preclinical study that have been carried out we also describe the preclinical model currently available for future research to assess the potential of molecularly matched therapy interestingly overexpression of many biomarkers in carcinosarcoma tumour often doesnt correlate with a worse prognosis therefore we propose that profiling the mutational landscape gene expression and gene amplificationdeletion may better indicate potential treatment strategy and predict response thus improving outcome for woman with this rare aggressive disease
label: Cancer
combined_text: genomics of gynaecological carcinosarcoma and future treatment option gynaecological carcinosarcoma are the most lethal gynaecological malignancy that are often highly resistant to standard chemotherapy they are composed of both carcinomatous and sarcomatous component and are associated with high rate of metastatic disease due to their rarity molecular study have been carried out on relatively few tumour revealing a broad spectrum of heterogeneity in this review we have collated the gene mutation gene expression epigenetic regulation and protein expression reported by a number of study on gynaecological carcinosarcoma based on these result we describe potential therapeutic that may demonstrate efficacy and present any preclinical study that have been carried out we also describe the preclinical model currently available for future research to assess the potential of molecularly matched therapy interestingly overexpression of many biomarkers in carcinosarcoma tumour often doesnt correlate with a worse prognosis therefore we propose that profiling the mutational landscape gene expression and gene amplificationdeletion may better indicate potential treatment strategy and predict response thus improving outcome for woman with this rare aggressive disease

title: the role of exosomes and myc in therapy resistance of acute myeloid leukemia challenge and opportunity
abstract: acute myeloid leukemia aml is caused by abnormal production of white blood cell red blood cell or platelet the leukemia cell communicate with their microenvironment through nanovesicle exosomes that are nm in diameter these nanovesicles are released from body fluid upon fusion of an endocytic compartment with the cell membrane exosomes function a cargo to deliver signaling molecule to distant cell this allows crosstalk between hematopoietic cell and other distant target cell environment exosomes support leukemia growth by acting a messenger between tumor cell and the microenvironment a well a inducing oncogenic factor such a cmyc exosomes have also been used a biomarkers in the clinical diagnosis of leukemia glycogen synthase kinase gsk and protein phosphatase a ppa are two crucial signaling molecule involved in the aml pathogenesis and myc stability gsk is a serinethreonine protein kinase that coordinate with over different protein during physiologicalpathological condition in blood cell the dysregulation in gsk ha been reported during hematological malignancy gsk act a a tumor suppressor by targeting cmyc mcl and betacatenin conversely gsk can also act a tumor promoter in some instance the pharmacological modulators of gsk such a abt bromoindirubinoxime bio g and ly have shown promise in the treatment of hematological malignancy ppa is a heterotrimeric serinethreonine phosphatase involved in the regulation of hematological malignancy ppaactivating drug pad can effectively antagonize leukemogenesis the discovery of exosomes kinase inhibitor and phosphatase activator have provided new hope to the leukemia patient this review discusses the role of exosomes gsk and ppa in the pathogenesis of leukemia we provide evidence from both preclinical and clinical study
label: Cancer

title: a first japanese case of neuroendocrine prostate cancer accompanied by lung and brain metastasis with somatic and germline brca mutation
abstract: germline mutation and copy number change in dna damage repair ddr gene such a brca are associated with aggressive form of prostate cancer pca although the prevalence of brca variant in pca is increasing in japan the genomic and biological implication in japanese patient are unclear an yearold male presented with prostatic adenocarcinoma with neuroendocrine differentiation accompanied by metastatic lung nodule and brain metastasis platinumbased doublet chemotherapy combined with etoposide resulted in partial and complete remission of brain and lung metastasis respectively nextgeneration sequencing of biopsy and peripheral blood sample demonstrated a somatic brca mutation at cac and a germline mutation at pe the patient son had been diagnosed with breast cancer year ago and wa found to have the same germline brca mutation brca mutation increase the risk of aggressive pca and other cancer type in japanese male these form may be highly responsive to platinumbased chemotherapy

title: malignant fibrous histiocytoma arising from the renal capsule and gene mutation screening a case report
abstract: malignant fibrous histiocytoma mfh is an aggressive soft tissue sarcoma renal mfh is rare and information about it molecular characterization is limited we present here the case of a yearold man who wa incidentally found to have a huge right renal mass on computed tomography radical nephrectomy wa performed pathological diagnosis wa mfh arising from the renal capsule we used ion ampliseq cancer hotspot panel version primer to perform gene mutation screening we detected mutation in hotspot oncogene csfr fgfr kdr apc pdgfra tp flt erbb kit stk ret but these were not matched to driver mutation
label: Cancer

title: intraoral ebvpositive sporadic burkitt lymphoma in an elderly patient with bilateral presentation
abstract: sporadic burkitt lymphoma sbl is a variant of burkitt lymphoma that occurs worldwide affecting mainly child and young adult association with epsteinbarr virus ebv can be identified in approximately of case herein we described a case of a yearold male presenting intraoral bilateral mandibular swelling subjacent to fixed dental prosthesis with one month of duration incisional biopsy were performed and after two day the patient wa hospitalized due to malaise and breathing difficulty and died after a week when an abdominal tumor wa detected the mandibular biopsy revealed a diffuse proliferation of mediumsized monomorphic atypical lymphoid cell exhibiting numerous mitoses and area of starrysky pattern the tumor showed immunohistochemical positivity for cd cd bcl and ki it wa negative for cd bcl vsc and mum positivity for ebv wa found by in situ hybridization the final diagnosis wa intraoral sbl positive for ebv clinical morphological and molecular criterion are necessary for the correct diagnosis of aggressive bcell neoplasm positive for ebv in elderly patient
label: Cancer

title: a rare simultaneous coexistence of epithelioid gastrointestinal stromal tumor and schwannoma in the stomach a case report
abstract: background gastrointestinal stromal tumor gist a type of mesenchymal tumor in the gastrointestinal tract are believed to be closely associated with pdgfra and ckit mutation schwannoma in the stomach which is an unusual location is a rare disorder the simultaneous occurrence of the two disease is rarer than metachronous occurrence and it pathological characteristic have not been reported to date we present a case report on a patient with simultaneous coexistence of gastric schwannoma and gist case presentation a yearold female visited our hospital complaining of intermittent abdominal pain for the previous month ct revealed a cm slight homogeneous enhancement in the lesser curvature of the stomach the mass wa nodular soft tissue which wa removed by radical surgery two solid tumor with different volume were located in the stomach histologically and immunohistochemically different the larger tumor consisted of spindle cell surrounded by a peripheral lymphoid cuff and wa positive for s the larger tumor wa therefore classified a a gastric schwannoma the smaller tumor wa composed of mediumsized round oval cell with amphiphilic granular cytoplasm vacuolization wa also observed the tumor cell were positive for dog and sporadically positive for cd and cd hence the smaller tumor wa diagnosed a epithelioid gist sanger sequencing revealed that the gist tumor cell contained a deletion mutation c deldel which wa located in exon of pdgfra conclusion gist combined with gastric schwannoma are a considerably rare subgroup of gastric tumor related clinical research is comparatively weak and the mechanism remains unknown we reviewed related article to provide knowledge to improve the correct identification diagnosis and management of patient with gastric cancer all pathologist involved in the diagnosis and clinician involved in the treatment should be aware of this new kind of disease pattern to improve their understanding of the disease
label: Cancer

title: comparative aspect of mast cell neoplasia in animal and the role of kit in prognosis and treatment
abstract: mast cell neoplasia clinical presentation and biological behaviour vary considerably across mammalian specie ranging from a solitary benign mass to an aggressive systemic malignancy mutation in the kit protooncogene receptor tyrosine kinase kit gene are common molecular abnormality involved in mast cell tumorigenesis kit mutation often occur in dog cat and human neoplastic mast cell and result in altered kit protein structure and function in dog certain kit mutation are associated with more malignant and lethal disease in contrast kit mutation in feline and human mast cell neoplasm are not correlated with prognosis but are of value in diagnosis and treatment planning in human kit genetic abnormality have not been well investigated in other specie although aberrant cytoplasmic kit protein staining detected in neoplasm of the ferret horse and cow resembles aberrant kit staining pattern detected in neoplastic mast cell of dog cat and human mutation within kit are classified a either regulatorytype or enzymatic pockettype mutation according to their location within the kit protooncogene mutation within the enzymatic pocket domain confer tumour resistance to tyrosine kinase inhibitor tkis hence knowledge of tumour kit mutation status add valuable information for optimizing patient treatment strategy the use of tkis in combination with conventional chemotherapeutics ha opened a new treatment avenue for patient unresponsive to existing drug this review highlight the similarity and difference of mast cell neoplasia in mammal with a special focus on the involvement of kit in the canine and feline form in comparison to human mast cell neoplasia
label: Cancer

title: tumor brca test for patient with epithelial ovarian cancer the role of molecular pathology in the era of parp inhibitor therapy
abstract: the parp inhibitor olaparib ha been approved in the maintenance setting of platinumsensitive epithelial ovarian cancer patient with germline or somatic brca mutation therefore the availability of a tumor brca test ha become a clinical need we report the result of the clinical implementation of a tumor brca test within the frame of an institutional workflow for the management of patient with nonmucinous and nonborderline epithelial ovarian cancer in total patient with epithelial ovarian cancer were prospectively analyzed brca status wa evaluated on formalinfixed paraffinembedded tumor specimen using nextgeneration sequencing technology the tumor brca test had a success rate of of successfully analyzed case and a median turnaround time of calendar day among the case brca or brca pathogeniclikely pathogenic mutation were found in case and variant of uncertain significance in case the concordance rate between tumor brca test result and germline brca status wa with five case harboring pathogeniclikely pathogenic somaticonly mutation the nextgeneration sequencingbased tumor brca test showed a high success rate and a turnaround time compatible with clinical purpose the tumor brca test could be implemented in a molecular diagnostic setting and it may guide the clinical management of patient with epithelial ovarian cancer
label: Cancer

title: d magnetic mosfeo hybrid nanostructures for ultrasensitive exosome detection in gmr sensor
abstract: exosome released from cell play an important role in intercellular communication and show great clinical potential in early cancer screening and prognosis herein an ultrasensitive giant magnetoresistance gmr biosensor wa developed for exosome detection which wa based on d mosfeo nanostructures mofe a magnetic responsive probe for signal amplification the mofe can be readily synthesized with simple phase transfer method compared to pure feo magnetic nanoparticles mnps the layered mo function a a template for recruiting high loading density of mnps a magnetic probe after modified by aptamer we discover that the d magnetic mofe hybrid nanostructures enable both multidentate targeting and multimagnetic particlebased signal amplification increasing the magnetic sensor performance especially in sensitivity and output signal moreover the d magnetic nanocomposites afford high selectivity and excellent reproducibility with detection limit of exosomes in gmr sensor result demonstrate that the magnetic strategy based on d structure introduced here provide a new dimension for exosome detection which show great potential of engineering d magnetic nanobioprobes for gmr based liquid biopsy application
label: Cancer

title: fineneedle aspiration feature of bcorccnb sarcoma
abstract: objective bcorccnb sarcoma bcs is an undifferentiated tumor that ha some clinical and morphologic similarity to classic ewing sarcoma but it is characterized by a distinct bcorccnb gene fusion there are no report describing it cytomorphologic finding method we describe cytologic finding of five molecularly proven bcs case four male and one female aged year result smear showed mainly round cell but some spindle cell and rhabdoidlike cell were also observed dispersed cell dominated in smear but also distinct pseudopapillary structure with vascular core were noted in four case scant connective tissue fragment were found in four case there wa no rosette formation in any case conclusion bcs should be differentiated from other round cell tumor some cytologic feature especially rhabdoidlike cell connective tissue fragment and pseudopapillary formation combined with immunohistochemical and molecular study may be helpful in making the appropriate diagnosis
label: Cancer

title: long noncoding rna in myeloid malignancy
abstract: acute myeloid leukemia aml represents of adult leukemia and of childhood leukemia aml are characterized by the presence of blast or more in the bone marrow or defining cytogenetic abnormality laboratory diagnosis of myelodysplastic syndrome md depend on morphological change based on dysplasia in peripheral blood and bone marrow including peripheral blood smear bone marrow aspirate smear and bone marrow biopsy a leukemic cell are not functional the patient develops anemia neutropenia and thrombocytopenia leading to fatigue recurrent infection and hemorrhage the genetic background and associated mutation in aml blast determine the clinical course of the disease over the last decade noncoding rna transcript that do not codify for protein but play a role in regulation of function have been shown to have multiple application in the diagnosis prognosis and therapeutic approach of various type of cancer including myeloid malignancy after a comprehensive review of current literature we found report of multiple long noncoding rna lncrnas that can differentiate between aml type and how their exogenous modulation can dramatically change the behavior of aml cell these lncrnas include h linc rpc crinde rpp znfas ac sfmbt linc meg ac pvt hottip snhg and ccat in addition by performing an analysis on available aml data in the cancer genome atlas tcga we found lncrnas with significantly differential expression between patient in favorable intermediatenormal or poor cytogenetic risk category these are dancr prdmdt snhg oipas snhg jpx ftx kcnqot tpas and gas the identification of a molecular signature based on lncrnas ha the potential for have deep clinical significance a it could potentially help better define the evolution from lowgrade md to highgrade md to aml changing the course of therapy this would allow clinician to provide a more personalized patienttailored therapeutic approach moving from transfusionbased therapy a is the case for lowgrade md to the introduction of azacytidinebased chemotherapy or allogeneic stem cell transplantation which is the current treatment for highgrade md
label: Cancer

title: epigenetic target in synovial sarcoma a minireview
abstract: synovial sarcoma s are a type of soft tissue sarcoma sts and represent of all sts case although s can arise at any age it typically affect younger individual aged and is therefore part of both pediatric and adult clinical practice s occurs primarily in the limb often near joint but can present anywhere it is characterized by the recurrent pathognomonic chromosomal translocation txpq that most frequently fuse ssx or ssx gene with s this lead to the expression of the ssssx fusion protein which cause disturbance in several interacting multiprotein complex such a the switchsucrose nonfermentable swisnf complex also known a the baf complex and the polycomb repressive complex and prc and prc furthermore this promotes widespread epigenetic rewiring leading to aberrant gene expression that drive the pathogenesis of s good prognosis are characterized predominantly by small tumor size and young patient age whereas high tumor grade and an increased genomic complexity of the tumor constitute poor prognostic factor the current therapeutic strategy relies on chemotherapy and radiotherapy the latter of which can lead to chronic side effect for pediatric patient we will focus on the known role of swisnf prc and prc a the main effector of the ssssxmediated genome modification and we present existing biological rationale for potential therapeutic target and treatment strategy
label: Cancer

title: genetic metaanalysis of cancer diagnosis following statin use identifies new association and implicates human leukocyte antigen hla in woman
abstract: we sought to perform a genomic evaluation of the risk of incident cancer in statin user free of cancer at study entry patient who previously participated in two phase iv trial tnt and ideal with genetic data were used npooled a gwas metaanalysis using cox modeling for the prediction of incident cancer wa conducted in the pooled cohort and sexstratified r near hladoa gene wa associated with higher risk of incident cancer amongst woman with prevalent coronary artery disease cad taking statin hazard ratio hr confidence interval ci p  using the uk biobank and focusing exclusively on woman statin user with cad nfemale r remained significantly associated with incident cancer hr ci p  the association wa not observed in nonstatin user in this genetic metaanalysis we have identified a variant in woman statin user with prevalent cad that wa associated with incident cancer possibly implicating the human leukocyte antigen pathway

title: single agent v or v plus defactinib in krasmutant nonsmallcell lung cancer the ramp phase ii trial
abstract: kras mutation occur in approximately of lung adenocarcinoma mainly in codon of case pgc being the prevalent one followed by pgv and pgd and respectively treatment option for advanced kras mutant nonsmallcell lung cancer krasmt nsclc are limited to chemotherapy and immune checkpoint inhibitor cpi however clinical trial exploring specific targeted agent are expected to change the treatment landscape of this disease here we describe the design and scientific rationale of the randomized phase ii open label ramp study which will evaluate the efficacy and safety of v versus v in combination with defactinib in advanced krasmt nsclc patient after failure of prior platinumbased chemotherapy and cpi

abstract: patient with platinumresistant or refractory highgrade serous ovarian cancer hgsoc have a poor prognosis and their management represents a substantial unmet medical need preclinical data and result from a phase ib trial demonstrated the efficacy and tolerability of the combination of the specific phosphatidylinositolkinase pik inhibitor alpelisib plus the polyadenosine diphosphateribose polymerase parp inhibitor olaparib in platinumresistant nonbrcamutated ovarian cancer here we describe the study design and rationale for the phase iii multicenter openlabel randomized activecontrolled epikoengotov trial investigating alpelisib in combination with olaparib compared with standardofcare chemotherapy in patient with platinumresistant or refractory hgsoc with no germline brca mutation progressionfree survival blinded independent review committee is the primary end point overall survival is a key secondary end point clinical trial registration nct clinicaltrialsgov

title: hepatocellular adenoma subtypes based on classification system exploratory study of gadoxetate disodiumenhanced mri feature with proposal of a diagnostic algorithm
abstract: background the classification of hepatocellular adenoma hcas wa updated in on the basis of genetic and molecular analysis objective the purpose of this article wa to evaluate feature on gadoxetate disodiumenhanced mri of hca subtypes on the basis of the classification and to propose a diagnostic algorithm for determining subtype using these feature method this retrospective study included patient woman seven men mean age  sd year with histologically confirmed hca evaluated by gadoxetate disodiumenhanced mri from january to january subtypes were reclassified using criterion hepatocyte nuclear factor mutated hca hhca inflammatory hca ihca catenin exon activated hca hca mixed inflammatory and hca ihca sonic hedgehog hca shhca and unclassified hca uhca qualitative mri feature were assessed livertolesion contrast enhancement ratio llcers were measured subtypes were compared and a diagnostic algorithm wa proposed result the analysis included hcas hhcas ihcas six hca four ihca five shhca and three uhcas hhcas showed homogeneous diffuse intralesional steatosis in whereas all other hcas showed this finding in p p p p p the hcas and ihcas showed fluid component in whereas all other hcas showed this finding in p p conclusion finding on gadoxetate disodiumenhanced mri including hepatobiliary phase characteristic were associated with hca subtypes using the classification clinical impact the algorithm identified common hca subtypes with high accuracy including those with catenin exon mutation

title: in multiple myeloma highrisk secondary genetic event observed at relapse are present from diagnosis in tiny undetectable subclonal population

title: nonviral precision t cell receptor replacement for personalized cell therapy
abstract: t cell receptor tcrs enable t cell to specifically recognize mutation in cancer cell here we developed a clinicalgrade approach based on crisprcas nonviral precision genomeediting to simultaneously knockout the two endogenous tcr gene trac which encodes tcr and trbc which encodes tcr we also inserted into the trac locus two chain of a neoantigenspecific tcr neotcr isolated from circulating t cell of patient the neotcrs were isolated using a personalized library of soluble predicted neoantigenhla capture reagent sixteen patient with different refractory solid cancer received up to three distinct neotcr transgenic cell product each product expressed a patientspecific neotcr and wa administered in a celldoseescalation firstinhuman phase i clinical trial nct one patient had grade cytokine release syndrome and one patient had grade encephalitis all participant had the expected side effect from the lymphodepleting chemotherapy five patient had stable disease and the other eleven had disease progression a the best response on the therapy neotcr transgenic t cell were detected in tumour biopsy sample after infusion at frequency higher than the native tcrs before infusion this study demonstrates the feasibility of isolating and cloning multiple tcrs that recognize mutational neoantigens moreover simultaneous knockout of the endogenous tcr and knockin of neotcrs using singlestep nonviral precision genomeediting are achieved the manufacture of neotcr engineered t cell at clinical grade the safety of infusing up to three geneedited neotcr t cell product and the ability of the transgenic t cell to traffic to the tumour of patient are also demonstrated

title: diagnosis and management of parathyroid carcinoma a stateoftheart review
abstract: parathyroid carcinoma is one of the least common endocrine malignancy and account for approximately of all patient with primary hyperparathyroidism a systematic review of peerreviewed literature published between january and march via medline embase cochrane central register of controlled trial eudract clinicaltrialsgov cinahl and scopus wa conducted manuscript were eligible if they included data on adult nonpregnant population with parathyroid carcinoma no restriction regarding intervention comparators or duration of followup were imposed single case report review or metaanalyses were excluded outcome of interest were molecular pathogenesis clinical presentation differential diagnosis treatment followup and overall survival study quality wa evaluated using the newcastleottawa scale for observational study this review included study from country reporting on more than patient with parathyroid carcinoma cdc mutation ha been recognised a playing a pivotal role in molecular pathogenesis parathyroid carcinoma typically present with markedly increased calcium and parathyroid hormone level the most frequently described symptom were bone and muscle pain or weakness en bloc resection remains the gold standard for the surgical approach the year overall survival ranged from to with resistant hypercalcaemia a significant cause of mortality emerging evidence indicating that targeted therapy based on molecular biomarkers present a novel treatment option the rarity of pc and need for personalised treatment warrant multidisciplinary management in a centre of excellence with a track record in pc management

title: p interacted with nmyc and regulated it protein stability via altering it posttranslational modification in neuroblastoma
abstract: mycn amplification is an independent risk factor for poor prognosis in neuroblastoma nb but it protein product can not be directly targeted because of protein structure thus this study aimed to explore novel way to indirectly target nmyc by regulating it posttranslational modification ptms and therefore protein stability nmyc coimmunoprecipitation combined with hplcmsms identified ptm residue and potential nmycinteracting protein notably both acetylation and ubiquitination were identified on lysine of nmyc we then discovered that p which can interact with nmyc modulated the protein stability of nmyc in mycnamplified nb cell line and simultaneously regulated the acetylation level and ubiquitination level on lysine of nmyc protein in vitro furthermore p correlated with poor prognosis in nb patient taken together p can be considered a a potential therapeutic target to treat mycnamplified nb patient and other identified ptms and interacting protein also provide potential target for further study
label: Cancer

title: intratumor injection of thermosensitive polypeptide with resveratrol inhibits glioblastoma growth
abstract: local tumor treatment is a feasible measure for patient with glioblastoma gbm who are unsuitable for surgical resection interferonelastinlike polypeptide ifnelpv is a slowrelease biodegradable thermosensitive fusion protein with antitumor immunity and resveratrol re is a polyphenolic compound with an antitumor effect in this study we found that intratumor injection of ifnelpv combined with intraperitoneal injection of re is more effective in delaying gbm growth in mouse specifically in an orthotopic gbm model we found a significant improvement in the median survival with this strategy our result suggested that the combined use of ifnelpv and re ha a dramatic synergistic effect on gbm thus providing a novel and effective therapeutic strategy for tumor impact statement we report a novel and effective strategy in which the combined use of interferonelastinlike polypeptide ifnelpv and re effectively inhibits glioblastoma growth ifnelpv can create a reservoir in the tumor and continuously release ifn to produce a powerful in situ antitumor immune response furthermore the combination of ifnelpv and re is more effective in inhibiting tumor growth
label: Cancer

title: atypical molecular feature of pediatric tectal glioma a single institutional series
abstract: we present child diagnosed between and y female and male with molecularly distinct tectal glioma kras mutant egfr mutant srgapraf fusion that contributes to the growing literature of this uncommonly biopsied tumor the patient with egfr rc mutation had a more severe course earlier diagnosis subsequent leptomeningeal metastatic disease required more aggressive therapy and died year after diagnosis patient with kras mutation and srgapraf fusion had a more indolent course our series expands the molecular phenotype of tectal glioma with the potential for leptomeningeal dissemination future study on establishing genotypicphenotypic correlation from those who undergo biopsy are needed

title: ampliconbased ng test for assessing mlh promoter methylation and it correlation with braf mutation in colorectal cancer patient
abstract: detecting mlh promoter methylation is highly relevant to differentiate between possible lynch syndrome patient or patient with sporadic cause of mlhpms deficiency in colorectal crc and endometrial cancer here we aimed to develop a test for assessing mlh promoter methylation based in next generation sequencing ng and to evaluate the concordance of mlh methylation and brafv mutation status in crc for that we performed a series of experiment with dna from tumor saliva and commercial control sample and our in house developed ampliconbased ng test in patient sample mlh methylation above wa only observed in tumor with mlhpms loss we confirmed the reproducibility and accuracy of mlh promoter analysis performing a serial dilution experiment with completely methylated and unmethylated control dna and a comparison between two ng platform ion proton and illumina in mlhpms deficient tumor the mlh methylation status wa concordant with the braf mutation status in of the case our ampliconbased ng test showed a great sensitivity and specificity for detecting mlh methylation in crc sample with a high agreement with the evaluation of braf mutation this simple and affordable test could be used a a reflex test to identify patient with sporadic cause of mlhpms deficiency in crc aiding to genetic test referral and identification of lynch syndrome patient
label: Cancer

title: molecular disparity of hladpb is associated with the development of subsequent solid cancer after allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation
abstract: an increased incidence of subsequent solid cancer sscs ha been reported in longterm survivor of allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation allohsct and ssc is associated with inferior mortality and morbidity previous study showed that the incidence of ssc is significantly higher in those who underwent allohsct from hlamismatched donor suggesting that persistent alloimmunity may predispose patient to sscs it wa recently reported that in a cohort of patient who received allohsct from an unrelated donor matched at hlaa b c drb and dqb locus hladpb alloimmunity determined by high mismatched eplets me and predicted indirectly recognizable hla epitope pirche score p wa associated with relapse protection and increased risk of acute graftversushost disease gvhd

title: genomic profiling and prognostic factor of h kmmutant spinal cord diffuse glioma
abstract: h kaltered diffuse midline glioma is a highly lethal pediatrictype tumor without efficacious treatment recent finding have highlighted the heterogeneity among diffuse midline glioma with different location and age compared to tumor located in the brain stem and thalamus the molecular and clinicopathological feature of h kaltered spinal cord glioma are still largely elusive thus hindering the accurate management of patient here we aimed to characterize the clinicopathological and molecular feature of h kmmutant spinal cord glioma in consecutive case we found that the h kmmutant spinal cord glioma with a median age of year old had a significantly better prognosis than h kmmutant brain tumor we noticed a molecular heterogeneity of h kmmutant spinal cord astrocytoma via targeted sequencing with case tp mutation which occurred in of case is mutually exclusive with ppmd and nf mutation the tpmutant case had a significantly higher number of copy number variant cnv and a marginally higher proportion of pediatric patient age at diagnosis are associated with a worse prognosis interestingly the histological type an independent prognostic factor in multivariate cox regression can also stratify molecular feature of h kmmutant spinal cord glioma including the rb pathway kraspik pathway and chromosome arm cnv in conclusion although all h kmmutant spinal cord diffuse glioma were diagnosed a who grade the histological type molecular feature representing chromatin instability and molecular alteration associated with accelerated cell proliferative activity should not be ignored in clinical management
label: Cancer

title: braf ve and rnf comutations predict patient outcome with targeted therapy in realworld case of colorectal cancer
abstract: antibrafegfr therapy is approved for metastatic colorectal cancer mcrc with brafve mutation although not all patient respond novel recent finding indicate the potential of rnf mutation to predict outcome in patient with brafmutated microsatellite stable ms mcrc treated with antibrafegfr therapy this study aimed to independently and rapidly validate brafvernf comutations a predictive biomarkers of benefit to antiegfrbraf therapy clinical data were derived from electronic health record data from u cancer clinic between january and march from the flatiron healthfoundation medicine realworld clinicogenomic mcrc database realworld case of brafvemutated mcrc with patient receiving antibrafegfr therapy n were included patient who were ms with rnf mutation had favorable progressionfree survival hazard ratio hr ci ci and overall survival hr ci compared with wild type no difference in outcome wa observed between patient group with rnfmutant versus wildtype receiving standardofcare chemotherapy brafvernf comutations predict mcrc antibrafegfr outcome in diverse clinical setting

title: comparison of the radiomicsbased predictive model using machine learning and nomogram for epidermal growth factor receptor mutation status and subtypes in lung adenocarcinoma
abstract: the purpose of this study is to develop the predictive model for epidermal growth factor receptor egfr mutation status and subtypes exon point mutation lr and exon deletion mutation del and evaluate their clinical usefulness total patient with lung adenocarcinoma were retrospectively analyzed the analysis of variance and the least absolute shrinkage were used for feature selection from plain computed tomography image then radiomic score radscore wa calculated for the training and test cohort two machine learning ml model with fold were applied to construct the predictive model with radscore clinical feature and the combination of radscore and clinical feature the nomogram wa developed using radscore and clinical feature the prediction performance wa evaluated by the area under the receiver operating characteristic curve auc finally decision curve analysis dca wa performed using the best ml and nomogram model in the test cohort the auc of the best ml and the nomogram model were confidence interval and in the egfr mutation group and in the lr mutation group a well a and in the del group the dca showed that the nomogram model have comparable result with ml model we constructed two predictive model for egfr mutation status and subtypes the nomogram model had comparable result to the ml model because the superiority of the performance of ml and nomogram model varied depending on the prediction group appropriate model selection is necessary
label: Cancer

title: pdgfrb and notch mutation are detectable in a wider range of pericytic tumor including myopericytomas angioleiomyomas glomus tumor and their combined tumor
abstract: pericytic tumor are subclassified a myopericytomas myofibromas angioleiomyomas and glomus tumor according to the current world health organization classification these pericytic tumor form a continuous morphologic spectrum including those with combined morphology however to our knowledge no widely accepted criterion for classifying tumor with combined morphology are available recent study have identified plateletderived growth factor receptorbeta pdgfrb gene mutation in a subset of myofibromas myopericytomas and myopericytomatoses but not in angioleiomyomas notch receptor notch mutation have been reported in a subset of infantile myofibromatosis to assess their potential role in classifying pericytic tumor we investigated pdgfrb and notch mutation in pericytic tumor of variable morphology including some combined form our result show these mutation to be present in a variety of pericytic tumor such a myopericytomas pdgfrb notch myopericytomatoses myofibromas angioleiomyomas and glomus tumor point mutation were identified in tumor in pdgfrb exon yc sf and g tumor in pdgfrb exon mi hl and nk and tumor in notch exon ast dn g ta ek g and va all pdgfrb mutation and notch g ta and g mutation were classified a deleteriousdamaging by  of pathogenicity prediction tool in silico fivemutationpositive tumor including myopericytomaangioleiomyoma myopericytomatosesmyofibroma myofibromamyopericytoma and angioleiomyomamyopericytoma were of combined morphology therefore we found pdgfrb and notch mutation to be detectable in a much wider variety of pericytic tumor than previously reported and confirmed myopericytomas myofibromas angioleiomyomas and glomus tumor a member harboring pdgfrb or notch mutation our result thus suggest that pdgfrb or notch mutation are not useful for subclassifying member of the pericytic tumor family
label: Cancer

title: the perrs snp induces pigmentation phenotype of dyschromatosis universalis hereditaria
abstract: dyschromatosis universalis hereditaria duh is a pigmentary genodermatosis characterized by a mixture of hyperpigmented and hypopigmented macule distributed randomly over the body although sterile alpha motif and sh domaincontaining protein sash and atpbinding cassette subfamily b member abcb have been identified a causative gene for this disorder some case involve unknown pathogenic gene in this study wholeexome sequencing data analysis and sanger sequencing were utilized for a fourgeneration extended chinese family with duh a singlenucleotide polymorphism snp c c t pps r variant in exon of period circadian regulator per nm wa detected in each affected individual of the duh family the c c t snp of per perrs snp and a novel mutation in exon of sash c c g ptr were both found in the proband the affected individual carrying perrs snp in this family demonstrated mildpigmented phenotype compared to those of the proband carrying perrs snp and sash tr mutation increased melanin synthesis wa induced by perrs snp in the melanocyte of affected epithelial tissue mutated sash or perrs snp alone or cooperation of mutation of sash and perrs snp synergistically led to increased melanin synthesis and enhanced proliferation of melanoma cell in vitro we also phenotypically characterized a commercially available zebrafish mutant line harboring the perrs snp to induce melanocyte proliferation in vivo our result are the first to reveal that this per snp may be pathogenic for a novel duh subtype with mild hyperpigmented andor hypopigmented phenotype and that mutation of sash and per cooperatively promotes hyperpigmentation phenotype key message per r snp is identified to be associated with hyperpigmentation andor hypopigmentation phenotype and the novel pathogenic variant of per r snp probably contributed the pathogenesis of duh sashtr mutation is confirmed to associate with duh a novel autosomal dominant inheritance duh subtype with mild pigmentated phenotype is caused by the perrs snp
label: Cancer

title: vorasidenib and ivosidenib in idhmutant lowgrade glioma a randomized perioperative phase trial
abstract: vorasidenib and ivosidenib inhibit mutant form of isocitrate dehydrogenase midh and have shown preliminary clinical activity against midh glioma we evaluated both agent in a perioperative phase trial to explore the mechanism of action in recurrent lowgrade glioma igg and select a molecule for phase testing primary endpoint wa concentration of dhydroxyglutarate hg the metabolic product of midh enzyme measured in tumor tissue from patient with midhrh nonenhancing glioma following randomized treatment with vorasidenib mg or mg once daily qd ivosidenib mg qd or mg twice daily or no treatment before surgery tumor hg concentration were reduced by credible interval cri and cri in patient treated with vorasidenib mg qd and ivosidenib mg qd respectively both agent were well tolerated and followup is ongoing in exploratory analysis hg reduction wa associated with increased dna hydroxymethylcytosine reversal of proneural and stemness gene expression signature decreased tumor cell proliferation and immune cell activation vorasidenib which showed brain penetrance and more consistent hg suppression than ivosidenib wa advanced to phase testing in patient with midh lggs funded by agio pharmaceutical inc and servier pharmaceutical llc clinicaltrialsgov number nct
label: Cancer

title: the antitumorigenic role of cannabinoid receptor in colon cancer a study in mouse and human
abstract: the endocannabinoid system particularly cannabinoid receptor cb in mouse and cnr in human ha controversial pathophysiological implication in colon cancer here we investigate the role of cb in potentiating the immune response in colon cancer in mouse and determine the influence of cnr variant in human comparing wildtype wt mouse to cb knockout cb mouse we performed a spontaneous cancer study in aging mouse and subsequently used the aomdss model of colitisassociated colorectal cancer and a model for hereditary colon cancer apcmin additionally we analyzed genomic data in a large human population to determine the relationship between cnr variant and colon cancer incidence aging cb mouse exhibited a higher incidence of spontaneous precancerous lesion in the colon compared to wt control the aomdsstreated cb and apcmincb mouse experienced aggravated tumorigenesis and enhanced splenic population of immunosuppressive myeloidderived suppressor cell along with abated antitumor cd t cell importantly corroborative genomic data reveal a significant association between nonsynonymous variant of cnr and the incidence of colon cancer in human taken together the result suggest that endogenous cb activation suppresses colon tumorigenesis by shifting the balance towards antitumor immune cell in mouse and thus portray the prognostic value of cnr variant for colon cancer patient
label: Cancer

title: rational design of nonlinear hybridization immunosensor chain reaction for simultaneous ultrasensitive detection of two tumor marker protein
abstract: sensitive biomarker detection technique are beneficial for both disease diagnosis and postoperative examination the nonlinear hybridization chain reaction nhcr is widely used a an output signal amplification technique for biosensor platform a novel hairpinfree nhcr wa developed in this study a a flow cytometric immunoassay to detect alphafetoprotein afp and prostate specific antigen psa first the target afp is captured on magnetic bead mb that are modified with capture antibody then the prepared biotinstreptavidinbiotin bsb system which link biotinylated detection antibody and biotinylated trigger dna together through the high affinity between biotinstreptavidin interaction is added to label the target afp forming a sandwich complex with three trigger dna chain each trigger dna chain grows a dendritic dna nanostructure following a nonlinear hybridization chain reaction a the substrate flue chain are labeled with fluorophores the selfassembly process of dendritic dna is accompanied by the continuous release of fluorophores dendrite with strong fluorescence then form on the surface of mb finally the target afp is quantified by analyzing the fluorescent mb using flow cytometry the proposed immunoassay ha a high selectivity along with isothermal enzymefree and exponential amplification efficiency it show a limit of detection lod of pg ml the proposed biosensor wa also successfully used to quantitatively detect afp in serum sample it may be utilized to detect multiple tumor marker simultaneously by changing the size of mb and antibodyantigen pair most tumor marker are only related to tumor diagnosis but without specificity so the combined detection of multiple tumor marker can improve the accuracy of early tumor diagnosis
label: Cancer

title: bleb promote cell survival by assembling oncogenic signalling hub
abstract: most human cell require anchorage for survival cellsubstrate adhesion activates diverse signalling pathway without which cell undergo anoikisa form of programmed cell death acquisition of anoikis resistance is a pivotal step in cancer disease progression a metastasizing cell often lose firm attachment to surrounding tissue in these poorly attached state cell adopt rounded morphology and form small hemispherical plasma membrane protrusion called bleb bleb function ha been thoroughly investigated in the context of amoeboid migration but it ha been examined far less in other scenario here we show by threedimensional imaging and manipulation of cell morphological state that blebbing trigger the formation of plasma membraneproximal signalling hub that confer anoikis resistance specifically in melanoma cell blebbing generates plasma membrane contour that recruit curvaturesensing septin protein a scaffold for constitutively active mutant nra and effector these signalling hub activate erk and pikwellestablished promoter of prosurvival pathway inhibition of bleb or septins ha little effect on the survival of welladhered cell but in detached cell it cause nra mislocalization reduced mapk and pik activity and ultimately death this unveils a morphological requirement for mutant nra to operate a an effective oncoprotein furthermore whereas some brafmutated melanoma cell do not rely on this survival pathway in a basal state inhibition of braf and mek strongly sensitizes them to both bleb and septin inhibition moreover fibroblast engineered to sustain blebbing acquire the same anoikis resistance a cancer cell even without harbouring oncogenic mutation thus bleb are potent signalling organelle capable of integrating myriad cellular information flow into concerted cellular response in this case granting robust anoikis resistance
label: Cancer

title: trustii a global phase ii study of taletrectinib in rospositive nonsmallcell lung cancer and other solid tumor
abstract: crizotinib and entrectinib have been approved to treat ro fusionpositive ro nonsmallcell lung cancer however unmet need remain including treatment of patient with resistance mutation efficacy in brain metastasis and avoidance of neurological side effect taletrectinib wa designed to improve efficacy overcome resistance to firstgeneration ro inhibitor and address brain metastasis while conferring fewer neurological adverse event all of these feature are demonstrated and supported by the interim data from the regional phase ii trusti clinical study here we describe the rationale and design of trustii a global phase ii study of taletrectinib in patient with locally advancedmetastatic ro nonsmallcell lung cancer and other ro solid tumor the primary end point is confirmed objective response rate secondary end point include duration of response progressionfree survival overall survival and safety this trial is enrolling patient in north america europe and asia

title: pd blockade plus chemoradiotherapy a preoperative therapy for patient with brpclapc a biomolecular exploratory phase ii trial
abstract: this is a phase ii study of pd blockade plus chemoradiotherapy a preoperative therapy for patient with locally advanced or borderline resectable pancreatic cancer lapc or brpc respectively twentynine patient are enrolled in the study the objective response rate orr is and the r resection rate is the month progressionfree survival pfs rate and month overall survival o rate are and respectively grade or higher adverse event are anemia thrombocytopenia and jaundice circulating tumor dna analysis reveals that patient with a decline in maximal somatic variant allelic frequency maxvaf between the first clinical evaluation and baseline have a longer survival outcome and a higher response rate and surgical rate than those who are not pd blockade plus chemoradiotherapy a preoperative therapy display promising antitumor activity and multiomics potential predictive biomarkers are identified and warrant further verification

title: investigation of phenylimidazoaquinolines a potential antiproliferative agent
abstract: background it ha been demonstrated that the lead compound phenylimidazoaquinoline a selectively inhibits cyp enzyme additionally cyp inhibition ha been linked to inducing antiproliferative effect in various breast cancer cell line a well a relieving drug resistance caused by cyp upregulation material method herein novel analog of phenylimidazoaquinoline a have been synthesized with varied substitution on the phenyl and imidazole ring antiproliferative testing wa conducted using h thymidine uptake assay result phenylimidazoaquinoline a and phenylsubstituted analog c ome n napthalene displayed excellent antiproliferative activity demonstrating their potency against cancer cell line for the first time molecular modeling suggested that c and n bind similarly to a in the cyp binding site

title: construction of anoikisrelated lncrnas risk model predicts prognosis and immunotherapy response for gastric adenocarcinoma patient
abstract: background anoikis act a a programmed cell death that is activated during carcinogenesis to remove undetected cell isolated from ecm further anoikis based risk stratification is expected to provide a deeper understanding of stomach adenocarcinoma stad carcinogenesis method the information of stad patient were acquired from tcga dataset anoikisrelated gene were obtained from the molecular signature database and pearson correlation analysis wa performed to identify the anoikisrelated lncrnas arls we performed machine learning algorithm including univariate cox regression and least absolute shrinkage and selection operator lasso analysis on the arls to build the osscore and ossignature clinical subgroup analysis tumor mutation burden tmb detection drug susceptibility analysis immune infiltration and pathway enrichment analysis were further performed to comprehensive explore the clinical significance result we established a stad prognostic model based on five arls and it prognostic value wa verified survival analysis showed that the overall survival of highrisk score patient wa significantly shorter than that of lowrisk score patient the column diagram show satisfactory discrimination and calibration the calibration curve verifies the good agreement between the prediction of the line graph and the actual observation tide analysis and drug sensitivity analysis showed significant difference between different risk group conclusion the novel prognostic model based on anoikisrelated lncrnas we identified could be used for prognosis prediction and precise therapy in gastric adenocarcinoma

title: disruption of estrogen receptor beta dna binding domain impairs it tumor suppressive effect in triple negative breast cancer
abstract: triple negative breast cancer tnbc is an aggressive subtype of the disease which account for a disproportionately high percentage of breast cancer morbidity and mortality for these reason a better understanding of tnbc biology is required and the development of novel therapeutic approach are critically needed estrogen receptor beta er is a reported tumor suppressor that is expressed in approximately of primary tnbc tumor where it is associated with favorable prognostic feature and patient outcome previous study have shown that er mediates the assembly of corepressor complex on dna to inhibit the expression of multiple growth promoting gene and to suppress the ability of oncogenic transcription factor to drive cancer progression to further elucidate the molecular mechanism by which er elicits it anticancer effect we developed mdamb cell that inducibly express a mutant form of er incapable of directly binding dna we demonstrate that disruption of ers direct interaction with dna abolishes it ability to regulate the expression of well characterized immediate response gene and render it unable to suppress tnbc cell proliferation loss of dna binding also diminishes the ability of er to suppress oncogenic nfb signaling even though it still physically associate with nfb and other critical cofactor these finding enhance our understanding of how er function in this disease and provide a model system that can be utilized to further investigate the mechanistic process by which er elicits it anticancer effect
label: Cancer
