title: orthopaedic management of bone metastasis
abstract: thanks to advancement in cancer therapy an increasing number of cancer patient are expected to live longer with cancer in japan activity of daily livingadland quality of lifeqolof cancer patient ha become much more important than ever because a decline in mobility negatively affect adl and qol the management of locomotive organ of cancer patient is crucial in the japanese orthopaedic association decided their annual activity theme aslocomotive syndrome in cancer patient with the concept of preventing and improving locomotive syndrome for longer and healthier life of cancer patient bone metastasis a a major cause of locomotive syndrome in cancer patient need to be evaluated and managed properly for better adl and qol of cancer patient pathological fracture spinal instability and spinal injury cause not only severe pain and massive functional impairment of patient but increased nursing care burden to resolve these problem surgery play a major role possible surgical procedure include internal fixation curettage cementation and arthroplasty for the long bone whereas percutaneous vertebroplasty decompression posterioranterior spinal fusion and total en bloc spondylectomy for the spine less invasive surgical procedure tends to be chosen for a patient with poorer prognosis the main purpose of bone metastasis surgery is to maintain adl and qol of cancer patient hopefully during the remaining survival time therefore estimated survival should be considered when determining the surgical strategy in addition caseby case careful perioperative management is required because cancer therapy can vary widely in patient age cancer type and tumor stage to accommodate the variety of orthopaedic surgery to the diversity of cancer therapy the corporation between oncologist and orthopaedic surgeon is indispensable

title: cdx expression correlate with clinical outcome in msih metastatic colorectal cancer patient receiving immune checkpoint inhibitor
abstract: immune checkpoint inhibitor icis showed efficacy in metastatic colorectal cancer mcrc with mismatchrepair deficiency or high microsatellite instability dmmrmsih unfortunately a patient subgroup did not benefit from immunotherapy caudalrelated homeobox transcription factor cdx would seem to influence immunotherapy sensitivity promoting the chemokine cxc motif ligand cxcl expression therefore we investigated cdx role a a prognosticpredictive marker in patient with mcrc msih we retrospectively collected data from msih mcrc patient treated with icis between and the primary endpoint wa the month progressionfreesurvival pfs rate the secondary endpoint were overall survival o pfs objective response rate orr and disease control rate dcr the pfs rate at month wa in cdx positive patient v in cdx negative patient p the median pfs wa not reached nr in the cdx positive group versus month ci in cdx negative patient p median o wa nr in cdxpositive patient versus month confidence interval ci in cdxnegative patient p all cdxpositive patient achieved a disease response one of them a complete response among cdxnegative patient one achieved stable disease while the other progressed rapidly orr v p dcr v p twelve patient received stline pembrolizumab cdx positive and cdx negative not reaching median pfs while two patient cdx positive and cdx negative received rdline pembrolizumab reaching a median pfs of month ci p although our study report result on a small population the prognostic role of cdx in crc seems confirmed and could drive a promising predictive role in defining the population more sensitive to immunotherapy treatment modulating the cdxcxcl axis in cdxnegative patient could help overcome primary resistance to immunotherapy

title: establishing an rna fusion panel in soft tissue sarcoma with clinical validation
abstract: the diagnosis and classification of soft tissue sarcoma sts remain challenging because of the rarity and overlapping morphologic manifestation of diverse sts subtypes characteristic gene fusion are commonly detected in sts and represent useful diagnostic marker this study established and validated a customdesigned rna sequencing panel that identified gene fusion in sts the analytical performance validation yielded excellent accuracy with ci sensitivity and ci specificity clinical performance were further confirmed with clinical formalinfixed and paraffinembedded ffpe sample from sts patient fusion were detected in of sample the common fusion ssssx family ewsrrelated fusion colapdgfb foxoassociated fusion and fusassociated fusion were identified in corresponding sts subtypes the rna panel detected specific fusion in several case where no conclusive diagnosis can be made based on the morphology and immunohistochemistry result data collected in this study demonstrate that the rna fusion panel can better classify sts subtypes and serve a a good supplement for histopathology exhibiting a great potential for the sts precise diagnosis
label: Cancer

title: genetic testing in epithelial ovarian cancer implementation of the tumorfirst workflow
abstract: the new tumorfirst workflow for genetic testing in epithelial ovarian cancer detects woman with a genetic predisposition effectively and efficiently tumorfirst indicates that the tumor dna of all patient diagnosed with epithelial ovarian cancer is examined for the presence of pathogenic variant in amongst others brca and brca gene woman with an aberrant tumor dna test result are eligible for genetic testing using a sample of blood to detect heredity simultaneously the tumor dna test provides information on the effectiveness of additional treatment with parp inhibitor thereby the tumorfirst workflow save time and healthcare cost this workflow is currently implemented on a national level the focus of implementation is transferring knowledge to healthcare professional on requesting interpreting and reporting the tumor dna test and providing adequate support this nationwide implementation of tumorfirst can improve the recognition of heredity in epithelial ovarian cancer

title: toripalimab combined with lenvatinib and gemox is a promising regimen a firstline treatment for advanced intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma a singlecenter singlearm phase study
abstract: advanced intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma icc ha a dismal prognosis here we report the efficacy and safety of combining toripalimab lenvatinib and gemcitabine plus oxaliplatin gemox a firstline therapy for advanced icc thirty patient with pathologically confirmed advanced icc received intravenous gemcitabine gm on day and and oxaliplatin mgm qw for six cycle along with intravenous toripalimab mg qw and oral lenvatinib mg once daily for one year the expression of programmed deathligand pdl and genetic status wa investigated in paraffinembedded tissue using immunohistochemistry and wholeexome sequencing wes analysis the primary endpoint wa the objective response rate orr secondary outcome included safety overall survival o progressionfree survival pfs disease control rate dcr and duration of response dor a of july the median followup time wa month and the orr wa twentythree patient achieved partial response and one achieved complete response patient with dna damage response ddrrelated gene mutation showed a higher orr while patient with tumor area positivity  pdl staining showed a trend of high orr but without significant difference the median o pfs and dor were and month respectively the dcr wa further of patient experienced manageable grade  adverse event aes commonly neutropenia and leukocytopenia in conclusion toripalimab plus lenvatinib and gemox are promising firstline regimen for the treatment of advanced icc a phaseiii multicenter doubleblinded randomized study to validate our finding wa approved by the national medical product administration nmpa no lptrial registration clinical trial nct
label: Cancer

title: characterization of pancreatic cancer with ultralow tumor mutational burden
abstract: in pancreatic cancer pc tumor mutation burden tmb ha been reported to be lower than in other cancer with it clinical significance remaining unclear we analyzed the dataset of wholeexome sequencing and gene expression profiling of resected pc case the median tmb wa the tmb wa classified a high  low  or ultralow nineteen sample were classified a tmblow and were classified a tmbultralow no sample were tmbhigh tmbultralow pc had significantly fewer borderline resectable lesion p and fewer adenosquamous carcinoma p than tbmlow pc furthermore the tmbultralow pc showed significantly lower detection rate of driver mutation and copy number variation microsatellite instability wa not significantly correlated with the tmb status the tmbultralow pc had a significantly better prognosis than tbmlow pc p a multivariate analysis identified tmbultralow pc a an independent favorable prognostic factor hazard ratio p a gene expression analysis showed that tmbultralow pc wa associated with reduced tp inactivation p and reduced chromosomal instability p compared to tbmlow pc tmbultralow pc had specific gene expression signature and a better prognosis than tmblow pc

title: statistical method for integrative clustering of multiomics data
abstract: cancer are heterogeneous disease caused by accumulated mutation or abnormal alteration at multilevels of biological process including genomics epigenomics transcriptomics and proteomics there is a great clinical interest in identifying cancer molecular subtypes for disease prognosis and personalized medicine integrative clustering is a powerful unsupervised learning method that ha been increasingly used to identify cancer molecular subtypes using multiomics data including somatic mutation dna copy number dna methylation and gene expression integrative clustering method are generally classified into modelbased or nonparametric approach in this chapter we will give an overview of the frequently used modelbased method including icluster iclusterplus and iclusterbayes and the nonparametric method integrative nonnegative matrix factorization intnmf we will use the integrative analysis of uveal melanoma and lowergrade glioma to illustrate these representative method finally we will discus the strength and limitation of these representative method and give suggestion for performing integrative analysis of cancer multiomics data in practice
label: Cancer

title: prognostic significance of the genetic variant of lymphotoxin alpha pthrasn in egyptian patient with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma
abstract: hepatocellular carcinoma hcc is one of the most common malignancy worldwide in term of mortality and susceptibility is attributed to genetic lifestyle and environmental factor lymphotoxin alpha lta ha a crucial role in communicating the lymphocyte with stromal cell and provoking cytotoxic effect on the cancer cell there are no report on the contribution of the lta c ca pthrasn r gene polymorphism to hcc susceptibility the main aim of this study is to investigate the association of lta c ca pthrasn r variant with the hcc risk in the egyptian population
label: Cancer

title: integration of clinical and spatial data to explore lipid metabolismrelated gene for predicting prognosis and immune microenvironment in glioma
abstract: lipid metabolism is crucial to tumor growth and immune microenvironment a well a drug sensitivity in glioma identifying prognostic indicator of glioma and elucidating the mechanism of glioma progression are critical for improving the prognosis of glioma patient in this study we investigated the role and prognostic value of metabolismrelated gene in glioma by integrative analysis of datasets from geo cgga and tcga based on clinical data and transcriptome data we found that the expression pattern of three major pathway related to lipid metabolism is fatty acidhighphospholipidhightriglyceridelow which is associated with better prognosis and immune infiltration the gene involved in these three pathway were used to generate a prognostic model which showed high stability and efficiency in the test set and validation set the spatial transcriptome of glioma patient revealed that the microenvironment of the region with high expression of risk gene cav and scd is in a state of hypoxia emt and cell cycle arrest and thus can be used a marker of metabolic reprogramming in the tumor microenvironment in the highrisk group m macrophage and m macrophage were significantly enriched and the risk score wa significantly correlated with gene mutation and methylation of risk gene we further performed drug sensitivity screening corresponding to different risk gene this study provided novel insight into the differential immune microenvironment with different expression pattern of metablismrelated gene and highlighted the spatial and temporal synergy of tumor progression and metabolic reprogramming
label: Cancer

title: large cell calcifying sertoli cell tumour molecular and immunohistochemical assessment of a series comprising nonmetastasising and metastasising neoplasm
abstract: large cell calcifying sertoli cell tumour lccsct is a type of testicular sex cordstromal tumour that may occur sporadically or in the context of carney complex and other genetic syndrome a subset is clinically malignant and the molecular mechanism that drive such aggressive behaviour remain unknown method and result we analysed sample from patient with lccsct nonmetastasising and eight metastasising using prkara immunohistochemistry ihc and nextgeneration sequencing all tumour except two case and both metastasising demonstrated loss of prkara expression among case with interpretable sequencing result all harboured pathogenic single nucleotide variant of prkara evidence of loss of heterozygosity loh of prkara wa present in all tumour with interpretable zygosity data but the mechanism of loh were different for nonmetastasising and metastasising tumour nonmetastasising tumour demonstrated only copyneutral loh while metastasising tumour demonstrated a spectrum of mechanism of loh including copyloss loh two concurrent mutation or copyneutral loh relevant molecular finding in nonmetastasising lccsct were limited to prkara variant in contrast all metastasising lccscts with interpretable data harboured additional pathogenic variant including but not restricted to brca mutation with evidence of loh and biallelic cdknab deletion three patient harboured prkara variant of inferred germline origin including one with carney complex and two without known syndromic feature conclusion this study further confirms that prkara ihc is a useful diagnostic tool for both nonmetastasising and metastasising tumour and suggests that molecular analysis can be helpful to identify nonmetastasising tumour with malignant potential in selected patient importantly these result highlight that germline assessment could be beneficial for all patient presenting with lccsct
label: Cancer

title: ikzf is a novel prognostic biomarker for head and neck squamous cell carcinoma a study based on bioinformatics analysis
abstract: in the past few year immunotherapy of tumor ha become an extensive research hotspot and the value of ikzf family gene in the tumor microenvironment ha also been increasingly recognized however the expression of the ikaros family zinc finger ikzf gene in human head and neck squamous cell carcinoma hnscc and it prognostic value were not reported for the main subset until now in the present study we analyzed the relationship between ikzf gene expression and the survival of hnscc patient to evaluate the potential of ikzf a a prognostic biomarker for hnscc comprehensively multiple online analysis tool including ualcan cbioportal gepia webgestalt string genomic data common and timer database were utilized in our study we observed that the hnscc patient with higher ikzf expression tended to exhibit longer overall survival univariate and multivariate cox regression analysis indicated that age and grade were independent prognostic indicator in hnscc moreover gene ontology and kegg function enrichment analysis showed that several pathway in hnscc might be pivotal pathway regulated by ikzf which revealed that ikzf wa probably participating in the occurrence and development of hnscc furthermore the hypomethylation of the ikzf gene wa closely associated with gene that observed mutation in hnscc ikzf wa significantly correlated with several immune cell in hnscc eg cd t cell cd cell and dendritic cell we explored the potential prognostic value and role of the ikzf in hnscc revealing that ikzf wa probably a novel and reliable prognostic biomarker for patient with hnscc
label: Cancer

title: comprehensive analysis of pancancer reveals the potential of slca a a prognostic and immunological biomarker
abstract: slca play an important role in the development of multiple cancer type pancancer analysis may have significant impact on the exploration of the relationship between slca gene expression prognosis and the molecular mechanism of tumorigenesis in this study through the analysis of tcga and geo datasets we explored the expression level and survival prognosis of slca in pancancer and further explored the difference in slca gene mutation methylation and phosphorylation between tumor and normal tissue in addition we focused on the biological function of this gene and the relationship between the prognosis and immune infiltration by immune infiltration analysis and enrichment analysis in order to evaluate the diagnostic and prognostic significance of slca in carcinoma the study found that slca wa highly expressed in kind of tumor and there were statistically significant difference in the prognosis of tumor the phosphorylation level of s increased in ov rcc and ucec there wa a statistically negative correlation between the cd tcell infiltration level and the slca expression in hnsc lusc sarc tgct and kirc the cancerrelated fibroblast were positively correlated with slca expression in blca brca kirc kirp paad pcpg and thca the enrichment analysis indicated that the tumorigenesis mechanism of this gene wa mainly related to glycolysis and glucose metabolism synthesis slca wa a promising prognostic and immunological biomarker in pancancer
label: Cancer

title: rectum adenocarcinoma metabolic subtypes analysis and a risk prognostic model construction based on fatty acid metabolism gene
abstract: fatty acid metabolism is an essential part of cancer research due to it role in cancer initiation and progression however it characteristic and prognostic value in rectum adenocarcinoma have not been systematically evaluated we collected fatty acid metabolism gene expression profile and clinical information from the cancer genome atlas and gene expression omnibus database after excluding individual lacking clinical information and the presence of genetic mutation we performed consistent clustering of the remaining patient and selected stable clustering result to group patient differentially expressed gene and gene set enrichment analysis were compared between subgroup while metabolic signature identification and decoding the tumor microenvironment were performed in addition we explored the survival status of patient among different subgroup and identified signature gene affecting survival by least absolute shrinkage and selection operator regression finally we selected signature gene to construct a risk prognostic model by multivariate cox regression and evaluated model efficacy by univariate cox regression and the receiver operating characteristic curve by consensus clustering patient were distinguished into stable subpopulation gene set enrichment analysis and metabolic signature identification effectively defined completely different subtypes of fatty acid metabolism fatty acid catabolic subtype and fatty acid anabolic subtype among them patient with the fatty acid catabolic subtype had a poorer prognosis with a significantly lower proportion of myeloid dendritic cell infiltration within the tumor microenvironment aquaporin hazard ratio hr p x inactive specific transcript hr p and interleukin induced hr p were selected by multivariate cox regression which constructed a risk prognostic model the independent hazard ratio of the model wa and the area under curve wa higher than age gender and tumor stage showing better predictive efficacy our study revealed the heterogeneity of fatty acid metabolism in rectum adenocarcinoma defined completely distinct subtypes of fatty acid metabolism and finally established a novel fatty acid metabolismrelated risk prognostic model the study contributes to the early risk assessment and monitoring of individual prognosis and provides data to support individualized patient treatment
label: Cancer

title: copy number alteration is an independent prognostic biomarker in triplenegative breast cancer patient
abstract: nextgeneration sequencing ng ha enabled comprehensive genomic profiling to identify gene alteration that play important role in cancer biology however the clinical significance of these genomic alteration in triplenegative breast cancer tnbc patient ha not yet been fully elucidated the aim of this study wa to clarify the clinical significance of genomic profiling data including copy number alteration cna and tumor mutation burden tmb in tnbc patient

title: pcb a pseudotemporal causalitybased bayesian approach to identify emtassociated regulatory relationship of a event and rbps during breast cancer progression
abstract: during breast cancer metastasis the developmental process epithelialmesenchymal em transition is abnormally activated transcriptional regulatory network controlling em transition are wellstudied however alternative rna splicing also play a critical regulatory role during this process alternative splicing wa proved to control the em transition process and rnabinding protein were determined to regulate alternative splicing a comprehensive understanding of alternative splicing and the rnabinding protein that regulate it during em transition and their dynamic impact on breast cancer remains largely unknown to accurately study the dynamic regulatory relationship timeseries data of the em transition process are essential however only crosssectional data of epithelial and mesenchymal specimen are available therefore we developed a pseudotemporal causalitybased bayesian pcb approach to infer the dynamic regulatory relationship between alternative splicing event and rnabinding protein our study shed light on facilitating the regulatory networkbased approach to identify key rnabinding protein or target alternative splicing event for the diagnosis or treatment of cancer the data and code for pcb are available at httphkumathhkuhkwkcpcbdatacodezip
label: Cancer

title: nanoengineered gallium ion incorporated formulation for safe and efficient reversal of parp inhibition and platinum resistance in ovarian cancer
abstract: platinumbased chemotherapy remains the main systemic treatment of ovarian cancer oc however the inevitable development of platinum and poly adenosine diphosphateribose polymerase inhibitor parpi resistance is associated with poor outcome which becomes a major obstacle in the management of this disease the present study developed allinone nanoparticles that contained the parpi olaparib and gallium ga iii olaparibga to effectively reverse parpi resistance in platinumresistant acis and skovcis oc cell and in skovcis tumor model notably the olaparibga suppressed skovcis tumor growth with negligible toxicity moreover the suppression effect wa more evident when combining olaparibga with cisplatin or carboplatin a evaluated in acis and skovcis cell mechanistically the combined treatment induced dna damage which elicited the activation of ataxia telangiectasia mutated atmamt and radrelated atr checkpoint kinase chkchk signal transduction pathway this led to the arrest of cell cycle progression at s and gm phase which eventually resulted in apoptosis and cell death due to unrepairable dna damage in addition effective therapeutic response to olaparibga and cisplatin combination or olaparibga and carboplatin combination were observed in skovcis tumorbearing animal model altogether the present finding demonstrate that olaparibga ha therapeutic implication in platinumresistant oc cell and the combination of olaparibga with cisplatin or carboplatin may be promising for treating patient with oc who exhibit resistance to both parpi and platinum
label: Cancer

title: kras nra braf and pikca mutation rate clinicopathological association and their prognostic value in iranian colorectal cancer patient
abstract: mutation in kras nra braf and pikca gene are critical factor in clinical evaluation of colorectal cancer crc development and progression in iran however the data regarding genetic profile of crc patient is limited except for kras exon and braf vf mutation this study aimed to investigate the mutational spectrum and prognostic effect of these gene and explore the relationship between these mutation and clinicopathological feature of crc

title: adjuvant durvalumab after concurrent chemoradiotherapy for patient with unresectable stage iii nsclc harbouring uncommon genomic alteration
abstract: adjuvant durvalumab is the standard of care for patient with stage iii unresectable nonsmall cell lung cancer nsclc without progression after concurrent chemoradiation ccrt patient with stage iii nsclc harbouring epidermal growth factor receptor egfr mutation and anaplastic lymphoma kinase rearrangement do not seem to benefit from durvalumab data are lacking about patient harbouring other driver genomic alteration dga we performed a multicentre n netherlands and italy retrospective study including consecutive patient with unresectable stage iii nsclc and treated with ccrtwith or without adjuvant durvalumabbetween and we enrolled patient of which received adjuvant durvalumab sixtysix patient had dga kras mutation egfr common mutation and uncommon dga in the entire population the median pfs wa month ci and month ci with and without durvalumab p in the dga group excluding common egfr mpfs wa month ci with and ci without durvalumab p for patient with kras mutation mpfs wa month ci with and month ci without durvalumab p among patient with uncommon dga mpfs wa month ci with and month ci without durvalumab p we have shown a meaningful survival benefit of adjuvant durvalumab in patient harbouring kras mutation and uncommon dga this is the largest stage iii nsclc cohort showing the efficacy of durvalumab in patient with uncommon dga further prospective study are needed to confirm our result
label: Cancer

title: dmap is an essential regulator of atm activity and function
abstract: the hereditary autosomal recessive disease ataxia telangiectasia at is caused by mutation in the dna damage kinase atm atm main function is to orchestrate dna repair thereby maintaining genomic stability atm activity is increased in response to several stimulus including ionising radiation ir and hypotonic stress dnmtassociated protein dmap is a member of the tipp histone acetyl transferase hat complex which acetylates histone h at lysine hk to affect chromatin relaxation and modulate atm activation here we demonstrate that dmap is required for both mode of atm activation knockdown of dmap impaired irinduced atm activation and consequently resulted in radiosensitivity and impaired the gm checkpoint moreover dmap wa also required for efficient atm signalling in response to hypotonic stress overexpression of dmap increased irinduced atm substrate phosphorylation suggesting that dmap function is rate limiting for atm signalling dmap associated with tipdependent hat activity and depletion of dmap reduced hk acetylation in response to dna damage treatment with histone deacetylase inhibitor rescued irinduced atm signalling in dmapdepleted cell these result suggest that dmap is a critical regulator of atm activity and function

title: a clinical and genetic overview of year neurofibromatosis type molecular diagnostics in the netherlands
abstract: nf mutation are the underlying cause of neurofibromatosis type nf a neurocardiofaciocutaneous syndrome ncfc because of the clinical overlap between ncfcs genetic analysis of nf is necessary to confirm a clinical diagnosis nf this report describes the clinical and genetic finding of year of nf molecular diagnostics in the netherlands a pathogenic mutation wa found in of the index patient mostly de novo the majority of the index patient fulfilled the national institute of health nf criterion a pathogenic mutation wa found in of these patient seventyfour percent of the index patient with an nf pathogenic mutation and not fulfilling the nf criterion is year in agreement with the fact that some nf symptom appear after puberty genotypephenotype correlation were studied for index patient nf patient with a type microdeletion have a sixfold higher risk of special education v nf patient with an intragenic mutation no evidently milder nf phenotype for patient with a missense mutation wa observed fortysix prenatal analysis were performed in family of which showed heterozygosity for the familial pathogenic mutation this indicates that there is a need for prenatal nf testing

title: adultonset mastocytosis in the skin is highly suggestive of systemic mastocytosis
abstract: adultonset urticaria pigmentosamastocytosis in the skin almost always persists throughout life the prevalence of systemic mastocytosis in such patient is not precisely known bone marrow biopsy from patient with mastocytosis in the skin and all available skin biopsy n were subjected to a meticulous cytological histological immunohistochemical and molecular analysis for the presence of whodefined diagnostic criterion for systemic mastocytosis compact mast cell infiltrates major criterion atypical mast cell morphology kit dv abnormal expression of cd by mast cell and serum tryptase level ngml minor criterion systemic mastocytosis is diagnosed when the major diagnostic criterion plus one minor criterion or at least three minor criterion are fulfilled systemic mastocytosis wa confirmed in patient by the diagnosis of compact mast cell infiltrates plus at least one minor diagnostic criterion n or at least three minor diagnostic criterion n in two patient only two minor diagnostic criterion were detectable insufficient for the diagnosis of systemic mastocytosis by the use of highly sensitive molecular method including the analysis of microdissected mast cell kit dv wa found in all bone marrow biopsy investigated for it but only in of the skin biopsy it is important to state that even in case with insufficient diagnostic criterion for systemic mastocytosis kit dvpositive mast cell were detected in the bone marrow this study demonstrates for the first time that almost all patient with adultonset mastocytosis in the skin in fact have systemic mastocytosis with cutaneous involvement
label: Non-Cancer

title: nonaggressive systemic mastocytosis sm without skin lesion associated with insectinduced anaphylaxis show unique feature versus other indolent sm
abstract: background indolent systemic mastocytosis ism without skin lesion ism show a higher prevalence in male lower serum baseline tryptase level and kit mutation more frequently restricted to bone marrow bm mast cell mc than ism with skin lesion ism interestingly in almost onehalf of ism patient mcmediator release episode are triggered exclusively by insect objective we aimed to determine the clinical and laboratory feature of ism associated with insectinduced anaphylaxis insectisms versus other patient with ism method a total of patient presenting with mc activation syndrome including insectisms ism triggered by other factor otherisms ism and nonclonal mc activation syndrome were studied result compared with otherisms and ism patient insectisms case showed marked male predominance v and p a distinct pattern of mcrelated symptom and significantly lower median serum baseline tryptase level v and mugl p moreover insectisms less frequently presented bm mc aggregate v and p and they systematically showed mcrestricted kit mutation conclusion ism patient with anaphylaxis triggered exclusively by insect display clinical and laboratory feature that are significantly different from other ism case including other ism and ism patient suggesting that they represent a unique subgroup of ism with a particularly low bm mc burden in the absence of adverse prognostic factor
label: Non-Cancer

title: common variant of znf rptor and trafip gene and psoriasis risk
abstract: psoriasis vulgaris is a genetically heterogenous disease with unclear molecular background we assessed the association of psoriasis and it main clinical phenotype with common variant of three potential psoriasis susceptibility gene znf rptor and trafp we genotyped common variant in a cohort of casecontrol individual using taqman genotyping assay and sequencing minor allele of all four trafip variant were more frequent among case the strongest significant association wa observed for r or p minor allele of this snp wa always present in two haplotype found to be associated with increased psoriasis risk rsg rsg rst rsa or p and rsa rsa rst rsg or p analysis of clinically relevant phenotype revealed association of r with pustular psoriasis or p we observed significant connection of severity of cutaneous disease with variation at r and suggestive with three remaining trafip snp another positive association were found between age of onset and familial aggregation of disease smoking and younger age of onset smoking and occurrence of pustular psoriasis nail involvement and arthropatic psoriasis nail involvement and more severe course of psoriasis we found no statistically significant difference in the prevalence of the examined variant of rptor and znf gene among our case and control we have replicated the association of trafiprs variant with the susceptibility to psoriasis we have found new association with clinically relevant subphenotypes such a pustular psoriasis or moderatetosevere case we ascertain no connection of rptor and znf variant with psoriasis or it subphenotypes
label: Non-Cancer

title: disruption of helixcapping residue and reveals a role in hiv entry for a specialized hinge segment of the membrane proximal external region of gp
abstract: hiv human immunodeficiency virus type us it trimeric gp envelope env protein consisting of noncovalently associated gp and gp subunit to mediate entry into human t lymphocyte a facile virus fusion mechanism compensates for the sparse env copy number observed on viral particle and includes a aminoacid lentivirusspecific adaptation at the gp base amino acid residue termed the membrane proximal external region mper we show by nmr and epr that the mper consists of a structurally conserved pair of viral lipidimmersed helix separated by a hinge with tandem joint that can be locked by capping residue between helix this design foster efficient hiv fusion via interconverting structure while at the same time affording immune escape disruption of both joint by double alanine mutation at env position and aa result in attenuation of envmediated cellcell fusion and hemifusion a well a viral infectivity mediated by both cddependent and cdindependent virus the potential mechanism of disruption wa revealed by structural analysis of mper conformational change induced by aa mutation a deeper acyl chainburied mper middle section and the elimination of crosshinge rigidbody motion almost certainly impede requisite structural rearrangement during the fusion process explaining the absence of mper aa variant among all known naturally occurring hiv viral sequence furthermore those broadly neutralization antibody directed against the hiv mper exploit the tandem joint architecture involving helix capping thereby disrupting hinge function
label: Non-Cancer

title: lower lip pit van der woude or kabuki syndrome
abstract: kabuki syndrome k is a multiple congenital anomalymental retardation syndrome with characteristic facial feature despite more than documented case and recent correlation of mll mutation a a genetic cause it full clinical spectrum is still being defined this report describes two patient who were initially diagnosed with van der woude syndrome vws based on the presence of lower lip pit however this finding can occur with k albeit infrequently for patient with lower lip pit a thorough evaluation should be made to distinguish between vws and k a there are difference in longterm prognosis

title: striking hematological abnormality in patient with microcephalic osteodysplastic primordial dwarfism type ii mopd ii a potential role of pericentrin in hematopoiesis
abstract: background microcephalic osteodysplastic primordial dwarfism type ii mopd ii is a rare primordial dwarfism that is similar to seckel syndrome seckel syndrome is known to be associated with various hematological abnormality however hematological finding in mopd ii patient have not been previously reported the present study aimed to describe the hematological finding in a series of eight patient with mopd ii from a single center material and method the study included eight patient with mopd ii that were analyzed via molecular testing and physical and laboratory examination result molecular testing showed that seven of the eight patient had pericentrin pcnt gene mutation hematological evaluation showed that patient had thrombocytosis had leukocytosis had both leukocytosis and thrombocytosis and had anemia conclusion we report leukocytosis and thrombocytosis a a common hematologic abnormality in patient with mopd ii the present finding may improve our understanding of the potential function of the pcnt gene in hematopoietic cell proliferation and differentiation
label: Non-Cancer

title: hlae restricted cd t cell subset are phenotypically altered in multiple sclerosis patient
abstract: background the importance of qa restricted cd t cell in regulating autoreactive t cell response ha been demonstrated in animal model for autoimmune disorder including multiple sclerosis m objective we hypothesize that their human variant hlae restricted cd t cell fulfills a similar regulatory role in man and that these cell are of importance in m method a large cohort of m patient and healthy control wa genotyped for the two known hlae polymorphism flow cytometry wa used to determine hlae expression kinetics and to phenotype hlae restricted cd t cell immunohistochemistry wa performed to investigate hlae expression in the central nervous system cns of m patient result hlae is upregulated on immune cell upon in vitro activation and this upregulation is polymorphismdependent for t and b cell t and b cell in lesion of m patient show enhanced hlae expression furthermore nkgccd t cell of m patient have a significantly lower foxp expression while nkgacd t cell of m patient produce higher level of proinflammatory cytokine compared to those of healthy individual conclusion our study indicates that the hlae system is altered in m and could play a regulatory role in disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: dynamic of histone h deposition in proliferating and senescent cell reveals a daxxdependent targeting to pmlnbs important for pericentromeric heterochromatin organization
abstract: oncogeneinduced senescence is a permanent cell cycle arrest characterized by extensive chromatin reorganization here we investigated the specific targeting and dynamic of histone h variant in human primary senescent cell we show that newly synthesized epitopetagged h is incorporated in senescent cell but doe not accumulate in senescenceassociated heterochromatin focus sahf instead we observe that new h colocalizes with it specific histone chaperone within the promyelocytic leukemia nuclear body pmlnbs and is targeted to pmlnbs in a daxxdependent manner both in proliferating and senescent cell we further show that overexpression of daxx enhances targeting of h in large pmlnbs devoid of transcriptional activity and promotes the accumulation of hp independently of hkme loss of h from pericentromeric heterochromatin upon daxx or pml depletion suggests that the targeting of h to pmlnbs is implicated in pericentromeric heterochromatin organization together our result underline the importance of the replicationindependent chromatin assembly pathway for histone replacement in nondividing senescent cell and establish pmlnbs a important regulatory site for the incorporation of new h into chromatin
label: Non-Cancer

title: monoclonality and cytogenetic abnormality in hyaline vascular castleman disease
abstract: hyaline vascular castleman disease is traditionally regarded a a reactive hyperplastic process occasional case however have been reported with cytogenetic anomaly bringing this concept into question in this study we used conventional and methylationspecific polymerase chain reaction method to assess the human androgen receptor alpha humara gene in female patient with hyaline vascular castleman disease and compared the result with three case of plasma cell castleman disease and case of agematched lymphoid hyperplasia we also assessed for immunoglobulin gene and tcell receptor gene rearrangement and conventional cytogenetic analysis wa performed in three case of hyaline vascular castleman disease in case with informative result conventional and methylationspecific human androgen receptor alpha gene analysis yielded a monoclonal pattern in of and of case of hyaline vascular castleman disease respectively a monoclonal pattern wa also detected in three case of plasma cell castleman disease but not in case of lymphoid hyperplasia the frequency of monoclonality wa higher for lesion cm in size and for the stromalrich variant cytogenetic abnormality in stromal cell were revealed in two case of hyaline vascular castleman disease and no case showed monoclonal immunoglobulin or tcell receptor gene rearrangement followup data showed persistent disease in of patient we conclude that hyaline vascular castleman disease is often a monoclonal proliferation most likely of lymph node stromal cell
label: Non-Cancer

title: mastocytosis
abstract: mastocytosis is a disorder of abnormal mast cell proliferation with clinical feature that include flushing pruritus abdominal pain diarrhea hypotension syncope and musculoskeletal pain these feature are the result of mast cell mediator release and infiltration into target organ patient of all age may be affected although in child manifestation primarily involve the skin most patient with systemic disease have a somatically acquired activating mutation in the kit oncogene this article discusses the cause and pathogenesis of mastocytosis with an overview of the clinical feature and the approach to diagnosis evaluation and therapy in adult and pediatric patient
label: Non-Cancer

title: a new germline mutation in kit associated with diffuse cutaneous mastocytosis in a chinese family
abstract: diffuse cutaneous mastocytosis dcm is an extremely rare disease characterized by massive proliferation of mast cell infiltrating the entire skin we report a chinese family with indolent dcm and detection of a new germline kit mutation located in the fifth immunoglobulinlike loop of the kit protein which probably result in a gainoffunction effect and consequent overactivation of mast cell our report expands the knowledge of correlation between the genotype of kit mutation and the phenotype of dcm
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: a new germline mutation in kit associated with diffuse cutaneous mastocytosis in a chinese family diffuse cutaneous mastocytosis dcm is an extremely rare disease characterized by massive proliferation of mast cell infiltrating the entire skin we report a chinese family with indolent dcm and detection of a new germline kit mutation located in the fifth immunoglobulinlike loop of the kit protein which probably result in a gainoffunction effect and consequent overactivation of mast cell our report expands the knowledge of correlation between the genotype of kit mutation and the phenotype of dcm

title: dynamic recruitment of active proteasomes into polyglutamine initiated inclusion body
abstract: neurodegenerative disorder such a huntington disease are hallmarked by neuronal intracellular inclusion body formation whether proteasomes are irreversibly recruited into inclusion body in these protein misfolding disorder is a controversial subject in addition it ha been proposed that the proteasomes may become clogged by the aggregated protein fragment leading to impairment of the ubiquitinproteasome system here we show by fluorescence pulsechase experiment in living cell that proteasomes are dynamically and reversibly recruited into inclusion body a these recruited proteasomes remain catalytically active and accessible to substrate our result challenge the concept of proteasome sequestration and impairment in huntington disease and support the reported absence of proteasome impairment in mouse model of huntington disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: phase i evaluation of xl an oral potent and selective jak inhibitor
abstract: this phase i study evaluated selective jak inhibitor xl in patient with myelofibrosis the initial dose cohort were and mg orally on day of a day cycle central andor peripheral neurotoxicity developed in all patient subsequently patient were treated on lower dos neurotoxicity wa again observed leading to study termination peripheral neuropathy resolved in and central neurotoxicity in all patient within month after therapy cessation myelosuppression wa minimal the terminal halflife of xl wa approximately h with steady state reached by day international working group defined response were seen in three patient

title: srsfp hotspot mutation is highly associated with advanced form of mastocytosis and mutation in epigenetic regulator gene
abstract: mastocytosis is a rare and chronic disease with phenotype ranging from indolent to severe prognosis for this disease is variable and very few biomarkers to predict disease evolution or outcome are currently known we have performed comprehensive screening in our large cohort of mastocytosis patient for mutation previously found in other myeloid disease and that could serve a prognostic indicator kit srsfp and tet mutation were by far the most frequent detected in and of patient respectively where tet and srsfp mutation both correlated with advanced disease phenotype srsfp hotspot mutation wa found almost exclusively in patient diagnosed with associated clonal hematologic nonmast cell disease statistically tet and srsfp mutation were highly associated suggesting a mechanistic link between these two factor finally analysis of both clonal and sorted cell population from patient confirms the presence of these mutation in the mast cell component of the disease suggests an ontological mutation hierarchy and provides evidence for the expansion of multiple clone this highlight the prognostic potential of such approach if applied systematically for delineating the role of specific mutation in predisposing andor driving distinct disease phenotype
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: srsfp hotspot mutation is highly associated with advanced form of mastocytosis and mutation in epigenetic regulator gene mastocytosis is a rare and chronic disease with phenotype ranging from indolent to severe prognosis for this disease is variable and very few biomarkers to predict disease evolution or outcome are currently known we have performed comprehensive screening in our large cohort of mastocytosis patient for mutation previously found in other myeloid disease and that could serve a prognostic indicator kit srsfp and tet mutation were by far the most frequent detected in and of patient respectively where tet and srsfp mutation both correlated with advanced disease phenotype srsfp hotspot mutation wa found almost exclusively in patient diagnosed with associated clonal hematologic nonmast cell disease statistically tet and srsfp mutation were highly associated suggesting a mechanistic link between these two factor finally analysis of both clonal and sorted cell population from patient confirms the presence of these mutation in the mast cell component of the disease suggests an ontological mutation hierarchy and provides evidence for the expansion of multiple clone this highlight the prognostic potential of such approach if applied systematically for delineating the role of specific mutation in predisposing andor driving distinct disease phenotype

title: benign mast cell hyperplasia and atypical mast cell infiltrates in penile lichen planus in adult men
abstract: introduction lichen planus lp is a chronic cytokinemediated disease of possible autoimmune etiology of men have anogenital manifestation erosive penile lp cause a scarring phimosis of the foreskin in uncircumcised men mast cell a potent immune modulators have been implicated in a number of autoimmune and chronic inflammatory disease but have not been investigated in lp material and method formalinfixed tissue of circumcision specimen of adult men affected by lp were evaluated for the extent of mast cell and lymphocyte infiltrates characterized immunohistochemically with antibody to cd c and human mast cell tryptase specimen with dense mast cell infiltrates were analyzed for point mutation of the ckit gene dv result unaffected skin and modified mucosa of foreskin contained mast cellsmm the inflammatory infiltrate of lplesions displayed mast cellsmm in foreskin mast cellsmm in and mast cellsmm average range in foreskin lesional mast cell of foreskin showed aberrant cdexpression andor spindled morphology with men having erosive lp a lymphocytic vasculitis and a systemic mastocytosis neither cdexpression nor ckit mutation were identified atypical mast cell infiltrates in lp correlated with high disease activity erosive lp and presence of lymphocytic vasculitis conclusion increased mast cell in penile lp mostly representing a benign hyperplasiaactivation syndrome suggests them a target for innovative therapy option for symptomatic lppatients not responding to corticosteroid therapy presently the biological implication of atypical mast cell infiltrates in penile lp are unknown
label: Non-Cancer

title: blood expression profile of fragile x premutation carrier identify candidate gene involved in neurodegenerative and infertility phenotype
abstract: male premutation carrier presenting between and cgg repeat in the fragilexassociated fmr gene are at risk of developing fragile x tremorataxia syndrome fxtas and female undergo premature ovarian failure pof here we have evaluated gene expression profile from blood in male fmr premutation carrier and detected a strong deregulation of gene enriched in fxtas relevant biological pathway including inflammation neuronal homeostasis and viability gene expression profiling distinguished between control individual carrier with fxtas and carrier without fxtas with level of expanded fmr mrna being increased in fxtas patient in vitro study in a neuronal cell model indicate that expression level of expanded fmr utr are relevant in modulating the transcriptome thus perturbation of the transcriptome may be an interplay between the cgg expansion size and fmr expression level several deregulated gene dffa bcll bcll app sod rnf hdac kcnc atxn atxn and eap were validated in brain sample of a fxtas mouse model downregulation of eap a gene involved in the female reproductive system physiology wa confirmed in female carrier decreased level were detected in female carrier with pof compared to those without pof suggesting that eap level contribute to ovarian insufficiency in summary gene expression profiling in blood ha uncovered mechanism that may underlie different pathological aspect of the premutation a better understanding of the transcriptome dynamic in relation with expanded fmr mrna expression level and cgg expansion size may provide mechanistic insight into the disease process and a more accurate fxtas diagnosis to the myriad of phenotype associated with the premutation
label: Non-Cancer

title: sensitive kit dv mutation analysis of blood a a diagnostic test in mastocytosis
abstract: the recent progress in sensitive kit dv mutation analysis suggests that mutation analysis of peripheral blood pb represents a promising diagnostic test in mastocytosis however there is a need for systematic assessment of the analytical sensitivity and specificity of the approach in order to establish it value in clinical use we therefore evaluated sensitive kit dv mutation analysis of pb a a diagnostic test in an entire caseseries of adult with mastocytosis we demonstrate for the first time that by using a sufficiently sensitive kit dv mutation analysis it is possible to detect the mutation in pb in nearly all adult mastocytosis patient the mutation wa detected in pb in of systemic mastocytosis and of cutaneous mastocytosis patient the test wa specific a determined by analysis of clinically relevant control patient who all tested negative mutation analysis of pb wa significantly more sensitive than serum tryptase ngml of patient with low tryptase tested mutation positive the test is furthermore readily available and we consider the result to serve a a foundation of experimental evidence to support the inclusion of the test in diagnostic algorithm and clinical practice in mastocytosis
label: Non-Cancer

title: variable clinical expressivity of stat mutation in hyperimmunoglobulin e syndrome genetic and clinical study of six patient
abstract: background and purpose autosomal dominant hyper ige syndrome adhies is a rare and complex primary immunodeficiency that affect multiple system mutation in signal transducer and activator of transcription stat gene cause adhies these mutation have a dominantnegative effect and the presence of such mutation is associated with a clinical phenotype we aim to describe genetic and clinical characteristic of patient with adhies in our clinic and to highlight the variability of clinical pattern in the same family method we describe six patient four individual of the same family and two unrelated patient all patient were given a clinical score based on disease phenotype according to the national institute of health nih score mutation analysis of stat wa done by pcr amplification of all coding exon followed by bidirectional sequencing using the bigdye kit v and an abi genetic analyzer applied biosystems result all six patient had dna binding region point mutation a proband and his three child with ppheleu mutation a patient with pargtrp substitution and a patient with parggln mutation all of these mutation were previously reported patient differed in infectious immunologic and somatic feature we observed an extreme variability in disease phenotype within the reported family with one genetically affected patient displaying an unaffected phenotype conclusion although the genetic cause of adhies is known more study are required to better understand the possible additional factor that may affect disease expressivity within family and the clinical diversity of the disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: plakophilin catenin associate with the etver transcription factor to positively modulate gene activity
abstract: member of the plakophilincatenin subfamily pkp and facilitate the linkage of desmosome junctional component to each other eg desmosomal cadherins to desmoplakin and the intermediatefilament cytoskeleton pkps also contribute to desmosomal stabilization and the trafficking of it component the function of pkps outside of the desmosome are less well studied despite evidence suggesting their role in mrna regulation smallgtpase modulation eg midbody scission during cell division and cell survival following dna damage pkpcatenins are further believed to have role in the nucleus given their nuclear localization in some context and the known nuclear role of structurally related catenins such a betacatenin and pcatenin further pkpcatenin activity in the nuclear compartment have become of increased interest with the identification of interaction between pkpcatenin and rna pol iii and pkp with singlestranded dna consistent with earlier report suggesting possible nuclear role in development we previously demonstrated prominent nuclear localization of pkp in xenopus naive ectoderm animal cap cell and recently resolved a similar localization in mouse embryonic stem cell here we report the association and positive functional interaction of pkp with a transcription factor ets variant gene etv which ha critical role in neural development and prominent role in human genetic disease our result are the first to report the interaction of a sequencespecific transcription factor with any pkp using xenopus laevis embryo and mammalian cell we provide evidence for the pkpetv complex on both biochemical and functional level
label: Non-Cancer

title: structural and functional characterization of cargobinding site on the musubunit of adaptor protein complex
abstract: adaptor protein ap complex facilitate protein trafficking by playing key role in the selection of cargo molecule to be sorted in postgolgi compartment four ap complex ap to ap contain a mediumsized subunit mumu that recognizes yxxosequences o is a bulky hydrophobic residue which are sorting signal in transmembrane protein a conserved canonical region in mu subunit mediates recognition of yxxosignals by mean of a critical aspartic acid recently we found that a noncanonical yxxosignal on the cytosolic tail of the alzheimers disease amyloid precursor protein app bind to a distinct region of the mu subunit of the ap complex in this study we aimed to determine the functionality of both binding site of mu on the recognition of the noncanonical yxxosignal of app we found that substitution in either binding site abrogated the interaction with the apptail in yeasttwo hybrid experiment further characterization by isothermal titration calorimetry showed instead loss of binding to the app signal with only the substitution rd at the noncanonical site in contrast to a decrease in binding affinity with the substitution da at the canonical site we solved the crystal structure of the cterminal domain of the da mutant bound to this noncanonical yxxosignal this structure showed no significant difference compared to that of wildtype mu both differential scanning fluorimetry and limited proteolysis analysis demonstrated that the da substitution rendered mu less stable suggesting an explanation for it lower binding affinity to the app signal finally in contrast to overexpression of the da mutant and acting in a dominantnegative manner overexpression of mu with either a fa or a rd substitution at the noncanonical site halted app transport at the golgi apparatus together our analysis support that the functional recognition of the noncanonical yxxosignal of app is limited to the noncanonical site of mu
label: Non-Cancer

title: the impact of molecular testing on the surgical management of patient with thyroid nodule
abstract: background the use of molecular test a an adjunct to fna diagnosis of thyroid nodule ha been increasing however the true impact of these test on surgical practice ha not been demonstrated this study examines the usefulness of molecular testing on surgical management decision in patient referred for thyroid surgery at a tertiary care center method clinical information wa collected from patient who presented to john hopkins hospital for surgical consultation regarding a thyroid nodule and who underwent molecular testing between august and march test included an rnabased gene expression classifier a dnabased somatic mutation panel braf nra andor retptc translocation a surgical management algorithm wa created by consensus of four thyroid surgeon postsurgical pathology analysis in each case wa then used to judge the appropriateness of the surgical decisionmaking and the usefulness of preoperative molecular testing in guiding surgical planning result of patient assessed by preoperative molecular testing underwent surgery surgical management wa altered in nine patient on the basis of molecular testing of these surgical management change wa appropriate relative to the postoperative pathology analysis for three patient and inappropriate for six patient conclusion in this study molecular testing of thyroid nodule did not alter the surgical management of the majority of patient with thyroid nodule these result indicate that molecular testing may be overused in patient for whom the result would not change surgical management furthermore our data question the usefulness of the molecular test examined in guiding preoperative surgical decisionmaking
label: Non-Cancer

title: erdheimchester disease with an ffluorodeoxyglucoseavid breast mass and braf ve mutation
abstract: erdheimchester disease ecd is a nonlangerhans cell histiocytosis herein we report a case of a yearold woman who developed bilateral knee pain imaging procedure revealed multiple long bone lesion and a welldefined ffluorodeoxyglucoseavid mass in the left breast the breast mass wa resected and an open biopsy wa performed on the right femoral lesion both specimen revealed involvement by histiocytic infiltrates with feature suggestive of ecd the braf ve mutation wa detected by dna sequencing and immunohistochemistry
label: Non-Cancer

title: fibrous papule of the face similar to tuberous sclerosis complexassociated angiofibroma show activation of the mammalian target of rapamycin pathway evidence for a novel therapeutic strategy
abstract: fibrous papule of the face are hamartoma characterized by stellateshaped stromal cell multinucleated giant cell and proliferative blood vessel in the dermis the pathogenesis of fibrous papule remains unclear there is a striking microscopic resemblance between fibrous papule and tuberous sclerosis complex tscassociated angiofibromas a germline mutation of the tsc or tsc gene leading to activation of the mammalian target of rapamycin mtor pathway account for the pathogenesis of tscassociated angiofibromas activated mtor subsequently activates p ribosomal protein s kinase psk and ribosomal protein s s by phosphorylation rapamycin a mtor inhibitor is effective in treating tscassociated angiofibromas the aim of this study wa to understand whether the mtor pathway is activated in fibrous papule we studied immunoexpressions of phosphorylated p mtor effector in fibrous papule tscassociated angiofibromas and normal skin control pmtor ppsk and p were highly expressed in dermal stromal cell and epidermal keratinocytes in fibrous papule and tscassociated angiofibromas but not in fibroblast and epidermal keratinocytes of normal skin control p the result suggest topical rapamycin may be a novel treatment option for fibrous papule
label: Non-Cancer

title: macronodular adrenal hyperplasia due to mutation in an armadillo repeat containing armc gene a clinical and genetic investigation
abstract: context inactivating germline mutation of the probable tumor suppressor gene armadillo repeat containing armc have recently been identified a a genetic cause of macronodular adrenal hyperplasia mah objective we searched for armc mutation in a large cohort of patient with mah the clinical phenotype of patient with and without armc mutation wa compared method blood dna from mah patient wa genotyped using sanger sequencing diurnal serum cortisol measurement plasma acth level urinary steroid day liddles test adrenal computed tomography and weight of adrenal gland at adrenalectomy were assessed result germline armc mutation were found in of patient in silico analysis of the mutation indicated that seven predicted major implication for gene function latenight cortisol level were higher in patient with armcdamaging mutation compared with those without andor with nonpathogenic mutation v p all patient carrying a pathogenic armc mutation had clinical cushing syndrome seven of seven compared with of of those without or with mutation that were predicted to be benign p repeatedmeasures analysis showed overall higher urinary hydroxycorticosteroids and free cortisol value in the patient with armcdamaging mutation during the day liddles test p conclusion armc mutation are implicated in clinically severe cushing syndrome associated with mah knowledge of a patient armc status ha important clinical implication for the diagnosis of cushing syndrome and genetic counseling of patient and their family
label: Non-Cancer

title: mri without magnet removal in neurofibromatosis type patient with cochlear and auditory brainstem implant
abstract: objective to assess the impact on image quality of mri without magnet removal in cochlear implant ci and auditory brainstem implant abi user with neurofibromatosis type nf study design prospective cohort setting tertiary center for cochlear and auditory brainstem implantation patient thirteen patient abi ci with nf underwent a total of mri scan intervention mri without magnet removal main outcome measure ability to visualize the ipsilateral and contralateral cerebellopontine angle cpa and internal auditory meati iam with head mri result of the scan were of the head of the spine and of other region scanning wa performed with a tight head bandage and plastic card there were no case of altered implant function or demagnetization of the device magneta grading system wa used to assess the view of the ipsilateral iamcpa in of head scan the view wa unimpaired grade in there wa distortion grade in case the view wa entirely obscured by artifact grade view of the contralateral cpa and iam were unimpaired in all case the best sequence for the depiction of the ipsilateral iamcpa percent graded a were a follows axial d inversion recovery prepared fast spoiled gradient echo mm coronal tw of the iamcpa and mm axial tw of the iamcpa conclusion mri scanning without magnet removal is safe and well tolerated in nf patient with auditory implant with appropriate mri sequence the image quality is not significantly impaired
label: Non-Cancer

title: metabolic reprogramming is required for antibody production that is suppressed in anergic but exaggerated in chronically baffexposed b cell
abstract: b cell activation lead to proliferation and ab production that can protect from pathogen or promote autoimmunity regulation of cell metabolism is essential to support the demand of lymphocyte growth and effector function and may regulate tolerance in this study we tested the regulation and role of glucose uptake and metabolism in the proliferation and ab production of control anergic and autoimmuneprone b cell control b cell had a balanced increase in lactate production and oxygen consumption following activation with proportionally increased glucose transporter glut expression and mitochondrial mass upon either lp or bcr stimulation this contrasted with metabolic reprogramming of t cell which had lower glycolytic flux when resting but disproportionately increased this pathway upon activation importantly tolerance greatly affected b cell metabolic reprogramming anergic b cell remained metabolically quiescent with only a modest increase in glycolysis and oxygen consumption with lp stimulation b cell chronically stimulated with elevated baff however rapidly increased glycolysis and ab production upon stimulation induction of glycolysis wa critical for ab production a glycolytic inhibition with the pyruvate dehydrogenase kinase inhibitor dichloroacetate sharply suppressed b cell proliferation and ab secretion in vitro and in vivo furthermore b cellspecific deletion of glut led to reduced b cell number and impaired ab production in vivo together these data show that activated b cell require glutdependent metabolic reprogramming to support proliferation and ab production that is distinct from t cell and that this glycolytic reprogramming is regulated in tolerance
label: Non-Cancer

title: adult mastocytosis a review of the santo antonio hospital s experience and an evaluation of world health organization criterion for the diagnosis of systemic disease
abstract: background mastocytosis is a clonal disorder characterized by the accumulation of abnormal mast cell in the skin andor in extracutaneous organ objective to present all case of mastocytosis seen in the porto hospital center and evaluate the performance of world health organization diagnostic criterion for systemic disease method the case of twentyfour adult patient with mastocytosis were reviewed their clinical and laboratorial characteristic were assessed and the property of the criterion used to diagnose systemic mastocytosis were evaluated result the age of disease onset ranged from to year twentythree patient had cutaneous involvement and were referred by dermatologist urticaria pigmentosa wa the most common manifestation of the disease one patient with severe systemic mast cell mediatorrelated symptom showed the activating vg kit mutation the bone marrow wa examined in of patient and mast cell immunophenotyping wa performed in of the participant systemic disease wa detected in of case and of the sample had elevated serum tryptase level all the diagnostic criterion for systemic mastocytosis had high specificity and positive predictive value bone marrow biopsy had the lowest sensitivity negative predictive value and efficiency while the highest such value were observed for mast cell immunophenotyping patient were treated with regimen including antihistamine sodium cromoglycate alphainterferon hydroxyurea and phototherapy conclusion cutaneous involvement is often seen in adult mastocytosis patient with most individual presenting with indolent systemic disease although serum tryptase level are a good indicator of mast cell burden bone marrow biopsy should also be performed in patient with normal serum tryptase with flow cytometry being the most adequate method to diagnose systemic disease
label: Non-Cancer

cromoglycate alphainterferon hydroxyurea and phototherapy conclusion cutaneous involvement is often seen in adult mastocytosis patient with most individual presenting with indolent systemic disease although serum tryptase level are a good indicator of mast cell burden bone marrow biopsy should also be performed in patient with normal serum tryptase with flow cytometry being the most adequate method to diagnose systemic disease

title: multiple nonglycemic genomic locus are newly associated with blood level of glycated hemoglobin in east asian
abstract: glycated hemoglobin ac hbac is used a a measure of glycemic control and also a a diagnostic criterion for diabetes to discover novel locus harboring common variant associated with hbac in east asian we conducted a metaanalysis of genomewide association study gwas n we replicated our finding in three additional study comprising individual of east asian ancestry ten variant showed association that reached genomewide significance in the discovery data set of which nine four novel variant at tmem p value x hbslmyb x myob x and cyba x a well a five variant at locus that had been previously identified cdkal gpcabcb gck ank and fnki showed consistent evidence of association in replication data set these variant explained of the variance in hbac several of these variant tmem hbslmyb cyba myob ank and fnk showed no association with either blood glucose or type diabetes among individual with nondiabetic level of fasting glucose had hbac after adjustment for these six variant our east asian gwas metaanalysis ha identified novel variant associated with hbac a well a demonstrated that the effect of known variant are largely transferable across ethnic group variant affecting erythrocyte parameter rather than glucose metabolism may be relevant to the use of hbac for diagnosing diabetes in these population
label: Non-Cancer

title: neurofibromatosis type gene mutation analysis using sequence capture and highthroughput sequencing
abstract: neurofibromatosis type syndrome nf is caused by mutation in the nf gene availability of new sequencing technology prompted u to search for an alternative method for nf mutation analysis genomic dna wa isolated from saliva avoiding invasive sampling the nf exon with an additional bp of flanking intronic sequence were captured and enriched using the seqcap ez choice library protocol the captured dna wa sequenced with the roche g junior system the mean coverage of the targeted region were x and x in separate set of sample an nf mutation wa discovered in out of separate patient sample our study provides proof of principle that the sequence capture methodology combined with highthroughput sequencing is applicable to nf mutation analysis deep intronic mutation may however remain undetectable and change at the dna level may not predict the outcome at the mrna or protein level
label: Non-Cancer

title: fast and robust nextgeneration sequencing technique using ion torrent personal genome machine for the screening of neurofibromatosis type nf gene
abstract: neurofibromatosis type nf gene exhibit one of the highest spontaneous mutation rate in the human genome identification of the nf mutation is challenging because the nf gene is very large and complex lacking mutational hot spot there is no clustering of mutation there are several pseudogenes and a wide spectrum of different type of mutation ha been recognized to date nf mutation or deleted region have been detected with a number of technique with the appearance of nextgeneration sequencing ng machine molecular biology is in a new revolutionary phase our aim wa to work out a method to use the highthroughput ng machine ion torrent pgm in diagnostic setting for neurofibromatosis type in our examination we could reveal distinct variation in nf gene in seven patient this is an absolutely new method for exploring the genetic background of neurofibromatosis type exhibiting the extremely high throughput of ng in a diagnostic setting
label: Non-Cancer

title: comparison of method for the extraction of dna from formalinfixed paraffinembedded archival tissue
abstract: aim discussing a protocol involving xyleneethanol deparaffinization on slide followed by a kitbased extraction that allows for the extraction of high quality dna from ffpe tissue method dna wa extracted from the ffpe tissue of randomly selected block method involving deparaffinization on slide or tube enzyme digestion overnight or for hour and isolation using phenol chloroform method or a silicabased commercial kit were compared in term of yield concentration and the amplifiability result the highest yield of dna wa produced from the sample that were deparaffinized on slide digested for hour and isolated with a commercial kit sample isolated with the phenolchloroform method produced dna of lower purity than the sample that were purified with kit the sample isolated with the commercial kit resulted in better pcr amplification conclusion silicabased commercial kit and deparaffinized on slide should be considered for dna extraction from ffpe
label: Non-Cancer

title: massively parallel sequencing of patient with intellectual disability congenital anomaly andor autism spectrum disorder with a targeted gene panel
abstract: developmental delay andor intellectual disability ddid affect of all child at least half of these are thought to have a genetic etiology recent study have shown that massively parallel sequencing mp using a targeted gene panel is particularly suited for diagnostic testing for genetically heterogeneous condition we report on our experience with using massively parallel sequencing of a targeted gene panel of gene for investigating the genetic etiology of eight patient with a wide range of phenotype including ddid congenital anomaly andor autism spectrum disorder targeted sequence enrichment wa performed using the agilent sureselect target enrichment kit and sequenced on the illumina hiseq using pairedend read for all eight patient of the targeted region achieved read depth of at least x with average read depth overlapping target ranging from x to x causative variant were successfully identified in two of the eight patient a nonsense mutation in the atrx gene and a canonical splice site mutation in the lcam gene in a third patient a canonical splice site variant in the uspx gene could likely explain all or some of her clinical phenotype these result confirm the value of targeted mp for investigating ddid in child for diagnostic purpose however targeted gene mp wa less likely to provide a genetic diagnosis for child whose phenotype includes autism
label: Non-Cancer

title: computing global minimizers to a constrained bspline image registration problem from optimal l perturbation to block match data
abstract: purpose block matching is a wellknown strategy for estimating corresponding voxel location between a pair of image according to an image similarity metric though robust to issue such a image noise and large magnitude voxel displacement the estimated point match are not guaranteed to be spatially accurate however the underlying optimization problem solved by the block matching procedure is similar in structure to the class of optimization problem associated with bspline based registration method by exploiting this relationship the author derive a numerical method for computing a global minimizer to a constrained bspline registration problem that incorporates the robustness of block matching with the global smoothness property inherent to bspline parameterization method the method reformulates the traditional bspline registration problem a a basis pursuit problem describing the minimallperturbation to block match pair required to produce a bspline fitting error within a given tolerance the sparsity pattern of the optimal perturbation then defines a voxel point cloud subset on which the bspline fit is a global minimizer to a constrained variant of the bspline registration problem a opposed to traditional bspline algorithm the optimization step involving the actual image data is addressed by block matching result the performance of the method is measured in term of spatial accuracy using ten inhaleexhale thoracic ct image pair available for download atwwwdirlabcom obtained from the copdgene dataset and corresponding set of expertdetermined landmark point pair the result of the validation procedure demonstrate that the method can achieve a high spatial accuracy on a significantly complex image set conclusion the proposed methodology is demonstrated to achieve a high spatial accuracy and is generalizable in that in can employ any displacement field parameterization described a a least square fit to block match generated estimate thus the framework allows for a wide range of image similarity block match metric and physical modeling combination
label: Non-Cancer

title: card deficiency and spontaneous central nervous system candidiasis complete clinical remission with gmcsf therapy
abstract: we demonstrate autosomalrecessive caspase recruitment domaincontaining protein card deficiency in a patient with relapsing c albicans meningoencephalitis we identified a novel hypomorphic mutation with intact th response but impaired gmcsf response we report complete clinical remission with adjunctive gmcsf therapy suggesting that a cardgmcsf axis contributes to susceptibility to candidiasis
label: Non-Cancer
