title: minimally invasive option in dupuytrens contracture aponeurotomy enzyme stretching and fat grafting
abstract: learning objective after studying this article the participant should be able to perform needle aponeurotomy fat grafting digit widget insertion and collagenase injection for dupuytrens cord describe how cord can be stretched without surgery explain to patient the risk and benefit of these new alternative of treatment summary surgery for dupuytrens contracture used to be the only alternative of treatment the past year have seen the widespread adoption of minimally invasive treatment in the form of needle aponeurotomy and collagenase injection to disrupt the cord and restore range of motion even newer and perhaps a effective treatment such a fat grafting and mechanical stretching with the digit widget may also end up being important tool of treatment the reader will be introduced to all of these modality with text illustration and video
label: Non-Cancer

title: earlyonset crohn disease and autoimmunity associated with a variant in ctla
abstract: objective ibd is a group of complex systemic disorder associated with intestinal inflammation and extraintestinal manifestation recent study revealed mendelian form of ibd which contributed significantly to our understanding of disease pathogenesis and the heritability of ibd design we performed exome sequencing in a family with crohn disease cd and severe autoimmunity analysed immune cell phenotype and function in affected and nonaffected individual and performed in silico and in vitro analysis of cytotoxic t lymphocyteassociated protein ctla structure and function result a novel missense variant wa identified in ctla encoding ctla a coinhibitory protein expressed by t cell and required for regulation of t cell activation the residue affected by the mutation ctla tyr is evolutionarily highly conserved and the identified yc variant is predicted to affect protein folding and structural stability and demonstrated to cause impaired ctla dimerisation and cd binding intestinal inflammation and autoimmunity in carrier of ctla yc exhibit incomplete penetrance with a spectrum of clinical presentation ranging from asymptomatic carrier status to fatal autoimmunity and intestinal inflammation in a clinically affected ctla yc carrier t cell proliferation wa increased in vitro and associated with an increased ratio of memory to naive t cell in vivo consistent with impaired regulation of t cell activation conclusion our result support the concept that variant in ctla provide the basis for a novel mendelian form of earlyonset cd associated with systemic autoimmunity incomplete penetrance of autoimmunity further indicates the presence of other genetic andor environmental modifier
label: Non-Cancer

title: the immunophenotype of mast cell and it utility in the diagnostic workup of systemic mastocytosis
abstract: sm comprises a heterogeneous group of disorder characterized by an abnormal accumulation of clonal mc in or more tissue frequently involving the skin and bm despite the fact that most adult patient carry the same genetic lesion dv kit mutation the disease present with multiple variant with very distinct clinical and biologic feature a diverse prognosis and different therapeutic requirement recent advance in the standardization of the study of bm mc by mfc allowed reproducible identification and characterization of normalreactive mc and their precursor a well a the establishment of the normal mc maturational profile analysis of large group of patient versus normalreactive sample ha highlighted the existence of aberrant mc phenotype in sm which are essential for the diagnosis of the disease in turn clearly distinct and altered maturationassociated immunophenotypic profile have been reported recently in sm which provide criterion for the distinction between ism patient with mcrestricted and multilineage kit mutation thus immunphenotyping also contributes to prognostic stratification of ism particularly when analysis of the kit mutation on highly purified bm cell is not routinely available in the diagnostic workup of the disease
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: the immunophenotype of mast cell and it utility in the diagnostic workup of systemic mastocytosis sm comprises a heterogeneous group of disorder characterized by an abnormal accumulation of clonal mc in or more tissue frequently involving the skin and bm despite the fact that most adult patient carry the same genetic lesion dv kit mutation the disease present with multiple variant with very distinct clinical and biologic feature a diverse prognosis and different therapeutic requirement recent advance in the standardization of the study of bm mc by mfc allowed reproducible identification and characterization of normalreactive mc and their precursor a well a the establishment of the normal mc maturational profile analysis of large group of patient versus normalreactive sample ha highlighted the existence of aberrant mc phenotype in sm which are essential for the diagnosis of the disease in turn clearly distinct and altered maturationassociated immunophenotypic profile have been reported recently in sm which provide criterion for the distinction between ism patient with mcrestricted and multilineage kit mutation thus immunphenotyping also contributes to prognostic stratification of ism particularly when analysis of the kit mutation on highly purified bm cell is not routinely available in the diagnostic workup of the disease

title: trf and lamin ac interact to facilitate the functional organization of chromosome end
abstract: telomere protect the end of linear genome and the gradual loss of telomere is associated with cellular ageing telomere protection involves the insertion of the overhang facilitated by telomere repeatbinding factor trf into telomeric dna forming tloops we present evidence suggesting that tloops can also form at interstitial telomeric sequence in a trfdependent manner forming an interstitial tloop itl we demonstrate that trf association with interstitial telomeric sequence is stabilized by colocalization with atype lamins lamin ac we also find that lamin ac interacts with trf and that reduction in level of lamin ac or mutation in lmna that cause an autosomal dominant premature ageing disorderhutchinson gilford progeria syndrome hgpslead to reduced itl formation and telomere loss we propose that cellular and organismal ageing are intertwined through the effect of the interaction between trf and lamin ac on chromosome structure
label: Non-Cancer

title: jak mutationpositive polycythemia vera presenting a central retinal artery occlusion
abstract: purpose to report the case of a yearold man who presented with profound visual loss in his right eye because of a central retinal artery occlusion accompanied by a stroke in the ipsilateral middle cerebral artery with left upper extremity sequela method the patient underwent a comprehensive ophthalmologic examination fluorescein angiography thorough neuroophthalmology evaluation including magnetic resonance imaging and magnetic resonance angiography lead electrocardiogram transesophageal echocardiogram bilateral carotid artery doppler holter monitoring comprehensive laboratory testing bone marrow biopsy and genetic testing result despite an initially normal hematocrit the etiology of the central retinal artery occlusion and that of the nearly concomitant stroke in the right medial cerebral artery territory wa confirmed by bone marrow biopsy to be polycythemia vera positive jak mutation patient received treatment with aspirin serial phlebotomy and hydroxyurea demonstrating a slight improvement in vision and substantial normalization of neurologic and hematological status at the time of this report year later patient remains stable conclusion central retinal artery occlusion a disease with a frequently devastating visual outcome is often not an isolated ocular occurrence in the absence of an obvious local trigger a thorough workup is always warranted especially in younger patient a the ocular pathology oftentimes may herald severe cerebrocardiovascular event
label: Non-Cancer

title: differentiating skinlimited and multisystem langerhans cell histiocytosis
abstract: objective to identify feature associated with multisystem involvement and therapeutic failure in patient with skin langerhans cell histiocytosis lch study design we reviewed medical record of consecutive patient with lch with skin involvement evaluated at texas childrens hospital and analyzed clinical feature laboratory result and the presence of circulating cell with the brafve mutation with respect to initial staging and clinical outcome result skin disease in patient older than month of age at diagnosis wa associated with the presence of multisystem disease or ci forty percent of patient referred for presumed skinlimited lch had underlying multisystem involvement onehalf of these with riskorgan involvement patient with skinlimited lch had a year progressionfree survival of after initial therapy and none developed multisystem disease patient with skinmultisystem involvement had a year progressionfree survival of with vinblastineprednisone therapy and riskorgan involvement did not correlate with failure to achieve nonactive disease circulating cell with brafve were detected at higher frequency in patient with multisystem involvement of skinmultisystem v of skinlimited p conclusion skinlimited lch necessitates infrequent therapeutic intervention and ha a lower risk of progression relative to skin plus multisystem lch the lessaggressive clinical course and lack of circulating cell with the brafve mutation in skinlimited lch suggest a different mechanism of disease origin compared with multisystem or riskorgan disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: loss of function in heparan sulfate elongation gene ext and ext result in improved nitric oxide bioavailability and endothelial function
abstract: background heparanase is the major enzyme involved in degradation of endothelial heparan sulfate which is associated with impaired endothelial nitric oxide synthesis however the effect of heparan sulfate chain length in relation to endothelial function and nitric oxide availability ha never been investigated we studied the effect of heterozygous mutation in heparan sulfate elongation gene ext and ext on endothelial function in vitro a well a in vivo method and result flowmediated dilation a marker of nitric oxide bioavailability wa studied in ext and ext mouse versus control n per group a well a in human subject with heterozygous loss of function mutation in ext and ext n hereditary multiple exostosis and n control endothelial function wa measured in microvascular endothelial cell under laminar flow with or without sirna targeting ext or ext endothelial glycocalyx and maximal arteriolar dilatation were significantly altered in ext and ext mouse compared to wildtype littermates glycocalyx wildtype mum ext mum and ext mum p maximal arteriolar dilation during reperfusion wildtype ext and ext p in human brachial artery flowmediated dilation wa significantly increased in hereditary multiple exostosis patient hereditary multiple exostosis versus control p in line silencing of microvascular endothelial cell ext and ext under flow led to significant upregulation of endothelial nitric oxide synthesis and phosphoendothelial nitric oxide synthesis protein expression conclusion our data implicate that heparan sulfate elongation gene ext and ext are involved in maintaining endothelial homeostasis presumably via increased nitric oxide bioavailability
label: Non-Cancer

title: intestinal epithelial myd is a sensor switching host metabolism towards obesity according to nutritional status
abstract: obesity is associated with a cluster of metabolic disorder lowgrade inflammation and altered gut microbiota whether host metabolism is controlled by intestinal innate immune system and the gut microbiota is unknown here we report that inducible intestinal epithelial cellspecific deletion of myd partially protects against dietinduced obesity diabetes and inflammation this is associated with increased energy expenditure an improved glucose homeostasis reduced hepatic steatosis fat mass and inflammation protection is transferred following gut microbiota transplantation to germfree recipient we also demonstrate that intestinal epithelial myd deletion increase antiinflammatory endocannabinoids restores antimicrobial peptide production and increase intestinal regulatory t cell during dietinduced obesity targeting myd after the onset of obesity reduces fat mass and inflammation our work thus identifies intestinal epithelial myd a a sensor changing host metabolism according to the nutritional status and we show that targeting intestinal epithelial myd constitutes a putative therapeutic target for obesity and related disorder
label: Non-Cancer

title: strategy for identifying repurposed drug for the treatment of cerebral cavernous malformation
abstract: background cerebral cavernous malformation ccm is a hemorrhagic stroke disease affecting up to of north american that ha no approved nonsurgical treatment a subset of patient have a hereditary form of the disease due primarily to lossoffunction mutation in krit ccm or pdcd we sought to identify known drug that could be repurposed to treat ccm method and result we developed an unbiased screening platform based on both cellular and animal model of loss of function of ccm our discovery strategy consisted of step an automated immunofluorescence and machinelearningbased primary screen of structural phenotype in human endothelial cell deficient in ccm a secondary screen of functional change in endothelial stability in these same cell a rapid in vivo tertiary screen of dermal microvascular leak in mouse lacking endothelial ccm and finally a quaternary screen of ccm lesion burden in these same mouse we screened known drug and bioactive compound and identified candidate cholecalciferol vitamin d and tempol a scavenger of superoxide for further study each drug decreased lesion burden in a mouse model of ccm vascular disease by conclusion by identifying known drug a potential therapeutic for ccm we have decreased the time cost and risk of bringing treatment to patient each drug also prompt additional exploration of biomarkers of ccm disease we further suggest that the structurefunction screening platform presented here may be adapted and scaled to facilitate drug discovery for diverse lossoffunction genetic vascular disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: brca diffuses a oligomeric cluster with rad and change mobility after dna damage in live cell
abstract: genome maintenance by homologous recombination depends on coordinating many protein in time and space to assemble at dna break site to understand this process we followed the mobility of brca a critical recombination mediator in live cell at the singlemolecule level using both singleparticle tracking and fluorescence correlation spectroscopy brcagfp and yfp were compared to distinguish diffusion from fluorophore behavior diffusive behavior of fluorescent rad and rad wa determined for comparison all fluorescent protein were expressed from endogenous locus we found that nuclear brca existed in oligomeric cluster and exhibited heterogeneous mobility dna damage increased brca transient binding presumably including binding to damaged site despite it very different size rad displayed mobility similar to brca which indicates physical interaction between these protein both before and after induction of dna damage we propose that brcamediated sequestration of nuclear rad serf to prevent inappropriate dna interaction and that all rad is delivered to dna damage site in association with brca
label: Non-Cancer

title: regulation of t cell by mtor the known knowns and the known unknown
abstract: mammalianmechanistic target of rapamycin mtor is emerging a an important integrator of environmental cue critical for the regulation of t cell activation differentiation and function recent study leveraging pharmacologic inhibition or t cell specific genetic deletion of signaling component in the mtor pathway have provided important insight into the mechanism involved and have been informative in defining target downstream of mtor that promote immune regulation however these study have also presented confusing and at time contradictory finding highlighting the complexity involved in examining the mtor pathway in distinct context here we review current understanding of the role of mtor in t cell biology highlighting emerging concept and area of investigation where the precise role of mtor ha yet to be fully discerned
label: Non-Cancer

title: d coregistration of xray and mrmammograms initial clinical result and potential incremental diagnostic value
abstract: purpose d coregistration of xray and mrmammograms xm and mm is a new method of image fusion the present study aim to evaluate it clinical feasibility radiological accuracy and potential clinical value method xm and mm of patient were coregistered result were evaluated by a blinded reader result precision of the d coregistration wa very good meanscore m and lesion were easier to delineate m in relevant additional diagnostic information wa present accounting for a more confident diagnosis in m conclusion d coregistration is feasible accurate and of potential clinical value

title: outcome of preimplantation genetic diagnosis in neurofibromatosis type
abstract: objective to examine the effect of patient and facility level factor on the success of preimplantation genetic diagnosis pgd in patient with neurofibromatosis nf design retrospective review setting large pgd reference laboratory patient all patient with nf referred from june to may intervention none main outcome measure embryo nf mutation status and live birth rate result seventyseven couple underwent pgd cycle during the study period the average maternal age at the time of embryo biopsy wa year the majority of embryo had a day single blastomere biopsy without aneuploidy screening a diagnosis wa obtained for of biopsied embryo of biopsy were nondiagnostic due to technical failure diagnosis wa more often obtained for embryo of parent with familial disease and for embryo biopsied at center that referred multiple nf case among diagnosed embryo were unaffected by the parental nf mutation twentytwo of the cycle had a confirmed live birth if the observed success rate is applied to cycle with unknown outcome cycle are expected to have resulted in live birth in multivariate logistic regression having a live birth wa significantly associated with having more unaffected embryo available for transfer odds ratio per additional embryo confidence interval conclusion advance in biopsy and diagnostic technique which increase the number of unaffected embryo identified may improve live birth rate for patient with nf clinician should counsel patient about their fertility and reproductive option early with the use of diseasespecific data to set appropriate expectation for the pgd process
label: Non-Cancer

title: risk factor for anaphylaxis in patient with mastocytosis
abstract: introduction symptom resulting from the activation and release of mediator from the mast cell are observed in about of the patient with mastocytosis objective the aim of the study wa to assess the prevalence of anaphylactic reaction and to identify the risk factor for anaphylaxis in patient with mastocytosis depending on the type of the disease furthermore we analyzed a response to treatment of mediatorrelated symptom in this patient group patient and method the study group included adult patient with mastocytosis the diagnostic workup included a histopathological examination flow cytometry kit mutation analysis and measurement of tryptase level the diagnosis of allergy wa confirmed by the skin prick test and serum immunoglobulin e level result the prevalence of anaphylactic reaction in the study group wa and wa higher in patient with systemic mastocytosis p specifically in it indolent variant p than in patient with cutaneous mastocytosis the most frequent trigger of anaphylaxis were food insect sting and drug tryptase level were higher in patient with a history of anaphylaxis p a well a in those with symptom provoked by physical factor p such symptom were reported in patient and were more common in patient with systemic mastocytosis compared with those with cutaneous mastocytosis p the treatment wa ineffective in patient and resulted only in partial remission in patient conclusion the study showed a significant incidence of symptom related to physical factor in patient with mastocytosis and anaphylaxis in history risk factor for anaphylaxis included increased serum tryptase level and indolent variant of systemic mastocytosis standard pharmacological treatment wa ineffective in of the patient who may require biological treatment
label: Non-Cancer

title: the impact of sensitive kit dv detection on recognition of indolent systemic mastocytosis
abstract: patient with systemic mastocytosis sm need a highly sensitive diagnostic test for dv detection of the kit receptor gene along with histologycytology and flow cytometry evaluation bone marrow bm from consecutive adult patient referred with a suspicion of sm to multidisciplinary outpatient clinic for mastocytosis in verona were tested both by amplification refractory mutation system reverse transcriptase quantitative real time polymerase chain reaction armsrtqpcr and rtpcrrestriction fragment length polymorphism rflp followed by denaturinghigh performance liquid chromatography dhplc and sanger sequencing armsrtqpcr identified dv mutation in patient corresponding to of case showing cd mast cell mc whereas rtpcrrflpdhplcsequencing revealed dv mutation in patient according to the who criterion sm cutaneous mastocytosis cm monoclonal mc activation syndrome mmas and sm associated with haematologic nonmast cell disorder smahnmd were diagnosed seventeen out sm patient would have not satisfied sufficient who criterion on the basis of the sole rtpcrrflp these patient had significantly lower serum tryptase level and amount of cd mc therefore armsrtqpcr might result particularly useful in patient that do not fulfil major bm histological criterion for the recognition of indolent sm with a very low mc burden
label: Non-Cancer

title: bp promotes microhomologymediated endjoining in gphase cell
abstract: alternative nonhomologous end joining altnhej wa originally identified a a backup repair mechanism in the absence of classical nhej cnhej factor but recent study have demonstrated that altnhej is active even when cnhej a well a homologous recombination is available the function of bp in nhej process are not well understood here we report that bp promotes dna doublestrand break dsb repair and genomic stability not only in cnhejproficient but also deficient human gphase cell using an array of repair substrate we show that these effect of bp are correlated with a promotion of microhomologymediated endjoining mmej a subtype of altnhej in gphase consistent with a specific role in mmej we confirm that bp status doe not affect cnhej bp support sequence deletion during mmej consistent with a putative role in facilitating endresection interestingly promotion of mmej by bp in gphase cell is only observed in the presence of functional brca depletion of both bp and brca increase repair needing microhomology usage and augments loss of dna sequence suggesting that mmej is a highly regulated dsb repair process together these finding significantly expand our understanding of the cellcycledependent role of bp in dsb repair
label: Non-Cancer

title: identification of chimeric antigen receptor that mediate constitutive or inducible proliferation of t cell
abstract: this study compared secondgeneration chimeric antigen receptor car encoding signaling domain composed of cd icos and bb tnfrsf here we report that certain car endow t cell with the ability to undergo longterm autonomous proliferation transduction of primary human t cell with lentiviral vector encoding some of the car resulted in sustained proliferation for up to month following a single stimulation through the tcell receptor tcr sustained numeric expansion wa independent of cognate antigen and did not require the addition of exogenous cytokine or feeder cell after a single stimulation of the tcr and cd result from gene array and functional assay linked sustained cytokine secretion and expression of tbet tbx eomes and gata to the effect sustained expression of the endogenous il locus ha not been reported in primary t cell sustained proliferation wa dependent on car structure and high expression the latter of which wa necessary but not sufficient the mechanism involves constitutive signaling through nfkappab akt erk and nfat the propagated car t cell retained a diverse tcr repertoire and cellular transformation wa not observed the car with a constitutive growth phenotype displayed inferior antitumor effect and engraftment in vivo therefore the design of car that have a nonconstitutive growth phenotype may be a strategy to improve efficacy and engraftment of car t cell the identification of car that confer constitutive or nonconstitutive growth pattern may explain observation that car t cell have differential survival pattern in clinical trial
label: Non-Cancer

title: evaluation of somatic mutation in tibial pseudarthrosis sample in neurofibromatosis type
abstract: background tibial pseudarthrosis is associated with neurofibromatosis type nf and there is wide clinical variability of the tibial dysplasia in nf suggesting the possibility of genetic modifier double inactivation of nf is postulated to be necessary for the development of tibial pseudarthrosis but tissue or cell of origin of the second hit mutation remains unclear method exome sequencing of different section of surgically resected nf tibial pseudarthrosis tissue wa performed and compared to germline peripheral blood result a germline nf splice site mutation cat pl mdel wa identified from dna extracted from peripheral blood exome sequencing of dna extracted from tissue removed during surgery of the tibial pseudarthrosis showed a somatic mutation of nf cgt pe in the normal germline allele further analysis of different region of the tibial pseudarthrosis sample showed enrichment of the somatic mutation in the soft tissue within the pseudarthrosis site and absence of the somatic mutation in cortical bone in addition a germline variant in ptpn cct ptm a gene involved in the ra signal transduction pathway wa identified although the clinical significance is unknown conclusion given that the nf somatic mutation wa primarily detected in the proliferative soft tissue at the pseudarthrosis site it is likely that the second hit occurred in mesenchymal progenitor from the periosteum these result are consistent with a defect of differentiation which may explain why the mutation is found in proliferative cell and not within cortical bone tissue a the latter by definition contains mostly mature differentiated osteoblast and osteocyte
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: evaluation of somatic mutation in tibial pseudarthrosis sample in neurofibromatosis type background tibial pseudarthrosis is associated with neurofibromatosis type nf and there is wide clinical variability of the tibial dysplasia in nf suggesting the possibility of genetic modifier double inactivation of nf is postulated to be necessary for the development of tibial pseudarthrosis but tissue or cell of origin of the second hit mutation remains unclear method exome sequencing of different section of surgically resected nf tibial pseudarthrosis tissue wa performed and compared to germline peripheral blood result a germline nf splice site mutation cat pl mdel wa identified from dna extracted from peripheral blood exome sequencing of dna extracted from tissue removed during surgery of the tibial pseudarthrosis showed a somatic mutation of nf cgt pe in the normal germline allele further analysis of different region of the tibial pseudarthrosis sample showed enrichment of the somatic mutation in the soft tissue within the pseudarthrosis site and absence of the somatic mutation in cortical bone in addition a germline variant in ptpn cct ptm a gene involved in the ra signal transduction pathway wa identified although the clinical significance is unknown conclusion given that the nf somatic mutation wa primarily detected in the proliferative soft tissue at the pseudarthrosis site it is likely that the second hit occurred in mesenchymal progenitor from the periosteum these result are consistent with a defect of differentiation which may explain why the mutation is found in proliferative cell and not within cortical bone tissue a the latter by definition contains mostly mature differentiated osteoblast and osteocyte

title: hypogammaglobulinemia in child after allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation a cytokine mediated immunoglobulin isotype class switch arrest
abstract: background hypogammaglobulinemia hypoigg is common early posthsct in child occasionally necessitating longterm immunoglobulin ig g replacement therapy igg replacement may not reduce mortality although infectious complication are decreased procedure clinical data and sample from child were analyzed retrospectively with the aim to identify risk factor for developing longterm hypoigg ie requiring month igg replacement posthsct and studying the underlying biology laboratory study covered serum cytokine ighg genotyping and routine laboratory investigation result were analyzed statistically result fortyeight percent of the child developed longterm hypoigg these child were younger year and had higher acute gvhd incidence but had better overall survival v p significantly lower ig level posthsct but equal immune cell recovery were seen in patient with longterm hypoigg compared with those of transient or no hypoigg prehsct il and and posthsct baff and april level were significantly higher in the longterm hypoigg group conclusion finding suggests an unfavorable cytokine milieu for graftderived immune recovery possibly inducing ig isotype class switch arrest younger age acute gvhd and higher prehsct il level were identified a significant risk factor for longterm hypoigg longterm hypoigg posthsct doe not need to be unfavorable and could be an effect of deteriorated cytokine signaling
label: Non-Cancer

title: protein of the mitotic checkpoint and spindle are related to chromosomal instability and unfavourable prognosis in patient with myelodysplastic syndrome
abstract: aim to study the immunoexpression of protein related to the mitotic checkpoint cell division cycle cdc mitotic arrest deficient mad and the mitotic spindle aurorab in patient with myelodysplastic syndrome md method protein expression wa analysed in bone marrow tissue sample from patient with md using immunohistochemistry prognostic marker transfusion dependency depth of cytopenia chromosomal abnormality and survival were also studied result higher mad expression wa observed among patient with platelet xl v respectively higher cdc expression wa identified among patient with three dysplasia compared with patient who presented with one or two dysplasia v v respectively among patient who exhibited a complex versus noncomplex karyotype v respectively and among patient with platelet xl v respectively higher aurorab expression wa found in patient with an abnormal versus normal karyotype v respectively high expression of mad and cdc wa associated with severe thrombocytopenia we also found statistically significant difference in the overall survival rate when comparing different degree of cdc mad and aurorab protein expression conclusion to the best of our knowledge this is the first report to demonstrate that these protein are associated with chromosomal abnormality and poor prognosis in patient with md
label: Non-Cancer

title: mutational profiling in patient with md ready for everyday use in the clinic
abstract: multiple recurrent somatic mutation were identified in the majority of patient with myelodysplastic syndrome md but investigating the broad spectrum of molecular marker in md exceeds many laboratory capacity when traditional molecular technique are used highthroughput second generation sequencing nextgeneration sequencing ng ha proven to be applicable for comprehensive biomarker mutation analysis allowing to increase diagnostic sensitivity and accuracy and to improve risk stratification and prognostication in addition to cytomorphology and cytogenetic analysis in patient with md amplicon deepsequencing enables comprehensive biomarker analysis in a multitude of patient per investigation in an acceptable turnaround time and at affordable cost comprehensive myeloid marker panel were successfully introduced into diagnostic practice therefore molecular mutation analysis is ready for use in all patient with suspected md may contribute to risk stratification in possible candidate for allogeneic stem cell transplantation and should become an integral part of clinical research study in md patient

title: paediatric mastocytosis a systematic review of case
abstract: paediatric mastocytosis wa previously considered to be a benign and spontaneously regressing disease however this evolution is impossible to predict to clarify the characteristic and course of paediatric mastocytosis we performed a literature review of case published between and april lesion occurred before the age of year in of case and presented a urticaria pigmentosa of case mastocytoma or diffuse cutaneous mastocytosis the maletofemale ratio wa kit dv mutation wa detected in of tested patient clinical regression complete or partial occurred in of case and stabilization in however the outcome wa fatal in of patient

title: cd t cell stat phosphorylation precedes acute gvhd and subsequent th tissue invasion correlate with gvhd severity and therapeutic response
abstract: th cell contribute to severe gvhd in murine bone marrow transplantation targeted deletion of the rorgammat transcription factor or blockade of the jakstat axis suppresses il production and alloreactivity by th cell here we show that pstat y is increased significantly in cd t cell among human recipient of allogeneic hct before the onset of grade iiiv acute gvhd examination of targetorgan tissue at the time of gvhd diagnosis indicates that the amount of rorgammat th cell is significantly higher in severe gvhd greater accumulation of tissueresident th cell also correlate with the use of mtx compared with rapabased gvhd prophylaxis a well a a poor therapeutic response to glucocorticoid rorgammat is optimally suppressed by concurrent neutralization of torc with rapa and inhibition of stat activation with si supporting that mtor and statdependent pathway converge upon rorgammat gene expression raparesistant t cell proliferation can be totally inhibited by stat blockade during initial allosensitization we conclude that stat signaling and resultant th tissue accumulation are closely associated with acute gvhd onset severity and treatment outcome future study are needed to validate the association of stat activity in acute gvhd novel gvhd prevention strategy that incorporate dual stat and mtor inhibition merit investigation
label: Non-Cancer

title: immunodeficiency and autoimmune enterocolopathy linked to nfat haploinsufficiency
abstract: the link between autoimmune disease and primary immunodeficiency syndrome ha been increasingly appreciated immunologic evaluation of a young man with autoimmune enterocolopathy and unexplained infection revealed evidence of immunodeficiency including igg subclass deficiency impaired aginduced lymphocyte proliferation reduced cytokine production by cd t lymphocyte and decreased number of nk cell genetic evaluation identified haploinsufficiency of nfat a transcription factor regulating immune cell function and cellular adaptation to hyperosmotic stress a a possible cause of this syndrome inhibition or deletion of nfat in normal human and murine cell recapitulated several of the immune deficit identified in the patient these result provide evidence of a primary immunodeficiency disorder associated with organspecific autoimmunity linked to nfat deficiency
label: Non-Cancer

title: cenpa k ubiquitylation is required for cenpa deposition at the centromere
abstract: cenpa is a centromerespecific histone h variant that epigenetically determines centromere identity to ensure kinetochore assembly and proper chromosome segregation but the precise mechanism of it specific localization within centromeric heterochromatin remains obscure we have discovered that cularbxcops e ligase activity is required for cenpa ubiquitylation on lysine k and cenpa centromere localization a mutation of cenpa kr reduces interaction with hjurp a cenpaspecific histone chaperone and abrogates localization of cenpa to the centromere addition of monoubiquitin is sufficient to restore cenpa kr to centromere and the interaction with hjurp indicating that signaling ubiquitylation is required for cenpa loading at centromere the cularbx complex is required for loading newly synthesized cenpa and maintaining preassembled cenpa at centromere thus cenpa kr ubiquitylation mediated by the cularbxcops complex is essential for cenpa deposition at the centromere
label: Non-Cancer

title: screening analysis of candidate gene mutation in a kindred with polycystic liver disease
abstract: aim to find potential mutable site by detecting mutation of the candidate gene in a kindred with polycystic liver disease pcld method first we chose a kindred with pcld and obtained five venous blood sample of this kindred after the family member signed the informed consent form in the kindred two case were diagnosed with pcld and the left three case were normal individual all the blood sample were preserved at c second we extracted the genomic dna from the venous blood sample of the kindred using a qiaamp dna mini kit and then performed longrange polymerase chain reaction pcr with different primer the exon of pkd were all sequenced with the forward and reverse primer to ensure the accuracy of the result next we purified the pcr product and directly sequenced them using big dye terminator chemistry version the sequencing reaction wa conducted with biomekfx beckman finally we analyzed the result result a total of normal exon were identified in detecting mutation of the pkd gene a synonymous mutation occurred in exon the mutation wa a homozygous t in the proband and wa c in the reference sequence this mutation wa located in the third codon and did not change the amino acid encoded by the codon missense mutation occurred in exon and these mutation were located in the second codon they changed the amino acid sequence and existed in the dbsnp library a nonsense mutation occurred in exon the mutation wa a heterozygous ct in the proband and wa c in the reference sequence this mutation wa located in the first codon and resulted in a termination codon this mutation had an obvious influence on the encoded protein and changed the length of the protein from to amino acid this wa a new mutation that wa not present in the dbsnp library conclusion the nonsense mutation of exon existed in the proband and in the third individual additionally the proband wa heterozygous for this mutation so the mutable site wa a pathogenic mutation
label: Non-Cancer

title: atm gene single nucleotide polymorphism predict regimenrelated gastrointestinal toxicity in patient allografted after reduced conditioning
abstract: polymorphism of gene involved in innate and adaptive immunity have become an object of major interest in regard to hematopoietic stem cell transplantation hsct complication regimenrelated gastrointestinal toxicity rrgit is the dominant complication during the preengraftment period and ha been linked to increased risk of graftversushost disease gvhd development according to our hypothesis functional variant of gene participating in dna damage response ddr may have an impact on the extent of tissue damage caused by the conditioning regimen in our singlecenter study we analyzed patient who underwent hsct from hlaidentical donor after reduced conditioning the patient were genotyped for single nucleotide polymorphism snp r tg r ag r tg r ct and r tc of the atm genethe essential member of the ddr pathway using allelespecific matrixassisted laser desorptionionization timeofflight malditof mass spectrometry assay because of almost absolute linkage disequilibrium observed among all snp association of major atm haplotype atmatm with rrgit and acute gvhd agvhd wa analyzed importantly the univariate and multivariate analysis showed that patient homozygous for atm haplotype rst rsa rst rsc and rst are more likely to suffer from highgrade rrgit than atm homozygous patient the association with agvhd wa not significant to our knowledge this is the first report showing the atm gene variability in relation to rrgit in the allogeneic hsct setting
label: Non-Cancer

title: evaluation of von willebrand factor phenotype and genotype in hemophilia a patient with and without identified f mutation
abstract: background hemophilia a ha is an xlinked bleeding disorder caused by a deficiency in factor viii fviii von willebrand disease vwd is characterized by a quantitative or qualitative defect in von willebrand factor vwf patient with vwd with severely low vwf or vwd type n vwdn a vwd subtype distinguished by defective vwf binding to fviii may have reduced fviii level secondary to their vwd these patient superficially resemble patient with ha and pose a potential for misdiagnosis objective to investigate the unexplained cause of bleeding in ha patient without known fviii mutation by assessing plasma vwf antigen vwfag fviii binding capacity and vwf genotype patientsmethods thirtyseven of patient with ha studied a part of the hemophilia inhibitor research study lacked identifiable f mutation these patient case and patient with identified f mutation control were evaluated for vwfag a patient vwf capacity to bind fviii vwffviiib and vwf sequence result four case had vwfag iu dl and vwf mutation consistent with type vwd six case and one control were heterozygous for mutation previously reported to cause type vwd vwd n five case and one control or predicted to be deleterious by polyphen and sift prediction tool n case one control had vwfag iu dl and seven patient four case and three control including two case who were heterozygous for a known vwdn mutation had reduced vwffviiib conclusion these data emphasize that some patient diagnosed with ha require vwf assessment in order to achieve a comprehensive diagnosis and an optimal treatment strategy
label: Non-Cancer

title: clinical and laboratory characterization of case of castleman disease patient from a single centre paraneoplastic pemphigus is an unfavourable prognostic factor
abstract: this study retrospectively collected the clinical and laboratory data of patient with castleman disease cd from a single medical centre clinical classification identified patient with unicentric castleman disease and with multicentric castleman disease pathological classification revealed case of hyaline vascular variant mixed cellular variant mix and plasmacytic variant clinical complication occurred in cd patient including case of paraneoplastic pemphigus pnp and case with renal complication haematological involvement pleural effusion andor ascites and poem syndrome polyneuropathy organomegaly endocrinopathy monoclonal gammopathy and skin change were also found univariate analysis showed that presence of clinical complication and pnp were both risk factor relating to cd patient survival prognostic factor showing p in univariate analysis and those with clinical significance were subjected to multivariate analysis using a cox regression model pnp presence and age over year both significantly adversely affected survival thus only presence of pnp wa identified a an independent unfavourable survival risk factor in both univariate and multivariate analysis overall the present data provide a panoramic description of cd case and emphasize that the presence of pnp is an adverse prognostic factor
label: Non-Cancer

title: activation of kit modulates the function of tumor necrosis factorrelated apoptosisinducing ligand receptor trailr in mast cell
abstract: background mastocytosis is characterized by the accumulation of mast cell mc associated with activating mutation of kit tumor necrosis factorrelated apoptosisinducing ligand receptor trailrs are preferentially expressed on neoplastic cell and induce the extrinsic apoptotic pathway recent study reported on the expression of trailrs and trailinduced apoptosis in cultured human mc which depend on stem cell factor scfinduced or constitutive kit activation material and method we sought to further define the impact of trailrs on mc in vivo and in vitro using creloxp recombination we generated mouse with mcspecific and ubiquitous knockout of trailr in these mouse anaphylaxis and number of mc were investigated we also explored the expression and function of trailrs in cultured murine and human mc upon activation of kit by conducting immunofluorescence staining we analyzed the expression of trailrs in mc infiltrating the bone marrow of patient with mastocytosis result mcspecific deletion of trailr wa associated with a slight but significant increase in anaphylaxis number of mc in mcspecific knockout of trailr were comparable to control whereas cultured ildependent murine mc from wildtype mouse were resistant to trailinduced apoptosis scfstimulated mc underwent apoptosis in response to trail interestingly activating kit mutation also promoted sensitivity to trailmediated apoptosis in human mc in line with these finding mc infiltrating the bone marrow of patient with mastocytosis expressed trailr conclusion activation of kit regulates the function of trailrs in mc trailr may represent an attractive diagnostic and therapeutic target in disease associated with kit mutation such a mastocytosis
label: Non-Cancer

title: the clinical and laboratory evaluation of the patient with erythrocytosis
abstract: erythrocytosis is frequently encountered a an incidental abnormality on laboratory testing that reveals persistent elevation of the hematocrit level in men and in woman in many case erythrocytosis is the manifestation of an underlying cardiopulmonary process druginduced due to androgen or secondary to smoking rather than a primary bone marrow disorder such a polycythemia vera a systematic approach to the clinical and laboratory evaluation of each patient is indicated to consider diverse differential diagnosis possibility and to identify the underlying etiology of erythrocytosis in order to formulate appropriate subspecialist referral and management plan a thorough medical history and meticulous physical examination supplemented by a focused initial laboratory evaluation will enable the general practitioner to ascertain the etiology of erythrocytosis in the majority of case patient with clinical and laboratory feature suggestive of polycythemia vera and those patient without an apparent underlying condition known to cause erythrocytosis benefit from early referral to a hematologist for further specialized diagnostic evaluation and therapy consideration
label: Non-Cancer

title: apol toxin innate immunity and kidney injury
abstract: the discovery that two common apol allele were strongly associated with nondiabetic kidney disease in african descent population led to hope for improved diagnosis and treatment unfortunately we still do not have a clear understanding of the biological function played by apol in podocytes or other kidney cell nor how the renal risk allele initiate the development of nephropathy important clue for apol function may be gleaned from the natural defense mechanism of apol against trypanosome infection and from similar protein eg diphtheria toxin mammalian bcl family member this review provides an update on the biological function for circulating trypanosome resistance and intracellular emerging role for autophagy apol further we introduce a multimer model for apol in kidney cell that reconciles the gainoffunction variant with the recessive inheritance pattern of apol renal risk allele
label: Non-Cancer

title: anaphylaxis after hymenoptera sting is it venom allergy a clonal disorder or both
abstract: a yearold man presented with loss of consciousness minute after being stung by a yellow jacket in his backyard epinephrine and fluid were required for resuscitation allergy evaluation revealed specific ige to yellow jacket and honeybee and the patient wa started on venom immunotherapy he had systemic reaction during buildup and a severe anaphylactic episode requiring dos of intramuscular epinephrine at maintenance dos immunotherapy wa discontinued serum tryptase level after such episode wa ngml with a baseline level of ngml week later the physical examination wa unremarkable including no skin lesion of cutaneous mastocytosis because of elevated baseline tryptase level a bone marrow biopsy wa performed which revealed multifocal dense infiltrates of mast cell a diagnosis of systemic mastocytosis wa made the patient wa treated with omalizumab and wa able to tolerate immunotherapy and is currently maintained on lifelong immunotherapy he wa restung in the field and ha not had anaphylaxis
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: anaphylaxis after hymenoptera sting is it venom allergy a clonal disorder or both a yearold man presented with loss of consciousness minute after being stung by a yellow jacket in his backyard epinephrine and fluid were required for resuscitation allergy evaluation revealed specific ige to yellow jacket and honeybee and the patient wa started on venom immunotherapy he had systemic reaction during buildup and a severe anaphylactic episode requiring dos of intramuscular epinephrine at maintenance dos immunotherapy wa discontinued serum tryptase level after such episode wa ngml with a baseline level of ngml week later the physical examination wa unremarkable including no skin lesion of cutaneous mastocytosis because of elevated baseline tryptase level a bone marrow biopsy wa performed which revealed multifocal dense infiltrates of mast cell a diagnosis of systemic mastocytosis wa made the patient wa treated with omalizumab and wa able to tolerate immunotherapy and is currently maintained on lifelong immunotherapy he wa restung in the field and ha not had anaphylaxis

title: simultaneous assessment of nfkappabp phosphorylation and nuclear localization using imaging flow cytometry
abstract: aberrant activity of nuclear factorkappab nfkappab is associated with many disease and is therapeutically targeted posttranslational modification particularly phosphorylation of the relap subunit are essential for cytoplasmic to nuclear localization of nfkappabp and initiation of transcription of downstream target gene immunoblot and phosphoflow cytometry have been used to study the relationship between phosphorylation motif and nfkappab activation and microscopic analysis of nuclear localization of p is also used a a parameter for activation the labor intensive nature of these approach commonly limit the number of sampling point or replicates recent insight into the relationship between p phosphorylation motif and their nuclear localization indicate that these parameter have different significance and should not be used interchangeably in this study we demonstrate feasibility and reproducibility of studying the relationship between p phosphorylation and nuclear translocation using imaging flow cytometry ifc tnfalpha or pmaionomycininduced phosphorylation of p at serine in cell line model and healthy donor lymphocyte served a the experimental model ifc analysis demonstrated that expression of phosphorylated serine pps increased rapidly following stimulation and that nuclear localization of pps followed the nuclear localization pattern of total p however in the presence of tacrolimus pps expression wa inhibited without affecting nuclear localization of total p the data demonstrate the application of ifc to simultaneously assess phosphorylation of p and it cellular localization and the result obtained by this analysis corroborate current insight regarding the specific effect of tacrolimus on serine phosphorylation
label: Non-Cancer

title: anaphylaxis with clonal mast cell in normal looking skin a new entity
abstract: background patient with elevated basal tryptase sbt mugl and anaphylaxis may have an underlying mastocytosis a monoclonal mast cell activation syndrome with aberrant mast cell mc at extracutaneous site ha been described in patient with severe hypotension or anaphylaxis method a mc in patient with elevated sbt might be altered in the skin a well we studied mc in normal neck skin in anaphylaxis and urticaria patient with elevated sbt result a mean of sd mcmm wa counted in normal neck skin in patient with anaphylaxis sd in seven patient with urticaria sd in two patient with eczema sd in five patient with systemic mastocytosis sm in comparison with autopsy skin mcmm sd in five of of the anaphylaxis and three of five sm patient more than of mc were spindle shaped and expressed cd antigen conclusion we could show for the first time that the normal skin can harbour clonal mc in anaphylaxis patient analogous to the criterion for mastocytosis we suggest a skin score criterion including an elevated number of mc spindle shape cd expression ckit mutation and sbt value mugl in patient with anaphylaxis and elevated sbt skin should be biopsied and a with the approach for mastocytosis diagnosis in the bone marrow mc should be analysed for their number clonality and ckit mutation this approach should be confirmed in further study patient with aberrant skin mc should be handled a mastocytosis patient
label: Non-Cancer

title: analysis of oxidative stress status through mn test and serum mda level in pcos woman
abstract: polycystic ovary syndrome pcos is a multifactorial reproductive healthcare problem affecting of woman and a leading cause of female infertility worldwide the potential genetic contributor of pcos are unclear however over the past decade emerging evidence ha shown that increased oxidative stress o and decreased antioxidant status were often linked with pcos the present casecontrol study wa aimed to assess the reactive oxygen specie induced o in woman from south india a total of individual comprising of patient and control were enrolled in the present study for all the subject the frequency of micronucleated cell mnc in epithelial sample and serum malondialdehyde mda level were estimated to assess genomic instability and cytotoxicity respectively a statistically significant difference between the group were identified with respect to body mass index waist to hip ratio luteinizing hormone and prolactin level however the mean follicle stimulating hormone wa not different between the group p the frequency of mn cell v and mean serum mda v level were considerably higher in patient than control p furthermore a positive correlation wa observed between mnc and mda level in patient r p and not in control r p suggest high o in pcos woman therefore mn assay and serum mda level may serve together or individually a biomarkers of o in pcos woman

title: porphobilinogen deaminase gene mutation in polish patient with nonerythroid acute intermittent porphyria
abstract: background acute intermittent porphyria aip is an metabolic disorder characterized by a partial deficiency of the porphobilinogen deaminase the enzyme of heme biosynthesis the metabolic defect in aip involves an approximately halfnormal activity of porphobilinogen deaminase pbgd ec the enzyme catalyzing condensation of four porphobilinogen molecule to hydroxymethylbilane due to tissuespecific alternative transcript splicing the pbgd gene mutation within the range of exon may lead to classical aip involving erythrocyte and all the other tissue mutation within intron and exon may result in the socalled nonerythroid aip in which the pbgd activity is normal in erythrocyte and diminished in other tissue objective the aim of the present study wa to characterise molecular error in the pbgd gene in polish patient with nonerythroid aip and to evaluate the efficacy of the dna sequencing method in the early diagnosis of this disorder material and method twenty five member of nine nonerythroid aip family were assessed in each of them dna sequencing wa performed using the big dye terminator cycle sequencing kit v on the hitachi analyzer applied biosystem usa result four mutation were detected in intron of the pbgd gene including one unreported novel mutation del agtgctgag of an unknown biological mechanism and three previously described mutation ie g a t c g c responsible for abnormal transcript splicing in the area of exon of asymptomatic member of proband family in subject were diagnosed with aip and in the aip wa excluded based on the dna sequencing method conclusion dna sequencing based analysis is the only reliable method for correct diagnosis of asymptomatic nonerythroid aip patient with normal urinary excretion of heme precursor the mutation found in polish patient with nonerythroid aip represented those of splice defect and resulted in abnormal exon splicing
label: Non-Cancer

title: high genetic risk individual benefit less from resistance exercise intervention
abstract: objective genetic factor have an important role in body mass index bmi variation and also likely have a role in the weight loss and body composition response to physical activityexercise with the recent identification of bmiassociated genetic variant it is possible to investigate the interaction of these genetic factor with exercise on body composition outcome method in a blockrandomized clinical trial of resistance exercise among woman n we examined whether the putative effect of exercise on weight and dualenergy xray absorptiometryderived body composition measurement differs according to genetic risk for obesity approximately onehalf of the sample wa randomized to an intervention consisting of a supervised intensive resistance exercise program lasting year genetic risk for obesity wa defined a a genetic risk score grs comprised of singlenucleotide polymorphism snp known to be associated with bmi variation we examined the interaction of exercise intervention and the grs on anthropometric and body composition measurement after year of the exercise intervention result we found statistically significant interaction for body weight p body fat p body fat p and abdominal fat p whereby the putative effect of exercise is greater among those with a lower level of genetic risk for obesity no single snp appears to be a major driver of these interaction conclusion the weightloss response to resistance exercise including change in body composition differs according to an individual genetic risk for obesity
label: Non-Cancer

title: analysis of phenotype and outcome in essential thrombocythemia with calr or jak mutation
abstract: the jak vf mutation the thrombopoietin receptor mpl wkl mutation and calreticulin calr mutation are mutually exclusive in essential thrombocythemia and support a novel molecular categorization of essential thrombocythemia calr mutation account for approximately of case of essential thrombocythemia in a retrospective study we examined the frequency of mpl and calr mutation in jak vfnegative case of essential thrombocythemia n in addition we compared the clinical phenotype and outcome of calr mutant case of essential thrombocythemia with a cohort of jak vfpositive essential thrombocythemia n calrpositive case represented of doublenegative case of essential thrombocythemia and most carried calr type or type indels however we also identified one patient who wa positive for both the jak vf and the calr mutation this study revealed that calr mutant essential thrombocythemia is associated with younger age higher platelet count lower erythrocyte count leukocyte count hemoglobin and hematocrit and increased risk of progression to myelofibrosis in comparison with jak vfpositive essential thrombocythemia analysis of the calr mutant group according to indel type showed that calr type deletion is strongly associated with male gender calr mutant patient had a better overall survival than jak vfpositive patient in particular patient of age year or younger in conclusion this study in a belgian cohort of patient support and extends the growing body of evidence that calr mutant case of essential thrombocythemia are phenotypically distinct from jak vfpositive case with regard to clinical and hematologic presentation a well a overall survival
label: Non-Cancer

title: evaluation of posterior hippocampal epileptogenicity during epilepsy surgery for temporal lobe cavernoma by the occipital approach
abstract: background cavernomas frequently are associated with intractable epilepsy when cavernomas located in the temporal lobe are associated with intractable epilepsy the hippocampus also may have an epileptic focus the objective in the present study wa to clarify the importance of evaluation of the posterior hippocampal epileptogenicity during epilepsy surgery for posteromedial temporal lobe cavernoma case description in this study we describe rare case of medically intractable epilepsy in patient with posteromedial temporal lobe cavernomas who underwent surgery via the occipital approach using longitudinal insertion of depth electrode into the hippocampus we evaluated epileptogenicity in both patient from the cavernoma cavity and it surrounding hemosiderin a well a from the posterior hippocampus near the cavernoma we show that the transoccipital approach to the posteromedial temporal lobe is compatible with depth electrode insertion and subdural electrode placement on the temporal lobe enabling an accurate evaluation of potential epileptogenic zone in the posterior part of the hippocampus both patient did not experience any seizure and had no postoperative neurologic deficit and their cognitive function were intact conclusion the transoccipital approach enables the optimization of the extent of posterior hippocampectomy while avoiding unnecessary resection for seizure control we suggest resecting the posterior part of the hippocampus in addition to the cavernoma and surrounding area in patient with medically refractory epilepsy due to a posteromedial temporal cavernoma tailored systematic resection guided by intraoperative electrocorticography and electroencephalography with a depth electrode wa important and necessary in the present case
label: Non-Cancer

title: spindle checkpoint factor bub and bub promote dna doublestrand break repair by nonhomologous end joining
abstract: the nonhomologous endjoining nhej pathway is essential for the preservation of genome integrity a it efficiently repair dna doublestrand break dsbs previous biochemical and genetic investigation have indicated that despite the importance of this pathway the entire complement of gene regulating nhej remains unknown to address this we employed a plasmidbased nhej dna repair screen in budding yeast saccharomyces cerevisiae using putative nonessential dna repairrelated component a query among the newly identified gene associated with nhej deficiency upon disruption are two spindle assembly checkpoint kinase bub and bub both observation of resulting phenotype and chromatin immunoprecipitation demonstrated that bub and either alone or in combination with cell cycle regulator are recruited near the dsb where phosphorylated rad or ha accumulates largescale proteomic analysis of bub kinase phosphorylated in response to dna damage identified previously unknown kinase substrate on tel stq site moreover bub nhej function appears to be conserved in mammalian cell bp which influence dsb repair by nhej colocalizes with human bub and is recruited to the break site thus while bub is not a core component of nhej machinery our data support it dual role in mitotic exit and promotion of nhej repair in yeast and mammal
label: Non-Cancer

title: impaired function of bone marrow stromal cell in systemic mastocytosis
abstract: patient with systemic mastocytosis sm have a wide variety of problem including skeletal abnormality the disease result from a mutation of the stem cell receptor ckit in mast cell and we wondered if the function of bone marrow stromal cell bmscs also known a msc or mesenchymal stem cell might be affected by the invasion of bone marrow by mutant mast cell a expected bmscs from sm patient do not have a mutation in ckit but they proliferate poorly in addition while osteogenic differentiation of the bmscs seems to be deficient their adipogenic potential appears to be increased since the hematopoietic supportive ability of bmscs are also important we also studied the engraftment in nsg mouse of human cd hematopoietic progenitor after being cocultured with bmscs of healthy volunteer v bmscs derived from patient with sm bmscs derived from the bone marrow of patient with sm could not support hematopoiesis to the extent that healthy bmscs do finally we performed an expression analysis and found significant difference between healthy and sm derived bmscs in the expression of gene with a variety of function including the wnt signaling ossification and bone remodeling we suggest that some of the symptom associated with sm might be driven by epigenetic change in bmscs caused by dysfunctional mast cell in the bone marrow of the patient
label: Non-Cancer

title: costotransverse screw fixation in a severe cervicothoracic deformity because of a type neurofibromatosis case report
abstract: background context spinal implant placement may be challenging in case of severe cervicothoracic spinal deformity and anatomical anomaly a in type neurofibromatosis intralaminar screwing of the thoracic spine ha been described in few case in which pedicle were hypoplasic the costovertebral joint have never been used before a an anchorage point for screw purpose the purpose of the study wa to describe a new thoracic fixation technique to be used in severe deformity whenever the posterior arch lamina and pedicle is not available because of anatomic abnormality study design this is a case report method an yearold woman with progressive tetraparesis caused by increasing deformity of cervicothoracic spine underwent evaluation and surgical treatment procedure and technique were described the clinical feature the radiological finding and the outcome were assessed complication and local recurrence were also recorded result costotransverse joint screwing wa successfully used in one case of severe cervicothoracic spine deformity with major hypoplasia of the pedicle the posterior arch of one thoracic vertebra became mobile soon after periosteal stripping probably because of iatrogenic fracture of the only existent pedicle the fourcortical trajectory of the screw resulted in a good bone purchase allowing the surgeon to complete the procedure no local or general complication were recorded during year of followup conclusion the procedure wa used a a salvage technique during a difficult surgery where a local complication forced a change of strategy although the implant remained stable long enough to achieve fusion it still consists of placing a screw through a joint that remains slightly mobile this could possibly result in a screw loosening in the long period if fusion is not achieved we suggest the use of this technique when all the other option have been explored and excluded for anatomical reason
label: Non-Cancer

title: expression analysis of microrna in patient with polycythemia vera and essential thrombocythemia and correlation with jak allele burden and laboratory finding
abstract: introduction the jakvf mutation ha emerged in recent year a a diagnostic a well a a treatment target in patient with polycythemia vera pv and essential thrombocythemia et the disease phenotype is also influenced by other factor such a microrna mirna deregulation the aim of this study wa to investigate mir expression level in these patient with those obtained from healthy control subject and it correlation with jak allele burden and laboratory finding method in total forty patient with a clinical diagnosis of pv and et were examined at the time of diagnosis ten healthy subject were checked a control we performed jak vf allele burden measurement and expression analysis of mirbp mirbp mirap and mirap in leukocyte isolated from peripheral blood by quantitative realtime polymerase chain reaction result mirbp and mirap were upregulated in both patient with pv p and p respectively and et p and p respectively in pv group a significant correlation wa observed between mirap and platelet count p r the correlation between mirna and jak allele burden wa not significant conclusion in conclusion our data indicate that other factor such a aberrant mir expression may influence on the disease phenotype in patient with pv and et

title: pseudomonas aeruginosa exot induces atypical anoikis apoptosis in target host cell by transforming crk adaptor protein into a cytotoxin
abstract: previously we demonstrated that pseudomonas aeruginosa exot induces potent apoptosis in host epithelial cell in a manner that primarily depends on it adpribosyltransferase domain adprt activity however the mechanism underlying exotadprtinduced apoptosis remains undetermined we now report that exotadprt disrupts focal adhesion site activates pbeta and jnk and interferes with integrinmediated survival signaling causing atypical anoikis we show that exotadprtinduced anoikis is mediated by the crk adaptor protein we found that crk knockout cell are significantly more resistant to exotinduced apoptosis while crk cell complemented with crk are rendered sensitive to exotinduced apoptosis moreover a dominant negative dn mutant form of crk phenocopies exotinduced apoptosis both kinetically and mechanistically crk is generally believed to be a component of focal adhesion fa and it role in cellular survival remains controversial in that it ha been found to be either prosurvival or proapoptosis our data demonstrate that although crk is recruited to fa site it function is likely not required for fa assembly or for survival per se however when modified by exot or by mutagenesis it can be transformed into a cytotoxin that induces anoikis by disrupting fa site and interfering with integrin survival signaling to our knowledge this is the first example whereby a bacterial toxin exerts it cytotoxicity by subverting the function of an innocuous host cellular protein and turning it against the host cell
label: Non-Cancer

title: tuberous sclerosis complex
abstract: tuberous sclerosis complex is an autosomaldominant neurocutaneous multisystem disorder characterized by cellular hyperplasia and tissue dysplasia the genetic cause is mutation in the tsc gene found on chromosome q and tsc gene found on chromosome p the clinical phenotype resulting from mutation in either of the gene are variable in each individual herein advance in the understanding of molecular mechanism in tuberous sclerosis complex are reviewed and current guideline for diagnosis treatment followup and management are summarized
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: tuberous sclerosis complex tuberous sclerosis complex is an autosomaldominant neurocutaneous multisystem disorder characterized by cellular hyperplasia and tissue dysplasia the genetic cause is mutation in the tsc gene found on chromosome q and tsc gene found on chromosome p the clinical phenotype resulting from mutation in either of the gene are variable in each individual herein advance in the understanding of molecular mechanism in tuberous sclerosis complex are reviewed and current guideline for diagnosis treatment followup and management are summarized

title: anetoderma in a patient with terminal osseous dysplasia with pigmentary defect
abstract: terminal osseous dysplasia with pigmentary defect todpd is a rare xlinked syndrome classically characterized by distal limb anomaly pigmented skin defect of the face and recurrent digital fibroma xinactivation play a major role in determining the range of phenotypic expression thus patient can demonstrate a wide spectrum of disease severity making accurate diagnosis more challenging recent study have identified a flna cga mutation a the cause of todpd allowing for diagnostic genetic testing we present a case of molecularly confirmed todpd in a girl with the xxx chromosomal complement and deformity of the hand and foot craniofacial abnormality and discolored linear facial lesion skin biopsy of the patient facial lesion revealed absent papillary dermal elastic fiber consistent with anetoderma which contrast with the dermal hypoplasia described in the only other such facial biopsy reported in the literature the finding of absent elastic fiber in the skin lesion suggests that mutated filamin a in part exerts it effect through dysregulated elastin biology which may explain the nature of many connective tissue pleotropic effect in flnarelated disorder
label: Non-Cancer

title: detection of the kit dv mutation in peripheral blood of systemic mastocytosis diagnostic implication
abstract: recent study have found the kit dv mutation in peripheral blood of virtually all adult systemic mastocytosis patient once highly sensitive pcr technique were used thus detection of the kit dv mutation in peripheral blood ha been proposed to be included in the diagnostic workup of systemic mastocytosis algorithm however the precise frequency of the mutation the biological significance of peripheral bloodmutated cell and their potential association with involvement of bone marrow hematopoietic cell other than mast cell still remain to be investigated here we determined the frequency of peripheral blood involvement by the kit dv mutation a assessed by two highly sensitive pcr method and investigated it relationship with multilineage involvement of bone marrow hematopoiesis overall our result confirmed the presence of the kit dv mutation in peripheral blood of most systemic mastocytosis case with an increasing frequency from indolent systemic mastocytosis without skin lesion to indolent systemic mastocytosis with skin involvement and more aggressive disease subtypes a assessed by the allelespecific oligonucleotideqpcr method which wa more sensitive p than the peptide nucleic acidmediated pcr approach although the presence of the kit mutation in peripheral blood a assessed by the allelespecific oligonucleotideqpcr technique did not accurately predict for multilineage bone marrow involvement of hematopoiesis the allelespecific oligonucleotideqpcr allele burden and the peptide nucleic acidmediatedpcr approach did these result suggest that both method provide clinically useful and complementary information through the identification andor quantification of the kit dv mutation in peripheral blood of patient suspected of systemic mastocytosis
label: Non-Cancer

title: urinary betapgfalpha and nmethyl histamine correlate with bone marrow biopsy finding in mast cell disorder
abstract: background the utility of measuring histamine and prostaglandin metabolite in the urine of patient with mastocytosis ha not been critically examined in a large series of patient this study examined the relationship between the extent of increase in urinary excretion of betaprostaglandinfalpha and nmethyl histamine with serum tryptase whole blood serotonin and bone marrow finding including morphology percentage involvement and abnormal mast cell phenotype method this wa a retrospective analysis of patient who were continuously enrolled in the study for a period of year we recorded serum tryptase whole blood serotonin level of urinary mast cell metabolite betaprostaglandinfalpha and nmethyl histamine nmh and bone marrow finding result urinary mast cell metabolite betaprostaglandinfalpha and nmethyl histamine correlated with level of serum tryptase mast cell burden in the bone marrow the presence of mast cell aggregate and atypical mast cell on bone marrow biopsy whole blood serotonin did not have a significant correlation with the serum tryptase or mast cell burden in the bone marrow urinary nmh wa significantly different between ckit dvpositive and ckit dvnegative patient while betaprostaglandinfalpha wa not urinary betaprostaglandinfalpha h excretion ng and nmh level muggm cr corresponded with the high degree of bone marrow biopsy positive for atypical mast cell the presence of aggregate and ckit mutation conclusion easily obtained and quantified urinary metabolite of histamine greater than twice the upper limit of normal and prostaglandin d time the upper limit of normal correlate well with bone marrow finding of mastocytosis
label: Non-Cancer

title: vertical extraventricular functional hemispherotomy a new variant for hemispheric disconnection technical note and result in three patient
abstract: purpose hemispherectomy and disconnective hemispherotomy are the most effective epilepsy surgical procedure for the treatment of epilepsy due to hemispheric pathology such a sturgeweber syndrome diffuse hemispheric cortical dysplasia and posttraumatic and postischemic focal lesion disconnective hemispherotomy is nowadays preferred to reduce surgical morbidity in term of early and late complication ie cerebral superficial hemosiderosis despite the number of existing technical variant conceived to further reduce the amount of brain tissue to be removed postoperative hydrocephalus still persists and may account for an average incidence of according to different series and review a new variant of disconnective vertical hemispherotomy we termed vertical extraventricular parasagittal hemispherotomy is described aiming to further reduce the amount of removed brain tissue and so the risk of postoperative hydrocephalus in favor of a pure hemispheric disconnection method three patient affected by drugresistant epilepsy due to different hemispheric pathology posttraumatic epilepsy sturgeweber syndrome diffuse hemispheric cortical dysplasia were considered to be candidate for vertical extraventricular parasagittal hemispherotomy disconnective based on presurgical evaluation protocol the oldest patient wa year old the two youngest were both year old result none of the patient experienced early and late surgical complication after a mean followup of month range month two patient were seizure free one relapsed seizure month later postoperative hydrocephalus never occurred conclusion vertical extraventricular parasagittal hemispherotomy may be an efficacious and less invasive technique a it consists in a pure disconnection of the hemisphere with less amount of brain tissue removed and a theoretical reduced risk of postoperative hydrocephalus
label: Non-Cancer
