title: herpesvirus genome recognition induced acetylation of nuclear ifi is essential for it cytoplasmic translocation inflammasome and ifnbeta response
abstract: the ilbeta and type i interferonbeta ifnbeta molecule are important inflammatory cytokine elicited by the eukaryotic host a innate immune response against invading pathogen and danger signal recently a predominantly nuclear gammainterferoninducible protein ifi involved in transcriptional regulation ha emerged a an innate dna sensor which induced ilbeta and ifnbeta production through inflammasome and sting activation respectively herpesvirus kshv ebv and hsv episomal dsdna genome recognition by ifi lead to ifiascprocaspase inflammasome association cytoplasmic translocation and ilbeta production independent of asc hsv genome recognition result in ifi interaction with sting in the cytoplasm to induce interferonbeta production however the mechanism of ifiinflammasome formation cytoplasmic redistribution and sting activation are not known our study here demonstrate that recognition of herpesvirus genome in the nucleus by ifi lead into it interaction with histone acetyltransferase p and ifi acetylation resulting in ifiasc interaction inflammasome assembly increased interaction with rangtpase cytoplasmic redistribution caspase activation ilbeta production and interaction with sting which result in irf phosphorylation nuclear pirf localization and interferonbeta production asc and sting knockdown did not affect ifi acetylation indicating that this modification is upstream of inflammasomeassembly and stingactivation vaccinia virus replicating in the cytoplasm did not induce nuclear ifi acetylation and cytoplasmic translocation ifi physically associate with kshv and hsv genome a revealed by proximity ligation microscopy and chromatinimmunoprecipitation study which is not hampered by the inhibition of acetylation thus suggesting that acetylation of ifi is not required for it innate sensing of nuclear viral genome collectively these study identify the increased nuclear acetylation of ifi a a dynamic essential postgenome recognition event in the nucleus that is common to the ifimediated innate response of inflammasome induction and ifnbeta production during herpesvirus kshv ebv hsv infection
label: Non-Cancer

title: hymenoptera anaphylaxis and ckit mutation an unexpected association
abstract: clinical manifestation of mastocytosis in adult comprise sign and symptom linked to mast cell mc activation including anaphylaxis depending on mc burden adult can be diagnosed with systemic mastocytosis when the who criterion are fulfilled or with other clonal mc disorder characterized by mc mediator symptom and demonstration of activating kit mutation andor expression of cd on mc there is a specific link between mastocytosis and hymenoptera venom allergy hva the reported frequency of hva in mastocytosis is and raise to in patient affected by indolent systemic mastocytosis without skin lesion the presentation of hva characterized by severe hypotension in the absence of urticarial or angioedema is typical in patient with an underlying mc disorder even in the presence of normal baseline serum tryptase level

title: large maculopapular cutaneous lesion are associated with favorable outcome in childhoodonset mastocytosis
abstract: background mastocytosis characterized by pathologic accumulation of mast cell can manifest itself in adulthood or childhood pediatric patient usually have cutaneous mastocytosis cm with mast cell infiltrates limited to the skin and spontaneous improvement of skin lesion after several year however there are some patient with persistent disease resembling adulthoodonset mastocytosis objective the current classification of cm differentiates between subforms in clinical practice we noticed that different variant of these subforms might exist particularly in patient with childhoodonset mastocytosis therefore in the present study we aimed to investigate whether specific cutaneous lesion in patient with childhoodonset mastocytosis are associated with other disease parameter method we analyzed patient with a disease onset of less than age year using a systematic dermatologic approach result one hundred twentytwo patient presented with maculopapular cutaneous mastocytosis mpcm patient presented with diffuse cm and patient presented with solitary mastocytoma of the skin patient with mpcm showed particularly heterogeneous cutaneous lesion and were therefore grouped into variant presenting either with small lesion mpcmsmall skin lesion cm in diameter n or atypical lesion mpcmother n patient with mpcmlarge lesion compared with those with mpcmsmall lesion were characterized by significantly lower tryptase level shorter disease duration and earlier disease onset in addition more patient with mpcmlarge lesion exhibited spontaneous regression of cutaneous lesion conclusion our data show that patient with mpcmlarge lesion compared with those with mpcmsmall lesion have a more favorable disease course and suggest exploring the size of cutaneous lesion a a prognostic parameter in childhoodonset mpcm
label: Non-Cancer

title: increased il plasma level in indolent systemic mastocytosis patient are associated with high risk of disease progression
abstract: systemic mastocytosis sm is a heterogeneous disease with altered interleukin il and il plasma level however no study ha simultaneously investigated the plasma level of ilbeta il il ccl and clusterin in sm at diagnosis and correlated them with disease outcome here we investigated ilbeta il il ccl and clusterin plasma level in sm patient indolent sm ism and aggressive smand analyzed their prognostic impact among ism case grouped according to the extent of hematopoietic involvement of the bone marrow cell by the kit dv mutation although increased ilbeta il and ccl level were detected in sm patient versus healthy control only il and ccl level gradually increased with disease severity moreover increased il plasma level were associated with ism progression to more aggressive disease in particular among ism patient with multilineal kit mutation ismml these patient also showing a higher frequency of organomegalies versus other ismml patient of note all ism patient who progressed had increased il plasma level already at diagnosis our result indicate that sm patient display an altered plasma cytokine profile already at diagnosis increased il plasma level emerging a an early marker for disease progression among ism case in particular among highrisk ism patient who carry multilineage kit mutation
label: Non-Cancer

title: massive gastric polyposis associated with a germline smad gene mutation
abstract: juvenile polyposis syndrome jps is a rare autosomal dominant disorder characterized by the development of multiple hamartomatous polyp in the gastrointestinal tract polyp are most common in the colorectum of patient and the stomach causative mutation for jps have been identified in two gene to date smad and bmpra smad mutation are associated with a higher incidence of gastric polyposis in this case report we describe two patient with massive gastric polyposis associated with a smad mutation both presented with anaemia and both had colonic polyp initial endoscopic finding revealed giant rugal fold suggestive of menetrier disease however a other possible gastropathies could not be differentiated on the basis of histology a definitive diagnosis of jps required additional mutation analysis in patient with polyposis predominant in or limited to the stomach establishing a diagnosis based solely on the pathological feature of polyp can be challenging due to difficulty in differentiating jps from other hypertrophic gastropathies mutation analysis should be considered early in the diagnostic process in case of suspected juvenile polyposis thus facilitating rapid diagnosis and adequate followup
label: Non-Cancer

title: a polymorphism in a phosphotyrosine signalling motif of cd ly slamf alters sh domain binding and tcell activation
abstract: signalling lymphocyte activation molecule slam family member regulate activation and inhibition in the innate and adaptive immune system genomewide association study identified their genetic locus q a highly polymorphic and associated with susceptibility to systemic lupus erythematosus sle here we show that the val variant of the nonsynonymous single nucleotide polymorphism snp r in the slam family member cd ly slamf ha a twofold lower affinity compared with the sleassociated met variant for the small adaptor protein sap comparison of the two variant in tcell line revealed the val variant to be significantly more highly expressed than cd met activation wa diminished in cell expressing cd val compared with cd met a measured by upregulation of cd there wa no correlation between homozygosity at r and activation in peripheral blood mononuclear cell from healthy donor these finding identify potential mechanism by which a single snp can perturb finetuning in the immune system with significant functional consequence
label: Non-Cancer

title: pathologic finding in nemo deficiency a surgical and autopsy survey
abstract: hypomorphic mutation in nuclear factor kappab nfkappab essential modulator nemo encoded by ikbkg lead to a variable combined immunodeficiency which put patient at risk of early death from infectious complication the spectrum of clinical manifestation includes inflammatory disorder especially colitis because of the multiple complication of nemo deficiency a variety of biopsy excisional and autopsy material from these patient may be subject to pathologic examination therefore using sample from a cohort of patient with this disorder we aimed to survey the pathologic spectrum of nemo deficiency and search for correlation between specific genotype and phenotype clinical and laboratory data mutation analysis and pathology from patient were examined including autopsy no specific genotypepathology correlation wa identified however we confirmed an association between ectodermal dysplasia and inflammatory condition we found no characteristic pathology to identify patient with nemo deficiency therefore history physical examination and specific infection must remain the clue to suggest the diagnosis variability among patient and by infection make the pathologic recognition of nemo deficiency challenging
label: Non-Cancer

title: morphologically occult systemic mastocytosis in bone marrow clinicopathologic feature and an algorithmic approach to diagnosis
abstract: objective bone marrow bm biopsy specimen involved by systemic mastocytosis sm typically show multifocal compact dense aggregate of spindled mast cell mc however some case lack aggregate formation and fulfill the world health organization criterion for sm based on minor criterion method we identified bm case of kit dvmutated morphologically occult sm in the bm result all patient had some combination of allergicmc activating symptom peripheral blood count were generally normal bm aspirate showed or less mc which were only occasionally spindled bm biopsy specimen showed no morphologic classic mc lesion tryptase immunohistochemistry ihc demonstrated interstitial individually distributed mc up to with prominent spindling lacking aggregate formation mc coexpressed cd by ihc andor flow cytometry spindled mc constituted more than of total mc in all case and more than in of case conclusion morphologically occult involvement of normalappearing bm by sm will be missed without appropriate clinical suspicion and pathologic evaluation by tryptase and cd ihc and kit dv mutation analysis on the basis of these finding we propose a costeffective datadriven evidencebased algorithmic approach to the workup of these case
label: Non-Cancer

title: hematopoietic stem cell transplantation for cd ligand deficiency single institution experience
abstract: background xlinked hyperigm syndrome xhigm due to mutation in the gene encoding cd ligand result in failure of ig class switching and an increased propensity for recurrent sinopulmonary and other infection and thus decreased life expectancy allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation hsct is curative but longterm followup data are limited procedure we conducted a retrospective analysis of seven patient who have undergone allogeneic hsct for higm syndrome at duke university medical center result median age at transplant wa year range none of the patient had active hepatic or pulmonary disease immediately prior to transplant but all had a history of serious infection five patient received myeloablative conditioning and two patient received reduced intensity conditioning graft source included bone marrow peripheral blood and unrelated umbilical cord blood posttransplantation complication included venoocclusive disease hemorrhagic cystitis adenoviremia and cryptosporidium recurrence in one patient each two patient developed acute gvhd grade iiiv that resolved promptly with treatment and none developed extensive chronic gvhd all patient are intravenous iggindependent and have normal antibody titer immunoglobulin ig a level normalized in all but one patient and t and b cell number and function are otherwise normal in all all patient are alive at a median followup of range year posttransplantation with predominantly donor chimerism and no recurrent infection conclusion allogeneic hsct result in excellent survival and sustained immune reconstitution in patient with cd ligand deficiency using both myeloablative and reduced intensity conditioning approach and various graft source including bone marrow peripheral blood and umbilical cord blood
label: Non-Cancer

title: an adverse implication of radiation therapy for implantretained maxillofacial prosthesis
abstract: we report the year postoperative course of a patient whose maxillary defect wa reconstructed with maxillofacial implantretained facial prosthesis the patient received gy of radiation therapy adjunctive hyperbaric oxygen therapy wa administered and four mm long maxillofacial implant were inserted four year and month after insertion surgery two of the four implant were lost and the others showed bone regression in the surrounding bone all implant were replaced with epitec system maxillofacial implant placed in nonirradiated bone eleven year and month after replacement the epitec system ha been maintaining good and firm osseointegration appropriate selection of implant site and no history of radiation therapy are key to successful implant reconstruction however adjunctive hyperbaric oxygen therapy is believed to be effective osseointegrated implant should be inserted at a point appropriately distant from an irradiated lesion
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: an adverse implication of radiation therapy for implantretained maxillofacial prosthesis we report the year postoperative course of a patient whose maxillary defect wa reconstructed with maxillofacial implantretained facial prosthesis the patient received gy of radiation therapy adjunctive hyperbaric oxygen therapy wa administered and four mm long maxillofacial implant were inserted four year and month after insertion surgery two of the four implant were lost and the others showed bone regression in the surrounding bone all implant were replaced with epitec system maxillofacial implant placed in nonirradiated bone eleven year and month after replacement the epitec system ha been maintaining good and firm osseointegration appropriate selection of implant site and no history of radiation therapy are key to successful implant reconstruction however adjunctive hyperbaric oxygen therapy is believed to be effective osseointegrated implant should be inserted at a point appropriately distant from an irradiated lesion

title: effect of a thrombopoietin receptor agonist on use of intravenous immune globulin in patient with immune thrombocytopenia
abstract: background thrombopoietin receptor agonist are new treatment for patient with chronic immune thrombocytopenia itp how one of these agent romiplostim ha impacted practice pattern especially the use of intravenous immune globulin ivig ha not been evaluated outside of clinical trial study design and method this wa a retrospective cohort study of adult itp patient treated with romiplostim in four canadian center patient had primary or secondary itp and were followed for year before starting weekly romiplostim treatment we compared ivig use clinical outcome and cost before and after romiplostim result twentynine patient with itp received romiplostim median age wa year interquartile range iqr year and patient had a median of two prior itp treatment iqr including splenectomy n median platelet plt count wa x before and x after romiplostim median duration of romiplostim treatment wa month patient used a median of two ivig infusion per year before and per year after starting romiplostim p for patient who received weekly romiplostim for at least month n ivig infusion were three iqr per year before and iqr per year after romiplostim result were squewed by two high ivig user nineteen patient discontinued romiplostim treatment during followup because of lack of response n sustained response n toxicity n or response to splenectomy n overall health care cost were similar before and after romiplostim when concomitant treatment nursing resource and hospitalization were considered conclusion romiplostim wa associated with improved plt count and fewer ivig infusion for most itp patient in practice romiplostim wa generally not continued long term and wa cost neutral for overall itp management

title: modeling linkage disequilibrium increase accuracy of polygenic risk score
abstract: polygenic risk score have shown great promise in predicting complex disease risk and will become more accurate a training sample size increase the standard approach for calculating risk score involves linkage disequilibrium ldbased marker pruning and applying a p value threshold to association statistic but this discard information and can reduce predictive accuracy we introduce ldpred a method that infers the posterior mean effect size of each marker by using a prior on effect size and ld information from an external reference panel theory and simulation show that ldpred outperforms the approach of pruning followed by thresholding particularly at large sample size accordingly predicted r increased from to in a large schizophrenia dataset and from to in a large multiple sclerosis dataset a similar relative improvement in accuracy wa observed for three additional large disease datasets and for noneuropean schizophrenia sample the advantage of ldpred over existing method will grow a sample size increase
label: Non-Cancer

title: a case of recurrent ischemic stroke involving subacute progressive intracranial cerebral arterial sclerosis prior to diagnosis with jakmutated polycythemia vera
abstract: case report a yearold man presenting with no vascular risk factor visited our hospital with right hemiparesis and total aphasia diffusionweighted magnetic resonance imaging of the brain showed multiple hyperintensities in watershed distribution in the left hemisphere magnetic resonance angiography mra revealed stenosis of the middle cerebral artery despite normal mra finding month prior one year after the first stroke the patient experienced a recurrent ischemic stroke involving the left anterior choroidal artery pulmonary embolism and deep venous thrombosis after the recurrent stroke event hemoglobin level increased gradually two year after the first stroke a jakvf mutation wa detected conclusion our report suggests that progressive intracranial arterial sclerosis and venous thrombosis of undetermined etiology could be several initial symptom of polycythemia vera

title: diagnosis and classification of mastocytosis in nonspecialized versus reference centre a spanish network on mastocytosis rema study on patient
abstract: the diagnosis of rare disease such a mastocytosis remains a challenge despite this the precise benefit of referral of mastocytosis patient to highly specialized reference centre are poorly defined and whether patient should be managed at nonspecialized versus reference centre remains a matter of debate to evaluate the quality and efficiency of diagnostic procedure performed at the reference centre for mastocytosis in spain rema versus other nonreference centre we retrospectively analysed a series of patient for the overall degree of agreement obtained for the world health organization who diagnostic and classification criterion betwen the referring and rema centre our result showed that not all who diagnostic criterion were frequently investigated at the referring centre among the five who diagnostic criterion the highest degree of agreement wa obtained for serum tryptase level median confidence interval in turn the overall agreement wa significantly lower for the major histopathological criterion and the other three minor criterion cytomorphology immunophenotyping of bm mast cell and detection of the kit mutation referral of patient with diagnostic suspicion of mastocytosis to a multidisciplinary reference centre improves diagnostic efficiency and quality
label: Non-Cancer

title: generation and periodontal differentiation of human gingival fibroblastsderived integrationfree induced pluripotent stem cell
abstract: induced pluripotent stem cell ipscs have been recognized a a promising cell source for periodontal tissue regeneration however the conventional virusbased reprogramming approach is associated with a high risk of genetic mutation and limit their therapeutic utility here we successfully generated ipscs from readily accessible human gingival fibroblast hgfs through an integrationfree and feederfree approach via delivery of reprogramming factor of oct sox klf lmyc lin and tp shrna with episomal plasmid vector the ipscs presented similar morphology and proliferation characteristic a embryonic stem cell escs and expressed pluripotent marker including oct tra nanog and ssea additionally these cell maintained a normal karyotype and showed decreased cpg methylation ratio in the promoter region of oct and nanog in vivo teratoma formation assay revealed the development of tissue representative of three germ layer confirming the acquisition of pluripotency furthermore treatment of the ipscs in vitro with enamel matrix derivative emd or growthdifferentiation factor gdf significantly upregulated the expression of periodontal tissue marker associated with bone periodontal ligament and cementum respectively taken together our data demonstrate that hgfs are a valuable cell source for generating integrationfree ipscs which could be sequentially induced toward periodontal cell under the treatment of emd and gdf
label: Non-Cancer

title: an unusual longterm outcome of a child with primary myelofibrosis harboring a jak mutation
abstract: we report an extremely rare case of a female child who presented the onset of primary myelofibrosis pmf harboring jak janus kinase gene mutation jakvf when she wa month old she wa monitored over year a period in which she wa treated with spleen radiotherapy and recombinant interferon alpha she also underwent splenectomy when she wa year old due to massive splenomegaly anemia and various infection disease episode the longstanding evolution of the patient enabled u to verify that there were no complication related to postsplenectomy event andor blast transformation to the best of our knowledge this is the first reported case of severe pmf with jak mutation in a child we provide evidence that a better quality of life and long survival in pediatric pmf may be provided by splenectomy
label: Non-Cancer

title: the common gammachain cytokine receptor tricksandtreats for t cell
abstract: originally identified a the third subunit of the highaffinity il receptor complex the common gammachain gammac also act a a nonredundant receptor subunit for a series of other cytokine collectively known a gammac family cytokine gammac play essential role in t cell development and differentiation so that understanding the molecular basis of it signaling and regulation is a critical issue in t cell immunology unlike most other cytokine receptor gammac is thought to be constitutively expressed and limited in it function to the assembly of highaffinity cytokine receptor surprisingly recent study reported a series of finding that unseat gammac a a simple housekeeping gene and unveiled gammac a a new regulatory molecule in t cell activation and differentiation cytokineindependent binding of gammac to other cytokine receptor subunit suggested a preassociation model of gammac with proprietary cytokine receptor also identification of a gammac splice isoform revealed expression of soluble gammac protein sgammac sgammac directly interacted with surface ilrbeta to suppress il signaling and to promote proinflammatory th cell differentiation a a result endogenously produced sgammac exacerbated autoimmune inflammatory disease while the removal of endogenous sgammac significantly ameliorated disease outcome these data provide new insight into the role of both membrane and soluble gammac in cytokine signaling and open new venue to interfere and modulate gammac signaling during immune activation these unexpected discovery further underscore the perspective that gammac biology remains largely uncharted territory that invite further exploration
label: Non-Cancer

title: evaluation of romiplostim for the treatment of secondary failure of platelet recovery among allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplant patient
abstract: secondary failure of platelet recovery sfpr is a serious complication observed in approximately of allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplant hsct recipient although the standard therapeutic approach ha been frequent platelet transfusion romiplostim a thrombopoietin receptor agonist may have utility in treating sfpr the primary objective of this singlecenter retrospective analysis wa to assess effectiveness of romiplostim for sfpr and to evaluate patient factor which may influence clinical outcome the primary outcome measure of response wa defined a achievement of platelet count x l without transfusion for consecutive day during the study period patient underwent hsct and received romiplostim for sfpr seven patient responded to romiplostim requiring a median of three dos range to achieve independence from platelet transfusion disease relapse occurred in of all patient two responder and three nonresponders median survival posthsct wa day among responder and day among nonresponders p no serious adverse event were reported and rate of graftversushost disease did not increase following administration of romiplostim thrombopoietin receptor agonist including romiplostim offer a treatment option for persistent thrombocytopenia following hsct positive clinical response to romiplostim posthsct is associated with improved outcome
label: Non-Cancer

title: cerebellar enterogenous cyst with atypical appearance and pathological finding
abstract: background intracranial enterogenous cyst are rare and occur mainly in the posterior fossa these cyst are usually extraaxial midline anterior to the brainstem or at the cerebellopontine angle intracranial intraaxial enterogenous cyst are extremely rare we report a case of an intraaxial cerebellar enterogenous cyst in which diagnosis wa difficult because the lesion resembled an arachnoid cyst in appearance and showed atypical pathologic finding case description a yearold woman had a year history of progressive headache giddiness and unsteadiness of gait magnetic resonance imaging showed a cystic lesion with isointensity to cerebrospinal fluid in the left cerebellar hemisphere reaching into the fourth ventricle the patient underwent fenestration of the cyst and creation of a communication between the fourth ventricle and cyst because the tight attachment of the cyst wall to the cerebellum prevented total removal of the cyst although pathologic examination did not show finding typical of enterogenous cyst the diagnosis wa finally made based on the presence of basement membrane and immunohistochemical result conclusion the diagnosis of enterogenous cyst is based mainly on histologic finding because characteristic finding on neuroimaging have not been defined although total resection of enterogenous cyst is recommended in general partial resection while ensuring the cyst communicates adequately with the surrounding cerebrospinal fluid space with or without a shunt procedure may be useful if the cyst is adherent to surrounding neurovascular structure
label: Non-Cancer

title: correlation between mutation and mrna expression of apc and mutyh gene new insight into hereditary colorectal polyposis predisposition
abstract: background transcript dosage imbalance may influence the transcriptome to gain insight into the role of altered gene expression in hereditary colorectal polyposis predisposition in the present study we analyzed absolute and allelespecific expression ase of adenomatous polyposis coli apc and muty homolog mutyh gene method we analyzed dna and rna extracted from peripheral blood mononuclear cell pbmc of familial polyposis patient and healthy blood donor selected according similar gender and age patient were studied for germline alteration in both gene using dhplc mlpa and automated sequencing apc and mutyh mrna expression level were investigated by quantitative realtime pcr qrtpcr analysis using taqman assay and by ase assay using dhplcbased primer extension result twenty out of patient showed germline mutation in apc gene and six in mutyh gene twentynine patient did not show mutation in both gene result from qrtpcr indicated that gene expression of both apc and mutyh wa reduced in patient analyzed in particular a significant reduction in apc expression wa observed in patient without apc germline mutation v control group p while apc expression in the mutation carrier patient although lower compared to control individual did not show statistical significance on the other hand a significant reduced mutyh expression wa detected in patient with mutyh mutation v control group p altered ase of apc wa detected in four out of eight apc mutation carrier in particular one case showed a complete loss of one allele among apc mutation negative case out of showed a moderate ase ase of mutyh did not show any altered expression in the case analyzed spearmans rho test analysis showed a positive and significant correlation between apc and mutyh gene both in case and in control p and p conclusion apc and mutyh showed a reduced germline expression not always corresponding to gene mutation expression of apc is decreased in mutation negative case and this appears to be a promising indicator of fap predisposition while for mutyh gene mutation is associated to reduced mrna expression this study could improve the predictive genetic diagnosis of atrisk individual belonging to family with reduced mrna expression regardless of presence of mutation
label: Non-Cancer

significant reduction in apc expression wa observed in patient without apc germline mutation v control group p while apc expression in the mutation carrier patient although lower compared to control individual did not show statistical significance on the other hand a significant reduced mutyh expression wa detected in patient with mutyh mutation v control group p altered ase of apc wa detected in four out of eight apc mutation carrier in particular one case showed a complete loss of one allele among apc mutation negative case out of showed a moderate ase ase of mutyh did not show any altered expression in the case analyzed spearmans rho test analysis showed a positive and significant correlation between apc and mutyh gene both in case and in control p and p conclusion apc and mutyh showed a reduced germline expression not always corresponding to gene mutation expression of apc is decreased in mutation negative case and this appears to be a promising indicator of fap predisposition while for mutyh gene mutation is associated to reduced mrna expression this study could improve the predictive genetic diagnosis of atrisk individual belonging to family with reduced mrna expression regardless of presence of mutation

title: nevus anemicus associated with neurofibromatosis type in a neonate a case report
abstract: neurofibromatosis type nf is a multisystemic autosomal dominant disease affecting approximately individual in the diagnostic criterion developed by nih in allow unequivocal diagnosis in all case but the youngest child due to the variable phenotypic expression the diagnosis of nf in the youngest may be challenging particularly when the distinctive cutaneous lesion are missing we describe the case of a neonate who presented at birth solely with a nevus anemicus although this is not considered a diagnostic feature given the presence of a few cafe au lait lesion in the patient father the genetic test wa performed and the diagnosis of nf confirmed to our knowledge the association between nevus anemicus and nf is only anedoctal the peculiarity clinical manifestation of this case highlight the high variable expressivity of the nf gene mutation and reinforces the importance of genetic counseling in affected individual
label: Non-Cancer

title: altered cerebellum development and impaired motor coordination in mouse lacking the btg gene involvement of cyclin d
abstract: cerebellar granule neuron develop postnatally from cerebellar granule precursor gcps which are located in the external granule layer egl where they massively proliferate thereafter gcps become postmitotic migrate inward to form the internal granule layer igl further differentiate and form synapsis with purkinje cell dendrite we previously showed that the btg family gene tisbtg is required for normal gcp migration here we investigated the role in cerebellar development of the related gene btg which regulates stem cell quiescence in adult neurogenic niche and is expressed in the cerebellum knockout of btg in mouse caused a major increase of the proliferation of the gcps in the egl whose thickness increased remaining hyperplastic even after postnatal day when the egl is normally reduced to a few gcp layer this wa accompanied by a slight decrease of differentiation and migration of the gcps and increase of apoptosis the gcps of double btgtisnull mouse presented combined major defect of proliferation and migration outside the egl indicating that each gene play unique and crucial role in cerebellar development remarkably these developmental defect lead to a permanent increase of the adult cerebellar volume in btgnull and double mutant mouse and to impairment in all mutant including tisnull of the cerebellumdependent motor coordination gain and lossoffunction strategy in a gcp cell line revealed that btg regulates the proliferation of gcps selectively through cyclin d thus btg play a critical role for cerebellar maturation and function
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: altered cerebellum development and impaired motor coordination in mouse lacking the btg gene involvement of cyclin d cerebellar granule neuron develop postnatally from cerebellar granule precursor gcps which are located in the external granule layer egl where they massively proliferate thereafter gcps become postmitotic migrate inward to form the internal granule layer igl further differentiate and form synapsis with purkinje cell dendrite we previously showed that the btg family gene tisbtg is required for normal gcp migration here we investigated the role in cerebellar development of the related gene btg which regulates stem cell quiescence in adult neurogenic niche and is expressed in the cerebellum knockout of btg in mouse caused a major increase of the proliferation of the gcps in the egl whose thickness increased remaining hyperplastic even after postnatal day when the egl is normally reduced to a few gcp layer this wa accompanied by a slight decrease of differentiation and migration of the gcps and increase of apoptosis the gcps of double btgtisnull mouse presented combined major defect of proliferation and migration outside the egl indicating that each gene play unique and crucial role in cerebellar development remarkably these developmental defect lead to a permanent increase of the adult cerebellar volume in btgnull and double mutant mouse and to impairment in all mutant including tisnull of the cerebellumdependent motor coordination gain and lossoffunction strategy in a gcp cell line revealed that btg regulates the proliferation of gcps selectively through cyclin d thus btg play a critical role for cerebellar maturation and function

title: neurofibromatosis associated panhypopituitarism presenting a hypoglycaemic seizure and strokelike symptom
abstract: a yearold man with a known history of neurofibromatosis nf presented within day of diarrhoeal illness followed by encephalopathy facial twitching hypoglycaemia hypotension tachycardia and lowgrade fever examination showed multiple cafeaulait spot and neurofibroma over the trunk arm and leg and receptive aphasia with right homonymous hemianopia which resolved workup for cardiac inflammatory and infectious aetiology wa unrevealing a brain mri showed gyral swelling with increased t fluidattenuated inversion recovery signal and diffusion restriction in the left cerebral cortex neuroendocrine finding suggested panhypopituitarism with centrally derived adrenal insufficiency supportive treatment hormone supplementation antibiotic antiviral and levetiracetam yielded clinical improvement a followup brain mri showed focal left parietooccipital atrophy with finding of cortical laminar necrosis in conclusion we describe a case of nfassociated panhypopituitarism presenting a hypoglycaemic seizure and strokelike finding hitherto unreported manifestation of nf prompt recognition and treatment of these associated condition can prevent devastating complication
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: neurofibromatosis associated panhypopituitarism presenting a hypoglycaemic seizure and strokelike symptom a yearold man with a known history of neurofibromatosis nf presented within day of diarrhoeal illness followed by encephalopathy facial twitching hypoglycaemia hypotension tachycardia and lowgrade fever examination showed multiple cafeaulait spot and neurofibroma over the trunk arm and leg and receptive aphasia with right homonymous hemianopia which resolved workup for cardiac inflammatory and infectious aetiology wa unrevealing a brain mri showed gyral swelling with increased t fluidattenuated inversion recovery signal and diffusion restriction in the left cerebral cortex neuroendocrine finding suggested panhypopituitarism with centrally derived adrenal insufficiency supportive treatment hormone supplementation antibiotic antiviral and levetiracetam yielded clinical improvement a followup brain mri showed focal left parietooccipital atrophy with finding of cortical laminar necrosis in conclusion we describe a case of nfassociated panhypopituitarism presenting a hypoglycaemic seizure and strokelike finding hitherto unreported manifestation of nf prompt recognition and treatment of these associated condition can prevent devastating complication

title: remission and platelet response with romiplostim in primary immune thrombocytopenia final result from a phase study
abstract: in anecdotal report some patient with immune thrombocytopenia itp maintained platelet count after discontinuing romiplostim here we examined rate of platelet response x l remission splenectomy and adverse event in patient with primary itp duration x l at the end of month entered a dose taper in which the romiplostim dose wa decreased a long a platelet count were maintained remission platelet count x l for consecutive week with no itp treatment wa evaluated in patient once romiplostim wa discontinued over the month a high response rate wa observed platelet response occurred quickly median week and wa observed for a cumulative median of month remission wa observed in patient there were no significantly predictor of remission most patient had remission start before the forced taper no new safety signal were identified thus in patient with earlystage itp romiplostim wa well tolerated and induced rapid response with remission occurring in approximately onethird of patient nct amgen
label: Non-Cancer

title: microdeletion delq excluding the mn gene in a patient with craniofacial anomaly
abstract: several study have recently reported that q deletion encompassing the mn gene are associated with craniofacial anomaly these observation are consistent with the hypothesis that mn haploinsufficiency may be solely responsible for craniofacial anomaly andor cleft palate we report here the case of a yearold boy presenting with global developmental delay and craniofacial anomaly including severe maxillary protrusion and retromicrognathia arraycgh detected a mb de novo deletion of chromosome q which did not encompass the mn gene thought to be the main pathological candidate in q deletion this observation combined with data from other patient from the database of chromosomal imbalance and phenotype in human using ensemble resource decipher suggests that other gene in the q region are likely involved in craniofacial anomaly andor may contribute to the phenotypic variability observed in patient with mn deletion
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: microdeletion delq excluding the mn gene in a patient with craniofacial anomaly several study have recently reported that q deletion encompassing the mn gene are associated with craniofacial anomaly these observation are consistent with the hypothesis that mn haploinsufficiency may be solely responsible for craniofacial anomaly andor cleft palate we report here the case of a yearold boy presenting with global developmental delay and craniofacial anomaly including severe maxillary protrusion and retromicrognathia arraycgh detected a mb de novo deletion of chromosome q which did not encompass the mn gene thought to be the main pathological candidate in q deletion this observation combined with data from other patient from the database of chromosomal imbalance and phenotype in human using ensemble resource decipher suggests that other gene in the q region are likely involved in craniofacial anomaly andor may contribute to the phenotypic variability observed in patient with mn deletion

title: update on mastocytosis part pathophysiology clinical feature and diagnosis
abstract: mastocytosis is a term used to describe a heterogeneous group of disorder characterized by clonal proliferation of mast cell in various organ the organ most often affected is the skin mastocytosis is a relatively rare disorder that affect both sex equally it can occur at any age although it tends to appear in the first decade of life or later between the second and fifth decade our understanding of the pathophysiology of mastocytosis ha improved greatly in recent year with the discovery that somatic ckit mutation and aberrant immunophenotypic feature have an important role the clinical manifestation of mastocytosis are diverse and skin lesion are the key to diagnosis in most patient

title: effect of zoledronic acid on bone fusion in osteoporotic patient after lumbar fusion
abstract: unlabelled treatment with zoledronic acid in osteoporotic patient with spinal fusion shortens the duration of time to fusion improves the fusion rate prevents the subsequent adjacent vertebral compression fracture improves the clinical outcome and prevents immobilizationinduced bone loss in the hip introduction the objective of the study wa to explore the effect of zoledronic acid on the healing process in osteoporotic patient following spinal fusion in a randomized placebocontrolled and tripleblinded study method seventynine osteoporotic patient with singlelevel degenerative spondylolisthesis were randomly assigned to receive either zoledronic acid infusion zoledronic acid group or saline infusion control after spinal fusion functional radiography and ct scan were used to evaluate fusion status bone formation wa graded into three category grade a bridging bone bonding with adjacent vertebral body grade b bridging bone bonding with either superior or inferior vertebral body or grade c incomplete bony bridging a solid fusion wa defined a less than of angular motion with grade a or b bone formation adjacent vertebral compression fracture vcf were assessed on mri at month after surgery serum level of carboxy terminal crosslinked telopeptide of type i collagen betactx and aminoterminal propeptide of type i procollagen pinp wa measured bone mineral density bmd wa measured by dxa oswestry disability index odi wa used to assess the clinical outcome result grade a or b bridging bone wa more frequently observed in zoledronic acid group at and month postoperation compared to the control group p at month postoperation bridging bone and solid fusion were not significantly different between group no patient in zoledronic acid group showed avcf whereas six patient in the control group did p both betactx and pinp were suppressed in zoledronic acid group bmd at the femoral neck decreased rapidly and did not return to the preoperative level in the control at and month after surgery zoledronic acid prevented this immobilizationinduced bone loss and increased bmd odi showed the improved clinical outcome compared with control at and month postsurgery conclusion treatment with zoledronic acid in osteoporotic patient with spinal fusion shortens the time to fusion improves the fusion rate prevents subsequent avcfs and improves clinical outcome

title: mesenchymal stem cell engineered to express selectin ligand and il exert enhanced therapeutic efficacy in murine experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis
abstract: systemic administration of mesenchymal stem cell msc affords the potential to ameliorate the symptom of multiple sclerosis m in both preclinical and clinical study however the efficacy of mscbased therapy for m likely depends on the number of cell that home to inflamed tissue and on the controlled production of paracrine and immunomodulatory factor previously we reported that engineered msc expressing pselectin glycoprotein ligand psgl and sialyllewisx slex via mrna transfection facilitated the targeted delivery of antiinflammatory cytokine interleukin il to inflamed ear here we evaluated whether targeted delivery of msc with triple psglslexil engineering improves therapeutic outcome in mouse experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis eae a murine model for human m we found psglslex mrna transfection significantly enhanced msc homing to the inflamed spinal cord this is consistent with result from in vitro flow chamber assay in which psglslex mrna transfection significantly increased the percentage of rolling and adherent cell on activated brain microvascular endothelial cell which mimic the inflamed endothelium of blood brainspinal cord barrier in eae in addition iltransfected msc show significant inhibitory activity on the proliferation of cd t lymphocyte from eae mouse in vivo treatment with msc engineered with psglslexil in eae mouse exhibited a superior therapeutic function over native unmodified msc evidenced by significantly improved myelination and decreased lymphocyte infiltration into the white matter of the spinal cord our strategy of targeted delivery of performanceenhanced msc could potentially be utilized to increase the effectiveness of mscbased therapy for m and other central nervous system cns disorder
label: Non-Cancer

title: the human decapping scavenger enzyme dcps modulates microrna turnover
abstract: the decapping scavenger enzyme dcps is known for it role in hydrolyzing the cap structure following mrna degradation recently we discovered a new function in mirna degradation activation for the ortholog of dcps in c elegans here we show that human dcps conserve it role in mirna turnover in human cell dcps is a nucleocytoplasmic shuttling protein that activates mirna degradation independently of it scavenger decapping activity in the cytoplasmic compartment we also demonstrate that this new function for dcps requires the contribution of the exonuclease xrn our finding support a conserved role of dcps a a modulator of mirna turnover in animal
label: Non-Cancer

title: diverse cutaneous presentation of langerhans cell histiocytosis in child a retrospective cohort study
abstract: background langerhans cell histiocytosis lch is a rare disease frequently affecting young child procedure we performed a retrospective study in patient younger than year old manifesting with skin symptom and documented their different cutaneous lesion and systemic symptom we compared subgroup of child with singlesystem skinonly and multisystem disease and sought sign predictive for multisystem disease in a small sample of patient braf mutation were analyzed in archived biopsy result a wide spectrum of cutaneous presentation varying from crusted nodule and papule blister vascular tumorlike lesion scaling orange to red macule frequently in seborrheic region to purpuric macule and papule wa documented in our cohort of child otitis externa wa a common manifestation and mucosal lesion were seen in three patient a novel manifestation wa a redblue nodule that appeared in a patient after a vaccination none of the cutaneous lesion wa predictive for the classification or final outcome a a singlesystem or multisystem disease however later onset and a more protracted course of skin lesion were more frequent finding in multisystem lch mucosal lesion and otitis externa were almost exclusively seen in patient with multisystem disease a finding that warrant further investigation both wildtype wt and mutated braf were found not only in multisystem lch but also in skinonly lch two case with rapidly resolving congenital lesion had wt braf conclusion late onset and a protracted course of skin lesion are associated with mslch whereas wt braf is found in rapidly resolving skin lesion

title: kit dvmutated bone marrow mesenchymal stem cell in indolent systemic mastocytosis are associated with disease progression
abstract: multilineage involvement of bone marrow bm hematopoiesis by the somatic kit dv mutation is present in a subset of adult indolent systemic mastocytosis ism patient in association with a poorer prognosis here we investigated the potential involvement of bm mesenchymal stem cell msc from ism patient by the kit dv mutation and it potential impact on disease progression and outcome this mutation wa investigated in highly purified bm msc and other bm cell population from ism patient followed for a median of month kit dvmutated msc were detected in of case all mscmutated patient had multilineage kit mutation v p and they more frequently showed involvement of lymphoid plus myeloid bm cell v p and a polyclonal pattern of inactivation of the xchromosome of kitmutated bm mast cell v p v other multilineage ism case moreover presence of kitmutated msc wa associated with more advanced disease feature a greater rate of disease progression v p and a shorter progressionfree survival p overall these result support the notion that ism patient with mutated msc may have acquired the kit mutation in a common pluripotent progenitor cell prior to differentiation into msc and hematopoietic precursor cell before the xchromosome inactivation process occurs from a clinical point of view acquisition of the kit mutation in an earlier bm precursor cell confers a significantly greater risk for disease progression and a poorer outcome

title: direct intrahepatic portocaval shunt for treatment of portal thrombosis and buddchiari syndrome
abstract: buddchiari syndrome bcs refers to hepatic venous outflow obstruction that in severe case can lead to acute liver failure prompting consideration of revascularization or transplantation here a year old female with angiographically proven bcs secondary to jakvf positive polycythemia vera on therapeutic warfarin presented with acute liver failure alf imaging revealed a new near complete thrombotic occlusion of the main portal vein with extension into the superior mesenteric vein an emergent direct intrahepatic portocaval shunt dip wa created and liver function promptly normalized she ha been maintained on rivaroxaban since that time serial assessment over year demonstrated continued shunt patency and improved flow in the mesenteric vasculature on ultrasound a well a normal liver function dip is a viable alternative in the treatment of alf from bcs when standard recanalization is not feasible improved blood flow may also improve portalmesenteric clot burden while further investigation is needed new targeted anticoagulant may be viable a a long term anticoagulation strategy
label: Non-Cancer

title: genotypephenotype correlation in tuberous sclerosis complex
abstract: tuberous sclerosis complex tsc is an autosomal dominant disorder characterized by the development of widespread hamartomatous lesion in various organ including brain skin kidney heart and eye central nervous system is almost invariably involved with up to of patient presenting with epilepsy and at least half of patient having intellectual disability or other neuropsychiatric disorder including autism spectrum disorder tsc is caused by the mutation in one of the gene tsc at q and tsc at p they respectively encode for hamartin and tuberin which form an intracellular complex inhibiting the mammalian target of rapamycin mammalian target of rapamycin overactivation following the genetic defect determines the cell growth and proliferation responsible for tscrelated lesion a well a the alteration in neuronal excitability and synaptogenesis leading to epilepsy and neuropsychiatric disorder a causative mutation for the disorder is identified in about of patient with a clinical diagnosis of tsc mosaicism and technology limit likely explain most of the no mutation identified case this review confirms that patient with tsc mutation considered a a group usually present a more severe phenotype characterized by higher number of tuber earlier age at seizure onset and higher prevalence of intellectual disability however the clinical phenotype of the disease present a high variability thus making the prediction of the phenotype on an individual basis still challenging the increasing application of new molecular technique to subject with tsc ha the potential to significantly reduce the rate of patient with no mutation demonstrated and to identify an increasing higher number of mutation this would hopefully allow a better characterization of higher risk mutation which might help clinician to plan individualized surveillance plan furthermore the increasing availability of disease registry to collect clinical and genetics data of patient help to define more valid and clinically oriented genotype or phenotype correlation

title: spleen enlargement is a risk factor for thrombosis in essential thrombocythemia evaluation on patient
abstract: spleen enlargement present in of essential thrombocythemia et patient at diagnosis is a feature clinically easy to assess confirmable by echography with a very low chance of misinterpretation nonetheless the clinical and prognostic role of splenomegaly ha been seldom evaluated from to et patient retrospectively collected in the database of the lazio cooperative group and bologna university hospital were evaluable for spleen enlargement at diagnosis and included in the analysis on the whole spleen wa enlarged in patient in most case splenomegaly wa mild cm patient with splenomegaly were younger predominantly male presented higher platelet count and jakvf allele burden and had a lower incidence of concomitant cardiovascular risk factor at least one thrombotic event during followup occurred in patient without spleen enlargement compared to patient with spleen enlargement p despite comparable use of cytoreductiveantiplatelet therapy in the two group the cumulative risk of thrombosis at year wa significantly higher in patient with baseline splenomegaly versus in patient without splenomegaly p in multivariate analysis exploring risk factor for thrombosis splenomegaly retained it negative prognostic role together with previous thrombosis leucocyte count and male gender baseline splenomegaly seems to be an independent additional risk factor for thrombosis in nonstrictly whodefined et patient this data could be useful in the reallife clinical management of these patient

title: hepatitis b virus x protein binding to hepsin promotes c production by inducing il secretion from hepatocytes
abstract: hepatitis b virus hbv x protein hbx is an important effector for hbvassociated pathogenesis in this study we identified hepsin a an hbxinteracting protein and investigated the effect of hepsin on hbxmediated complement component c secretion in hepatocytes in vivo and in vitro binding between hbx and hepsin wa confirmed by coimmunoprecipitation and glutathione stransferase pulldown assay hbx synergized with hepsin to promote c production by potentiating interleukin il secretion knockdown of endogenous hepsin attenuated c and il secretion induced by hbx in hepatic cell in addition level of hepsin protein correlated positively with c expression in human nontumor liver tissue further exploration revealed that hbx and hepsin increased c promoter activity by upregulating the expression and phosphorylation of the transcription factor caatenhancer binding protein beta cebpbeta which bind to the ilil response element in the c promoter hbx and hepsin synergistically enhanced il mrna level and promoter activity by increasing the nuclear translocation of nuclear factor kappab nfkappab our finding show for the first time that binding between hbx and hepsin promotes c production by inducing il secretion in hepatocytes
label: Non-Cancer

title: the spectrum of nephrocutaneous disease and association genetic cause of nephrocutaneous disease
abstract: there are a significant number of disease and treatment consideration of considerable importance relating to the skin and renal system this emphasizes the need for dermatologist in practice or in clinical training to be aware of these association part i of this part continuing medical education article review the genetic syndrome with both renal and cutaneous involvement that are most important for the dermatologist to be able to identify manage and appropriately refer to nephrology colleague part ii review the inflammatory syndrome with relevant renal manifestation and therapeutic agent commonly used by dermatologist that have druginduced effect on or require close consideration of renal function in addition we will likewise review therapeutic agent commonly used by nephrologists that have druginduced effect on the skin that dermatologist are likely to encounter in clinical practice in both part of this continuing medical education article we discus diagnosis management and appropriate referral to our nephrology colleague in the context of each nephrocutaneous association there are a significant number of dermatosis associated with renal abnormality and disease emphasizing the need for dermatologist to be keenly aware of their presence in order to avoid overlooking important skin condition with potentially devastating renal complication this review discusses important nephrocutaneous disease association with recommendation for the appropriate urgency of referral to nephrology colleague for diagnosis surveillance and early management of potential renal sequela

title: natural history of renal angiomyolipoma aml most patient with large amls cm can be offered active surveillance a an initial management strategy
abstract: background the natural history of renal angiomyolipoma aml is unknown treatment recommendation are based on smaller case series with selection bias towards symptomatic patient objective to define the natural history of renal aml including growth rate size and clinical presentation design setting and participant we used a unique radiology datamining system montage montage healthcare system philadelphia pa usa to retrospectively review the radiology database in an academic health centre between and to identify all renal amls of patient identified with amls had three or more imaging study suitable for analysis intervention angioembolisation surgery radiofrequency ablation and mammalian target of rapamycin inhibitor outcome measurement and statistical analysis the primary end point wa the growth rate of untreated amls we used a linear mixedeffects model to determine change in growth rate over time we evaluated the association among growth rate size and patient factor a well a intervention result and limitation the majority of untreated amls had not grown at a median followup of mo with no difference in growth rate between amls cm most amls occurred in female participant and were asymptomatic tuberous sclerosis complex tsc wa confirmed in n and presented at an earlier age median size wa cm but wa significantly larger for tsc cm pcm do not require early intervention based on size alone the vast majority are sporadic asymptomatic and initially harmless with a negligible growth rate our finding support a policy of initial active surveillance for all asymptomatic amls patient summary we evaluated the natural history and growth rate of renal amls we found no difference in growth rate between amls and cm initial a appears to be a safe management option

title: a novel folliclestimulating hormone receptor mutation causing primary ovarian failure a fertility application of whole exome sequencing
abstract: study question can whole exome sequencing wes and in vitro validation study be used to find the causative genetic etiology in a patient with primary ovarian failure and infertility summary answer a novel folliclestimulating hormone receptor fshr mutation wa found by wes and shown via in vitro flow cytometry study to affect membrane trafficking what is known already wes may diagnose up to of patient with suspected disorder of sex development dsd fshr mutation are an extremely rare cause of xx gonadal dysgenesis with primary amenorrhea due to hypergonadotropic ovarian failure study design size duration a wes study wa followed by flow cytometry study of mutant protein function participantsmaterials setting method the study subject were two turkish sister with hypergonadotropic primary amenorrhea their parent and two unaffected sister the affected sibling and both parent were sequenced triowes transient transfection of hek t cell wa performed with a vector containing wildtype fshr a well a the novel fshr variant that wa discovered by wes cellular localization of fshr protein a well a fshstimulated cyclic amp camp production wa evaluated using flow cytometry main result and the role of chance both affected sister were homozygous for a previously unreported missense mutation cgt pasptyr in the second transmembrane domain of fshr modeling predicted disrupted secondary structure flow cytometry demonstrated an average of reduction in cellsurface signal detection p the mean fluorescent signal for camp second messenger of fshr stimulated by fsh wa reduced by in the mutanttransfected cell p limitation reason for caution this is an in vitro validation all novel purported genetic variant can be clinically reported only a variant of uncertain significance until more patient with a similar phenotype are discovered with the same variant wider implication of the finding we report the first wesdiscovered fshr mutation validated by quantitative flow cytometry wes is a valuable tool for diagnosis of rare genetic disease and flow cytometry allows for quantitative characterization of purported variant wesassisted diagnosis allows for treatment aimed at the underlying molecular etiology of disease future study should focus on pharmacological and assisted reproductive treatment aimed at the disrupted fshr so that patient with fsh resistance can be treated by personalized medicine study fundingcompeting interest ev is partially funded by the dsd translational research network nichd rhd msb is funded by the neuroendocrinology sex difference and reproduction training grant nichd thd the author have no competing interest to disclose

of reduction in cellsurface signal detection p the mean fluorescent signal for camp second messenger of fshr stimulated by fsh wa reduced by in the mutanttransfected cell p limitation reason for caution this is an in vitro validation all novel purported genetic variant can be clinically reported only a variant of uncertain significance until more patient with a similar phenotype are discovered with the same variant wider implication of the finding we report the first wesdiscovered fshr mutation validated by quantitative flow cytometry wes is a valuable tool for diagnosis of rare genetic disease and flow cytometry allows for quantitative characterization of purported variant wesassisted diagnosis allows for treatment aimed at the underlying molecular etiology of disease future study should focus on pharmacological and assisted reproductive treatment aimed at the disrupted fshr so that patient with fsh resistance can be treated by personalized medicine study fundingcompeting interest ev is partially funded by the dsd translational research network nichd rhd msb is funded by the neuroendocrinology sex difference and reproduction training grant nichd thd the author have no competing interest to disclose

title: mechanical and histological effect of resorbable blasting medium surface treatment on the initial stability of orthodontic miniimplants
abstract: introduction this study aimed to evaluate the effect of resorbable blasting medium rbm treatment on early stability of orthodontic miniimplants by mechanical histomorphometric and histological analysis method ninetysix for mechanical study and for histological study and histomorphometric analysis titanium orthodontic miniimplants omis with machined machined group or rbmtreated cap surface rbm group were implanted in the tibia of rabbit maximum initial torque mit wa measured during insertion and maximum removal torque mrt and removal angular momentum ram were measured at and week after implantation bonetoimplant contact bic and bone area ba were analyzed at week after implantation result rbm group exhibited significantly lower mit and significantly higher mrt and ram at week than machined group no significant difference in mrt ram and bic between the two group wa noted at week although ba wa significantly higher in rbm group than in machined group rbm group showed little bone resorption whereas machined group showed new bone formation after bone resorption conclusion rbm surface treatment can provide early stability of omis around week after insertion whereas stability of machined surface omis may decrease in early stage because of bone resorption although it can subsequently recover by new bone apposition
label: Non-Cancer

title: metformin facilitates amyloidbeta generation by beta and gammasecretases via autophagy activation
abstract: the evidence of strong pathological association between type diabetes and alzheimers disease ad ha increased in recent year contrary to suggestion that antidiabetes drug may have potential for treating ad we demonstrate here that the insulin sensitizing antidiabetes drug metformin glucophage increased the generation of amyloidbeta abeta one of the major pathological hallmark of ad by promoting beta and gammasecretasemediated cleavage of amyloidbeta protein precursor abetapp in shsyy cell in addition we show that metformin caused autophagosome accumulation in tg ad model mouse extremely high gammasecretase activity wa also detected in autophagic vacuole apparently a novel site of abeta peptide generation together these data suggest that metformininduced accumulation of autophagosomes resulted in increased gammasecretase activity and abeta generation additional experiment indicated that metformin increased phosphorylation of ampactivated protein kinase which activates autophagy by suppressing mammalian target of rapamycin mtor the suppression of mtor then induces the abnormal accumulation of autophagosomes we conclude that metformin an antidiabetes drug may exacerbate ad pathogenesis by promoting amyloidogenic abetapp processing in autophagosomes
label: Non-Cancer

title: extending the spectrum of radiological finding in patient with severe osteopetrosis and different genetic background
abstract: purpose to evaluate radiological finding in a cohort of patient with infantile malignant osteopetrosis in order to establish the correlation between radiological finding and different genetic background material and method clinical file genetic analysis result and radiological examination of child treated for osteopetrosis with bone marrow transplantation in a referral center in the last year were retrospectively evaluated the study received institutional review board irb approval result twentytwo patient were included in the study male four female age month year month and the median age wa month mean month there were patient with different mutation in the tcirg gene five with mutation in the snx gene four child harbored rank mutation and one patient had a clcn mutation we noted more severe radiological finding in patient with tcirg and rank mutation including fracture osteopetrorickets hydrocephalus and hepatomegaly varus deformity of the femoral neck wa seen exclusively in patient with a tcirg mutation conclusion the variable genetic spectrum of osteopetrosis is associated with a variable radiological presentation these correlation may be helpful for priority in genetic analysis
label: Non-Cancer

title: eightyear followup finding of surgical treatment for severe dystrophic change in the cervical spine associated with neurofibromatosis type i a case report
abstract: longterm followup finding for dystrophic change in the cervical spine caused by neurofibromatosis type have been rarely reported a yearold boy with severe dural ectasia in the cervical spine underwent cervical posterior fusion from c to c for prevention of cervical spine fracture and spinal injury we followed him up for year after surgery we measured the progression of the destruction on yearly mri the dural ectasia gradually progressed until year postoperatively subsequently no further enlargement of the dural sac occurred at the year followup examination the patient had no limitation in the activity of daily life
label: Non-Cancer

title: the oculocerebrorenal syndrome of lowe an update
abstract: the oculocerebrorenal syndrome of lowe is a rare xlinked multisystemic disorder characterized by the triad of congenital cataract intellectual disability and proximal renal tubular dysfunction whereas the ocular manifestation and severe muscular hypotonia are the typical first diagnostic clue apparent at birth the manifestation of incomplete renal fanconi syndrome are often recognized only later in life other characteristic feature are progressive severe growth retardation and behavioral problem with tantrum many patient develop a debilitating arthropathy treatment is symptomatic and the life span rarely exceeds year the causative oculocerebrorenal syndrome of lowe gene ocrl encodes the inositol polyphosphate phosphatase ocrl ocrl variant have not only been found in classic lowe syndrome but also in patient with a predominantly renal phenotype classified a dent disease type dent recent data indicate that there is a phenotypic continuum between dent disease and lowe syndrome suggesting that there are individual difference in the ability to compensate for the loss of enzyme function extensive research ha demonstrated that ocrl is involved in multiple intracellular process involving endocytic trafficking and actin skeleton dynamic this explains the multiorgan manifestation of the disease still the mechanism underlying the wide phenotypic spectrum are poorly understood and we are far from a causative therapy in this review we provide an update on clinical and molecular genetic finding in lowe syndrome and the cellular and physiological function of ocrl
label: Non-Cancer

title: rspondin facilitates differentiation of proliferating chondrocytes into hypertrophic chondrocytes by enhancing wntbetacatenin signaling in endochondral ossification
abstract: endochondral ossification is a crucial process for longitudinal growth of bone differentiating chondrocytes in growth cartilage form four sequential zone of proliferation alignment into column hypertrophy and substitution of chondrocytes with osteoblast wntbetacatenin signaling is essential for differentiation of proliferating chondrocytes into hypertrophic chondrocytes in growth cartilage rspondin rspo a member of rspondin family is an agonist for wnt signaling but it role in chondrocyte differentiation remains unknown here we report that growth cartilage of rspoknockout mouse show a decreased amount of betacatenin and increased amount collagen type ii cii and sox in the abnormally extended proliferating zone in contrast expression of collagen type x cx in the hypertrophic zone remains unchanged differentiating chondrogenic atdc cell mimicking proliferating chondrocytes upregulate rspo and it putative receptor lgr in parallel addition of recombinant human rspo to differentiating atdc cell decrease expression of cola sox and acan a well a production of proteoglycans in contrast lentivirusmediated knockdown of rspo ha the opposite effect the effect of rspo on chondrogenic differentiation is mediated by wntbetacatenin signaling and not by wntpcp or wntca signaling we propose that rspo activates wntbetacatenin signaling to reduce cola and sox and to facilitate differentiation of proliferating chondrocytes into hypertrophic chondrocytes in growth cartilage
label: Non-Cancer

title: a pot mutation implicates defective telomere end fillin and telomere truncation in coat plus
abstract: coat plus cp can be caused by mutation in the ctc component of cst which promotes polymerase alpha polalphaprimasedependent fillin throughout the genome and at telomere the cellular pathology relating to cp ha not been established we identified a homozygous pot sl substitution potcp in two sibling with cp potcpinduced a proliferative arrest that could be bypassed by telomerase potcpwas expressed at normal level bound tpp and telomere and blocked atr signaling potcpwas defective in regulating telomerase leading to telomere elongation rather than the telomere shortening observed in other telomeropathies potcpwas also defective in the maintenance of the telomeric c strand causing extended overhang and stochastic telomere truncation that could be healed by telomerase consistent with shortening of the telomeric c strand metaphase chromosome showed loss of telomere synthesized by leading strand dna synthesis we propose that cp is caused by a defect in potcstdependent telomere fillin we further propose that deficiency in the fillin step generates truncated telomere that halt proliferation in cell lacking telomerase whereas in tissue expressing telomerase eg bone marrow the truncation are healed the proposed etiology can explain why cp present with feature distinct from those associated with telomerase defect eg dyskeratosis congenita
label: Non-Cancer

title: mastocytosis a comprehensive insight
abstract: mastocytosis refers to a heterogeneous group of clinical disorder characterized by an abnormal accumulation of mast cell mc in various tissue the skin is the organ most frequently involved but all organ may be affected the clinical sign and symptom are produced by the functional effect of mast cellderived mediator and the anatomical distribution of the mast cell the whoclassification defines category of mastocytosis skin disease with or without systemic involvement is by far the most common form of childhood mastocytosis measurement of serum tryptase is important in the diagnostic algorithm of pediatric mastocytosis in child with tryptase ngml the diagnosis of cutaneous mastocytosis cm may be decided upon without bone marrow examination bme unless other sign of sm are present if the baseline tryptase level exceeds ngml a bme should be considered regardless of age if the serum tryptase is ngml in child without other sign of sm the provisional diagnosis mastocytosis in the skin mi can be established and monitored until puberty if mi remains present after puberty a bme should be performed in adultonset mastocytosis a complete staging and application of the systemic mastocytosis criterion should always be performed treatment is mainly directed at alleviation of symptom a ckit mutation prove to be very important in the pathogenesis of mastocytosis targeted therapy using kit inhibitor may evolve a important future therapeutic option
label: Non-Cancer

title: recurrence after robotic myomectomy is it associated with use of gnrh agonist
abstract: gonadotropinreleasing hormone gnrh agonist therapy is used before myomectomy to decrease the size of the fibroid but it association with fibroid recurrence postoperatively remains unsettled we undertook a retrospective study of roboticassisted myomectomy rm patient at our academic medical center to determine symptomatic recurrence and reoperation rate in those who did versus did not receive preoperative gnrh therapy only patient who had their index myomectomy at least year prior to the chart review were included in this study of rm patient identified between january and december patient had symptomatic recurrence a early a month to a late a month postoperatively the symptomatic recurrence group had significantly higher preoperative gnrh use v nonrecurrence p a total of of all patient underwent reoperation gnrh agonist use wa significantly higher in the reoperation group v no reoperation p cavity entry during the initial surgery wa also more frequent in the reoperation group v p whereas the presence of multiple fibroid size of the largest leiomyoma and uterine volume were not statistically different between group our study is among the earliest to report rm reoperation rate in patient receiving preoperative gnrh therapy showing that the role of gnrh agonist therapy to shrink myoma may not be beneficial when measured against risk of disease recurrence
label: Non-Cancer
