title: molecular cytogenetic characterization of five f complex rearrangement utility for haemophilia a genetic counselling
abstract: background genomic inversion are usually balanced but unusual pattern have been described in haemophilia a ha patient for intron inv and intron inv inversion leading to the hypothesis of more complex rearrangement involving deletion or duplication aim to characterize five abnormal pattern either in southern blot and longrange pcr for inv or in pcr for inv material and method all patient were studied using cytogenetic microarray analysis cma result in all case cma analysis found that each inversion wa associated with complex xq rearrangement in three patient cma analysis showed large duplication ranging from to kb and encompassing a various number of contiguous gene among which rabb rabb duplication is a strong candidate gene for xlinked intellectual disability xlid surprisingly none of the severe ha patient with rabb duplication reported in this study or in the literature exhibited xlid we hypothesise that f complex rearrangement down regulated rabb expression in the two remaining patient cma analysis found xq large deletion from to kb moyamoya syndrome wa strongly suspected in one of them who carried brcc deletion conclusion because several f neighbouring gene are associated with other pathology such a xlid and cardiovascular disease all ha patient where complex xq rearrangement wa suspected should be referred to a geneticist for possible utility of a pangenomic study such investigation should be carefully considered in genetic counselling in female carrier to assess the risk of transmitting severe ha with a contiguous gene syndrome
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: molecular cytogenetic characterization of five f complex rearrangement utility for haemophilia a genetic counselling background genomic inversion are usually balanced but unusual pattern have been described in haemophilia a ha patient for intron inv and intron inv inversion leading to the hypothesis of more complex rearrangement involving deletion or duplication aim to characterize five abnormal pattern either in southern blot and longrange pcr for inv or in pcr for inv material and method all patient were studied using cytogenetic microarray analysis cma result in all case cma analysis found that each inversion wa associated with complex xq rearrangement in three patient cma analysis showed large duplication ranging from to kb and encompassing a various number of contiguous gene among which rabb rabb duplication is a strong candidate gene for xlinked intellectual disability xlid surprisingly none of the severe ha patient with rabb duplication reported in this study or in the literature exhibited xlid we hypothesise that f complex rearrangement down regulated rabb expression in the two remaining patient cma analysis found xq large deletion from to kb moyamoya syndrome wa strongly suspected in one of them who carried brcc deletion conclusion because several f neighbouring gene are associated with other pathology such a xlid and cardiovascular disease all ha patient where complex xq rearrangement wa suspected should be referred to a geneticist for possible utility of a pangenomic study such investigation should be carefully considered in genetic counselling in female carrier to assess the risk of transmitting severe ha with a contiguous gene syndrome

title: calcium signaling from normal b cell development to tolerance breakdown and autoimmunity
abstract: maintenance of selftolerance of autoreactive lymphocyte is a fundamental mechanism to prevent the onset of autoimmune disease deciphering the mechanism involved in the deregulation leading to tolerance disruption and autoimmunity is still a major area of interest to identify new therapeutic target and option ca signaling play a major role in b cell normal development and is therefore finely tuned by b cell receptor bcrdependent and independent pathway developmental change in the characteristic of bcrdependent ca signal a well a the modulation of basal intracellular concentration cai contribute strongly to selftolerance maintaining mechanism responsible for the physical or functional elimination of autoreactive b cell such a clonal deletion receptor editing and anergy implication of ca signal in b tolerance mechanism mainly occurs through the specific activation of transcriptional program depending on the amplitude shape and duration of ca signal a large number of study reported ca signaling defect in autoimmune pathology such a systemic lupus erythematosus sle rheumatoid arthritis ra and primary sjogrens syndrome ps however the precise nature of the molecular event responsible for these deregulation is not fully understood moreover the demonstration of a direct correlation between ca signaling defect and tolerance disruption is still lacking the recent identification of protein involved in b cell ca signal such a orai stromal interaction molecule and transient receptor potential is opening new horizon for understanding ca signaling defect observed in autoimmune disease and for proposing potentially new therapeutic solution this review aim to present an overview of the developmental evolution of bcr dependent ca signaling and to place this signaling pathway in the context of mechanism involved in tolerance maintenance and breakdown
label: Non-Cancer

title: fully automated plex fluorescent immunohistochemistry with tyramide signal amplification and same specie antibody
abstract: the ability to simultaneously visualize the presence abundance location and functional state of many target in cell and tissue ha been described a a true nextgeneration approach in immunohistochemistry ihc a typical requirement for multiplex ihc mihc is the use of different animal specie for each primary ab and secondary ab antibody pair although ab from different specie have been used with differently labeled speciesspecific ab quite often the appropriate combination of antibody is not available more recently sequential detection of multiple antigen using ab from the same specie used a microwaving treatment between successive antigen detection cycle to elute previously bound ab ab complex and therefore to prevent the crossreactivity of antispecies ab used in subsequent detection cycle we present here a fully automated ab ab complex heat deactivation hd method on ventanas benchmark ultra slide stainer this method is applied to detection using fluorophoreconjugated tyramide deposited on the tissue and take advantage of the strong covalent bonding of the detection substrate to the tissue preventing it elution in the hd process the hd process wa characterized for effectiveness in preventing ab crossreactivity impact on the epitope and impact on the fluorophores an automated plex fluorescent ihc assay wa further developed using the hd method and rabbit ab for cd cd cd cd and foxp immune biomarkers in human tissue specimen the fluorophores were carefully chosen and the narrowband filter were designed to allow visualization of the staining under fluorescent microscope with minimal bleed through the automated plex fluorescent ihc assay achieved staining result comparable to the respective singleplex chromogenic ihc assay this technology enables automated mihc using unmodified ab from same specie and the corresponding antispecies ab on a clinically established automated platform to ensure staining quality reliability and reproducibility
label: Non-Cancer

on a clinically established automated platform to ensure staining quality reliability and reproducibility

title: activating mapk erk mutation in an aggressive case of disseminated juvenile xanthogranuloma
abstract: juvenile xanthogranuloma jxg is a rare histiocytic disorder that is usually benign and selflimiting we present a case of atypical aggressive jxg harboring a novel mitogenactivated protein kinase mapk pathway mutation in the mapk gene which encodes mitogenactivated protein kinase or extracellular signalregulated erk our analysis revealed that the mutation result in constitutive erk activation that is resistant to braf or mek inhibitor but susceptible to an erk inhibitor these data highlight the importance of identifying specific mapk pathway alteration a part of the diagnostic workup for patient with histiocytic disorder rather than initiating empiric treatment with mek inhibitor
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: activating mapk erk mutation in an aggressive case of disseminated juvenile xanthogranuloma juvenile xanthogranuloma jxg is a rare histiocytic disorder that is usually benign and selflimiting we present a case of atypical aggressive jxg harboring a novel mitogenactivated protein kinase mapk pathway mutation in the mapk gene which encodes mitogenactivated protein kinase or extracellular signalregulated erk our analysis revealed that the mutation result in constitutive erk activation that is resistant to braf or mek inhibitor but susceptible to an erk inhibitor these data highlight the importance of identifying specific mapk pathway alteration a part of the diagnostic workup for patient with histiocytic disorder rather than initiating empiric treatment with mek inhibitor

title: the anaphase promoting complex impact repair choice by protecting ubiquitin signalling at dna damage site
abstract: doublestrand break dsbs are repaired through two major pathway homologydirected recombination hdr and nonhomologous end joining nhej while hdr can only occur in sg nhej can happen in all cell cycle phase except mitosis how then is the repair choice made in sg cell here we provide evidence demonstrating that apccdh play a critical role in choosing the repair pathway in sg cell our result suggest that the default for all dsbs is to recruit bp and rif brca is blocked from being recruited to broken end because it recruitment signal klinked polyubiquitin chain on histone is actively destroyed by the deubiquitinating enzyme usp we show that the removal of usp depends on apccdh and requires chk activation known to be catalysed by ssdnarpaatr signalling at the end designated for hdr linking the status of end processing to rif or brca recruitment
label: Non-Cancer

title: characterization of the phenotype associated with microduplication reciprocal to nf microdeletion syndrome
abstract: q microduplication syndrome is a recently described relatively rare condition associated with a nonspecific phenotype intellectual disability developmental delay and dysmorphisms are the only clinical feature common to a majority of case seventeen patient have been reported so far here we present another patient with q duplication and no sign of neurofibromatosis type identified by arraycgh we compared clinical feature and genetic data with those of previously reported patient with q microduplications we also analyzed the gene content of the duplicated region in order to investigate the possible role of specific gene in the clinical phenotype of our patient
label: Non-Cancer

title: multidimensional assessment of patient condition and mutational analysis in peripheral blood a tool to improve outcome prediction in myelodysplastic syndrome a prospective study of the spanish md group
abstract: the international prognostic scoring system and it revised form ipssr are the most widely used index for prognostic assessment of patient with myelodysplastic syndrome md but can only partially account for the observed variation in patient outcome this study aimed to evaluate the relative contribution of patient condition and mutational status in peripheral blood when added to the ipssr for estimating overall survival and the risk of leukemic transformation in patient with md a prospective cohort of consecutive patient with md were included in the study series and categorized according to the ipssr patient were further stratified according to patient condition assessed using the multidimensional lee index for older adult and genetic mutation peripheral blood sample screened using nextgeneration sequencing the change in likelihoodratio wa tested in cox model after adding individual covariates the addition of the lee index to the ipssr significantly improved prediction of overall survival hazard ratio hr confidence interval ci p and mutational analysis significantly improved prediction of leukemic evolution hr p nonleukemic death wa strongly linked to patient condition hr p but not to ipssr score p or mutational status p adjustment for exposure to diseasemodifying therapy evaluated a a timedependent covariate had no effect on the proposed model predictive ability in conclusion patient condition assessed by the multidimensional lee index and patient mutational status can improve the prediction of clinical outcome of patient with md already stratified by ipssr
label: Non-Cancer

title: beyond cervical lipoma myoclonus gait disorder and multisystem involvement leading to mitochondrial disease
abstract: madelungs disease benign symmetric lipomatosis is a rare syndrome in which there are multiple lipoma around the neck upper limb and trunk in the context of chronic alcoholism we report on a female patient with lipoma and slightly progressive myoclonus neuropathy myopathy ataxia and respiratory systemic involvement labelled in the past a madelungs disease multisystem involvement and family history of lipoma led to the development of mitochondrial genetic test which can assess two concurrent mitochondrial mutation the mag mutation in mttk gene related merrf myoclonic epilepsy with raggedred fibre phenotype and mtc mutation in the mtnd gene responsible for leber hereditary optic neuropathy phenotype
label: Non-Cancer

title: detection and visualization of dna damageinduced protein complex in suspension cell culture using the proximity ligation assay
abstract: the dna damage response orchestrates the repair of dna lesion that occur spontaneously are caused by genotoxic stress or appear in the context of programmed dna break in lymphocyte the ataxiatelangiectasia mutated kinase atm atm and radrelated kinase atr and the catalytic subunit of dnadependent protein kinase dnapkcs are among the first that are activated upon induction of dna damage and are central regulator of a network that control dna repair apoptosis and cell survival a part of a tumorsuppressive pathway atm and atr activate p through phosphorylation thereby regulating the transcriptional activity of p dna damage also result in the formation of socalled ionizing radiationinduced focus irif that represent complex of dna damage sensor and repair protein that accumulate at the site of dna damage which are visualized by fluorescence microscopy colocalization of protein in irifs however doe not necessarily imply direct proteinprotein interaction a the resolution of fluorescence microscopy is limited in situ proximity ligation assay pla is a novel technique that allows the direct visualization of proteinprotein interaction in cell and tissue with unprecedented specificity and sensitivity this technique is based on the spatial proximity of specific antibody binding to the protein of interest when the interrogated protein are within nm an amplification reaction is triggered by oligonucleotides that are conjugated to the antibody and the amplification product is visualized by fluorescent labeling yielding a signal that corresponds to the subcellular location of the interacting protein using the established functional interaction between atm and p a an example it is demonstrated here how pla can be used in suspension cell culture to study the direct interaction between protein that are integral part of the dna damage response
label: Non-Cancer

title: selenomethionine attenuates the amyloidbeta level by both inhibiting amyloidbeta production and modulating autophagy in neuronaabetappswe cell
abstract: alzheimers disease ad is a complex and progressive neurological disorder and amyloidbeta abeta ha been recognized a the major cause of ad inhibiting abeta production andor enhancing the clearance of abeta to reduce it level are still the effective therapeutic strategy pursued in antiad research in previous study we have reported that selenomethionine semet a major form of selenium in animal and human with significant antioxidant capacity can reduce both amyloidbeta abeta deposition and tau hyperphosphorylation in a triple transgenic mouse model of ad in this study a semet treatment significantly decreased the abeta level in neuronaabetappswe nasw cell and the antiamyloid effect of semet wa attributed to it ability to inhibit abeta generation by suppressing the activity of bace furthermore both the lciilci ratio and the number of lcpositive puncta were significantly decreased in semettreated cell suggesting that semet also promoted abeta clearance by modulating the autophagy pathway subsequently semet inhibited the initiation of autophagy through the aktmtorpsk signaling pathway and enhanced autophagic turnover by promoting autophagosomelysosome fusion and autophagic clearance our result further highlight the potential therapeutic effect of semet on ad
label: Non-Cancer

title: hematopoietic stem cell transplantation in patient hemizygous for hypomorphic ikbkgnemo mutation
abstract: xlinked recessive ectodermal dysplasia with immunodeficiency is a rare primary immunodeficiency caused by hypomorphic mutation of the ikbkg gene encoding the nuclear factor kappab essential modulator nemo protein this condition display enormous allelic immunological and clinical heterogeneity and therapeutic decision are difficult because nemo operates in both hematopoietic and nonhematopoietic cell hematopoietic stem cell transplantation hsct is potentially lifesaving but the small number of case report available suggests it ha been reserved for only the most severe case here we report the health status before hsct transplantation outcome and clinical followup for a series of patient from unrelated kindred from country between them these patient carry different hypomorphic ikbkg mutation hsct wa performed from hlaidentical related donor n hlamatched unrelated donor n hlamismatched unrelated donor n and hlahaploidentical related donor n engraftment wa documented in patient and graftversushost disease in patient up to patient died to month after hsct the global survival rate after hsct among nemodeficient child wa at a median followup after hsct of month range month preexisting mycobacterial infection and colitis were associated with poor hsct outcome the underlying mutation doe not appear to have any influence a patient with the same mutation had different outcome transplantation did not appear to cure colitis possibly a a result of cellintrinsic disorder of the epithelial barrier overall hsct can cure most clinical feature of patient with a variety of ikbkg mutation
label: Non-Cancer

title: type neurofibromatosis complicated by pulmonary arterial hypertension a case report
abstract: neurofibromatosis type i nf is a rare genetic disease caused by mutation in the nf gene which encodes the tumor suppressor neurofibromin precapillary pulmonary hypertension is a severe complication of nf initially described in patient with advanced parenchymal lung disease which may complicate the course of nf presently described is a case of neurofibromatosis complicated by pulmonary hypertension
label: Non-Cancer

title: telomere length and somatic mutation in correlation with response to immunosuppressive treatment in aplastic anaemia
abstract: we investigated the frequency of cytogenetic aberration and somatic mutation of prognostic relevance in patient with aplastic anaemia aa clonality wa determined by gbandingfluorescence in situ hybridization fish n and targeted capture sequencing wa performed for haematopoiesisrelated gene n the telomere length tl of bone marrow nucleated cell wa measured at the single cell level by fish n eighteen patient showed disease progression and monosomy wa the most predominant cytogenetic evolution at disease transformation one third of patient presented at least mutation the most frequently mutated gene were notch nf scrib bcor and dnmta the patient group with clonal change showed an adverse response to immunosuppressive treatment ist compared to the nonclonal group but this finding did not show statistical significance the tl of aa patient wa significantly shorter than normal control and patient with clonal change showed significantly shorter tl patient with tl showed a higher response rate to ist p in conclusion the patient with clonal change or tl attrition showed a poor response to ist shorter tl can be used not only a a biomarker but also a a predictive marker for treatment response to ist
label: Non-Cancer

title: progression of primary myelofibrosis to polycythemia vera a case report
abstract: rationale this case report describes the progression of primary myelofibrosis pmf to polycythemia vera pv and discus it potential mechanism patient concern the patient wa admitted because of abdominal discomfort and enlarged spleen for month diagnosis a case of pmf progressed to pv wa retrospectively analyzed there were month between the diagnosis of pmf and pv the jak vf mutation wa positive before and after the diagnosis of pv however new chromosomal abnormality were detected during the progression intervention for treatment of pmf the danazol calcitriol and thalidomide were given then the use of thalidomide and calcitriol wa stopped and hydroxyurea wa started for treatment of pv interferon treatment wa given whereas hydroxyurea wa continued outcome after month of the progression at the recent followup this patient had no obvious symptom or thrombosis lesson pmf rarely progress to pv however the progression will significantly improve the quality of life and prognosis
label: Non-Cancer

title: genetic variant in hsdb smad and ipo impact circulating lipid in response to fenofibrate in individual with type diabetes
abstract: individual with type diabetes td and dyslipidemia are at an increased risk of cardiovascular disease fibrates are a class of drug prescribed to treat dyslipidemia but variation in response ha been observed to evaluate common and rare genetic variant that impact lipid response to fenofibrate in statintreated patient with td we examined lipid change in response to fenofibrate therapy using a genomewide association study gwas association were followedup using gene expression study in mouse common variant in smad and ipo were marginally associated with lipid change in black subject p x rare variant and gene expression change were assessed using a false discovery rate approach akra and hsdb were associated with lipid change in white subject q mouse fed fenofibrate displayed reduction in hsdb gene expression q association of variant in smad ipo and hsdb with gene expression change in mouse indicate that transforming growth factorbeta tgfbeta and nrf signaling pathway may influence fenofibrate effect on dyslipidemia in patient with td
label: Non-Cancer

title: cutting edge ilinduced expression of the amino acid transporter slca and cd is a prerequisite for nkgdmediated activation of human nk cell
abstract: priming of human nk cell with il is necessary to render them functionally competent upon nkgd engagement we examined the underlying mechanism that control nkgd responsiveness in nk cell and found that il upregulates expression of the amino acid transporter slca and cd using specific inhibitor to block slca and cd function we found that production of ifngamma and degranulation by cdbright and cddim nk cell following nkgd stimulation were dependent on both transporter il priming increased the activity of mtorc and inhibition of mtorc abrogated the ability of the ilprimed nk cell to produce ifngamma in response to nkgdmediated stimulation this study identifies a series of ilinduced cellular change that regulates the nkgd responsiveness in human nk cell
label: Non-Cancer

title: newborn screening for carnitine palmitoyltransferase ii deficiency using ccc evaluation of additional index for adequate sensitivity and lower falsepositivity
abstract: background carnitine palmitoyltransferase cpt ii deficiency is one of the most common form of mitochondrial fatty acid oxidation disorder faod however newborn screening nb for this potentially fatal disease ha not been established partly because reliable index are not available method we diagnosed cpt ii deficiency in a monthold boy presenting with hypoglycemic encephalopathy which apparently had been missed in the nb using c and c concentration a index by referring to his acylcarnitine profile from the nb we adopted the ccc ratio cutoff and c concentration cutoff nmolml a alternative index for cpt ii deficiency such that an analysis of a dried blood specimen collected at postnatal day five retroactively yielded the correct diagnosis thereafter positive case were assessed by measuring the fatty acid oxidation ability of intact lymphocyte andor cpt ii activity in the lysates of lymphocyte the diagnosis were then further confirmed by genetic analysis result the disease wa diagnosed in seven of newborn suspected of having cpt ii deficiency based on nb we also analyzed the falsenegative patient and five symptomatic patient for comparison value for the nb index of the falsenegative symptomatic patient were lower than those of the seven affected newborn although it wa difficult to differentiate the falsenegative patient from heterozygous carrier and falsepositive subject the fatty acid oxidation ability of the lymphocyte and cpt ii activity clearly confirmed the diagnosis among several other index proposed previously cc completely differentiated the seven nbspositive patient and the falsenegative patient from the heterozygous carrier and the falsepositive subject genetic analysis revealed kind of variant allele the most prevalent detected in ten allele in nine patient from eight family wa cta pfy a finding in line with those of several previous report on japanese patient conclusion these finding suggested that cpt ii deficiency can be screened by using ccc and c a index an appropriate cutoff level is required to achieve adequate sensitivity albeit at the cost of a considerable increase in the falsepositive rate which might be reduced by using additional index such a cc
label: Non-Cancer

established partly because reliable index are not available method we diagnosed cpt ii deficiency in a monthold boy presenting with hypoglycemic encephalopathy which apparently had been missed in the nb using c and c concentration a index by referring to his acylcarnitine profile from the nb we adopted the ccc ratio cutoff and c concentration cutoff nmolml a alternative index for cpt ii deficiency such that an analysis of a dried blood specimen collected at postnatal day five retroactively yielded the correct diagnosis thereafter positive case were assessed by measuring the fatty acid oxidation ability of intact lymphocyte andor cpt ii activity in the lysates of lymphocyte the diagnosis were then further confirmed by genetic analysis result the disease wa diagnosed in seven of newborn suspected of having cpt ii deficiency based on nb we also analyzed the falsenegative patient and five symptomatic patient for comparison value for the nb index of the falsenegative symptomatic patient were lower than those of the seven affected newborn although it wa difficult to differentiate the falsenegative patient from heterozygous carrier and falsepositive subject the fatty acid oxidation ability of the lymphocyte and cpt ii activity clearly confirmed the diagnosis among several other index proposed previously cc completely differentiated the seven nbspositive patient and the falsenegative patient from the heterozygous carrier and the falsepositive subject genetic analysis revealed kind of variant allele the most prevalent detected in ten allele in nine patient from eight family wa cta pfy a finding in line with those of several previous report on japanese patient conclusion these finding suggested that cpt ii deficiency can be screened by using ccc and c a index an appropriate cutoff level is required to achieve adequate sensitivity albeit at the cost of a considerable increase in the falsepositive rate which might be reduced by using additional index such a cc

title: oct and sox work a transcriptional activator in reprogramming human fibroblast
abstract: sox and oct in conjunction with klf and cmyc are sufficient to reprogram human fibroblast to induced pluripotent stem cell ipscs but it is unclear if they function a transcriptional activator or a repressor we now show that like oct sox function a a transcriptional activator we substituted soxvp a strong activator for wildtype wt sox and we saw an increase in the efficiency and rate of reprogramming whereas the soxhp fusion a strong repressor eliminated reprogramming we report that at an early stage of reprogramming virtually all dnabound oct sox and soxvp were embedded in putative enhancer about half of which were created de novo those associated with soxvp were on average stronger than those bearing wt sox many newly created putative enhancer were transient and many transcription factor location on dna changed a reprogramming progressed these result are consistent with the idea that during reprogramming there is an intermediate state that is distinct from both parental cell and ipscs
label: Non-Cancer

title: thrombopoietinreceptor agonist for child with immune thrombocytopenia a systematic review
abstract: objective we conducted a systematic review to assess the efficacy and safety of thrombopoietinreceptor agonist tporas for pediatric immune thrombocytopenia itp method we searched pubmed embase and cochrane library from their earliest record to january randomized controlled trial rcts were included primary outcome were durable response and clinically significant bleeding secondary outcome were overall response overall bleeding event the use of rescue medication and adverse event aes result five randomized rcts participant were included compared with placebo group the proportion of patient achieving durable platelet response wa significantly higher in eltrombopag p or romiplostim p group so wa the overall response in eltrombopag rr ci or romiplostim rr ci group both clinically significant bleeding p and total bleeding p in eltrombopag group were significantly less frequent than those in placebo group while no significant difference between romiplostim and placebo group the proportion of patient receiving rescue medication the incidence of overall aes and serious aes between tporeceptor agonist and placebo group were not significantly different conclusion tporas might improve both durable and overall platelet response in pediatric itp compared with placebo
label: Non-Cancer

title: thrombocytopenia and cd expression is decoupled from alphagranule deficiency with mutation of the first growth factorindependent b zinc finger
abstract: essential the phenotype of different growth factorindependent b gfib variant are not established gfib variant produce heterogeneous clinical phenotype dependent on the site of mutation mutation of the first nondnabinding zincfinger cause a mild platelet and clinical phenotype gfib regulates the cd promoter platelet cd expression is an indicator of gfib mutation summary background mutation of the growth factorindependent b gfib fifth dnabinding zincfinger domain cause macrothrombocytopenia and alphagranule deficiency leading to clinical bleeding the phenotype associated with gfib variant disrupting nondnabinding zincfingers remain uncharacterized objective to determine the functional and phenotypic consequence of gfib variant disrupting nondnabinding zincfinger domain method the gfib cf variant and a novel gfib c delgtgggcac splice variant were identified in four unrelated family phenotypic feature dnabinding property and transcriptional effect were determined and compared with those in individual with a gfib h f mutation of the fifth dnabinding zincfinger patientspecific induced pluripotent stem cell ipscderived megakaryocyte were generated to facilitate disease modeling result the dnabinding gfib variant cf which is predicted to disrupt the first nondnabinding zincfinger domain is associated with macrothrombocytopenia without alphagranule deficiency or bleeding symptom a gfib splice variant c delgtgggcac which generates a short gfib isoform that lack nondnabinding zincfingers and is associated with increased platelet cd expression only without quantitative or morphologic platelet abnormality gfib represses the cd promoter and this repression is attenuated by different gfib zincfinger mutation suggesting that deregulation of cd expression occurs at a direct transcriptional level patientspecific ipscderived megakaryocyte phenocopy these observation conclusion disruption of gfib nondnabinding zincfinger is associated with mild to moderate thrombocytopenia without alphagranule deficiency or bleeding symptomatology indicating that the site of gfib mutation ha important phenotypic implication platelet cd expression appears to be a common feature of perturbed gfib function and may have diagnostic utility

title: prevalence and risk factor for fragility fracture in systemic mastocytosis
abstract: objective systemic mastocytosis sm is characterized by the accumulation of mast cell in tissue other than the skin bone involvement although frequent ha not been thoroughly evaluated primary objective wa to determine risk factor associated with fragility fracture ff in sm secondary objective were to evaluate the ability of bone marrow tryptase bmt level to identify patient with ff and to describe bone involvement in sm method we analyzed retrospectively all consecutive patient seen in our expert center with a diagnosis of sm according to the who criterion and with complete bone assessment we collected data about lifetime fracture type of cutaneous manifestation degranulation symptom blood and bmt level bone mineral density assessed by densitometry and kit mutation we performed a univariate analysis investigating the factor associated with ff and then a logistic multivariable regression analysis we assessed the ability of bone marrow tryptase to identify patient with ff result eightynine patient with sm were included thirtysix patient suffered from osteoporosis and twentyfive experienced lifetime ff univariate analysis identified age at diagnosis and disease onset presence of telangiectasia macularis eruptiva perstans digestive symptom mast cell activation symptom elevated bmt low femoral and lumbar bmd a associated with ff multivariate analysis identified elevated bmt low femoral t score and older age at diagnosis a independently associated with ff conclusion low femoral tscore bmt level and older age at diagnosis are marker associated with ff in sm bmt may represent an important biomarker to predict ff in sm patient
label: Non-Cancer

title: intrauterine hyperglycemiainduced inflammatory signalling via the receptor for advanced glycation end product in the cardiac muscle of the infant of diabetic mother rat
abstract: purpose gestational diabetes is associated with increased risk to the health of the mother and her offspring in particular the infant of diabetic mother idms exhibit elevated level of preterm birth macrosomia hypoglycemia hypocalcemia and cardiomyopathy we have previously reported that idms showed abnormality in cardiac aktrelated insulin signalling and that these deficiency in aktrelated signalling were attenuated by supplementing the maternal diet with fishoil herein we investigated whether the eicosapentaenoic acid epa found in fish oil can be used to attenuate diabetes associated impairment in cardiomyocyte signalling method pregnant diabetic rat were administered streptozotocin before receiving epa or water and their infant were designated idmepa idmw we assessed the potential molecular pathway for this effect in the primary cardiac cell from newborn rat heart result insulin resistance a determined by diminished glut translocation following insulin stimulation the level of advanced glycation end product age and reactive oxygen specie were elevated in the neonatal heart of idmw compared with that seen in the offspring born from nondiabetic control animal similarly the receptor of age rage mrna level reactive oxygen specie and the amount of nuclear factorkappab nfkappab tumor necrosis factoralpha tnfalpha and interleukin il mrna were higher in the heart from the idmw when compared to that observed in the heart of offspring born to nondiabetic animal these deleterious effect of gestational diabetes were significantly decreased in the offspring of diabetic mother receiving epa supplementation conclusion taken together our data suggest that the epa in fish oil may improve the impaired signalling and the excessive protein glycation in the cardiac muscle of infant exposed to intrauterine hyperglycemia
label: Non-Cancer

glycation end product age and reactive oxygen specie were elevated in the neonatal heart of idmw compared with that seen in the offspring born from nondiabetic control animal similarly the receptor of age rage mrna level reactive oxygen specie and the amount of nuclear factorkappab nfkappab tumor necrosis factoralpha tnfalpha and interleukin il mrna were higher in the heart from the idmw when compared to that observed in the heart of offspring born to nondiabetic animal these deleterious effect of gestational diabetes were significantly decreased in the offspring of diabetic mother receiving epa supplementation conclusion taken together our data suggest that the epa in fish oil may improve the impaired signalling and the excessive protein glycation in the cardiac muscle of infant exposed to intrauterine hyperglycemia

title: chimerism in pediatric hematopoietic stem cell transplantation and it correlation with the clinical outcome
abstract: hematopoietic stem cell transplantation hsct is the only hope to cure many inherited and acquired hematological disorder in child monitoring of chimerism help to predict the posttransplantation event with the intention to enhance the longterm disease free survival dfs the study aimed to investigate the importance of early chimerism detection to predict the clinical outcome following hsct the study included nine recipient six betathalassemia and three severe aplastic anemia patient and their hla identical sibling donor chimerism detection wa performed by analysis of short tandem repeat str polymerase chain reaction pcr for detection and quantification of the relative amount of donor and recipient cell present on day peripheral blood pb wa the main stem cell source for hsc transplantation disease free survival dfs wa while overall survival wa for pbsc transplant at the median follow up period of year the early detection of chimerism by pcrstr analysis for child with betathalassemia and aplastic anemia correlated with the outcome of hsct in patient complete chimerism wa associated with diseasefree survival while mixed chimerism and autologous pattern were associated with poor prognosis in conclusion early chimerism testing is clinically important in prediction of outcome after allogeneic hsc transplantation
label: Non-Cancer

title: dimerization of the adaptor gad facilitates antigen receptor signaling by promoting the cooperative binding of gad to the adaptor lat
abstract: the accurate assembly of signalosomes centered on the adaptor protein lat linker of activated t cell is required for antigen receptor signaling in t cell and mast cell during signalosome assembly member of the growth factor receptorbound protein grb family of cytosolic adaptor protein bind cooperatively to lat through interaction with it phosphorylated tyrosine ptyr residue we demonstrated the src homology sh domainmediated dimerization of the grb family member grbrelated adaptor downstream of shc gad gad dimerization wa mediated by an sh domain interface which is distinct from the ptyr binding pocket and which promoted cooperative preferential binding of paired gad to lat this sh domainintrinsic mechanism of cooperativity which we quantified by mathematical modeling enabled gad to discriminate between dually and singly phosphorylated lat molecule mutational inactivation of the dimerization interface reduced cooperativity and abrogated gad signaling in t cell and mast cell the dimerizationdependent cooperative binding of gad to lat may increase antigen receptor sensitivity by reducing signalosome formation at incompletely phosphorylated lat molecule thereby prioritizing the formation of complete signalosomes
label: Non-Cancer

title: utility and limitation of exome sequencing in the molecular diagnosis of pediatric inherited platelet disorder
abstract: inherited platelet disorder ipd are a heterogeneous group of rare disorder that affect platelet number and function and often predispose to other significant medical complication in spite of the identification of over ipd diseaseassociated gene a molecular diagnosis is only identified in a minority of affected patient without a clinically suspected etiology we studied a cohort of pediatric patient with suspected ipds by exome sequencing e to examine the performance of the exome test for ipd gene determine if this exomewide diagnostic test provided a higher diagnostic yield than ha been previously reported to evaluate the frequency of variant of uncertain significance identified and to identify candidate variant for functional evaluation in patient with an uncertain or negative diagnosis we established a high priority gene list of gene evaluated exome capture kit performance and determined the coverage for these gene and diseaserelated variant we identified likely disease causing variant in of the probands and variant of uncertain significance in of patient studied in conclusion e ha the potential to molecularly diagnose cause of ipd and to identify candidate gene for functional evaluation robust exome sequencing also requires that coverage of gene known to be associated with clinical finding of interest need to be carefully examined and supplemented if necessary clinician who undertake e should understand the limitation of the test and the full significance of result that may be returned
label: Non-Cancer

title: mutation in aifm cause an xlinked childhood cerebellar ataxia partially responsive to riboflavin
abstract: background aifm encodes a mitochondrial flavoprotein with a dual role nadh oxidoreductase and regulator of apoptosis which us riboflavin a a cofactor mutation in the xlinked aifm were reported in relation to two main phenotype a severe infantile mitochondrial encephalomyopathy and an earlyonset axonal sensorimotor neuropathy with hearing loss in this paper we report two unrelated male harboring aifm mutation one of which is novel who display distinct phenotype including progressive ataxia which partially improved with riboflavin treatment method for both patient trio whole exome sequencing wa performed validation and segregation were performed with sanger sequencing following the diagnosis patient were treated with up to mg riboflavinday for month ataxia wa assessed by the icars scale at baseline and and month following treatment result patient presented at the age of year with auditory neuropathy followed by progressive ataxia vermian atrophy and axonal neuropathy patient presented at the age of year with severe limb and palatal myoclonus followed by ataxia cerebellar atrophy ophthalmoplegia sensorineural hearing loss hyporeflexia and cardiomyopathy two deleterious missense mutation were found in the aifm gene p metthr mutation located in the fad dependent oxidoreductase domain and the novel p thrile mutation located in a highly conserved dna binding motif ataxia score decreased by in patient and in patient following month of treatment conclusion aifm mutation cause childhood cerebellar ataxia which may be partially treatable in some patient with high dose riboflavin
label: Non-Cancer

title: atypical haematological presentation in a case of polycythaemia vera with a new variant mutation detected in exon cgt pmetile
abstract: one of the major genetic insight into the pathogenesis of polycythaemia vera included the identification of the somatic point gainoffunction mutation in janus kinase genefirst jakvf on exon present in of the case and later on exon in the literature we can find some reported study where different exon mutation are identified unlike patient with jakvf mutation in exon the mutation at exon is not usually associated with an increase in the three haematopoietic series erythrocytosis leucocytosis and thrombocytosis it appears to be associated with a distinct syndrome mostly characterised by isolated and more marked erythrocytosis independently of the mutational variant we report here the case of a patient who is jakexon positive presenting a novel mutationcgt pmetileassociated with cct phistyr mutation previously described evidencing an atypical clinical phenotype
label: Non-Cancer

title: angiocrine wnt signaling control liver growth and metabolic maturation in mouse
abstract: postnatal liver development is characterized by hepatocyte growth proliferation and functional maturation notably canonical wnt signaling in hepatocytes ha been identified a an important regulator of final adult liver size and metabolic liver zonation the cellular origin of wnt ligand responsible for homeostatic liverbody weight ratio lwbw remained unclear which wa also attributable to a lack of suitable endothelial cre driver mouse to comprehensively analyze the effect of hepatic angiocrine wnt signaling on liver development and metabolic function we used endothelial subtypespecific stabcre driver mouse to delete wls from hepatic endothelial cell hecs the resultant stabcretgwt wlsflfl wlshecko mouse were viable but showed a significantly reduced lwbw specifically ablation of angiocrine wnt signaling impaired metabolic zonation in the liver a shown by loss of pericentral betacatenindependent target gene such a glutamine synthase glul rhbg axin and cytochrome p e a well a by extended expression of periportal gene such a arginase furthermore endothelial subtypespecific expression of a cterminally yfptagged wls fusion protein in wlshecko mouse stabcretgwt wlsflfl rosawlsyfpflwt wlsrescue restored metabolic liver zonation interestingly lipid metabolism wa altered in wlshecko mouse exhibiting significantly reduced plasma cholesterol level while maintaining normal plasma triglyceride and blood glucose concentration on the contrary zonal expression of endomucin lyve and other marker of hec heterogeneity were not altered in wlshecko liver conclusion angiocrine wnt signaling control liver growth a well a development of metabolic liver zonation in mouse whereas intrahepatic hec zonation is not affected hepatology

title: treatment of hemorrhagic head and neck lesion by direct puncture and nbca embolization
abstract: lifethreatening bleeding in the head and neck region requires urgent management these hemorrhagic lesion for example a ruptured pseudoaneurysm are often treated by transarterial embolization tae but prior intervention or surgery inflammation anatomic variant and vessel tortuosity may render an endovascular approach challenging timeconsuming and sometimes impossible we report two case of severe head and neck hemorrhage successfully embolized with nbutyl cyanoacrylate via direct puncture and propose this approach a a fast safe and effective alternative to tae
label: Non-Cancer

title: jakvf detection and allele burden measurement in saliva v peripheral blood in patient with myelofibrosis
abstract: we previously demonstrated that peripheral blood pb is a reliable source for testing jakvf mutation in patient with myelofibrosis mf saliva ha also been tested to detect such mutation however it diagnostic accuracy a compared to pb ha not been validated in this study we prospectively tested patient with mf for jakvf mutation using both saliva and pb collected at the same time from each patient the concordance between the source wa with a sensitivity of and a specificity of the only factor associated with false positivity on saliva wa ongoing transfusion dependency jakvf testing using saliva is a simple noninvasive and potentially a more reliable method than pb for measuring jak status and assessing vf allelic burden in patient with transfusion dependency
label: Non-Cancer

title: radiation retinopathy treated successfully with aflibercept
abstract: aflibercept aflibercept is a novel antivascular endothelial growth factor drug indicated for wet agerelated macular degeneration and macular oedema secondary to retinal vein occlusion and diabetic macular oedema while only newly introduced on the market it is growing in popularity and over million dos have been prescribed worldwide due to it versatile mechanism it is indicated for numerous eye pathology and in particular ha been adapted to treat various type of retinopathy to our knowledge this is the first case report of solely using aflibercept to treat cystoid macular oedema in radiation retinopathy
label: Non-Cancer

title: mtor intersects antibodyinducing signal from taci in marginal zone b cell
abstract: mechanistic target of rapamycin mtor enhances immunity in addition to orchestrating metabolism here we show that mtor coordinate immunometabolic reconfiguration of marginal zone mz b cell a preactivated lymphocyte subset that mount antibody response to tcellindependent antigen through a tolllike receptor tlramplified pathway involving transmembrane activator and caml interactor taci this receptor interacts with mtor via the tlr adapter myd the resulting mtor activation instigates mz bcell proliferation immunoglobulin g igg class switching and plasmablast differentiation through a rapamycinsensitive pathway that integrates metabolic and antibodyinducing transcription program including nfkappab disruption of tacimtor interaction by rapamycin truncation of the mydbinding domain of taci or bcellconditional mtor deficiency interrupt taci signaling via nfkappab and cooperation with tlrs thereby hampering igg production to tcellindependent antigen but not bcell survival thus mtor drive innatelike antibody response by linking proximal taci signaling event with distal immunometabolic transcription program
label: Non-Cancer

title: dysregulation of autophagy in melanocyte contributes to hypopigmented macule in tuberous sclerosis complex
abstract: background tuberous sclerosis complex tsc gene mutation lead to constitutive activation of the mammalian target of rapamycin mtor pathway resulting in a broad range of symptom hypopigmented macule are the earliest sign although we have already confirmed that topical rapamycin treatment an mtor inhibitor protects patient with tsc against macular hypopigmentation the pathogenesis of such lesion remains poorly understood objective recently emerging evidence support a role for autophagy in skin pigmentation herein we investigated the impact of autophagic dysregulation on tscassociated hypopigmentation method skin sample from patient with tsc each bearing characteristic hypopigmented macule and healthy donor were subjected to immunohistochemical and electron microscopic analysis in addition tscknockdown kd wa investigated in human epidermal melanocyte by melanin content examination realtime pcr western blotting analysis and intracellular immunofluorescence staining result activation of the mtor signaling pathway decreased melanocytic pigmentation in hypopigmented macule of patient with tsc and in tsckd melanocyte in addition lc expression a marker of autophagy and autophagosome count increased whereas intracellular accumulation of autophagic degradative substrate p and ubiquitinated protein wa evident in tsckd melanocyte furthermore depigmentation in tsckd melanocyte wa accelerated by inhibiting autophagy atgkd or bafilomycin apretreatment and wa completely reversed by induction of autophagy via mtordependent rapamycin or mtorindependent smer exposure finally dysregulation of autophagy marked by increased lc expression and accumulation of ubiquitinated protein wa also observed in melanocyte of tscrelated hypopigmented macule conclusion our data demonstrate that melanocyte of patient with tsc display autophagic dysregulation which thereby reduced pigmentation serving a the basis for the hypomelanotic macule characteristic of tsc
label: Non-Cancer

title: muscle regeneration potential and satellite cell activation profile during recovery following hindlimb immobilization in mouse
abstract: reduced muscle activity lead to muscle atrophy and function loss in patient and animal model satellite cell sc are postnatal muscle stem cell that play a pivotal role in skeletal muscle regeneration following injury the regenerative potential satellite cell number and marker during recovery following immobilization of the hindlimb for day were explored in mouse exposed to day of hindlimb immobilization in those exposed to recovery day splint removal and in contralateral control muscle muscle precursor cell were isolated from all hindlimb muscle fluorescenceactivated cell sorting facs and sc and muscle regeneration were identified using immunofluorescence gastrocnemius and soleus and electron microscopy em gastrocnemius expression of ki pax myod and myogenin wa quantified rtpcr from sc facs yield body and grip strength were determined following day hindlimb immobilization a decline in sc facs immunofluorescence wa observed together with an upregulation of sc activation marker and sign of muscle regeneration including fusion to existing myofibers em recovery following hindlimb immobilization wa characterized by a program of muscle regeneration event hindlimb immobilization induced a decline in sc together with an upregulation of marker of sc activation suggesting that fusion to existing myofibers take place during unloading muscle recovery induced a significant rise in muscle precursor cell and regeneration event along with reduced sc activation expression marker and a concomitant rise in terminal muscle differentiation expression these are novel finding of potential applicability for the treatment of disuse muscle atrophy which is commonly associated with severe chronic and acute condition
label: Non-Cancer

title: unicentric castleman disease
abstract: unicentric castleman disease ucd is a rare lymphoproliferative disorder that manifest typically a proliferation of a single lymph node or region of lymph node histologically hyaline vascular variant is found in a majority of ucds ucd commonly present in younger patient population patient with ucd may be asymptomatic or present with symptom related to mass effect on surrounding structure it is difficult to achieve a definitive diagnosis by imaging alone histologic examination of the lesion remains the gold standard for diagnosis complete surgical resection is the best primary treatment modality for ucd resulting in excellent longterm survival and low recurrence rate
label: Non-Cancer

title: emerging biomarkers of lymphangioleiomyomatosis
abstract: introduction lymphangioleiomyomatosis lam is a destructive lung disease affecting primarily woman lam is caused by inactivating mutation in the tuberous sclerosis complex tsc gene resulting in hyperactivation of mechanisticmammalian target of rapamycin complex mtorc over the past five year there have been remarkable advance in the diagnosis and therapy of lam including the identification of vascular endothelial growth factor d vegfd a a diagnostic biomarker and the u food and drug administration approval of sirolimus a therapy for lam in appropriate clinical situation vegfd testing can make lung biopsy unnecessary to diagnose lam however there remains an urgent unmet need for additional biomarkers of disease activity andor response to therapy area covered this work review vegfd an established lam biomarker and discusses emerging biomarkers including circulating lam cell imaging lipid and metabolite biomarkers focusing on those with the highest potential impact for lam patient expert commentary ongoing research priority include the development of validated biomarkers to noninvasively diagnose lam in woman whose vegfd level are not diagnostic accurately predict the likelihood of disease progression and quantitatively measure disease activity and lam cell burden these biomarkers would enable personalized precision clinical care and fasttrack clinical trial implementation with high clinical impact
label: Non-Cancer

title: novel biotechnological platform based on baculovirus occlusion body carrying babesia bovis small antigenic peptide for the design of a diagnostic enzymelinked immunosorbent assay elisa
abstract: baculoviruses are large dna virus of insect principally employed in recombinant protein expression it ability to form occlusion body ob which are composed mainly of polyhedrin protein polh make them biotechnologically attractive a these crystal polyhedron can incorporate foreign peptide and can be easily isolated on the other hand peptide microarrays allow rapid and inexpensive highthroughput serological screening of new candidate to be incorporated to ob to integrate these biotechnological approach we worked on babesia bovis one of the causative agent of bovine babesiosis current molecular diagnosis of infection with b bovis includes enzymelinked immunosorbent assay elisa technique which use merozoite lysate obtained from infected bovine erythrocyte however it is important to produce recombinant antigen that replace the use of crude antigen here we describe a new biotechnological platform for the design of indirect elisa based on antigenic peptide of amino acid residue of b bovis apbb selected from a peptide microarray and expressed a a fusion to polh an sfpolheg packaging cell line infected with recombinant baculoviruses carrying polhapbb fusion yielded higher level of chimeric polyhedron highlighting the advantage of a transcontribution of a mutant copy of polyhedrin finally the use of dissolved recombinant polyhedron a antigen wa successful in an elisa assay a b bovispositive serum recognized the fusion polhapbb thus the use of this platform resulted in a promising alternative for molecular diagnosis of relevant infectious disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: ringed telangiectasias an unusual presentation of telangiectasia macularis eruptiva perstans
abstract: telangiectasia macularis eruptiva perstans tmep is a rare form of cutaneous mastocytosis while most cutaneous mastocytoses occur in child and are asymptomatic tmep occurs predominantly in adult and is associated with systemic manifestation requiring medical management tmep is typically characterised by scattered redbrown macule on the trunk and extremity but must be differentiated from other telangiectatic condition such a scleroderma hereditary haemorrhagic telangiectasia and telangiectasias secondary to cirrhosis practitioner must be aware that variant to the classic presentation of tmep exist such a the ringed telangiectasias we describe diagnostic workup including tissue biopsy must be considered in such patient after a thorough history and physical have been performed and other telangiectatic process have been ruled out the treatment of cutaneous mastocytosis aim at controlling symptom and preventing mast cell degranulation cosmetic treatment includes the use ofpsoralen and ultraviolet a puva therapy total skin electron beam radiation and flashlamp pulseddye laser treatment
label: Non-Cancer

title: giant retrocardiac foregut duplication cyst presenting with left atrial compression and palpitation
abstract: a yearold man presented with a month history of palpitation and shortness of breath an ecg showed premature atrial contraction and episode of supraventricular tachycardia a subsequent echocardiogram showed a retrocardiac cystic mass that wa compressing the left atrium a ct scan confirmed these finding by showing a large leftsided posterior mediastinal cyst compressing the left atrium and pulmonary vein the cyst wa successfully excised from the retrocardiac position via left thoracotomy after which there wa complete resolution of the palpitation histopathology showed it to be a mediastinal cyst most likely a foregut duplication of the enterogenic variant this is an extremely unusual case of foregut duplication cyst presenting with compression of the left atrium and pulmonary vein leading to atrial arrhythmia
label: Non-Cancer

title: mast cell burden in a patient with cutaneous disease
abstract: mastocytosis is a disease characterized by the abnormal clonal proliferation of mast cell in skin andor extracutaneous organ often relating to activating mutation of ckit histopathology special stain such a giemsa leder and toluidine blue are key for the diagnosis of cutaneous mastocytosis cm in adult skin lesion can be associated with systemic disease tryptase is a diagnostic marker in mastocytosis and thought to reflect the burden of mast cell disease in this report we present a case of cutaneous mast cell disease with associated finding of elevated serum tryptase and mast cell infiltration of the bone marrow consistent with indolent systemic mastocytosis
label: Non-Cancer

title: liver angiomyolipomas in tuberous sclerosis complextheir incidence and course
abstract: background the purpose of this study wa to evaluate the epidemiology and clinical significance of hepatic angiomyolipomas in patient with tuberous sclerosis complex method we performed a retrospective analysis of clinical and imaging data from patient with tuberous sclerosis complex the prevalence progression and potential relationship between liver lesion and other clinical finding including genetic association were assessed result twentyeight of patient had hepatic lesion there wa a predominance of female over male patient in individual with liver lesion versus with statistical significance in patient under five year of age p all individual having hepatic lesion who also had available genetic testing data n were diagnosed with a tsc gene mutation all patient with liver lesion had coexisting renal angiomyolipomas amls p the age of onset of renal lesion wa lower and their prevalence wa significantly higher in patient with liver involvement p in most instance hepatic lesion measured several millimeter in diameter and were clinically asymptomatic progressive lesion growth wa documented in six individual but with no clinical consequence to date conclusion this study confirms the association of hepatic lesion with tsc mutation a common origin of liver and renal amls a well a the predominance of female patient in this group hepatic amls are relatively common but mostly benign lesion
label: Non-Cancer

title: cryoem structure of human atratrip complex
abstract: atr ataxia telangiectasiamutated and radrelated protein kinase and atrip atrinteracting protein form a complex and play a critical role in response to replication stress and dna damage here we determined the cryoelectron microscopy em structure of the human atratrip complex at a resolution and built an atomic model of the cterminal catalytic core of atr residue at a resolution the complex adopts a hollow heart shape consisting of two atr monomer in distinct conformation the em map for atrip reveals heat repeat in an extended s shape the conformational flexibility of atr allows atrip to properly lock the ntermini of the two atr monomer to favor atratrip complex formation and functional diversity the isolated headhead and tailtail each adopts a pseudo fold symmetry the catalytic pocket face outward and substrate access is not restricted by inhibitory element our study provide a structural basis for understanding the assembly of the atratrip complex and a framework for characterizing atrmediated dna repair pathway
label: Non-Cancer

title: wnt signaling perturbation underlie the genetic heterogeneity of robinow syndrome
abstract: locus heterogeneity characterizes a variety of skeletal dysplasia often due to interacting or overlapping signaling pathway robinow syndrome is a skeletal disorder historically refractory to molecular diagnosis potentially stemming from substantial genetic heterogeneity all current known pathogenic variant reside in gene within the noncanonical wnt signaling pathway including ror wnta and more recently dvl and dvl however of autosomaldominant robinow syndrome case remain molecularly unsolved to investigate this missing heritability we recruited family with at least one family member clinically diagnosed with robinow or robinowlike phenotype and performed genetic and genomic study in total four family with variant in fzd were identified a well a three individual from two family with biallelic variant in nxn that cosegregate with the phenotype importantly both fzd and nxn are relevant protein partner in the wnta interactome supporting their role in skeletal development in addition to confirming that clustered frameshifting variant in dvl and dvl are the main contributor to dominant robinow syndrome we also found likely pathogenic variant in candidate gene gpc and rac both linked to the wnt signaling pathway these data support an initial hypothesis that robinow syndrome result from perturbation of the wntpcp pathway suggest specific relevant domain of the protein involved and reveal key contributor in this signaling cascade during human embryonic development contrary to the view that nonallelic genetic heterogeneity hamper gene discovery this study demonstrates the utility of rare disease genomic study to parse gene function in human developmental pathway
label: Non-Cancer

title: telangiectasias in ataxia telangiectasia clinical significance role of atm deficiency and potential pathophysiological mechanism
abstract: ataxia telangiectasia at is named after the two key clinical feature that characterize it classical phenotype namely a progressive cerebellar gait disorder ataxia and vascular anomaly telangiectasias visible in the conjunctiva and skin at is an autosomal recessively inherited disorder caused by mutation in the atm gene that encodes the atm protein while the ataxia is subject of many publication the telangiectasias are under emphasised we here describe the observation that the absence or presence of atm protein and the level of residual atm kinase activity are related to the occurrence of telangiectasias and describe the clinical consequence of these vascular malformation finally we hypothesize that atm dysfunction dysregulates angiogenesis
label: Non-Cancer

title: initial romiplostim dosing and time to platelet response in patient with treatment refractory immune thrombocytopenia
abstract: backgroundrationale romiplostim is a thrombopoietin receptor agonist recommended a a secondline therapy for immune thrombocytopenia an initial dose of mcgkgweek subcutaneously with weekly mcgkg dose escalation is recommended per package labeling optimizing romiplostim dosing for hospitalized corticosteroid and intravenous immunoglobulinrefractory patient with severe thrombocytopenia secondary to immune thrombocytopenia may be critical for improving platelet response reducing the risk of bleeding and decreasing hospital length of stay limited data are available evaluating the efficacy and safety of higher initial dos objective the primary objective of this study wa to compare the time to platelet x l between patient who received an initial romiplostim dose of mcgkgweek compared to the standard initial dose of mcgkgweek secondary objective included time to platelet response x l and x l percentage of patient achieving platelet response hospital length of stay and incidence of adverse event and bleeding complication method this wa a retrospective singlecenter cohort study including hospitalized adult with corticosteroid and intravenous immunoglobulinrefractory immune thrombocytopenia a baseline platelet mcgkgweek a review of electronic medical record and descriptive statistic generated finding result a total of patient were included in cohort and in cohort patient in cohort had a median initial dose of mcgkgweek patient in cohort achieved a platelet x l in a median of day versus day for cohort more patient in cohort achieved a platelet x l v and platelet x l v the median hospital length of stay wa shorter in cohort v day clinically relevant nonmajor bleeding wa noted less frequently in cohort v while major bleeding wa more frequent in cohort v no thrombotic event occurred conclusion our study suggests that higher initial romiplostim dos may be safe for hospitalized patient with treatmentrefractory immune thrombocytopenia compared to food and drug administrationapproved dosing higher initial dos may shorten time to platelet response and hospital length of stay further largescale study are needed to confirm these finding
label: Non-Cancer

title: the expression of mctla in skin lesion inversely correlate with the severity of psoriasis
abstract: background psoriasis is a chronic inflammatory disease characterized by epidermal hyperplasia and increased t cell infiltration cytotoxic t lymphocyte antigen ctla is a key factor that affect t cell function and immune response however whether the expression of ctla affect the severity of psoriasis is still unknown objective the aim of the project wa to investigate the correlation between the expression of ctla and the severity of psoriasis method the plasma soluble ctla level and membrane ctla expression were measured by enzymelinked immunosorbent assay and immunohistochemistry analysis in mild moderate and severe psoriasis patient respectively imiquimodinduced mouse model of psoriasis wa treated with ctla immunoglobulin fusion protein ctla ig or antictla antibody epidermal thickness and infiltrating cd t cell count were evaluated result the plasma soluble ctla level had no significant difference among mild moderate and severe patient p however the membrane ctla expression in skin wa significantly higher in mild psoriasis patient compared to moderate and severe psoriasis patient v v p furthermore in imiquimodinduced mouse model of psoriasis the result showed that mimicking ctla function improved the skin phenotype and reduced epidermal thickness v mum n p a well a infiltrating cd t cell count v p compared to control group however blocking ctla function aggregated the skin phenotype including enhanced epidermal thickness and infiltrating cd t cell count compared to control group conclusion these result indicated that the expression of mctla in skin lesion inversely correlated with the severity of psoriasis and ctla might play a critical role in the disease severity of psoriasis
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: the expression of mctla in skin lesion inversely correlate with the severity of psoriasis background psoriasis is a chronic inflammatory disease characterized by epidermal hyperplasia and increased t cell infiltration cytotoxic t lymphocyte antigen ctla is a key factor that affect t cell function and immune response however whether the expression of ctla affect the severity of psoriasis is still unknown objective the aim of the project wa to investigate the correlation between the expression of ctla and the severity of psoriasis method the plasma soluble ctla level and membrane ctla expression were measured by enzymelinked immunosorbent assay and immunohistochemistry analysis in mild moderate and severe psoriasis patient respectively imiquimodinduced mouse model of psoriasis wa treated with ctla immunoglobulin fusion protein ctla ig or antictla antibody epidermal thickness and infiltrating cd t cell count were evaluated result the plasma soluble ctla level had no significant difference among mild moderate and severe patient p however the membrane ctla expression in skin wa significantly higher in mild psoriasis patient compared to moderate and severe psoriasis patient v v p furthermore in imiquimodinduced mouse model of psoriasis the result showed that mimicking ctla function improved the skin phenotype and reduced epidermal thickness v mum n p a well a infiltrating cd t cell count v p compared to control group however blocking ctla function aggregated the skin phenotype including enhanced epidermal thickness and infiltrating cd t cell count compared to control group conclusion these result indicated that the expression of mctla in skin lesion inversely correlated with the severity of psoriasis and ctla might play a critical role in the disease severity of psoriasis

title: eltrombopag versus romiplostim in treatment of child with persistent or chronic immune thrombocytopenia a systematic review incorporating an indirectcomparison metaanalysis
abstract: in absence of direct comparison we conducted an indirectcomparison metaanalysis to evaluate the efficacy and safety of thrombopoietinreceptor agoniststporas in treatment of pediatric persistent or chronic immune thrombocytopeniaitp pubmed embase cochrane library clinical trialsgov china national knowledge infrastructure and chinese biomedical literature database were searched from their earliest record to may randomized controlled trial comparing the tporas with placebo in pediatric itp were included outcome included overall response rateprimary durable response overall or clinically significant bleeding the proportion of patient receiving rescue medication and safety five randomized placebocontrolled studiesn were analyzed the overall responserisk ratiorr confidence intervalci the incidence of adverse event rr ci durable responserr ci and the proportion of patient receiving rescue treatmentrr ci were similar between eltrombopag and romiplostim group nevertheless eltrombopag might have lower risk of overall bleedingrr ci and clinically significant bleedingrr ci than romiplostim this metaanalysis suggests that eltrombopag might be similar to romiplostim in efficacy and safety but seems to reduce the risk of bleeding compared to romiplostim furthermore cost of the treatment comorbidity of patient and drug compliance should also be considered in clinical decision making

title: characterization of cd hematopoietic cell in systemic mastocytosis potential role in disease dissemination
abstract: background recent study show that most systemic mastocytosis sm patient including indolent sm ism with ism and without skin lesion ism carry the kit dv mutation in pb leukocyte we investigated the potential association between the degree of involvement of bm hematopoiesis by the kit dv mutation and the distribution of different maturationassociated compartment of bone marrow bm and peripheral blood pb cd hematopoietic precursor hpc in ism and identified the specific pb cell compartment that carry this mutation method the distribution of different maturationassociated subset of bm and pb cd hpc from newly diagnosed kitmutated ism patient and healthy control wa analyzed by flow cytometry in patient distinct facspurified pb cell compartment were also investigated for the kit mutation result ism patient showed higher percentage of both bm and pb mccommitted cd hpc v control particularly among ism case with mcrestricted kit mutation ismmc this wa associated with progressive blockade of maturation of cd hpc to the neutrophil lineage from ismmc to multilineage kitmutated case ismml regarding the frequency of kitmutated case and cell population in pb variable pattern were observed the percentage of kitmutated pb cd hpc eosinophil neutrophil monocyte and t cell increasing from ismsmc and ismsmc to ismml patient conclusion the presence of the kit dv mutation in pb of ism patient is associated with early involvement of circulating cd hpc and multiple myeloid cell subpopulation kitmutated pb cd hpc potentially contributing to early dissemination of the disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: effect of betaagonists on lam progression and treatment
abstract: lymphangioleiomyomatosis lam a rare disease of woman is associated with cystic lung destruction resulting from the proliferation of abnormal smooth musclelike lam cell with mutation in the tuberous sclerosis complex tsc gene tsc andor tsc the mutant gene and encoded protein are responsible for activation of the mechanistic target of rapamycin mtor which is inhibited by sirolimus rapamycin a drug used to treat lam patient who have lam may also be treated with bronchodilator for asthmalike symptom due to lam we observed stabilization of forced expiratory volume in s over time in patient receiving sirolimus and longacting betaagonists with shortacting rescue inhaler compared with patient receiving only sirolimus because betaagonists increase camp and pka activity we investigated effect of pka activation on the mtor pathway human skin tsc fibroblast or lam lung cell incubated shortterm with isoproterenol betaagonist showed a sirolimusindependent increase in phosphorylation of s a downstream effector of the mtor pathway and increased cell growth cell incubated longterm with isoproterenol which may lead to betaadrenergic receptor desensitization did not show increased s phosphorylation inhibition of pka blocked the isoproterenol effect on s phosphorylation thus activation of pka by betaagonists increased phosphos independent of mtor an effect abrogated by betaagonistdriven receptor desensitization in agreement retrospective clinical data from patient with lam suggested that a combination of bronchodilator in conjunction with sirolimus may be preferable to sirolimus alone for stabilization of pulmonary function
label: Non-Cancer
