title: dynamic dosing of romiplostim in patient with immune thrombocytopenia purpura two case report
abstract: romiplostim is a thrombopoietin receptor agonist approved for the treatment of immune thrombocytopenia purpura when following fdaapproved romiplostim prescribing recommendation to withhold treatment for platelet count above kmicrol some patient exhibit a precipitous decline in their platelet count potentially causing patient harm we present two case where stable platelet count were achieved only through persistent weekly dosing of romiplostim despite platelet count above kmicrol on the day of administration therefore continuous weekly dosing of romiplostim despite platelet count being above kmicrol combined with twice weekly vigilant monitoring is an alternative method of romiplostim dosing that mitigates severe fluctuation in platelet we also discus important detail postulated mechanism and evidencebased mitigation strategy
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: dynamic dosing of romiplostim in patient with immune thrombocytopenia purpura two case report romiplostim is a thrombopoietin receptor agonist approved for the treatment of immune thrombocytopenia purpura when following fdaapproved romiplostim prescribing recommendation to withhold treatment for platelet count above kmicrol some patient exhibit a precipitous decline in their platelet count potentially causing patient harm we present two case where stable platelet count were achieved only through persistent weekly dosing of romiplostim despite platelet count above kmicrol on the day of administration therefore continuous weekly dosing of romiplostim despite platelet count being above kmicrol combined with twice weekly vigilant monitoring is an alternative method of romiplostim dosing that mitigates severe fluctuation in platelet we also discus important detail postulated mechanism and evidencebased mitigation strategy

title: ablation of grb specifically in muscle impact muscle size and glucose metabolism in mouse
abstract: grb is an adaptortype signaling protein most highly expressed in tissue involved in insulin action and glucose metabolism such a muscle pancreas and adipose germline deletion of grb in mouse creates a phenotype with larger muscle and improved glucose homeostasis however it ha not been determined whether grb ablation specifically in muscle is sufficient to induce hypermuscularity or affect whole body glucose metabolism in this study we generated musclespecific grbdeficient mouse grbmko by crossing grbfloxflox mouse with mouse expressing cre recombinase under control of the human alphaskeletal actin promoter oneyearold grbmko mouse had enlarged muscle with greater crosssectional area of fiber compared with wildtype wt mouse this degree of hypermuscularity did not affect whole body glucose homeostasis under basal condition however hyperinsulinemiceuglycemic clamp study revealed that grbmko mouse had greater glucose uptake into muscle compared with wt mouse insulin signaling wa increased at the level of phosphoakt in muscle of grbmko mouse compared with wt mouse consistent with a role of grb a a modulator of proximal insulin receptor signaling we conclude that ablation of grb in muscle is sufficient to affect muscle size and metabolism supporting an important role for this protein in growth and metabolic pathway
label: Non-Cancer

title: chronic lymphoproliferative disorder of nkcells a singleinstitution review with emphasis on relative utility of multimodality diagnostic tool
abstract: background chronic lymphoproliferative disorder of nkcells clpdnk manifest a a persistent increase x l for month of mature nkcells in peripheral blood with an indolent clinical course the disease is rare and only limited case series have been published method we retrospectively studied patient with clpdnk diagnosed at our institution between and result patient included men and woman with a median age of year range year ten patient had cytopenia bone marrow involvement by clpdnk ranged from the most commonly detected antigenic aberrancy by low cytometry immunophenotyping were a follows cddecreaseddim cduniform cdpartial cdbright and kir restriction jakstat pathway mutation were detected in of patient and involved stat n and jak n the presence of mutation tended to correlate with the occurrence of other cytopenia anemiathrombocytopenia and requirement for treatment seven patient received singleagent therapy with amelioration of symptom patient were observed there were no diseaseassociated death or progression to more aggressive disease during the followup interval median month conclusion patient with clpdnk have an indolent clinical course and frequent hematologic manifestation that are responsive to singleagent therapy mutation in stat are common and portend more pronounced clinical manifestation

title: analysis of chronic granulomatous disease in the kavkazi population in israel reveals phenotypic heterogeneity in patient with the same ncf mutation cga
abstract: purpose chronic granulomatous disease cgd is an innate immune deficiency disorder of phagocyte resulting from mutation in the component of the nadph oxidase complex that impair the synthesis of oxygen radical thus rendering patient susceptible to recurrent infection and excessive hyperinflammatory response the most common autosomal recessive form of cgd is pphox deficiency which is often clinically milder than the more common xlinked recessive form here we report data on genetics clinical and biochemical finding in cgd patient of kavkazi origin with the nonsense mutation cga in the ncf gene leading to pphox deficiency method diagnosis wa based on detailed clinical evaluation respiratory burst activity by cytochrome c reduction and dihydrorhodamine dhr assay by flow cytometry expression of pphox by immunoblotting and molecular confirmation by dna sequence analysis result twelve male and five female patient with median age at onset of year range day to year were included in the study the present cohort display an encouraging overall longterm survival with median followup of year clinical manifestation varied from mild to severe expression of the disease correlation between genotype and phenotype is unpredictable although the kavkazi patient were more severely affected than other patient with pphox deficiency conclusion kavkazi cgd patient harbor a common genetic mutation that is associated with a heterogeneous clinical phenotype early diagnosis and proper clinical management in an experienced phagocytic leukocyte center is imperative to ensure favorable patient outcome new treatment strategy are ongoing but result are not yet conclusive
label: Non-Cancer

title: dissecting wnt signaling for melanocyte regulation during wound healing
abstract: abnormal pigmentation is commonly seen in the wound scar despite advancement in the research of wound healing little is known about the repopulation of melanocyte in the healed skin previous study have shown the capacity of melanocyte stem cell in the hair follicle to contribute skin epidermal melanocyte after injury in mouse and human here we focused on the wnt pathway known to be a vital regulator of melanocyte stem cell in effort to better understand the regulation of folliclederived epidermal melanocyte during wound healing we showed that transgenic expression of wnt inhibitor dkk in melanocyte reduced epidermal melanocyte in the wound scar conversely forced activation of wnt signaling by genetically stabilizing betacatenin in melanocyte increase epidermal melanocyte furthermore we show that deletion of wntless wls a gene required for wnt ligand secretion within epithelial cell result in failure in activating wnt signaling in adjacent epidermal melanocyte these result show the essential function of extrinsic wnt ligand in initiating wnt signaling in folliclederived epidermal melanocyte during wound healing collectively our result suggest the potential for wnt signal regulation to promote melanocyte regeneration and provide a potential molecular window to promote proper melanocyte regeneration after wounding and in condition such a vitiligo
label: Non-Cancer

title: rhabdomyolysis in stuvewiedemann syndrome
abstract: a monthold male infant with stuvewiedemann syndrome sw presented with an acute respiratory arrest secondary to a rhinovirus respiratory infection from which he wa rapidly resuscitated he developed an acute kidney injury requiring supportive treatment and on day of his illness wa noted to have developed severe rhabdomyolysis creatine kinase level ul normal ul he wa born from consanguineous parent with homozygous mutation in the leukaemia inhibitory factor receptor he had skeletal dysplasia with metabolic bone disease and episode of hyperthermia with lactic acidosis he also had paroxysmal ventricular tachycardia treated with prophylactic propranolol this is a case report of a child with sw who had a febrile illness and epileptic seizure which led to severe rhabdomyolysis outside the context of anaesthesia and we would like to draw the attention of clinician to this potential complication
label: Non-Cancer

title: method to study dna end resection i recombinant protein purification
abstract: accurate repair of dna doublestrand break dsbs is carried out by homologous recombination in order to repair dna break by the recombination pathway the terminated dna strand at dsb site must be first nucleolytically processed to produce overhang the process is termed dna end resection and involves the interplay of several nuclease complex dna end resection commits dsb repair to the recombination pathway including a process termed singlestrand annealing a resected dna end are generally nonligatable by the competing nonhomologous endjoining machinery biochemical reconstitution experiment provided invaluable mechanistic insight into the dna end resection pathway in this chapter we describe preparation procedure of key protein involved in dna end resection in human cell including the mreradnbs complex phosphorylated variant of ctip the dna nucleasehelicase with it helicase partner bloom blm or werner wrn a well a the singlestranded dnabinding protein replication protein a the availability of recombinant dna end resection factor will help to further elucidate resection mechanism and regulatory process that may involve novel protein partner and posttranslational modification
label: Non-Cancer

title: colonic perineurioma benign fibroblastic polyp case report and review of the literature
abstract: background colorectal perineuriomas are uncommon benign mucosalbased proliferation of mesenchymal cell that express perineurial marker often associated with colonic crypt displaying a serratedhyperplastic architecture the vast majority of case arise distal to the splenic flexure and have been described a sessile polyp using molecular analysis braf mutation have been demonstrated in the serrated crypt epithelium we report a new case of perineurioma presenting a a pedunculated polyp in the transverse colon with prominent hemosiderin deposit in the uninvolved lamina propria that separated the perineurial proliferation from the surface epithelium a previously unreported histological finding by using immunohistochemistry we demonstrated the presence of braf ve mutated protein in the serrated crypt epithelium in addition a review of the literature on colorectal perineurioma is provided case presentation a mm pedunculated polyp wa removed from the transverse colon of a year old man who presented with epigastric pain weight loss and rectal bleeding a proliferation of uniform plump spindled cell expanded the lamina propria and separated serrated colonic crypt the epithelial component closely resembled microvesicular hyperplastic polyp immunohistochemical stain for epithelial membrane antigen ema glucose transporter glut and collagen iv were positive in the stromal proliferation a mutationspecific monoclonal antibody directed against braf ve showed positive cytoplasmic staining in the serrated crypt epithelium but not in the perineurial proliferation conspicuous hemosiderin deposition wa seen in the inflamed lamina propria between the perineurial proliferation and the surface epithelium conclusion although the majority of colorectal perineuriomas occur in the sigmoid colon and rectum and are described a sessile polyp colorectal perineurioma can present a a pedunculated polyp proximal to the splenic flexure a described in this case conspicuous hemosiderin deposition can be seen in the superficial lamina propria braf mutation are limited to the serrated crypt epithelium
label: Non-Cancer

to the serrated crypt epithelium

title: tuberous sclerosis complex
abstract: tuberous sclerosis complex tsc is an autosomaldominant or sporadic multisystem disorder that result from mutation in either tsc or tsc the primary organ affected include the brain skin lung kidney and heart all with variable frequency penetrance and severity there are over known allelic variant for tsc including nonsense and misssense mutation and all pathogenic mutation are inactivating leading to lossoffunction effect on the encoded protein tsc and tsc these protein form a complex to constitutively inhibit the mammalian target of rapamycin mtor signaling cascade and a a consequence mtor signaling is constitutively active within all tscassociated lesion the mtor inhibitor rapamycin sirolimus and everolimus have been shown to reduce renal and brain lesion size and improve pulmonary function in tsc and these compound may also decrease seizure frequency the clinical application of mtor inhibitor in tsc ha provided one of the first example of precision medicine in a neurodevelopmental disorder
label: Non-Cancer

title: phosphatidylinositolbisphosphate kinase catalytic subunit alpha pikcarelated overgrowth spectrum a brief report
abstract: a patient with extensive multisystem overgrowth caused by a somatic gain of function pikcamutation is described this case is an example of the clinical diversity of the pikcarelated overgrowth spectrum pro a the patient had overlapping feature of congenital lipomatous overgrowth vascular malformation epidermal nevus and skeletal abnormality clove syndrome and megalencephalycapillary malformation polymicrogyria mcap syndrome and underline the utility of this umbrella term
label: Non-Cancer

title: osteopontindeficient progenitor cell display enhanced differentiation to adipocytes
abstract: objective osteopontin opn spp is a protein upregulated in white adipose tissue wat of obese subject deletion of opn protects mouse from highfat dietinduced wat inflammation and insulin resistance however the alteration mediated by loss of opn in wat before the obesogenic challenge have not yet been investigated therefore we hypothesised that the lack of opn might enhance the proadipogenic micro environment before obesity driven inflammation method opn deficiency wa tested in visceral v and subcutaneous sc wat from wt and spp female mouse gene expression for hypoxia inflammation and adipogenesis wa checked in wt v spp mouse n adipocytes progenitor cell apc were isolated by fluorescence cell sorting and role of opn deficiency in adipogenesis wa investigated by cell image and rtpcr result we show that spp maintained normal body and fatpad weight although hypoxia and inflammation marker were significantly reduced in contrast expression of gene involved in adipogenesis wa increased in wat from spp mouse strikingly apc from spp were diminished but differentiated more efficiently to adipocytes than those from control mouse conclusion apc from scwat of lean opndeficient mouse display an enhanced capacity for differentiating to adipocytes these alteration may explain the healthy expansion of wat in the opndeficient model which is associated with reduced inflammation and insulin resistance

title: rare case of thoracic endometriosis presenting with lung nodule and pneumothorax
abstract: we present the case of a yearold nigerian woman who wa referred to the respiratory team with a month history of breathlessness she wa concurrently being investigated for an abdominal mass and rectal and vaginal bleeding consequently she underwent crosssectional imaging of her chest abdomen and pelvis revealing a small rightsided pneumothorax and right lower lobe pleuralbased lesion shortly thereafter she wa admitted to the hospital with chest pain and required chest drain insertion this partially treated her pneumothorax but she required referral to a cardiothoracic centre for definitive diagnosis and to manage her nonresolving pneumothorax biopsy from the videoassisted thoracoscopic surgery confirmed the very rare diagnosis of thoracic endometriosis
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: rare case of thoracic endometriosis presenting with lung nodule and pneumothorax we present the case of a yearold nigerian woman who wa referred to the respiratory team with a month history of breathlessness she wa concurrently being investigated for an abdominal mass and rectal and vaginal bleeding consequently she underwent crosssectional imaging of her chest abdomen and pelvis revealing a small rightsided pneumothorax and right lower lobe pleuralbased lesion shortly thereafter she wa admitted to the hospital with chest pain and required chest drain insertion this partially treated her pneumothorax but she required referral to a cardiothoracic centre for definitive diagnosis and to manage her nonresolving pneumothorax biopsy from the videoassisted thoracoscopic surgery confirmed the very rare diagnosis of thoracic endometriosis

title: diagnosis of sporadic neurofibromatosis type in the paediatric population
abstract: objective onset of symptom in severe sporadic neurofibromatosis type nf is typically within childhood however there is poor awareness of presenting feature in young child potentially resulting in delayed diagnosis and poorer outcome we have reviewed presentation of sporadic paediatric nf to raise awareness of early feature highlighting those requiring further investigation design patient diagnosed with nf at age atypical feature including cerebellar hypoplasia in three case and focal cortical dysplasia in five out of seven seizurerelated presentation five case presented with a sometimes transient or intermittent cranial nerve mononeuropathy the mean delay to diagnosis wa year in eight case this exceeded year most significant delay occurred in mononeuropathy ophthalmological andor seizure presentation with a mean delay of and year respectively eightyfour per cent of case needed intervention in childhood conclusion all nonvestibular schwannoma nf presentation in childhood had significant diagnostic delay we emphasise the importance of detailed assessment of skin and eye in unusual presentation and propose an aide to prompt timely referral to specialist service
label: Non-Cancer

title: a nonconserved amino acid variant regulates differential signalling between human and mouse cd
abstract: cd superagonistic antibody cdsab can preferentially activate and expand immunosuppressive regulatory t cell treg in mouse however preclinical trial assessing cdsabs for the therapy of autoimmune disease reveal severe systemic inflammatory response syndrome in human thereby implying the existence of distinct signalling ability between human and mouse cd here we show that a single amino acid variant within the cterminal prolinerich motif of human and mouse cd p in human v a in mouse regulates cdinduced nfkappab activation and proinflammatory cytokine gene expression moreover this yapp sequence in human is crucial for the association of cd with the nck adaptor protein for actin cytoskeleton reorganisation event necessary for cd autonomous signalling this study thus unveils different outcome between human and mouse cd signalling to underscore the importance of specie difference when transferring result from preclinical model to the bedside
label: Non-Cancer

title: clinic pathogenic mechanism and drug testing of two inherited thrombocytopenia ankrdrelated thrombocytopenia and myhrelated disease
abstract: inherited thrombocytopenia it are a heterogeneous group of disorder characterized by low platelet count resulting in impaired hemostasis patient can have spontaneous hemorrhage andor excessive bleeding provoked by hemostatic challenge a trauma or surgery to date it encompass different rare monogenic disorder caused by mutation of gene this review will focus on the major discovery that have been made in the last year on the diagnosis treatment and molecular mechanism of ankrdrelated thrombocytopenia and myhrelated disease furthermore we will discus the use a thrombopoietin mimetic a a novel approach to treat the thrombocytopenia in these patient we will propose the use of a new d bone marrow model to study the mechanism of action of these drug and to test their efficacy and safety in patient the overall purpose of this review is to point out that important progress have been made in understanding the pathogenesis of ankrdrelated thrombocytopenia and myhrelated disease and new therapeutic approach have been proposed and tested future advancement in this research will rely in the development of more physiological model to study the regulation of human platelet biogenesis disease mechanism and specific pharmacologic target
label: Non-Cancer

title: clinical spectrum of pyruvate kinase deficiency data from the pyruvate kinase deficiency natural history study
abstract: an international multicenter registry wa established to collect retrospective and prospective clinical data on patient with pyruvate kinase pk deficiency the most common glycolytic defect causing congenital nonspherocytic hemolytic anemia medical history and laboratory and radiologic data were retrospectively collected at enrollment for patient with molecularly confirmed pk deficiency perinatal complication were common including anemia that required transfusion hyperbilirubinemia hydrops and prematurity nearly all newborn were treated with phototherapy and many were treated with exchange transfusion child age year and younger were often transfused until splenectomy splenectomy of patient wa associated with a median increase in hemoglobin of gdl and a decreased transfusion burden in of patient predictor of a response to splenectomy included higher presplenectomy hemoglobin p lower indirect bilirubin p and missense pklr mutation p postsplenectomy thrombosis wa reported in of patient the most frequent complication included iron overload and gallstone but other complication such a aplastic crisis osteopeniabone fragility extramedullary hematopoiesis postsplenectomy sepsis pulmonary hypertension and leg ulcer were not uncommon overall of patient had both a splenectomy and cholecystectomy in those who had a splenectomy without simultaneous cholecystectomy later required a cholecystectomy although the risk of complication increase with severity of anemia and a genotypephenotype relationship wa observed complication were common in all patient with pk deficiency diagnostic testing for pk deficiency should be considered in patient with apparent congenital hemolytic anemia and close monitoring for iron overload gallstone and other complication is needed regardless of baseline hemoglobin this trial wa registered at wwwclinicaltrialsgov a nct
label: Non-Cancer

title: buckling collapse of midcervical spine secondary to neurofibromatosis
abstract: buckling collapse is the term typically used to describe severe kyphosis degree characteristically seen in thoracolumbar tuberculosis neurofibromatosis is rarely associated with severe cervical kyphosis dystrophic change in vertebra make surgical correction and fusion challenging singlestage cervical osteotomy eg pedicle subtraction osteotomy vertebral column resection are commonly done in cervicothoracic junction however it is technically challenging and associated with high risk of vertebral artery injury neural injury etc when performed in higher cervical spine hence in our case we did a staged procedure performing circumferential osteotomy for buckling kyphosis in the midcervical spine because it involved midcervical spine and there wa no chintochest deformity we preferred the anteriorposterioranterior sequence
label: Non-Cancer

title: chemotherapyrelated cardiac dysfunction a systematic review of genetic variant modulating individual risk
abstract: chemotherapyrelated cardiac dysfunction is a significant side effect of anticancer treatment risk stratification is based on clinical and treatmentrelated risk factor that do not adequately explain individual susceptibility the addition of genetic variant may improve risk assessment we conducted a systematic literature search in pubmed and embase to identify study investigating genetic risk factor for chemotherapyrelated cardiac dysfunction included were article describing genetic variant in human altering susceptibility to chemotherapyrelated cardiac dysfunction the validity of identified study wa assessed by criterion including assessment of population stratification statistical methodology and replication of finding we identified study exploring genetic risk factor for anthracyclineinduced cardiotoxicity n and study related to trastuzumabassociated cardiotoxicity n the majority of study had a candidate gene approach whereas genomewide association study have been performed we identified genetic variant in gene and intergenic variant reported significant at least once the overall validity of study wa limited with small cohort failure to assess population ancestry and lack of replication snp with the most robust evidence up to this point are celf r sarcomere structure and function rarg r topoisomerasebeta expression slca r drug transport ugta r drug metabolism and intergenic variant r existing evidence support the hypothesis that genetic variation contributes to chemotherapyrelated cardiac dysfunction although many variant identified by this systematic review show potential to improve risk stratification future study are necessary for validation and assessment of their value in a diagnostic and prognostic setting
label: Non-Cancer

title: bendamustine and rituximab br versus dexamethasone rituximab and cyclophosphamide drc in patient with waldenstrom macroglobulinemia
abstract: the treatment approach for waldenstrom macroglobulinemia wm are largely based upon information from singlearm phase ii trial without comparative data we compared the efficacy of two commonly used regimen in routine practice bendamustinerituximab br and dexamethasone rituximab plus cyclophosphamide drc and evaluated their activity with respect to the patient mydlp mutation status of consecutive patient received br with relapsedrefractory wm and received drc had relapsedrefractory wm in the treatmentnaive setting overall response rate orr wa with br versus with drc p twoyear progressionfree survival pfs with br and drc wa and respectively p in salvage setting orr wa with br versus with drc p median pfs with br wa versus month with drc year pfs wa versus p median diseasespecific survival wa not reached with br versus month with drc p the timetoevent endpoint and depth of response were independent of the myd mutation status grade adverse event of both regimen were comparable a trend for longer pfs wa observed with br although the regimen have comparable toxicity the activity of br and drc appears to be unaffected by patient myd mutation status
label: Non-Cancer

title: treatment of hemorrhagic head and neck lesion by direct puncture and nbca embolization
abstract: lifethreatening bleeding in the head and neck region requires urgent management these hemorrhagic lesion for example a ruptured pseudoaneurysm are often treated by transarterial embolization tae but prior intervention or surgery inflammation anatomic variant and vessel tortuosity may render an endovascular approach challenging timeconsuming and sometimes impossible we report two case of severe head and neck hemorrhage successfully embolized with nbutyl cyanoacrylate via direct puncture and propose this approach a a fast safe and effective alternative to tae
label: Non-Cancer

title: patient with cdg mutation reveal a role for human cdgamma in treg diversity and suppressive function
abstract: integrity of the tcell receptorcd complex is crucial for positive and negative selection of t cell in the thymus and for effector and regulatory function of peripheral t lymphocyte in human cdd cde and cdz gene defect are a cause of severe immune deficiency and present early in life with increased susceptibility to infection by contrast cdg mutation lead to milder phenotype mainly characterized by autoimmunity however the role of cdgamma in establishing and maintaining immune tolerance ha not been elucidated in this manuscript we aimed to investigate abnormality of tcell repertoire and function in patient with genetic defect in cdg associated with autoimmunity high throughput sequencing wa used to study composition and diversity of the tcell receptor beta trb repertoire in regulatory t cell tregs conventional cd tconv and cd t cell from patient with cdg mutation and healthy control treg function wa assessed by studying it ability to suppress proliferation of tconv cell treg cell of patient with cdg defect had reduced diversity increased clonality and reduced suppressive function the trb repertoire of tconv cell from patient with cdg deficiency wa enriched for hydrophobic amino acid at position and of the cdr a biomarker of selfreactivity these data demonstrate that the tcell repertoire of patient with cdg mutation is characterized by a molecular signature that may contribute to the increased rate of autoimmunity associated with this condition

title: a yearold male with extensive cerebral venous thrombosis clinicopathological correlation of a rare case
abstract: we present the autopsy finding and differential diagnosis of a yearold immunocompetent male patient who presented primarily with extensive cerebral vein thrombosis and wa found to have a rare association with jakvf mutation positivity
label: Non-Cancer

title: increased proteasomal activity support photoreceptor survival in inherited retinal degeneration
abstract: inherited retinal degeneration affecting more than million people worldwide are caused by mutation in over gene this suggests that the most efficient therapeutic strategy would be mutation independent ie targeting common pathological condition arising from many diseasecausing mutation previous study revealed that one such condition is an insufficiency of the ubiquitinproteasome system to process misfolded or mistargeted protein in affected photoreceptor cell we now report that retinal degeneration in mouse can be significantly delayed by increasing photoreceptor proteasomal activity the largest effect is observed upon overexpression of the s proteasome cap subunit paalpha which enhanced ubiquitinindependent protein degradation in photoreceptors applying this strategy to mouse bearing one copy of the ph rhodopsin mutant a mutation frequently encountered in human patient quadruple the number of surviving photoreceptors in the inferior retina of monthold mouse this striking therapeutic effect demonstrates that proteasomes are an attractive target for fighting inherited blindness
label: Non-Cancer

title: reconciling newborn screening and a novel splice variant in btd associated with partial biotinidase deficiency a babyseq project case report
abstract: here we report a newborn female infant from the wellbaby cohort of the babyseq project who wa identified with compound heterozygous btd gene variant the two identified variant included a wellestablished pathogenic variant cct pargcys that cause profound biotinidase deficiency btd in homozygosity in addition a novel splice variant cga p wa identified in the invariant splice donor region of intron potentially predictive of loss of function the novel variant wa predicted to impact splicing of exon however given the absence of any reported pathogenic variant in exon and the presence of alternative splicing with exon absent in most tissue in the gtex database we assigned an initial classification of uncertain significance followup medical record review of statemandated newborn screen nb result revealed an initial outofrange biotinidase activity level level from a repeat nb sample barely passed cutoff into the normal range to determine whether the infant wa biotinidasedeficient subsequent diagnostic enzyme activity testing wa performed confirming partial btd and resulted in a change of management for this patient this led to reclassification of the novel splice variant based on these result in conclusion combining the genetic and nb result together prompted clinical followup that confirmed partial btd and informed this novel splice site reclassification emphasizing the importance of combining iterative genetic and phenotypic evaluation
label: Non-Cancer

title: splenic cyst and it management in a monthold boy a rare complication of invasive meningococcal disease
abstract: splenic complication of invasive meningococcal disease imd are well recognised though cyst formation is rare particularly in paediatric population the best approach to their management is not yet established this case outline the management of a splenic cyst in a monthold boy following severe imd the case took place in the context of an acute emergence of serogroup w prompting significant medium attention and subsequent change in vaccination practice at a jurisdictional level in australia the patient wa critically unwell early in the illness then later a collection in the left upper quadrant wa detected shown on ultrasound to be a x cm splenic cyst in this case the cyst wa managed by ultrasoundguided drainage tube insertion the residual collection wa small and stable on subsequent imaging
label: Non-Cancer

title: apoptotic cellinduced ahr activity is required for immunological tolerance and suppression of systemic lupus erythematosus in mouse and human
abstract: the transcription factor ahr modulates immunity at multiple level here we report that phagocyte exposed to apoptotic cell exhibited rapid activation of ahr which drove production of the cytokine il activation of ahr wa dependent on interaction between apoptoticcell dna and the patternrecognition receptor tlr that wa required for the prevention of immune response to dna and histone in vivo moreover disease progression in mouse systemic lupus erythematosus sle correlated with strength of the ahr signal and the disease course could be altered by modulation of ahr activity deletion of ahr in the myeloid lineage caused systemic autoimmunity in mouse and an enhanced ahr transcriptional signature correlated with disease in patient with sle thus ahr activity induced by apoptotic cell phagocyte maintains peripheral tolerance
label: Non-Cancer

title: the rna binding protein ar support hematopoiesis at multiple level
abstract: recent biochemical characterization of arsenic resistance protein ar ha established it a central in determining the fate of nascent ribonucleic acid rna polymerase ii rnapii transcript through interaction with the nuclear methylguanosine capbinding complex ar promotes cotranscriptional processing coupled with nuclear export or degradation of several class of rnapii transcript allowing for gene expression program that facilitate rapid and sustained proliferation of immortalized cell in culture however rapidly dividing cell in culture do not represent the physiological condition of the vast majority of cell in an adult mammal to examine function of ar in a physiological setting we generated inducible ar knockout mouse and found that deletion of ar from adult mouse resulted in defective hematopoiesis in bone marrow and thymus importantly only some of this defect could be explained by the requirement of ar for rapid proliferation which we found to be celltype specific in vivo rather ar wa required for survival of developing thymocytes and for limiting differentiation of bone marrow resident longterm hematopoietic stem cell a a result ar knockout led to rapid thymic involution and loss of the ability of mouse to regenerate peripheral blood after myeloablation these in vivo data demonstrate that ar expression is important at several step of hematopoiesis likely because ar act on gene expression program underlying essential cell fate decision such a the decision to dieproliferate or differentiate
label: Non-Cancer

title: new approach to accurate interpretation of sickle cell disease newborn screening by applying multiple of median cutoff and ratio
abstract: background the main goal of newborn screening nb for sickle cell disease scd is to detect affected neonate so that specific preventive care can be implemented highperformance liquid chromatography hplc used for nb ha high sensitivity and specificity but we lack guideline for quantitative hemoglobin hb fraction interpretation the purpose of this study wa to determine cutoff value to standardize quantitative interpretation in scd nb for different clinical situation such a red blood cell transfusion or betathalassemia which can be real screening pitfall method retrospective study of sample from the neonatal screening program analyzed in our laboratory precise hba and hb percentage at birth were recorded and median value established for each gestational age allowing percentage result to be expressed in normal gestationspecific multiple of the median mom three threshold value of clinical interest were determined result high level of hba mom allowed identification of newborn who received transfusion low level of hb mom allowed detection of the association between hb and other mutation of the betaglobin gene ie hbhope betathalassemia etc an hbahbs ratio to distinguish healthy carrier from scd with sbetathalassemia the screening accuracy for each threshold wa established the screening accuracy of lowlevel hba which is determinant in identifying the subgroup of patient at risk of betathalassemia will be determined prospectively conclusion this new approach introduces tool for a quantitative interpretation in scd nb by hplc method and could allow standardization of interpretation between center
label: Non-Cancer

title: characterization of an activating rh insulinlike growth factor receptor variant in a male with extreme tall height
abstract: objective the insulinlike growth factor receptor igfr is important in growth and development and inactivating igfr mutation cause short stature and relatively high level of serum igfi we identified an unclassified igfrrh variant in a male with extreme tall height very low level of serum igfi and delayed and prolonged growth spurt the index case mother and three son all carried the variant but so far only the eldest son age year presented with tall height we hypothesized that the variant could constitute an activating mutation design the igfrrh variant wa investigated in igfr mouse embryonic fibroblast rcells by cell cycle colony formation and transcriptome analysis result the igfrrh r exhibited significantly increased cell proliferation g progression and colony formation in soft agar rna sequencing identified differentially expressed gene between rwt and r adjusted p e most gene were upregulated in r including the gene encoding the androgen receptor ar gene expression profiling showed the most significant enrichment in extracellular matrix organization p e collagen biosynthesis p e and cell adhesion p e retrospective biochemical analysis of the index case revealed decreased testosterone and sex hormonebinding globulin level whereas lh and fsh were within normal range this profile suggests an increased sensitivity to androgen which is compatible with the enhanced expression of ar in r cell conclusion our finding suggest that rh constitutes an activating igfr variant the possible deregulation of collagen turnover and increased androgen sensitivity implicates an association to tall phenotype in male carrier
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: characterization of an activating rh insulinlike growth factor receptor variant in a male with extreme tall height objective the insulinlike growth factor receptor igfr is important in growth and development and inactivating igfr mutation cause short stature and relatively high level of serum igfi we identified an unclassified igfrrh variant in a male with extreme tall height very low level of serum igfi and delayed and prolonged growth spurt the index case mother and three son all carried the variant but so far only the eldest son age year presented with tall height we hypothesized that the variant could constitute an activating mutation design the igfrrh variant wa investigated in igfr mouse embryonic fibroblast rcells by cell cycle colony formation and transcriptome analysis result the igfrrh r exhibited significantly increased cell proliferation g progression and colony formation in soft agar rna sequencing identified differentially expressed gene between rwt and r adjusted p e most gene were upregulated in r including the gene encoding the androgen receptor ar gene expression profiling showed the most significant enrichment in extracellular matrix organization p e collagen biosynthesis p e and cell adhesion p e retrospective biochemical analysis of the index case revealed decreased testosterone and sex hormonebinding globulin level whereas lh and fsh were within normal range this profile suggests an increased sensitivity to androgen which is compatible with the enhanced expression of ar in r cell conclusion our finding suggest that rh constitutes an activating igfr variant the possible deregulation of collagen turnover and increased androgen sensitivity implicates an association to tall phenotype in male carrier

title: yap control endothelial activation and vascular inflammation through traf
abstract: rationale microvascular inflammation and endothelial dysfunction secondary to unchecked activation of endothelium play a critical role in the pathophysiology of sepsis and organ failure the intrinsic signaling mechanism responsible for dampening excessive activation of endothelial cell are not completely understood objective to determine the central role of yap yesassociated protein the major transcriptional coactivator of the hippo pathway in modulating the strength and magnitude of endothelial activation and vascular inflammation method and result endothelialspecific yap knockout mouse showed increased basal expression of eselectin and icam intercellular adhesion molecule in endothelial cell a greater number of adherent neutrophil in postcapillary venule and increased neutrophil count in bronchoalveolar lavage fluid lipopolysaccharide challenge of these mouse augmented nfkappab nuclear factorkappab activation expression of endothelial adhesion protein neutrophil and monocyte adhesion to cremaster muscle venule transendothelial neutrophil migration and lung inflammatory injury deletion of yap in endothelial cell also markedly augmented the inflammatory response and cardiovascular dysfunction in a polymicrobial sepsis model induced by cecal ligation and puncture yap functioned by interacting with the e ubiquitinprotein ligase tlr tolllike receptor signaling adaptor traf tumor necrosis factor receptorassociated factor to ubiquitinate traf and thus promoted traf degradation and modification resulting in inhibition of nfkappab activation traf depletion in endothelial cell rescued the augmented inflammatory phenotype in mouse with endothelial cellspecific deletion of yap conclusion yap modulates the activation of endothelial cell and suppresses vascular inflammation through preventing trafmediated nfkappab activation and is hence essential for limiting the severity of sepsisinduced inflammation and organ failure
label: Non-Cancer

puncture yap functioned by interacting with the e ubiquitinprotein ligase tlr tolllike receptor signaling adaptor traf tumor necrosis factor receptorassociated factor to ubiquitinate traf and thus promoted traf degradation and modification resulting in inhibition of nfkappab activation traf depletion in endothelial cell rescued the augmented inflammatory phenotype in mouse with endothelial cellspecific deletion of yap conclusion yap modulates the activation of endothelial cell and suppresses vascular inflammation through preventing trafmediated nfkappab activation and is hence essential for limiting the severity of sepsisinduced inflammation and organ failure

title: distant insulin signaling regulates vertebrate pigmentation through the sheddase bace
abstract: patterning of vertebrate melanophores is essential for mate selection and protection from uvinduced damage patterning can be influenced by circulating longrange factor such a hormone but it is unclear how their activity is controlled in recipient cell to prevent excess in cell number and migration the zebrafish wanderlust mutant harbor a mutation in the sheddase bace and exhibit hyperdendritic and hyperproliferative melanophores that localize to aberrant site we performed a chemical screen to identify suppressor of the wanderlust phenotype and found that inhibition of insulinpikgammamtor signaling rescue the defect in normal physiology bace cleaves the insulin receptor whereas it loss result in hyperactive insulinpikmtor signaling insulin b an isoform enriched in the head drive the melanophore defect these result suggest that insulin signaling is negatively regulated by melanophorespecific expression of a sheddase highlighting how longdistance factor can be regulated in a celltypespecific manner
label: Non-Cancer

title: hypohidrotic ectodermal dysplasia clinical and molecular review
abstract: hypohidrotic ectodermal dysplasia hed is a genetic human disorder which affect structure of ectodermal origin although there are autosomal recessive and dominant form xlinked xl is the most frequent form of the disease this xlhed phenotype is associated with mutation in the gene encoding the transmembrane protein ectodysplasin eda a member of the tnfalpharelated signaling pathway the protein from this pathway are involved in signal transduction from ectoderm to mesenchyme leading to the development of ectodermderived structure in the fetus such a hair teeth skin nail and eccrine sweat gland the aim of this review wa to update the main clinical characteristic of hed regarding to recent molecular advance in the comprehension of all the possible gene involved in this group of disorder since it is known that edaaedar signaling ha multiple role in ectodermal organ development regulating their initiation morphogenesis and differentiation step the knowledge of the biological mechanism that generate hed is needed for both a better detection of possible case and for the design of efficient prevention and treatment approach
label: Non-Cancer

title: eltrombopag versus romiplostim in treatment of adult patient with immune thrombocytopenia a systematic review incorporating an indirectcomparison metaanalysis
abstract: purpose in absence of direct comparison randomized controlled trial rcts indirect comparison wa conducted to evaluate the efficacy and safety of thrombopoietinreceptor agonist tporas in treatment of adult immune thrombocytopenia itp method we searched pubmed embase and cochrane library clinical trialsgov china national knowledge infrastructure and chinese biomedical literature database from their earliest record to may rcts comparing the tporas with placebo in adult itp were included primary outcome were the overall response rate secondary outcome included safety durable response overall or clinically significant bleeding and the proportion of patient receiving rescue medication result nine randomized placebocontrolled trial participant were included in this systematic review overall response risk ratiorr confidence intervalci the incidence of adverse event rr ci durable response rr ci the incidence of overall bleeding rr ci and clinically significant bleeding rr ci and the proportion of patient receiving rescue treatment rr ci were similar between eltrombopag and romiplostim conclusion eltrombopag and romiplostim might be equivalent in efficacy and safety for adult itp however physician should still take into account drug cost and comorbidities of the specific patient while making decision on the treatment of itp with tporas registration prospero international prospective register of systematic review prospero crd
label: Non-Cancer

title: mtor complex signaling regulates the generation and function of central and effector foxp regulatory t cell
abstract: the mechanisticmammalian target of rapamycin mtor ha emerged a a critical integrator of signal from the immune microenvironment capable of regulating t cell activation differentiation and function the precise role of mtor in the control of regulatory t cell treg differentiation and function is complex pharmacologic inhibition and genetic deletion of mtor promotes the generation of tregs even under condition that would normally promote generation of effector t cell alternatively mtor activity ha been observed to be increased in tregs and the genetic deletion of the mtor complex mtorcscaffold protein raptor inhibits treg function in this study by employing both pharmacologic inhibitor and genetically altered t cell we seek to clarify the role of mtor in tregs our study demonstrate that inhibition of mtor during t cell activation promotes the generation of longlived central tregs with a memorylike phenotype in mouse metabolically these central memory tregs possess enhanced spare respiratory capacity similar to cd memory cell alternatively the generation of effector tregs etregs requires mtor function indeed genetic deletion of rptor lead to the decreased expression of icos and pd on the etregs overall our study define a subset of mtorchi etregs and mtorclo central tregs
label: Non-Cancer

title: in situ analysis of mtorc and cellular metabolismrelated protein in human lymphangioleiomyomatosis
abstract: lymphangioleiomyomatosis lam is a rare progressive cystic lung disease with feature of a lowgrade neoplasm it is primarily caused by mutation in tsc or tsc gene sirolimus an inhibitor of mtor complex mtorc slows down disease progression in some but not all patient hitherto other potential therapeutic target such a mtor complex mtorc and various metabolic pathway have not been investigated in human lam tissue the aim of this study wa to assess activity of mtorc mtorc and various metabolic pathway in human lam tissue through analysis of protein expression immunohistochemical analysis of p mtorc downstream protein rictor mtorc scaffold protein a well a glut gapdh atpb gls mct acss and cpta metabolic pathway marker were performed on lung tissue from patient with sporadic lam immunoreactivity wa assessed in lam cell with bronchial smooth muscle cell a control expression of p rictor gapdh gls mct acss and cpta wa significantly higher in lam cell than in bronchial smooth muscle cell p no significant difference were found between lam cell and normal bronchial smooth muscle cell in glut and atpb expression the result are uniquely derived from human tissue and indicate that in addition to mtorc mtorc may also play an important role in the pathobiology of lam furthermore glutaminolysis acetate utilization and fatty acid betaoxidation appear to be the preferred bioenergetic pathway in lam cell mtorc and these preferred bioenergetic pathway appear worthy of further study a they may represent possible therapeutic target in the treatment of lam
label: Non-Cancer

title: cdhladr regulatory t cell change with aging they increase in number but lose checkpoint inhibitory molecule and suppressive function
abstract: cd regulatory t cell have been intensively studied during aging but little is still known about agerelated change of other regulatory t cell subset it wa therefore the goal of the present study to analyze cdhuman leukocyte antigenantigen d related hladr t cell in old age a cell population reported to have suppressive activity and to be connected to specific genetic variant we demonstrate a strong increase in the number of cdhladr t cell with age in a cohort of female sardinian a well a in elderly male and female person from austria we also show that cdhladr t cell lack classical activation molecule such a cd and cd but contain increased number of checkpoint inhibitory molecule such a cytotoxic t lymphocyteassociated antigen t cell immunoglobulin and mucin protein lag and pd when compared with their hladr counterpart they also have the capacity to inhibit the proliferation of autologous peripheral blood mononuclear cell this suppressive activity is however decreased when cdhladr t cell from elderly person are analyzed in accordance with this finding cdhladr t cell from person of old age contain lower percentage of checkpoint inhibitory molecule than young control we conclude that in spite of high abundance of a cd regulatory t cell subset in old age it expression of checkpoint inhibitory molecule and it suppressive function on a per cell basis are reduced reduction of suppressive capacity may support uncontrolled subclinical inflammatory process referred to a inflammaging
label: Non-Cancer

title: calcification in cerebral parenchyma affect pharmacoresistant epilepsy in tuberous sclerosis
abstract: purpose tuberous sclerosis tsc is an autosomal dominant inherited disease caused by mutation in the tsc or tsc gene and result in the overactivation of the mammalian target of the rapamycin mtor signaling pathway rapamycin an mtor inhibitor is clinically used to treat hamartomatous lesionsas in tsc and it effect on controlling epilepsy is also reported in many study this study aim to evaluate the risk factor of pharmacoresistant epilepsy in patient with tsc receiving longterm rapamycin treatment method a total of patient with tsc taking rapamycin for over year were enrolled in this study factor that might influence seizure control were statistically analyzed by multiple factor analysis a subgroup analysis wa also conducted to access the relationship between calcified epileptic focus and pharmacoresistant epilepsy clinical trial registration number chictroob result seizure wa controlled in patient but wa not managed in patient considered to be drug resistant logistic regression analysis showed that calcification in the cerebral parenchyma wa a risk factor of pharmacoresistant epilepsy p odds ratio or fifteen of patient with calcified epileptic focus suffered from pharmacoresistant epilepsy seizure in patient with calcified epileptic focus were probably pharmacoresistant p conclusion calcification in epileptic focus strongly indicates pharmacoresistant epilepsy in patient with tsc even when treated with appropriate antiepilepsy drug aeds and rapamycin calcification can be used to evaluate pharmacoresistant epilepsy in patient with tsc
label: Non-Cancer

title: analysis of shared heritability in common disorder of the brain
abstract: disorder of the brain can exhibit considerable epidemiological comorbidity and often share symptom provoking debate about their etiologic overlap we quantified the genetic sharing of brain disorder from genomewide association study of patient and control participant and assessed their relationship to phenotype from individual psychiatric disorder share common variant risk whereas neurological disorder appear more distinct from one another and from the psychiatric disorder we also identified significant sharing between disorder and a number of brain phenotype including cognitive measure further we conducted simulation to explore how statistical power diagnostic misclassification and phenotypic heterogeneity affect genetic correlation these result highlight the importance of common genetic variation a a risk factor for brain disorder and the value of heritabilitybased method in understanding their etiology
label: Non-Cancer

title: membranebound and soluble form of an nmda receptor extracellular domain retain epitope targeted in autoimmune encephalitis
abstract: background antinmda receptor encephalitis anre is a potentially lethal disease attributed to autoantibody against the nmethyldaspartate receptor nmdar full recovery is possible if therapy is initiated early in the disease course detection of anre antibody in the cerebrospinal fluid csf is essential for diagnosis the assay for anreassociated igg often rely on cell transiently transfected with nmdar gene a cell line that stably express pathogenic nmdar epitope could improve standardization of the assay and provide antigen that could be used in commercial solid state assay system result we expressed the amino terminal domain atd of the glun nmdar subunit nr a a fusion protein on the outer plasma membrane of t cell creating a stable cell population tatd that is recognized by anre patient monoclonal antibody in flow cytometry and immunofluorescence assay the atd fusion protein also contains a myc tag and a xhis tag which provide functionality for immunoassay and antigen purification and a tev protease site which allows the atd domain to be specifically released from the cell in essentially pure form atd mobilized from the t atd cell line maintained the pathogenic anre epitope in elisa binding assay csf and serum from anre patient also bound the tatd cell line whereas normal csf and serum did not conclusion the tatd cell line is potentially adaptable to a variety of format to identify antibody associated with anre including cellbased and soluble antigen format and demonstrates a useful method to produce complex protein for research drug discovery and clinical diagnosis
label: Non-Cancer

title: t nk il receptor gamma chain mutation a challenging diagnosis of atypical severe combined immunodeficiency
abstract: purpose all reported patient with hypomorphic xlinked severe combined immunodeficiency xscid due to cct prc mutation in the gene ilrg encoding the common gamma chain gammac have presented with opportunistic infection within the first year of life despite the presence of nearly normal nk and t cell number reporting five child of one extended family with hemizygous mutation in ilrg we explore potential diagnostic clue and extend our comprehension of the functional impact of this mutation method whole exome sequencing wes detailed immune phenotyping cytokineinduced stat phosphorylation b t and nk cell activation and quantification of sjtrecs in five arab child with cct prc ilrg mutation result the mean age at clinical presentation with respiratory tract infection or diarrhea wa range month none of the child presented with opportunistic infection diagnostic clue were early onset in the first year of life and a suggestive family history associated with reduced naive cd t cell and absent switched memory b cell number and phenotype of nk cell and innatelike lymphocyte were normal the diagnosis wa made by wes and corroborated by absent stat phosphorylation and reduced functional response after il and il stimulation four patient underwent successful hematopoietic stem cell transplantation conclusion a early diagnosis and treatment are important a high index of suspicion in the diagnosis of cct prc xscid is needed this requires prompt genetic testing by next generation sequencing in order to avoid unnecessary delay in the definite diagnosis since immunological work up may not be discriminating assay directly testing cytokine signaling or cytokinedependent function are helpful in confirming the functional impact of the identified hypomorphic variant
label: Non-Cancer

title: genotypephenotype correlation in type neurofibromatosis pmetdel mutation and milder disease
abstract: a few genotypephenotype correlation have been described in type neurofibromatosis one deletion pmetdel seems to be responsible for a mild form of the condition in which there is absence of externally visible neurofibroma we report a mother and a son with this mutation

title: inherited pphox deficiency differs from classic chronic granulomatous disease
abstract: biallelic lossoffunction lof mutation of the ncf gene encoding the pphox subunit of the phagocyte nadph oxidase have been described in only patient we report on pphoxdeficient patient from additional family in country these patient display different inframe or outofframe mutation of ncf that are homozygous in of the family and compound heterozygous in another when overexpressed in nb neutrophillike cell and ebvtransformed b cell in vitro the mutant allele were found to be lof with the exception of the prc and cdel allele which were hypomorphic particleinduced nadph oxidase activity wa severely impaired in the patient neutrophil whereas pmainduced dihydrorhodamine dhr oxidation which is widely used a a diagnostic test for chronic granulomatous disease cgd wa normal or mildly impaired in the patient moreover the nadph oxidase activity of ebvtransformed b cell wa also severely impaired whereas that of mononuclear phagocyte wa normal finally the killing of candida albicans and aspergillus fumigatus hypha by neutrophil wa conserved in these patient unlike in patient with cgd the patient suffer from hyperinflammation and peripheral infection but they do not have any of the invasive bacterial or fungal infection seen in cgd inherited pphox deficiency underlies a distinctive condition resembling a mild atypical form of cgd
label: Non-Cancer

title: mechanism for remodelling of the cell cycle checkpoint protein mad by the atpase trip
abstract: the maintenance of genome stability during mitosis is coordinated by the spindle assembly checkpoint sac through it effector the mitotic checkpoint complex mcc an inhibitor of the anaphasepromoting complex apcc also known a the cyclosome unattached kinetochore control mcc assembly by catalysing a change in the topology of the betasheet of mad an mcc subunit thereby generating the active closed mad cmad conformer disassembly of free mcc which is required for sac inactivation and chromosome segregation is an atpdependent process driven by the aaa atpase trip in combination with pcomet an sac antagonist trip remodels cmad into inactive open mad omad here we present a mechanism that explains how trippcomet disassembles the mcc cryoelectron microscopy structure of the trippcometcmadcdc complex reveal that pcomet recruit cmad to a defined site on the trip hexameric ring positioning the n terminus of cmad madnt to insert into the axial pore of trip and distorting the trip ring to initiate remodelling molecular modelling suggests that by gripping madnt within it axial pore trip couple sequential atpdriven translocation of it hexameric ring along madnt to push upwards on and simultaneously rotate the globular domain of the pcometcmad complex this unwinds a region of the alphaa helix of cmad that is required to stabilize the cmad betasheet thus destabilizing cmad in favour of omad and dissociating mad from pcomet our study provides insight into how specific substrate are recruited to aaa atpases through adaptor protein and suggests a model of how translocation through the axial pore of aaa atpases is coupled to protein remodelling
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: mechanism for remodelling of the cell cycle checkpoint protein mad by the atpase trip the maintenance of genome stability during mitosis is coordinated by the spindle assembly checkpoint sac through it effector the mitotic checkpoint complex mcc an inhibitor of the anaphasepromoting complex apcc also known a the cyclosome unattached kinetochore control mcc assembly by catalysing a change in the topology of the betasheet of mad an mcc subunit thereby generating the active closed mad cmad conformer disassembly of free mcc which is required for sac inactivation and chromosome segregation is an atpdependent process driven by the aaa atpase trip in combination with pcomet an sac antagonist trip remodels cmad into inactive open mad omad here we present a mechanism that explains how trippcomet disassembles the mcc cryoelectron microscopy structure of the trippcometcmadcdc complex reveal that pcomet recruit cmad to a defined site on the trip hexameric ring positioning the n terminus of cmad madnt to insert into the axial pore of trip and distorting the trip ring to initiate remodelling molecular modelling suggests that by gripping madnt within it axial pore trip couple sequential atpdriven translocation of it hexameric ring along madnt to push upwards on and simultaneously rotate the globular domain of the pcometcmad complex this unwinds a region of the alphaa helix of cmad that is required to stabilize the cmad betasheet thus destabilizing cmad in favour of omad and dissociating mad from pcomet our study provides insight into how specific substrate are recruited to aaa atpases through adaptor protein and suggests a model of how translocation through the axial pore of aaa atpases is coupled to protein remodelling

title: type von willebrand disease in indiaclinical spectrum and molecular profile
abstract: introduction type von willebrand disease vwd is the rare and most severe form of vwd which result from a nearcomplete deficiency of the von willebrand factor vwf this study evaluates in detail the molecular pathology of type vwd in india one hundred and two patient from family were evaluated patient and method phenotypic data including bleeding score b were documented using structured questionnaire diagnosis of type vwd wa based on undetectable vwf antigen level in the plasma genomic dna from these patient wa screened for mutation in vwf gene structural modeling and expression study were carried out for missense mutation result out of patient mutation could be identified in n fiftyfive different gene variant were identified thirtyfour were novel mutation could be identified in both the allele in patient while no causative mutation could be identified in patient twentyfour patient had mutation clustered in the propeptide region of vwf interestingly five mutation accounted for the defect in patient structural analysis and in vitro study on missense mutation imply impaired process associated with secretion of vwf conclusion this study is one of the largest series to define the molecular basis of type vwd
label: Non-Cancer

title: cutaneous mastocytosis in adult and child new classification and prognostic factor
abstract: the skin is one of the most frequent tissue affected in patient with mastocytosis but cutaneous lesion are highly heterogeneous in shape size color number localization and distribution the world health organization recognizes subtypes of cutaneous mastocytosis cm maculopapular cm mpcm diffuse cm and mastocytoma of skin an international task force of expert in mastocytosis ha recently proposed subdividing mpcm into monomorphic and polymorphic which could predict the duration of the disease in child more research is warranted to develop an improved classification of cm that ideally should incorporate robust factor with prognostic impact on disease behavior

title: bone marrow expression of mast cell disorder
abstract: mast cell disorder comprise a heterogeneous group of rare disease the diagnosis of which still remains a challenge bone marrow analysis constitutes the most appropriate site for screening systemic involvement in mastocytosis morphologic immunohistochemical flow cytometric immunophenotyping and molecular study should be routinely performed for diagnosticprognostic purpose in experienced reference center during the diagnostic workup in suspected systemic mastocytosis the author review the most relevant characteristic of bone marrow expression of mast cell disorder a well a the different methodological approach to be applied to perform an objective and reproducible diagnosis and classification of mastocytosis and other mast cell disorder

title: generation of cd fluorescent reporter human induced pluripotent stem cell for monitoring hematopoietic differentiation
abstract: hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell hspcs derived from human induced pluripotent stem cell hipscs hold great promise for disease modeling drug screen and eventually cell therapy approach during in vitro differentiation of hipscs into hematoendothelial progenitor the emergence of cdpositive cell indicates a critical step of lineage specification to facilitate the monitoring of hematopoietic differentiation of hipscs we established fluorescent reporter cell for the stem and progenitor cell marker cd an iresgfp internal ribosome entry site green fluorescent protein construct wa introduced by crisprcas into the untranslated region of one endogenous cd allele singlecell clone were generated after excision of the floxed puromycin resistance cassette by cre recombination and correct insertion wa confirmed by genotyping polymerase chain reaction and southern blot to validate their functionality the reporter hipscs were in vitro differentiated toward cd cell using the stemdiff hematopoietic kit combined with shortterm inhibition of gsk glycogen synthase kinase all cell expressing nuclear gfp were positive for cell surface cd thus allowing the direct monitoring of the differentiation of hipscs into cd cell either by flow cytometry or confocal microscopy after fluorescenceactivated cell sorting cell displaying high gfp expression exhibited increased colonyforming potential in the methocult colonyforming unit assay a compared with cd cell obtained by magneticactivated cell sorting in summary we have generated functional cd gfp reporter hipscs which not only permit labelfree separation of hspcs but also tracing of the emergence and fate of cd progenitor at the singlecell level
label: Non-Cancer

title: toxoplasma gondii chromosomal passenger complex is essential for the organization of a functional mitotic spindle a prerequisite for productive endodyogeny
abstract: the phylum apicomplexa encompasses deadly pathogen such a malaria and cryptosporidium apicomplexa cell division is mechanistically divergent from that of their mammalian host potentially representing an attractive source of drug target depending on the specie apicomplexan parasite can modulate the output of cell division producing two to thousand of daughter cell at once the inherent flexibility of their cell division mechanism allows these parasite to adapt to different niche facilitating their dissemination toxoplasma gondii tachyzoites divide using a unique form of cell division called endodyogeny this process involves a single round of dna replication closed nuclear mitosis and assembly of two daughter cell within a mother in higher eukaryote the foursubunit chromosomal passenger complex cpc aurora kinase b arkbincenpborealinsurvivin promotes chromosome biorientation by detaching incorrect kinetochoremicrotubule attachment playing an essential role in controlling cell division fidelity herein we report the characterization of the toxoplasma cpc aurora kinase arkincenpincenp we show that the cpc exhibit dynamic localization in a cell cycledependent manner tgark interacts with both tgincenps with tgincenp being essential for it translocation to the nucleus while tgincenp appears to be dispensable interfering with tgark or tgincenp result in pronounced division and growth defect significant anticancer drug development effort have focused on targeting human arkb parasite treatment with low dos of hesperadin a known inhibitor of human arkb at higher concentration phenocopies the tgark and tgincenp mutant overall our study provides new insight into the mechanism underpinning cell cycle control in apicomplexa and highlight tgark a potential drug target
label: Non-Cancer

title: myelofibrosis treatment algorithm
abstract: two novel prognostic system for primary myelofibrosis pmf were recently unveiled gipss genetically inspired prognostic scoring system and mips mutationenhanced international prognostic scoring system for transplantage patient gipss is based exclusively on genetic marker mutation and karyotype mips includes mutation and clinical risk factor in it most recent adaptation the prognostic value of mips ha been bolstered by the inclusion of a threetiered cytogenetic risk stratification and use of hemoglobin threshold that are adjusted for sex and severity mips version gipss feature four mips three and mips version five risk category mips is most useful in the absence of cytogenetic information mips version is more comprehensive than mips and is the preferred model in the presence of cytogenetic information both mips and mips version require an online score calculator httpwwwmipssscoreit gipps offer a lower complexity prognostic tool that reliably identifies candidate for allogeneic stem cell transplant gipss highrisk disease or longterm observation with little or no therapeutic intervention gipss lowrisk disease ultimately we favor a stepwise prognostication approach that start with gipss but also considers mips version for confirming the most appropriate treatment approach for the individual patient
label: Non-Cancer

title: bioengineered pbgd variant improves the therapeutic index of gene therapy vector for acute intermittent porphyria
abstract: a firstinhuman gene therapy trial using a recombinant adenoassociated viral raav vector for acute intermittent porphyria aip reveals that higher dos would be required to reach therapeutic level of the porphobilinogen deaminase pbgd transgene we developed a hyperfunctional pbgd protein to improve the therapeutic index without increasing vector dose a consensus protein sequence from mammal specie wa compared to the human pbgd sequence and eight amino acid were selected im and n variant showed the highest increase in enzymatic activity when expressed in prokaryotic and eukaryotic system in silico analysis indicates that isoleucine to methionine and asparagine to serine variant did not affect the active site of the enzyme in vitro analysis indicated a synergistic interaction between these two substitution that improve kinetic stability finally full protection against a phenobarbitalinduced attack wa achieved in aip mouse after the administration of x gckg of raavpbgdimns vector three time lower than the dose required to achieve full protection with the control raavhpbgd vector in conclusion we have developed and characterized a hyperfunctional pbgd protein the inclusion of this variant sequence in a raav vector allows the effective dose to be lowered in aip mouse
label: Non-Cancer

title: rna binding protein hur regulates extracellular matrix gene expression and ph homeostasis independent of controlling hifalpha signaling in nucleus pulposus cell
abstract: nucleus pulposus np cell reside in the hypoxic niche of the intervertebral disc study have demonstrated that rnabinding protein hur modulates hypoxic signaling in several cancer however it function in the disc is unknown hur did not show cytoplasmic translocation in hypoxia and it silencing did not alter level of hifalpha or hiftargets in np cell rnasequencing data revealed that important extracellular matrixrelated gene including several collagen mmps aggrecan tgfbeta and sdc were regulated by hur further analysis of hursilenced np cell confirmed that hur maintained expression of these matrix gene we confirmed decreased level of secreted collagen i and sdc and increased prommp in hurknockdown cell in addition messenger ribonucleoprotein immunoprecipitation demonstrated hur binding to tgfbeta and sdc mrna interestingly while hur bound to hifalpha and vegf mrna it wa clear that compensatory mechanism sustained their expression when hur wa silenced noteworthy despite the presence of multiple hurbinding site and reported interaction in other cell type hur showed no binding to pgk eno pdk and pfkfb in np cell metabolic study showed a significant decrease in the extracellular acidification rate ecar and mitochondrial oxygen consumption rate ocr and acidic ph in hursilenced np cell without appreciable change in total ocr these change were likely due to decreased ca expression in hur silenced cell taken together our study demonstrates for the first time that hur regulates extracellular matrix ecm and ph homeostasis of np cell and ha important implication in the maintenance of intervertebral disc health
label: Non-Cancer

title: everolimus in infant with tuberous sclerosis complexrelated west syndrome first result from a singlecenter prospective observational study
abstract: tuberous sclerosis complex tsc is the most common cause of west syndrome w currently available treatment option are ineffective in the majority of affected infant andor associated with potential serious side effect based on the assumption that mtor overactivation result in increased neuroexcitability in tsc mtor inhibitor have been studied a antiseizure therapy a a result everolimus recently received approval for the adjunctive treatment of patient aged year with refractory tscassociated focal and secondary generalized seizure however efficacy and safety data for infant with tscassociated w are still lacking therefore a prospective openlabel observational study wa initiated at our center to evaluate everolimus addon treatment in infant with tscassociated w previously refractory to standard treatment for this preliminary report data from four male infant with tsc and a median observation period of range month after treatment initiation were analyzed two infant showed electroclinical remission until day after everolimus treatment initiation in one additional infant hypsarrhythmia resolved no relapse after initial response wa documented developmental progress improved in three infant tolerability wa similar to that described in older child according to our preliminary result everolimus appears to have the potential to treat successfully both spasm and hypsarrhythmia in infant with tscassociated w contributing to better developmental progress
label: Non-Cancer

title: tension haemothorax from a bleeding branch of the renal artery following isolated penetrating thoracic trauma a rare presentation
abstract: a yearold man presented to a major trauma centre with two posterolateral thoracic stab injury over the right scapula and thoracoabdominal junction he wa tachycardic and hypotensive with a chest xray revealing a large rightsided tension haemothorax requiring insertion of two intercostal chest drain a subsequent ct scan demonstrated a grade right kidney laceration with active back bleeding from a renal artery branch through a right diaphragmatic defect into the pleural cavity embolisation of the feeding renal vessel controlled the bleeding and avoided the need for a nephrectomy the patient required subsequent videoassisted thoracoscopic evacuation of the haemothorax and diaphragmatic repair confirming that there wa no associated lung or major vessel injury a ureteric stent wa ultimately inserted to manage a persistent urinary leak this case highlight a rare cause for a common traumatic presentation and the need for a multidisciplinary approach in effective management of complex multiorgan trauma
label: Non-Cancer
