title: a case of growth hormone deficiency combined with neurofibromatosis type and it gene analysis
abstract: neurofibromatosis type nf is an autosomal dominant genetic disorder caused by nf gene mutation cafe au lait spot neurofibromatosis lisch nodule axillary freckling dermal neurofibroma and skeletal dysplasia are the most common manifestation for this disease a yearold boy visited third xiangya hospital central south university due to growthretardation he wa eventually diagnosed a nf with growth hormone deficiency a novel heterozygous splicing mutation c tc iv tc of nf gene wa identified in the patient and his mother considering nf may present with short stature due to growth hormone deficiency all child with short stature combined with cafe au lait spot should be screened for nf which may assist the clinical diagnosis and the genetic counseling
label: Non-Cancer

title: distinct systemic microbiome and microbial translocation are associated with plasma level of anticd autoantibody in hiv infection
abstract: microbial signal have been linked to autoantibody induction recently we found that purified anticd autoantibody from the plasma of chronic hivinfected patient under viralsuppressed antiretroviral therapy art play a pathologic role in poor cd t cell recovery the purpose of the study wa to investigate the association of systemic microbiome and anticd autoantibody production in hiv plasma microbiome from healthy control and hivinfected subject under viralsuppressed art were analyzed by miseq sequencing plasma level of autoantibody and microbial translocation lp total bacterial s rdna soluble cd and lp binding protein were analyzed by elisa limulus amebocyte assay and qpcr we found that plasma level of anticd igg but not anticd igg wa increased in hiv subject compared to healthy control hiv subject with plasma anticd igg ngml high had reduced microbial diversity compared to hiv subject with anticd igg ngml low moreover plasma anticd igg level wa associated with elevated microbial translocation and reduced microbial diversity in hiv subject the alphaproteobacteria class wa significantly enriched in hiv subject with low anticd igg compared to patient with high anticd igg even after controlling for false discovery rate fdr the microbial component were different from the phylum to genus level in hiv subject with high anticd igg compared to the other two group but these difference were not significant after controlling for fdr these result suggest that systemic microbial translocation and microbiome may associate with anticd autoantibody production in arttreated hiv disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: scid genotype and month posttransplant cd count predict survival and immune recovery
abstract: the primary immune deficiency treatment consortium pidtc performed a retrospective analysis of patient with severe combined immunodeficiency scid who received a hematopoietic cell transplantation hct a firstline treatment between and in north american institution overall survival wa higher after hct from matchedsibling donor msds among recipient of nonmsd hct multivariate analysis showed that the scid genotype strongly influenced survival and immune reconstitution overall survival wa similar for patient with rag ilrg or jak defect and wa significantly better compared with patient with ada or dclrec mutation patient with rag or dclrec mutation had poorer immune reconstitution than other genotype although survival did not correlate with the type of conditioning regimen recipient of reducedintensity or myeloablative conditioning had a lower incidence of treatment failure and better t and bcell reconstitution but a higher risk for graftversushost disease compared with those receiving no conditioning or immunosuppression only infectionfree status and younger age at hct were associated with improved survival typical scid leaky scid and omenn syndrome had similar outcome landmark analysis identified cd and cdcdra cell count at and month posthct a biomarkers predictive of overall survival and longterm tcell reconstitution our data emphasize the need for patienttailored treatment strategy depending upon the underlying scid genotype the prognostic significance of cd cell count a early a month after hct emphasizes the importance of close followup of immune reconstitution to identify patient who may need additional intervention to prevent poor longterm outcome
label: Non-Cancer

title: inheritance of oct predetermines fate choice in human embryonic stem cell
abstract: it is well known that clonal cell can make different fate decision but it is unclear whether these decision are determined during or before a cell own lifetime here we engineered an endogenous fluorescent reporter for the pluripotency factor oct to study the timing of differentiation decision in human embryonic stem cell by tracking singlecell oct level over multiple cell cycle generation we found that the decision to differentiate is largely determined before the differentiation stimulus is presented and can be predicted by a cell preexisting oct signaling pattern we further quantified how maternal oct level were transmitted to and distributed between daughter cell a mother cell underwent division newly established oct level in daughter cell rapidly became more predictive of final oct expression status these result imply that the choice between developmental cell fate can be largely predetermined at the time of cell birth through inheritance of a pluripotency factor
label: Non-Cancer

title: loss of placental growth factor ameliorates maternal hypertension and preeclampsia in mouse
abstract: preeclampsia remains a clinical challenge due to it poorly understood pathogenesis a prevailing notion is that increased placental production of soluble fmslike tyrosine kinase sflt cause the maternal syndrome by inhibiting proangiogenic placental growth factor plgf and vegf however the significance of plgf suppression in preeclampsia is uncertain to test whether preeclampsia result from the imbalance of angiogenic factor reflected by an abnormal sfltplgf ratio we studied plgf ko pgf mouse and noted that the mouse did not develop sign or sequela of preeclampsia despite a marked elevation in circulating sflt notably plgf ko mouse had morphologically distinct placenta showing an accumulation of junctional zone glycogen we next considered the role of placental plgf in an established model of preeclampsia pregnant catecholomethyltransferasedeficient comtdeficient mouse by generating mouse with deletion in both the pgf and comt gene deletion of placental plgf in the context of comt loss resulted in a reduction in maternal blood pressure and increased placental glycogen indicating that loss of plgf might be protective against the development of preeclampsia these result identify a role for plgf in placental development and support a complex model for the pathogenesis of preeclampsia beyond an angiogenic factor imbalance
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: loss of placental growth factor ameliorates maternal hypertension and preeclampsia in mouse preeclampsia remains a clinical challenge due to it poorly understood pathogenesis a prevailing notion is that increased placental production of soluble fmslike tyrosine kinase sflt cause the maternal syndrome by inhibiting proangiogenic placental growth factor plgf and vegf however the significance of plgf suppression in preeclampsia is uncertain to test whether preeclampsia result from the imbalance of angiogenic factor reflected by an abnormal sfltplgf ratio we studied plgf ko pgf mouse and noted that the mouse did not develop sign or sequela of preeclampsia despite a marked elevation in circulating sflt notably plgf ko mouse had morphologically distinct placenta showing an accumulation of junctional zone glycogen we next considered the role of placental plgf in an established model of preeclampsia pregnant catecholomethyltransferasedeficient comtdeficient mouse by generating mouse with deletion in both the pgf and comt gene deletion of placental plgf in the context of comt loss resulted in a reduction in maternal blood pressure and increased placental glycogen indicating that loss of plgf might be protective against the development of preeclampsia these result identify a role for plgf in placental development and support a complex model for the pathogenesis of preeclampsia beyond an angiogenic factor imbalance

title: baloxavir marboxil for uncomplicated influenza in adult and adolescent
abstract: background baloxavir marboxil is a selective inhibitor of influenza capdependent endonuclease it ha shown therapeutic activity in preclinical model of influenza a and b virus infection including strain resistant to current antiviral agent method we conducted two randomized doubleblind controlled trial involving otherwise healthy outpatient with acute uncomplicated influenza after a title: suppression of wntbetacatenin signaling by egf receptor is required for hair follicle development
abstract: mouse that lack the epidermal growth factor receptor egfr fail to develop a hair coat but the mechanism responsible for this deficit is not completely understood here we show that egfr play a critical role to attenuate winglesstype mmtv integration site family member wntbetacatenin signaling during postnatal hair follicle development genetic ablation of egfr in mouse resulted in increased mitotic activity in matrix cell apoptosis in hair follicle and impaired differentiation of epithelial lineage that form hair egfr is activated in wildtype hair follicle stem cell marked with sox or nfatc and is essential to restrain proliferation and support stem cell number and their quiescence we observed elevated level of wnt b a b and transcript and hyperactivation of the betacatenin pathway in egfr knockout follicle using primary keratinocytes we linked ligandinduced egfr activation to suppression of nascent mrna synthesis of wnt gene overexpression of the wnt antagonist sfrp in mouse lacking egfr demonstrated that elevated wnts are a major cause for the hair follicle defect colocalization of transforming growth factor alpha and wnts regulated by egfr in stem cell and progeny indicates that egfr autocrine loop control wnts our finding define a novel mechanism that integrates egfr and wntbetacatenin pathway to coordinate the delicate balance between proliferation and differentiation during development
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: suppression of wntbetacatenin signaling by egf receptor is required for hair follicle development mouse that lack the epidermal growth factor receptor egfr fail to develop a hair coat but the mechanism responsible for this deficit is not completely understood here we show that egfr play a critical role to attenuate winglesstype mmtv integration site family member wntbetacatenin signaling during postnatal hair follicle development genetic ablation of egfr in mouse resulted in increased mitotic activity in matrix cell apoptosis in hair follicle and impaired differentiation of epithelial lineage that form hair egfr is activated in wildtype hair follicle stem cell marked with sox or nfatc and is essential to restrain proliferation and support stem cell number and their quiescence we observed elevated level of wnt b a b and transcript and hyperactivation of the betacatenin pathway in egfr knockout follicle using primary keratinocytes we linked ligandinduced egfr activation to suppression of nascent mrna synthesis of wnt gene overexpression of the wnt antagonist sfrp in mouse lacking egfr demonstrated that elevated wnts are a major cause for the hair follicle defect colocalization of transforming growth factor alpha and wnts regulated by egfr in stem cell and progeny indicates that egfr autocrine loop control wnts our finding define a novel mechanism that integrates egfr and wntbetacatenin pathway to coordinate the delicate balance between proliferation and differentiation during development

title: hepatic agomediated rna silencing control energy metabolism linked to ampk activation and obesityassociated pathophysiology
abstract: rna silencing inhibits mrna translation while mrna translation account for the majority of cellular energy expenditure it is unclear if rna silencing regulates energy homeostasis here we report that hepatic argonaute agomediated rna silencing regulates both intrinsic energy production and consumption and disturbs energy metabolism in the pathogenesis of obesity ago regulates expression of specific mirnas including mir mir and mira causing metabolic disruption while simultaneously suppressing the expression of gene regulating glucose and lipid metabolism including hnfbeta cav and ampka liverspecific agodeletion enhances mitochondrial oxidation and atp consumption associated with mrna translation which result in ampk activation and improves obesityassociated pathophysiology notably hepatic agodeficiency improves glucose metabolism in condition of insulin receptor antagonist treatment highfat diet challenge and hepatic ampkalphadeletion the regulation of energy metabolism by ago provides a novel paradigm in which rna silencing play an integral role in determining basal metabolic activity in obesityassociated sequela
label: Non-Cancer

title: the italian mastocytosis registry year experience from a hospitalbased registry
abstract: aim we collected reallife data on the management of patient with mastocytosis in the italian mastocytosis registry method six hundred patient diagnosed with mastocytosis between and were included from center result among adult n patient were diagnosed with systemic mastocytosis in adult no bone marrow study were performed resulting in a provisional diagnosis of mastocytosis of the skin this diagnosis wa most frequently established in nonhematologic center in total pediatric patient had cutaneous mastocytosis we confirmed that in the most patient with systemic mastocytosis serum tryptase level were ngml and kit dv wa detectable conclusion the italian mastocytosis registry revealed some centerspecific approach for diagnosis and therapy epidemiological evidence on this condition is provided
label: Non-Cancer

title: functional monoamine oxidase b gene intron polymorphism predicts putaminal dopamine turnover in de novo parkinson disease
abstract: objective the objective of this study wa to evaluate the effect of common functional polymorphism in gene involved in dopamine metabolism on striatal dopamine turnover in de novo parkinson disease pd method this wa an observerblinded cohort study investigating effect of common functional polymorphism in dopa decarboxylase ddc r monoamine oxidase b maob r catecholomethyltransferase comt r and dopamine transportersolute carrier family member datslca variable number tandem repeat gene on ffluorodopa uptake and an effective distribution volume ratio inverse of dopamine turnover measured by ffluorodopa pet in untreated pd patient result patient carrying the maobcccct genotype lowintermediate enzyme activity had a lower dopamine turnover in the putamen higher mean effective distribution volume ratio when compared with patient with maobttt genotype high enzyme activity striatal pet measure were not different between variant in the remaining gene conclusion the maob r polymorphism predicts putaminal dopamine turnover in early pd with the maobtt allele linked to high enzyme activity leading to higher intrinsic dopamine turnover which ha been demonstrated to constitute a risk factor for motor complication the author movement disorder published by wiley periodical inc on behalf of international parkinson and movement disorder society
label: Non-Cancer

title: influenza hemagglutinin membrane anchor
abstract: virus with membrane fuse them with cellular membrane to transfer their genome into cell at the beginning of infection for influenza virus the membrane glycoprotein involved in fusion is the hemagglutinin ha the d structure of which is known from xray crystallographic study the soluble ectodomain fragment used in these study lacked the membrane anchor portion of the molecule since this region ha a role in membrane fusion we have determined it structure by analyzing the intact fulllength molecule in a detergent micelle using cryoem we have also compared the structure of fulllength hadetergent micelle with fulllength hafab complex detergent micelle to describe an infectivityneutralizing monoclonal fab that bind near the ectodomain membrane anchor junction we determine a highresolution ha structure which compare favorably in detail with the structure of the ectodomain seen by xray crystallography we detect clearly all five carbohydrate side chain of ha and we find that the ectodomain is joined to the membrane anchor by flexible eightresiduelong linkers the linkers extend into the detergent micelle to join a central triplehelical structure that is a major component of the membrane anchor
label: Non-Cancer

title: genetics genomics and genotypephenotype correlation of tsc insight for clinical practice
abstract: tuberous sclerosis complex tsc is a multisystem autosomal dominant condition caused by inactivating pathogenic variant in either the tsc or the tsc gene leading to hyperactivation of the mtor pathway here we present an update on the genetic and genomic aspect of tsc with a focus on clinical and laboratory practice we briefly summarize the structure of tsc and tsc a well a their protein product and discus current diagnostic testing addressing mosaicism we consider genotypephenotype correlation a an example of precision medicine and discus genetic counseling in tsc with the aim of providing geneticist and health care practitioner involved in the care of tsc individual with useful tool for their practice
label: Non-Cancer

title: identification of a novel titin variant underlying myocardial involvement in neurofibromatosis type
abstract: because of the rare cooccurrence it remains a question whether cardiomyopathy is a true association of neurofibromatosis type a boy with cafeaulait spot manifested restrictive cardiomyopathy whole exome sequencing confirmed the genetic diagnosis of neurofibromatosis and further identified a novel titin ttn missense variant the significance of the variant is supported by it de novo origin in silico prediction and evolutionary conservation modern genetics raise an intriguing explanation for the unexpected phenotype and add to the evolving role of ttn variant in cardiomyopathy
label: Non-Cancer

title: xeroderma pigmentosum cockayne syndrome complex xpcs another case
abstract: we present the case of a year old girl with clinical manifestation typical of xpcs an extremely rare combination of xeroderma pigmentosum and cockayne syndrome she had a swelling above the upper lip and multiple brown spot on her face neck arm and back she wa globally delayed deaf dumb and photophobic mri brain showed mild cerebral atrophy and bilateral demyelination de sanctis cacchione variant dscs and rothmund thomson syndrome rts which were among the differential diagnosis were ruled out upon careful evaluation supportive treatment wa given and regular checkup were recommended to monitor the progression of the disease but our patient did not show up for the follow up this report show that the diagnosis of xpcs can be based on clinical feature and mri finding when the genetic testing is not available
label: Non-Cancer

title: ataxia telangiectasia alters the apob and reelin pathway
abstract: autosomal recessive ataxia telangiectasia at is characterized by radiosensitivity immunodeficiency and cerebellar neurodegeneration at is caused by inactivating mutation in the ataxia telangiectasiamutated atm gene a serinethreonine protein kinase involved in dna damage response and excitatory neurotransmission the selective vulnerability of cerebellar purkinje neuron pn to at is not well understood employing global proteomic profiling of cerebrospinal fluid from patient at age around year we detected reduced calbindin reelin cerebellin cerebellin protocadherin fat sempahorin a and increased apolipoprotein b and j peptide bioinformatic enrichment wa observed for pathway of lipoprotein endocytosis extracellular matrix receptor interaction peptidase activity adhesion calcium binding and complement immunity this seemed important since secretion of reelin from glutamatergic afferent axon is crucial for pn lipoprotein receptor endocytosis and lipid signaling reelin expression is downregulated by irradiation and reelinapob mutation are known cause of ataxia validation effort in monthold atm mouse before onset of motor deficit confirmed cerebellar transcript reduction for reelin receptor apoervldlr with increase for their ligand apoeapoh and cholesterol hydroxylase cypa concomitant dysregulations were found for vglutsemaa a climbing fiber marker glutamate receptor like grinb and calcium homeostasis factor atpb calb itpr while factor involved in dna damage oxidative stress neuroinflammation and cell adhesion were normal at this stage quantitative immunoblots confirmed apob and apoj increase and vldlr reduction in cerebellar tissue at the age of month these finding show that apob excess and reelin signaling deficit reflect the neurodegeneration in at in a sensitive and specific way a extracellular factor apolipoproteins and their cargo such a vitamin e may be useful for neuroprotective intervention
label: Non-Cancer

title: wntbetacatenin signaling play a crucial role in myoblast fusion through regulation of nephrin expression during development
abstract: skeletal muscle development is controlled by a series of multiple orchestrated regulatory pathway wntbetacatenin is one of the most important pathway for myogenesis however it remains unclear how this signaling pathway regulates myogenesis in a temporal and spatialspecific manner here we show that wntbetacatenin signaling is crucial for myoblast fusion through regulation of the nephrin nphs gene in the myogcreexpressing myoblast population mouse deficient for the betacatenin gene in myogcreexpressing myoblasts ctnnbffmyogcre mouse displayed myoblast fusion defect but not migration or cell proliferation defect the promoter region of nphs contains the conserved betacateninbinding element and nphs expression wa induced by the activation of wntbetacatenin signaling the induction of nphs in cultured myoblasts from ctnnbffmyogcre mouse restored the myoblast fusion defect indicating that nephrin is functionally relevant in wntbetacatenindependent myoblast fusion taken together our result indicate that wntbetacatenin signaling is crucial for myoblast fusion through the regulation of the nphs gene
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: wntbetacatenin signaling play a crucial role in myoblast fusion through regulation of nephrin expression during development skeletal muscle development is controlled by a series of multiple orchestrated regulatory pathway wntbetacatenin is one of the most important pathway for myogenesis however it remains unclear how this signaling pathway regulates myogenesis in a temporal and spatialspecific manner here we show that wntbetacatenin signaling is crucial for myoblast fusion through regulation of the nephrin nphs gene in the myogcreexpressing myoblast population mouse deficient for the betacatenin gene in myogcreexpressing myoblasts ctnnbffmyogcre mouse displayed myoblast fusion defect but not migration or cell proliferation defect the promoter region of nphs contains the conserved betacateninbinding element and nphs expression wa induced by the activation of wntbetacatenin signaling the induction of nphs in cultured myoblasts from ctnnbffmyogcre mouse restored the myoblast fusion defect indicating that nephrin is functionally relevant in wntbetacatenindependent myoblast fusion taken together our result indicate that wntbetacatenin signaling is crucial for myoblast fusion through the regulation of the nphs gene

title: tenofovir disoproxil fumarate discontinuation for renal outcome any room for treatment personalization
abstract: tenofovir disoproxil fumarate tdf is a very effective antiviral drug that ha been associated with tubular dysfunction the aim of this study wa to analyze the demographic pharmacokinetic and pharmacogenetic variable associated with tdf discontinuation for renal outcome in stable hivpositive patient using multivariable analysis three hundred and four patient were included male with median age and ecrcl of year and mlmin respectively after a median followup of month patient discontinued tdf for renal adverse event persistent urinary abnormality n or ecrcl mlmin n providing an incidence of event per patientyear the probability of tdf discontinuation wa higher with several feature male gender older age not caucasian ancestry absence of intravenous drug abuse protease inhibitor previous indinavir hcvpositivity lower cd cell count detectable hivrna lower ecrcl spoturine proteinuria and higher tenofovir concentration but not genetic variant tenofovir plasma concentration were prognostic of tdf discontinuation for renal adverse event suggesting that doseadjustment may be warranted for longterm safety
label: Non-Cancer

title: identification of a somatic mutation in the rheb gene through high depth and ultrahigh depth next generation sequencing in a patient with hemimegalencephaly and drug resistant epilepsy
abstract: malformation of cortical development are a frequent cause of drugresistant epilepsy and developmental delay hemimegalencephaly is a malformation of cortical development characterized by enlargement of all or a part of one cerebral hemisphere germline and somatic mutation in gene belonging to the mammalian target of rapamycin mtor pathway ha been identified in patient suffering from epilepsy secondary to hemimegalencephaly and focal cortical dysplasia we present here a patient suffering from severe neonatal epilepsy since h of life secondary to hemimegalencephaly requiring an anatomic hemispherectomy surgical procedure for seizure control where by mean of nextgeneration sequencing at an ultrahigh depth coverage we were able to identify a novel somatic mutation in the rheb gene nm ca t p gluval the histopathological diagnosis wa cortical dysplasia type iib determined by the presence of dysmorphic neuron of variable size with nuclear alteration and balloon cell in the context of hemimegalencephaly which are similar to that have been demonstrated in hyperactivating rheb model this is the first report of a somatic mutation in rheb gene in a patient suffering from epilepsy secondary to hemimegalencephaly it highlight different current topic in the field of genetics of malformation of cortical development asomatic mosaicism is not uncommon in these neurodevelopmental disorder bthe molecular diagnostic approach should involve the use of stateoftheart method and the sampling of different tissue cnew finding might facilitate therapeutic discovery while providing an improved understanding of normal brain development
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: identification of a somatic mutation in the rheb gene through high depth and ultrahigh depth next generation sequencing in a patient with hemimegalencephaly and drug resistant epilepsy malformation of cortical development are a frequent cause of drugresistant epilepsy and developmental delay hemimegalencephaly is a malformation of cortical development characterized by enlargement of all or a part of one cerebral hemisphere germline and somatic mutation in gene belonging to the mammalian target of rapamycin mtor pathway ha been identified in patient suffering from epilepsy secondary to hemimegalencephaly and focal cortical dysplasia we present here a patient suffering from severe neonatal epilepsy since h of life secondary to hemimegalencephaly requiring an anatomic hemispherectomy surgical procedure for seizure control where by mean of nextgeneration sequencing at an ultrahigh depth coverage we were able to identify a novel somatic mutation in the rheb gene nm ca t p gluval the histopathological diagnosis wa cortical dysplasia type iib determined by the presence of dysmorphic neuron of variable size with nuclear alteration and balloon cell in the context of hemimegalencephaly which are similar to that have been demonstrated in hyperactivating rheb model this is the first report of a somatic mutation in rheb gene in a patient suffering from epilepsy secondary to hemimegalencephaly it highlight different current topic in the field of genetics of malformation of cortical development asomatic mosaicism is not uncommon in these neurodevelopmental disorder bthe molecular diagnostic approach should involve the use of stateoftheart method and the sampling of different tissue cnew finding might facilitate therapeutic discovery while providing an improved understanding of normal brain development

title: cystic hygroma a preliminary genetic study and a short review from the literature
abstract: background the objective of this study is to examine the hypothesis that cystic hygroma ch with normal karyotype can manifest a a mendelian inherited trait and that a genetic similitude with hereditary lymphedema exists to reach this goal we investigated the prevalence of genetic variant in angiogenesis and lymphangiogenesis gene in a cohort of euploid fetus with ch that almost resolved before delivery a short review of case from literature is also reported method and result five fetus were screened using a nextgeneration sequencing approach by targeting gene known to be associated with vascular and lymphatic malformation the genetic evaluation revealed two novel variant in kdr and krit gene conclusion a review of the literature to date revealed that an association exists between ch and hereditary lymphedema and similar to lymphedema ch can be inherited in autosomal recessive and autosomal dominant manner with the latter most likely associated with a better prognosis about kdr and krit gene no other similar association are reported in the literature and caution is needed in their interpretation in conclusion we thought that a genetic test for the outcome of familial ch could be of enormous prognostic value
label: Non-Cancer

title: detection of kit dv in peripheral blood of child with manifestation of cutaneous mastocytosis suggests systemic disease
abstract: the use of allelespecific quantitative polymerase chain reaction to identify kit dv in the peripheral blood of adult with mastocytosis ha been reported to have value in the diagnosis assessment of disease burden and management of this disease to examine the value of this assay in child with cutaneous manifestation of mastocytosis we assessed data on patient with all variant of paediatriconset mastocytosis including those known to have systemic disease to correlate kit mutation status with clinical finding serum tryptase level and bone marrow histopathology we found that kit dv wa not identified in the peripheral blood of child known to have only cutaneous disease specificity but wa found in those known to have both cutaneous and systemicprobable systemic disease sensitivity of these finding were the basis of the development of an algorithm to assist in the decision for when to perform a bone marrow biopsy in child presenting with cutaneous manifestation of mastocytosis
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: detection of kit dv in peripheral blood of child with manifestation of cutaneous mastocytosis suggests systemic disease the use of allelespecific quantitative polymerase chain reaction to identify kit dv in the peripheral blood of adult with mastocytosis ha been reported to have value in the diagnosis assessment of disease burden and management of this disease to examine the value of this assay in child with cutaneous manifestation of mastocytosis we assessed data on patient with all variant of paediatriconset mastocytosis including those known to have systemic disease to correlate kit mutation status with clinical finding serum tryptase level and bone marrow histopathology we found that kit dv wa not identified in the peripheral blood of child known to have only cutaneous disease specificity but wa found in those known to have both cutaneous and systemicprobable systemic disease sensitivity of these finding were the basis of the development of an algorithm to assist in the decision for when to perform a bone marrow biopsy in child presenting with cutaneous manifestation of mastocytosis

title: circular rna involvement in aging an emerging player with great potential
abstract: circular rna circrna is a class of newly discovered noncoding rna ncrna presenting a a special covalent loop without a cap or tail multiple biological property of circrna have been revealed during the past decade such a widespread expression high conservation cellspecificity tissuespecificity and developmental stagespecific expression pattern a well a resistance to rnase r digestion circrna also exhibit diverse biological function including regulation of host gene alternative splicing mirna sponge protein trap and even protein synthesis recently a global accumulation of circrnas during aging ha been identified across different specie indicating a potential role a a causal factor in aging and agerelated disease the high stability could be one of the mechanism contributing to this phenomenon circrna could play a role in aging such a neural aging muscle aging reproductive aging skin aging immunosenescence visual aging and agerelated disease like alzheimers disease via interaction with mirnas rna binding protein modulation of parental gene transcription mainly at the transcriptional and posttranscriptional level the present study will focus on the advancement of circrna regarding aging and agerelated disease we will also discus the biogenesis property biological function and the perspective of circrna
label: Non-Cancer

title: carnitine palmitoyltransferase ii deficiency with a focus on newborn screening
abstract: carnitine palmitoyltransferase cpt ii deficiency is one of the most common form of mitochondrial fatty acid oxidation disorder it clinical phenotype are classified into the muscle severe infantile and lethal neonatal form among caucasian the muscle form predominates and the cc t psl variant is detected in most case whereas among the japanese ct a pfy is the variant allele occurring with the highest frequency and can apparently cause symptom of the severe infantile form newborn screening nb for this potentially fatal disease ha not been established we encountered an infantile case of cpt ii deficiency not detected in nb using c and c concentration a index and therefore we adopted the c cc ratio a an alternative primary index a a result the disease wa diagnosed in nine of nbspositive subject the value for c cc in the affected newborn partly overlapped with those in unaffected one among several other index proposed previously cc ha emerged a a more promising index based on these finding nationwide nb for cpt ii deficiency using both c cc and cc a index wa officially approved and started in april we diagnosed the disease in four young child presenting with symptom of the muscle form whose value for the new index were not elevated although it is still difficult to detect all case of the muscle form of cpt ii deficiency in nb our system is expected to save many affected child in japan with the severe infantile form predominating
label: Non-Cancer

title: juno the receptor of sperm izumo is expressed by the human oocyte and is essential for human fertilisation
abstract: study question is juno protein present at the surface membrane of human oocyte and involved in the fertilisation process summary answer juno protein is expressed on the plasma membrane of human oocyte and it inhibition by a monoclonal antibody completely block gamete fusion what is known already fusion of gamete membrane is the culminating event of the fertilisation process but it molecular mechanism are poorly understood until now three molecule have been shown to be essential cd tetraspanin in the oocyte izumo protein on the sperm and juno it corresponding receptor on the oocyte oocyte cd and sperm izumo have been identified in human gamete and their interaction is also wellconserved among several mammalian specie the presence of juno on human oocyte however ha not yet been reported nor ha it role in fertilisation been investigated study design size duration we selected an antihuman juno antibody in order to investigate the presence of juno on the oocyte membrane surface and studied it potential involvement in gamete membrane interaction during fertilisation participantsmaterials setting method monoclonal antibody against human juno antihjuno mab were produced by immunisation of mouse with hek cell transfected with the putative human juno sequence hekhjuno these antibody were used for immunostaining experiment and in vitro fertilisation assay with human gamete germetheque biobank main result and the role of chance three hybridoma supernatant verified by immunostaining revealed specifically hekhjuno cell the three purified monoclonal antibody fje igg fje igg and fjf igga recognised the soluble recombinant human juno protein and in a western blot of hekhjuno extract a protein with an expected mw of kda in addition soluble recombinant human izumo protein inhibited the binding of antihjuno mabs to cell expressing hjuno using these antihjuno mabs in immunostaining we identified the presence of juno protein at the plasma membrane of human oocyte furthermore we revealed a progressive expression of juno according to oocyte maturity finally we showed that human zonafree oocyte inseminated in the presence of antihjuno mab were not fertilised by human sperm these result suggest that a seen in the mouse juno is indeed involved in human gamete membrane fusion during fertilisation largescale data na limitation reason for caution in accordance with french bioethics law functional test were performed using zonafree oocyte which of course doe not fully encompass all normal in vivo physiological condition however these in vitro test do provide direct information regarding spermoocyte membrane interaction wider implication of the finding mechanism of gamete fusion appear to be homologous between mouse and human however some difference do exist and analysing the human mechanism is essential in fact this is the first report describing the presence of juno on human oocyte and it involvement in human fertilisation this discovery allows further examination of the understanding of molecular mechanism that drive gamete fusion a crucial challenge at a time when infertility affect of reproductively active couple study fundingcompeting interest this work wa supported by the agence nationale pour la recherche grant no anrbvs and by association institut du cancer et dimmunogenetique icig there are no competing interest
label: Non-Cancer

title: systemic mastocytosis version nccn clinical practice guideline in oncology
abstract: mastocytosis is a group of heterogeneous disorder resulting from the clonal proliferation of abnormal mast cell and their accumulation in the skin andor in various extracutaneous organ systemic mastocytosis is the most common form of mastocytosis diagnosed in adult characterized by mast cell infiltration of one or more extracutaneous organ with or without skin involvement the identification of kit dv mutation and the emergence of novel targeted therapy have significantly improved the diagnosis and treatment of systemic mastocytosis however certain aspect of clinical care particularly the diagnosis assessment and management of mediatorrelated symptom continue to present challenge this manuscript discusses the recommendation outlined in the nccn guideline for the diagnosis and management of patient with systemic mastocytosis
label: Non-Cancer

title: familial intracranial arachnoid cyst with a missense mutation cc t in rere a case report
abstract: rationale arachnoid cyst are relatively common intracranial spaceoccupying lesion nevertheless familial intracranial arachnoid cyst are extremely rare with only a few case having been reported patient concern the proband wa a yearold girl who had experienced generalized tonicclonic seizure time in the day prior to admission nine month later her yearold younger female cousin presented to u with a day history of headache diagnosis brain magnetic resonance imaging mri confirmed the diagnosis of arachnoid cyst for both of the girl intervention a cystperitoneal shunting and cyst fenestration were performed for the yearold girl and her cousin separately sanger sequencing revealed a heterozygous missense mutation cc t in the arginineglutamic acid dipeptide repeat gene rere outcome the outcome wa favorable and the followup wa uneventful lesson we hypothesize that the mutation in rere may be associated with the pathogenesis of familial intracranial arachnoid cyst
label: Non-Cancer

title: arteriovenous fistula inside cervical spinal canal associated with neurofibromatosis type
abstract: background neurofibromatosis type nf is an autosomal dominant disease caused by mutation on chromosome which affect the skin vascular system nervous system and skeleton system arteriovenous fistula avf is one of the recognized complication of nf case description we report a case of a yearold woman with nf with cervical spine avf inside the cervical spinal canal who presented with progressive spinal cord compression which wa abnormal after sufficient preparation the patient underwent vascular embolization and then symptom of spinal cord compression significantly improved conclusion this report reminds reader of the possibility of avf if there is a spaceoccupying lesion inside the cervical spinal canal and to do computed tomography angiography examination when necessary
label: Non-Cancer

title: mammalian target of rapamycin inhibitor in a patient with polycystic kidney diseasetuberous sclerosis contiguous gene syndrome
abstract: the mutation associated with polycystic kidney disease are closely aligned with that of tuberous sclerosis tsc in chromosome occasionally the presence of these mutation in an individual can lead to a presence of a disease phenotype with a combination of polycystic kidney disease and tsc contiguous gene syndrome we present a case report of a young girl who presented with skin lesion central nervous system tuber and cystic disease of the kidney she wa treated with mammalian target of rapamycin inhibitor with a favorable outcome

title: development of iieoetpz and iieoetpzmo novel tirapazamine tpzbased radioiodinated pharmaceutical for application in theranostic management of hypoxia
abstract: introduction benzotriazinedioxides btdos such a tirapazamine tpz and it derivative act a radiosensitizers of hypoxic tissue the benzotriazinemonoxide btmo metabolite sr tpzmo of tpz also ha radiosensitizing property and via unknown mechanism is a potent enhancer of the radiosensitizing effect of tpz unlike their nitroimidazole radiosensitizer counterpart radiolabeled benzotriazine oxide have not been used a radiopharmaceutical for diagnostic imaging or molecular radiotherapy mrt of hypoxia the radioiodination chemistry for preparing model radioiodinated btdos and btmos is now reported hypothesis radioiodinated iodoethoxyethylaminobenzotriazinedioxide ieoetpz a novel bioisosteric analogue of tpz and iodoethoxyethylaminobenzotriazineoxide ieoetpzmo it monoxide analogue are candidate for in vivo and in vitro investigation of biochemical mechanism in pathology that develop hypoxic microenvironments in theory both radiotracers can be prepared from the same precursor method radioiodination procedure were based on classical nucleophilic iiodide substitution on toseoetpz p and by iiodide exchange on ieoetpz p reaction parameter including temperature reaction time solvent and the influence of pivalic acid on product formation and the corresponding radiochemical yield rcy were investigated result the iiodide labeling reaction invariably led to the synthesis of both product but with careful manipulation of condition the preferred product could be recovered a the major product radioiodide exchange on p in acn at c for min afforded the highest rcy of iieoetpz which upon solid phase purification on an alumina cartridge gave yield of the product with over of radiochemical purity similarly radioiodide exchange on p in acn at c for min with pivalic acid afforded the highest yield of iieoetpzmo exclusively with no trace of iieoetpz in both case extended reaction time andor elevated temperature resulted in the formation of at least two additional radioactive reaction product conclusion radioiodination of p and p with iiodide lead to the facile formation of iieoetpzmo at c and short reaction time the facile reduction of the noxide moiety wa minimized to afford acceptable radiochemical yield of iieoetpz from either precursor regeneration of iieoetpz from iieoetpzmo is impractical after reaction workup

title: zmiz variant cause a syndromic neurodevelopmental disorder
abstract: zmiz is a coactivator of several transcription factor including p the androgen receptor and notch here we report subject with intellectual disability and developmental delay carrying variant in zmiz the associated feature include growth failure feeding difficulty microcephaly facial dysmorphism and various other congenital malformation of these unrelated subject carried de novo heterozygous singlenucleotide variant snvs or singlebase insertionsdeletions sibling harbored a heterozygous singlebase insertion and subject had a balanced translocation disrupting zmiz or involving a regulatory region of zmiz in total we identified point mutation that affect key protein region including a sumo acceptor site a central disordered alaninerich motif a prolinerich domain and a transactivation domain all identified variant were absent from all available exome and genome database in vitro zmiz showed impaired coactivation of the androgen receptor in vivo overexpression of zmiz mutant allele in developing mouse brain using in utero electroporation resulted in abnormal pyramidal neuron morphology polarization and positioning underscoring the importance of zmiz in neural development and supporting mutation in zmiz a the cause of a rare neurodevelopmental syndrome
label: Non-Cancer

title: aneurysmal bone cyst of the frontal bone a radiologicpathologic correlation
abstract: we present a case of yearold female who presented for a progressive frontal swelling with ipsilateral headache subsequent ct scan revealed an extradural and expansile multiloculated mass with thin and strongly enhanced septation and mri evaluation showed internal hyperintensity on t with no restriction of diffusion and confirmed the multiple cystic space with enhancing septation and rare hemorrhagic fluidfluid level surgery wa performed and diagnosis of aneurysmal bone cyst wa made on frozen section identification of usp fusion gene by in situ hybridization technique permitted to confirm the diagnosis of primary abc although aneurysmal bone cyst abc of the skull is a very rare entity and account for of all abc we should think about it in front of osteolytic and cystic skull change even with very few fluidfluid level following description of our case and differential diagnosis we conduct a literature review of skull abc imaging characteristic and discus the interest of usp rearrangement identification
label: Non-Cancer

title: editing aberrant splice site efficiently restores betaglobin expression in betathalassemia
abstract: the thalassemia are compelling target for therapeutic genome editing in part because monoallelic correction of a subset of hematopoietic stem cell hscs would be sufficient for enduring disease amelioration a primary challenge is the development of efficient repair strategy that are effective in hscs here we demonstrate that allelic disruption of aberrant splice site one of the major class of thalassemia mutation is a robust approach to restore gene function we target the ivsga mutation using ca ribonucleoprotein rnp and the ivsct mutation by casacpf rnp in primary cd hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell hspcs from betathalassemia patient each of these nuclease complex achieves high efficiency and penetrance of therapeutic edits erythroid progeny of edited patient hspcs show reversal of aberrant splicing and restoration of betaglobin expression this strategy could enable correction of a substantial fraction of transfusiondependent betathalassemia genotype with currently available geneediting technology
label: Non-Cancer

title: disruption of spermatogenesis and infertility in ataxia with oculomotor apraxia type aoa
abstract: ataxia with oculomotor apraxia type aoa is a rare autosomal recessive cerebellar ataxia characterized by onset between and year of age and a range of neurological feature that include progressive cerebellar atrophy axonal sensorimotor neuropathy oculomotor apraxia in a majority of patient and elevated serum alphafetoprotein afp aoa is caused by mutation of the setx gene which encodes senataxin a dnarna helicase involved in transcription regulation rna processing and dna maintenance disruption of senataxin in rodent led to defective spermatogenesis and sterility in male uncovering a key role for senataxin in male germ cell survival here we report the first clinical and cellular evidence of impaired spermatogenesis in aoa patient we assessed sperm production in three aoa patient and testicular pathology in one patient and compared the finding to those of setxknockout mouse sperm production wa impaired in all patient assessed analysis of testicular biopsy from an aoa patient recapitulate feature of the histology seen in setxknockout mouse strongly suggesting an underlying mechanism centering on dnadamagemediated germ cell apoptosis these finding support a role for senataxin in human reproductive function and highlight a novel clinical feature of aoa that extends the extraneurological role of senataxin this raise an important reproductive counseling issue for clinician and fertility specialist should be aware of setx mutation a a possible diagnosis in young male patient presenting with oligospermia or azoospermia since infertility may presage the later onset of neurological manifestation in some individual
label: Non-Cancer

title: mucus penetrating property of soft distensible lipid nanocapsules
abstract: designing nanomaterials to release their drug payload upon exposure to an exogenous trigger can help to direct drug delivery but how the triggered release which often modifies the nanomaterial property influence the biological fate of these system is currently unknown the aim of this study wa to investigate how the triggered drug release from peg coated soft nm distensible lipid nanocapsules lnc influenced their diffusion across a mucus barrier the translocation speed of the nontriggered lnc across a microm thick purified gastric mucin pgm barrier wa time faster x cm s compared to equivalentsized negatively charged polystyrene particle x cm s p in a static mucus barrier but when shear wa applied to the barrier the distended lncs diffused more slowly x cm s p compared to the nondistended material x cm s this data suggested the rapid mucus penetration of the distended lncs despite their increased size wa a consequence of their capacity to take a less tortuous path through the barrier ie they experienced less steric hinderance compared to the nondistended lnc
label: Non-Cancer

title: genetic metaanalysis of diagnosed alzheimers disease identifies new risk locus and implicates abeta tau immunity and lipid processing
abstract: risk for lateonset alzheimers disease load the most prevalent dementia is partially driven by genetics to identify load risk locus we performed a large genomewide association metaanalysis of clinically diagnosed load individual we confirm previous load risk locus and identify five new genomewide locus iqck ace adam adamts and wwox two of which adam ace were identified in a recent genomewide association gwasbyfamilialproxy of alzheimers or dementia finemapping of the human leukocyte antigen hla region confirms the neurological and immunemediated disease haplotype hladr a a risk factor for load pathway analysis implicates immunity lipid metabolism tau binding protein and amyloid precursor protein app metabolism showing that genetic variant affecting app and abeta processing are associated not only with earlyonset autosomal dominant alzheimers disease but also with load analysis of risk gene and pathway show enrichment for rare variant p x indicating that additional rare variant remain to be identified we also identify important genetic correlation between load and trait such a family history of dementia and education
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: genetic metaanalysis of diagnosed alzheimers disease identifies new risk locus and implicates abeta tau immunity and lipid processing risk for lateonset alzheimers disease load the most prevalent dementia is partially driven by genetics to identify load risk locus we performed a large genomewide association metaanalysis of clinically diagnosed load individual we confirm previous load risk locus and identify five new genomewide locus iqck ace adam adamts and wwox two of which adam ace were identified in a recent genomewide association gwasbyfamilialproxy of alzheimers or dementia finemapping of the human leukocyte antigen hla region confirms the neurological and immunemediated disease haplotype hladr a a risk factor for load pathway analysis implicates immunity lipid metabolism tau binding protein and amyloid precursor protein app metabolism showing that genetic variant affecting app and abeta processing are associated not only with earlyonset autosomal dominant alzheimers disease but also with load analysis of risk gene and pathway show enrichment for rare variant p x indicating that additional rare variant remain to be identified we also identify important genetic correlation between load and trait such a family history of dementia and education

title: giant cerebral aneurysm in a patient with cowden syndrome treated with surgical clipping
abstract: background cowden syndrome is characterized by multiple hamartoma and accompanied by a germline mutation of the phosphatase and tensin homolog gene cowden syndrome ha been described to be associated with vascular anomaly such a arteriovenous malformation and developmental venous anomaly with high frequency however the association of cerebral aneurysm with this syndrome ha not been reported yet case description a yearold japanese man presented with a subarachnoid hemorrhage due to a ruptured giant fusiform middle cerebral artery aneurysm we diagnosed him with cowden syndrome by clinical presentation a outlined in the national comprehensive cancer network criterion a the ruptured fusiform aneurysm involved a middle cerebral artery bifurcation we prepared for extracranialintracranial bypass surgery we successfully performed a surgical clipping using multiple tandem clipping technique and suction decompression technique bypass surgery wa not performed a reconstruction of the m trunk wa successfully completed conclusion we present this rare case that potentially indicates an association between cerebral aneurysm and cowden syndrome because vascular anomaly are not included in the diagnostic criterion for cowden syndrome intracranial vascular anomaly may be underestimated we therefore recommended a careful search of vascular disease including cerebral aneurysm in case of cowden syndrome
label: Non-Cancer

title: n mri of slicsabre hyperpolarized nlabelled pyridine and nicotinamide
abstract: magnetic resonance imaging mri is a powerful noninvasive diagnostic method extensively used in biomedical study a significant limitation of mri is it relatively low signaltonoise ratio which can be increased by hyperpolarizing nuclear spin one promising method is signal amplification by reversible exchange sabre which employ parahydrogen a a source of hyperpolarization recent study demonstrated the feasibility to improve mri sensitivity with this hyperpolarization technique hyperpolarized n nucleus in biomolecules can potentially retain their spin alignment for ten of minute providing an extended time window for the utilization of the hyperpolarized compound in this work we demonstrate for the first time that radiofrequencybased sabre hyperpolarization technique can be used to obtain n mri of biomolecule nnicotinamide two image acquisition strategy were utilized and compared single point imaging spi and fast low angle shot flash these method demonstrated opportunity of highfield sabre for biomedical application
label: Non-Cancer

title: tuberous sclerosis complex
abstract: tuberous sclerosis complex tsc is an autosomal dominant inherited disorder that is characterized by the systemic hamartoma along with epilepsy cognitive impairment and hypopigmented macule it is caused by genetic mutation in either tsc or tsc gene which encodes hamartin and tuberin respectively a the hamartintuberincomplex downregulates the mechanisticmammalian target of the rapamycin complex mtorc dysfunction in either hamartin or tuberin induces the constitutive activation of mtorc in fact almost all the symptom in tsc are derived from the activation of mtorc therefore mtorc inhibitor improves all the symptom including skin lesion and neural symptom among the many symptom skin lesion appear earlier than renal or pulmonary lesion and are more specific than neuronal symptom therefore skin lesion are useful for the diagnosis of tsc this chapter focus on the feature of skin lesion and mechanistic their potential role in differential diagnosis and therapy including the therapeutic use of mtorc inhibitor
label: Non-Cancer

title: hereditary segmental neurofibromatosis a report of three case in a family
abstract: hereditary segmental neurofibromatosis snf is an extremely rare form of snf with nine family reported till date snf is considered to be a result of mosaicism and hereditary transmission is possibly explained by increased susceptibility of mutation at neurofibromatosis gene locus we report here three member of an indian family with snf our index case a yearold woman had multiple soft to firm papule and nodule over right shoulder associated with severe intermittent pain her father had three similar nodule over left upper arm and elder sister had two such nodule over right upper arm the father and elder sister were incidentally diagnosed and they had never sought medical advice considering their lesion to be a familial trait in the absence of symptom many familial case of snf are missed thus making any systematic analysis to ascertain it genetic basis difficult
label: Non-Cancer

title: frequency of isolated cutaneous involvement in adult mastocytosis a cohort study
abstract: background mastocytosis is characterized by the accumulationproliferation of abnormal mast cell the frequency of isolated cutaneous involvement in adult with mastocytosis ha not been fully determined the main objective of our study wa to assess the frequency of isolated cutaneous mastocytosis cm in adult with mastocytosis skin lesion the second objective wa to compare the clinical histological biological and imaging feature in patient with isolated cm and patient with systemic mastocytosis sm method we included all patient with histologyproven mastocytosis skin lesion between january and december the mastocytosis diagnosis wa made according to the international diagnostic criterion all data were collected from a dedicated specific case report result among patient with mastocytosis skin lesion patient had isolated cm had sm and patient had undetermined mastocytosis skin kit mutation or ci p and high bone marrow tryptase or ci p were strong predictor of sm the prevalence of osteoporosis wa higher in the sm population than in the isolated cm population moreover a decrease in bone mineral density over a short period of followup year wa associated with sm there were no difference between the two group regarding the frequency of mast cell activation symptom the presentation of skin lesion the number of mast cell in the dermis and the level of serum tryptase we propose considering the kit mutation status and bone marrow tryptase level to aid the diagnosis of isolated cm in adult mastocytosis patient conclusion only a small minority of adult with mastocytosis skin lesion ha isolated cutaneous involvement in of mastocytosis case even complete workup doe not allow for a precise classification of patient
label: Non-Cancer

title: transcription factor stat serf a a negative regulator controlling ige class switching in mouse
abstract: a mutation in stat ha been linked to the incidence of autosomal dominant hyper ige syndrome a disease characterized by elevated serum ige ab however how this genetic mutation lead to the phenotype ha not been fully understood we investigated the specific role of stat in the germinal center gc b cell and plasma cell for ige class switching through the use of stat conditional knockout cko mouse in a thtype immunization model we demonstrated that cdcredriven stat cko mouse showed elevated ige and decreased igg in the serum and a reduction in gc formation within the gc igg gc b cell were decreased whereas ige gc b cell were more prevalent additionally these mouse exhibited reduced igg and elevated ige population of abproducing plasma cell subsequent experiment using a cdcre cko mouse established this effect to be b cellintrinsic transcription factor critical for gc and plasma cell differentiation including bcl and aicda were shown to function a downstream signal of stat regulation chromatin immunoprecipitation sequencing analysis revealed that many gene including bcl and crtc were among the direct stat regulated target mouse with stat deficiency in b cell also demonstrated an increase in lung inflammation when used in an asthmalike disease model this model suggests a negative role for stat in regulating class switching of the gc b cell from the igg to the ige producing state which may serve a a therapeutic target for treatment of autosomal dominant hyper ige syndrome and other immune disorder
label: Non-Cancer

title: rare hereditary hemolytic anemia diagnostic approach and consideration in management
abstract: hereditary hemolytic anemia hhas comprise a heterogeneous group of anemia caused by mutation in gene coding the globin red blood cell rbc membrane protein and rbc enzyme congenital dyserythropoietic anemia cdas are rare disorder of erythropoiesis characterized by binucleated and multinucleated erythroblast in bone marrow cdas typically present with a hemolytic phenotype a the produced rbc have structural defect and decreased survival and should be considered in the differential of hhas this article discusses the clinical presentation laboratory finding and management consideration for rare hhas arising from unstable hemoglobin rbc hydration defect the less common rbc enzymopathies and cdas
label: Non-Cancer

title: heterozygous variant in kmte cause a spectrum of neurodevelopmental disorder and epilepsy
abstract: we delineate a kmterelated neurodevelopmental disorder on the basis of individual in family this study includes distinct heterozygous variant in kmte ascertained from matchmaker exchange and three previously reported and four individual with chromosome q microdeletions encompassing kmte one previously reported almost all variant occurred de novo and most were truncating most affected individual with proteintruncating variant presented with mild intellectual disability onequarter of individual met criterion for autism additional common feature include macrocephaly hypotonia functional gastrointestinal abnormality and a subtle facial gestalt epilepsy wa present in about onefifth of individual with truncating variant and wa responsive to treatment with antiepileptic medication in almost all more than of the individual were male and expressivity wa variable by sex epilepsy wa more common in female and autism more common in male the four individual with microdeletions encompassing kmte generally presented similarly to those with truncating variant but the degree of developmental delay wa greater the group of four individual with missense variant in kmte presented with the most severe developmental delay epilepsy wa present in all individual with missense variant often manifesting a treatmentresistant infantile epileptic encephalopathy microcephaly wa also common in this group haploinsufficiency versus gainoffunction or dominantnegative effect specific to these missense variant in kmte might explain this divergence in phenotype but requires independent validation disruptive variant in kmte are an underrecognized cause of neurodevelopmental abnormality
label: Non-Cancer

title: atomic resolution cryoem structure of a nativelike cenpa nucleosome aided by an antibody fragment
abstract: genomic dna in eukaryote is organized into chromatin through association with core histone to form nucleosomes each distinguished by their dna sequence and histone variant here we used a singlechain antibody fragment scfv derived from the antinucleosome antibody mab pl to stabilize human cenpa nucleosome containing a native alphasatellite dna and solved it structure by the cryoelectron microscopy cryoem to a resolution in comparison the corresponding cryoem structure of the free cenpa nucleosome could only reach a resolution we find that scfv bind to a conserved acidic patch on the histone hahb dimer without perturbing the nucleosome structure our result provide an atomic resolution cryoem structure of a nucleosome and insight into the structure and function of the cenpa nucleosome the scfv approach is applicable to the structural determination of other nativelike nucleosomes with distinct dna sequence
label: Non-Cancer

title: facile spectroscopy and atomic force microscopy for the discrimination of alpha and beta thalassemia trait and disease a photodiagnosis approach
abstract: thalassemia thal is an inherited blood disorder endemic to the mediterranean and middle east eg ksa and uae this disease is caused by defect in the synthesis of one or more hemoglobin chain in red blood cell rbc alpha alpha thal is caused by a reduced or absent alpha globin segment similarly beta beta thal is caused by a defect in the beta globin segment we divided the disease into four group alpha thal trait alpha thal disease beta thal trait and beta thal disease the alpha or beta thal trait are milder variant of these disease and do not require treatment but beta thal disease and to a lesser extent alpha thal cause hemolytic anemia splenomegaly and bone deformity and requires repeated lifelong blood transfusion this paper present result regarding the identification of thal variant using fluorescence spectroscopy of blood biomolecules and atomic force microscopy analysis of the morphologic feature of red blood cell the combined result provide new insight into the characteristic of these disease furthermore this study show why beta thal disease subject are often transfusiondependent and alpha thal disease subject are only occasionally transfusion dependent
label: Non-Cancer

title: pedia prioritization of exome data by image analysis
abstract: purpose phenotype information is crucial for the interpretation of genomic variant so far it ha only been accessible for bioinformatics workflow after encoding into clinical term by expert dysmorphologists method here we introduce an approach driven by artificial intelligence that us portrait photograph for the interpretation of clinical exome data we measured the value added by computerassisted image analysis to the diagnostic yield on a cohort consisting of individual with different monogenic disorder for each case in the cohort we compiled frontal photo clinical feature and the diseasecausing variant and simulated multiple exomes of different ethnic background result the additional use of similarity score from computerassisted analysis of frontal photo improved the top accuracy rate by more than and the top accuracy rate by more than for the diseasecausing gene conclusion image analysis by deeplearning algorithm can be used to quantify the phenotypic similarity pp criterion of the american college of medical genetics and genomics guideline and to advance the performance of bioinformatics pipeline for exome analysis
label: Non-Cancer

title: highresolution pharyngeal manometry and impedance protocol and metricsrecommendations of a highresolution pharyngeal manometry international working group
abstract: highresolution manometry ha traditionally been utilized in gastroenterology diagnostic clinical and research application recently it is also finding new and important application in speech pathology and laryngology practice a highresolution pharyngeal manometry international working group wa formed a a grass root effort to establish a consensus on methodology protocol and outcome metric for highresolution pharyngeal manometry hrpm with consideration of impedance a an adjunct modality the working group undertook three task survey what expert were currently doing in their clinical andor research practice perform a review of the literature underpinning the value of particular hrpm metric for understanding swallowing physiology and pathophysiology and establish a core outcome set of hrpm metric via a delphi consensus process expert survey result were used to create a recommended hrpm protocol addressing system configuration catheter insertion and bolus administration ninety two article were included in the final literature review resulting in categorization of hrpmimpedance metric into three class pharyngeal lumen occlusive pressure hypopharyngeal intrabolus pressure and upper esophageal sphincter ues function a stable delphi consensus wa achieved for hrpmimpedance metric pharyngeal contractile integral ci velopharyngeal ci hypopharyngeal ci hypopharyngeal pressure at nadir impedance ues integrated relaxation pressure relaxation time and maximum admittance while some important unanswered question remain our work represents the first step in standardization of highresolution pharyngeal manometry acquisition measurement and reporting this could potentially inform future proposal for an hrpmbased classification system specifically for pharyngeal swallowing disorder
label: Non-Cancer

title: triglyceride deposit cardiomyovasculopathy a rare cardiovascular disorder
abstract: triglyceride deposit cardiomyovasculopathy tgcv is a phenotype primarily reported in patient carrying genetic mutation in pnpla encoding adipose triglyceride lipase atgl which release long chain fatty acid lcfa a a major energy source by the intracellular tg hydrolysis these patient suffered from intractable heart failure requiring cardiac transplantation moreover we identified tgcv patient without pnpla mutation based on pathological and clinical study we provided the diagnostic criterion in which tgcv with and without pnpla mutation were designated a primary tgcv ptgcv and idiopathic tgcv itgcv respectively we hereby report clinical profile of tgcv patient between and ptgcv and itgcv japanese patient have been registered in the international registry patient with itgcv of which etiology and cause are not known yet suffered from adultonset severe heart disease including heart failure and coronary artery disease associated with a marked reduction in atgl activity and myocardial washout rate of lcfa tracer a similar to those with ptgcv the present first registrybased study showed that tgcv is an intractable at least at the moment and heterogeneous cardiovascular disorder
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: triglyceride deposit cardiomyovasculopathy a rare cardiovascular disorder triglyceride deposit cardiomyovasculopathy tgcv is a phenotype primarily reported in patient carrying genetic mutation in pnpla encoding adipose triglyceride lipase atgl which release long chain fatty acid lcfa a a major energy source by the intracellular tg hydrolysis these patient suffered from intractable heart failure requiring cardiac transplantation moreover we identified tgcv patient without pnpla mutation based on pathological and clinical study we provided the diagnostic criterion in which tgcv with and without pnpla mutation were designated a primary tgcv ptgcv and idiopathic tgcv itgcv respectively we hereby report clinical profile of tgcv patient between and ptgcv and itgcv japanese patient have been registered in the international registry patient with itgcv of which etiology and cause are not known yet suffered from adultonset severe heart disease including heart failure and coronary artery disease associated with a marked reduction in atgl activity and myocardial washout rate of lcfa tracer a similar to those with ptgcv the present first registrybased study showed that tgcv is an intractable at least at the moment and heterogeneous cardiovascular disorder

title: feedback inhibition of camp effector signaling by a chaperoneassisted ubiquitin system
abstract: activation of gprotein coupled receptor elevates camp level promoting dissociation of protein kinase a pka holoenzymes and release of catalytic subunit pkac this result in pkacmediated phosphorylation of compartmentalized substrate that control central aspect of cell physiology the mechanism of pkac activation and signaling have been largely characterized however the mode of pkac inactivation by regulated proteolysis were unknown here we identify a regulatory mechanism that precisely tune pkac stability and downstream signaling following agonist stimulation the recruitment of the chaperonebound e ligase chip promotes ubiquitylation and proteolysis of pkac thus attenuating camp signaling genetic inactivation of chip or pharmacological inhibition of hsp enhances pkac signaling and sustains hippocampal longterm potentiation interestingly primary fibroblast from autosomal recessive spinocerebellar ataxia scar patient carrying germline inactivating mutation of chip show a dramatic dysregulation of pka signaling this suggests the existence of a negative feedback mechanism for restricting hormonally controlled pka activity
label: Non-Cancer

title: identification of driver gene and somatic mutation in cellfree dna of patient with pulmonary lymphangioleiomyomatosis
abstract: nextgeneration sequencing of cellfree circulating dna cfdna ha emerged a promising technique for identifying minimally invasive genomic profiling of tumor cell recently however it remains relatively unknown in lam disease in our study paired cfdna and genomic dna gdna in blood sample were obtained from lam patient and seven healthy control to explore mutation profile of targeted cancerrelated gene a result logbased allele frequency of mutation in cfdna were significantly different from those of gdna by comparing the mutual mutation identified both in cfdna and gdna a significant correlation wa also observed after removing mutation in gdna distinct somatic mutation profile of cfdna were observed in lam patient forty of targeted gene had recurrent mutation of which atm brca and apc showed the highest frequency based on the mutation correlation network constructed of mutated gene hub gene bearing intensive interaction were highlighted including brca brca rad rb nf apc mlh atm pdgfra palb and blm expression of the hub gene showed significant cluster between lam patient and control and that rad and brca had the strongest association with subject phenotype myogenesis and estrogen response were confirmed to be positively regulated in lam patient collectively our study provided a landscape of genomic alteration in lam and discovered several potential driver gene that is brca and rad which shed a substantial light on the clinical application of key molecular marker and potential therapy target for precision diagnosis and treatment in the future
label: Non-Cancer

title: exome sequencing in routine diagnostics a generic test for patient with primary immunodeficiency
abstract: background diagnosis of primary immunodeficiency pid is complex and cumbersome yet important for the clinical management of the disease exome sequencing may provide a genetic diagnosis in a significant number of patient in a single genetic test method in may we implemented exome sequencing in routine diagnostics for patient suffering from pid this study report the clinical utility and diagnostic yield for a heterogeneous group of consecutively referred pid patient from family for the majority of patient the clinical diagnosis wa based on clinical criterion including rare andor unusual severe bacterial viral or fungal infection sometimes accompanied by autoimmune manifestation functional immune defect were interpreted in the context of aberrant immune cell population aberrant antibody level or combination of these factor result for patient exome sequencing identified pathogenic variant in wellestablished pid gene an exomewide analysis diagnosed additional patient providing diagnosis for patient from family altogether the genetic diagnosis directly indicated novel treatment option for patient that received a diagnosis conclusion exome sequencing a a firsttier test for pid granted a diagnosis for of patient importantly molecularly defined diagnosis indicated altered therapeutic option in of case in addition exome sequencing harbor advantage over gene panel a a truly generic test for all genetic disease including in silico extension of existing gene list and reanalysis of existing data
label: Non-Cancer

title: moxifloxacin resistance and genotyping of mycobacterium avium and mycobacterium intracellulare isolates in japan
abstract: background although fluoroquinolones are considered a alternative therapy of pulmonary mycobacterium avium complex mac disease the association between fluoroquinolone resistance and mac genotype in clinical isolates from individual not previously treated for mac infection is not fully clear method total of m avium isolates and mycobacterium intracellulare isolates were obtained from treatmentnaive patient with pulmonary mac disease at the diagnosis of mac infection at hospital in japan their susceptibility of moxifloxacin were determined by broth microdilution method moxifloxacinresistant isolates were examined for mutation of gyra and gyrb variable number of tandem repeat vntr assay wa performed using m avium vntr locus and m intracellulare vntr locus result moxifloxacin susceptibility wa categorized a resistant and intermediate for and respectively of m avium isolates and and of m intracellulare isolates although the isolates of both specie had amino acid substitution of thr and thr at the site corresponding to ser in the m tuberculosis gyra and gly in the m tuberculosis gyrb respectively these substitution were observed irrespective of susceptibility and did not confer resistance the vntr assay showed revealed three cluster among m avium isolates and two cluster among m intracellulare isolates no significant difference in moxifloxacin resistance were observed among these cluster conclusion although resistance or intermediate resistance to moxifloxacin wa observed in approximately onefourth of m avium and m intracellulare isolates this resistance wa not associated with mutation in gyra and gyrb or with vntr genotype
label: Non-Cancer
