title: using imputed wholegenome sequence data to improve the accuracy of genomic prediction for parasite resistance in australian sheep
abstract: background this study aimed at comparing the accuracy of genomic prediction for parasite resistance in sheep based on wholegenome sequence wgs data to those based on k and highdensity hd single nucleotide polymorphism snp panel investigating whether the use of variant within quantitative trait locus qtl region that were selected from regional heritability mapping rhm in an independent dataset improved the accuracy more than variant selected from genomewide association study gwas and comparing the prediction accuracy between variant selected from wgs data to variant selected from the hd snp panel result the accuracy of genomic prediction improved marginally from and when using all the variant from k and hd genotype respectively to when using all the variant from wgs data fitting a grm from the selected variant alongside a grm from the k snp genotype improved the prediction accuracy substantially compared to fitting the k snp genotype alone the gain in prediction accuracy wa slightly more pronounced when variant were selected from wgs data compared to when variant were selected from the hd panel when sequence variant that passed the gwas formula see text threshold of across the entire genome were selected the prediction accuracy improved by up to whereas when selection wa limited to sequence variant that passed the same gwas formula see text threshold of in region identified by rhm the accuracy improved by up to conclusion our result show that through careful selection of sequence variant from the qtl region the accuracy of genomic prediction for parasite resistance in sheep can be improved these finding have important implication for genomic prediction in sheep
label: Non-Cancer

title: a clinical study of proteus syndrome caused by a mosaic somatic mutation in akt gene
abstract: objective proteus syndrome is a rare disease the aim of the present study wa to analyze the clinical characteristic and gene mutation of proteus syndrome with a case report and relevant literature review method clinical data of the patient with proteus syndrome were collected in detail and biochemical measurement and radiological examination were conducted tissue from phalanx with lesion were obtained to extract dna and sanger sequencing of akt gene wa carried on the pathogenic mutation wa further tested in peripheral blood sample of the patient his parent and healthy volunteer orthopaedic surgery wa performed on the affected limb of the patient result the patient wa presented with progressive overgrowth of the right extremity scoliosis cerebral connective tissue nevus and lower extremity venous a heterozygous mutation of akt gene c ga wa identified in dna extracted from the affected bone tissue of the patient but not be found in genomic dna of peripheral blood sample from the patient his parent and healthy volunteer movement function of the affected limb improved significantly after the operation conclusion the prominent feature of proteus syndrome are overgrowth of one extremity and cerebral connective tissue nevus a mosaic somatic mutation of akt gene is one of the pathogenic mutation for proteus syndrome and orthopedic surgery may be a good way to improve symptom of the disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: prediction of functional consequence of the five newly discovered gpd variation in taiwan
abstract: glucosephosphate dehydrogenase deficiency gpd deficiency omim is the most common inborn error disorder worldwide while the gpd is the key enzyme of removing oxidative stress in erythrocyte the early diagnosis is utmost vital to prevent chronic and drug food or infectioninduced hemolytic anemia the characterization of the mutation is also important for the subsequent genetic counseling especially for female carrier with ambiguous enzyme activity and male with mild mutation while multiplex snapshot assay and sanger sequencing were performed on gpd deficient male five newly discovered variation namely cg a pek cg c pqh ca t pif cg a pgd and cg a pvi were detected in the other six patient these variant were previously named a the pingtung tainan changhua chiayi and tainan variant respectively the in silico analysis a well a the prediction of the structure of the resultant mutant gpd protein indicated that these five newly discovered variant might be disease causing mutation
label: Non-Cancer

title: a pilot study of sirolimus in subject with cowden syndrome or other syndrome characterized by germline mutation in pten
abstract: lesson learned this is the first human interventional study in patient with cowden syndrome that is driven by inactivation of germline pten genesingleagent sirolimus a mtor inhibitor suppressed mtor signaling in surrogate human tissue without significant toxicity background cowden syndrome is characterized by inactivating germline pten mutation which can lead to activation of the pikaktmtor pathway method adult subject with germline pten mutation who met international diagnostic criterion for cowden syndrome and who had eastern cooperative oncology group ecog performance status and adequate organ function were enrolled subject were treated with a day course of daily oral sirolimus in addition to symptom assessment and physical examination dermatologic endoscopic neurologic cerebellar and radiographic assessment were conducted inhibition of the mtor pathway in benign skin and gastrointestinal gi lesion wa assessed by immunohistochemistry result a total of patient and family were enrolled pten mutation were located at exon regression of skin and gi lesion wa observed by dermoscopy or endoscopy neurological evaluation showed improvement in cerebellar function score at month immunohistochemistry ihc analysis in skin and gi benign lesion showed a decrease in the ratio of phosphorylated p to total s in response to sirolimus ratio of psk to total s at day and were significantly lower than at baseline p p respectively a day course of sirolimus wa well tolerated conclusion a day course of sirolimus wa well tolerated in subject with cowden syndrome and wa associated with some evidence of improvement in symptom skin and gi lesion cerebellar function and decreased mtor signaling
label: Non-Cancer

title: use of mammographic measurement to predict complication after nipplesparing mastectomy in brca mutation carrier
abstract: background there is limited data evaluating mastectomy skin flap complication of nipplesparing mastectomy nsm in patient with brca gene mutation the purpose of this study wa to identify factor associated with postoperative complication in brca mutation carrier undergoing nsm method following institutional review board approval we interrogated a prospectively collected institutional database for patient undergoing nsm who tested positive for brca mutation patient characteristic preoperative detail and complication were evaluated digital mammogram wa used to estimate the breast volume result from august to december patient male with brca mutation underwent nsms ninetytwo were riskreduction surgery thirtytwo underwent singlestage reconstruction autologous the overall complication rate wa n and n underwent unanticipated reoperation n had fullthickness skin flap necrosis n nipple necrosis and n fullthickness nipple necrosis these complication were associated with larger breast volume cc v cc p and greater body mass index v p by univariate analysis body mass index and breast volume greater than cc were associated with significantly higher complication rate odds ratio and respectively p conclusion this study confirms that nsm in brca mutation carrier is associated with complication in one in four patient utilizing the preoperative mammogram to estimate breast size may be more helpful than breast cup size in counseling preoperatively the risk of complication
label: Non-Cancer

title: a review on protein marker of exosome from different bioresources and the antibody used for characterization
abstract: exosomes are small membrane vesicle ranging from nm to nm secreted by different cell type upon fusion of multivesicular body mvb to the cell plasma membrane under a variety of normal and pathological condition through transferring their cargo such a protein lipid and nucleic acid from donor cell to recipient cell exosomes play a crucial role in celltocell communication due to their presence in most body fluid such a blood breast milk saliva urine bile pancreatic juice cerebrospinal and peritoneal fluid and their role in carrying bioactive molecule from the cell of origin exosomes have attracted great interest in their diagnostic and prognostic value for various disease and therapeutic approach although a large body of literature ha documented the importance of exosomes over the past decade there is no article systematically summarizing protein marker of exosome from different resource and the antibody that are suited to characterize exosomes in this review we briefly summarize the exosome marker protein exosomal biomarkers for different disease and the antibody suitable for different bioresources exosomes characterization
label: Non-Cancer

title: probable progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathyimmune reconstitution inflammatory syndrome with immunosuppressant dose reduction following lung transplantation a case report and literature review
abstract: background progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy pml is a rapidly developing demyelinating disease in the cerebral white matter and is often caused by jc polyomavirus jcv pml after lung transplantation is rare and ha a poor prognosis with no established therapy reducing the patient immunosuppressant dos thereby restoring immunity could be used to treat pml however some patient develop immune reconstitution inflammatory syndrome iris with this treatment an immuneinduced inflammatory response to jcv that result in serious neuronal damage we herein report a case of a yearold female who suffered from pml year after lung transplantation had worsened brain lesion thought to be related to pmliris at the time of immunosuppressant reduction and missed treatment opportunity case presentation a yearold female developed pml year after lung transplantation fluidattenuated inversion recovery and diffusionweighted brain magnetic resonance imaging mri revealed multiple highsignal lesion mainly in the cerebral white matter polymerase chain reaction found million copiesml of jcv in the cerebrospinal fluid thus she wa given a diagnosis of pml mycophenolate mofetil and tacrolimus dosage were reduced and cdpositive cell count and the blood concentration of each immunosuppressant were monitored mefloquine wa also orally administered at a daily dose of mg for day and wa then administered at a dose of mg per week although the patient cdpositive cell count increased and her immune system recovered her symptom and brain mri finding worsened we suspected pml progression or a transition to pmliris steroid pulse therapy to suppress the inflammatory lesion wa not possible but wa retrospectively indicated the patient rapidly began to exhibit akinetic mutism and died month after the onset of neurologic symptom conclusion when neurologic symptom and abnormal brain mri finding are noted during immune recovery it is often difficult to distinguish between progressed pml and pmliris however the pathogenesis of brain lesion usually involves inflammation and immunereactive mechanism for jcv steroid pulse therapy which can reduce inflammation should thus be administered in organ transplantation case with differential diagnosis including pmliris

between progressed pml and pmliris however the pathogenesis of brain lesion usually involves inflammation and immunereactive mechanism for jcv steroid pulse therapy which can reduce inflammation should thus be administered in organ transplantation case with differential diagnosis including pmliris

title: novel genetic determinant of dental maturation in child
abstract: dental occlusion requires harmonious development of teeth jaw and other element of the craniofacial complex which are regulated by environmental and genetic factor we performed the first genomewide association study gwas on dental development dd using the demirjian radiographic method radiographic assessment from participant of the generation r study primary study population n mean age of y were correlated with million genetic variant while adjusting for age sex and genomic principal component proxy for population stratification variant associated with dd at genomewide significant level p mapped to q irx lead variant r b p  we used fisher combined probability test weighted by sample size to perform a metaanalysis n combining radiographic dd at a mean age of y from generation r with data from a previous gwas n on number of teeth nt in infant used a proxy of dd at a mean age of y including the alspac and nfbc this gwas metaanalysis revealed novel locus mapping to p igfbp p  q pax p  and q irx p  and validated previously reported nt locus a polygenic allele score constructed from these locus wa associated with radiographic dd in an independent generation r set of child n b p furthermore profiling of the identified gene across an atlas of murine and human stem cell observed expression in the cell involved in the formation of bone andor dental tissue frequency per kilobase of transcript per million mapped read likely reflecting functional specialization our finding provide biological insight into the polygenic architecture of the pediatric dental maturation process

abstract: focal segmental glomerulosclerosis fsgs is a major cause of pediatric nephrotic syndrome and african american exhibit an increased risk for developing fsgs compared with other population predisposing genetic factor have previously been described in adult here we performed genomic screening of primary fsgs in a pediatric african american population

title: effectiveness of elbasvirgrazoprevir plus ribavirin for hepatitis c virus genotype a infection and baseline nsa resistance
abstract: in clinical trial patient with hepatitis c virus hcv genotype gta infection and baseline resistanceassociated substitution ras at amino acid position or receiving elbasvirgrazoprevir for week achieved lower rate of sustained virologic response svr than those without baseline ras svr rate in patient with ras were improved when elbasvirgrazoprevir treatment duration wa extended from to week and administered concomitantly with ribavirin

title: toward a realistic in silico abdominal phantom for qsm
abstract: qsm outside the brain ha recently gained interest particularly in the abdominal region however the absence of reliable ground truth make difficult to assess reconstruction algorithm whose quality is already compromised by additional signal contribution from fat gas and different kind of motion this work present a realistic in silico phantom for the development evaluation and comparison of abdominal qsm reconstruction algorithm

title: adsynnet systematic identification of alzheimers diseaseassociated mutation and comutation vulnerability via deep learning
abstract: alzheimers disease ad is one of the most challenging neurodegenerative disease because of it complicated and progressive mechanism and multiple risk factor increasing research evidence demonstrates that genetics may be a key factor responsible for the occurrence of the disease although previous report identified quite a few adassociated gene they were mostly limited owing to patient sample size and selection bias there is a lack of comprehensive research aimed to identify adassociated risk mutation systematically to address this challenge we hereby construct a largescale ad mutation and comutation framework adsynnet and propose deep learning model named deepsmci and deepcmci configured with fully connected layer that are capable of predicting cognitive impairment of subject effectively based on genetic mutation and comutation profile next we apply the customized framework to data set to evaluate the importance score of the mutation and identified mutation effector and comutation combination vulnerability contributing to cognitive impairment furthermore we evaluate the influence of mutation pair on the network architecture to dissect the genetic organization of ad and identify novel comutations that could be responsible for dementia laying a solid foundation for proposing future targeted therapy for ad precision medicine our deep learning model code are available open access here httpsgithubcompanbioadmutationeffectors
label: Non-Cancer

title: multiple infliximab biosimilar switch appear to be safe and effective in a realworld inflammatory bowel disease cohort
abstract: switching from originator infliximab ifx to biosimilar ifx is effective and safe however data on multiple switching are scarce the edinburgh inflammatory bowel disease ibd unit ha undertaken three switch programme remicade to ctp ctp to sb and sb to ctp
label: Non-Cancer

title: fzd regulates limb development by mediating catenindependent and independent wnt signaling pathway
abstract: human robinow syndrome r and dominant omodysplasia type omod characterized by skeletal limb and craniofacial defect are associated with heterozygous mutation in the wnt receptor fzd however a fzd can activate both canonical and noncanonical wnt pathway it precise function and mechanism of action in limb development are unclear to address these question we generated mouse harboring a singlenucleotide insertion in fzd fzdemsmill causing a frameshift mutation in the final dishevelledinteracting domain fzdemsmill mutant mouse had shortened limb resembling those of r and omod patient indicating that fzd mutation are causative fzdemsmill mutant embryo displayed decreased canonical wnt signaling in developing limb mesenchyme and disruption of digit chondrocyte elongation and orientation which is controlled by the cateninindependent wntaplanar cell polarity pcp pathway in line with these observation we found that disruption of fzd function in limb mesenchyme caused formation of shortened bone element and defect in wntcatenin and wntapcp signaling these finding indicate that fzd control limb development by mediating both canonical and noncanonical wnt pathway and reveal causality of pathogenic fzd mutation in r and omod patient
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: fzd regulates limb development by mediating catenindependent and independent wnt signaling pathway human robinow syndrome r and dominant omodysplasia type omod characterized by skeletal limb and craniofacial defect are associated with heterozygous mutation in the wnt receptor fzd however a fzd can activate both canonical and noncanonical wnt pathway it precise function and mechanism of action in limb development are unclear to address these question we generated mouse harboring a singlenucleotide insertion in fzd fzdemsmill causing a frameshift mutation in the final dishevelledinteracting domain fzdemsmill mutant mouse had shortened limb resembling those of r and omod patient indicating that fzd mutation are causative fzdemsmill mutant embryo displayed decreased canonical wnt signaling in developing limb mesenchyme and disruption of digit chondrocyte elongation and orientation which is controlled by the cateninindependent wntaplanar cell polarity pcp pathway in line with these observation we found that disruption of fzd function in limb mesenchyme caused formation of shortened bone element and defect in wntcatenin and wntapcp signaling these finding indicate that fzd control limb development by mediating both canonical and noncanonical wnt pathway and reveal causality of pathogenic fzd mutation in r and omod patient

title: the genetic basis of endometriosis and comorbidity with other pain and inflammatory condition
abstract: endometriosis is a common condition associated with debilitating pelvic pain and infertility a genomewide association study metaanalysis including case and control of european and east asian descent identified genomewide significant locus comprising distinct association signal effect size were largest for stage disease driven by ovarian endometriosis identified signal explained up to of disease variance and regulated expression or methylation of gene in endometrium and blood many of which were associated with pain perceptionmaintenance srpbmf gdap mllt bsn and ngf we observed significant genetic correlation between endometriosis and pain condition including migraine back and multisite chronic pain mcp a well a inflammatory condition including asthma and osteoarthritis multitrait genetic analysis identified substantial sharing of variant associated with endometriosis and mcpmigraine targeted investigation of genetically regulated mechanism shared between endometriosis and other pain condition are needed to aid the development of new treatment and facilitate early symptomatic intervention
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: the genetic basis of endometriosis and comorbidity with other pain and inflammatory condition endometriosis is a common condition associated with debilitating pelvic pain and infertility a genomewide association study metaanalysis including case and control of european and east asian descent identified genomewide significant locus comprising distinct association signal effect size were largest for stage disease driven by ovarian endometriosis identified signal explained up to of disease variance and regulated expression or methylation of gene in endometrium and blood many of which were associated with pain perceptionmaintenance srpbmf gdap mllt bsn and ngf we observed significant genetic correlation between endometriosis and pain condition including migraine back and multisite chronic pain mcp a well a inflammatory condition including asthma and osteoarthritis multitrait genetic analysis identified substantial sharing of variant associated with endometriosis and mcpmigraine targeted investigation of genetically regulated mechanism shared between endometriosis and other pain condition are needed to aid the development of new treatment and facilitate early symptomatic intervention

title: synthetic multiantigen mva vaccine cohs and variantspecific derivative protect syrian hamster from sarscov omicron subvariants
abstract: emerging sarscov omicron subvariants continue to disrupt covid vaccine efficacy through multiple immune mechanism including neutralizing antibody evasion we developed cohs a synthetic modified vaccinia ankara vector that coexpresses wuhanhubased spike and nucleocapsid antigen cohs demonstrated efficacy against ancestral virus and beta and delta variant in animal model and wa safe and immunogenic in a phase clinical trial here we report efficacy of cohs and analogous omicron ba and betaspecific vaccine to protect syrian hamster from omicron subvariants despite eliciting strainspecific antibody response all three vaccine protect hamster from weight loss lower respiratory tract infection and lung pathology following challenge with omicron ba or ba while the baspecifc vaccine affords consistently improved efficacy compared to cohs to protect against homologous challenge with ba all three vaccine confer similar protection against heterologous challenge with ba these result demonstrate efficacy of cohs and variantspecific derivative to confer crossprotective immunity against sarscov omicron subvariants
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: synthetic multiantigen mva vaccine cohs and variantspecific derivative protect syrian hamster from sarscov omicron subvariants emerging sarscov omicron subvariants continue to disrupt covid vaccine efficacy through multiple immune mechanism including neutralizing antibody evasion we developed cohs a synthetic modified vaccinia ankara vector that coexpresses wuhanhubased spike and nucleocapsid antigen cohs demonstrated efficacy against ancestral virus and beta and delta variant in animal model and wa safe and immunogenic in a phase clinical trial here we report efficacy of cohs and analogous omicron ba and betaspecific vaccine to protect syrian hamster from omicron subvariants despite eliciting strainspecific antibody response all three vaccine protect hamster from weight loss lower respiratory tract infection and lung pathology following challenge with omicron ba or ba while the baspecifc vaccine affords consistently improved efficacy compared to cohs to protect against homologous challenge with ba all three vaccine confer similar protection against heterologous challenge with ba these result demonstrate efficacy of cohs and variantspecific derivative to confer crossprotective immunity against sarscov omicron subvariants

title: structural basis for antibody recognition of vulnerable epitope on nipah virus f protein
abstract: nipah virus niv is a pathogenic paramyxovirus that cause fatal encephalitis in human two envelope glycoprotein the attachment protein grbp and fusion protein f facilitate entry into host cell due to it vital role niv f present an attractive target for developing vaccine and therapeutic several neutralizationsensitive epitope on the niv f apex have been described however the antigenicity of most of the f protein surface remains uncharacterized here we immunize mouse with prefusionstabilized niv f and isolate ten monoclonal antibody that neutralize pseudotyped virus cryoelectron microscopy reveals eight neutralizationsensitive epitope on niv f four of which have not previously been described novel site span the lateral and basal face of niv f expanding the known library of vulnerable epitope seven of ten antibody bind the hendra virus hev f protein multiple sequence alignment suggests that some of these newly identified neutralizing antibody may also bind f protein across the henipavirus genus this work identifies new epitope a target for therapeutic provides a molecular basis for niv neutralization and lay a foundation for development of new crossreactive antibody targeting henipavirus f protein
label: Non-Cancer

title: genomewide association study identifies genetic variant which predict the response of bone mineral density to teriparatide therapy
abstract: teriparatide tptd is an effective treatment for osteoporosis but the individual response to therapy is variable for reason that are unclear this study aimed to determine whether the response to tptd might be influenced by genetic factor

title: scalable rtlampbased sarscov testing for infection surveillance with application in pandemic preparedness
abstract: throughout the sarscov pandemic limited diagnostic capacity prevented sentinel testing demonstrating the need for novel testing infrastructure here we describe the setup of a costeffective platform that can be employed in a highthroughput manner which allows surveillance testing a an acute pandemic control and preparedness tool exemplified by sarscov diagnostics in an academic environment the strategy involves selfsampling based on gargling saline pseudonymized sample handling automated rna extraction and viral rna detection using a semiquantitative multiplexed colorimetric reverse transcription loopmediated isothermal amplification rtlamp assay with an analytical sensitivity comparable with rtqpcr we provide standard operating procedure and an integrated software solution for all workflow including sample logistics analysis by colorimetry or sequencing and communication of result we evaluated factor affecting the viral load and the stability of gargling sample a well a the diagnostic sensitivity of the rtlamp assay in parallel we estimated the economic cost of setting up and running the test station we performed test with an average turnover time of h from sample arrival to result announcement altogether our work provides a blueprint for fast sensitive scalable cost and laborefficient rtlamp diagnostics which is independent of potentially limiting clinical diagnostics supply chain
label: Non-Cancer

title: the pyruvate kinase deficiency global longitudinal peak registry rationale and study design
abstract: pyruvate kinase pk deficiency is a rare underrecognised hereditary condition that lead to chronic haemolytic anaemia and potentially serious secondary complication such a iron overload cholecystitis pulmonary hypertension and extramedullary haematopoiesis it is an autosomal recessive disease caused by homozygous or compound heterozygous mutation in the pklr gene due to it rarity and clinical heterogeneity information on the natural history and longterm clinical course of pk deficiency is limited presenting major challenge to patient management the development of new therapy and establishing diseasespecific treatment recommendation the pyruvate kinase deficiency global longitudinal peak registry is an initiative to address the gap in the knowledge of pk deficiency this manuscript describes the objective study design and methodology for the peak registry
label: Non-Cancer

title: pediatric nemaline myopathy a systematic review using individual patient data
abstract: nemaline myopathy is a skeletal muscle disease that affect in live birth the objective of this study wa to develop a narrative synthesis of the finding of a systematic review of the latest case description of patient with nm a systematic search of medline embase cinahl web of science and scopus wa performed using preferred reporting item for systematic review and metaanalyses prisma guideline using the keywords pediatric child nm nemaline rod and rod myopathy case study focused on pediatric nm and published in english between january and december in order to represent the most recent finding information wa collected about the age of first sign earliest presenting neuromuscular sign and symptom system affected progression death pathologic description and genetic change of a total of record case report or series were reviewed covering pediatric patient from country we review varying presentation in child ranging in severity despite being caused by the same mutation in addition to current and future clinical consideration relevant to the care of patient with nm this review synthesizes genetic histopathologic and disease presentation finding from pediatric nm case report these data strengthen our understanding of the wide spectrum of disease seen in nm future study are needed to identify the underlying molecular mechanism of pathology to improve diagnostics and to develop better method to improve the quality of life for these patient

title: persistent sarscovspecific immune defect in kidney transplant recipient following third mrna vaccine dos
abstract: kidney transplant recipient ktrs show poorer response to sarscov mrna vaccination yet response pattern and mechanistic driver following third dos are illdefined we administered third monovalent mrna vaccine to n ktrs with negative or lowtiter antireceptor binding domain rbd antibody n antirbdneg n antirbdlo compared to healthy control hc n measuring antirbd omicron neutralization spikespecific cd and sarscovreactive t cell receptor tcr repertoire by day antirbdneg remained seronegative ktrs developed ba neutralization versus hcs p day sarscovreactive tcr repertoire were detected in ktrs versus hcs p spikespecific cd tcr expansion wa similar between ktrs and hcs yet ktr cd tcr depth wa fold lower p global negative response wa seen in ktrs associated with highdose mycophenolate p showed global positive response ktrs experienced breakthrough infection with hospitalization prebreakthrough variant neutralization wa poor absent neutralizing and cd response in ktrs indicate vulnerability to covid despite threedose mrna vaccination lack of neutralization despite cd expansion suggests b cell dysfunction andor ineffective t cell help development of more effective ktr vaccine strategy is criticalnct

title: implementation of dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase deficiency testing in europe
abstract: the main cause for fluoropyrimidinerelated toxicity is deficiency of the metabolizing enzyme dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase dpd in the european medicine agency ema recommended two method for pretreatment dpd deficiency testing in clinical practice phenotyping using endogenous uracil concentration or genotyping for dpyd risk variant allele this study assessed the dpd testing implementation status in europe and the release of the ema recommendation

title: the power of topmed imputation for the discovery of latinoenriched rare variant associated with type diabetes
abstract: the latino population ha been systematically underrepresented in largescale genetic analysis and previous study have relied on the imputation of ungenotyped variant based on the genome g imputation panel which result in suboptimal capture of lowfrequency or latinoenriched variant the national heart lung and blood institute nhlbi transomics for precision medicine topmed released the largest multiancestry genotype reference panel representing a unique opportunity to analyse rare genetic variation in the latino population we hypothesise that a more comprehensive analysis of lowrare variation using the topmed panel would improve our knowledge of the genetics of type diabetes in the latino population
label: Non-Cancer

title: clonal hematopoiesis is associated with protection from alzheimers disease
abstract: clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential chip is a premalignant expansion of mutated hematopoietic stem cell a chipassociated mutation are known to alter the development and function of myeloid cell we hypothesized that chip may also be associated with the risk of alzheimers disease ad a disease in which brainresident myeloid cell are thought to have a major role to perform association test between chip and ad dementia we analyzed blood dna sequencing data from individual with ad and individual without ad individual with chip had a lower risk of ad dementia metaanalysis odds ratio or p  and mendelian randomization analysis supported a potential causal association we observed that the same mutation found in blood were also detected in microgliaenriched fraction of the brain in seven of eight chip carrier singlenucleus chromatin accessibility profiling of brainderived nucleus in six chip carrier revealed that the mutated cell comprised a large proportion of the microglial pool in the sample examined while additional study are required to validate the mechanistic finding these result suggest that chip may have a role in attenuating the risk of ad
label: Non-Cancer

title: an integral approach to the molecular diagnosis of tuberous sclerosis complex the role of mosaicism and splicing variant
abstract: tuberous sclerosis complex tsc is an autosomal dominant genetic disorder characterized by the presence of hamartoma in multiple organ at the molecular level the disease is caused by pathogenic variant in the tsc and tsc gene and only to of clinically diagnosed patient remain negative after multiplex ligationdependent probe amplification and exon sequencing of both gene here to improve the molecular diagnosis of tsc we developed an integral approach that includes multiplex ligationdependent probe amplification and deepcoverage nextgeneration sequencing of the entire tsc and tsc gene along with an adapted bioinformatic pipeline to detect variant at low allele frequency using this workflow the molecular cause wa identified in of patient with tsc describing here for the first time novel pathogenic variant in tsc gene these variant included seven splicing variant five of which were studied at the cdna level determining their effect on splicing in addition of the pathogenic variant were detected in mosaicism including four patient with previous negative study result who presented extremely low mosaic variant allele frequency we demonstrate that this integral approach allows the molecular diagnosis of patient with tsc and improves the conventional one by adapting the technology to the detection of lowfrequency mosaic
label: Non-Cancer

title: radiogenomics in nfassociated schwannomatosis neurofibromatosis type ii exploratory data analysis
abstract: our pilot study aimed at exploratory radiogenomic data analysis in patient with nfassociated schwannomatosis formerly neurofibromatosis type ii to assume the potential of image biomarkers in this pathology fiftythree unrelated patient woman avg age  yo were enrolled in the study firstorder graylevel cooccurrence matrix glcm graylevel run length matrix glrlm and geometrybased statistic were calculated feature per region of interest we demonstrated imaging pattern and statistically significant difference in radiomic feature potentially related to the genotype and clinical phenotype of the disease however the clinical utility of these pattern should be further evaluated the study wa supported by the russian science foundation grant

title: ulk phosphorylation of stx control autophagosome maturation via flna
abstract: autophagy is a conserved and tightly regulated intracellular quality control pathway ulk is a key kinase in autophagy initiation but whether ulk kinase activity also participates in the late stage of autophagy remains unknown here we found that the autophagosomal snare protein stx is phosphorylated by ulk at residue s beyond which it localizes specifically to autophagosomes inhibition of stx phosphorylation prevents such autophagosome localization flna wa then identified a a linker between atg family protein atgs and stx with essential involvement in stx recruitment to autophagosomes phosphorylation of stx s promotes it interaction with flna activating it recruitment to autophagosomes and facilitating autophagosomelysosome fusion diseasecausative mutation around the atgs and stxbinding region of flna disrupt it interaction with atgs and stx inhibiting stx recruitment and autophagosomelysosome fusion cumulatively our study reveals an unexpected role of ulk in autophagosome maturation uncovers it regulatory mechanism in stx recruitment and highlight a potential association between autophagy and flna
label: Non-Cancer

title: an improved recombinase polymerase amplification assay for the visual detection of staphylococcus epidermidis with lateral flow strip
abstract: staphylococcus epidermidis is an opportunistic pathogenic microorganism that is an important cause of crossinfection in hospital the development of rapid and effective detection technique is important for it control the application of traditional identification and pcrbased method is limited by their requirement for both laboratory instrumentation and trained personnel to overcome this issue we developed a fast detection approach for s epidermidis that wa based on recombinase polymerase amplification rpa and lateral flow strip lf first five pair of primer were designed for molecular diagnosis using the sesb gene a the target and were screened for their amplification performance and the formation of primer dimer specific probe were then designed based on the best primer pair screened which were susceptible to primerdependent artifact and generated falsepositive signal when used for lf detection this weakness of the lf assay wa overcome by modifying the sequence of the primer and probe the efficacy of these measure wa rigorously tested and improved the rpalfs system standardized system completed the amplification process within min at a constant temperature of c followed by visualization of the lf within min the approach wa very sensitive with a detection limit of cful with very good interspecies specificity in the analysis of clinical sample the approach produced result consistent with pcr and consistent with the culturebiochemical method with a kappa index of our method wa rapid accurate and less dependent on equipment and trained personnel than traditional method and provided information for the timely development of rational antimicrobial treatment plan it ha high potential utility in clinical setting particularly in resourceconstrained location
label: Non-Cancer

title: a rapid cellfree expression and screening platform for antibody discovery
abstract: antibody discovery is bottlenecked by the individual expression and evaluation of antigenspecific hit here we address this bottleneck by developing a workflow combining cellfree dna template generation cellfree protein synthesis and binding measurement of antibody fragment in a process that take hour rather than week we apply this workflow to evaluate previously published antibody targeting the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus sarscov including all antibody previously granted emergency use authorization for coronavirus disease covid and demonstrate identification of the most potent antibody we also evaluate antisarscov antibody from a mouse immunized with the sarscov spike protein and identify neutralizing antibody candidate including the antibody sc which bind the sarscov spike protein of all tested variant of concern we expect that our cellfree workflow will accelerate the discovery and characterization of antibody for future pandemic and for research diagnostic and therapeutic application more broadly
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: a rapid cellfree expression and screening platform for antibody discovery antibody discovery is bottlenecked by the individual expression and evaluation of antigenspecific hit here we address this bottleneck by developing a workflow combining cellfree dna template generation cellfree protein synthesis and binding measurement of antibody fragment in a process that take hour rather than week we apply this workflow to evaluate previously published antibody targeting the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus sarscov including all antibody previously granted emergency use authorization for coronavirus disease covid and demonstrate identification of the most potent antibody we also evaluate antisarscov antibody from a mouse immunized with the sarscov spike protein and identify neutralizing antibody candidate including the antibody sc which bind the sarscov spike protein of all tested variant of concern we expect that our cellfree workflow will accelerate the discovery and characterization of antibody for future pandemic and for research diagnostic and therapeutic application more broadly

title: inhibition of tmema improves cisplatininduced acute kidney injury via preventing drpmediated mitochondrial fission
abstract: acute kidney injury aki is associated with high morbidity and mortality our previous study ha demonstrated that tmema a caactivated chloride channel contributes to renal fibrosis progression in chronic kidney disease however whether tmema is involved in aki is still unknown in this study we established cisplatin aki mouse model and found that tmema expression wa upregulated in the injured kidney in vivo knockdown of tmema effectively prevented cisplatininduced tubular cell apoptosis inflammation and kidney function loss western blot and transmission electron microscopy tem revealed that tmema knockdown inhibited drp translocation from the cytoplasm to mitochondrion and prevented mitochondrial fission in tubular cell consistently in cultured hk cell knockdown or inhibition of tmema by shrna or it specific inhibitor suppressed cisplatininduced mitochondrial fission and it associated energy dysfunction ro accumulation and cell apoptosis via inhibiting drp activation further investigation showed that genetic knockdown or pharmacological inhibition of tmema inhibited cisplatininduced drp ser site phosphorylation through erk signaling pathway whereas overexpression of tmema promoted this effect treatment with drp or erk inhibitor could efficiently prevent cisplatininduced mitochondrial fission collectively our data suggest that tmema inhibition alleviated cisplatininduced aki by preventing tubular cell mitochondrial fission through the erk drp pathway inhibition of tmema may be a novel therapeutic strategy for aki
label: Non-Cancer

title: dynamic rod construct a the preventive strategy against adjacent segment disease in degenerative lumbar spinal disorder a retrospective comparative cohort study
abstract: adjacent segment degeneration asde and adjacent segment disease asdi are potential longterm complication after lumbar fusion with rigid instrumentation dynamic fixation technique toppingoff adjacent to the fused segment have been developed to curtail the risk of asde and asdi the current study sought to investigate whether the addition of dynamic rod construct drc in patient with preoperative degeneration in the adjacent disc wa effective in reducing the risk of asdi

title: protocadherin maintains intestinal barrier function to protect against crohn disease by targeting atf
abstract: intestinal barrier dysfunction play a central role in the pathological onset of crohn disease we identify the cadherin superfamily member protocadherin pcdh a a crucial factor in crohn disease here we describe the function of pcdh and it mechanism in gut homeostasis barrier integrity and crohn disease development
label: Non-Cancer

title: mechanistic and evolutionary insight into a type vm crisprcas effector enzyme
abstract: rnaguided type v crisprcas effector provide adaptive immunity against mobile genetic element mges in bacteria and archaea among diverse ca enzyme the recently identified casm crisprcas type vm is highly compact and ha a unique ruvc active site although the noncanonical ruvc triad doe not permit dsdna cleavage casm still protects against invading mges through transcriptional silencing by strong dna binding however the molecular mechanism of rnaguided genome inactivation by casm remains unknown here we report cryoelectron microscopy structure of two state of casmcrispr rna crrnatarget dna ternary complex and the casmcrrna binary complex revealing structural dynamic during crrnatarget dna heteroduplex formation the structure indicate that the nontarget dna strand is tightly bound to a unique argininerich cluster in the recognition rec domain and the noncanonical active site in the ruvc domain ensuring strong dnabinding affinity of casm furthermore a structural comparison of casm with tnpb a putative ancestor of ca enzyme suggests that the interaction of the characteristic coiledcoil rec insertion with the protospaceradjacent motifdistal region of the heteroduplex is crucial for casm to engage in adaptive immunity collectively our finding improve mechanistic understanding of diverse type v crisprcas effector and provide insight into the evolution of tnpb to ca enzyme
label: Non-Cancer

title: elevated binding and functional antibody response to sarscov in infant versus mother
abstract: infant antibody response to viral infection can differ from those in adult however data on the specificity and function of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus sarscov antibody in infant and direct comparison between infant and adult are limited here we characterize antibody binding and functionality against wuhanhu b lineage strain sarscov in convalescent plasma from postpartum woman and of their infant infected with sarscov from a vaccinenave prospective cohort in nairobi kenya we find significantly higher antibody titer against sarscov spike receptor binding domain and nterminal domain and spikeexpressing cellsurface staining level in infant versus mother plasma antibody from mother and infant bind to similar region of the spike s subunit including the fusion peptide fp and stem helixheptad repeat however infant display higher antibody level and more consistent antibody escape pathway in the fp region compared to mother finally infant have significantly higher level of antibodydependent cellular cytotoxicity adcc though surprisingly spike pseudovirus neutralization titer between infant and mother are similar these result suggest infant develop distinct sarscov binding and functional antibody activity and reveal agerelated difference in humoral immunity to sarscov infection that could be relevant to protection and covid disease outcome
label: Non-Cancer

title: detection of primary dna lesion by transient change in mating behavior in yeast saccharomyces cerevisiae using the alphatest
abstract: spontaneous or induced dna lesion can result in stable gene mutation and chromosomal aberration due to their inaccurate repair ultimately resulting in phenotype change some dna lesion per se may interfere with transcription leading to temporary phenocopies of mutation the direct impact of primary dna lesion on phenotype before their removal by repair is not well understood to address this question we used the alphatest which allows for detecting various genetic event leading to temporary or hereditary change in mating type a in heterothallic strain of yeast saccharomyces cerevisiae here we compared yeast strain carrying mutation in dna repair gene mismatch repair pm base excision repair ogg and homologous recombination repair rad a well a mutagen causing specific dna lesion uv light and camptothecin we found that doublestrand break and uvinduced lesion have a stronger effect on the phenotype than mismatch and oxoguanine moreover the loss of the entire chromosome iii lead to an immediate mating type switch a and doe not prevent hybridization we also evaluated the ability of primary dna lesion to persist through the cell cycle by assessing the frequency of uvinduced inherited and noninherited genetic change in asynchronous culture of a wildtype wt strain and in a cdc mutant arrested in the g phase our finding suggest that the phenotypic manifestation of primary dna lesion depends on their type and the stage of the cell cycle in which it occurred
label: Non-Cancer

title: diagnosis and management of patient with left ventricular hypertrophy role of multimodality cardiac imaging a scientific statement of the heart failure association of the esc
abstract: left ventricular lv hypertrophy consists in an increased lv wall thickness lv hypertrophy can be either secondary in response to pressure or volume overload or primary ie not explained solely by abnormal loading condition primary lv hypertrophy may be due to gene mutation or to the deposition or storage of abnormal substance in the extracellular space or within the cardiomyocytes more appropriately defined a pseudohypertrophy lv hypertrophy is often a precursor to subsequent development of heart failure cardiovascular imaging play a key role in the assessment of lv hypertrophy echocardiography the firstline imaging technique allows a comprehensive assessment of lv systolic and diastolic function cardiovascular magnetic resonance provides added value a it measure accurately lv and right ventricular volume and mass and characterizes myocardial tissue property which may provide important clue to the final diagnosis additionally scintigraphy with bone tracer is included in the diagnostic algorithm of cardiac amyloidosis once the diagnosis is established imaging finding may help predict future disease evolution and inform therapy and followup this consensus document by the heart failure association of the european society of cardiology provides an overview of the role of different cardiac imaging technique for the differential diagnosis and management of patient with lv hypertrophy this article is protected by copyright all right reserved

title: rare disease variant curation from literature assessing gap with creatine transport deficiency in focus
abstract: approximately of the world suffers from a rare disease rare disease are often difficult to diagnose and many do not have approved therapy genetic sequencing ha the potential to shorten the current diagnostic process increase mechanistic understanding and facilitate research on therapeutic approach but is limited by the difficulty of novel variant pathogenicity interpretation and the communication of known causative variant it is unknown how many published rare disease variant are currently accessible in the public domain

title: endothelial fis desumoylation protects against hypoxic pulmonary hypertension
abstract: hypoxia is a major cause and promoter of pulmonary hypertension ph a representative vascular remodeling disease with poor prognosis and high mortality however the mechanism underlying how pulmonary arterial system responds to hypoxic stress during ph remains unclear endothelial mitochondrion are considered signaling organelle on oxygen tension result from previous clinical research and our study suggested a potential role of posttranslational sumoylation in endothelial mitochondrion in hypoxiarelated vasculopathy

title: myodfamily inhibitor protein act a auxiliary subunit of piezo channel
abstract: piezo channel are critical cellular sensor of mechanical force despite their large size ubiquitous expression and irreplaceable role in an evergrowing list of physiological process few piezo channelbinding protein have emerged in this work we found that myod myoblast determinationfamily inhibitor protein mdfic and mdfi are piezo interacting partner these transcriptional regulator bind to piezo channel regulating channel inactivation using singleparticle cryogenic electron microscopy we mapped the interaction site in mdfic to a lipidated cterminal helix that insert laterally into the piezo pore module these piezointeracting protein fit all the criterion for auxiliary subunit contribute to explaining the vastly different gating kinetics of endogenous piezo channel observed in many cell type and elucidate mechanism potentially involved in human lymphatic vascular disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: gene editing of hematopoietic stem cell restores t cell response in familial hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis
abstract: hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis hlh is a hyperinflammatory disorder characterized by a lifethreatening cytokine storm and immunopathology familial hlh type fhl account for  of all inborn hlh case worldwide it is caused by mutation in the uncd gene which result in impaired degranulation of cytotoxic vesicle and hence compromised t and nk cellmediated killing current treatment protocol including allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell hsc transplantation still show high mortality

title: brjesonforssmanlehmann syndrome delineating the clinical and allelic spectrum in new family
abstract: brjesonforssmanlehmann syndrome bfls is an xlinked intellectual disability syndrome caused by variant in the phf gene we ascertained individual from family with likely pathogenic or pathogenic phf variant male and female one family had previously been reported six variant were novel we analysed the clinical and genetic finding in our series and compared them with reported bfls patient affected male had classic feature of bfls including intellectual disability distinctive facies large ear gynaecomastia hypogonadism and truncal obesity carrier female relative of affected male were unaffected or had only mild symptom the phenotype of affected female with de novo variant overlapped with the male but included linear skin hyperpigmentation and a higher frequency of dental retinal and cortical brain anomaly complication observed in our series included keloid scarring digital fibroma absent vaginal orifice neuropathy umbilical hernia and talipes our analysis highlighted sexspecific difference in phf variant type and location affected male often have missense variant or small inframe deletion while affected female tend to have truncating variant or large deletionsduplications missense variant were found in a minority of affected female and clustered in the highly constrained phd domain of phf we propose recommendation for the evaluation and management of bfls patient these result further delineate and extend the genetic and phenotypic spectrum of bfls
label: Non-Cancer

title: reassessment of the nf variant of unknown significance found during the year activity of a genetics diagnostic laboratory
abstract: the finding of variant of uncertain significance vus in the activity of a diagnostic genetic laboratory is a common issue which is however provisional and need to be periodically reevaluated due to the continuous advancement in our knowledge of the genetic disease neurofibromatosis type caused by the occurrence of heterozygous pathogenic nf variant is a good model for studying the evolution of vus due to the widespread use of genetic testing for the disease the constant enrichment of the international database with nf variant and the full adult penetrance of the disease which make genotyping the parent a crucial step in the diagnostic workflow the present study retrospectively reviewed and reinterpreted the genetic test result of nf in a diagnostic genetic laboratory in the period from january to december all the vus were reinterpreted using the consensus standard and guideline for the interpretation out of nf genetic test which were performed in the period a total of vus were found and reinterpreted in case were reclassified a benignlikely benign whereas were recoded a pathogeniclikely pathogenic with a significant trend distribution chi square test for trend p synonymous vus have mainly been reclassified a class and whereas missense variant have been attributed to class and in out of the case these finding underline an improvement in the classification of variant over time suggesting that a reinterpretation of the genetic test should be routinely performed to support the physician in the clinical diagnosis of genetic disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: symptomatic intraventricular choroid plexus cyst illustrative case and systematic review
abstract: although choroid plexus cyst are a frequent incidental neuroimaging finding symptomatic one are rarea series of more than five case are hard to find in the absence of highvolume study there are no generally accepted algorithm for diagnosis and treatment for this pathology proposed surgical technique include microsurgical excision or fenestration and endoscopic excision or fenestration with or without additional shunting no definitive conclusion exist about the superiority of a certain technique here we introduce an illustrative case of a patient with a symptomatic choroid plexus cyst in the trigone of the lateral ventricle and a systematic review of additional published case with the aim of identifying epidemiological feature variant of localization of the cyst their symptom persistence of concomitant obstructive hydrocephalus and treatment modality a prismabased literature search wa performed on the pubmed medline scopus and web of knowledge database we include in the review case report and case series of symptomatic choroid plexus cyst with full text or valuable abstract available online in english and published by april all abstract of retrieved study were assessed by two independent researcher to avoid bias only descriptive statistic were used for the presentation of the result a total of study case report and case series with depicted case met the eligibility criterion the review showed a slight predominance of choroid plexus cyst in men the most common localization of cyst were the trigone and the body of the lateral ventricle obstructive hydrocephalus is often present in patient with choroid plexus cyst the most common symptom of cyst were sign of increased icp headache and vomiting the main treatment approach for symptomatic choroid plexus cyst were microsurgical excision microsurgical fenestration endoscopic fenestration and total endoscopic excision the tendency ha been noted to shift from microsurgical to endoscopic procedure over the past two decade some data on the classification of cyst of the central nervous system and the underlying mechanism of the pathogenesis of choroid plexus cyst are also presentedalthough symptomatic case of choroid plexus cyst are rare by summarizing currently available data one could clarify their common feature and identify a preferable treatment modality
label: Non-Cancer

sign of increased icp headache and vomiting the main treatment approach for symptomatic choroid plexus cyst were microsurgical excision microsurgical fenestration endoscopic fenestration and total endoscopic excision the tendency ha been noted to shift from microsurgical to endoscopic procedure over the past two decade some data on the classification of cyst of the central nervous system and the underlying mechanism of the pathogenesis of choroid plexus cyst are also presentedalthough symptomatic case of choroid plexus cyst are rare by summarizing currently available data one could clarify their common feature and identify a preferable treatment modality

title: risk factor for early mortality in elderly patient with unstable isolated c odontoid fracture treated with halovest or surgery
abstract: the aim of this study wa to compare inhospital mortality of three procedure halovest immobilization anterior spinal fixation asf and posterior spinal fixation psf in the treatment of elderly patient with isolated c odontoid fracture we extracted data for elderly patient who were admitted with c odontoid fracture and treated with at least one of the three procedure halovest immobilization asf or psf during hospitalization we conducted a generalized propensity scorebased matching weight analysis to compare inhospital mortality among the three procedure we further investigated independent risk factor for inhospital death the study involved patient halovest n asf n and psf n with a mean age of year inhospital death occurred in patient treatment type wa not significantly associated with inhospital mortality male sex odds ratio confidence interval p and a charlson comorbidity index of  odds ratio confidence interval p were independent risk factor for inhospital mortality in conclusion treatment type wa not significantly associated with inhospital mortality in elderly patient with isolated c odontoid fracture halovest immobilization can help to avoid adverse event in patient with c odontoid fracture who are considered less suitable for surgical treatment
label: Non-Cancer

title: retrospective pharmacogenetic study in a cohort of pediatric tuberous sclerosis complex patient using everolimus
abstract: aim tuberous sclerosis complex tsc is a rare disease that produce multisystemic disorder everolimus evr is the only immunosuppressive drug approved to control the symptom and progression of the disease the aim wa to evaluate the genotypephenotype association to improve the pediatric tsc pharmacotherapeutic outcome patient method ten pediatric tsc patient were recruited concomitant treatment and main metabolic enzyme and transporter coding gene variant of evr were analyzed result significant association were found between cypa allele and concomitant treatment with valproic acid cypainhibitor with a poor metabolizer phenotype and the presence of pneumonia conclusion this is the first pharmacogenetic study of evr in pediatric tsc patient the author propose to consider concomitant treatment and pharmacogenetics due to their multifactorial status
label: Non-Cancer

title: exome copy number variant detection analysis and classification in a large cohort of family with undiagnosed rare genetic disease
abstract: copy number variant cnvs are significant contributor to the pathogenicity of rare genetic disease and with new innovative method can now reliably be identified from exome sequencing challenge still remain in accurate classification of cnv pathogenicity cnv calling using gatkgcnv wa performed on exomes from a cohort of family individual with heterogeneous phenotype and variable prior genetic testing collected at the broad institute center for mendelian genomics of the gregor consortium each family cnv data wa analyzed using the seqr platform and candidate cnvs classified using the acmgclingen cnv interpretation standard we developed additional evidence criterion to address situation not covered by the current standard the addition of cnv calling to exome analysis identified causal cnvs for family the estimated size of cnvs ranged from bp to mb with estimate that would not have been detected by standard chromosomal microarrays the causal cnvs consisted of deletion duplication suspected complex structural variant svs insertion and complex svs the latter two group being identified by orthogonal validation method we interpreted cnvs a likely pathogenicpathogenic and cnvs a high interest variant of uncertain significance calling cnvs from existing exome data increase the diagnostic yield for individual undiagnosed after standard testing approach providing a higher resolution alternative to array at a fraction of the cost of genome sequencing our improvement to the classification approach advance the systematic framework to assess the pathogenicity of cnvs
label: Non-Cancer

title: candida albicans exhibit heterogeneous and adaptive cytoprotective response to antifungal compound
abstract: candida albicans an opportunistic human pathogen pose a significant threat to human health and is associated with significant socioeconomic burden current antifungal treatment fail at least in part because c albicans can initiate a strong drug tolerance response that allows some cell to grow at drug concentration above their minimal inhibitory concentration to better characterize this cytoprotective tolerance program at the molecular singlecell level we used a nanoliter dropletbased transcriptomics platform to profile thousand of individual fungal cell and establish their subpopulation characteristic in the absence and presence of antifungal drug profile of untreated cell exhibit heterogeneous expression that correlate with cell cycle stage with distinct metabolic and stress response at day postfluconazole exposure a time when tolerance is measurable surviving cell bifurcate into two major subpopulation one characterized by the upregulation of gene encoding ribosomal protein rrna processing machinery and mitochondrial cellular respiration capacity termed the ribodominant rd state and the other enriched for gene encoding stress response and related process termed the stressdominant sd state this bifurcation persists at and day posttreatment we provide evidence that the ribosome assembly stress response rastr is activated in these subpopulation and may facilitate cell survival
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: candida albicans exhibit heterogeneous and adaptive cytoprotective response to antifungal compound candida albicans an opportunistic human pathogen pose a significant threat to human health and is associated with significant socioeconomic burden current antifungal treatment fail at least in part because c albicans can initiate a strong drug tolerance response that allows some cell to grow at drug concentration above their minimal inhibitory concentration to better characterize this cytoprotective tolerance program at the molecular singlecell level we used a nanoliter dropletbased transcriptomics platform to profile thousand of individual fungal cell and establish their subpopulation characteristic in the absence and presence of antifungal drug profile of untreated cell exhibit heterogeneous expression that correlate with cell cycle stage with distinct metabolic and stress response at day postfluconazole exposure a time when tolerance is measurable surviving cell bifurcate into two major subpopulation one characterized by the upregulation of gene encoding ribosomal protein rrna processing machinery and mitochondrial cellular respiration capacity termed the ribodominant rd state and the other enriched for gene encoding stress response and related process termed the stressdominant sd state this bifurcation persists at and day posttreatment we provide evidence that the ribosome assembly stress response rastr is activated in these subpopulation and may facilitate cell survival

title: crisprbased diagnostics detects invasive insect pest
abstract: rapid identification of organism is essential for many biological and medical discipline from understanding basic ecosystem process disease diagnosis to the detection of invasive pest crisprbased diagnostics offer a novel and rapid alternative to other identification method and can revolutionize our ability to detect organism with high accuracy here we describe a crisprbased diagnostic developed with the universal cytochromeoxidase gene co the co gene is the most sequenced gene among animalia and therefore our approach can be adopted to detect nearly any animal we tested the approach on three difficulttoidentify moth specie keiferia lycopersicella phthorimaea absoluta and scrobipalpa atriplicella that are major invasive pest globally we designed an assay that combine recombinase polymerase amplification rpa with crispr for signal generation our approach ha a much higher sensitivity than realtime pcr assay and achieved accuracy for identification of all three specie with a detection limit of up to fm for p absoluta and fm for the other two specie our approach doe not require a sophisticated laboratory reduces the risk of crosscontamination and can be completed in less than h this work serf a a proof of concept that ha the potential to revolutionize animal detection and monitoring
label: Non-Cancer

title: characterization of new alpha zero  thalassaemia deletion gb among malay in malaysian population
abstract: malaysia is a multicultural and multiethnic country comprising numerous ethnic group from the total population of million malay form the bulk of the bumiputera in malaysia comprise about followed by chinese indian and others the heterogeneous population and increasing number of noncitizen in this country affect the heterogeneity of genetic disease diversity and heterogeneity of thalassaemia mutation alpha thalassaemia is an inherited haemoglobin disorder characterized by hypochromic microcytic anaemia caused by a quantitative reduction in the globin chain a majority of the thalassaemia are caused by deletion in the globin gene cluster among malay the most common deletional alpha thalassaemia is  deletion followed by sea deletion we described the molecular characterization of a new gb deletion in our population involving both alpha gene in ci interestingly we found that this mutation is unique among malay ethnicity it is important to diagnose this deletion because of the risk of hb bart with hydrops fetalis in the offspring when in combination with another  thalassaemia allele mlpa is a suitable method to detect unknown and uncommon deletion and to characterize those case which remain unresolved after a standard diagnostic approach
label: Non-Cancer

title: significance of hlae and it two nkg receptor in development of complication after allogeneic transplantation of hematopoietic stem cell
abstract: transplantation of hematopoietic stem cell hsct is a procedure commonly used in treatment of various haematological disorder which is associated with significantly improved survival rate however one of it drawback is the possibility of development of posttransplant complication including acute and chronic graftversushost disease gvhd or cmv infection various study suggested that nk cell and their receptor may affect the transplant outcome in the present study patient and donor were found to significantly differ in the distribution of the nkga r genetic variant recipient carried the c allele more often than their donor v pnkgc deletion characterized with decreased frequency of nkgc nk cell p our study confirms the importance of nk cell in the development of posttransplant complication and highlight the effect of hlae and nkgc genetic variant shlae serum concentration a well a nkgc surface expression on transplant outcome
label: Non-Cancer

title: mosaic chromosomal alteration in blood across ancestry using wholegenome sequencing
abstract: megabasescale mosaic chromosomal alteration mcas in blood are prognostic marker for a host of human disease here to gain a better understanding of mca rate in genetically diverse population we analyzed wholegenome sequencing data from individual from the national heart lung and blood institute transomics for precision medicine program we observed higher sensitivity with wholegenome sequencing data compared with arraybased data in uncovering mcas at low mutant cell fraction and found that individual of european ancestry have the highest rate of autosomal mcas and the lowest rate of chromosome x mcas compared with individual of african or hispanic ancestry although further study in diverse population will be needed to replicate our finding we report three locus associated with loss of chromosome x association between autosomal mcas and rare variant in dcps adm ppprb and tet and ancestryspecific variant in atm and mpl with mcas in ci
label: Non-Cancer

title: variant classification for pompe disease acmgamp specification from the clingen lysosomal disease variant curation expert panel
abstract: accurate determination of the clinical significance of genetic variant is critical to the integration of genomics in medicine to facilitate this process the nihfunded clinical genome resource clingen ha assembled variant curation expert panel vceps group of expert and biocurators which provide gene and disease specification to the american college of medical genetics genomics and association for molecular pathology acmgamp variation classification guideline with the goal of classifying the clinical significance of gaa variant in pompe disease glycogen storage disease type ii the clingen lysosomal disease ld vcep ha specified the acmgamp criterion for gaa variant classification can play an important role in confirming the diagnosis of pompe disease a well a in the identification of carrier furthermore since the inclusion of pompe disease on the recommended uniform screening panel rusp for newborn in the usa in the addition of molecular genetic testing ha become an important component in the interpretation of newborn screening result particularly for asymptomatic individual to date the ld vcep ha submitted classification and supporting data on gaa variant to public database specifically clinvar and the clingen evidence repository here we describe the acmgamp criterion specification process for gaa an update of the gaaspecific variant classification guideline and comparison of the clingen ld vceps gaa variant classification with variant classification submitted to clinvar the ld vcep ha added to the publicly available knowledge on the pathogenicity of variant in gaa by increasing the number of expertcurated gaa variant present in clinvar and aid in resolving conflicting classification and variant of uncertain clinical significance
label: Non-Cancer

title: smurf control the pppcalcineurin complex and tfeb at a regulatory node for lysosomal biogenesis
abstract: macroautophagyautophagy is a homeostatic process in response to multiple signaling such a the lysosomedependent recycling process of cellular component starvationinduced mtor inactivation and pppcalcineurin activation were shown to promote the nuclear translocation of tfeb however the mechanism via which signal from endomembrane damage are transmitted to activate pppcalcineurin and orchestrate autophagic response remain unknown this study aimed to show that autophagy regulator smurf controlled tfeb nuclear import for transcriptional activation of the lysosomal biogenesis we showed that blocking smurf affected lysosomal biogenesis in response to lysosomal damage by preventing tfeb nuclear translocation it revealed galectins recognized endolysosomal damage and led to recruitment of smurf and the pppcalcineurin apparatus on lysosome smurf interacts with both lgals and pppcb to form the lgalssmurfpppcalcineurin complex importantly this complex further stabilizes tfeb thereby activating tfeb for lysosomal biogenesis we determined that llomemediated tfeb nuclear import is dependent on smurf under the condition of mtorc inhibition in addition smurf is required for pppcalcineurin activity a a positive regulator of tfeb smurf controlled the phosphatase activity of the pppcb by promoting the dissociation of it autoinhibitory domain aid from it catalytic domain cd overexpression of smurf showed similar effect a the constitutive activation of pppcb thus smurf which bridge environmental stress with the core autophagosomal and autolysosomal machinery interacted with endomembrane sensor lgals and phosphatase pppcb to control tfeb activationabbreviations atg autophagyrelated llome lleucyllleucine methyl ester mlsa mucolipin synthetic agonist mtor mechanistic target of rapamycin kinase pppcb protein phosphatase catalytic subunit beta rpskbpsk ribosomal protein s kinase b smurf smad specific e ubiquitin protein ligase tfeb transcription factor eb
label: Non-Cancer

title: sequence basis for selectivity of ephrinb ligand for eph receptor and pathogenic henipavirus g glycoprotein
abstract: ephrinb efnb is a ligand for six eph receptor in human and function a a cell entry receptor for several henipaviruses including the nipah virus niv a pathogenic zoonotic virus with pandemic potential to understand the sequence basis of promiscuity for efnb binding to the attachment glycoprotein of niv nivg and eph receptor we performed deep mutagenesis on efnb to identify mutation that enhance binding to nivg over ephb one of the highest affinity eph receptor the mutation highlight how different efnb conformation are selected by nivg versus ephb specificity mutation are enriched at the base of the gh binding loop of efnb especially surrounding a phenylalanine hinge upon which the gh loop pivot and at a phenylalanine hook that rotates away from the efnb core to engage eph receptor one efnb mutant dq possesses panspecificity to the attachment glycoprotein of closely related henipaviruses and ha markedly diminished binding to the six eph receptor however efnbdq ha high residual binding to ephb and ephb a second deep mutational scan of efnb identified combinatorial mutation to further enhance specificity to nivg a triple mutant of soluble efnb dqqlvl ha minimal binding to eph receptor but maintains binding albeit reduced to nivg soluble efnb decoy receptor carrying the specificity mutation were potent neutralizers of chimeric henipaviruses these finding demonstrate how specific residue change at the shared binding interface of a promiscuous ligand efnb can influence selectivity for multiple receptor and may also offer insight toward the development of henipavirus therapeutic and diagnostics importance ephrinb efnb is a ligand for six eph receptor in human and regulates multiple cell developmental and signaling process it also function a the cell entry receptor for nipah virus and hendra virus zoonotic virus that can cause respiratory andor neurological symptom in human with high mortality here we investigate the sequence basis of efnb specificity for binding the nipah virus attachment g glycoprotein over eph receptor we then use this information to engineer efnb a a soluble decoy receptor that specifically bind the attachment glycoprotein of the nipah virus and other related henipaviruses to neutralize infection these finding further mechanistic understanding of protein selectivity and may facilitate the development of diagnostics or therapeutic against henipavirus infection
label: Non-Cancer
