title: autoantibody against type i ifns in human with alternative nfb pathway deficiency
abstract: patient with autoimmune polyendocrinopathy syndrome type aps caused by autosomal recessive aire deficiency produce autoantibody that neutralize type i interferon ifns conferring a predisposition to lifethreatening covid pneumonia here we report that patient with autosomal recessive nik or relb deficiency or a specific type of autosomaldominant nfb deficiency also have neutralizing autoantibody against type i ifns and are at higher risk of getting lifethreatening covid pneumonia in patient with autosomaldominant nfb deficiency these autoantibody are found only in individual who are heterozygous for variant associated with both transcription p activity loss of function lof due to impaired p processing to generate p and regulatory ib activity gain of function gof due to the accumulation of unprocessed p therefore increasing the inhibitory activity of ib hereafter plofibgof by contrast neutralizing autoantibody against type i ifns are not found in individual who are heterozygous for nfkb variant causing haploinsufficiency of p and p hereafter plofiblof or gainoffunction of p hereafter pgofiblof in contrast to patient with aps patient with disorder of nik relb or nfb have very few tissuespecific autoantibody however their thymus have an abnormal structure with few aireexpressing medullary thymic epithelial cell human inborn error of the alternative nfb pathway impair the development of aireexpressing medullary thymic epithelial cell thereby underlying the production of autoantibody against type i ifns and predisposition to viral disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: prediction of mortality and overt hepatic encephalopathy undergoing transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt a retrospective cohort study
abstract: data on medium and longterm efficacy and safety of transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt tip using viatorr stent in chinese patient are limited this study aimed to evaluate the year mortality and the incidence of overt hepatic encephalopathy ohe after viatorr stent insertion and construct a model to predict posttips ohe preoperatively
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: prediction of mortality and overt hepatic encephalopathy undergoing transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt a retrospective cohort study data on medium and longterm efficacy and safety of transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt tip using viatorr stent in chinese patient are limited this study aimed to evaluate the year mortality and the incidence of overt hepatic encephalopathy ohe after viatorr stent insertion and construct a model to predict posttips ohe preoperatively

title: investigation of bak bax and madl gene expression in human aneuploid blastocyst
abstract: maintaining genomic stability is crucial for normal development at earlier stage of preimplantation development a the embryonic genome activation is not fully completed the embryo may be more prone to abnormality aneuploidy are one of the most common genetic cause of implantation failure or firsttrimester miscarriage apoptosis is a crucial mechanism to eliminate damaged or abnormal cell from the organism to enable healthy growth therefore this study aimed to determine the relationship between the expression level of gene involved in apoptosis in human aneuploid and euploid blastocyst in total human embryo obtained from patient were used for this study trophectoderm biopsy were performed and nextgeneration screening wa carried out for aneuploidy screening total rna wa extracted from each blastocyst separately and cdna wa synthesized gene expression level were evaluated using rtpcr the statistical analysis wa performed to evaluate the gene expression level variation in the euploid and aneuploid embryo respectively the expression level of the bax gene wa significantly different between the aneuploid and euploid sample bax expression level were found to be fold lower in aneuploid cell however the expression level of bak and madl gene were similar in each group this study aimed to investigate the possible role of gene involved in apoptosis and aneuploidy mechanism the finding of this investigation revealed that the bax gene wa expressed significantly differently between aneuploid and euploid embryo therefore it is possible that the gene involved in the apoptotic pathway have a role in the aneuploidy mechanism
label: Non-Cancer

title: polycystic ovary syndrome and recurrent pregnancy loss a review of literature
abstract: pcos is a syndrome of ovarian dysfunction associated with recurrent pregnancy loss several correlating factor have been investigated that influence the risk of pregnancy loss in pcos however uncertainty remains about their contribution to pregnancy loss and prognosis this review of literature aim to identify what is known and what requires further investigation on the relationship between pcos and recurrent pregnancy loss to guide future research and optimize medical guidance throughout pregnancy
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: polycystic ovary syndrome and recurrent pregnancy loss a review of literature pcos is a syndrome of ovarian dysfunction associated with recurrent pregnancy loss several correlating factor have been investigated that influence the risk of pregnancy loss in pcos however uncertainty remains about their contribution to pregnancy loss and prognosis this review of literature aim to identify what is known and what requires further investigation on the relationship between pcos and recurrent pregnancy loss to guide future research and optimize medical guidance throughout pregnancy

title: change of gut microbiota and short chain fatty acid in patient with peutzjeghers syndrome
abstract: peutzjeghers syndromeis a rare autosomal dominant genetic disease characterized by gastrointestinal hamartomatous polyp and skin and mucous membrane pigmentation the pathogenesis of pjs remains unclear however it may be associated with mutation in the stk gene and there is currently no effective treatment available the gut microbiota play an important role in maintaining intestinal homeostasis in the human body and an increasing number of study have reported a relationship between gut microbiota and human health and disease however relatively few study have been conducted on the gut microbiota characteristic of patient with pjs in this study we analyzed the characteristic of the gut microbiota of patient with pjs using s sequencing and measured the level of shortchain fatty acid in the intestine the result showed dysbiosis in the gut microbiota of patient with pjs and decreased synthesis of shortchain fatty acid bacteroides wa positively correlated with maximum polyp length while agathobacter wa negatively correlated with age of onset in addition acetic acid propionic acid and butyric acid were positively correlated with the age of onset but negatively correlated with the number of polyp furthermore the butyric acid level wa negatively correlated with the frequency of endoscopic surgery in contrast we compared the gut microbiota of stkpositive and stknegative patient with pjs for the first time but s sequencing analysis revealed no significant difference finally we established a random forest prediction model based on the gut microbiota characteristic of patient to provide a basis for the targeted diagnosis and treatment of pjs in the future
label: Non-Cancer

title: neurological disease in xeroderma pigmentosum prospective cohort study of it feature and progression
abstract: xeroderma pigmentosum xp result from biallelic mutation in any of eight gene involved in dna repair system thus defining eight different genotype xpa xpb xpc xpd xpe xpf xpg and xp variant or xpv in addition to cutaneous and ophthalmological feature some patient present with xp neurological disease it is unknown whether the different neurological sign and their progression differ among group therefore we aim to characterize the xp neurological disease and it evolution in the heterogeneous uk xp cohort patient with xp were followed in the uk national xp service from to age of onset for different event wa recorded cerebellar ataxia and additional neurological sign and symptom were rated with the scale for the assessment and rating of ataxia sara the inventory of nonataxia sign inas and the activity of daily living questionnaire adl patient mutation received score based on their predicted effect data from available ancillary test were collected ninetythree xp patient were recruited thirtysix reported neurological symptom especially in the xpa xpd and xpg group with earlyonset and lateonset form and typically appearing after cutaneous and ophthalmological symptom xpa xpd and xpg patient showed higher sara score compared to xpc xpe and xpv sara total score significantly increased over time in xpd pointsyear confidence interval and xpa pointsyear confidence interval hyporeflexia hypopallesthaesia upper motor neuron sign chorea dystonia oculomotor sign and cognitive impairment were frequent finding in xpa xpd and xpg cerebellar and global brain atrophy axonal sensory and sensorimotor neuropathy and sensorineural hearing loss were common finding in patient some xpc xpe and xpv case presented with abnormality on examination andor ancillary test suggesting underlying neurological involvement more severe mutation were associated with a faster progression in sara total score in xpa pointsyear per unit increase in severity score and xpd pointsyear per unit increase and in adl total score in xpa pointsyear per unit increase symptomatic and asymptomatic form of neurological disease are frequent in xp patient and neurological symptom can be an important cause of disability typically the neurological disease will be preceded by cutaneous and ophthalmological feature and these should be actively searched in patient with idiopathic lateonset neurological syndrome scale assessing cerebellar function especially walking and speech and disability can show progression in some of the group mutation severity can be used a a prognostic biomarker for stratification purpose in clinical trial
label: Non-Cancer

disability can show progression in some of the group mutation severity can be used a a prognostic biomarker for stratification purpose in clinical trial

title: development of a neutralization monoclonal antibody with a broad neutralizing effect against sarscov variant
abstract: the emergence of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus sarscov variant ha challenged the effectiveness of current therapeutic regimen here we aimed to develop a potent sarscov antibody with broad neutralizing effect by screening a scfv library with the spike protein receptorbinding domain rbd via phage display
label: Non-Cancer

title: discriminative fusion of momentsaligned latent representation of multimodality medical data
abstract: fusion of multimodal medical data provides multifaceted diseaserelevant information for diagnosis or prognosis prediction modeling traditional fusion strategy such a feature concatenation often fail to learn hidden complementary and discriminative manifestation from highdimensional multimodal data to this end we proposed a methodology for the integration of multimodality medical data by matching their moment in a latent space where the hidden shared information of multimodal data is gradually learned by optimization with multiple feature collinearity and correlation constrains we first obtained the multimodal hidden representation by learning mapping between the original domain and shared latent space within this shared space we utilized several relational regularization including data attribute preservation feature collinearity and featuretask correlation to encourage learning of the underlying association inherent in multimodal data the fused multimodal latent feature were finally fed to a logistic regression classifier for diagnostic prediction extensive evaluation on three independent clinical datasets have demonstrated the effectiveness of the proposed method in fusing multimodal data for medical prediction modelingxd
label: Non-Cancer

title: mutational spectrum and phenotypic variability of duchenne muscular dystrophy and related disorder in a bangladeshi population
abstract: duchenne muscular dystrophy dmd is a severe rare neuromuscular disorder caused by mutation in the xlinked dystrophin gene several mutation have been identified yet the full mutational spectrum and their phenotypic consequence will require genotyping across different population to this end we undertook the first detailed genotype and phenotype characterization of dmd in the bangladeshi population we investigated the rare mutational and phenotypic spectrum of the dmd gene in dmdsuspected bangladeshi participant using an economically affordable diagnostic strategy involving initial screening for exonic deletion in the dmd gene via multiplex pcr followed by testing pcrnegative patient for mutation using whole exome sequencing the deletion mapping identified two critical dmd gene hotspot region near proximal and distal end spanning exon and exon respectively that comprised of the deletion for this population cohort from our exome analysis we detected two novel pathogenic hemizygous mutation in exon and of the dmd gene and novel pathogenic recessive and loss of function variant in four additional gene sgcd dysf cola and dok our phenotypic analysis showed that dmd suspected participant presented diverse phenotype according to the location of the mutation and which gene wa impacted our study provides ethnicity specific new insight into both clinical and genetic aspect of dmd
label: Non-Cancer

title: sex genotype and liver volume progression a risk of hospitalization determinant in autosomal dominant polycystic liver disease
abstract: autosomal dominant polycystic liver disease is a rare condition with a female preponderance based mainly on pathogenic variant in gene prkcsh and sec clinically autosomal dominant polycystic liver disease is characterized by vast heterogeneity ranging from asymptomatic to highly symptomatic hepatomegaly to date little is known about the prediction of disease progression at early stage hindering clinical management genetic counseling and the design of randomized controlled trial to improve disease prognostication we built a consortium of european and u center to recruit the largest cohort of patient with prkcsh and sec liver disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: clingen guidance for use of the ppbs cosegregation and pp phenotype specificity criterion for sequence variant pathogenicity classification
abstract: the american college of medical genetics and genomics and the association for molecular pathology variant classification publication established a standard employed internationally to guide laboratory in variant assessment those recommendation included both pathogenic pp and benign b criterion for evaluating the inheritance pattern of variant but detail of how to apply those criterion at appropriate evidence level were sparse several publication have since attempted to provide additional guidance but anecdotally this issue is still challenging additionally it is not clear that those prior effort fully distinguished diseasegene identification consideration from variant pathogenicity consideration nor did they address autosomalrecessive and xlinked inheritance here we have taken a mixed inductive and deductive approach to this problem using real disease a example we have developed a practical heuristic for genetic cosegregation evidence and have also determined that the specific phenotype criterion pp is inseparably coupled to the cosegregation criterion we have also determined that negative evidence at one locus constitutes positive evidence for other locus for disorder with locus heterogeneity finally we provide a pointsbased system for evaluating phenotype and cosegregation a evidence type to support or refute a locus and show how that can be integrated into the bayesian framework now used for variant classification and consistent with the guideline
label: Non-Cancer

title: unravelling the complexity of dnapk activation by structurebased mutagenesis
abstract: it ha been known for decade that the dnadependent protein kinase dnapk is only an active serinethreonine protein kinase when it is bound to a dna doublestranded end still the molecular detail of how this activation is achieved have remained elusive the recent surge in structural information for dnapk complex ha provided valuable insight into the process of dna end recognition by dnapk a particularly intriguing feature of this kinase is a region of the protein that can transition from a seemingly structurally disordered state to a single alphahelix that traverse down the dna binding cradle the dnapk bound dna end of the dna substrate engages with and appears to split around this helix which ha been named the dna end blocking helix deb here a mutational approach is utilized to clarify the role of the deb and how dna end activate the enzyme our data suggest two distinct method of kinase activation that is dependent on the dna end chemistry if the dna end can split around the helix and stabilize the interaction between the dna end and the deb with a recently defined helixhairpinhelix hhh motif the kinase form an endprotection monomer that is active towards dnapks many substrate but if the dna end can not stably interact with the deb because of the dna end structure for instance hairpin or because the deb ha been disrupted by mutation the kinase is only partially activated resulting in specific autophosphorylations of the dnapk monomer that allows nucleolytic endprocessing we posit that mutant that disrupt the capacity to stably generate the debhhh dna endinteraction are inefficient in generating the dimer complex that is requisite for nhej in support of this idea mutation that promote formation of this dimer partially rescue the severe cellular phenotype associated with mutation of the deb helix
label: Non-Cancer

title: treatment and outcome of unicameral bone cyst a systematic review and metaanalysis
abstract: unicameral bone cyst ubcs can increase the risk of pathologic fracture of both long and short bone although multiple treatment exist data are conflicting regarding optimal management  we sought to analyze treatment strategy for ubcs and their rate of successful treatment  success rate were analyzed according to treatment modality with emphasis on filling technique andor decompression associated with curettage and injection compound  curettage with bone substitute and cyst decompression wa identified a a highly successful technique for ubc treatment  decompressing the cyst wall after injection regardless of the specific compound used had a greater potential to enhance healing rate  the management decision should be individually guided within the patient context
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: treatment and outcome of unicameral bone cyst a systematic review and metaanalysis  unicameral bone cyst ubcs can increase the risk of pathologic fracture of both long and short bone although multiple treatment exist data are conflicting regarding optimal management  we sought to analyze treatment strategy for ubcs and their rate of successful treatment  success rate were analyzed according to treatment modality with emphasis on filling technique andor decompression associated with curettage and injection compound  curettage with bone substitute and cyst decompression wa identified a a highly successful technique for ubc treatment  decompressing the cyst wall after injection regardless of the specific compound used had a greater potential to enhance healing rate  the management decision should be individually guided within the patient context

title: biomarkers of axonal damage to favor early diagnosis in variant transthyretin amyloidosis aattrv
abstract: early identification of attrv amyloidosis disease onset is still often delayed due to the lack of validated biomarkers of this disease light chain neurofilament nfl have shown promising result in early diagnosis in this disease but data is still needed including with alternative measuring method our aim wa to study the level of nfl measured by elisa furthermore interstitial matrix metalloproteinase type mmp serum level were measured a a potential new biomarker in attrv serum nfl and mmp were measured using elisa assay in participant attrvm patient asymptomatic vmttr variant carrier and healthy control median nfl level among attrv amyloidosis patient were significantly higher pgml v pgml in both comparison group the auc comparing attrv amyloidosis patient and asymptomatic carrier wa and the nfl concentration of pgml yielded a sensitivity of and a specificity of nfl level had a significant positive correlation with ni value among patient we found a negative significant correlation between egfr and nfl level finally mmp level were not different between group evidence of nfl use for early diagnosis of attrpn amyloidosis is growing elisa seems a reliable and available technique for it quantification decreased gfr could influence nfl plasma level
label: Non-Cancer

title: dkk a a potential novel biomarker in patient with autosomal polycystic kidney disease
abstract: autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease adpkd is the most common inherited kidney disease and lead to a steady loss of kidney function in adulthood the variable course of the disease make it necessary to identify the patient with rapid disease progression who will benefit the most from targeted therapy and intervention currently magnetic resonance imagingbased volumetry of the kidney is the most commonly used tool for this purpose biomarkers that can be easily and quantitatively determined which allow a prediction of the loss of kidney function have not yet been established in clinical practice the glycoprotein dickkopf dkk which is secreted in the renal tubular epithelium upon stress and contributes to tubulointerstitial fibrosis via the wnt signaling pathway wa recently described a a biomarker for estimating risk of kidney function loss but ha not been investigated for adpkd this study aimed to obtain a first insight into whether dkk may indeed improve outcome prediction in adpkd in the future
label: Non-Cancer

title: causal association of immune cell and polycystic ovarian syndrome a mendelian randomization study
abstract: polycystic ovarian syndrome pcos is a common reproductive disorder that affect a considerable number of woman worldwide it is accompanied by irregular menstruation hyperandrogenism metabolic abnormality reproductive disorder and other clinical symptom which seriously endangers womens physical and mental health the etiology and pathogenesis of pcos are not completely clear but it is hypothesized that immune system may play a key role in it however previous study investigating the connection between immune cell and pcos have produced conflicting result

title: automatic detection of myocardial ischaemia using generalisable spatiotemporal hierarchical bayesian modelling of dcemri
abstract: dynamic contrast enhanced magnetic resonance imaging dcemri can be used a a noninvasive method for the assessment of myocardial perfusion the acquired image can be utilised to analyse the spatial extent and severity of myocardial ischaemia region with impaired microvascular blood flow in the present paper we propose a novel generalisable spatiotemporal hierarchical bayesian model gsthbm to automate the detection of ischaemic lesion and improve the in silico prediction accuracy by systematically integrating spatiotemporal context information we present a computational inference procedure with an adequate tradeoff between accuracy and computational efficiency whereby model parameter are sampled from the posterior distribution with gibbs sampling while lowerlevel hyperparameters are selected using model selection strategy based on the watanabe akaike information criterion waic we have assessed our method on both synthetic in silico data with known goldstandard and set of clinical firstpass myocardial perfusion dcemri datasets we have also carried out a comparative performance evaluation with four established alternative method gaussian mixture model gmm opening and closing operation based on gaussian mixture model gmmcomax markov random field constrained gaussian mixture model gmmmrf and modelbased hierarchical bayesian model mhbm our result show that the proposed gsthbm method achieves much higher in silico prediction accuracy than the established alternative method furthermore this method appears to provide a more robust delineation of ischaemic lesion in datasets affected by spatially variant noise
label: Non-Cancer

title: genomewide association study identifies human genetic variant associated with fatal outcome from lassa fever
abstract: infection with lassa virus lasv can cause lassa fever a haemorrhagic illness with an estimated fatality rate of but cause no or mild symptom in many individual here to investigate whether human genetic variation underlies the heterogeneity of lasv infection we carried out genomewide association study gwas a well a seroprevalence survey human leukocyte antigen typing and highthroughput variant functional characterization assay we analysed lassa fever susceptibility and fatal outcome in case of lassa fever and population control recruited over a year period in nigeria and sierra leone we detected genomewide significant variant association with lassa fever fatal outcome near grm and lif in the nigerian cohort we also show that a haplotype bearing signature of positive selection and overlapping large a required lasv entry factor is associated with decreased risk of lassa fever in the nigerian cohort but not in the sierra leone cohort overall we identified variant and gene that may impact the risk of severe lassa fever demonstrating how gwas can provide insight into viral pathogenesis
label: Non-Cancer

title: a unifying model to explain high nirmatrelvir therapeutic efficacy against sarscov despite low postexposure prophylaxis efficacy and frequent viral rebound
abstract: in a pivotal trial epichr a day course of oral ritonavirboosted nirmatrelvir given early during symptomatic sarscov infection within three day of symptom onset decreased hospitalization and death by and nasal viral load by log relative to placebo in highrisk individual yet nirmatrelvirritonavir failed a postexposure prophylaxis in a trial and frequent viral rebound ha been observed in subsequent cohort we developed a mathematical model capturing viralimmune dynamic and nirmatrelvir pharmacokinetics that recapitulated viral load from this and another clinical trial platcov our result suggest that nirmatrelvirs in vivo potency is significantly lower than in vitro assay predict according to our model a maximally potent agent would reduce the viral load by approximately log relative to placebo at day the model identifies that earlier initiation and shorter treatment duration are key predictor of posttreatment rebound extension of treatment to day for omicron variant infection in vaccinated individual rather than increasing dose or dosing frequency is predicted to lower the incidence of viral rebound significantly

title: digenic inheritance involving a musclespecific protein kinase and the giant titin protein cause a skeletal muscle myopathy
abstract: in digenic inheritance pathogenic variant in two gene must be inherited together to cause disease only very few example of digenic inheritance have been described in the neuromuscular disease field here we show that predicted deleterious variant in srpk encoding the xlinked serineargenine protein kinase lead to a progressive early onset skeletal muscle myopathy only when in combination with heterozygous variant in the ttn gene the cooccurrence of predicted deleterious srpkttn variant wa not seen among healthy male individual and statistical modeling strongly supported digenic inheritance a the bestfitting model furthermore doublemutant zebrafish srpk ttn replicated the myopathic phenotype and showed myofibrillar disorganization transcriptome data suggest that the interaction of srpk and ttn in zebrafish occurs at a posttranscriptional level we propose that digenic inheritance of deleterious change impacting both the protein kinase srpk and the giant muscle protein titin cause a skeletal myopathy and might serve a a model for other genetic disease
label: Non-Cancer

title: microrna attenuates secondary brain injury following experimental intracerebral hemorrhage via inhibition of nlrp
abstract: the pathophysiological mechanism underlying brain injury resulting from intracerebral hemorrhage ich remain incompletely elucidated and efficacious therapeutic intervention to enhance the prognosis of ich patient are currently lacking previous research indicates that microrna mir can suppress the expression of nodlike receptor protein nlrp thereby modulating neuroinflammation in parkinson disease pathogenesis however the potential regulatory effect mir on nlrp inflammasome after ich are yet to be established this study aim to ascertain whether mir mitigates secondary brain injury following experimental ich by inhibiting nlrp and to investigate the underlying mechanism
label: Non-Cancer

title: assessment of autophagy in leishmania parasite
abstract: leishmaniasis is a neglected tropical disease caused by numerous specie of leishmania parasite including leishmania major the parasite is transmitted by several specie of sandfly vector and infects myeloid cell leading to a myriad of inflammatory response immune dysregulations and disease manifestation every cell undergoes autophagy a selfregulated degradative process that permit the cell to recycle damaged or wornout organelle in order to maintain cellular health and homeostasis study have shown that leishmania modulates their host cell autophagic machinery and there are indication that the parasitespecific autophagic process may be valuable for parasite virulence and survival however the role of autophagy in leishmania is inconclusive because of the limited tool available to study the leishmaniaspecific autophagic machinery here we describe method to study and definitively confirm autophagy in leishmania major transmission electron microscopy tem allowed u to visualize leishmania autophagosomes especially those containing damaged mitochondrial content a well a dividing mitochondrion with ongoing fusionfission process flow cytometry enabled u to identify the amount of acridine orange dye accumulating in the acidic vacuolar compartment in leishmania major by detecting fluorescence in the red laser when autophagic inhibitor or enhancer were included these method will advance study that aim to understand autophagic regulation in leishmania parasite that could provide insight into developing improved therapeutic target against leishmaniasis
label: Non-Cancer

title: impaired polyamine metabolism cause behavioral and neuroanatomical defect in a mouse model of snyderrobinson syndrome
abstract: snyderrobinson syndrome sr is a rare xlinked recessive disorder caused by a mutation in the sm gene which encodes spermine synthase and aberrant polyamine metabolism sr is characterized by intellectual disability thin habitus seizure low muscle tonehypotonia and osteoporosis progress towards understanding and treating sr requires a model that recapitulates human gene variant and disease presentation here we evaluated molecular and neurological presentation in the g mouse model which carry a missense mutation in the sm gene the lack of sm protein in the g mouse resulted in increased spermidinespermine ratio failure to thrive short stature and reduced bone density they showed impaired learning capacity increased anxiety reduced mobility and heightened fear response accompanied by reduced total and regional brain volume furthermore impaired mitochondrial oxidative phosphorylation wa evident in g cerebral cortex g fibroblast and smsnull hippocampal cell indicating that sm may serve a a future therapeutic target collectively our study establishes the suitability of the g mouse a a preclinical model for sr and provides a set of molecular and functional outcome measure that can be used to evaluate therapeutic intervention for sr
label: Non-Cancer
combined_text: impaired polyamine metabolism cause behavioral and neuroanatomical defect in a mouse model of snyderrobinson syndrome snyderrobinson syndrome sr is a rare xlinked recessive disorder caused by a mutation in the sm gene which encodes spermine synthase and aberrant polyamine metabolism sr is characterized by intellectual disability thin habitus seizure low muscle tonehypotonia and osteoporosis progress towards understanding and treating sr requires a model that recapitulates human gene variant and disease presentation here we evaluated molecular and neurological presentation in the g mouse model which carry a missense mutation in the sm gene the lack of sm protein in the g mouse resulted in increased spermidinespermine ratio failure to thrive short stature and reduced bone density they showed impaired learning capacity increased anxiety reduced mobility and heightened fear response accompanied by reduced total and regional brain volume furthermore impaired mitochondrial oxidative phosphorylation wa evident in g cerebral cortex g fibroblast and smsnull hippocampal cell indicating that sm may serve a a future therapeutic target collectively our study establishes the suitability of the g mouse a a preclinical model for sr and provides a set of molecular and functional outcome measure that can be used to evaluate therapeutic intervention for sr

title: biallelic naa variant with impaired nterminal acetylation capacity cause autosomal recessive primary familial brain calcification
abstract: primary familial brain calcification pfbc is characterized by calcium deposition in the brain causing progressive movement disorder psychiatric symptom and cognitive decline pfbc is a heterogeneous disorder currently linked to variant in six different gene but most patient remain genetically undiagnosed here we identify biallelic naa variant in ten individual from seven family with autosomal recessive pfbc the naa variant lead to lossoffunction with lack of protein nterminal ntacetylation activity we show that the phosphate importer slca is a substrate of naa in vitro in cell loss of naa caused reduced surface level of slca and a reduction in extracellular phosphate uptake this study establishes naa a a causal gene for pfbc provides a possible biochemical explanation of it diseasecausing mechanism and underscore naamediated ntacetylation of transmembrane protein a a fundamental process for healthy neurobiological functioning
label: Non-Cancer

title: deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier gene uncovers a presenilinbetaamyloidactin genetic risk module shared among alphasynucleinopathies
abstract: whether neurodegenerative disease linked to misfolding of the same protein share genetic risk driver or whether different proteinaggregation pathology in neurodegeneration are mechanistically related remains uncertain conventional genetic analysis are underpowered to address these question through careful selection of patient based on protein aggregation phenotype rather than clinical diagnosis we can increase statistical power to detect associated variant in a targeted set of gene that modify proteotoxicities genetic modifier of alphasynuclein s and betaamyloid a cytotoxicity in yeast are enriched in risk factor for parkinson disease pd and alzheimers disease ad respectively here along with known adpd risk gene we deeply sequenced exomes of sa modifier gene in patient across alphasynucleinopathies pd lewy body dementia and multiple system atrophy beyond known pd gene gba and lrrk rare variant ad gene cd cr and psen and a toxicity modifier involved in rhoaactin cytoskeleton regulation arghef arhgef mical pask pkn psen were shared risk factor across synucleinopathies actin pathology occurred in ipsc synucleinopathy model and rhoa downregulation exacerbated s pathology even in sporadic pd the expression of these gene wa altered across cns cell type genomewide crispr screen revealed the essentiality of psen in both human cortical and dopaminergic neuron and psen mutation carrier exhibited diffuse brainstem and cortical synucleinopathy independent of ad pathology psen contributes to a commonrisk signal in pd gwas and regulates s expression in neuron our result identify convergent mechanism across synucleinopathies some shared with ad
label: Non-Cancer

title: comparison of rtpcr and antigen test sensitivity across nasopharyngeal naris and oropharyngeal swab and saliva sample type during the sarscov omicron variant
abstract: limited data highlight the need to understand difference in sarscov omicron b variant viral load between the gold standard nasopharyngeal np swab midturbinate mtanterior nasal swab oropharyngeal op swab and saliva mt op and saliva sample from symptomatic individual in atlanta ga in january and longitudinal sample from a small familial cohort were tested by both rtpcr and ultrasensitive antigen assay higher concentration in the naris were observed in the familial cohort but a dominant sample type wa not found among case in the crosssectional cohort the composite of positive mt or op assay for both rtpcr and antigen assay trended toward higher diagnostic yield but did not achieve significant difference our data did not identify a singular preferred sample type for sarscov testing but higher level of saliva nucleocapsid a trend toward higher yield of composite opmt result and association of apparent mt or op predominance with symptom warrant further study

title: rapid measurement of hemoglobinoxygen dissociation by leveraging bohr effect and soret band bathochromic shift
abstract: oxygen o bind to hemoglobin hb in the lung and is then released dissociated in the tissue the bohr effect is a physiological mechanism that governs the affinity of hb for o based on ph where a lower ph result in a lower hbo affinity and higher hbo dissociation hbo affinity and dissociation are crucial for maintaining aerobic metabolism in cell and tissue despite it vital role in human physiology hbo dissociation measurement is underutilized in basic research and in clinical laboratory primarily due to the technical complexity and limited throughput of existing method we present a rapid hbo dissociation measurement approach by leveraging the bohr effect and detecting the optical shift in the soret band that corresponds to the light absorption by the heme group in hb this new method reduces hbo dissociation measurement time from hour to minute we show that hb deoxygenation can be accelerated chemically at the optimal ph of we show that time and phcontrolled deoxygenation of hb result in rapid and distinct conformational change in it tertiary structure these molecular conformational change are manifested a significant detectable shift in hb optical absorption spectrum particularly in the characteristic soret band nm we extensively validated the method by testing human blood sample containing normal hb and hb variant we show that rapid hbo dissociation can be used to screen for and detect hbo affinity disorder and to evaluate the function and efficacy of hbmodifying therapy the ubiquity of optical absorption spectrophotometer position this approach a an accessible rapid and accurate hbo dissociation measurement method for basic research and clinical use we anticipate this method broad adoption will democratize the diagnosis and prognosis of hb disorder such a sickle cell disease further this method ha the potential to transform the research and development of new targeted and genomeeditingbased therapy that aim to modify or improve hbo affinity
label: Non-Cancer

title: highthroughput rnahcrfish detection of endogenous premrna splice variant
abstract: rnafluorescence in situ hybridization rnafish is an essential and widely used tool for visualizing rna molecule in intact cell recent advance have increased rnafish sensitivity signal detection efficiency and throughput however detection of endogenous mrna splice variant ha been challenging due to the limit of visualization of rnafish fluorescence signal and due to the limited number of rnafish probe per target hifens highthroughput fish detection of endogenous premrna splicing isoforms is a method that enables visualization and relative quantification of mrna splice variant at singlecell resolution in an automated highthroughput manner hifens incorporates hcr hybridization chain reaction signal amplification strategy to enhance the fluorescence signal generated by low abundance transcript or a small number of fish probe targeting short stretch of rna such a single exon the technique offer a significant advance in highthroughput fishbased rna detection and provides a powerful tool that can be used a a readout in functional genomics screen to discover and dissect cellular pathway regulating gene expression and alternative premrna splicing event
label: Non-Cancer

title: more attention should be paid to omicronassociated sepsis a multicenter retrospective study in south china
abstract: the omicron variant of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus sarscov is highly transmissible but cause less severe disease compared to other variant however it association with sepsis incidence and outcome is unclear this study aimed to investigate the incidence of omicronassociated sepsis a per the sepsis definition in hospitalized patient and to explore it relationship with clinical characteristic and prognosis
label: Non-Cancer

title: functional diversity of nlrp gainoffunction mutant associated with cap autoinflammation
abstract: nlrpassociated autoinflammatory disease is a heterogenous group of monogenic condition caused by nlrp gainoffunction mutation the poor functional characterization of most nlrp variant hinders diagnosis despite efficient antiil treatment additionally while nlrp is controlled by priming and activation signal gainoffunctions have only been investigated in response to priming here we characterize nlrp variant in vitro evaluating their activity upon induction priming andor activation signal and their sensitivity to four inhibitor we highlight the functional diversity of the gainoffunction mutant and describe four group based on the signal governing their activation correlating partly with the symptom severity we identify a new group of nlrp mutant responding to the activation signal without priming associated with frequent misdiagnoses our result identify key nlrp residue controlling inflammasome activity and sensitivity to inhibitor and antagonistic mechanism with broader efficacy for therapeutic strategy they provide new insight into nlrp activation an explanatory mechanism for nlrpaid heterogeneity and original tool for nlrpaid diagnosis and drug development
label: Non-Cancer

title: a systematic review of progranulin concentration in biofluids in over peopleassessing the pathogenicity of grn mutation and other influencing factor
abstract: pathogenic heterozygous mutation in the progranulin gene grn are a key cause of frontotemporal dementia ftd leading to significantly reduced biofluid concentration of the progranulin protein pgrn this ha led to a number of ongoing therapeutic trial aiming to treat this form of ftd by increasing pgrn level in mutation carrier however we currently lack a complete understanding of factor that affect pgrn level and potential variation in measurement method here we aimed to address this gap in knowledge by systematically reviewing published literature on biofluid pgrn concentration
label: Non-Cancer

abstract: differencesdisorders of sex development dsds are condition in which the development of chromosomal gonadal and anatomical sex is atypical dsds are relatively rare but their incidence is becoming alarmingly common in subsaharan africa ssa their etiology and mechanism are poorly understood therefore we have investigated cytogenetic profile including telomere dysfunction in a retrospective cohort of senegalese dsd patient

title: transcriptome and metabolome analysis reveal hfpota induced disorder of hepatic glucose and lipid metabolism in rat by interfering with ppar signaling pathway
abstract: pfoa is one of the most representative compound in the family of perfluorinated organic compound due to it varying toxicity alternative to pfoa are beginning to emerge hfpota is an alternative for pfoa it is currently unclear whether hfpota affect glucose and lipid metabolism in this study rat were used a an animal model to investigate the effect of hfpota on liver glucose and lipid metabolism we found that hfpota can affect glucose tolerance through omics analysis and molecular detection it wa found that hfpota mainly affect the ppar signaling pathway in the liver of rat inhibiting liver glycolysis while promoting glucose production hfpota not only promotes the synthesis of fatty acid in the liver but also promotes the breakdown of fatty acid which ultimately lead to the disruption of hepatic glucose and lipid metabolism the effect of hfpota on metabolism are discussed in this paper to provide a reference for the risk assessment of this pfoa substitute
label: Non-Cancer

title: early antiretroviral therapy in sivinfected rhesus macaque reveals a multiphasic saturable dynamic accumulation of the rebound competent viral reservoir
abstract: the rebound competent viral reservoir rcvrvirus that persists during antiretroviral treatment art and can reignite systemic infection when treatment is stoppedis the primary barrier to eradicating hiv we used time to initiation of art during primary infection of rhesus macaque rms after intravenous challenge with barcoded sivmac a a mean to elucidate the dynamic of rcvr establishment in group of rms by creating a multilog range of preart viral load and then assessed viral timetorebound and reactivation rate resulting from the discontinuation of art after one year rms started on art on day or postinfection showed a nearly fold difference in preart viral measurement for successive artinitiation timepoints only of rms initiating art on day and rebounded after art interruption despite measurable preart plasma viremia rebounding plasma from the rebounding rm contained only a single barcode lineage detected at day postart all rms starting art on day and rebounded between and day postart with rebounding variant each rms starting art on day and had similar timetomeasurable plasma rebound kinetics despite multiple log difference in preart plasma viral load pvl with all rms rebounding between and day postart with rebounding lineage calculated reactivation rate per preart pvl were highest for rms starting art on day and after which the rate of accumulation of the rcvr markedly decreased for rms treated on day and consistent with multiphasic establishment and near saturation of the rcvr within week post infection taken together these data highlight the heterogeneity of the rcvr between rms the stochastic establishment of the very early rcvr and the saturability of the rcvr prior to peak viral infection
label: Non-Cancer

title: fltl governs the development of partially overlapping hematopoietic lineage in human and mouse
abstract: fmsrelated tyrosine kinase ligand fltl encoded by fltlg is a hematopoietic factor essential for the development of natural killer nk cell b cell and dendritic cell dc in mouse we describe three human homozygous for a lossoffunction fltlg variant with a history of various recurrent infection including severe cutaneous wart the patient bone marrow bm wa hypoplastic with low level of hematopoietic progenitor particularly myeloid and b cell precursor count of b cell monocyte and dc were low in the patient blood whereas the other blood subset including nk cell were affected only moderately if at all the patient had normal count of langerhans cell lcs and dermal macrophage in the skin but lacked dermal dc thus fltl is required for b cell and dc development in mouse and human however unlike it murine counterpart human fltl is required for the development of monocyte but not nk cell
label: Non-Cancer
